div0.head: *x
div0.entryFree: *x x, xei= (q.v.), to/, indecl., twenty-second letter of the Gr. alphabet, Pl.Cra.414b, Ti.36b. As numeral, x/ = 600, x' = 600,000: but in Inscrr., X stands for xi/lioi, ai, a, = 1000.

xa/, exclamation representing laughter,
ha! ha!, PMag.Leid.W. 4.33.

xaanai/a, h(,
priest's robe, J.AJ3.7.1 (xanai/as codd.): a mistranslation of Aram.
kāh[acaron]nayyâ 'priests'.
xabi/tia, ta/, prob. = xabo/tia, PCair.Zen.680.20 (iii B. C.).
xabo/s, h/, o/n, = kampu/los, steno/s, Hsch.; cf. xamo/n.
xa/bos, o(, = khmo/s, Sch.Ar.Eq.1147.

xabo/tia, ta/, dub. sens., perh.
honey-pots, PSI4.428.53 (iii B. C.).
xa/de, xade/ein, xadw/n, v. xanda/nw.
xa/dhn, f.l. for xade/ein, aor. inf. of xanda/nw, Hp.Genit.9.

xa/zw,
cause to retire; Act. only in Hsch. and in compd. a)naxa/zw (also paraxa/zw, proxa/zw Hsch.), and in Ep. redupl. aor. ke/ka^don, fut. keka^dh/sw:—
force to retire from, bereave or
deprive of, tou\s . . qumou= kai\ yuxh=s kekadw/n Il.11.334; a)risth=as kekadh/sei qumou= kai\ yuxh=s Od.21.153,170. Med., xa/zomai, Il.5.34, etc.; imper. xa/zeo, xa/zeu, ib.440, Call.Cer.54: Ep. impf. xa/zeto Il.16.736, 3 du. xaze/sqhn A.R.3.1320: fut. xa/somai, Ep. xa/ssomai Il.13.153: aor. 1 e)xa^sa/mhn, Ep. 3sg. xa/ssato ib.193, inf. xa/ssasqai 12.172; part. xassa/menos 13.148, etc.: keka/donto (for kexa/donto) 3pl. of redupl. aor. 2 kekado/mhn, Il.4.497, 15.574:—
give way, draw or
shrink back, recoil, freq. in Il. (never in Od.), xa/zeo Il.5.440; o( de\ xassa/menos pelemi/xqh 4.535; ou)d' o(/ ge pa/mpan xa/zet' 12.407; a)\y d' e(ta/rwn ei)s e)/qnos e)xa/zeto 3.32, al.; ai)e\n o)pi/ssw xa/zonto 5.702, cf. 18.160, A.R. 1.c., Call. l.c., Nonn.D.48.618. c. gen.,
draw back or
retire from, pula/wn xa/ssasqai Il.12.172; xa/zonto keleu/qou 11.504; xa/zesqe ma/xhs 15.426; mi/nunqa de\ xa/zeto douro/s 11.539; o( de\ xa/ssat' o)pi/ssw nekrw=n 13.193, cf. 17.357; less freq. with a Prep., x. e)k bele/wn 16.122; xa/ssontai u(p' e)/gxeos 13.153; ou)de\ dh\n xa/zeto fwto/s nor in truth
was he (or
it, the stone)
far from the man, i.e. nearly hit him, 16.736. Poet., and mainly Ep., exc. in the compds. a)na-, dia-xa/zomai (qq. vv.).—ou)x a(/zomai, ou)x a(/zetai (not ou) xa/z-), shd. be written in E.Or.1116, Alc. 326, A.Eu.389.
xai/nw, v. xa/skw.

xa/i+os [a_], a, on,
genuine, true, good, Lacon. word in Ar.Lys.91; Comp. xai+w/teros ib.1157; *)anacago/rou tro/fimos xai/+ou Alex.Aet.7 (Valck. for a)rxai/ou); cf. baquxa/i+os:—also xa_o/s, o/n, xaoi\ oi( e)pa/nwqen
the good men of olden time, Theoc.7.5, ubi v. Sch., cf. xa/sios.

xai=os, o(, or xai=on, to/,
shepherd's staff, A.R.4.972, Call.Fr.125. (Cf. Gaulish
gaiso- (Lat.
gaesum, Gr. gai=son) 'javelin'.)
xaireka^k-e/w, = e)pixairekake/w, Ph.1.314.
xaireka^k-i/a, h(, = e)pixairekaki/a, Arist.MM1192b18 (v.l.), Andronic.Rhod.p.573 M.
xaire/ka^k-os, on, = e)pixaire/kakos, interpol. in Poll.5.128, cf. EM808.6.

xairet-i/zw,
say xai=re,
to greet, welcome, tina LXX To.7.1, POxy. 1242ii35 (iii A. D.), D.L.3.98, Lyd.Mens.4.158;
salute a god, PMag.Par.1.1053.

xaire/t-isma, atos, to/,
greeting, salutation, Sch.rec.A. Pers.935.
xairet-istiko/s, h/, o/n, Sch.rec.A.Pers.l.c.

xaire/fullon, to/,
chervil, Anthriscus Cerefolium, only in Lat. form
chaerephylon (metri grat.) Colum.10.110;
caerefolium Plin. HN19.170.

xair-hdw/n, o/nos, h(,
delectation, Com. word in Ar.Ach.4, formed after a)lghdw/n.

xair-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
jovial, hilarious, Vett.Val.18.29.

xairosu/nh, h(,
joy, BCH50.529 (Marathon, ii A. D.), Hsch.

xai/rw, Il.7.191, etc.; 3pl. imper. xairo/ntwn E.HF575: impf., Ep. xai=ron Il.14.156, Ion. xai/reskon 18.259: fut. xairh/sw 20.363, Hdt. 1.128, Ar.Pl.64, And.1.101, Arr.An.5.20.6; Ep. redupl. inf. kexa^rhse/men Il.15.98; later xa^rw= v.l. in Apoc. 11.10: aor. e)xai/rhsa Plu. Luc.25: pf. kexa/rhka Ar.V.764, part. -hkw/s Hdt.3.42, etc., Ep. acc. kexa^rho/ta, pl. -o/tas, Il.7.312, Hes.Fr.77:—Med. (in same sense), xai/romai, noted as a barbarism in Ar.Pax291 (v. Sch.), but found in BCH36.622 (Perinthus, written xe/r-), Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.20, al.: fut. xa^rh/somai Ps.-Luc.Philopatr.24, (sug-) Plb.30.18.1, D.S. 31.15; Dor. xarhsou=mai Pythag.Ep.3.7; xa^rou=mai LXXZa.4.10, (kata-) ib.Pr.1.26; Ep.kexa^rh/somai Od.23.266: aor. 1 part. xairhsa/menos BGU742 ii 3 (ii A. D.): Ep. aor.1 xh/rato Il.14.270; e)x- Opp.C.1.509, etc.; part. xhra/menos AP7.198 (Leon.): Ep. redupl. aor. 2, 3pl. kexa/ronto Il.16.600 (xa/ronto Q.S.6.315); opt. 3sg. and pl. kexa/roito, -oi/ato, Od.2.249, Il.1.256:—Pass. (in same sense), aor. 2 e)xa/rhn [a^] 7.54, etc., Ep. 3sg. xa/rh 5.682, 13.609; subj. xa^rh=|s Pl.R.606c; opt. xa^rei/h Il.6.481; inf. xa^rh=nai Simon.164; part. xa^rei/s Il.10.541, Sapph.118, Pi.I.6(5).10, Ar.Th.981 (lyr.), etc.; pf. kexa/rhmai h.Bacch.7.10, E.IA200 (lyr.), Ar.V.389 (anap.); part. kexarme/nos E.Or.1122, Tr.529 (lyr.), Cyc.367 (lyr.): plpf. 3sg. and pl. kexa/rhto, -hnto, Hes.Sc.65, h.Cer.458:—
rejoice, be glad, Il.3.111, 21.347, etc.; grau=s h(/de oi)nofo/ros kexarhme/nh w(=de ka/qhtai IG12(8).679 (Scyros, ii B. C.): x. qumw=| Il.7.191, al.; e)n qumw=| 24.491, Od.22.411; fresi\n h(=|si Il.13.609; fre/na 6.481; x. no/w|
to rejoice in wardly, Od. 8.78; xai/rei de/ moi h)=tor Il.23.647; au)ta\r e)mo\n kh=r x. Od.4.260; x. kai\ gela=n S.El.1300; h(/domai kai\ xai/romai keu)frai/nomai Ar.Pax291; opp. lupei=sqai, A.Fr.266.3, S.Aj.555, etc.; opp. a)lgei=n, Id.Tr.1119. —Constr., c. dat. rei,
rejoice at, take pleasure in a thing, ni/kh| Il.7.312; fh/mh| Od.2.35; dw/rw| Hes.Op.358; mo/lpa| Sapph.Supp. 25.5, cf. S.OT1070, Pl.Mx.238d, etc.: c. dat. pers., xai=re . . a)ndri\ dikai/w| Od.3.52; with a part. added, xa/rh d' a)/ra oi( prosio/nti Il.5.682, cf. 24.706, Od.19.463: with Preps., xai/rein e)pi/ tini S.Fr.926, X. Mem.2.6.35, Cyr.8.4.12, Isoc.2.30, Pl.Lg.739d, etc.; pro\s toi=s paidikoi=s Eup.327; with a part. added, e)p' e)cergasme/nois kakoi=si x. E.Ba. 1040, cf. 1033: rarely e)/n tini A.Eu.996 (lyr.), S.Tr.1119: also c. dat. modi, x. ge/lwti
express one's joy by laughter, X.Cyr.8.1.33. of a plant, xai/rei u(fa/mmois xwri/ois Thphr.HP6.5.2; also h( ku/stis x. th=| xolh=| Gal.19.646. rarely c. acc., with a part. added, xai/rw de/ s' eu)tuxou=nta E.Rh.390; tou\s ga\r eu)sebei=s qeoi\ qnh/|skontas ou) x. Id.Hipp.1340; xai/rw s' <e)lqo/nta> Id.Fr.673 (this usage is said to be Oropian, EM808.4). with a neut. Adj., tau)ta\ lupei=sqai kai\ tau)ta\ xai/rein toi=s polloi=s D.18.292: c. acc. cogn., a(plh=n xai/rein h(donh/n Arist.EN1154b26; x. a)ndrapo/dwn tina\ xara/n Plu.2.1091e. c. part., xai/rw . . to\n mu=qon a)kou/sas
I rejoice at having heard,
am glad to hear, Il.19.185, cf. 7.54, 11.73; xai/rousin bi/oton nh/poinon e)/dontes Od.14.377, cf. 12.380, Hes.Op.55; xai/rw . . ko/mpon i(ei/s Pi.N.8.49; xai/reis o(rw=n fw=s, pate/ra d' ou) xai/rein dokei=s; E.Alc. 691; xai/rw feido/menos Ar.Pl.247; qwpeuo/menos xai/reis Id.Eq.1116 (lyr.), cf. Pl.Smp.191e, etc. c. part. pres.,
delight in doing,
to be wont to do, xrew/menoi xai/rousi Hdt.7.236, cf. S.Ph.449, Ar.V. 764, Pl.Prt.318d, 346c, 358a. xai/rein o(/tti or o(/ti . . , Od.14.51, 526, Pi.N.5.46; e)xa/rhn kai\ e)qrasuna/mhn o(/ti e)/maqon . . Metrod.Fr.42; x. ou(/neka . . Od.8.200. with negat., esp. with fut., ou) xairh/seis
thou wilt or
shalt not
rejoice, i.e.
thou shalt not
go unpunished, shalt repent it, Ar.Pl.64; ou) xairh/seton Id.Eq.235; so ou)de/ tin' oi)/w *trw/wn xairh/sein Il.20.363, cf.15.98, Od.2.249, Ar.V.186; a)ll' ou)d' w(\s *ku=ro/s
ge xairh/sei Hdt.1.128; with an interrog., su\ . . xairh/sein nomi/zeis; Plu.Alex.51: rarely with other tenses, o(/pws a)\n mh\ xai/rwsin. D.19.299; ou)k e)xai/rhsen Plu.Luc.25: for a similar use of the part., v. infr. IV. 2. freq. in imper. xai=re, dual xai/reton, pl. xai/rete, as a form of greeting, at meeting,
hail, welcome (esp. in the morning, acc. to D.C.69.18, cf. Luc.Laps.), Il.9.197, Od.13.229, etc.; xai=re, cei=ne, par' a)/mmi filh/seai 1.123; strengthd., ou)=le/ te, kai\ ma/la xai=re, qeoi\ de/ toi o)/lbia doi=en 24.402; xai=re/ moi Il.23.19, cf. S.OC1137; repeated, A.Eu.996, 1014 (both lyr.), S.Aj.91, etc.; xai=r' w(s me/gista, xai=re Id.Ph.462; in greeting one's native land, the sun, etc., A.Ag.508,22, S.Ph.1453 (anap.). sts. implied in the use of xai/rw, kh=ruc *)axaiw=n, xai=re . . Answ. xai/rw I
accept the greeting, A.Ag.538; nu=n pa=si xai/rw, nu=n me pa=s a)spa/zetai I
hear the word xai=re from all, S.OT596: so in inf., to\ xai/rein dub. l. in Pl.Chrm. 164e; xai/rein de\ to\n kh/ruka prou)nne/pw I bid him
welcome, S.Tr.227; proseipw/n tina x. ou)k a)ntiproserrh/qh X.Mem.3.13.1; but xai/rein ta)/ll' e)gw/ s' e)fi/emai I bid thee
have thy pleasure, S.Aj.112. inf. alone at the beginning of letters, *ku=ros *kuaza/rh| xai/rein (sc. le/gei) X.Cyr.4.5.27, cf. Theoc.14.1; used by Alexander the Great to Phocion as a mark of respect, Duris 51J. at leavetaking,
fare-thee-well, Od.5.205, 13.59, 15.151; xai=re po/ll' w)=delfe/ Ar.Ra.164; pl., xai/rete polla/ki Theoc.1.144; freq. put into the mouth of the dying, S.Aj.863, Tr.921, Pl.Phd.116d, etc.: hence in sepulchral inscriptions, IG7.203, etc. hence, imper. xaire/tw, xairo/ntwn,
have done with . . , away with . . , ei)/t' e)ge/neto a)/nqrwpos ei)/t' e)sti\ dai/mwn, xaire/tw Hdt.4.96; xaire/tw bouleu/mata ta\ pro/sqen E. Med.1044, xairo/ntwn po/noi Id.HF575; cf. Pl.Smp.199a, Lg.636d, 886d. e)a=n xai/rein tina/ or ti
dismiss from one's mind, put away, renounce, Hdt.6.23, 9.41, Ar.Pl.1187, Pl.Phd.63e, Prt.348a, X.An.7.3.23, etc.; suxna\ x. e)a=n tina Pl.Phlb.59b; e)leuqeri/an makra\ x. e)a=n Luc.Apol.3; makra\ x. ei)pou=sa Ael.VH12.1; po/lla moi ta\n *pwluana/ktida pai=da xai/rhn Sapph.86; th\n *ku/prin po/ll' e)gw\ xai/rein le/gw E.Hipp.113, cf. 1059, Pl.Tht.188a; x. keleu/wn polla\ tou\s *)axarne/as Ar.Ach.200; ei)pei=n xai/rein tina/ Ath.Mitt.56.131 (Milet., Hellenistic), cf. Luc.Dem.Enc.50; xai/rein prosagoreu/ein Ar.Pl.322 (metaph. in Pl.Lg.771a); xai/rein proseipei=n Eup.308: less freq. c. dat. pers. (never with e)a=n x.）, polla\ xai/rein cumforai=s kataciw= A.Ag.572 (nisi leg.cumfora/s）; fra/sai . . xai/rein *)aqhnai/oisi Ar.Nu.609 (troch.); polla\ ei)po/nta x. tw=| a)lhqei= Pl.Phdr.272e, cf. Phd.64c, R.406d, X.HG4.1.31 (codd., fort. a)llh/lous), Jul.
ad Them.255a. on other occasions, as in comforting,
be of good cheer, Od.8.408; at meals, 4.60, 18.122; xai=re, gu/nai, filo/thti
good luck be on our union, 11.248; eu)xwlh=|s xai/rete 13.358: xai=re a)oidh=| h.Hom.9.7. part. xai/rwn
glad, joyful, Il.1.446, etc.; xai/ronta fi/lhn e)s patri/d' e)/pempon ei)s *)iqa/khn Od.19.461; xai/ronti fe/rein . . xai/rwn 17.83; lupou/menoi kai\ xai/rontes in sorrow and
in joy, Arist.Rh.1356a16: also pf. part. kexarhkw/s Hdt.3.27,42, etc. joined with another Verb,
safe and sound, with impunity, xai/ronta a)palla/ssein ib.69, cf. 9.106, D.24.153; more freq. with a neg., ou) xai/rwn
to one's cost, ou) xai/rontes ge/lwta e)me\ qh/sesqe Hdt.3.29; ou)/ ti xai/rwn . . e)rei=s S. OT363, cf. Ant.759, Ph.1299, E.Med.398, Ar.Ach.563, Pl.Grg.510d; ou) ga\p . . xai/rwn tis . . tou)mo\n a)lgunei= ke/ar Eup.90; ou)/te xai/rontes a)\n a)palla/zaite X.An.5.6.32; also ou)/ti xairh/swn ge su/ Ar.V.186; cf. supr. 11. in the same sense as imper. (supr. 111), su\ de/ moi xai/rwn a)fi/koio
fare-thee-
well, and may'st thou arrive, Od.15.128, cf. Theoc.2.163; xai/rois' e)/rxeo go thy way
rejoicing, Sapph.Supp.23.7; a)ll' e(rpe/tw xai/rousa let her go
with a benison, S.Tr.819; xai/rwn i)/qi
fare-thee-
well, E.Alc.813, Ph.921; xai/rousa . . stei=xe Id.Hipp. 1440. to\ xai=ron th=s yuxh=s Plu.2.136c, 1089e. Astrol., of a planet, occupy the position appropriate to another of its own ai(/resis, Serapio in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).230, Ptol.Tetr.51, Vett.Val. 63.6, Man.2.348. (Cf. Skt.
háryati 'take pleasure in', Umbr.
heriest 'will wish', Lat.
horior.）
xait-e/eis, essa, en, Old Ionic for xaith/eis, Semon.7.57.

xai/t-h, h(,
loose, flowing hair, zanqh\n a)pekei/rato xai/thn Il.23.141; ti/llonto/ te xai/tas Od.10.567, cf. S.Aj.634 (lyr.): xai/tan e)lai/a| . . stefanwsa/menon B.10.28; pl., of a single person, xai/tas pezame/nh Il. 14.175, cf. 10.15, Pi.N.1.14, B.16.105, etc.; xai/ta^s (Dor. acc.) u(pe\p kefalh=s Tyrt.1.39 Diehl; used esp. of
back hair, acc.to Ruf. Onom.14. of a horse's
mane, qalerh\ d' e)miai/neto xai/th Il.17.439, cf. 19.405; a)mfi\ de\ xai=tai w)/mois a)i/+ssontai 6.509, cf. X.Eq. 5.5, 7.1, Plu.Pel.22. after Hom., of a lion's
mane, E.Ph. 1121; o(/sa xai/thn e)/xei, w(/sper le/wn, opp. o(/sa lofia\n e)/xei, w(/sper i(/ppos, Arist.HA498b28, cf. PA658a31: but metaph., fri/cas lofia=s lasiau/xena xai/tan, of Aeschylus, Ar.Ra.822 (hex.). o)cubelei=s x., of a hedgehog's spines, Emp.83.2.
crest of a helmet, Plu.Alex.16. metaph. of trees,
foliage, Call.Del.81: pl., Theoc.6.16, Anacreont.17/18.12; also bu/blos . . e)p' a)/krw| xai/thn e)/xousa Str.17.1.15. (Ambraciot word acc. to AB1095: not in Prose of human hair; cf. Avest.
gaēsa- 'curly hair'.)

xait-h/eis, Dor. xaita/eis, essa, en,
with long flowing hair, epith. of Apollo, Pi. P.9.5, cf. AP6.234 (Eryc.).
with a long mane, of the horse, Phoc.3, A.R.2.1237; of bears,
shaggy, Opp.H.5.38. of plants,
thick-leaved, kala/minqos Nic.Th.60; cf. xaite/eis.

xai/t-wma, atos, to/,
plume, kra/nous A.Th.385.
xa/kwma, misspelling of xa/lkwma, JHS32.159 (Pisidia).
xa_la/, h(, Dor. for xhlh/.
xalabei=n: qorubei=n, Hsch.; cf. a)labutw=.

xala/drion, to/,
mat or
pallet, PTeb.414.13 (ii A. D.), POxy.646 (ii A. D.), etc., cf. xa/landron; also written xala/trion PLond.5.1714.32 (vi A. D.).

xa/laz-a [xa^], hs, h(,
hail (cf. Pl.Ti.59e, Arist.Mu.394b1), o)/mbron . . h)e\ xa/lazan h)\ nifeto/n Il.10.6, cf. 15.170, Apoc.8.7, etc.: pl., X. Oec.5.18, Pl.Smp.188b, R.397a; x. stroggu/lai
hailstones, Ar.Nu. 1127(troch.); a)po\ tw=n xalazw=n . . a)/page seauto/n Id.Ra.852: metaph.,
any pelting shower, o)mbri/a x. S.OC1503; x. ai(/matos Pi.I.7(6).27.
any small knot like a hailstone,
pimple or
tubercle in the flesh of swine, Arist.HA603b18, Pr.963b34, Androsth. ap. Ath.3.93c.
small cyst, such as grows on the eyelid, Gal. 19.437, Poll.4.198, etc.
a knot or
hard lump; in an egg, Arist.HA560a28; in coal, Thphr.Sign.25; in ivory, Philostr.VA 2.13; li/qoi xala/zhs
crystals, 1Enoch14.9,10. (Cf. Sloven.
žled, Little Russian
oželeda 'sleet, ice'.)

xalaz-ai=os, a, on, = xalazh/eis, nifeto/s Nonn.D.2.540 (s. v.l.). (xa/laza 11.3)
knotty, fhgo/s Orph.A.763.

xalaz-a/w,
hail, Luc.
Bis Acc.2: metaph.,
fall thick as hail, Com.Adesp.314. (xa/laza 11.1)
to have pimples or
tubercles, Ar.Eq.381; xalazw=sai [u(/es] Arist.HA603b21.

xalaz-eph/s, e/s,
hurling abuse as thick as hail, ta/fos, of Hipponax, AP7.405 (Phil.).

xalaz-h/eis, Dor. xalaz-a/eis, essa, en,
like hail, fo/nos x. blood
thick as hail (cf. xa/laza 1 fin.), Pi.I.5(4).50; surmo/s AP6.221 (Leon.); o)i+stoi/ Nonn.D.18.232. skorpi/os x. a scorpion
whose sting causes an icy chill, Nic.Th.13.
xalaz-i/as, ou, o(, = xala/zios 111, Plin.HN37.189.

xalaz-ia/w,
suffer from xa/lazai 11.2, Aët.7.83.

xala/z-ion, to/, Dim. of xa/laza 11.2, Cels.7.7.3, Gal.10.1019, Paul.Aeg. 3.22. pl., of
trichinosis, in pigs, Archig. ap. Aët.13.120.

xala/z-ios, on,
full of knots or
clots, spe/rma Steph. in Hp.2.479D. epith. of Zeus,
god of hail, at Cyzicus, JHS24.21; of Apollo at Thebes, Procl. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.321 B. Subst., name of a precious stone,
resembling a hailstone, Orph.L.758, cf. xalazi/as.

xa^lazo-bole/w,
shower hail, AP5.63 (Asclep.).

xa^lazo-bo/los, on,
showering hail, ne/fh Plu.2.499f.

xa^lazo-kope/w,
smite with hail, in Pass., Thphr.CP5.8.3, HP4.14.1.

xa^lazo-kopi/a, h(,
damage by hailstorm, Id.CP5.8.2.

xa^lazo/-omai,
to be hailed upon, Gloss.

xa^lazo-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
hail-guard, one who averts hail by magical rites, Sen. QN4.6, Plu.2.700f.

xa^laz-w/dhs, es,
like hail, pa/gos a)e/ros Plu.2.922c.
granular, spermata Arist.HA582a30, cf. Ruf.Anat.57;
containing granules, of urinary sediment, Hp.Coac.569; of sputum, Aret.SD1.12.
bringing hail, a)/nemoi Arist.Mete.365a1, cf. 364b22, Vett.Val.6.4, Gp. 1.12.18; zw/|dion (viz. Aries) Cat.Cod.Astr.4.152. (xa/laza 11)
pimply, of the tongue, Hp.Epid.4.10; of pigs,
measly, Arist. HA603b16.

xa^la/z-wsis, ews, h(,
pimpliness, Gal.14.770.
xa^lai/nw, poet. for xala/w 1.4, r(uta\ xalai/nontes Hes.Sc.308.

xa^lai/pous, o(, h(, neut. poun, gen. podos:—
with loose, trailing feet, halting, *(/hfaistos Nic.Th.458; vv.ll. xwloi/pous, kullo/pous.

xa^lai/ru^pos, o(,
suds in which clothes have been washed, Cratin. 452, cj. in Polem.Hist.83 (xamai\ r(upw= codd.Macr.).
xa/landron: kra/bbaton, Hsch.; cf. xala/drion.
xa_largo/s, o/n, Dor. for xhlargo/s.

xa^la^r-o/s, a/, o/n,
slack, loose, de/rmata Hp.Aph.5.71; u(podh/mata Ar.Th.263; a(lu/seis Th.2.76; xalino/s X.Eq.10.3, cf. 7.1; qw=rac ib. 12.1; x. kotulhdw/n
loose, supple joint, Ar.V.1495 (anap.); x.knh/mh, opp. sklhra/, X.Eq.7.6; x. a(rmoni/ai
loose, languid, effeminate music, Pl.R.398e; xalarwte/ran . . e)poi/hse xordai=s dw/deka (sc. th\n mousikh/n) Pherecr.145.5; x. po/roi
relaxed, open pores, Arist.HA514a32; to\ x., = xalaro/ths, Anaximen.1. Adv. -rw=s Hp.Fract.16; x. e)nhrmo/sqai, dede/sqai, Plb.34.3.5, Gp.5.8.4.

xa^la^r-o/ths, htos, h(,
slackness, looseness, X.Eq.9.9, 10.13,16, Gal.18(2).87.

xa^la^r-o/w, in Pass.,
to be relaxed in tension, Erot. s.v. sfugmoi/.

xa/l-a^sis [xa^], ews, h(,
slackening, loosening, of bandages, Hp. Fract.10 (pl.); th=| x. te kai\ a)ne/sei Pl.R.590b;
relaxation, tou= r(ow/dous xala/sews deome/nou Gal.Sect.Intr.7; tw=n stegnw=n ib.6; but x. no/sou
remission, opp. e)pi/dosis, Id.19.190.
free play of the parts of a whole, Plot.4.4.45; th=| xala/sei ei)dopoihqh=nai Dam.Pr. 47.
lowering by means of pulleys, kio/nwn
University of Egypt, Faculty of Arts Bulletin 3(2).58.

xa/l-asma, atos, to/,
slackened condition, relaxation, a)napnoh\ kai\ x. Plu.2.133d, cf. Luc.Asin.9;
lack of elasticity, Ph.Bel.58.8, 65.50;
low tension of blood-vessels, Orib. 7.19.6.
gap in the line of battle, Plb.18.30.8; su/mmetron e)/xein x. to be packed
not too
tightly, Plu.Aem.32.
slit, Ruf.Anat.59, Gal.4.733; x. poiw=n e)n th=| u(potomh=| IG7.3073.114 (Lebad., ii B. C.).
baulk or
footpath on the edge of arable land, PLille2.16 (iii B. C.), PGiss.36.17 (ii B. C.), PLond.3.881.21 (ii B. C.), etc.
dislocation, a)/rqrwn Dsc.1.109 (pl.).
congenital hernia, Vett.Val.161.19 (pl.).
free play (cf. foreg. 2) of a joint, Erot. s.v. plow/dhs.

xal-asma/tion, to/,
slight slackening in a rope, Hero Aut.19.3.
xal-asmo/s, o(, = xa/lasis, Dsc.1.109 (pl., v.l.), Herod. Med. ap. Orib.10.8.10, Philum. ap. eund.45.29.2.

xal-aste/on,
one must relax, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus.58.91, Gal.Sect.Intr.7.

xal-asth/ria (sc. sxoini/a), ta/,
ropes for letting down a portcullis, opp. a)naspasth/ria, App.BC4.78: cf. sxasth/ria.

xal-astiko/s, h/, o/n, (xala/w)
fit for slackening or
making supple, e)/laion swma/twn x. Sch.Il.23.281, cf. Plu.2.658e.
laxative, Gal.Sect.Intr.7; o( x. tro/pos th=s e)pimelei/as S.E.P.2.240.

xal-asto/s, h/, o/n,
relaxed, dub. in PRyl.198 Intr. (iii A. D.).

*xa^lastrai=os, a, on,
of, from Chalastra on the Thermaic Gulf:—
to\ *xalastrai=on (sc. ni/tron) prob. a fine kind of
soda, found in a lake near that place, used with lye or soap for purposes of cleansing, Pl.R.430a, Plu.2.134e (pl.); r(u/mmati kai\ ni/trw| *xalastrai/w| Alciphr. 3.61, cf. Plin.HN31.115.—*xalestrai/ou is v.l. in Pl. l.c., *xale/strh is found in Hdt.7.123.

xala/trion, v. xala/drion: hence xalatrio/omai,
to be furnished with mats, PLond.3.1164
h.7 (iii A. D.).

xa^la/w, A.Eu.219, etc., Ep. 3pl. xalo/wsin Opp.H.2.451; Aeol. 3pl. xo/laisi Alc.18.9 codd. Heraclit.: fut. xa^la/sw [la^] Hp.
Aër.8, Epid.7.80: aor. e)xa/la^sa A.Pr.177 (anap.), Hp.Epid.7.23, etc.; Ep. xa/lassa h.Ap.6, pl. subj. xala/ssomen Alc.Supp.23.10; Dor. part.xa^la/cais Pi.P.1.6; 3sg. fut. or aor. subj. xala/cei (dub. sens.) Berl.Sitzb.1927.164 (Cyrene):—Med., Ep. aor. xala/santo A.R. 2.1264:—Pass., aor. e)xala/sqhn, subj. xa^lasqh=| A.Pr.991, Pl. Phd.86c: pf. kexa/lasmai AP9.297 (Antip.), App.Mith.74, Plot. 4.3.16: plpf. e)kexa/lasto Aristid.1.315J. trans.,
slacken, loosen, x. bio/n, to/ca,
unstring the bow, h.Ap.6, h.Hom.27.12; x. ta\ neu=ra, opp. suntei/nein, Pl.Phd.98d; x. to\n po/da, of a ship, v. pou/s 11.2: metaph., ta\ th=s politei/as x., opp. e)pitei/nein, Plu.2.827b:—Pass., opp. e)pitei/nesqai, Pl.Phd.86c, 94c; xala=sqai kai\ diafqei/resqai Id.Lg.653c; xala=sqai u(po\ th=s h(donh=s Porph.Marc.7.
let down, let fall, pte/ruga xala/cais Pi.l.c.; xala/sas o)li/gon to\ me/twpon
having unbent the brow, Ar.V.655 (anap.); mastou\s xa/lason, says the Cyclops to his ewe, E.Cyc.55 (lyr.); kra/bbaton, di/ktua x., Ev.Marc. 2.4, Ev.Luc.5.5; th\n i(era\n a)/gkuran Suid.;
dip in a liquid, ei)s ai(=ma PMag.Par.1.2886;
soak, PHolm.14.33:—Med., i(sto\n xala/santo
lowered it, A.R.2.1264.
let loose, release, tina\ e)k desmw=n A.Pr. 177 (anap.); abs.,
let go, slacken one's hold, mhdamh=| xa/la ib.58. h(ni/as x.
slacken the reins, esp. in metaph. sense, x. ta\s h(ni/as toi=s lo/gois Pl.Prt.338a, cf. E.Fr.409. klh=|qra x.
loose the bars or bolts, i.e.
undo or
open the door, S.Ant.1187, E.Hipp.808; klh=|das Id.Med.1314; x. tou\s moxlou/s Ar.Lys.310; but also pu/las moxloi=s xala=te A.Ch.879.
loosen or
undo things drawn tightly together, x. kremasth\n a)rta/nhn S.OT1266; x. pa=n ka/lumm' a)p' o)fqalmw=n Id.El.1468; x. desma/ E.Andr.577; a)sko/n Id.Cyc.161; to\ sto/ma X.Eq.6.8:—Pass., ta\ xalw/mena o(/pla Hp.Art.43; pri\n a)\n xalasqh=| desma/ A.Pr.991. of the bowels, etc., u(gra\ x. Hp.Prorrh.1.99, cf. Coac.20; h)\n ai( mh=trai mh\ xala/swsi ta\ e)pimh/nia Id.Mul.1.61. metaph., th\n o)rgh/n x.
let it
go, Ar.V.727 (anap.); x. [to\n no/on] e)s o)/yin tino/s Ti.Locr.104c; x. e)piqumi/an Plu.2.133a; to\ baru\ kai\ a)meide/s Alciphr.3.3;
remit, mh/te th=s pronoi/as xalw/shs th\n . . u(peroxh/n Procl.Inst. 122; to\ a)ei\ tau=ta ou(/tws e)/xein e)xa/lasan
relaxed the strict
principle that . . Pl.Sph.242e:—Pass.,
to be softened, li/qos ei)s u(gro/thta kexalasme/nos Callistr.Stat.5; also kexala/sqai ei)s to\ au)tecou/sion
to have free play, opp. sunteta/xqai, Plot.4.3.16. intr.,
become slack or
loose, opp. suntei/nw, Pl.Phd.98d; xo/laisin a)/gkurrai Alc.18.9 (s. v.l.); zw=nai xalw=si E.Ba.935; pu/lai xalw=|sai
open gates, X.Cyr.7.5.29: metaph. c. gen.,
have a remission of, xala/ssomen ta\s qumobo/rw lu/as Alc.Supp.23.10; ti/ xala=| maniw=n; A.Pr.1057 (anap.); (also abs., S.OC203 (lyr.), 840);
relax, fronh/matos x. E.Fr.716; th=s o)rgh=s Ar.Av.383 (troch.); [to\ o)\n] xala/san th=s tou= e(no\s a(plo/thtos Dam.Pr.13. c. dat. pers., x. tini
give way or
yield to any one,
be indulgent to him, ei) toi=sin . . ktei/nousin a)llh/lous xala=|s A.Eu.219; xa/la tokeu=sin E.Hec.403; with gen. add., moi th=s a)rxh=s xa/lason Pl.Men.86e, cf. Plu.Lyc.7: abs.,
give way, ei)/kein o(dou= xalw=nta toi=s kaki/osin E.Ion637. abs.,
grow slack or
weak, e)peida\n ai( e)piqumi/ai pau/swntai katatei/nousai kai\ xala/swsi Id.R.329c;
abate, xala/sei o( pageto/s Hp.
Aër.8; o)du/nh Id.Acut.16.

xalba/nh [ba^], h(,
the resinous
juice of all-heal, Ferula galbaniflua (v. pa/nakes), Thphr.HP9.1.2, 9.7.2, Nic.Th.52, LXX Ex.30.34, Si.24.15, Dsc.3.83, Plu.2.1009f. (Hebr.
[hudot ]elbenāh.）

xalba^ni/s, i/dos, h(,
of or
from xalba/nh, r(i/za Nic.Th.938: as Subst., Androm. ap. Gal.14.41.

xalba^no/eis, essa, en,
of or
from xalba/nh, r(i/za Nic.Al.555.

xald-ai/+zw,
follow the Chaldaean fashion or
creed, Ph.1.581,2.11.

xald-ai=os, o(,
Chaldaean, Hdt.3.155, S.Fr.638, etc.
astrologer, Arist.Fr.35, Cic.Div.1.1.2, Phld.Rh.1.42S., Gem.2.5 (since the Chaldaeans were given to astrology, cf. Hdt.1.181, Arr.An.7.17.1, etc.):—*xaldai/a (sc. gh=), h(,
Chaldaea, St.Byz., Ptol.Geog.5.19:— *xaldai+ko/s, h/, o/n,
Chaldaean, gra/mmata Ath.12.529f; i(stori/ai, title of work by Berosus, J.AJ10.11.1, cf. Ap.1.20; me/qodos, i.e. astrology, S.E.M.5.43 (so -kh/ alone, ib.45); e)pithdeu/mata Dam. ap. Suid. s.v. *xaldai+koi=s: Comp. -w/teros Id.Pr.206. Adv. -kw=s ib.183:— *xaldai+sti/, Adv.
in the Chaldaean language, LXXDa.2.26, Ph.2.546.
xaleidofo/ros, v. xalid-.

xalep-ai/nw, Il.14.399, etc.: fut. -a^nw= Pl.Tht.161a, Men.Sam.204: aor.1 e)xale/phna Isoc.4.102, etc.; subj. xaleph/nh| Il.16.386; inf. -h=nai 18.108:—Pass., aor. e)xalepa/nqhn, v. infr. 11: (xalepo/s):—
to be severe, sore, grievous, me/ga bre/metai xalepai/nwn [a)/nemos] Il.14.399; ei) kai\ ma/la per xalepai/noi [w(/rh xeimeri/h] Od.5.485. mostly of persons,
to be violent, angry, o(/te tis pro/teros xaleph/nh| Il.19.183, cf. Ar.Ra.1020 (anap.), Th.3.82, 8.92, Pl.R.426e, etc.;
display or
portray anger, a)lhqinw/tata Arist.Po.1455a31: c. dat.,
to be angry with . . , *zeu\s o(/te dh/ r(' a)/ndressi kotessa/menos xaleph/nh| Il.16.386, cf. Od.5.147, 16.114, 19.83; x. tw=| potamw=| Hdt.1.189, cf. Pl.Phd.116c, X. An.1.4.12, etc.; ai( [ku/nes] toi=s li/qois, oi(=s a)\n blhqw=si, xalepai/nousi Pl.R.469e: folld. by a Prep., x. e)pi/ tini
to be angry at a thing, Od. 18.415; pro/s ti Th.2.22,59; pro/s tina X.Mem.2.2.1: c. dupl. dat. pers. et rei, x. tini\ toi=s ei)rhme/nois
to be angry with him
for his words, Id.An.5.5.24: rarely, c. gen. causae, w(=n e)moi\ xalepai/nete, tou/twn toi=s qeoi=s xa/rin ei)de/nai ib.7.6.32; also x. u(pe/r tinos Luc.Ind.25: folld. by a conjunction, x. o(/ti . . X.An.1.5.14; xal. ei) . . Plu.Cam.8, etc. Medic.,
to be irritated, Aret.SD2.11. Pass.,
to be embittered or
provoked, xalepanqh=nai/ tini, o(/ti . . against one, X.An.4.6.2, Cyr.3.1.38; pro\s a)llh/lous ib.5.2.18. Pass.,
to be judged or
treated harshly, e)leei=sqai . . ma=llon ei)ko/s e)sti/ pou . . h)\ xalepai/nesqai Pl.R.337a.—Never used in Trag.
xalep-h/rhs, es, poet. for xalepo/s, a)/eqlon Mimn.11.3.

xalep-o/s, h/, o/n,
difficult (o(\ a)\n mh\ r(a/|dion h)=| a)lla\ dia\ pollw=n pragma/twn gi/gnhtai Pl.Prt.341d: opp. r(a/|dios, Arist.Rh.1363a24, in various relations): in reference to the feelings,
hard to bear, painful, grievous (so freq. in Hom.), kerauno/s Il.14.417; qu/ella 21.335; a)/nemoi Od.12.286; po/nos 23.250; a)/lgos, pe/nqos, 2.193, 6.169; gh=ras Il.8.103; a)/lh Od.10.464; xalepw/teros a)/eqlos Hes.Th.800; a)/lla tw=n katexo/ntwn prhgma/twn - w/tera Hdt.6.40; x. pneu=ma A.Supp.166 (lyr.); du/a Id.Th.228 (lyr.); xalepw/tata [pra/gmata] S.Tr.1273 (anap.); sumfora/ E.Hipp.768 (lyr.); no/sos, pla/nh, etc., X.Smp.4.37, Pl.Sph.245e (Comp.), etc.; h( e)sbolh\ au(/th -wta/th toi=s *)aqhnai/ois e)ge/neto Th.3.26; [qw/rakes] du/sforoi kai\ x., of ill-fitting cuirasses, X.Mem.3.10.13: to\ x. tou= pneu/matos the
severity of the wind, Id.An.4.5.4; ta\ x.
hardships, opp. ta\ terpna/, Id.Mem.2.1.23, etc.; terpnw=n xalepw=n te kri/sis Pi.Fr. 131, cf. Plot.5.9.14: Comp.,
more unpleasant, Jul.Or.6.202c.
hard to do or
deal with, difficult, irksome, -w/taton e)/rgon a(pa/ntwn Ar.Eq.516 (anap.); cf. Th.3.59 (Sup.), etc.; xalepa\ ta\ kala/ prov. ap.Pl.Hp.Ma.304e, al., attributed to Solon by Sch. ad loc.; xalepo\n o( bi/os X.Mem.2.9.1, cf. Pl.Plt.299e: c. inf. Act. or Med., xaleph/ toi e)gw\ me/nos a)ntife/resqai, = xalepo/n e)sti/ moi a)ntife/resqai/ soi, Il.21.482; xalepoi\ de\ qeoi\ fai/nesqai e)nargei=s 20.131; xalepo\n de/ t' o)ru/ssein [to\ mw=lu] Od.10.305; x. proi+de/sqai kapro/s Hes.Sc.386; x. e)/ris a)nqrw/pois o(milei=n kresso/nwn Pi.N.10.72; x. prospolemei=n Isoc.4.138, cf. Th.7.51 (Comp.); x. suggene/sqai, eu(rei=n, gene/sqai, Pl.R.330c, 412b, 502c; x. pa/sxein Id.Cri.49b (Comp.): also c. inf. Pass., xalepo\s diagnwsqh=nai kai\ deixqh=nai Antipho 2.1.1, cf. Th. 3.94, etc.; xalepo\n lhfqh=nai o( to/pos Arist.Ph.212a8; xalepo/n [e)sti] c. inf., 'tis
hard, difficult to do, Od.4.651; c. acc. et inf., 'tis
difficult for one to do . . , Il.16.620, Od.20.313: c. dat. et inf., Il.21.184, Od.11.156.
dangerous, lime/nes 19.189; qa/lassa Th. 4.24; x. ta\ paro/nta X.An.3.2.2. of ground,
difficult, rugged, xwri/a x. kai\ petrw/dh Th.4.9; o(do/s Id.5.58, Pl.R.328e; x. . . kai\ prosa/nths . . o(do/s e)stin Anaxandr.56; pro/sodoi X.An.5.2.3; porei/a ib.5.6.10; staqmo/s ib.4.5.3; xwri/on -w/taton a place
most difficult to take, ib.4.8.2. of persons,
hard to deal with, cruel, harsh, stern (opp. pra=|os, Pl.R.493b (Sup.), Arist.EN1126a26), basileu/s, dai/mwn, Od.2.232, 19.201; xalepoi/ te kai\ a)/grioi 8.575; -w/teros
a more bitter enemy, Th.3.40; -w/tatoi
most difficult to deal with, most dangerous or
troublesome, ib.42, cf. 7.21; -w/teroi pa/roikoi Id.3.113; xalepo/n ge quga/thr kth=ma Men.18: c. dat. pers.,
cruel or
harsh towards one, Od.17.388; toi=s cumproqumhqei=si to\n e)/kploun Th.8.1, etc.; pro\s tou\s polemi/ous, tou\s a)gnw=tas, Pl.R.375c, Arist.Pol.1328a8 (also pro\s tou\s dro/mous X.Cyn.5.17); e)pi\ nu/mfais a)llotri/ais Theoc. 22.145. of words, xalepw=| h)ni/pape mu/qw| Il.2.245, etc.; e)reqize/men ai)ei\ mu/qoisin x. Od.17.395; x. o)nei/dea, o(moklai/, Il.3.438, Od.17.189; fh=mis 14.239; mh=nis Il.5.178. esp. of judges, h)=n to\ di/kaion fula/sswn x. Hdt. 1.100, cf. Pl.Criti.107d, And.4.36; also x. a)rxh/ Th.1.77; timwri/a Pl.Ap.39c (Comp.); no/moi Id.Hp.Mi.372a (Comp.), D.21.44, 35.50.
savage, fierce, ku/nes X.An.5.8.24, Cyn.10.23; of bees, Arist.HA624b30 (Comp.); [qhri/a] x. ta\s fu/seis Pl.Plt. 274b.
ill-tempered, testy, x. w)\n kai\ du/skolos Ar.V.942, cf. Isoc.19.26; o)rgh\n x. Hdt.3.131; xaleph=| th=| xeiri/ with a
rough hand, Ar.Lys.1116. of plants,
hurtful to the soil, Thphr.HP8.9.3 (Sup.). Adv. -pw=s
hardly, with difficulty, diagnw=nai x. h)=n a)/ndra e(/kaston Il.7.424; x. de/ s' e)/olpa to\ r(e/cein 20.186; x. ke fu/gois kako/n Hes.Op.684; x. o)rga\s metaba/llousin E.Med.121 (anap.); x. gnw=nai Antipho 3.2.1; ta\ toi=s a)/llois x. eu(rhme/na r(a|di/ws manqa/nein Isoc.1.18, cf. 44; ou) or mh\ x. without
much ado, Th.1.2, 7.81, etc.
hardly, scarcely, doke/w . . x. a)\n *(/ellhnas *pe/rsh|si ma/xesqai Hdt.7.103; x. para\ toi=s e)xqroi=s eu(reqh/setai Lys.29.2; x. a)\n pei/saimi Pl.Phd. 84d. x. e)/xei, = xalepo/n e)sti, Th.3.53: c. acc. et inf., X.HG 7.4.6.
painfully, miserably, -w/teron zh=n Pl.R.579d; e)n toi=s -w/tata dih=gon Th.7.71. of persons,
angrily, cruelly, harshly, x. timwrei=sqai Id.3.46; a)pokri/nasqai Id.5.42, cf. E.Hipp.203 (anap.), Ar.Pl.60, Pl.Phdr.269b; x. fe/rein ti take it
ill, Th.2.16, Pl.R.330a, etc.; also x. e)/feron tw=| pole/mw|, toi=s pra/gmasin, X.HG5.1.29, An. 1.3.3; e)pi\ th=| poliorki/a| Id.HG7.4.21, cf. D.H.3.50; also x. fe/rein tino/s Th.2.62; also x. lamba/nesqai tou= paido/s Hdt.2.121.d/; x. lamba/nein peri/ tinos Th.6.61; of the laws (cf. supr. 11.1c), x. prosta/ttein Pl.Lg.925d. freq. in the phrase x. e)/xein to be
angry, X.An.6.4.16, etc.; tini
with one, Id.HG1.5.16; pro\s tou\s lo/gous Isoc.3.3, cf. 51; x. e)/xein tisi\n e)pi/ tini
with persons for a thing, D.20.135, cf. Plu.Cic.43; x. diakei=sqai pro\s a(/pantas Isoc.Ep. 7.5; x. pro\s filosofi/an diakei=sqai Pl.R.500b; x. pro\s h(ma=s diete/qhsan Isoc.8.79; e)pi/ tini x. diateqei/s Plu.Per.36. x. e)/xein, also, to be
in a bad way, x. e)/xw u(po\ tou= po/tou Pl.Smp.176a, cf. Tht.142b.—
Beside the regul. Comp.
xalep-w/teron (Th.1.77, 7.50, Pl.Phd.94d, etc.) we have -wte/rws Th.2.50, 8.40, Thphr.HP6.7.1: Sup. -w/tata Th.7.71, 8.95, Pl.R.579d, etc.

xalep-o/ths, htos, h(,
difficulty, ruggedness, tw=n xwri/wn Th.4.12,33: metaph. in pl., mega/las e)/xousin ai( su/ntomoi [o(doi\] xalepo/thtas Jul.Or.7.225c. generally,
difficulty, of understanding, Arist.APo.93b34. mostly of persons,
harshness, severity, opp. r(a|stw/nh, Pl.Criti.107c, Lg.902c; h( tou= sofistou= x. Id.Sph.254a; tro/pwn x. Id.Lg.929d; tw=n politeiw=n Isoc.4.142; abs., Th.1.84, Isoc.2.24, etc.; of the Lacedaemonians, Id.12.90; meta\ xalepo/thtos a)kroa=sqai Id.15.20; of the laws of Draco, Arist.Pol. 1274b17: pl., opp. prao/thtes, Isoc.5.116.
ill-temper, vice, of a horse, X.Eq.3.10.
xa^leptu/s, u/os, h(, Ion. for foreg., Hsch.

xa^le/ptw, poet. aor. xa/leya Dosiad.Ara13:—Med. and Pass., v. infr. 11:—causal of xalepai/nw 1.2,
oppress, crush, ei)/resqai de\ qew=n o(/stis se xale/ptei Od.4.423; r(e/a de\ bria/onta xale/ptei Hes.Op.5; pie/zein kai\ x. Plu.2.487b.
wound, tina\ i)w=| Dosiad.l.c.
provoke, enrage, *ku/prida AP5.262 (Agath.):—Med.,
to be angry, xaleyame/nhs *)afrodi/ths D.P.484, cf. A.R.1.1341; tisi Nic.Th.309; xale/ptesqai/ tini/ tinos
with one
for a thing, App.BC3.43; xaleya/meno/s tini/ tinos ib.3.7; tini alone, 2.29, al.; xale/pteo pe/nqei+ qumo/n QS.3.780:—Pass., xalefqei/s tini
enraged at one, v.l. in Thgn.155; mh\ xalefqh=|s e)moi/ S.Ichn.328 (lyr.); su/ggnwqi/ moi kai\ mh\ xalefqh=|s Com.Adesp.281. intr. in Act.,
to be angry, vexed, tini
at a person or thing, Bion Fr.11.2.:—Poet. and late Prose.
*xalestrai=on, *xale/strh, v. *xalastrai=os.

xali/a, h(, = h(suxi/a, Hsch. xali/dion, to/,
tablet, Id.

xa^li^dofo/ros, o(, (xa/lis)
cupbearer, IG5(1).1468, al. (Messene, xaleid- lapides).
xalika/zw, v. xalima/zw.
xa^li^ki=tis, idos, h(, dub. in Ostr.Strassb.619.2 (ii A. D.).

xa^li^kokau/sths, ou, o(,
lime-burner, Edict.Diocl.7.4.
xa^li/kraios, h, on, = sq., Nic.Al.29: irreg. Comp. xalikro/teros, as if from *xalikro/s, ib.59, 613.

xa^li/krhtos, on, poet. for a)/kratos,
unmixed, me/qu Archil.78, A.R. 1.473; spondai/ A.ap.Eust.1471.2 (v. Nauckad A.Fr.448); na=ma AP5.293.6 (Agath.).

xa^li^k-w/dhs, es,
in small masses, Thphr.Lap.65.

xa^li^/k-wma, atos, to/, (xa/lic) in pl.,
rubble and mortar, concrete, Lat.
caementa, Gloss.
xalim-a/zw, = to\ peri\ ta\s sunousi/as pei/qesqai (fort. e)ptoh=sqai), Epich.200 (xalik- cod. Philem.Gloss.).

xalim-a/s, a/dos, h(,
a shameless woman, Hsch.; = po/rnh, Suid. (xali/ma codd.); of the ba/kxai （xalwme/nas ei)s sunousi/an), EM805.9; also expld. as h( u(po\ me/qhs xalwme/nh, Eust.1471.3; xalimi/as and xali/das (of the ba/kxai) are vv.ll. in A. Fr.448 (ap.Sch.A.R.1.473).

xa^li_na^gwg-e/w,
guide with or
as with bit and bridle, glw=ssan, sw=ma, Ep.Jac.1.26, 3.2, cf. Luc.Salt.70, Tyr.4; a)/nqrwpon Vett.Val. 248.25, cf. Chor.32.139p.376 F.-R., Lib.Decl.3Intr.1.

xa^li_na^gwg-i/a, h(,
guiding as by bit and bridle, tw=n th=s neo/thtos paqw=n Simp. in Epict. p.119D.

xa^li_na^gwg-o/s, o/n,
guiding as with bit and bridle, *ne/mesis Vett. Val.131.6, al.

xali_n-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xalino/s, Arr.Epict.4.1.80, PLond.5.1657.8 (iv/v A. D.); =
frenum, Gloss.; also gloss on parh/i+on, Sch.D Il.4.142.

xali_n-i=tis, idos, h(,
bridling, epith. of Athena,
who bridled Pegasus for Bellerophon, Paus.2.4.1, 5.

xali_no-poiikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
the art of making bridles, Arist.EN 1094a11 (v.l. -poihtikh/, as in Asp. in EN4.26).

xali_no-poio/s, o(,
bridle-maker, Them.Or.26.329a, Gloss.

xa^li_no/s (Aeol. xa/linnos prob. in Et.Gud.561.5), o(, heterocl. pl. xalina/ A.R.4.1607, Opp.H.1.191, Plu.2.613c, Sor.1.100, etc.:—
bit, once in Hom., e)n de\ xalinou\s gamfhlh=|s e)/balon Il.19.393; xalino\n e)mbalei=n gna/qois E.Alc.492; x. e)cairei=tai X.Eq.3.2; of the horse, x. ou)k e)pi/statai fe/rein (metaph. of Cassandra) A.Ag.1066; x. de/xesqai, lamba/nein, X.Eq.3.2, 6.10; labei=n, e)/xein, Arist.Rh.1393b16, 21; to\n x. e)ndakei=n champ the
bit, Pl.Phdr.254d; of the rider, dote/on to\n x. one must give a horse the
rein, X.Eq.10.12; o)pi/sw spa/sai, cune/xein a)na/gkh|, Pl.Phdr.254e, Luc.DDeor.25.1; [x.] ei)s a)/kron to\ sto/ma kaqie/menos X.Eq.6.9.—Expld. of the
bit, opp. reins (h(ni/ai), by Poll.1.148; so h(ni/as te . . kai\ x. Pl.R.601c; x. tina xalkei= e)kdido/nta skeua/sai Id.Prm.127a; kata\ [to\n kuno/donta] e)mba/lletai o( x. Arist. HA576b18, cf. A.Th.123 (lyr.), S.OC1067 (lyr.); but distd. fr. sto/mion by Hdt.1.215, cf. A.Th.207 (lyr.), X.Eq.6.9, 10.9, etc.; and may be used generally for
bit and bridle, Hdt.3.118, 4.64, IG12.374.176, PCair.Zen.659.11 (iii B. C.). metaph., of
anything which curbs, restrains, or
compels, *)argou=s x., of an anchor, Pi.P.4.25; x. lino/detoi, = xalinwth/ria, E.IT1043; parqeni/as x. lu/ein, of the virgin zone, Pi.I.8(7).48; xalinoi=s e)n petri/noisin, of Prometheus' bonds, A.Pr.562 (anap.); *dio\s x., of the will of Zeus, ib.672; xalinw=n a)nau/dw| me/nei, of forcible constraint, Id.Ag.238 (lyr.); pollw=n xalinw=n e)/rgon oi)a/kwn q' a(/ma, i.e. it requires much skill and force to guide, S.Fr.869; tw=| dh/mw| x. e)mbalei=n u(/brews
a bridle to curb their violence, Plu.Comp.Per.Fab.1, cf. Luc.Herm.82; th=s glw/tths ta\ x. Plu.2.613c; e)pe/stw tw=| sto/mati x. Lib.Ep.315.4; x. ou)dei\s o)mma/twn Philostr. VA6.11. generally,
strap, thong, E.Cyc.461 (dual). part of the
tackle of a ship, IG22.1610.11,14.
corner of the horse's
mouth, where the bit rests, Poll.2.90 (pl.); of the human mouth, Nic.Al.117,223, PUniv.Giss.44.7, (ii/i B. C.), Heliod. ap.Orib 48.31.4, Sor.1.100, PSI9.1016.25 (ii B. C.), Aret.SA1.9, Cael.Aur.TP1.4, Aët.8.27; but, = h( su/ndesis tw=n gna/qwn, Ruf.Onom. 53, cf. Aët.8.40.
fangs of serpents, from their shape and position in the mouth, Nic.Th.234.

xa^li_nourgo/s, o(,
bridle-maker, Lat.
lorarius, Gloss.; abbreviated xalinou in Sammelb.5124.684 (ii A. D.) acc. to Schow.

xa^li_nofa/gos [fa^], on,
champing the bit, sto/mata Call.Lav.Pall.12.

xa^li_n-ow,
bridle or
bit a horse, X.Cyr.3.3.27, An.3.4.35, HG7.2.21:—Pass., Id.Eq.5.1, Plb.3.65.6, etc. metaph.,
curb, bridle, check, th\n nau=n Philostr.VA3.23; [fo/bon, e)piqumi/an] Epicur.Fr.485; th\n o)rgh/n, to\n qumo/n, Ps.-Phoc.57, Them.Or.34p.454Dind.; to\ filo/fwnon kai\ la/lon Plu.2.967b; th\n a)logi/an Hierocl. in CA8p.431M.; th\n e(autw=n a)plhsti/an Lib.Or.47.35:—Pass.,
to be bridled, curbed, th=| froura=| kai\ toi=s o(mh/rois Plu.Arat.38; u(po\ tou= lo/gou Philostr.VA4.30: abs.,
to be tongue-tied, Hp.Mul.1.2.

xa^li_/n-wsis, ews, h(,
bridling, X.Eq.3.11 (pl.), v.l. in Poll.1.184.

xa^li_n-wth/ria (sc. o(/pla), ta/, of ships,
mooring-cables, E.Hec.539, Opp.H.1.359, Nonn.D.3.20.

xa/lic [a^], i^kos, o( and h(,
small stone, pebble, in pl., Arist.Fr.213; e)strwme/nh xa/licin o(do/s Luc.Trag.226. freq. as collect. in sg.,
gravel, rubble, used in building, Th.1.93, PCair.Zen.760 (iii B. C.), PPetr.3p.290 (iii B. C.), Plu.Cim.13; th=| x. katamei/cantes th\n a)mmokoni/an, so as to make
concrete, Str.5.4.6: pl., Ar.Av.839; x. sidhrai= dub. sens. in IG12.314.44.

xa/lis [a^], ios, o(,
neat wine, Hippon.73, Docum. ant. dell' Africa Italianaii Cirenaica101 (i A. D.), Hsch., Suid., Eust.1471.2. = o( memhnw\s kai\ kexalasme/nos ta\s fre/nas (i.e. = xali/frwn), Hsch. f.l. for sxali/s, Them.Or.23.297a.

xa^li-frone/w,
to be light-minded, xalifrone/onta saofroni/hs e)pe/bhsan, Od.23.13.

xa^li-frosu/nh, h(,
levity, thoughtlessness, 16.310 (in pl.).

xa^li/-frwn, onos, o(, h(, (xa/lis)
light-minded, thoughtless, joined with nh/pios, 4.371, 19.530; of Dionysus (cf. xa/lis), AP9.524.23.
of yielding temper, pliable, x. neu/mata kou/rhs Musae. 117.
xalk-a/nqemon, to/, = xrusa/nqemon, Ps.-Dsc.4.58.
xalk-anqe/s, to/, = xa/lkanqon, Posidon.52J., Str.14.6.5, Dsc.5.79,98, v.l. in Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.38.
xalk-a/nqh, h(, v.l. for xa/lkanqon in Dsc.3.80.

xalk-anqi/zw,
resemble xa/lkanqon
in colour, Ruf.Fr.79. of water,
to be vitriolic, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.3.6.

xa/lk-anqon, to/,
solution of blue vitriol (
copper sulphate), used for ink and for shoemaker's blacking, Dsc.3.80, Orph.A.960, Plin.HN34.123. = xrusa/nqemon, Ps.-Dsc.4.58.
xa/lk-anqos, o( and h(, = foreg. 1, acc. to Gal.12.721, cf. Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.38 (v.l.).

xalk-a/nqrwpos, o(,
copper-man, alchemical term in Zos.Alch.p.110B.

xalk-anqw/dhs, es,
vitriolic, of water, Antyll. ap. Orib.10.3.1, Gal.13.958.

xalk-a/rma^tos, on,
with brazen chariot, epith. of Ares, Pi.P.4.87.
xalk-a/s, a/dos, h(, = xrusa/nqemon, Ps.-Dsc.4.58.

xa/lk-aspis, idos, o(, h(,
with brazen shield, of warriors, Pi.O.9.54, B.10.62, Ibyc.3.31 Diehl, E.HF795 (lyr.); epith. of Ares, Pi.I.7(6).25, E.IA764 (lyr.); of Heracles, S.Ph.727. oi( x., a corps in the Maced. army, Plb.2.66.5, al., Plu.Sull.16. of
one who ran the armed foot-race (o(plitodro/mos), Pi.P.9.1.

xalk-egxh/s, e/s,
with brazen lance, xalkegxe/wn *trw/wn E.Tr.143 (lyr.) (xalke/gxewn in cod.Hsch. is wrongly accented, cf. dolixegxh/s).

xalk-ei/a, h(,
smith's work, Hp.Art.53; opp. tektonikh/ (joiner's work), Pl.Prt.324e, cf. Smp.197b.
smithy, forge, HeroBel.98.3.

xalk-ei=on, Ion. xalk-h/i+on, to/, = foreg. 11, Hdt.1.68, Hp.Art.47,77, And.1.40, Pl.Euthd. 300b. = xalki/on (q.v.):
cauldron, pot, Hdt.4.81, 152 (v.l. xalki/on), Hp.Morb.4.39, Pl.Prt.329a codd.: esp.
copper in baths, Thphr.Char.9.8; x. e)ruqro/n
vessel of pure copper, Hp.Ulc.12; x. molubou=n POxy.1648.62 (ii A. D.).
concave metal reflector in a lamp, X.Smp.7.4.
bronze structure, Paus.2.22.2. ta\ xalkei=a (sc. i(era/), at Athens,
a festival at the end of the month Pyanopsion, Phanod.22, Hyp.Fr.90, cf. Poll.7.105; title of play by Menander.

xa/lk-eios, h, on, Ep. for xa/lkeos,
of copper or
bronze, brazen, e)/gxei+ xalkei/w| Il.3.380; ai)xmh\ x. 4.461; klhi/+s Od.21.7; au)gh\ x. gleam
of brass, Il. 13.341; xa/lkeion ge/nos, of the Age
of brass, Hes. Op.144; ei)kw\ xalkei/hn Maiist.15: once in Trag., xa/lkeion ka/ra, S.Fr. 537 (nisi leg. xa/lkeon); in late Prose, xa/lkeios sfai=ra S.E.M.7.376. Subst., xa/lkeios, h(,
yellow fish thistle, Carlina corymbosa, Thphr.HP6.4.3, Plin.HN21.94. v. xalkh/i+os.
xalk-ei/ths, v. xalki/ths 11.
xalk-eiw/dhs, es, = xalkoeidh/s 1, fa/rmakon prob. l. in Zos. Alch.p.216B.
xalk-e/la^tos, on, poet. for xalkh/latos, pe/lekus Pi.O.7.36; qa/lamoi AP5.216 (Paul.Sil.); sa/lpigc Epigr.Gr.350 (Nicaea); ei)kw/n ib.944 (Oenoanda).
xalk-embola/s, a/dos, poet. fem. of sq., na=es E.IA1319 (lyr.).

xalk-e/mbolos, on,
with brazen beak, D.S.14.59, Plu.Cim.13, Trag.Adesp.142, Lyr. in PTeb.2 (
a）ii 9; xalke/mboloi (abs.), as the name of a special kind of ship, Plu.Ant.35.

xalk-e/ndu^tos, on,
brass-clad, Sch.E.Ph.1130.

xalk-e/nteros, on,
of brazen bowels, applied by Suid. to the Grammarian Didymus.

xalk-enth/s, e/s,
brass-armed, po/lemos Pi.N.1.16; stratia/ ib.11.35.

xalk-e/ntonon, to/,
torsion-engine with metallic strands, Ph.Bel.56.22.

xalkeo/-gomfos, on,
brass-riveted, dw=ma Simon.37.7.
xalkeo/-qu_mos, on, = xalkeoka/rdios, Polem.Cyn.41.

xalkeo-qw/rac, Ion. xalkeo-qw/rhc, hkos, o(, h(,
with brazen breastplate, Il.4.448, 8.62; cf. xalkoqw/rac.

xalkeo-ka/rdios, on,
with heart of brass, Theoc.13.5.

xalkeo/-kra_nos, on,
bronze-tipped, i)o/s B.5.74.

xalkeo/-ktu^pos, on,
with clang of bronze, ma/xa Id.17.59.

xalkeo-mh/stwr, oros, o(,
skilled in arms, xalkeomh/storos *(/ektoros, restored by Burges in E.Tr.271 (lyr.) from Hsch. (xalkeomi/stwr: i)sxurofo/ros, i. e. xalkeomh/storos: i)sxuro/fronos).
xalkeo-mi/tras, Ion. xalkeo/-hs, o(, = xalkomi/tras, B.Scol.Oxy.5.8 (and prob. Id.12.109), Q.S.1.274; epith. of the planet Mars, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.173.

xalkeo/-nwtos,
on,
with back of brass, ku/mbala Nonn.D.10.388.

xalkeo/-pezos, on,
brass-footed, e(/drh AP9.140 (Claudian.).

xalke/oplos, on,
with arms or
armour of brass, *danaoi/ E.Hel. 693 (lyr.).

xa/lkeos, e/a, Ion. -e/h (Hom. always -ei/h (v. xa/lkeios)), eon (also eos, eon Il.18.222 (o)/pa xa/lkeon *ai)aki/dao, where Zenod. xalke/hn as disyll.), Hdt. (v. infr.): rarely in Trag., A.Ch.686, S.Fr.534.3,7 (anap.), E.Ion1; Aeol., Dor. xa/lkios Epich.79, Alc.15.3, SIG 945.6 (Assos, iv B. C.), IGRom.4.1302.35 (Cyme, i B. C./i A. D.), also Boeot., cf. xalkou=s; Att. xalkou=s, h=, ou=n (IG12.313.55, etc., but xalke/wn de/ltwn Pl.Ax.371a codd.); Ep. also xa/lkeios, v. xa/lkeios: (xalko/s):—
of copper or
bronze, brazen, ou)do/s, do/mos, tei=xos, Il.8.15, 18.371, Od.10.4; a)/cwn, ku/kla, Il.13.30, 5.723; x. *)ara/wn qa/lamoi Antim. in PMilan.17.48; x. kai\ a)damanti/nois tei/xesi Aeschin.3.84; o)do/s Astyd.9, Ister 30; esp. of arms and armour, e)/gxos, ci/fos, Il.3.317,335; sa/kos 7.220; qw/rhc, xitw/n, 13.398,440; e)/ntea 18.131, etc.; xalke/ois o(/plois E.Ph.1359; also le/bhtos xalke/ou A.Ch.686, cf. E.Cyc.392; xalke/oisika/dois, xalke/ois drepa/nois, S.l.c.; in Trag. mostly contr., xalkoi=s ba/qroisi Id.OC1591; xalkh=s u(pai\ sa/lpiggos Id.El. 711; xalkh=s e)k de/ltou Id.Tr.683. of statues, x. *zeu/s, x. *poseide/wn, a
bronze statue of . . , Hdt.9.81; x. tau=ros Pi.P.1.95; h( xalkh= *)aqhna= D.19.272; i(sta/nai tina\ xalkou=n Id.13.21; a)/cios staqh=nai xalkou=s Arist.Rh.1410a33; sth/lh e)f' h(=| o( strathgo/s e)stin o( xalkou=s And.1.38; cf. xalkh=. x. a)gw/n a contest
for a shield of brass, Pi.N.10.22. metaph.,
brazen, i. e.
hard, stout, strong, xa/lkeos *)/arhs Il.5.704, etc. (unless
wearing brazen armour, cf. xa/lkeoi a)/ndres Orac. ap. Hdt.2.152); *xalkou=s, nickname of Aristomedes, Din. ap. Did.
in D.9.57, Philem.1.2 D., Plu.Dem.11; x. stono/ent' o(/madon Pi.I.8(7).27; x. au)da/ Id.Pae.2.100; xa/lkeon h)=tor a heart
of brass, Il.2.490; o)/pa x. 18.222; x. u(/pnos, i. e. the sleep of death, 11.241; xalke/oisi nw/tois, of Atlas, E.Ion1. xalkh= mui=a, a boy's game, a sort of
blind-man's-buff, Herod.9a, Poll.9.123. as Subst., v. xalkou=s. [xa/lkeoi is disyll. in Hes. Op.150.]
xalkeo/-sternos, on, = xalkoqw/rac, *)/arhs B.5.34.

xalkeo-teuxh/s, e/s,
armed in brass, E.Supp.999 (lyr.).

xalkeo-te/xnhs, ou, o(,
worker in metal, smith, Epigr.Gr.269 (Aedepsus); of Hephaestus, Q.S.2.440.

xalkeo/-fwnos, on,
with voice of brass, i. e.
ringing strong and clear, of Stentor, Il.5.785; of Cerberus, Hes.Th.311.
xalke/oy, o(, h(, gen. opos, = foreg., au)lw=n o)mfa/ Pi.Pae.3.94.

xa/lk-euma, atos, to/,
anything made of brass, e.g.
an axe or
sword, A.Ch.576. in pl.,
brazen bonds, Id.Pr.19.

xalk-eu/s, e/ws, o(: pl. xalkei=s, Att. -h=s Ar.Av.490 (anap.), Pl.R.370d, Ep. -h=es (v. infr.): acc. xalke/as Id.Smp.221e, R.428d, xalkei=s Plu.2.214a:—
coppersmith, opp. te/ktwn (joiner, Pl.R.370d), h(\n [a)spi/da] x. h)/lasen Il.12.295, etc.; mi/trh, th\n xalkh=es ka/mon a)/ndres 4.187,216. generally,
worker in metal, of a
goldsmith, Od.3.432; of a
worker in iron. 9.391; hence later,
blacksmith, smith (xalke/as tou\s to\n si/dhron e)rgazome/nous Arist.Po.1461a29), Hdt.1.68, Ar.l.c., X.HG3.4.17; a)nh\r x. Hdt.4.200; x. xalkou= kai\ sidh/rou LXXGe.4.22.
John Dory, Zeus faber, Opp.H.1.133, prob. in Arist.HA535b18; distd. fr. xalki/s, Ath.7.328d.
xalk-euth/rion, to/, = xalkei=on, Gloss.
xalk-euth/s, ou=, o(, = xalkeu/s, x. u(/mnwn AP7.34 (Antip. Sid.).

xalk-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the smith's art, fu=sa Hp.Morb.3.14; e)/rga X.Vect.4.6; to\ x. pu=r, opp. to\ mageiriko/n, Arist.Spir.485a35.
skilled in metal-working, X.Mem.1.1.7: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) the
smith's art or
trade, Id.Oec.1.1, Arist.PA683a24, GA789b10.

xalk-euto/s, h/, o/n,
wrought of metal: metaph., sti/xos *pieri/dwn x. e)p' a)/kmosin AP7.409 (Antip.).

xalk-eu/w,
make of copper or
bronze or (generally)
of metal, forge, dai/dala polla/ Il.18.400; ci/fos S.Aj.1034, etc.; to\n xalke/a au)to\n x.
work him
on the anvil, Pl.Euthd.301d: metaph., a)yeudei= pro\s a)/kmoni xa/lkeue glw=ssan Pi.P.1.86: in Med. sense, pe/das xalkeu/etai au(tw=| Thgn.539; xalkeu/esqe mhni/skous forei=n Ar.Av.1114 (troch.); e)xalkeu/sato kra/nh . . o(losi/dhra Plu.Cam.40:—Pass.,
to be wrought or
forged, e)c a)da/mantos h)\ sida/rou kexa/lkeutai Pi.Fr.123.4; a)f' o(po/swn tala/ntwn kex. at the cost of . . , Luc.JTr.11; tw=n kexalkeume/nwn pro\s a)pw/leian o(/plwn D.S.17.58: metaph., e)pi\ toi=s dedeme/nois xalkeu/etai [tau=ta] these arms
are being forged against . . , Ar.Eq.469; also of the victims in Phalaris' bull, Phalar.Ep.113. abs.,
to be a smith, Ar.Pl.163,513 (anap.), Th.3.88, Pl.R.396a; to\ xalkeu/ein
the smith's art, X.Mem.4.2.22.

xalk-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
forge, smithy, bh= r(' i)/men e)s xalkew=na [where ew must be pronounced as one syll.] Od.8.273, cf. A.R.3.41.
bar of wrought iron, Lat.
strictura, glossed fushth/r, xalkew/n (nisi leg. xalke/wn), Gloss.
xa/lkh, v. ka/lxh.

xalkh= (sc. ei)kw/n), h(,
bronze statue, Antig.Mir.15, cf. D.L.9.39, 10.9.
xalkhdo/nion, to/, = sti/mmi, interpol. in Dsc.5.84.

xalkhdw/n, o/nos, h(,
chalcedony, Apoc.21.19.
xalk-h/i+on, v. xalkei=on.

xalk-h/i+os, h, on, (xalkeu/s)
of or
for a smith, o(/pla Od.3.433; do/mos, i.e.
forge, 18.328; in form xalkei=os, qw=kos Hes.Op.493.

xalk-h/la^tos, on, (e)lau/nw)
forged out of brass, of beaten brass, kw/dwnes, sa/kos, A.Th.386,539; pla/stigc Id.Ch.290; ska/fh Id.Fr. 225; o(/pla S.Fr.341; le/bhtes ib.378; a)spi/s E.Ba.799, cf. Ar.Ra. 929; cf. xalke/latos (q.v.).

xalk-h/rhs, es,
furnished or
fitted with bronze, of spears and arrows
tipped or
armed with bronze, custo/n, do/ru, o)i+sto/s, i)oi/, Il.4.469, 5.145, 13.650, Od.1.262; xalkh/reon (sic) e)/gxos Pancrat. in POxy.1085.6; kune/h, ko/rus, Il.3.316, 15.535; sa/kh 17.268; generally, x. teu/xea 15.544; x. sto/los, of a ship's beak, A.Pers.408; nau=s x. Plu.Demetr.42, Sull.22.
xalkh/sion, to/, = karxh/sion, HeroBel.88.5.

xalki^ai=os, a, on,
costing one xalkou=s, PCair.Zen.19.5 (iii B. C.). xalkiai/a, h(,
supplementary tax on sales, Sammelb.5729 (iii B. C.); abbrev. in Ostr.Bodl.i 96 (ii B. C.); also written xalkiei/a (q. v.).

xalki^d-eu/omai,
to be parsimonious, Suid.; cf. *xalkidi/zw.

xalki^d-eu/s, e/os, o(,
inhabitant of Chalcis, Hdt.5.74, etc.: acc. pl. *xalkide/as Ar.Eq. 238. expld. by deilo/s, Hsch.
xalki^d-iako/s, h/, o/n, = *xalkidiko/s (quod fort. leg.), Lesb.Gramm.4.

xalki^d-i/zw,
imitate the Chalcidians in paiderasti/a (Hsch.) or parsimony (Eust.279.18), Com.Adesp. 1192.

xalki^d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
from Chalcis (in Euboea or Thrace), Alc.15, Hdt.7.185, Ar.Eq.237. xalkidikh/, h(, = xalki/s 11, Dorioap.Ath.7.328d. sau/ra x. = xalki/s 111, sh/y 11.2, Dsc.2.65, Philum.Ven.34. ei)=dos a)lektruo/nos, Hsch.
chalcidicum, = fori deambulatorium, Gloss.
xalk-i/dion, to/, Dim. of xalki/on 1, Hermipp.65.

xalk-idi=tis, idos, h(,
a penny prostitute, Com.Adesp.1352.

xalk-iei/a, h(, = xalkiai/a,
supplementary tax on sales, PLond.3.1200 (ii B. C.).

xalk-i/zw,
shine like brass, x. th\n xroia/n Sch.Il.14.291; of snakes, xrw/mati x. Philum. Ven.32.1;
ring like brass, fwnh\ xalki/zousa Poll.2.117.
play the game xalkismo/s, '
spin a copper', Alex.337, Herod.3.65, Poll.7.105, 206; cf. xalki/nda.

xalk-iko/s, h/, o/n,
in copper coin, PFrankf.1.38,91 (iii B. C.).

xalk-i/na_os, on,
dwelling in a brazen temple, like xalki/oikos, Hsch.

xalk-i/nda^, pai/zein to play
the game xalkismo/s, Id.

xa/lk-inos, h, on,
of bronze, no/misma OGI339.44 (Sestos, ii B. C.); dia/dhma Ostr.Bodl. i 262 (ii B. C.); xalki/nh (sc. draxmh/) PLond.2.380 (ii/iii A. D.).
concerning or
in bronze coin, lo/gos PTeb.119.51 (ii B. C.).

xalki/oikos [i^], h(,
she who dwells in a brazen house (i. e. Athena, whose name is freq. omitted), at Sparta, from the brazen shrine in which her statue stood, E.Hel.228,245 (both lyr.), Ar.Lys.1300 (lyr.), Th.1.128,134, Paus.3.17.2, 10.5.11.

xalki/on, to/,
copper vessel, cauldron, kettle, IG12.393, Ar.Ach.1128, Fr.107,330, Eup.108,256, X.Oec.8.19; x. qermanth/rion, = qermanth/r, IG22.1416, 4.39 (Aegina), Gal.13.663.
cymbal, to\ *dwdwnai=on x., prov. of a
chatterbox, Men.66, cf. Zen.6.5.
bowl of the ko/ttabos, Poll.6.110.
copper ticket given to the dicasts, bearing the name of the court in which they were to serve, D.39.10.
piece of copper money, ponhra\ xalki/a Ar.Ra.724 (troch.); paralabw\n tw\ xalki/w Eub.83; cf. Poll.9.90.—Freq. written xalkei=on in codd., but xalki/on is required by the metre in Com., and corroborated by Inscrr. (v. supr.), and Pap., PCair.Zen.630.4 (iii B. C.), PMich.Zen.65.2 (iii B. C.), PSI6.625.12 (iii B. C.), etc. prob. Dim. of xa/lkh, = ka/lxh 11, IG42(1).102.242 (Epid., iv B. C.).

xalkiofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
boiler-keeper in a bathing-establishment, Stoic.1.10, PCair.Zen.799.8 (iii B. C.).

xalki/s, i/dos, h(, an unknown bird (cf. ku/mindis), Il.14.291, cf. Arist.HA615b10, Parth.13.4:—Cratin.315 (hex.) parodies Il.l.c., taking x. in the sense of
a brazen pot. =
pica maritima (i. e.
roller, Coracias garrula), Gloss. a migratory fish, perh.
pilchard or
sardine, Clupea sardina, Epich.48, al., Arist.HA543a2, Numen. ap. Ath.7.328d, Opp.H.1.244; also a freshwater fish, Arist. HA568a18. = zigni/s, a poisonous
lizard, cicigna, ib.604b23, Plin.HN32.30, Aët.13.15; cf. xalkidiko/s 11.2. at Lacedaemon,
female slave, Proxen.8, Eust.1090.57. as pr. n., *xalki/s, i/dos, h(,
Chalcis, name of various cities, Il.2.537, etc.
xalkiska/rion, to/, dub. sens. in PLond.2.191.8 (ii A. D.).

xalk-ismo/s, o(,
game played by spinning a copper coin, which was stopped by the finger before it fell, Poll.9.118, Eust.986.41, 1409.18.
xalk-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, = sq. 1.2, Gal.1.452 cod.Marc.(ed. Helmreich), 15.32 (prob. l.). written xalk-ei/ths, = xalkeu/s, JHS32.165 (Pisidia); written kaxei/ths ib.161 (ibid.).

xalk-i=tis, idos （ews Gal. 13.375), h(,
containing copper, li/qos x.
copper-ore, worked in Cyprus, Arist.HA552b10; and in Euboea, Plu.2.434a. a mineral,
rock-alum, Emp. ap. Gal.15.32 (sed v. foreg.), Dsc.5.99, POxy.1088.19 (i A. D.), Sor.2.41; x. stupthri/h Hp.Ulc.14; x. kuane/h (of doubtful nature) ib.21. = xrusa/nqemon, Ps.-Dsc.4.58.

xalko-a/ra_s [a^r], a, o(,
bronze-armed, of men, in gen. pl. -ara=n, Pi.I.4(3).63(81); acc. sg. -a/ran ib.5(4).41.

xalko-ba^rh/s, e/s,
heavy or
loaded with bronze, i)o/s Il.15.465, Od.21.423; do/ru 11.532: fem. xalko-ba/reia (as if from *xalko/barus), Il.11.96, Od.22.259, 276.

xalko-ba^th/s, e/s, (bai/nw)
standing on bronze, with brazen base, or
with floor of bronze, xalkobate\s dw=, of the house of Zeus, Od.8.321, Il.1.426, 14.173, etc.; of that of King Alcinoüs, Od.13.4.
xalko/-ba^tos, on, = foreg., Hsch.
xalko-bo/as, ou, o(, = xalkeo/fwnos, *)/arhs S.OC1046 (lyr.).
xalko-ge/neios, on, = sq., AP6.236 (Phil.).

xalko/-genus, u,
with teeth of bronze, a)/gkura Pi.P.4.24.

xalko-glw/xi_s, i_nos, o(, h(,
with point or
barbs of bronze, meli/h Il.22.225.

xalko-dai/da^los, on,
wrought in bronze, a)spi/s B.Fr.6. Act.,
working in brass, te/xna AP9.777 (Phil.).

xalko-da/ma_s [da^], antos,
subduing, i.e.
sharpening bronze, a word of masc. termin. with fem. Subst., xalkoda/mant' a)ko/nan Pi.I.6(5).73.
xalko-desmwth/r and xalko-desmh/twr, expld. by xalko/desmos (-der- cod.), Hsch.

xalko/-detos, on,
bronze-bound, sa/kh A.Th.160 (lyr.); kotu/lai Id.Fr.57.6 (anap.); au)lai/ S.Ant.945 (lyr.); e)/mbola E.Ph.114 (lyr.).
xalko/dous, = xalkw/dwn, Hdn.Epim.208.

xalko-eidh/s, e/s,
like copper, copper-coloured, Arist.Col.793a26; me/littai Ael.NA17.35; r(a/bdoi D.S.17.90, cf. Dsc.5.99. epith. of the
cuneiform bone, x. o)ste/on, o)sta=, PLit.Lond.167.16
(ii/iii A. D.), Gal.14.725.

xalko/-zwnos, on,
girt with bronze, epith. of Heracles, EM436.18.

xalko/-qermon, to/,
hot bath, Gloss.

xalko-qe/sion, to/,
boiler-room in baths, POxy.2146.5 (iii A. D.), Stud.Pal.20.230 (iv A. D.).

xalko-qh/kh, h(, a building on the Acropolis of Athens, IG22120, 1469.84.
case for bronze vessels, provided specially for those of value, Ath.6.231d.

xalko/-qroos, on,
ringing with or
like bronze, Nonn.D.13.48.
xalko-qw/rac, a_kos, o(, h(, = xalkeoqw/rac, Pi.Pae.2.1, B.10.123, S.Aj.179 (lyr.).

xalko-ke/raunos, on, epith. of the sea, perh. f.l. for xalk-ama/rugos,
gleaming like copper or
bronze, A.Fr.192.3 (anap.).

xalko-knh/mi_s, i_dos, o(, h(,
bronze-greaved, Il.7.41.

xalko-kollhth/s, ou=, o(,
copper-welder, coppersmith, POxy.85 ii 4 (pl., iv A. D.).

xalko-ko/llhtos, on,
welded, Lat.
ferruminatus, Gloss.

xalko-korusth/s, ou=, o(,
bronze-armed, equipped with bronze, Il. 5.699, 6.199,398, al.; o(/milos Pi.Pae.6.108.

xalko-kra/s, a=tos, o(, h(, = foreg., IG22.1424
a.95, 1425.91; no/misma Hsch., Choerob.in Theod. 1.132, al.; on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.51, al.
copper-headed, i.e.
bronze-tipped, of missiles, Tim.Pers.30.

xalko/-kra_tos, on,
mixed with copper, Polyaen.4.10.2.

xalko-krodustai/, ai(, a mystic name for the
Nurses of Dionysus, Plu.2.672b (dub. l.).

xalko/-krotos, on,
sounding or
rattling with bronze, epith. of Demeter, in allusion to instruments used in her worship, Pi.I.7(6).3; x. i(/ppoi horses
that stamp with hoofs of bronze, brazen-hoofed, Ar.Eq.552 (lyr.). = xalkh/latos, fa/sganon E.Ph.1577 (lyr.); xalko/krota
bronze utensils, POxy.1657.1 (iii A. D.). xalkokro/tos, o(, = Lat.
aerarius, Gloss. (kalko/krotos cod.).
xalko/-ktu^pos, on, = foreg.1, kanaxa/ prob. in B.13.16; ku/mbala, Diog.Ath.1.3.

xalko-kw/dwn, wnos, o(, h(,
brazen-mouthed, sa/lpigc B.17.3.

xalko-li/ba^nos [i^], ou, h(, either
fine brass, brass of Lebanon, or
yellow frankincense, Apoc.1.15, 2.18.

xalko/-li^qos, o(,
copper ore, copper, Ps.-Democr.Alch.p.54B.

xalko-loge/w,
collect or
exact copper money, Rev. Épigr.1.239 (Naples, ii A. D.), Lyd.Mag.3.37, Hsch., Gloss.

xalko-lo/gos, o(,
collector of money, IG14.759 (Naples), MAMA3.514 (Corycus, written xark-), Gloss.

xalko/-lofos, on,
with bronze crest, Hsch. (s. v.l.).

xalko-mi/tras, a, o(,
with mi/trh
of bronze, *ka/stwr Pi.N. 10.90 (to be restored for xalkeom-):—also xalko/-mitros, on, Lyc. 997.

xalko-mo/lubdos, o(,
alloy of copper and lead, Maria ap. Olymp.Alch.p.93B.

xalko/-muia, h(,
a fly of bright metallic hue, ingredient of an eye-salve, Aët.7.100.

xalko-mwth/s, ou=, o(,
coppersmith, PMasp.143r14 (vi A. D.).

xalko/-nwtos, on,
bronze-backed, a)spi/s, i)te/a, E.Tr.1136,1193.

xalko-pa^gh/s, e/s,
made of bronze, sa/lpigc AP6.46 (Antip.Sid.).

xalko-pa/rh|os [pa^], Dor. xalko-pa/ra_|os, on,
with cheeks or
sides of bronze, epith. of helmets, Il.12.183, 17.294, 20.397, Od.24.523; of a javelin, Pi.P.1.44, N.7.71; kre/mbala Carm.Pop.3.

xalko/-pedos, on,
with floor of bronze, e(/dra qew=n Pi.I.7(6).44.

xalko-pla/sths, ou, o(,
bronze-worker, LXXWi.15.9.

xalko/-pleuros, on,
with sides of bronze, tu/pwma x., of a cinerary urn, S.El.54.

xalko-plhqh/s, e/s,
multitudinous and bronze-clad, strato/s E.Supp.1220.

xalko/-plhktos, Dor. xalko/-plaktos, on,
smiting with brazen edge, ge/nus, of the battle-axe, S.El.484 (lyr.; also expld. as = xalkh/latos).

xalko-poio/s, o(,
metalworker, Sammelb.5726.

xalko/-pous, podos, o(, h(,
with feet of bronze, tri/pous E.Supp.1197; o)do/s,
founded on bronze, S.OC57 (expld. by Sch. with ref. to
copper-mines): in Hom. of horses, to express the solid strength of their hoofs, xalko/pod' i(/ppw Il.8.41; tau=roi Pherecyd.112J.; x. *)erinu/s, to express her untiring pursuit, S.El.491 (lyr.); of Empedocles,
with bronze slippers, Luc.DMort.20.4.

xalko/-prw|ros, on,
with prow of bronze, of ships, Poll.2.102.

xalko/-pteros, on,
with wings of metallic hue, o)/rnis PSI6.569.9 (iii B. C.); mui=a Philum.Ven. 25.1.

xalk-o/pths, ou, o(,
copper-smelter, IG2.2867 (fort. xalko<ko/>pths）; [xalk]o/pths dub. in PCair.Goodsp.30 xii 30 (ii A. D.).

xalko/-pu^los, on,
with gates of brass or
bronze, i(ro/n Hdt.1.181; x. qea/, epith. of Athena, E.Tr.1113 (lyr.); u(/dwr, of Castalia, because issuing
from bronze spouts in the shape of lions' heads, Pi.Pae.6.7.

xalko-pw/gwn, wnos, o(, transl. of Lat.
Ahenobarbus, Plu.Aem.25, D.Chr.37.40.

xalko-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in copper or
bronze, Critias Fr.70 D., Poll.7.196.

xalk-o/rofos, on,
with roof of bronze, parqenew/n Nonn.D.47.543 (s. v. l.).
xalk-oru^xei=on, to/, f.l. for xalkwruxei=on (q. v.), Thphr.Lap. 25.

xalko/s, Cret. kauxo/s GDI5011.4 (iii B. C.), o(:—
copper, x. e)ruqro/s Il.9.365; with reference to its polished surface, ai)=qoy, h)=noy, nw=roy, faeino/s, 4.495, 16.408, 2.578, 12.151; *trw=es . . xalkw=| marmai/rontes 13.801; pedi/on . . la/mpeto xalkw=| 20.156; th=le de\ x. la/mf' w(/s te steroph/ 10.153, cf. 11.65, 19.363; sa/kos . . xalkw=| pamfai=non 14.11; and of the ornaments of a house, xalkou= te steroph/n Od.4.72; of
copper as the first metal that men learnt to smelt and work, tw=n d' h)=n xa/lkea me\n teu/xea, xa/lkeoi de/ te oi)=koi, xalkw=| d' ei)rga/zonto, me/las d' ou)k e)/ske si/dhros Hes.Op.151; x. e)ruqro/s (cf. supr.) Hp.Ulc.17, Thphr.Lap.57, Callix.1; x. e)ruqro\s kai\ leuko/s Thphr.Od.71; x. *ku/prios Posidon.52J., Dsc.1.102, cf. Polyaen.3.10.14; alloyed with tin to form
bronze, the usual meaning of the word in Hom. (v. infr. 11) and freq. in later writers: si/dhros de\ kai\ x. pole/mwn o)/rgana Pl.Lg.956a, etc.; x. kekrame/nos D.Chr.28.3. in Poets freq. for
anything made of metal, esp. of arms (hence Pi. calls it polio/s, the proper epith. of iron, P.3.48); of offensive arms, o)ce/i+ xalkw=|, nhle/i+ x., of a spear, a sword, Il.4.540, 3.292, al.; of a knife, 1.236, al.; of an axe, 13.180, Od.5.244, al.; of a fish-hook, Il.16.408; of defensive arms, as the plates laid on a shield, 20.275; xalko\n zw/nnusqai, of a warrior girding on his armour, 23.130; kekoruqme/nos, ai)/qopi x. 4.495; e)du/seto nw/ropa x. 2.578; of both combined, pla/gxqh d' a)po\ xalko/fi xalko/s
the spear of bronze glanced off
the helm of bronze, 11.351. of vessels,
copper, cauldron, urn, 18.349, Od.8.426; of a cinerary urn, S.El.758; collectively of
bronze plate, x. muri/os, Pi.N.10.45; qa/lamon . . , o(/qi nhto\s xruso\s kai\ x. e)/keito Od. 2.338, cf.13.19,21.10,62, Il.2.226; used in payment of ransom, 22.50, cf. 340, Od.5.38. of a
bronze mirror, A.Fr.393, Call.Lav.Pall.21, Ap6.210 (Philet.); used as a burning-glass, Thphr.Ign.73. collectively,
copper money, IPE12.24.15 (Olbia, iv B. C.), Ev.Matt. 10.9, Ev.Marc.12.41, cf. i)so/nomos 11; generally,
money, opp. ku/amoi, IG14.423 ii 21 (Tauromenium), cf. BGU822.12 (iii A. D.), etc.; xalkou= spa/nis MenMon.156; xalko\n e)/xwn pw=s ou)de\n e)/xeis ma/qe AP 11.167 (Pollian.). = xa/lkwma,
bronze plate or
tablet, ta\n proceni/an gra/yantas ei)s xalko\n a)nqe/men IG9(1).682 (Corcyra, iv B. C.); ou)etranoi\ oi( xwri\s xalkw=n, who have not received
bronze copies of the privileges granted on discharge, BGU113.5 (ii A. D.), etc. a weight, 1/8 obol, Gal.19.752. xalkou= a)/nqos, particles thrown off by copper when cooling, Hp.Mul.1.104, Ph.Bel.102.34, Dsc.5.77. xalkou= lepi/s, small pieces that scale off under the hammer, ib.78. (Perh. cf. Lith.
geležìs 'iron'.)

xalko-sa/nda^los, on,
with sandals of bronze, Porph. ap. Eus.PE 3.11.

xalko-skelh/s, e/s,
with legs of bronze, bou=s S.Fr.336.

xalko-sma/ragdos [sma^], h(,
a green stone with metallic veins, perhaps
malachite, Plin.HN37.74.
xalko/-sternos, on, = xalkoqw/rac, duna/meis Phleg.Fr. 36.3J.

xalko-ste/fa^nos, on,
bronze-crowned, te/menos Epigr. ap. D.S. 11.14.

xalko/-stomos, on,
with mouth of bronze, x. kw/dwn *turshnikh/, i.e. a trumpet, S.Aj.17.
with edge or
point of bronze, e)/mboloi A.Pers.415, Aristid.Or.25(43).4; me/tron POxy.101.40 (ii A. D.).

xalko-teixh/s, e/s,
with walls of bronze, au)la/ B.3.32.

xalko/-teuktos, on,
made of bronze, klh=|qra E.IT99.

xalko-th/ga^non, to/,
scutra, Gloss.

xalko/-tonon, to/,
torsion-engine with strands of bronze, Ph. Bel.67.43, cf. xalke/ntonon.

xalko/-tocos, on,
armed with brazen bow, Pi.N.3.38.

xalko-to/reutos, on,
wrought of bronze, tri/aina Orph.H.17.2.

xalko-tore/w,
to work or
form of bronze, e)/ntea APl.1.15.

xalko/-toros, on,
of piercing, sharp bronze, ci/fh Pi.P.4.147.
caused by piercing with bronze, w)teilai/ Opp.H.5.329 (expld. by xalko-tru/phtoi Sch.).

xalkotu^p-ei=on, to/,
forge, smithy, Ph.1.153, Nicom.Harm.6.

xalkotu^p-e/w,
work in bronze: timai\ -tupou/menai, of honorary statues,
wrought in bronze, Plu.2.820b.

xalkotu^p-i/a, h(,
wound by stroke of sword, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. xalkotu/pous (pl.).

xalkotu^p-ikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
art of a xalkotu/pos, Pl.Plt.288a, Plu.2.1084c.
xalkotu^/p-ion, to/, f.l. for xalkotupei=on.

xalko/tu^p-os (parox.), on,
forging or
working copper, te/xnai Man.4.570; a)nh\r e)n *kori/nqw| x. Plu.2.395c:—Subst.,
coppersmith, x. kai\ sidhrei=s X.Ages. 1.26. Vect.4.6; generally,
smith, Lycurg.58, D.25.38, IGRom.4.1259 (Thyatira), etc.; but distd. from xalkeu/s, X.HG3.4.17. = xalko/krotos 1, mani/h, of the priests of Cybele, AP6.51. proparox. xalko/tu^pos, on, Pass.,
inflicted with arms of bronze, w)teilai/ Il.19.25.
wrought of bronze, ei)kw/n APl.5.362.

xalkourg-ei=on, to/,
copper-mine, Plb.12.1.5 (pl.), Str.3.2.8, 6.1.5.
foundry, Dsc.5.75.

xalkourg-e/w,
work in bronze, Clara Rhodos 6/7.403 (Camirus, iii B. C.).

xalkou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
work of bronze, J.AJ 8.3.5, S.E.M.9.75, BGU362i 8 (iii A. D.). = xa/lkwma,
Peripl. M.Rubr.24, Supp.Epigr.6.616 (Pisidia).

xalkourg-i/a, h(,
working in bronze, Poll.7.104.

xalkourg-iko/s, h/, o/n: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) the
coppersmith's art, Arist.Pol.1256a6.

xalkourg-o/s, o/n,
working copper, x. me/talla
copper mines, Dsc.5.91 (nisi leg. -ourgika/): Subst. -go/s, o(,
miner, Posidon. 47J.;
worker in bronze, Luc.JTr.33, BGU362x17 (iii A.D.).

xalkou=s, h=, ou=n, Att. contr. from xa/lkeos, q.v. Subst. xalkou=s, o(,
copper coin used at Athens, 1/8 of an obol, Ar.Ec.815, 818, D.42.22, Alex.15.2, Philem.64,74, Cerc.17.41, Plu.2.665b, etc.: in pl.,
money, PCair.Zen.519 (iii B. C.), etc.

xalko-fa/la^ros [fa^], on,
adorned with brass, dw/mata Ar.Ach. 1072.

xalko-fa^nh/s, e/s,
having the appearance of copper, Dsc.5.74.
xalko/fi^, Ep. gen. from xalko/s, Il.11.351.

xalko-fo/ros, on,
producing copper, rich in copper, Eust.1409.8.
tipped with copper, qu/rsos Nonn.D.14.343.

xalko/-fwnos, on, = xalkeo/fwnos:—as Subst., h(, name of a
metallic-sounding stone, Plin.HN37.154.

xalko-xa/rmhs, ou, o(,
fighting in armour of bronze, ce/noi *trw=es Pi.P.5.82; x. po/lemos Id.I.6(5).27 (also expld. as (from xa/rma),
delighting in arms).

xalko-xi/twn [i^], wnos, o(, h(,
bronze-clad, *)axaioi/ Il.1.371, 2.47, etc.; *trw=es 5.180, al.; *boiwtoi/ 15.330; *krh=tes 13.255; *danaoi\ pu/ka x. Epigr. ap. Aeschin.3.185.

xalko/-xrous, oun,
copper-coloured, Dsc.2.182.

xalko/-xu^tos, on,
cast in bronze, pleurai\ boo/s AP9.739 (Jul.).

xalk-o/w,
turn to bronze, po/rtin AP9.795 (Jul.):—Pass., ib.716 (Anacr.). xalkwqei/s
clad in bronze, Pi.O.13.86.

xalk-u/drion, to/, Dim. of xalko/s, Zos.Alch.p.216B., Theognost.Can.fol.83 (om. Cramer p.126, ante neanisku/drion): pl.,
small change, BGU1821.12 (i B. C.).

xalk-w/dhs, es,
like bronze, xrw=ma Thphr.Sign.51; o)/tties Aret.SD2.13.

xalk-w/dwn, ontos, o(, h(,
bronze-beaked, sto/loi Hsch. (-o/d- cod., extra ordinem).

xa/lk-wma, atos, to/,
anything made of bronze or
copper, vessel, instrument, Ar.V.1214, Fr.436, Lys.19.27, X.An.4.1.8, Sophr.30, Nicostr.21.4, PCair.Zen.40.1 (iii B. C.), BGU993 iii 12 (ii B. C.), Sor.2.29, etc.; a)spi/dos to\ x. the
bronze-work, opp. to\ cu/lon, Arist.Mete.371a26, cf. Aen. Tact.37.7;
cauldron, Plu.Demetr.24.
copper plate or
tablet, for engraving records on, Plb.3.26.1, 3.33.18, IG9(1).685, al. (Corcyra, ii B. C.), 14.612 (Rhegium, i B. C.), 952.22 (Agrigentum, iii B. C.), 953.24 (Melita, iii B. C.); written xa/lxwma, JHS32.160 (Pisidia). generally,
metal plate, Plb.6.23.14.
beak of
a ship, D.S.20.9, Plu.Ant.67, etc.
xalk-wma=s, a=tos, o(, = xalkwmatourgo/s, PLond.3.1170v.244,257 (iii A. D.).
xalk-wma/tion, to/, Dim. of xa/lkwma, Inscr.Délos 1417Ai 104 (ii B. C.), Hsch.s.v. pla/twn.

xalk-wma^tourgo/s, o(,
maker of bronze plates, PRyl.397.3 (iii A. D.).
xalk-w/n, w=nos, o(, cited as a collective noun by Hdn.Gr.1.29.

xalk-w/nhtos, on,
bought with money, Hsch., cf. a)rgurw/nhtos.

xalk-w=nuc, u^xos, o(, h(,
with brazen hoofs, tau=roi Sch.A.R.3.233.

xalkwru^x-ei=on, to/,
copper-mine, Thphr.Lap.25, Str.17.2.2, Plu. 2.659c, better written xalkwru^x-ru/xion, as in PPetr.3p.320 (iii B. C.), Str. l. c. (v. l.), Plu. l. c. (codd.).

xalkwru^x-e/w,
dig or
mine copper, Lyc. 484.

xalkw/ru^x-os (parox.), on,
digging copper, copper miner, Tz.ad Lyc. 484.

xalmai/as, o(, a liquid
measure used in Egypt, to\n xalmai/an tou= e)lai/ou PSI5.531 (iii B. C.).

*xa^lubdiko/s or *xa^lu^biko/s (later, acc. to St. Byz.), h/, o/n,
Chalybian, si/dhros o( *xalubiko/s Arist.Mir.833b22: *xalu/binos is v.l. in Sch. S.Tr.1259 cod.Laur.: h( X.
the land of the Chalybes, Hsch.
of steel, Cratin.247, Lyc.1109; a)/ter *xalubdikou= without
Chalybian, i.e. without
steel, E.Heracl.161; *x. sto/mwma, v. sto/mwma.
xa^lu^bhi/+s, i/dos, poet. fem. of xalubdiko/s, Max.302.
xa/lubos, v. sq. 11.

xa/luy [a^], u^bos, o(, in pl.,
the Chalybes in Pontus, who were famous for the preparation of steel, oi( sidhrote/ktones *xa/lubes A.Pr. 715, cf. Hdt.1.28, X.An.5.5.1, Call. in PSI9.1092.48 (on another nation of the same name v. Str.12.3.20). as Appellat., xa/luy,
hardened iron, steel, A.Pr.133 (lyr.), S.Tr.1260 (anap.), Antip.Sid. in POxy.662.52; of a
penknife, AP6.65 (Paul.Sil.); of an
axe, APl. 4.127: as Adj., Nonn.D.36.182:—also *xa/lubos, on, *xa/lubos *skuqw=n a)/poikos, i. e.
steel, A.Th.728 (lyr.); *xalu/bw| pele/kei E.Fr.472.6 (anap.): pl., = *xa/lubes, E.ap.Sch.Il.Oxy.1087 i 28; to\n e)n *xalu/bois si/daron Id.Alc.980 (lyr.).

xa^ma/di^s [a^d] (xa^ma/di read in Od.19.599 by Eust.1879.53, cf. xama/ndis), Adv., Ep. for xama=ze,
to the ground, on the ground, ta\ me/n t' a)/nemos x. xe/ei Il.6.147; x. pe/se 7.16; x. ba/le ib.190, etc.; once in Trag., A.Th.358 (lyr.).

xa^ma_du/ths [u^], ou, o(,
earth-creeper, i. e.
snail, Hsch.

xa^m-a=ze, Adv., (xamai/)
to the ground, on the ground, freq. in Hom., e)c o)xe/wn su\n teu/xesin a)=lto x. Il.3.29, al.; a)po\ pu/rgou bai=ne x. stepped
to the ground, 21.529; [kerauno\n] h(=ke x. 8.134, cf. 14.497, 20.461; x. ka/ppesen 15.537; to/con . . qh=ke x. Od.21.136, cf.22.340: rare in Trag. and Com., E.Ba.633 (troch.), Ar.Ach.341, 344 (both troch.); mh\ pe/sh| x. Id.V.1012 (lyr.); x. probai/nousa Babr. 115.13; freq. in later Prose, x. qureoi=s keklime/nois Plu.Sull.28; e)/xein x. du/' o)bolw/ Luc.Lex.2. (On the exceptional accent cf. Ael. Dion.Fr.322, Hdn.Gr.2.951.)

xa^m-a=qen, Adv., (xamai/)
from the ground, Hdt.2.125, 4.172, Eup.146b, Ar.V.249, the Attic form, acc. to A.D.Adv.187.7 (who also gives xamai=qen which is found in Plu. 2.296e; xama/qen [a^] is v.l. in Hdt.2.125). xamo/qen is found in Cratin.296, X.HG7.2.7, Stesich. ap. Arist.Rh.1395a2, Plu. Alex.35, Luc.Ind.9, and was the colloquial form acc. to A.D.Adv. 188.33.

xa^m-ai/, Adv.
on the ground, x. h(=sqai Od.7.160; to\n au)= x. e)cena/rice Il.11.145; x. e)rxome/nwn a)nqrw/pwn 5.442, cf. Sapph.94, etc.; x. tiqei\s po/da A.Ag.906; ai(=ma mhtrw=|on x. Id.Eu.261 (lyr.), cf. Ar. Ach.869, Eq.155, Nu.231, al.; qe/ntes x. Hdt.4.67; x. kaqi/zontes Pl. Criti.120b; x. kei/menos IG22.1672.305; of birds, poiei=n neottia\n x., opp. e)pi\ de/ndrou, Arist.HA618a10. metaph., e)slo\n x. siga=| kalu/yai to bury in silence
underground, Pi.N.9.7; x. e)rxo/menoi cleaving to
earth, Luc.Herm.5, Icar.6; o( x. bi/os Metrod.Fr.38. = xama=ze,
to earth, e)n koni/h|si x. pe/sen Il.4.482; x. ba/lon e)n koni/h|si 5.588, cf. Od.22.188, Il.4.526; e)k di/froio xamai\ qo/re 8.320; mh\ x. pesei=n
to the ground, E.Med.1170; ou) x. pesei=tai o(/ ti a)\n ei)/ph|s Pl. Euthphr. 14d; e)/ptuse x. Ev.Jo.9.6; also e)kbalei=n ei)s to\ x. AP11.89 (Lucill.). (Cf. Lat.
humus, humi, Lith.
ž[etilde]mė 'earth'.)

xa^mai-a/kth, h(,
elder, Sambucus Ebulus, Ps.-Dsc.4.173, Plin. HN24.51.
xa^mai-ba/la^nos [ba^], h(, = a)/pios (A) 11, Dsc.4.175.

xa^mai/-ba^tos, h(,
blackberry, Rubus ulmifolius, Thphr.HP3.18.4.
xam-ai/geiron, to/, = bh/xion, Ps.-Dsc.3.112.

xa^mai-genh/s, e/s,
earth-born, epith. of men, h.Ven.108, h.Cer.352, Hes.Th.879, Pi.P.4.98; of ants, Nonn.D.13.209.

xa^mai-da/fnh, h(,
periwinkle, Vinca herbacea, Thphr.HP3.18.13, Plin.HN21.172. = da/fnh *)alecandrei/a, Dsc.4.147, Plin.HN24.132. = dafnoeide/s, Dsc.4.146.

xa^mai-di^da/ska^los, o(,
elementary schoolmaster, Edict.Diocl. 7.66, Paul.Al.O.2, Sch.Ar.Ec.804, Hierocl.Facet.61.

xa^mai-di^kasth/s, ou=, o(, = Lat.
judex pedaneus, Lyd.Mag.3.8: hence xa^mai-di^kaste/w,
fill this office, PLips.64.30 (iv A. D.).
xa^mai-dru^a/s, a/dos, h(, = xamai/drus, Androm. ap. Gal.14.40.

xa^mai-dru^i/+ths [i_] oi)=nos, o(, wine
flavoured with germander, Dsc.5.41.

xa^mai/-dru_s, u^os, h(,
germander, Teucrium Chamaedrys, Thphr.HP9.9.5, Dsc.3.98, Plin.HN24.130; gen. sg. written xame/truos BKT3p.32 (v/vi A. D.). = teu/krion, Ps.-Dsc. 3.97. = sko/rdion, ib.111; also xa^mai/-rwy (q. v.).
xa^mai-eu/nh, h(, = xameu/nh, PGen.68.16 (iv A. D.).

xa^mai-eu/nhs, ou, o(,
lying, sleeping on the ground, *selloi/ Il.16.235; le/ontes Emp.127; e)/rws Max.Tyr.24.8:—fem. xa^mai-euna/s, a/dos, su/es Od.10.243, 14.15; Com., of parasites, Eub.139 (lyr.).

xa^mai-eu/retos, on,
found on the ground, Anon. ap. Suid.

xa^mai/-zhlos, on （h, on Hp.Art.13):—
seeking the ground, low-growing, dwarf, x. futa/, opp. de/ndra, Arist.HA559a13; ko/nuza Nic.Th.70; oi( x. foi/nikes
dwarf-palms (cf. xamairifh/s 11) Dsc.1.109; karpoi\ kai\ la/xana Jul.Or.5.175d: generally, ta\ e)ggu\s h(mw=n kai\ x. Them.Or.26.327d.
sunk
down, h( e)pwmi\s fai/netai x. Hp.l.c.; th=| h(liki/a| xamai/zhlos Luc.
pro Im.13. xamai/zhlos (sc. di/fros, which is added by Plu.2.150a), o(,
low seat, stool, Hp.Fract.37, Pl.Phd.89b. x. krath=res
flat bowls, Polem.Hist.83. *zeu\s x., = xqo/nios, Orph.A.931; *poseidw=n x. IG22.1367. metaph.,
of low estate, humble, yuxh/ Ph. 1.91, cf. 240, al., Luc.Somn.13; ta\ x. Them.Or.15.184d; x. dikasth/s, =
judex pedaneus, Lyd.Mag.2.15. Adv. -lws Ph.1.103. xamai/zhlon, to/, = gnafa/lion, Plin.HN27.88. = penta/fullon, ib.25.109.
xa^mai-zu_mh/ths a)/rtos, o(, sine expl., Suid. (leg. -i/ths).
xa^mai=qen, v. xama=qen.

xa^mai/-kaulos, on,
with creeping stalk, Thphr.HP6.5.2.

xa^mai-ke/ra^sos, o(, = mimai/kulon, Asclep.Myrl. ap. Ath.2.50e.
dwarf cherry, Prunus prostrata, Plin.HN15.104.
May lily, Convallaria majalis, interpol. in Dsc.Eup.1.154 Sprengel (post 145 W.).

xa^mai/-kissos, o(,
ground-ivy, Glechoma hederacea, Dsc.4.125, Plin.HN24.135. = i)xquoqh/ra, ib.25.116. = kisso/s, ib.16.152.

xa^mai-koite/w,
lie on the ground, Luc.Syr.D.55 (v.l. xamokoite/wn).
xa^mai-koi/ths, ou, o(, = xamaieu/nhs, *selloi/ S.Tr.1166.

xa^mai-koiti/a, h(,
a lying or
sleeping on the ground, v.l. in Philostr.Ep.29 (pl.).

xa^mai-koi/tion, to/,
bed on the ground, Suid. s.v. stiba/des.

xa^mai-ku^pa/rissos [pa^], h(,
lavender cotton, Santolina Chamaecyparissus, Poet.
de herb.106, Plin.HN24.136.
xa^mai/-leos, o(, poet. for xamaile/wn 11, Nic.Th.656.
xa^mai-leu/kh, h(, = bh/xion, Ps.-Dsc.3.112; also = xamai/kissos, ib.4.125.

xa^mai-lexh/s, e/s,
on the ground, koi/ta AP7.413 (Antip.).

xa^mai-le/wn, ontos, o(,
chameleon, Chamaeleo vulgaris, Arist. HA503a15, Plin.HN8.120, Lib.Or.1.249; used as an image of changefulness, Arist.EN1100b6, Plu.Alc.23. name of various plants, so called
from their leaves changing colour, Thphr. HP6.4.3, 9.12.1, 9.14.1; x. leuko/s
pine-thistle, Atractylis gummifera, Dsc.3.8; x. me/las,
Cardopatium corymbosum, ib.9, Plin. HN22.47.
xa^mai-li/ba^nos [i^], o(, a kind of li/banos, Aët.1.129.
xa^mai/-lu^kos, o(, = peristerew\n u(/ptios, Ps.-Dsc.4.60; xa^mai/-lu^kon, to/, PMag.Par.1.2307.

xa^mai-mhla=ton, to/,
preparation of camomile, interpol. in Orib.5.33.7.

xa^mai-mhle/laion, to/,
camomile-oil, Alex.Trall.1.10.

xa^mai-mh/linos, h, on,
made of xamai/mhlon, Gal. 12.507, interpol. in Dsc.Eup.1.120.

xa^mai/-mhlon, to/,
earth-apple, camomile, Orph.A.921. = a)nqemi\s leukh/, Dsc.3.137, Plin.HN22.53. = parqe/nion, Ps.-Dsc.3.138.
xa^mai-mursi/nh, h(, = mursi/nh a)gria/, Plin.HN15.27, 23.165, prob. to be read for sq.
xa^mai-mu/rth, h(, = foreg., dub. l. in Dsc.4.144.

xa^mai-pe/teia, h(,
being xamaipeth/s, lamb.Protr.21. is/.

xa^mai-pete/w,
fall to the ground, gnw/ma xamaipetoi=sa thought
that falls to the ground, Pi.N.4.41 (sed leg. xamai\ petoi=sa).

xa^mai-peth/s, e/s, (pi/ptw)
falling to the ground, x. pi/ptei pro\s ou)=das E.Ba.1111 (s. v. l.); fo/nos x. blood
that has fallen on the earth, Id.Or.1491 (lyr.); do/moi . . xamaipetei=s e)/keisq' a)ei/ ye were lying
prostrate, A.Ch.964 (lyr.);
grovelling, mhde\ . . xamaipete\s bo/ama prosxa/nh|s e)moi/ Id.Ag.920; x. [be/los], of a
spent missile, Aen.Tact.32.9; x. e)lai=ai
windfall olives, Luc.Lex.13.
lying or
sleeping on the ground, x. a)ei\ w)\n kai\ a)/strwtos Pl.Smp.203d.
on the ground, x. stiba/s, eu)nh/, E.Tr.507, Cyc.386; dei=pnon Posidon.5J. of trees,
creeping, dwarf, Plb.13.10.8.
flying low, x. strouqoi/ Luc.Dips.2. Adv. -tw=s
along the ground, like a goose's flight, Id.Icar.10. metaph.,
falling to the ground, i. e.
coming to naught, lo/goi, e)/pos, Pi.O.9.12, P.6.37.
grovelling, low, of style, komidh=| pezo\n kai\ x. Luc.Hist.Conscr.16, cf. Somn.13.

xa^mai-peu/kh, h(,
fishbone thistle, Chamaepeuce mutica, Dsc.4.126, Plin.HN24.136.

xa^mai/-pi^tus, u^os, h(,
ground-pine, Ajuga Chamaepitys, Nic.Al.56, Apollod. ap. Ath.15.681d, Dsc.3.158, Plin.HN24.29.
mountain germander, Teucrium montanum, Dsc. l. c., Plin. l.c.
herbivy, Ajuga Iva, Dsc. and Plin. ll.cc. = u(periko/n, Dsc.3.154. = mursi/nh a)gri/a, Ps.-Dsc.4.144:—hence xa^maipi^tu/i+nos oi)=nos wine
flavoured with one of these plants, Dsc.5.70.

xa^mai-pla/ta^nos [pla^], h(,
dwarf plane, Plin.HN12.13.

xa^mai/-pous, o(, h(, -poun, to/, gen. -podos,
going on foot, Poll.2.195,3.40.
xa^mai-ra/fa^nos [ra^], o(, = a)/pios (A) 11, Paul. Aeg.7.4:—spelt xa^mai-re/fa^nos Orib.Fr.52, Hippiatr.130.184.

xa^mai-reph/s, e/s,
creeping on the ground, grovelling, Gal.12.308. Adv. -pw=s Hsch. cf. sq. 11.

xa^mai-ri^fh/s, e/s, (r(i/ptw)
thrown to the ground, mined, nho/n Inscr. in Ferri
Contributi di Cirene alla storia della religione greca (Rome, 1923）5 (ii A. D.), cf. Eust.1279.45. = foreg. 1, Sch.Gen.Il.5.442; paidi/a EM781.36. =
collecticius, Gloss. foi=nic x.
dwarf-palm,
Chamaerops humilis, Thphr. HP2.6.11 (nisi leg. xamaireph/s as in Plin.HN13.39).
xa^mai/-ru^ton, to/, = strou/qion, Ps.-Dsc.2.163.

xa^mai/-rwy, h(, = xamai/drus 1, Dsc.3.98 (v.l. xamai/drwy), Paul.Aeg.7.3; acc. sg.
chamaeropem Plin.HN24.130 (elsewh. only nom.).
dwarf-palm, v.l. in Plin.HN13.39.

xa^mai-strwsi/a, h(,
a bed on the ground, Sch.S.Ph.33.

xa^mai/-strwtos, on,
strewed or
stretched on the ground, ne/kus alcmaeonis 2p.76K.; xamai/strwta
beds on the floor, Ph.2.482.

xa^mai-su/kh [u_], h(,
thyme spurge, Euphorbia Chamaesyce, Dsc.4.169, Plin.HN24.134: Adj. xa^mai-su/kinos, h, on, Gloss. = a)stra/galos VII, Ps.-Dsc.4.61.

xa^mai-sxi^dh/s, e/s,
branching from the ground upwards, pi/sos Thphr.CP4.14.4.

xa^maitu^p-ei=on, to/,
brothel, Phld.Rh.2.281S., Ph.2.228, Luc.DMort. 10.11, Nigr.22, Jul.Or.6.186d.

xa^maitu^p-e/w,
to be a prostitute, D.Chr.33.60.

xa^maitu^/p-h, h(,
harlot, strumpet, Timocl.22.2, Men.879, Sam.133, Theopomp.Hist.217 codd.Ath. (xamaitu/pous codd. Plb.), Phld.Rh.1.236S., Ph.2.48, Plu.2.5b.

xa^maitu^p-h/s, e/s,
vulgar, to\ x.
vulgarity of style, D.H.Th.27.

xa^maitu^p-i/a, h(,
whoredom, Alciphr.3.64, Man. 4.353.

xa^maitu^p-i/s, i/dos, h(, = xamaitu/ph, rejected by Thom.Mag.
p.400R.

xa^mai/tu^p-os (parox.), on,
striking its prey near or
on the ground, name of a certain hawk, opp. metewroqh/ras, Arist.HA620a31. xamaitu/pos po/rnh, = Lat.
scortum, Gloss.; but ai( xamaitu/poi is prob. f. l. for ai( xamaitu/pai (corr. Wendland) in Ph.1.345, cf. xamaitu/ph.
xa^ma/ndis, = xama/dis, Theognost.Can.163.
xa^ma/omai, = xasma/omai, Hsch.

xa^m-elai/a, h(,
spurge-olive, Daphne oleoïdes, Nic.Al.48, Dsc.4.171, Plin.HN15.24, 24.133. = qumelai/a, Dsc.4.172.

xa^m-elai/+ths [i_] oi)=nos wine
flavoured with xamelai/a, Id.5.69.

xa^m-erph/s, e/s,
crawling on the ground, me/ropes App.Anth.3.146 (Theon); zw=|on Olymp.Alch. p.102 B., Hsch.
xa^m-etairi/s, i/dos, h(, = xamaitu/ph, Id., EM806.25.

xa/meun-a [xa^], h(, = xameu/nh,
pallet-bed, IG12.330.5, Nicaenet.6.3, Eleg.Alex.Adesp.2.17.

xameun-a/s, a/dos, h(,
on the ground, eu)nai/ Lyc. 848. = xamaieuna/s,
having their lair on the ground, bou=s, le/aina, fw/kh, Nonn.D.4.348, 6.299, 43.339. Subst.,
lair, Nic.Th. 23. = xamaitu/ph, Lyc.319.

xameun-e/w,
lie on the ground, Ph.1.640, Philostr.VA6.10, Gal.Protr.13.

xameu/n-h, h(, for xamaieu/nh,
a bed on the ground, A.Ag.1540 (anap.), S.Fr.175, E.Rh.852, Theoc.13.33, A.R.4.883, Herod.3.16; x. fullo/strwtos E.Rh.9 (anap.). generally,
bedstead, Ar.Av.816.

xameu/n-hs, ou, o(,
one who sleeps on the ground, Hsch.

xameun-i/a, h(,
a lying on the ground, Ph.1.323 (pl.), Gal.17(2).642, Philostr.VA3.15, Gym.43. pl.,
sleeping-mats, Poll.6.11.
xameu/n-ion, to/, Dim. of xameu/nh, Pl.Smp.220d, Luc.Asin.51, Poll. 6.9.
xameun-i/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Theoc.7.133.

xa/meun-os, on,
sleeping on the ground, Hsch.

xa^mhlo/s, h/, o/n,
on the ground, creeping, leixh/n Nic.Th.944; pi/tus x., = xamai/pitus, ib.841: Comp. -o/teros Id.Fr.70.2.
low, = xqamalo/s, Str.10.2.12; of a horse's hoofs,
flat, X.Eq.1.3.
diminutive, trifling, stigmh=s ei)/ ti -o/teron AP7.472.4 (Leon.); xamhla\ pne/wn one of a
low spirit, Pi.P.11.30.

xa^mi=tis a)/mpelos, h(, a vine trained
