low on the ground, GP.3.1.5, Eust.1163.19; without a)/mpelos, Suid.

xamno/s, gloss on a)deukh/s, Hsch. (In Mod. Gk. =
thin, watery.）
xa^mo/qen, v. xama=qen.
xa^mo-koite/w, f.l. for xamaik- (q.v.).
xamo/mulon (sic), to/, = xamai/mhlon, PLond.5.1788.12 (vi A. D.).
xamo/n: ka/mpulon, Hsch.; cf. xabo/s.

xamoso/rion, to/,
flat tomb, Heuzey-Daumet,
Mission Archéologique de Macédoine No.49.

xa^m-ou/lkion, to/, =
stludio, Gloss., and xa^m-oulki/s, i/dos, h(, =
sclodia, ib. (both perh. Dim. of sq.).

xa^m-oulko/s (sc. mhxanh/), h(, (e(/lkw)
crane or
windlass, BGU162 viii 4, Amm.Marc.17.4.14, cf. Poll.7.191. Lat. =
trahea, Gloss.

xa/mya, o(, Egyptian name for kroko/deilos, Hdt.2.69, cj. in A.Supp.878 (lyr.). (Egyptian
msh, Arabic
timsāh.）

xa/n [a_], a(, Dor. for xh/n,
goose, gen. xa_no/s Epich.152, nom. xa/n IG42(1).122.133 (Epid., iv B. C.); acc. pl. xa=nas Ar.Ach.878.

xa^na^nai=os, a, on,
Canaanite, LXX Ge.12.6. al.:—as Appellat.,
merchant (of Tyre or Sidon), Id.Pr.31.24.
xa=nas, v. xa/n.
xanda/, = xando/n, A.D.Adv.152.13.

xanda/nw, Hp.Mul.1.78, Ep. impf. xa/ndane（n) Il.23.742, Q.S.12.328: fut. xei/somai Od.18.17: aor. e)/xa^don Il.4.24, Ep. xa/don 11.462, inf. xadei=n Nic.Th.956, Ep.and Ion. xade/ein Il.14.34, Hp.Genit.9, part. xadw/n Nic.Al.145: pf. with pres. sense, ke/xanda and plpf. kexa/ndei （kexo/ndei v.l. in Il.24.192, e)kexa/ndei Hsch.), v. infr.:—Ep. Verb (used once or twice in Ion. Prose, and once in Ar., v. infr.),
take in, hold, contain, e(\c d' a)/ra me/tra xa/ndanen (sc. krhth/r) Il.23.742; le/bhs te/ssara me/tra kexandw/s ib.268; ou)k e)dunh/sato pa/sas ai)gialo\s nh=as xade/ein 14.34; oi)=kos kexandw\s polla\ kai\ e)sqla/ Od.4.96; o(\s [qa/lamos] glh/nea polla\ kexa/ndei Il.24.192; ou)do\s a)mfote/rous o(/de xei/setai Od.18.17; *(/hrh| d' ou)k e)/xade sth=qos xo/lon the breast of Hera
could not
contain her rage (v.l. *(/hrh d' . . , Hera
could not
contain her anger in her breast), Il.4.24; kre/as w(/s oi( xei=res e)xa/ndanon as much as his hands
could hold, Od.17.344; o(/son xanda/nei xei/r Hp.Mul.1.78; [r(o/palo/n] oi( e)xa/ndane xei/r Theoc.13.57, cf. Lyc.317, Arat.697. in prescriptions,
take, Nic.Th.956, Al.58,145. metaph.,
to be capable, able, h)/u+sen o(/son kefalh\ xa/de fwto/s Il.11.462; kekraco/mesqa/ g' o(po/son h( fa/ruc a)\n h(mw=n xanda/nh| di' h(me/ras Ar.Ra.260; kwku/sasa . . o(/sson e)xa/ndane mhtro\s a)ni/h AP7.644 (Bianor); o(/son xa/don, o(/sson e)/recan Opp.C.4.210: c. inf., sto/ma xei/setai e)conomh=nai tou=to prob. for stonaxh/setai in h.Ven.252. (Cf. Lat.
pr(a)e-hendo; root xend- in xei/somai （xend-s-) and ke/xonda (which shd. prob. be restored in Hom.); xa-n-d-a/nw is formed from e)/xadon （e)/x
ṇdon).)

xando/n, Adv.
with mouth wide open, greedily, eagerly, [oi)=non] x. e(lei=n Od.21.294, cf. Call.Aet.1.1.11, Nic.Th.341, Opp.C.4.430 (cj.), etc.; in late Prose x. e)kpiei=n, pie/sqai, pi/nein, Gal.15.735, Luc.Merc. Cond.7, Jul.Mis.338c; spa=n D.C.71.10; metaph., x. e)nepi/mplanto eu)xw=n Luc.Alex.14; x. e)mpipla/menos tou= u(/pnou Philostr.Im.2.22.

xandopo/ths, ou, o(,
toper, AP11.59 (Maced.).

xando/s, h/, o/n,
yawning, roomy, e)k xandh=s zwropotw=n ku/likos Epigr. ap. Polem.Hist.79.

xa/nna or xa/nnh, h(, a kind of
sea-perch, Serranus hepatus or
cabrilla, Epich.67, Arist.HA538a21, 591b6, Ael.NA4.5; acc. xa/nnan Speus. ap. Ath.7.319b; acc. pl. xa/nas (sic) BGU844.17 (i A. D.):— also xa/nnos, o(, Numen. ap. Ath.7.304e; = Lat.
perca, Gloss.
xa/noi, xanw/n, v. xa/skw.

xa/nos [a^], eos, to/,
mouth, Com.Adesp.1193.

xa^nu/w and xa^nu/ssw,
speak with mouth wide open, Hsch.

xa/os [a^], eos, Att. ous, to/,
chaos, the first state of the universe, prw/tista x. ge/net', au)ta\r e)/peita *gai=' eu)ru/sternos ktl. Hes.Th.116, cf. Ibyc.28, Epich.170.3, Acus.Fr.5J., Arist.Metaph.1091b6, Ar.Av. 693 (anap.); xa/ous . . pai=s kaleu=mai Simm.Alae7; represented sts. as
infinite space, S.E.P.3.121, cf. Plot.6.8.11; sts. as
unformed matter, Luc.Am.32 (esp., acc. to the Stoics,
water, Zeno Stoic.1.29 (with deriv. fr. xe/w)).
space, the expanse of air, a)/truton x. B.5.27, cf. Ar.Nu.424 (anap.), 627, Av.1218. to\ x. tou= e)f' e(ka/tera a)pei/rou ai)w=nos, of
infinite time, M.Ant.4.3.
the nether abyss, infinite darkness, joined with *)/erebos, Pl.Ax.371e; with o)/rfnh, Q.S. 2.614; represented as in the interior of the globe, Plu.2.953a; xa/ous ku/na, of Cerberus, APl.4.91. generally,
darkness, A.R.4.1697.
any vast gulf or
chasm, LXX Mi.1.6, Za.14.4; of a
pit, Opp.C.4.92; of the
gaping jaws of the crocodile, ib.3.414, cf. 4.161, H.5.52. Pythag. name for
one, Theol.Ar.6.
xa_o/s, o/n, v. xa/i+os.

xa^o/w,
destroy utterly, swallow up, le/gwn xaw=sai au)to/n Simp.in Epict.p.47 D.:—Pass., e)n th=| gh=| xaou/menos Olymp. in Mete.143.5.

xa^ra/, h(: (xai/rw):—
joy, delight, first in Sapph.Supp.1.6, then in Trag. and (less freq.) in Com. and Prose: c. gen., sto/matos e)n prw/th| x., of a hungry man, A.Fr.258; c. gen. objecti,
joy in or
at a thing, mele/wn E.Alc.579 (lyr.); pro\s xara\n lo/gwn in accordance with
joyous tidings, S.Tr.179 (v.l. xa/rin）; ke/rtomos qeou= x.
a joy sent by some mocking god, E.Alc.1125; a(/ma xara=| dakruou/sas X. HG7.2.9; x. e)pi/ tini Pl.Def.413e; e)/dwkas h(mi=n x. S.Tr.201; e)la/bomen x. E.Ion1449 (lyr.); e)mplh=sai/ tina xara=s Id.Ph.170; xara/ m' u(fe/rpei A.Ag.270; le/geis moi xara/n wishest me
joy, Ar.Pl.637 (lyr.); x. e)nerga/sasqai Gorg.Hel.8; xai/rein a)ndrapo/dwn tina\ xara/n Plu.2.1091e, cf. Ev.Matt.2.10; h(donh\ kai\ te/ryis kai\ x. Pl.Phlb.19; a)pore/ousi . . xara=s Democr.293, cf. Epicur.Fr.2; zh/lou kai\ xara=s kai\ e)pai/nwn h( po/lis h)=n mesth/ D.18.217; ei)/selqe ei)s th/n x. tou= *kuri/ou sou Ev.Matt.25.21: xara=|
with joy, A.Ag.1630, Ch.233, etc.; meta\ xara=s Com.Adesp.771, X.Hier.1.25, LXX 1 Ch.29.22, al.; meta\ mega/lhs x. Plb.21.34.12 (s.v.l.); meta\ pollh=s x. BGU1141.3 (i B. C.), cf. 1768.7 (i B. C.); xara=s u(/po A.Ag.541; u(po\ x. X.Cyn.6.15; su\n xara=| S.El.934, etc.; opp. lu/ph, Sor.1.46, al. in concrete sense,
a joy, of persons, x. mou Ep.Phil.4.1, cf. 1 Ep.Thess.2.20.

xa^ra/ggelos, o(, = xara=s a)/ggelos,
messenger of joy, EM7.32.

xa/rag-ma [xa^], atos, to/, (xara/ssw)
any mark engraved, imprinted, or
branded, x. e)xi/dnhs the serpent's
mark, i. e. its
bite, sting, S.Ph. 267; e)n i)sxi/ois me\n i(/ppoi puro\s xa/ragm' e)/xousin Anacreont.26 B 2; e)/xein to\ x. tou= qhri/ou Apoc.16.2, cf. 13.16; x. xeiro/s, i.e. writing, AP9.401 (Pall.); xara/gmata pambasilh=os, of an imperial
missive, Epic. in BKT5(1).115: abs.,
inscription, AP7.220 (Agath.), cf. PLond.5.1688.8 (iv A. D.);
stamped document, Sammelb.5275.11 (i A. D.);
brand on a camel, PGrenf.2.50（
a).5 (ii A. D.); x. te/xnhs
carved work, Act.Ap.17.29; to\ x. tou= nomi/smatos the
impress on the coin, Plu.Lys.16, cf. Ages.15, Jul.Mis.355d (pl.), etc.; hence,
stamped money, coin, AP5.29 (Antip.Thess.), POxy.144.6 (vi A. D.). metaph.,
mark, stamp, character, to\ th=s mona/dos shmantiko\n x. Theol.Ar.6.
endorsement, Arch.Pap.1.85.

xarag-mh/, h(,
loaf, siligni/wn x. PKlein.Form.986 (v/vi A. D.); written silikni/wn

xarakmh/ ib.985 (v/vi A. D.).
water-channel, Gloss.

xarag-mo/s, o(,
incision, notch, Thphr.HP3.11.3, 3.13.5.
stamped document, PRyl.160（
a).10 (i A. D.).
xa/ra^dos [xa^], eos, to/, Dor. for sq., Tab.Heracl.1.60.

xa^ra/dr-a, Ion. xara/drh, h(,
mountain-stream, torrent, which cuts itself (xara/ssei) a way down the mountain-side, kleitu=s to/t' a)potmh/gousi xara/drai Il.16.390, cf. D.P.1077; oi)/nw| . . a(/pas' e)/rrei x. TeleclId.1.4 (anap.); x. xeimeri/h A.R.4.460; x. xeima/rrous kai\ baqei=a Plb.10.30.2; fwnh\ xara/dras o)/leqron tetokui/as (of a loud, harsh voice), Ar.V.1034 (anap.); x. katelh/luqen, of a
torrent of words, Pherecr.51.
the bed of such a stream, gully, ravine, koi/lhs e)/ntosqe xara/drhs Il.4.454; cf. Hdt.9.102, Th.3.98,107, X.An. 3.4.1, D.55.5; x. krhmnw/dhs Th.7.78; h( *nemea\s x. Aeschin.2.168, cf. X.HG4.2.15. metaph. of
wounds produced by scourging, Lib.Or.57.16. prov., *oi)nw/nh (fort. *oi)no/h） th\n x. of those who bring misfortune on themselves, interpol. in Str.8.6.16.

xa^radr-ai=os, a, on,
of or
from a xara/dra, i)lu/s APl.4.230 (Leon.); phgh/, r(e/eqron, Nonn.D.15.191, 2.444.
jagged, ai)xmh/, be/lemna, ib.28.210, 35.4; pareiai/
furrowed, ib.2.641.
xa^ra/dr-eion, to/, poet. for xara/dra, Nic.Th.389.

xa^radr-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
ground broken up by gullies, Hdn. Epim.199.

xa^radr-h/eis, essa, en, =
full of gullies, *puqw/ Nonn.D.9.251. = xaradrai=os 2, kenew/n ib.48.34; be/lemnon ib.17.202, al.
xa^ra/dr-ion, to/, Dim. of xara/dra, Str.16.4.13.

xa^radr-io/s, o(, a
bird, prob. the
thickknee or
Norfolk plover, Charadrius oedicnemus, Ar.Av.266,1141, Hp.Int.37, Arist.HA593b15, 615a1, LXXLe.11.19, De.14.17(18); it was very greedy, hence prov. xaradriou= bi/on zh=n, of a glutton, Pl.Grg.494b; the sight of it was held to be a cure for the jaundice, cf. Hippon.52, Plu.2.681c, Ael.NA17.13.

xa^radr-o/omai, Pass.,
to be broken into clefts by mountain-streams, to be full of gullies, xw/rh kexaradrwme/nh Hdt.2.25; w(s a)\n xaradrwqei/h o( xw=ros Id.7.176: metaph., oi( po/roi xaradrou=ntai the pores
are widened into large channels, Hp.Flat.10.

xa^/radr-os, o(, = xara/dra, Plu.Agis8, IG7.3170 (Orchom. Boeot.), SIG826 E23 (Delph., ii B. C.): as pr. n. of
many
torrents in Greece, Th.5.60, Paus.2.25.2, 7.22.11, etc.

xa^radr-w/dhs, es,
full of gullies, to/poi Dsc.4.57.
of a torrent, ta\ x. u(/data Str.14.1.43.

xa^ra^k-i/as, ou, o( （xa/rac)
of or
fit for a stake, pale, or
palisade, a species of ka/lamos, Thphr.HP4.11.1, Plin.HN16.168. a kind of tiqu/mallos a)/rrhn,
wood spurge, Euphorbia Sibthorpii, Dsc.4.164, Plin.HN26.62 (xara/khs is f. l. in Hsch.). a fish, Gp.20.7.1.

xa^ra^k-i/zw,
fence with stakes driven in cross-wise: metaph. of a fly, x. toi=s prosqi/ois ske/lesi
dress itself by crossing the forelegs, Arist.PA683a30.

xa^ra^/k-ion, to/, Dim. of xa/rac, in pl., = u(posthri/gmata, Hsch. xara/kin (sic), = Lat.
tessera, Gloss.

xa^ra^k-i/des, =
terriclae, ib.

xa^ra^k-ismo/s, o(,
palisading, fencing, Pherecr.130.2 (anap.), JHS33.338 (Maced., iii A. D.).

xa^ra^k-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
living behind a fence: metaph.,
cloisterling, bibliakoi\ x. Timo 12.2. x. tiqumali/s, = xaraki/as 11, Afric.Cest.p.81 V., Aët.1.397.

xa^ra^ko-boli/a, h(,
forming a palisade, LXX Ez.17.17.

xa^ra^ko-loge/w,
collect stakes, BGU1534.2 (iii B. C.).

xa^ra^ko-poie/omai,
form a palisade, fortify a camp, App.BC5.110.

xa^ra^ko-poii/a, h(,
making of a vallum, Plb.6.34.1.

xa^ra^ko/w,
fence by a palisade, fortify, *)ela/teian Aeschin.3.140; x. kai\ tafreu/ein po/lin D.S.23.18, cf. Plu.Cleom.20; metaph., x. to\n plou=ton Philostr.VA7.23: c. dat. modi, to\ sto/ma o)dou=si Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.69; tw\ po/de sku/tesin Max.Tyr.36.2:—Pass., o)/strakon kexarakwme/non tai=s a)ka/nqais, of the echinus, Arist.PA679b29; metaph., ma=za kexarakwme/nh a)xu/rois Antiph.226.1: f.l. for e)karw/qh in Ant.Lib.12.4. abs., x. e)pi\ *)ierousalh/m
raise a barricade against it,
besiege it, LXXJe.39(32).2.
prop vines with stakes, [a)/mpelon] PCair.Zen.229 (iii B. C.), cf. Gp.5.27.1; blasto/n PSI6.624.14 (iii B. C.).

xa^rakth/r, h=ros, o(, (xara/ssw)
engraver, Euryph. ap. Stob.4.39.27;
one who mints coins, IPE1216A14 (Olbia, iii B. C.).
graving tool, Daimachus 4J. (pl.) ap.St.Byz. s.v. *lakedai/mwn.
die, stamp, IG22.1013.64, 1408.11, 1424a120, 280, 1469.107; in a simile, Arist.GA781a28.
branding-iron, Clara Rhodos 2.171 (ii B. C.).
mark engraved, impress, stamp on coins and seals, a)rgu/rou lampro\s x. E.El.559, cf. Pl.Plt.289b, Arist. Pol.1257a40;
coin type, standard, h)=n d' o( a)rxai=os x. di/draxmon Id.Ath.10.2, cf. OGI339.45 (Sestos, ii B. C.), D.S.17.66; *ko/tuos x. Head Hist.Num.2285 (Thrace, i B. C.): hence, in pl., = xa/ragma 1.2, PFlor.61.21 (i A. D.): metaph., oi(=s h( a)reth\ eu)doci/as xarakth=ra toi=s e)/rgois e)pe/balen set a
stamp upon them, Isoc.1.8; *ku/prios (s. v. l.) xarakth\r . . e)n gunaikei/ois tu/pois ei)kw\s pe/plhktai A.Supp.282. esp. of
figures or
letters, oi( tw=n gramma/twn x. Plu.2.214f; o( tu/pos tw=n x. ib.577f, cf. 1120f, D.S.3.67; of the
letters used by Hp. in Epid.3.1, Zeno and Apollonius ap.Gal.17(1).618, cf. 524sq.; of a single
letter of the alphabet, Jul.Or.2.72a; culh/fia braxe/a e)/xonta xarakth=ra Plb.6.35.7;
brand on a camel, PGen.29.8 (ii A. D.); of
symbols in a prescription, Gal.13.995; of magical
symbols (such as the seven vowels), tw=n x. h( a)po/rrhtos fu/sis Jul.Or.7.216c, cf. Iamb.Myst.3.13, Sallust.15; of hieroglyphs, opp. gra/mmata, Luc. Herm.44. metaph.,
distinctive mark or
token impressed (as it were)
on a person or thing, by which it is known from others,
characteristic, character, x. glw/sshs, of a particular dialect, Hdt.1.57,142; x. au(to\s e)n glw/ssh| S.Fr.176; x. h(medapo\s tw=n r(hma/twn Ar.Pax220; o( *(ellhniko\s x. Greek
idiom, D.H.Pomp.3: freq. of persons,
feature, o( x. tou= prosw/pou Hdt.1.116; ei)lhfe/nai xarakth=ra e(kate/rou tou= ei)/dous Pl.Phdr.263b; oi( th=s o)/yews x. D.S.1.91; a)ndrw=n ou)dei\s x. e)mpe/fuke sw/mati E.Med.519; deino\s x. ka)pi/shmos . . e)sqlw=n gene/sqai Id.Hec.379; fanero\s x. a)reta=s Id.HF659 (lyr.); h)qikoi\ x., title of work by Thphr.: pl., oi( x. the
features of the face, J.AJ13.12.1, cf. OGI508.13 (Ephesus, ii A. D.); x. morfh=s e)mh=s ib.383.60 (Nemrud Dagh, i B. C., sg.); [tou= e)mbru/ou] Sor.1.33 (pl.): hence,
type or
character (regarded as shared with others) of a thing or person, rarely of an
individual nature, a)ndro\s x. e)k lo/gou gnwri/zetai Men.72; x. moxqhro/taton parapla/ttesqai Phld.Rh.1.6 S.; to\n x. to\n *dioge/nous Arr.Epict.3.22.80; ti/na e)/xei x. ta\ do/gmata; ib.4.5.17; of nations, Plb.18.34.7.
style, freq. in Rhet., o( *dhmosqe/nous x. D.H.Dem.9, cf. Pomp.1, Cic.QF2.15(16).5; x. dikaniko/s Phld.Rh.2.137S.; x.
optimi the ideal
type, Cic.Orat. 11.36, cf.39.134; x. i)sxno/s, megalopreph/s, glafuro/s, deino/s Demetr. Eloc.36, cf. D.H.Dem.33; x. le/cews Id.Lys.11; x. *)asiano/s Str.13.1.66.
impress, image, th=s u(posta/sews [tou= qeou=] Ep.Heb.1.3; pa/qous, a)reth=s, Longin.22.1, Eun.Hist.p.243 D.: abs., oi( *seba/steioi x. the imperial
seal, i.e. the emperor himself, IG5(2).268.24 (Mantinea, i B. C.). Gramm.,
typical form, A.D.Synt.20.10, 103.23.

xarakthr-ia/zw,
mint, coin, IGRom.4.960 (Samos, i A. D.). = sq. 2, Gloss.

xarakthr-i/zw, fut. -i/sw Phld.D.3.14: pf. kexarakth/rika Aristeas 153:—
engrave, inscribe, Manethoap.Syncell.1p.72D.（Pass.);
form, stamp, to\ khru/keion e)k tou= *babulwni/ou xrusou= -i/zesqai pe/fuken Aristaenet.2.1: metaph., e)k qew=n-i/zesqai
to be made in the image of gods, Men.Prot.p.16D.
designate by a characteristic mark, characterize, Ph.1.151, Gal.8.188, Plot.1.8.3, Sch.E.Hec.379; meizo/nws x. to\n *di/a Max.Tyr.17.3: abs., peri/ tinwn Hermog.Id.2.10:—Pass.,
to be characterized, Phld.Herc.1457.11; x. kata\ diafora/n Stoic.2.132, cf. Iamb.Comm.Math.4.
emphasize, c. acc. et inf., Aristeas l. c.;
indicate, expound, ti Phld.D.3.14.
xarakthr-iko/s, = xarakthristiko/s (q.v.).

xarakth/r-isma, atos, to/, = xarakth/r 11.5, in pl., poihtw=n Tz.
Proll. Hes., Proll.Lyc.

xarakthr-ismo/s, o(,
characterization, Tryph.Trop.2.6, Plb. Rh.p.108S., Sch.E.Hec.379.

xarakthr-iste/on,
one must characterize, Hermog.Id.2.10, Eust.1388.26.
one must endow with distinctive character, Iamb.Myst.3.27, Dam.Pr.102.

xarakthr-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
characteristic, th=s *lusi/ou le/cews D.H.Lys.11 (Sup.); lo/gou *dhmosqenikou= mhnu/mata x. Id.Dem.34, al.; tou= a)gaqou=, th=s u(/lhs, S.E.P.3.173, Dam.Pr.36; tou= a(plw=s bare/os, kou/fou, Simp. in Cael.713.24; to\ x. A.D.Synt.103.17, cf. Choerob. in Theod.2.31H. Adv. -kw=s Eust. 1167.59.—The form xarakthriko/s is found in Phld.Po.Herc.1676.7, in codd. of D.H.Dem.39, 51, and is v.l. in Id.Lys.l.c. Adv. xarakthrikw=s Phld.Rh.2.297S.

xa^ra/k-ths, ou, o(,
stamper, coiner, Man.6.388.

xa^rak-to/s, h/, o/n,
notched, toothed, pri/wn, r(i=nai, coi/+s, Hp.VC21, AP6.205 (Leon.), IG7.3073.104 (Lebad., ii B. C.); knhsth=ri xaraktw=| (v.l. xara/ktrw|) Nic.Al.308; xarka ska/fin perh. written for xarakto\n (
engraved) ska/fion in PLond.2.193v11, al. (ii A. D.).

xa^ra/k-wma, atos, to/,
palisaded enclosure, entrenched camp. X.HG5.4.38, 6.2.23; xarakw/mata pro\ th=s po/lews bale/sqai Plu.Cat.Mi.58.
palisade, X.An.5.2.26; x. kai\ tei/xh kai\ ta/froi D.6.23: metaph., of the eyelashes, Arist.PA658b18. = Lat.
vallum, Plb.9.3.2; x. dipla= Id.10.31.8.

xa^rak-w/n, w=nos, o(, perh.
vineyard containing staked vines, PRyl. 427 Fr.19 (ii/iii A. D.), Hdn.Gr.1.30.

xa^ra/k-wsis, ews, h(,
palisading, fortifying, Lycurg.44, Ph.Bel.85.48 (pl.), Plu.Mar.7.
palisade, LXX De.20.20.
propping of vines, PSI6.595.3 (iii B. C.), Gp.5.27 tit.
xarambaliastu/s: ge/lws o( meta\ paidia=s, Hsch. (post xra=|n); leg. kram-, q.v.
xaramo/s: h( th=s gh=s dia/stasis, oi(=on xhramo/s （xir- cod.), Hsch.

xa/rac [xa^], a^kos, o(, also h(, (xara/ssw)
pointed stake: esp.,
vine-prop, pole, Ar.Ach.986, V.1201, Pax1263, Th.3.70, BGU 1122.17 (i B. C.): prov. e)chpa/thsen h( x. th\n a)/mpelon, of those who trust in a 'broken reed', Ar.V.1291.
pale, used in fortifying the entrenchments of a camp, Id.Ach.1178, D.21.167; = Lat.
vallus, Plb.1.29.3, 18.18.1: collectively, = xara/kwma,
palisaded camp, Theophil.Com.9, SIG363.1 (Ephesus, iii B. C.), Men.77, Plu.Caes.17 (pl.), Jul.Or.2.60b; ta\n e)kto\s tou= x. xw/ran IG42(1).76.21 (Epid., ii B. C.);
palisade, xa/raka bale/sqai pro\s th=| po/lei (v.l. xara/kwma) D.18.87; = Lat.
vallum, Plb.1.80.11, 3.45.5, al., Ev.Luc.19.43; xa/raka ti/qesqai form
an entrenched camp, D.H.6.29; x. bale/sqai Plu.Aem.17, cf. Marc.18, etc.; ba/llein Id.Sull.28; a)potafreu/ein, peritafreu/ein, ib.21, Luc.31; diaspa=n Id.Ant.18; x. sesidhrwme/nos kai\ a(lu/sesi dedeme/nos D.S.19.83; x. ku/klw| th=s new/s Moschio ap.Ath.5.208d.
cutting, slip, esp. of an olive, Thphr.HP2.1.2, CP5.1.[4], Gp.9.11.5; of other plants, Thphr.CP 1.12.9. collectively, = a)kanqw/dh futa/, Hsch. a seafish, one of the
breams, Sargus, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath 8.355e, Opp.H. 1.173; also a fish of the Red Sea, Ael.NA12.25. name of a
bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.31 tit., Sor.Fasc.17, Gal.18 (1).777. (Phryn.43 gives h( x. in signf. 1, and in PSp.125B. gives o( x. in signf. 11, cf. Poll.1.162; but this distinction is not observed by later writers.)

xa^raci/pontos [i^], on,
ploughing the sea, nai/+a klai\+s x. Simon.23.

xa/racis [xa^], ews, h(,
incision, mark, Sch.Ar.Nu.23 (pl.); h( x. tou= a)ro/trou Theognost.Can.38; tw=n troxw=n Hsch. s.v. a(matroxia/s; tou= troxou=, = Lat.
orbita, Gloss.
erasure, PLips.10 ii 4 (iii A. D.). metaph. of acute pain, u(po\ bhxo\s i)/sxei traxu/thtas kai\ x. Plu.2.698c.
coining, minting, tou= leptou= xalkou= OGI 485.12 (Magn.Mae.).

xa^ra/ssw, Att. xa^ra/k-ttw,
make pointed, sharpen, whet, a(/rpas, o)do/ntas, Hes.Op.573, Sc.235, cf. Plu.2.350d; kaqa/per be/lh ta\ pra/gmata ib. 825f; xarasso/menos si/dhros Hes.Op.387.
furnish with notches or
teeth, like a saw, ta\ sidh/ria Arist.Aud.803a3:—Pass., of certain birds, e)/xousi . . ta\ a)/kra tou= r(u/gxous kexaragme/na Id.PA662b16; fu/lla kexaragme/na
serrated leaves, Dsc.4.173, cf. Thphr.HP3.10.5; sku/talon kex. o)/zois
jagged or
rugged with . . , Theoc.17.31. metaph.,
whet, stimulate, e)/rws yuxa\s x. S.Fr.684 codd. Stob. (tara/ssei E.Fr.431 codd. Clem.Al.); to\ filo/nikon Plu.2.92a, cf. 825f:—Pass., kexaragme/nos tini/
exasperated at . . , Hdt.7.1; kei/nw| to/de mh\ xara/ssou
be not
angry at him
for this, E.Med.157 (lyr.); th=|parrhsi/a| xaraxqei/s Plu.2.74e.
cut into furrows, scratch, strwmna\ de\ xara/ssois' a(/pan nw=ton kentei= Pi.P.1.28; ku=ma x. Orph.A.372; a)ro/trw| . . x. xe/rson AP6.238 (Apollonid.); u(/dwr e)retmoi=s Nonn.D.3.46, cf. 41.114 (Pass.); tw=| qermw=| xara/ssonti th\n e)pifa/neian Plu.2.651e:— Pass., nw=ton xaraxqei/s
wounded, E.Rh.73; ke/koptai kai\ xara/ssetai pe/don A.Pers.683; qa/lassa friki\ xarassome/nh AP10.2 (Antip. Sid.), cf. 10.14 (Agath.); to/pos kexaragme/nos u(po\ o)/mbrou, gloss on r(wxmo/s, Sch.Gen.Il.23.420.
smite, LXX 3 Ki.15.27.
stamp, seal, PRyl. 160.6 (i. A. D.), etc.
brand, BGU100.3 (Pass., ii A. D.), etc.
engrave, carve, e)n nomi/smati [*ba/tton] x. (i.e.
stamp his portrait) Arist. Fr.528; ou)/reakai\ po/nton u(pe\r tu/mboio AP7.237 (Alph.); sta/lan ib.547 (Leon.Alex.);
inscribe, do/gmata . . ei)s sth/lhn SIG795B27 (Delph., i A. D.); gra/mma . . toi/xoisi xara/cw Theoc.23.46, cf. AP12.130; e)n tu/mbw| gra/mm' e)xa/race to/de Erinn.5.8; to\n *troi/hs po/lemon seli/dessi x. APl.4.293; grafi/dessi . . xa/raca . . i(ero\n lo/gon Hymn.Is.11; [no/mous] ei)s pi/nakas x. D.S.12.26; o( grammateu\s tou= dh/mou to\ b/ e)xa/raca BMus.Inscr.481*.430 (Ephesus); simply,
write, gra/mmata PMasp.2 ii 2 (vi A. D.),
sketch, draw, morfh\n xara/cai AP11.412 (Antioch.), cf. Anacreont.55.5; of the down
marking the cheek, APl.5.344:—so in Med., i)/oulos a)/xnoa xione/hs e)xara/sseto ku/kla pareih=s Nonn.D.10.180:—Pass., ib.5.404; [o)/mma] h)lema/tois a)kti=si xara/ssetai, of lines
drawn with antimony, AP9.139 (Claudian.); e)pi\
tou= nomi/smatos kexara/xqai pe/lekun Arist.Fr.593; sth/las gra/mmasi kexaragme/nas D.S.3.44; sth=lai xara/ssontai IG14.297 (Panormus); toi=xos a(/pas e)xara/sseto Luc.Am.16; to\ xaraxqe\n no/misma
stamped money,
coin, Plb.10.27.13; xrh=sqai tw=| . . me/trw| kexaragme/nw| tw=| xarakth=ri IG22.1013.64; also of the letters
engraved, Peripl.M. Eux.2: metaph., le/cis kexaragme/nh
with a stamp, i.e. character of its own, Diocl.Magn.Stoic.3.213; th\n me\n (sc. th\n sofistikh\n） i)diw/mati kexara/xqai fh/somen Phld.Rh.1.77 S. (Perh. a Semitic loan-word, cf. Hebr.
[hudot ]āraš 'engrave'; or cogn. with Lith. že[rtilde]<*>i 'rake, scrape'.)
xa^rh=nai, xa^rh/somai, v. xai/rw.
xari/a: bouno/s, Hsch.; also xa/reia in Hdn.Gr.2.603, Suid.
xa^ri^-do/ths, written for sq., in codd. of Plu. ll. cc., Jul. l. c. and Or.4.148d.

xa^ri^-dw/ths, ou, o(,
joy-giver, epith. of Hermes, h.Hom.18.12, Plu.2.303d; of Dionysus, Id.Ant.24,2.613e, Jul.Caes.308d; of Zeus, Plu.2.1048c; Dor. xa^ri^-dw/tas, of Dionysus, Africa Italiana 2.144 (Cyrene):—fem. xa^ri^-dw=tis, idos, Orph.H.55.9.

xa^ri/eis, xari/essa (Boeot. xari/vetta Mon.Piot2.138 (statuette from Thebes, vii/vi B. C.), xari/en (for xa/rien, v. infr. iv): gen. xari/entos, dat. -enti: voc. xari/ei, xari/en, acc. to Theodos. Can.1.11, 209 H.: (xa/ris):—
graceful, beautiful: in Hom. freq. of the works of men, [pe/plos] xarie/statos Il.6.90,271; ei(/mata 5.905; e)/rga Od. 10.223; fa=ros 5.231; also,
gracious, a)moibh/ 3.58; a)oidh/ 24.197; te/los xarie/steron 9.5; dw=ra x.
acceptable gifts, Il.8.204, Ar.Pl.849; ou) pa/ntessi qeoi\ xari/enta didou=sin Od.8.167; ei)/ pote/ toi xari/ent' e)pi\ nho\n e)/reya Il.1.39; of the parts of a person, x. me/twpon, pro/swpon, ka/rh, 16.798, 18.24, 22.403; me/lea Archil.12; of a youth, prw=ton u(phnh/th|, tou=per xariesta/th h(/bh Il.24.348 (also -e/statos h(/bh Od.10.279); of persons first in Hes.Th.247; xari/essa de/mas ib.260; w)= ka/la, w)= xari/essa Sapph. h_ 5 App.p.48 Lobel, cf. Alc.46; fuh\n xarie/steros Tyrt.12.5; soi\ xa/rien me\n ei)=dos Sapph. h_ 9 App.p.49 Lobel; once in Trag., sa\n xari/essan w(/ran E.Fr.453.6 (lyr.); also xari/essa xelidoi= Anacr.67: later zw=|a o)fqh=nai xari/enta Luc.Prom.Es3. in Att., freq. of persons, in relation to qualities of mind,
elegant, accomplished, x. h)=san oi( *lakwnikoi/ Ar.Lys.1226; oi( xarie/statoi
men of taste, Isoc.12.8, Arist.Metaph.1060a25, cf. Pl.R.605b (Comp.); oi( x. Arist.Pol.1297b9, Phld.Mort.31; opp. oi( polloi\ kai\ fortikw/tatoi, Arist.EN1095b22, cf. Pol.1267a1; ta\ tw=n x. skw/mmata the
wits, Pl.R.452b; x. kai\ nou=n e)/xontes Arist.Pol.1320b7; xarie/statos th\n mousikh/n
accomplished in . . , Pl.La.180d; peri\ filosofi/an Id.Ep. 363c; x. poihth/s Id.Lg.680c; tw=n i)atrw=n oi( x. Arist.EN1102a21; strathgoi/ D.S.12.33 (Sup.); gewrgo/s, paidagwgo/s, etc., Plu.2.92b, Cat.Mi.1, etc. of things,
graceful, elegant, me/los, po/nos, Pi.P.5.107, N.3.12, cf. Ar.Pl.145; filosofi/a e)sti\n xari/en Pl.Grg.484c, cf. Sph.234b (Comp.); xari/enta me\n ga\r a)/|dw, x. d' oi)=da le/cai Anacr.45; lo/gon le/cai xari/enta Ar.V.1400; boh/qeiai xarie/statai pro/s ti Pl.R.602d; e)nqu/mhma x.
clever, smart, X.An.3.5.12; to\ a)stei=on kai\ x. Luc.VH1.2; xari/enta . . e)sofi/sw kai\ sofa/ Ar.Av.1401; ironical, xari/enta pa/qoim' a)/n I should be
nicely off, Id.Ec.794; xari/en [e)sti\] ei)de/nai
it is well to know, Hp.Art.34; x. ou)=n . . lalei=n Ar. Ra.1491 (lyr.); dokei= xarie/steron ei)=nai . . le/gein Pl.Prt.320c; also xari/en ga/r, ei) . . it would be
a pretty thing, if . . ! X.Cyr.1.4.13, Luc. JTr.26. rarely of natural objects, qew=n x. e)nau/lous Hes. Th. 129; xari/enta ta\ u(da/tia fai/netai Pl.Phdr.229b; phgh\ xariesta/th ib.230b; th\n *)indw=n li/qon x. Jul.Or.2.51a. name of a plant, xari/en to\ e)ponomazo/menon, tou/tou r(i/zan pro/sqes Hp.Mul.1.78. Adv. xarie/ntws
gracefully, elegantly, cleverly; pa/nu x. a)podedei=xqai Pl.Phd.87a, cf. Plt.300b; x. e)/xwn to\ sw=ma
in fine condition, Id.Phd. 80c; dei/pnou x. peprutaneume/nou Alex.110.4; x. ei)pei=n Pl.R.331a: Comp., a)nqhro/teron kai\ -e/steron tw=n a)/llwn le/gein Isoc. 13.18; oi( -este/rws le/gontes Arist.Metaph.1075a26.
kindly, courteously, Isoc.5.22.
with good intention, x. me/n, a)peirote/rws de\ e)painei=n Id.12.37. the neut., as Adv., was written proparox. xa/rien in Att., acc. to Hdn.Gr.1.350, A.D.Adv.160.22, etc., but no example is quoted; neut. as Adj. is proparox. acc. to Suid.

xa^rient-i/zomai,
to be witty, jest, Ar.Fr.166, Pl.R.436d; spoudh=| x.
to jest in earnest, Id.Ap.24c; x. e)n ou) xari/enti kairw=| D.H.Lys. 14, cf. 13.—Late in Act., Procop.Arc.9. x. e)c a)nafora=s
make a charming use of . . Demetr.Eloc.141.

xa^rie/nt-isma, atos, to/,
witty saying, bon mot, in pl., Ph.2.570, Sch.Ar.Ach.380.

xa^rient-ismo/s, o(,
wit, Pl.Tht.168d; x. kai\ eu)trapeli/a Id.R.563a; opp. spoudh/, Plu.2.11e; x. e)n spoudh=| geno/menos D.H.Isoc.12; including a vein of irony, coupled with drimu/ths, Hermog.Id.2.5.

xa^rient-o/ths, htos, h(,
gracefulness of manner, playfulness, Plu.2.441b(pl.).

xa^ri^ergo/s, o/n, prob.
elegantly working, artistic, epith. of Athena, as protectress of artificers, AP6.205 (Leon.).

xa^ri/zw, fut. xariw= Phld.Rh.1.381 S., Gloss.: aor. imper. xa/rison PMag.Lond.122.17:—usu. Med. xari/zomai, fut. -iou=mai Th.3.40, 8.65; xarih=| (v.l. -ei=) also in Hdt.1.90; Cret. xarici/omai GDI5176.16 (found at Teos); also xari/comai ib.5178.17 (ibid.); xari/hntai is a false Aeol. form in Milet.3 No.152.56; later xari/somai Ep.Rom. 8.32, Luc.DDeor.22.4: aor. e)xarisa/mhn Hdt.1.91, etc.; opt. xari/saito Il.6.49; Aeol. imper. xa/rissai Sapph.Supp.16.4; Cret. inf. xari/casqai GDI5163b8 (Mylasa):—Pass. forms, fut. xarisqh/somai in pass. sense, Ep.Philem.22: aor. e)xari/sqhn in pass. sense, Act.Ap. 3.14, 1 Ep.Cor.2.12: pf. kexa/rismai in act. sense, kexa/risai Ar.Ec. 1045, -istai Id.Eq.54; also in pass. sense, imper. -i/sqw Pl.Phdr. 250c: plpf. e)kexa/risto Hdt.8.5, Ep. kexa/risto Od.6.23:—
say or
do something agreeable to a person,
show him
favour or
kindness, oblige, gratify, c. dat. pers., freq. in part., xarizome/nh po/sei+ w(=| Il.5.71, cf. 11.23, 15.449, Od.8.538,13.265; once in Hes., poi/hse . . xarizo/menos *dii/ Th.580; pa=si xarizoi/mhn a)/n Hdt.6.130, cf. Th.3.40; toi=s qeoi=s X.Mem.4.3.16; *kalli/a| xarizo/menos
to oblige, humour him, Pl.Prt.362a, cf. Men.75b, Ar.Eq.1368; of a judge, give a
partial verdict, x. oi(=s a)\n dokh=| au)tw=| Pl.Ap.35c; also x. tw=| i(/ppw| X. Eq.10.12: abs.,
make oneself agreeable, comply, opp. a)nti/a fa/sqai, once in A., Pers.700 (lyr.); oi( u(pe\r kairo\n xarizo/menoi And.4.7: c. acc. cogn., xa/ritas x. E.Fr.360.1, Isoc.1.31, D.18.239; x. ti kai\ au)to/s Th.3.42; with part. added, xari/zeto i(era\ r(e/zwn Od. 1.61, cf. Hdt.1.90, Ar.Ec.1045, Pl.R.338a, 426c, etc.: more freq. c. dat. modi, mh/te ti/ moi yeu/dessi xari/zeo
do not
court favour by lies, Od.14.387; xarizo/menos filo/thti 10.43, etc.; lo/gw| qwpeu=sai kai\ e)/rgw| x. Pl.Tht.173a codd.; opp. ta\ be/ltista le/gein, D.9.2, cf. Plu.2.66a.
gratify or
indulge a humour or passion, once in S., qumw=| xari/zesqai kena/ El.331, cf. Antipho 4.3.2, X.An. 7.1.25; o)rgh=| E.Fr.31; glw/ssh| Id.Or.1514 (troch.); e)/rwti Pi.Fr. 127; th=| e)piqumi/a| Pl.R.561c: tw=| sw/mati X.Mem.1.2.23; th=| gastri/ ib.2.1.2, Cyr.4.2.39; th=| h(donh=| ib.4.3.2. in erotic sense,
grant favours to a man, Ar.Ec.629 (anap.), Pl.Smp.182a, Phdr.231c, 256a, X.Mem.3.11.12, etc.: hence of Comedy, o)li/gois xari/sasqai Ar.Eq.517 (anap.): c. acc. cogn., x. qh/leian a)po/lausin Luc.Am. 27. c. acc. rei,
give graciously or
cheerfully, dw=ra Od.24.283; a)/poina Il.6.49, 10.380; xari/zesqai/ tini/ ti Hdt.1.91, Ar.Ach.437, Eq.54, X.Cyr.1.4.9, etc.; pwlei=n kai\ x. kai\ te/knois metadido/nai PGrenf.1.60.45 (vi A. D.); so c. acc. pers., xari/zomai/ se toi=s o)/xlois PFlor.61.61 (i A.D.): with a strong oxymoron, cei/nia dusmene/sin lugra\ x. Archil.7: c. inf. with Art., x. to\ poqei=n Plu.2.609a; to\ zh=n LXX 2 Ma.3.33; without the Art., polloi=s e)xari/sato ble/pein (v.l. to\ b.) Ev.Luc.7.21; xa/risai [au)toi=s] me/nein
allow them to remain, Luc.Am.19, cf. AP5.236 (Agath.); so a)=r' a)/n ti/ moi xari/saio toio/nde—mh/ mou katagela=n; Pl.Hp.Mi.364c. x. th\n de/hsin
grant the request, Luc.
Bis Acc.14. Pass., c. acc.,
to be favoured with, a)na/gka| pneu=ma xarizo/menos Epigr.Gr.204.18 (Cnidus). c. gen. partit.,
give freely of a thing, a)llotri/wn x. Od.17.452; tami/h . . xarizome/nh pareo/ntwn
giving freely of such things as were ready, 1.140, etc.; pantoi/wn a)gaqw=n gastri\ xarizo/menoi Thgn.1000; glw/sshs mafidi/oio x. pareou=si Theoc.25.188; proiko\s xari/zesqai, of his bounty, Od.13.15. c. acc. pers.,
give up as a favour, th=| mhtri\ x. *)okta/bion, by dropping a law aimed at him, Plu.CG4; but also, by unjust condemnation, Act.Ap.25.11,16; also tw=| qew=| me e)xari/sw, of a
dedication ceremony, PBremen49.14 (ii A. D.).
forgive, th\n a)diki/an tini/ 2 Ep.Cor.12.13, cf. Ep.Col.2.13: abs., 2 Ep.Cor. 2.7, etc. Pass., esp. in pf. and plpf., kexa/risto qumw=|
was dear to her heart, Od.6.23; toi=si *eu)boeu=si e)kexa/risto the
pleasure of the Euboeans
was done, Hdt.8.5; tau=ta me\n ou)=n mnh/mh| kexari/sqw
let a tribute be paid . . Pl.Phdr.250c; cf. xa/ris A. V. mostly part. pf. kexarisme/nos, h, on, as Adj.,
acceptable, welcome, e)mw=| kexarisme/ne qumw=| Il.5.243,826, etc.; kexarisme/na dw=ra qeoi=si di/dwsi, 20.298, cf. Od.16.184, 19.397; kexarisme/na qei=nai/ tini to do
things pleasing to one, Il.24.661; a)nh\r kexarisme/na ei)dw/s Od.8.584; qeois kexarisme/na poiei=n Lys.6.33; kex. toi=s qeoi=s le/gein te kai\ pra/ttein, Pl.Euthphr.14b, cf. Phdr.273e; doi/h w(=| k' e)qe/loi kai/ oi( kexarisme/nos e)/lqoi Od.2.54, cf. Hdt.1.87, 3.119, X.Mem. 1.2.10, etc.; kexarisme/na qu/rsw| E.HF892 (lyr.); kexar. xoiri/dion Ar.Pax386 (lyr.); pa=sin kexarisme/nos Pl.Sph.218a; lo/gos kex. D.14.1; siti/on h)\ poto/n X.Mem.2.1.24; e)n toi=s mh\ kexarisme/nois . . pro\s th\n ai)/sqhsin Arist.PA645a7; cf. kexarisme/nws. later, Comp. kexarismenw/teros Ael.NA12.7; Sup. -w/tatos Alciphr. 3.65.—Rare in Trag., but freq. in Att. Prose.

xa^ri^lampe/tis, idos, h(,
graciously shining, epith. of the moon, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.111.
xa/rin, v. xa/ris A. VI. I.

xa/ris [a^], h(, gen. xa/ri^tos: acc. xa/rin [i_ in arsi, Il.5.874], etc.; also xa/rita Hdt.6.41, 9.107, E.El.61, Hel.1378, X.HG3.5.16, Phylarch. 24 J., PGen.47.17 (iv A.D.), etc. (un-Attic, acc. to Moer.p.414P.): xa/ritan Gloss.: pl. xa/rites; dat. xa/risi, xari/tessi, Od.6.237, Il. 17.51, Pi.O.7.93: (xai/rw):—
grace: in objective sense,
outward grace or
fauour, beauty, prop. of persons or their portraits, qespesi/hn d' a)/ra tw=| ge xa/rin katexeu/at' *)aqh/nh Od.2.12, etc.; xa/rin a)mfixe/ai kefalh=| Hes.Op.65; eu)mo/rfwn de\ kolossw=n e)/xqetai x. a)ndri/ A.Ag. 417 (lyr.): pl.,
graces, ka/llei+ kai\ xa/risi sti/lbwn Od.6.237; o)/ssois xa/ritas *)afrodi/ths e)/xwn E.Ba.236; meta\ xari/twn
gracefully, Th.2.41: less freq. of things, x. d' a)pela/mpeto pollh/, of ear-rings, Il.14.183; of works, e)/rgoisi xa/rin kai\ ku=dos o)pa/zei Od.15.320; of words, ou)/ oi( x. a)mfiperiste/fetai e)pe/essin 8.175; plei/sth de\ x. kata\ me/tron i)ou/shs [glw/sshs] Hes.Op.720; tai\ *diwnu/sou su\n bohla/ta xa/rites diqura/mbw| Pi.O.13.19; h( tw=n lo/gwn x. D.4.38, cf. D.H. Comp.23; mu=qoi plhqo/menoi xari/twn AP9.186 (Antip.Thess.).
glory, *fereni/kou x. Pi.O.1.18, cf. 8.57,80. in subjective sense,
grace or
favour felt, whether on the part of the doer or the receiver (both senses appear in such phrases as o(/t' . . h( xa/ris xa/rin fe/roi S.OC779; xa/ris xa/rin ga/r e)stin h( ti/ktous' a)ei/ Id.Aj.522, cf. E.Hel.1234, Arist.Rh.1385a16): on the part of the doer,
grace, kindness, goodwill, tinos
for or
towards one, Hes.Op.190; tw=n *messhni/wn xa/riti peisqei/s Th.3.95; ou) xa/riti th=| e)mh=| not for any
kind feeling towards me, Antipho 5.41: abs., ei) de/ tis mei/zwn x. A. Supp.960; th=s palaia=s x. e)kbeblhme/nh S.Aj.808; h)= mega/la x. dw/rw|
su/n o)li/gw| Theoc.28.24; x. eu(rei=n e)nanti/on tou= qeou= LXX Ge.6.8, al.; xa/rin e)/xein pro\s to\n dh=mon Plu.Dem.7;
partiality, favour, mh/te e)/leon mh/te suggnw/mhn mh/te x. mhdemi/an peri\ plei/onos poih/sasqai tw=n no/mwn Lys.14.40; ou) sumfwnou=sin o)rgai\ kai\ xa/rites makario/thti Epicur. Ep.ip.28 U., cf. Pl.Lg.740c. more freq. on the part of the receiver,
sense of favour received,
thankfulness, gratitude, xa/rin kai\ ku=dos a)/roio Il.4.95; a)re/omai pa\r *salami=nos *)aqanai/wn x. Pi.P.1.76; tinos
for a thing, ou)de/ ti/s e)sti xa/ris meto/pisq' eu)erge/wn Od.4.695, cf. 22.319; a)nti\ po/nwn x. Th.4.86: less freq. c. inf., ou)k a)/ra tis xa/ris h)=en ma/rnasqai one has, it seems, no
thanks for fighting, Il.9.316, 17.147; oi(/ oi( a)pemnh/santo x. eu)ergesia/wn Hes.Th.503, cf. Th.1.137; xa/rin fe/rein tini/ Pi.O.10(11).17; x. trofeu=sin a)mei/bwn A.Ag.728 (lyr.); filo/thtos a)meibo/menai x. S.El.134 (lyr.); xa/rin ei)de/nai tini/ to acknowledge
a sense of favour, feel grateful, once in Hom., e)gw\ de/ ke/ toi i)de/w x. h)/mata pa/nta Il.14.235; freq. in Prose, Hdt.3.21, Lys.2.23, Isoc.4.175, etc.; tou/twn
for a thing, X.Cyr.1.6.11, etc.; toi=s diapepragme/nois Plu.Alex.62; moi x. oi)=den e)pi\ tou/tois Luc.
Bis Acc.17; x. proseide/nai Pl.Ap.20a; a)podido/nai Id.R.338a; tina\ a)posterh=sai xa/ritos Id.Hp.Mi.372c; later x. gnw=nai Philostr.VA2.17; pollh\n gnou=sa x. X.Eph.3.5; x. e)pi/stamai pa=si Charito 3.4, cf. 8.5, Poll.5.142, Jul.Or.8.246c; also tw=n paroixome/nwn e)/xein sfi mega/lhn x. Hdt.7.120, cf. 1.71, E.Heracl.767 (lyr.), IT847 (lyr.), Lys.16.1, Hyp.Ath.5: c. part., x. e)/xein swqe/ntes X.An.2.5.14; also xa/ritas e)/xwn patro/s owing him a debt of
gratitude, E.Or.244: but a)spasma/twn xa/rin ti/n' e(/cei; what
thanks will she have
for . . ? Id.Hec. 830; x. a)\n e)n tou/tw| mei/zw e)/ti e)/sxen Th.8.87; x. o)fei/lein to owe
gratitude, be beholden, toi=s qeoi=s S.Ant.331, cf. X.Cyr.3.2.30; prosofei/lein D.3.31; x. ou)demi/a e)fai/neto pro\s *)aqhnai/wn Hdt.5.90; xa/rin a)qa/naton kataqe/sqai to lay up a store of undying
gratitude, Id.7.178, cf. 6.41; th=| po/lei x. kataqe/sqai Antipho 5.61, cf. Th.1.33; xa/rin labei=n tinos receive
thanks from one, S.OT1004, etc.; a)polabei=n para/ tinwn Lys.20.31; tinos
for a thing, X.Mem.2.2.5, Aeschin.2.4; diplh=n e)c e)mou= kth/sei xa/rin S.Ph.1370; ka)p' e)mou= kth/sei x. Id.Tr.471; komi/sasqai x. Th.3.58; xa/ritos tuxei=n Lycurg. 135; a)pe/xein xa/ritas Call.Epigr.51.4, etc.; toi=s qeoi=s xa/ris (sc. e)sti/） o(/ti . . ,
thank the gods that . . , X.An.3.3.14, Cyr.7.5.72; x. tini/ tinos Luc.Tim.36; tini\ u(pe/r tinos Plu.2.1122a.
favour, influence, opp. force, xa/riti to\ ple/on h)\ fo/bw| Th.1.9; x. kai\ deh/sei, opp. a)peilh=|, Plu.Sull.38.
love-charm, philtre, Luc. Alex.5, Merc.Cond.40. in concrete sense,
a favour done or returned,
boon, xa/rin fe/rein tini/ confer
a favour on one, do a thing
to oblige him, Il.5.211,874, 9.613, Od.5.307, E.IT14, Or.239, And.2.24 (so in Med., of the recipient, ib.9); a)/llois x. fe/rontes Th.3.54; xa/rin qe/sqai or ti/qesqai/ tini, Hdt.9.60,107, A. Pr.782, E.Hec.1211, etc.; prosqe/sqai S.OC767; x. u(pourgh=sai/ tini A.Pr.635; parasxei=n S.OC1183; pra/ssein E.Ion36, 896 (lyr.); dra/sas Th.2.40; a)nu/sai prob. in S.Tr.995 (anap.); ne/mein Id.Aj.1371; x. dou=nai/ tini A.Pr.821, S.OC1489 (but x. dou=nai, = xari/zesqai (1.2),
indulge, humour, o)rgh=| ib.855; gastri/ Cratin.317); x. xari/zesqai, v. xari/zomai 1.1: x. a)nqupourgei=n return
a favour, S.Fr.339; ti/nein A.Pr.985, Ag.821; xa/ritas patrw/|as e)kti/nwn E.Or.453, cf. Pl. Mx.242c, etc.; x. a)podido/nai tini/ Lys.12.60, 28.17; a)nti/ tinos X.Ages.2.29; u(pe/r tinos Isoc.4.56; tw=n e)/rgwn ta\s xa/ritas a)pod. tini/ Lys.31.24; xa/ritas a)ntidido/nai Th.3.63; opp. xa/rin a)paitei=n to ask the repayment of
a boon, E.Hec.276, cf. Lys.18.23, D.20.156; xa/ritas a)p. Lycurg.139; xa/rin e)caitei=sqai S.OC586; x. a)posterei=n withhold
a return for what one has received, Pl.Grg. 520c; ta\s au(tou= ei)s tou\s fi/lous x. the
favours one has done them, Id.Lg.729d; x. a)/xaris a thankless
favour, one which receives, or deserves, no thanks, A.Pr.545 (lyr.); x. a)xa/ritos Id.Ch.42 (lyr.), E.Ph.1757 (lyr.).
grant made in legal form, POxy.273.14 (i A.D.), PGrenf.2.70.5 (iii A.D.), etc.; ai( tw=n *sebastw=n x. imperial
grants, OGI669.44 (Egypt, i A.D.). esp. in erotic sense, of
favours granted (v. xari/zomai 1.3), a)lo/xou xa/rin i)dei=n Il.11.243, cf. A.Ag.1206: more freq. in pl., X.Hier.1.34, 7.6, etc.; bi/a| d' e)/pracas xa/ritas h)\ pei/sas ko/rhn; Trag.Adesp.402; in full, xa/rites a)frodisi/wn e)rw/twn Pi.Fr.128, cf. Pl.Phdr.254a, al.
gratification, delight, tinos
in or
from a thing, sumposi/ou Pi. O.7.5; vi/kas Id.O.10(11).78; u(/pnou x. E.Or.159 (lyr.); even x. go/wn Id.Supp.79 (lyr.); also concrete, of things,
a delight, Pi.I.2.19 (pl.); ta\n botruw/dh *dionu/sou x. oi)/nas E.Ba.535 (lyr.), cf. Ar.Nu.311 (lyr.), Jul.Or.3.125b; e)/noptra, parqe/nwn xa/ritas E.Tr.1108 (lyr.): abs., *)/erws . . ei)sa/gwn glukei=an x. Id.Hipp.527 (lyr.); opp. lu/ph, S.El.821, E.Hel.655 (lyr.); opp. po/nos, S.OC232 (lyr.); qanei=n pollh\ xa/ris A.Ag.550, cf. 1304; bi/ou x. meqei=sa E.Med.227; ou)demi/an e)/xw tw=| bi/w| xa/rin Ar.Lys.865; toi=s de\ siti/ois x. ou)demi/an oi)=d' e)sqi/wn ib.869; less freq. in Prose, x. kai\ h(donh/ Pl.Grg.462c, cf. D.20.26; tosau/thn e)/xei x. Isoc.9.10. daimo/nwn xa/ris
homage due to them, their
worship, majesty, A.Ag. 182 (lyr.); a)qi/ktwn x. ib.371 (lyr.); o(/rkwn E.Med.439 (lyr.).
thank-offering, eu)ktai/a x. tino/s, opp. a common gift, A.Ag.1387, cf. X.Hier.8.4; e)/pemye xai/thn kouri/mhn x. patro/s A.Ch.180, cf. 517; timh\ kai\ ge/ra kai\ x. Pl.Euthphr.15a, cf. La.187a. Special usages: acc. sg. as Adv., x. tino/s
in any one's
favour, for his
pleasure, for his
sake, x. *(/ektoros Il.15.744; yeu/desqai glw/sshs x.
for one's tongue's
pleasure, i.e.
for talking's
sake, Hes.Op.709, cf. A.Ch.266; rarely with Art., th\n *)aqhnai/wn xa/rin e)strateu/onto Hdt.5.99. as Prep., sts. before its case (once in Pi., P.2.70; xa/rin plhsmonh=s Pl.Phdr.241c; x. fili/as Epicur.Sent.Vat.28; x. ti/nos; LXX 2 Ch.7.21, cf. POxy.743.29 (i B. C.), etc.), but mostly after,
for the sake of, on behalf of, on account of, kaka/ nin e(/loito moi=ra duspo/tmou xa/rin xlida=s S.OT888 (lyr.); tou= xa/rin;
for what
reason? Ar.Pl.53; sugxwrw= tou= lo/gou x. Pl.R.475a; so e)mh\n xa/rin, xa/rin sh/n,
for my, thy
pleasure or
sake, A.Pers.1046 (lyr.), E.HF1238, etc.; kei/nou te kai\ sh\n e)c i)/sou koinh\n x. S.Tr.485: less freq. with the Art., th\n sh\n d' h(/kw x. Id.Ph.1413 (anap.); sou= te th/n t' e)mh\n x. E.Ph.762:—pleon., ti/nos xa/rin e(/neka; Pl.Lg.701d; also xa/rin tino/s
as far as regards . . , as to . . , e)/pous smikrou= x. S.OC443; dakru/wn xa/rin
if tears
would serve, Id.Fr.557.6; x. qana/tou po/lin a)tei/xiston oi)kou=men Epicur.Sent.Vat.31; also,
about, e)/pemfen e)pi\ th\n penqera/n sou x. tou= kth/matos
about the farm, PFay.126.5 (ii/iii A. D.).—Orig. an acc. in apposition with the sentence, as in Il.15.744, etc.,
being a favour, since it is (was) a favour, as is evident in kakh=s gunaiko\s xa/rin a)/xarin a)pw/leto E.IT566; tino\s ni/kas a)ka/rpwton x. S.Aj.176 (lyr.). with Preps.: ei)s xa/rin
to do a pleasure, ou)de\n e)s x. pra/sswn Id.OT1353 (lyr.); e)s x. ti/qesqai/ ti Plu.Mar.46; mhde\ kri/sin ei)s x. e(/lke Ps.-Phoc.9 (but e)s th\n tw=n cumma/xwn x. in such a way as to earn
thanks . . Th.3.37); also kata\ xa/rin Pl.Lg.740c; xa/ritos e(/neka ib.771d. pra/ssein ti/ tini pro\s xa/rin S.OC1776 (anap.); dra=sai E.Hel.1281; toi=si polloi=s pro\s xa/rin le/gein ti Id.Hec.257, cf. X.Mem.4.4.4, HG6.3.7, Isoc.2.18, D.8.1 (but pro\s x. bora=s
for the sake of it, S.Ant.30); pro\s x., opp. klai/wn, Id.OT1152:—but pro\s x. eu)sebi/as, just like xa/rin, Pi.O.8.8; ti/nos no/mou tau=ta pro\s x. le/gw; S.Ant.908; pro\s i)sxu/os x. E.Med.538; pro\s x. alone,
as a favour, freely, pro\s x. te kou) bi/a| S.Fr.28; but kore/sai sto/ma pro\s x.
to their
heart's content, Id.Ph.1156 (lyr.). e)n xa/riti kri/nein tina/ to decide
from partiality to one, Theoc.5.69; but also,
for one's
gratification, pleasure, e)n xa/riti dido/nai or poiei=n tini/ ti, X.Oec.8.10, Pl.Phd.115b: paralamba/nein e)n xa/risin
gratefully, Id.Lg.796b. dia\ xari/twn ei)=nai or gi/gnesqai/ [tini] to be
pleasing to one, X.Hier.9.1,2. e)qelonti\ kai\ meta\ xa/ritos
of pure good will, Plb.2.22.5, etc.; e)qelou/sioi kai\ xa/ritos e(/neka e)cio/ntes X.Cyr.4.2.11. metaph. of
the cypress, Gp.11.4.1; of some kind of
myrtle, Sch.Il.17.51; of
salt, o(/ti to\ a)nagkai=on h(du\ poiou=sin (sc. a(/les) Plu.2.685a. *xa/ris, h(, as a mythological pr. n. declined like xa/ris, save that the acc. is generally *xa/rita (exc. AP5.148 (Mel.), Luc.DDeor. 15.1, Paus.9.35.4): poet. dat. pl. *xari/tessi Il.17.51, Pi.N.9.54; *xa/rissin ib.5.54:—
Charis, wife of Hephaestus, Il.18.382; mostly in pl. *xa/rites, ai(,
the Graces, 14.267,275, Od.6.18, Pi.O.2.50, etc.; three in number, Hes.Th.907, etc. (te/ssares ai( X., as a compliment, Call.Epigr.52.1); attendants of Aphrodite, Il.5.338, Hes. Op.73, h.Ven.61, Paus.6.24.7; coupled with *mou=sai, Hes.Th.64; ko/mai *xari/tessin o(moi=ai, i.e. like that of the
Graces, Il.17.51; worshipped at Orchomenus in Boeotia, *)eteo/kleioi *xa/rites qeai/ Theoc. 16.104, cf. Sch. ad loc., Str.9.2.40, Paus.9.35.3, 9.38.1: but at Lacedaemon and Athens only two were orig. worshipped, Id.3.18.6, 9.35.2; *xari/twn i(ero\n e)mpodw\n poiou=ntai Arist.EN1133a3; qu/ein tai=s X. Plu.2.141f; in adjurations, pro\s tw=n *xari/twn Pl.Tht. 152c; nh\ ta\s X. Luc.Hist.Conscr.26; w)= fi/lai X. Plu.2.710d.— Rarely in sg., X. zwqa/lmios Pi.O.7.11; *xa/ritos h(di/sths qew=n Antiph. 228.4.

xa^r-i/sios [i_], a, on,
of thanksgiving, e(/dnon Call.Fr.193.
free, xari/sia
free gifts, Dam.Isid.216. xarisi/a bota/nh
love-plant, used as a philtre, Arist.Mir.846b7, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.17.4. x. plakou=s, a sort of cake, Ar.Fr.202; pe/ttousa to\n x. (sc. plakou=nta) Eub.2, cf. Ath.15.668c. ta\ *xari/sia (sc. i(era/), = *xarith/sia, Eust.1843.24.

xa^/r-isma, atos, to/,
grace, favour, qeou= Ph.1.102, cf. Fr.84 H.; esp. in
NT, gift of God's grace, 1 Ep.Cor.12.4, al.; opp. o)yw/nia, Ep.Rom.6.23; later, generally,
favour bestowed, BGU1044.4 (pl., iv A. D.).

xa^r-ismo/s, o(,
bestowing of favours, gratifying, Sopat. in Rh. 8.70 W.

xa^r-istei=on, to/,
thank-offering, IG12(3).416, 420 (Thera): pl., SIG1146.3 (Cnidus):—in form xaristh=ion, Schwyzer 192 (Crete).
charistia, = dies festus inter cognatos, Gloss.

xa^r-iste/on,
one must humour, tini Pl.Phdr.227c.
one must give freely, opp. a)ntapodote/on, Arist.EN1164b32; ou) pa/nta pa=sin x. Ph. 1.253.

xa^r-isth/rios, on,
of or
for thanksgiving, qusi/a D.H.1.88: so in pl., Id.10.17,54, IGRom.4.566.19 (Aezani, ii A. D.); a)parxai/ Ph.2.236; a)moibai/ D.H.1.6; u(/mnos Jul.Or.4.158a: c. gen., qusi/a x. u(da/twn D.H.1.55, cf. Plu.Lyc.11. Subst., xaristh/rion, to/,
thank-offering, IG22.3003,4798, 7.3100 (Lebad.), Plu.Caes.57, Ath.15.672a, etc.: freq. in pl. xaristh/ria, ta/,
thank-offerings, x. toi=s qeoi=s a)potelei=n X.Cyr.4.1.2; o)feilh/sein ib.7.2.28; prosfe/rein, qu=sai, D.S.5.31, 20.76: c. gen., qu/ein toi=s qeoi=s x. tw=n eu)tuxhma/twn Plb.21.2.2; x. trofw=n a)podido/nai Luc.Patr.Enc.7; th=| *(eka/th| x. th=s ni/khs e(orta/zein Plu.2.862a; x. e)leuqeri/as, in memory of the liberation by Thrasybulus on 12th Boëdromion, ib.349f, cf. Neanth.9J., OGI654.8 (Egypt. i B.C.); = Lat.
supplicatio, Plu.Cam.7.

xa^r-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
giving freely, bounteous, filotimi/a Aristeas 227: of persons, Democr. 96, Corn.ND15 (Comp.), Plu.2.632c, Ptol.Tetr.67, etc.; megalo/qumos kai\ x. Phld.Herc.1457.5; to\ x.
bounteousness, tou= qeou= Ph.1.108, cf. Plu.2.332d. Adv. -kw=s Corn.l.c.

xa^r-isti/wn, wnos, o(,
an instrument of Archimedes
for weighing, Simp. in Ph.1110.4; = Lat.
campana, Gloss.; or
for lifting, Tz.H.2.130.

xa^r-istwni/a, h(,
buying of favour, Anon. Epicureus in POxy.215 ii 10.

xari/terpnos [i^], h, on,
delightsome, Epic.Alex.Adesp.9 iii 5.

xari^th/sion, to/,
thank-offering, kala=s x. a)/gras Antip.Sid. in Oxy. 662.53, cf. Supp.Epigr.8.464 (Egypt).
spell for winning
favour, PMag.Par.1.2227, PMag.Leid.W.8.28(both pl.), PMag.Osl. 1.35, Cyran.121, Gloss. *xari^th/sia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
feast of the Charites, IG7.3195.2 (Orchom.Boeot., xa^r-ei/sia lapis). i(ero\n X. temple
of the *xa/rites, PLond.2.353.8 (iii A. D.).

xari^ti/a, h(,
jest, joke, X.Cyr.2.2.13.
xari/tinos, h, on, dub. sens., [cu/l]a PBerl.Leihg.9.1 (iii A. D.).

xari/tion, in form xari/tin, to/, = Lat.
fimirium or
fimarium, Gloss. (in section headed o(/sa e)n tw=| qea/trw|).

xa^ri^to-ble/fa^ros, on,
with eyelids or
eyes like the Charites, o)/mmata IG3.1376; Com., ma=za x. Eub.112.4 (lyr.); of a person, MAMA4.133 (Metropolis, ii A. D.); applied to Demetrius of Phalerum, Hsch. Mil.Fr.7.17M. Subst., a plant, used in philtres, Plin.HN 13.142.

xa^ri^to-glwsse/w, Att. xa^ri^to-tte/w,
speak to please, A.Pr.296 (anap.), Ath.4.164b, Sch.E.Or.1514 (v.l. xaritoglw/ttizeis).
xa^ri^to-do/ths, o(, = xaridw/ths, of Dionysus, Plu.2.158e; of Hermes, cj. for xarido/ths in Jul.Or.4.148d.

xa^ri^to-dw/teira, h(,
bestower of favour, epith. of Isis, POxy.1380.10 (ii A.D.).
xa^ri^to/-eis, essa, en, = xari/eis, Anacr. ap. Hdn. Gr.2.921: neut. xaritou=n h)=qos cj. in Anacr.44.

xa^ri^to/-morfos,
endued with grace of form, epith. of Isis, POxy.1380.59 (ii A. D.).

xa^ri^to-poie/w,
make graceful, Sch.Il.17.600.

xa^ri^to/-pwlis, idos, h(,
she who sells her favours, Tab.Defix.68
a.6.

xa/ri^tos [a^], h, on,
acceptable, SIG741.13 (Nysa, i B. C., Epist. proconsulis).

xa^ri^to/fwnos, on,
with gracious voice, Philox.8.

xari^t-o/w,
show grace to any one, th=s xa/ritos h(=s e)xari/twsen h(ma=s Ep.Eph.1.6:—Med. xaritw/somai I
will bestow favour upon thee, BGU 1026 xxiii 24 (iv A. D.):—Pass.,
to have grace shown one, to be highly favoured, LXX Si.18.17, Ev.Luc.1.28; pro\s pa/ntas a)nqrw/pous Aristeas 225, cf. Heph.Astr.1.1; o)/mma strofai=s -ou/menon prob. in Lib.Descr.30.12.

xari^t-w/nu^mos, on,
of gracious import, a)ggeli/a B.2.2.

xari^t-w/phs, ou, o(, (w)/y)
graceful of aspect, Orph.H.17.5: fem. xaritw=pis, idos, IG3.1376.
xari^t-w/sios, a, on, = xarith/sios, Ibyc.51 (Rhegine, acc. to Sch.D.T.p.542 H.).
xark-eu/s, e/ws, o(, written for xalkeu/s, MAMA 3.329 (Corycus).

xark-olo/gos, o(, written for xalkolo/gos,
money-collector, ib.514 (ibid.).

xark-wmata=s, a=dos, o(, = xalkwmatourgo/s,
Schwyzer App.II. 5.2 (Lydia).

xa/rma, atos, to/, (xai/rw): in concrete sense,
source of joy, delight, x. gene/sqai or e)/ssesqai/ tini, Il.17.636, 23.342; x. fi/lois Thgn.692; x. mei=zon e)lpi/dos klu/ein A.Ag.266, cf. S.Fr.636.1; ma=zan, h(\n . . *dhw\ brotoi=si x. dwrei=tai Antiph.1; of victory in the games, a)/ponon e)/labon x. Pi.O.10 (11).22; kalli/nikon x. Id.I.5 (4). 54: freq. in pl., Od.6.185; mh\ gei/tosi xa/rmata gh/mh|s Hes.Op.701, cf. Max.87 (sg.); xa/rmat' *)erinu/os, xa/rmata qhrw=n, E.Ph.1503, Supp.282 (both lyr.); xa/rmat' a)/llois e)/qhken, e)mbalei=n x. a)nqrw/poisi, Pi.O.2.99, 7.44; a)ntidido/nai A.Eu.984 (lyr.).
source of malignant joy, Il.3.51, 6.82, al.; lupra/, xa/rmata d' e)xqroi=s A.Pers.1034 (lyr.). in abstract sense,
joy, delight, th\n d' a(/ma x. kai\ a)/lgos e(/le fre/na Od.19.471, cf. h.Cer.371, Hes.Sc.400.—Poet. and late Prose, Plu.Mar.46.

xa/rmh (A), h(, prop.
joy of battle, lust of battle, xa/rmh| ghqo/sunoi th/n sfin qeo\s e)/mbale qumw=| Il.13.82; once in Od., mnhsw/meqa xa/rmhs 22.73, cf. Il.4.222, 8.252, al.; opp. lh/qeto xa/rmhs 12.203,393, etc.: pl., du/o xa/rmai two
battle-joys, i.e.
victories, Pi.O.9.86;
successes, opp. kaka/, Ps.-Phoc.118: but,
battle, prokale/ssato xa/rmh| Il.7.218; e)/lqoi teqnhw/s, kai/ min e)rusai/meqa xa/rmhs 17.161; ei)do/te xa/rmhs 5.608; mhd' ei)/kete xa/rmhs *)argei/ois 4.509; pau=sai/ tina xa/rmhs 12.389; e)rwh/sousi de\ xa/rmhs 14.101.

xa/rmh (B), h(, = e)pidorati/s, Stesich.94, Ibyc.62, Pi.Dith.3.13. (Cf. Polish
grot 'arrow-point', Welsh
garth 'promontory', Gr. xari/a, xoira/s.）
xa/rmh (C), h(, or xa/rmhs, o(, name of an antidote sold by one *xa/rmhs, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.126 (found in acc. sg. xa/rmhn).

xarmi/deia, ta/,
games celebrated
in honour of Charmides at Antioch on Maeander, Rev.Phil.55.133.

xarmodo/teira, h(,
giving delights, o)/mfac prob. in Hymn.Is.169.

xarmonh/, h(, = xa/rma 1,
joy, delight, esp. in pl., te/rfin palaia=n xarmona=n E.Ph.317 (lyr.), cf. Ion1379, HF384 (lyr.), 742 (lyr.). = xa/rma 11,
joy, delight, S.Aj.559; also found in Prose, [bi/on] a)/lupo/n te kai\ a)/neu xarmonw=n Pl.Phlb.43c; u(po\ th=s xarmonh=s X.Cyr.1.4.22, cf. LXX Jb.3.7, al., Plu.2.1098c, Jul.Or.2.56a.

xarmoniko/s, h/, o/n,
pleasant, paraphrase of qumh/rhs, Procl.Par.Ptol. 274.

xarmosu/nh, h(,
joyfulness, delight, LXX 1 Ki.18.6, Je.40(33).11, Plu.2.1102a, Orph.H.60.4.
day of rejoicing, e(ortai\ kai\ x. LXX Ju.8.6.

xarmo/sunos, h, on,
joyful, glad, xarmo/suna poie/ein hold a
festival of thanksgiving, Hdt.3.27, cf. Plu.2.362d, Sch.E.Hec.916; xarmo/suna e)kfwnei=n Onos.23 tit.

xarmo/frwn, onos, o(, h(, (frh/n)
heart-delighting, or
of joyous heart, epith. of Hermes, h.Merc.127.

xa^ropoi-e/w,
make joyful, delight, Sm.Ps.20(21).7, Gloss.

xa^ropoi/-hma, atos, to/,
joy caused to any one, = a)galli/ama, Zonar.

xa^ropoi-o/s, o/n,
gladdening, Procl.Par.Ptol.16, Hsch. s.v. eu)ri/zwn a)gallia/mati, f.l. for xaropoi/ in LXX Ge.49.12.

xa^ropo/s, h/, o/n, also o/s, o/n Arat.1152, epith. of dub. sense, perh.
fierce, le/ontes Od.11.611, h.Merc.569, IG42(1).131.12 (Epid.); le/wn Hes.Th.321; ku/nes h.Merc.194; ku/na, of Hecuba, Lyr.Adesp. 101; qh=res S.Ph.1146 (lyr.); xaropoi=si piqh/kois （para\ prosdoki/an for le/ousi, in an oracle alluding to the Spartans) Ar.Pax1065 (hex.); of serpents, AP10.22 (Bianor);
grim, *)/arhs IG9(1).868.1 (Corc., vii/vi B. C., nisi leg. *xa/ropos, gen. of *xa/roy）; ge/neia, of bears, Nonn.D.5.363; kerai=ai, of a bull, ib.40.52; geneia/des, of dogs, ib.307. Adv. -pw=s Sch.Opp.C.3.510. of eyes,
flashing, bright, ble/pontos xaropoi=s toi=s o)fqalmoi=s u(po\ th\n ko/run oi(=on oi( le/ontes e)n a)nabolh=| tou= o(rmh=sai Philostr.Her.12a.1; to\ x. au)tou= kai\ gorgo/n Id.Im.1.23; x. ble/mmatos a)steropai/ AP5.152 (Asclep.), cf. 155 (Mel.); o)/mmata/ moi glauka=s xaropw/tera pollo\n *)aqa/nas Theoc.20.25; o)/mma x., typical of a brave man, Arist.Phgn.807b1; of persons,
flashing-eyed, fobera\ kai\ xaroph\ kai\ deinw=s a)ndrikh/ (sc. h( *)aqhna=) Luc.DDeor.19.1: neut. as Adv., xaropo\n ble/pein Philostr.Im.1.28; xaropo\n stra/ptousin o)pwpai/ (of the hare) Opp.C.3.510 (regul. Adv. -pw=s Sch. ad loc.).
glassy, glazed, dull, of the eyes of winedrinkers, Al.Ge.49.12 (xaropoioi\ . . u(pe\r oi)=non, v.l. a)po\ oi)/nou, LXX l.c., s. v.l.), Sm.Pr.23.29 (pelioi\ LXX l.c.). of one of the chief eye-colours in men and animals, perh.
bluish-grey, distd. fr. me/las, glauko/s, and ai)gwpo/s, Arist.HA492a3, GA779b14; ta\ x. h)\ me/lana o)/mmata Luc.DMort.1.3; of persons,
bluish-grey-eyed PPetr.1p.54, al. (iii B. C.), Theoc.12.35, cf. Philostr.Im.2.5, al.; of horses, Opp.C.1.310, 4.113; of dogs, X.Cyn.3.3, Arr.Cyn.5.1 (prob.), Gp.19.2.1; of rams, ib.18.1.3; of parda/leis, Eust. 1703.29; opp. melano/fqalmos, S.E.M.7.198; persons with this eyecolour are fqinw/dees acc. to Hp.Epid.3.14 (where Gal.17(1).726 thinks Hp. ought to have mentioned a different colour, glauko/s). Adv. Comp. -w/teron, melai/nesqai (of the eyes) Hld.2.35. of the sea,
bluish-grey, grey, xaropoi=o qala/sshs Orph.Fr.245.21, cf. A.272, [S.] Fr.1126.3, AP12.53 (Mel.), 9.36 (Secund.), Anacreont. 53.30, Nonn.D.4.187, al.; of the dawn, x. h)w/s A.R.1.1280; of the moon, Arat.1152, Q.S.10.337; pro\s e(/w lamba/nei [h( selh/nh] xro/an kuanoeidh= kai\ xaroph/n Plu.2.934d; of certain stars, x. kai\ a)nalde/es ei(li/ssontai Arat.394, cf. 594. metaph.,
grey, u(po\ so\n (sc. th=s *neme/sews） troxo\n a)/staton a)stibh= xaropa\ mero/pwn stre/fetai *tu/xa Mesom.Nem.8.

xa^rop-o/ths, htos, h(,
brightness of eye, Stoic.3.33, Archyt. ap. Simp. in Cat.93.2, EM807.30.
light-blue colour, of the eyes of the Germans, Plu.Mar.11; also ai)qe/rios x., of sky-
blue, Id.2.352d.
brightness, Simp. in Cat.298.15.

xa^rop-o/fqalmos, on,
bright-eyed, Phlp. in GA212.9.

xa/roy, opos, o(, h(, poet. for xaropo/s,
bright-eyed, glau=kos Opp.C. 3.114.

xart-are/a, h(, = xarthra/,
tax on papyrus, Abh.Berl.Akad.1932(5).46 (Pergam.).

xart-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xa/rths,
small piece of papyrus, AP12.208 (Strat.), BGU466.12 (ii/iii A. D.), PMed. in PSI10.1180.50 (ii A. D.), etc.

xart-hra/, h(,
tax on papyrus, PTeb.140 (i B. C.), Sammelb.5636 (Iconium, ii A. D.).
expenditure on papyrus, BGU277 ii 11 (ii A. D.).
xart-hri/a, h(, = sq., LXX 3 Ma.4.20.

xa/rt-hs, ou, o(, = foreg.,
papyrus, or a
roll made thereof, x. du/o IG12.374.279; ta\ grammatei=a tou/s te x. e)kfe/rwn Pl.Com.194, cf. LXXIs.8.1 cod.Alex., PCair.Zen.687.4 (iii B.C.), Inscr.Délos442A182 (ii B. C.), PTeb.112.61 (ii B. C.), Dsc.1.86, Ceb.4, etc., AP9.174 (Pall.), 401 (Id.); w(/sper xa/rthn eu)ergo\n ei)s a)polrafh/n (of the soul at birth) Stoic.2.28; xa/rtai bubli/wn Theopomp.Hist.283; x. basilikoi/, of the finest papyrus, Hero Aut.26.3; x. kekaume/nos used in Medicine, Gal. 10.382, 13.315; also xa/rtou spodia/ Lycus ap.Orib.8.25.15; to\ dia\ xa/rtou me/lan Sor.2.41. metaph.,
any leaf or
thin plate, x. molu/bdinoi
sheets of lead, Lysim. ap. J.Ap.1.34.

xart-ia_tika/, ta/, = Lat.
chartiatica, money for paper, CIG5187c21 (Ptolemais, vi A. D.).
xart-i/dion [i_d], to/, = sq., Ph.2.3, al., Alciphr.1.26, Sammelb. 5224.3 (-eid-).
xarti/on, to/, Dim. of xa/rths, IG42 (1).103.159 (Epid., iv B.C.), LXX Je.43 (36).2, PGrenf.2.38.5 (i B. C.), Plu.2.60a, Gal.7.493, D.L. 7.174, D.C.46.36.
xa/rtisma, atos, to/, dub. sens. in PStrassb.35.18 (v A. D.).

xarto-gra/fos [gra^], o(, = Lat.
chartularius, Gloss.

xarto-qh/kh, h(, = Lat.
scrinium, ib.

xarto/-phron, to/,
repository of papers, ib.

xarto-poio/s, o(,
paper-maker, dub. in PTeb.112.62 (ii B. C.): v. xartopw/lhs.

xarto-pra/ths [pra_], ou, o(,
dealer in papyrus, Cod.Just.11.18 tit.
xarto-pw/lhs, ou, o(, = foreg., Gloss., prob. in PTeb.112.62. (ii B.C.).

xarto/s, h/, o/n, (xai/rw)
causing delight, welcome, xarto\n ei)/ ti kai\ fe/reis S.Tr.228; xai/rois a)/n, ei)/ soi xarta\ tugxa/nei ta/de Id.El.1457; ei)/te h(du\ ei)/te terpno\n le/geis ei)/te x. Pl.Prt.358a: xarta/
delights, opp. kaka/, xartoi=sin xai=re Archil.66.6; xarta\ pa/sxw E.Ph.618 (troch.); to\ x. Chrysipp.Stoic.3.9, Epicur.Fr.423, S.E.M.11.85, etc. of persons, ei) x. a)ne/lqoi AP12.24 (Tull.Laur.). Adv. -tw=s, x. e)moi\ le/gein Sch.S.Aj.112.

xartoto/mos, on,
paper-cutting, Gloss. Pass., xarto/tomos, on,
cut in or
from paper, Sch.Il.15.389.

xartoula/rios, o(,
chartularius, keeper of archives, PKlein.Form. 1024 (v/vi A. D.), Sammelb.5656.4 (vi A. D.), Cod.Just.1.2.24.8, al., Lyd.Mag.3.20.

xarto-fu^la/kion [a^k], to/,
case for storing papers, Suid., Gloss.
xarto-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, = xartoula/rios, Lyd.Mag.3.19, Choerob.in Theod.1.287H., Suid. s.v. *gew/rgios.

xartu^fa/nths, ou, o(,
papyrus-weauer, i.e. maker of papyrus sheets, MAMA3.310,361 (Corycus).

xa/rubdis [a^], ews, Ion. ios, h(,
Charybdis, a whirlpool on the coast of Sicily, opposite Scylla, Od.12.104, E.Tr.436, Th.4.24, Str.6.2.
3. generally,
whirlpool, gulf, pa/nta mi/an i(knei=tai x. Simon.38, cf. E.Supp.500, Str.6.2.9. metaph. of a rapacious person, x. a(rpagh=s Ar.Eq.248 (troch.).

xa/rwn [a^], wnos, o(, h(, poet. for xaropo/s, *mh/nhs pai=da xa/rwna, of the Nemean lion, Euph.84.4; so as Subst. (said to be Maced.), xa/rwnos w)mhstou= dora/ Lyc.455, cf. Hsch., etc.; also of
the eagle, Lyc.260; of the Cyclops, Id.660. as pr. n.,
Charon, the ferryman of the Styx, E.Alc.254 (lyr.), 361, al.; voc. w)= *xa/ron Cratin.324c (v.l. *xa/rwn); but xai=r' w)= *xa/rwn (with a pun) Ar.Ra.184.

*xa^rw/n-ios (later *xa^rw/n-eios), on,
of or
belonging to Charon: hence, X. qu/ra the gate
through which criminals were led to execution, Zen. 6.41, Suid.; also *xarw/nion, to/, Poll.8.102, Hsch. X. kli/makes, a staircase in the theatre, leading up to the stage as if from the underworld, by which ghosts entered, Poll.4.132. xarw/nia, ta/,
caverns filled with mephitic vapours, being looked on as entrances to the nether world, Str.12.8.17; sg., Id.14.1.11,44: xarwnh/i+a, prob. in Aret.SA1.7; in full, xarw/neia ba/raqra Gal.17 (1).10; x. xwri/a Id.15.117.

*xa^rwn-i=tai, oi(, used to translate the Lat.
Orcini, Senators from the nether world, viz. those who were created after the death of Caesar, professedly on the authority of papers left behind by him, Plu.Ant.15.
xa^rwpo/s, o/n, late form for xaropo/s, Man.5.230, Gloss., f.l. in Arr.Cyn.4,5.

xa/sis, ews, h(,
chasm, separation, Hsch.

xaska/zw, Frequentat. of xa/skw, x. to\n kwlakre/thn
keep gaping at or
after him, Ar.V.695 (anap.).
xa/ska^non, to/, = ca/nqion, Dsc.4.136.

xa/skac, a_kos, o(,
gaper, gaby, Eust.1909.54.

xa/skw, Anacr.14.8, Ar.V.1493 (anap.); subj. xa/skh|s Id.Eq.1032 (hex.); inf. xa/skein X.Eq.10.7, (e)g-) Ar.V.721; part. xa/skwn Sol. 13.36, Hp.Art.30, f.l. in Ar.Eq.1018 (hex.), (a)na-) Id.Av.502(anap.): Ion. fem. xaskeusa Herod.4.42 Pap. (also Med. xasko/menoi Cass.Pr. 20): pres. xai/nw only in late writers, Phld.Rh.2.189 S., Antig.Mir. 128, AP9.797 (Jul.), 11.242 (Nicarch.), Gal.7.686, Gp.10.30 tit., etc., (e)pi-) Luc.DMort.6.3, (peri-) Ael.NA3.20: fut. xa^nou=mai （e)g-) Ar.Eq. 1313 (troch.), (a)na-) Hp.Steril.217, Superf.29, etc.: aor. 2 e)/xa^non Il.4.182, al., Hp.Art.30, S.Aj.1227, Ar.V.342 (lyr.), etc.; aor. 1 e)/xa_na Aesop.223: pf. ke/xhna Il.16.409, Hp.Coac.487, etc.; Dor. 3pl. kexa/nanti Sophr.25 (Hdn.Gr.2.793 cites kexh/nete from Ar.Ach.133, and A.D.Adv.197.31 has ke/xagka): plpf. e)kexh/nesan Ar.Eq.651; early Att. )kexh/nh Id.Ach.10.—Used by Hom. only in aor. 2 xa/noi, xanw/n, and pf. part. kexhnw/s:—
yawn, gape, to/te moi xa/noi eu)rei=a xqw/n then
may earth
yawn for me, i.e. to swallow me, Il.4.182, 8.150, cf. 17.417; esp. of
opening the mouth wide, [ai(=ma] a)na\ sto/ma kai\ kata\ r(i=nas prh=se xanw/n 16.350; e(/lk' e)k di/froio kexhno/ta ib.409; e)a/lh te xanw/n, of a lion, 20.168; pro\s ku=ma xanw\n a)po\ qumo\n o)le/ssai, of one drowning, Od.12.350: c. acc., sto/ma xa/skwn AP11.418 (Trajan); of a wound, v.l. in S.Fr.508; of shellfish, ai(/ ga ma\n ko/gxai . . kexa/nanti pa=sai Sophr. l.c.; e)pea\n o( kroko/deilos . . xa/nh| . . pro\s to\n ze/furon Hdt.2.68; of a goose, platugi/zonta kai\ kexhno/ta Eub.115; of fruit,
burst with ripeness, M.Ant.3.2, Gp.l.c. after Hom.,
gape in eager expectation, xa/skontes kou/fais e)lpi/si terpo/meqa Sol.l.c.: freq. in Com., o(/te dh\ 'kexh/nh prosdokw=n to\n *ai)sxu/lon when
I was all agape, Ar.Ach.10; lu/kos e)/xanen the wolf
opened his mouth (for nothing), prov. of disappointed hopes, Id.Fr.337, cf. Eub.15.11, Euphro 1.30: with Preps., pro\s tau=ta kexhnw/s Ar.Nu.996 (anap.); pro\s a)/llhn tina\ xa/skei Anacr. l.c., cf. Ar.Eq.651,804 (anap.), Porph.Marc.9, etc.; e)/s ti (sc. no/misma) Philostr.VA2.7; a)/nw kexhnw/s, of a stargazer, Ar.Nu.172, cf. Av.51, Pl.R.529b; w(=de xw(=de x. Herod.4.42; kexhno/tes
gaping fools, Ar.Ra.990 (lyr.), cf. Eq.261 (troch.), V.617 (anap.), and v. *kexhnai=oi.
yawn from weariness, ennui, or inattention, Id.Ach.30; o(/tan su/ pou a)/llose xa/skh|s Id.Eq.1032 (hex.), cf. Lys.426; xa/skeis au)to/s;
are you
yawning? paying no attention? Mnesim.4.22 (anap.). metaph., a)naplhrou=n to\ kexhno\s th=s e(rmhnei/as fill the
lacuna, A.D. Synt.266.22. less freq.,
speak with open mouth, utter, c. acc., se\ dh\ ta\ deina\ r(h/mat' . . kaq' h(mw=n . . xanei=n; S.Aj.1227; tou=t' e)to/lmhsen xanei=n; Ar.V.342 (lyr.); o)i+zuro/n ti xanou=sa Call.Ap.24. in Paus.6.21.13, if the text be correct, it must be trans., xanei=n . . th\n gh=n . . to\ a(/rma
opened and swallowed the chariot.—Not in A. (exc. in compd. pros-, q.v.) or E.; rare in early Prose, exc. Hp.; once in Hdt. (v. supr. 1.1).
xaskwre/w, = xaska/zw, Hsch.

xa/sma, atos, to/, (xai/nw)
yawning chasm, gulf, x. me/ga, of Tartarus, Hes.Th.740; *tarta/rou . . a)/bussa x. E.Ph.1605; x. gh=s Hdt. 7.30; ta\ x. th=s gh=s Pl.Phd.111e; xqono/s, pe/tras, E.Ion281, IT626; seismoi\ kai\ xa/smata Jul.Laod. in Cat.Cod.Astr.1.134.
open, gaping mouth, x. qhro/s E.HF363 (lyr.); as forming a helmet, Id.Rh.209; of a
yawning gulf, xa/rubdis . . a)/rma peribalou=sa xa/smati Id.Supp.501; *sku/llhs xa/smasin AP11.379 (Agath.); x. fa/rugos, of a lion, ib.6.218 (Alc.); x. o)do/ntwn Anacreont.24.4, etc. generally,
any wide opening, qure/trwn x. a)xane/s Parm.1.18; also,
expanse, of the sky and sea, x. pela/geos to\ dh\ *ai)gai=on kale/etai Hdt. 4.85; to\ x. tou= ou)ranou= Pl.R.614d.

xasma^qupourgo/s, o(,
servant in the chasm, PMag.Lond.121.353 (pl.).

xasm-a/omai,
yawn, gape, o(po/tan xasma=| when
you are gaping, Ar.Eq.824 (anap.), cf. Hp.Mochl.4, Arist.GA719a19, Porph.Abst.1.28, etc.; oi( tou\s xasmwme/nous o(rw=ntes Pl.Chrm.169c; i)liggia=n kai\ x. Id.Grg.486b, 527a; of a door, th=s qu/ras xasmwme/nhs Alex.257. oi( xasmw/menoi, = oi( kexhno/tes,
gabies, Porph.Chr.49.

xasm-a^ti/as, ou, o(, a kind of earthquake,
which causes fissures in the earth, Arist.Mu.396a4 (v.l. i(zhmati/ai), Posidon. ap. D.L.7.154, Heraclit. All.38.

xasm-a/tion, to/,
small aperture, vent, Hero Spir.2.34; xalka= leo/ntwn x., of the
spouts of a fountain, Sch.Pi.Pae.6.7.
xasm-e/omai, = xasma/omai, ei)s tau/tan xasmeu/menos Theoc.4.53.

xa/sm-h, h(,
yawning, gaping, Hp.Aph.7.56; esp. from drowsiness, Id.VM10, Pl.R.503d, etc.: pl., Hp.Art.30, Plu.2.45d.
object of idle gaping, gazing-stock, Antip.Stoic.3.254.

xa/sm-hma, atos, to/,
a wide yawn or
gape, Ar.Av.61.
xa/sm-hsis, ews, h(, = xa/smh, Hsch. s.v. a)luxh/n, EM 495.47, Gloss. = xasmwdi/a, Eust.12.4.

xasmwd-e/w,
write verses that have hiatus, Eust.11.42.

xasmw/d-hs, es,
always yawning, D.L.4.32; to\ x.
listlessness, Plu.2.92d. to\ x. tw=n fwnhe/ntwn
hiatus, A.D.Pron.50.11.

xasmwd-i/a, h(,
hiatus in verse, Eust.11.33, 12.8, Sch.Ar.Pl.696.
xasthri/a, f.l. for sxast- in Hsch.
xa^teu/w, = sq., Hsch.

xa^te/w, Ep. Verb, used by Hom. only in pres.: later, impf. xate/eske Nonn.D.4.56. c. inf.,
crave, need, ou)de/ tis h(mi=n do/rpou mnh=stis e)/hn, ma/la per xate/ousin e(le/sqai Od.13.280; dmw=es xate/ousin a)nti/a despoi/nhs fa/sqai 15.376: abs., xate/onti/ per e)/mphs Il.15.399, cf. 9.518; ma/la per xate/ousa Od.2.249. c. gen.,
want, have need of, pa/ntes de\ qew=n xate/ous' a)/nqrwpoi 3.48; ma/la per xate/ontes a)rwgh=s Epic.Oxy.422, cf. AP5.301.20 (Agath.), 7.583 (Id.), etc. rarely c. acc. oi(=a/ te polla\ a)/nqrwpoi x. A.R.4.1557.

xa^ti/zw, = foreg., only in pres.,
have need of, crave: c. gen. rei, no/stoio xati/zwn Od.8.156, 11.350, cf. Il.2 225: c. gen. pers., *qe/tis nu/ ti sei=o x. 18.392; e(rmhne/wn x. Pi.O.2.86; ou) sou= xati/zwn E. Heracl.465: abs., ou)de\ xati/zwn nor
in want [of anything], Od.22.351, Il.17.221; xati/zwn
in want, needy, Hes.Op.394.
lack, be without, e)/rgoio x. i. e. to be idle, ib.21; a(/ssa xati/zei ma/lista kata\ tau=ta a diet most
defective in these elements, Hp.Morb.4.39.
xati/s: e)piqumi/a, xrh=sis, Hsch. (perh. xa=tis, Dor. for xh=tis).

xatos, o(, = Lat.
maritus, Gloss. (dub.).

xauli^o/dous, o/dontos, o(, h(, neut. -o/doun Arist.PA661b23. of animals,
with outstanding teeth or
tusks, ka/pros x. (where most codd. xaulio/dwn, contr. to the rule of Hdn.Epim.208, that the correct forms are xaulio/dous and xauliw/dwn), Hes.Sc.387, cf. Arist. l. c., 663a7; x. ge/neqla Opp.C.3.6. Subst., of projecting teeth,
tusks, tushes, e)/xei [o( kroko/deilos] o)do/ntas mega/lous kai\ xaulio/dontas Hdt.2.68; tetra/poun xaulio/dontas fai=non, of the hippo-potamus, Id.2.71, cf. D.S.1.35; opp. karxaro/dous, Arist.HA501a15, PA661b18, cf. HA538b21.

xau=nac, a_kos, o(,
braggart, impostor, Hsch. xaunia/zw,
cheat, Id.

xauno/-geion, to/,
friable earth, PTeb.342.27 (ii A. D.).
xauno-lo/gos and xauno-poio/s, = xau=nac, Hsch.

xauno-poli/ths [i_], ou, o(,
gaping fool, who
swallows open-mouthed all that is told him (cf. *kexhnai=oi), Ar.Ach. 635 (pl., anap.).

xauno/-prwktos, on,
wide-breeched, ib.104.

xau=nos, h, on, but os, on Pl.Lg.728e, Arist.Pr.934b11:—of tissues,
porous, spongy, Hp.Aph.5.67; x. o)ste/a, such as the collar-bone, Id.Art.14;
loose, sustrofh/ Pl.Plt.282e; mastoi/ Sor.1.88; a(/les x. kai\ leptoi\ w(/sper xiw/n Arist.Mete.359a32; gh=, opp. sterro/s, Id.Pr.l.c., cf. Ephor.65（
e）J.;
loose-grained, of timber, Thphr.HP3.4.3, 5.3.3; also of the fruit of the medlar,
spongy, ib.3.12.5; -o/tatos pureto/s, = r(ow/dhs (A) 11.a, Erot. s.v. spo/ggoi; to\ x. D.S.3.14. Adv. -nws, of garments hanging
loosely, Hdn.4.15.3; of bandaging, Pall.
in Hp. Fract.12.285C. metaph.,
empty, frivolous, no/os Sol.11.6; prapi/s Pi.P.2.61; kenea=n e)lpi/dwn xau=non te/los Id.N.8.45; xau=na me\n to/t' e)fra/santo Sol.34; xau/nous ta\s yuxa\s kai\ qrasei/as poiei=
conceited, Pl.Lg.728e; o( mega/lwn e(auto\n a)ciw=n, a)na/cios w)/n, xau=nos Arist.EN 1123b9: Comp., oi( -o/teroi texni=tai Phld.Rh.1.376 S. Adv. -nws
sluggishly, Eustr. in EN379.15.
of vast extension, o)/noma Ar. Av.819. Adv. xau/nws
frivolously, Simp. in Epict.p.121 D. (Cf. xa/os.）

xauno/somfos, on,
loose and flaccid, Erot. s.v. skhro/n.

xauno/ths, htos, h(,
porousness, sponginess, th=s gh=s interpol. in X.Oec.19.11; ta/frou Plu.Pyrrh.28; of snow, Id.2.649c; of foam, ib.99b.
looseness of a bandage, Gal(?). ap.Orib.46.1.15. metaph.,
empty conceit, vanity, a)noh/tou yuxh=s Pl.Tht.175b; opp. megaloyuxi/a, Arist.EN1107b23.
xauno/frwn, fronos, o(, h(, = xali/frwn, Sch.Od.4.371.

xaun-o/w,
make flaccid, relax:—Pass.,
to lecome so, Heliod. ap.Orib.46.22.1, Ael.NA12.17; h( gh= x. ei)s r(aga/das Gp.5.2.2. Pass., of inflammation,
subside, Alex.Trall.3.3. xaunou=sa (codd.Ath.) is f.l. for xanou=sa,
opening the mouth in kissing, in Ephipp.6.5. metaph.,
puff up, fill with conceit, E.Andr.931, Pl.Ly.210e:—Pass.,
become vain, Arist.VV1251b18, Plb.6.57.7; tai=s pra/cesi Phld.Hom.p.55 O.; e)pi\ tou/tois Plu.Caes. 29; o( nou=s e)xaunw/qh Babr.95.36; ko/rac e)pai/nw| kardi/hn e)xaunw/qh Id.77.8; u(po\ th=s duna/mews D.C.Fr.49.3.
relax, weaken, ei)rh/nh x. th\n politei/an Lyd.Mag.3.51:—Pass., of character, Heliod. in EN149.13.

xau/n-wma, atos, to/,
loosened earth, Plu.Sert.17.

xau/n-wsis, ews, h(,
making slack or
loose, opp. ste/gnwsis, S.E.P.1.238.
void space or
interval, Gp.10.75.17. metaph.,
making confused, mystification, x. a)napeisthri/a Ar.Nu.875 (ubi v. Sch.).
puffing up, xau/nwsin e)rga/zesqai Phld.Rh.1.219S.: pl., Iamb.VP15.
64.
relaxation, relief, Alex.Trall.4.1.

xaun-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
apt to make loose or
flabby, sarko/s Plu.2.771b.

xauw/n, a kind of
cake, in LXX to represent Hebr. kauua=n, LXX Je.7.18, 51(44).19, cf. EM807.43, Suid., etc.:—wrongly written xaunw/n in Hsch.
xa/w, contr. xw=, = xwrw=, coined as etym. of xa/os by Simp. in Ph. 620.14.

xa^w/dhs, es,
like chaos, Dam.Pr.107.

xedri/a, h(, = sq., PLond.5.1833.5 (iv A. D.), PMasp.143.4 (vi A. D.): hence xedriofo/ros, o(,
hawker of xedri/ai, ib.143v6 (vi A. D.).

xedropa/, ta/,
leguminous fruits, pulse, Hp.Nat.Puer.12, Arist. Mete.389a15, GA750a24, Thphr.HP8.2.2, CP4.7.2, al.; gen. xedro/pwn or xedropw=n, Arist.PA653a24, GA752a21.—Acc. sg. xe/dropa occurs in Python 1.12 (prob.), Porph.Abst.2.6, and nom. xe/droy Hsch., and tou\s karpou\s tou\s xe/dropas (v.l. xedropou/s) is found in Arist.HA594b7: but the accent seems to point to sg. xedropo/s. (Perh. a compd. of xei/r, dre/pw, as if xer-dropa/,
plucked by the hand, cf. xeirodro/poi d' i(/na fw=tes a)/ter drepa/noio le/gontai o)/spria, xe/dropa/ t' a)/lla Nic.Th.752.)

xedropw/dhs, es,
like xedropa/, fu/sis Phaniasap.Ath.9.406c.
xe/eia, h(, Ep. for xeia/, cj. in Nic.Th.79.

xeza^na/gkh, h(,
purgative plaster, Aët.3.135, Paul.Aeg.7.9.

xezhtia/w, Desiderat. of xe/zw,
want to ease oneself, Ar.Nu.1387, Ra.8, al.

xe/zw, fut. xesou=mai Ar.V.941, Pax1235; also kata-xe/somai Id.Fr.152: aor. 1 e)/xesa Id.Ec.320,808, (e)g-) ib.347, (kat-) Nu. 174: aor. 2 e)/xeson （kat-) Alc.Com.4 (cf. Hdn.Gr.2.801); inf. xesei=n Ar.Th.570, AP7.683 (Pall.): pf. ke/xoda (only in compds. e)g-, e)pi-xe/zw): Pass., ke/xesmai (v. infr.):—
ease oneself, Ar. ll.cc., etc.: prov., ei) mhde\ xe/sai ge . . sxolh\ genh/setai Stratt.51; ou)k e)/xeis o(/[poi xe/sh|s] u(po\ tw=n a)gaqw=n cj. in Men.530.9, cf. Com.Adesp. 491; e)leuqe/ra *ko/rkura: xe/z' o(/pou qe/leis Str.7Fr.8: c. acc., x. shsami/das Eup.163 (lyr.):—Med. (for the sake of the pun), xe/saito ga\r ei) maxe/saito Ar.Eq.1057 (hex.):—Pass., pe/leqos a)rti/ws kexesme/nos dung just
dropped, Id.Ach.1170. (Cf. Skt.
hádati (same sense).)
xei=, to/, name of the letter x, IG22.1491.33, Pl.Ti.36b, Hellad. ap. Phot.Bibl.p.530B.; later written xi=, v.l. in Hp.VC1.

xeia/, Ion. xeih/, h(,
hole, esp. of serpents, Il.22.93,95, Plu.2.169e, Orph.L.473; h(/ban ou)x u(po\ xeia=| da/masen he buried not his youth in
a hole, Pi.I.8(7).77: pl., Schwyzer 194.5 (Crete).

xeil-a/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of xei=los,
small lip, Gloss.

xeil-a=s,
labrosus, ib.
xeili/arxos, = xil- Sammelb.4018.3, etc.

xeilo-la/bos [a^], o(, surgical
bandage for the lips, Gal.Fasc.69,71 tit. (12.489 Chart.).

xeilo-pote/w,
drink with the lips, sip, AP7.223 (Thyill.).
xeilo/s, o(, with its derivs., v. xilo/s.

xei=los (Dor. xh=los Cerc.1.5, Aeol. xe/llos Choerob. in An.Ox. 2.278), eos, to/: pl., gen. xeilw=n Arist.HA492b26; xeile/wn Herod. 3.4, LXXPr.12.13, al., Plu.Cat.Ma.12, v.l. in D.H.Comp.14: poet. dat. xei/lessi (v. infr.):—
lip, Hom., etc.: prov., e)ge/lasse xei/lesin laughed
with the lips only, Il.15.102; xei/lea me/n t' e)di/hn', u(perw/|hn d' ou)k e)di/hne wetted
the lips, but not the palate, i.e. drank sparingly, 22.495; ne/ktar e)n xei/lessi sta/coisi Pi.P.9.63; peiqw/ tis e)peka/qizen e)pi\ toi=s x., of Pericles, Eup.94.5; xei/lesin didou\s o)do/ntas E.Ba.621 (troch.); xei/lesin a)mfila/lois, of incessant talk, Ar.Ra. 678 (lyr.); da/knwn ta\ x., of one in a difficulty, Eub.53.6; a)/xris h( yuxh/ . . e)pi\ xeile/wn leifqh=| Herod. l.c.; e)pi\ toi=s xei/lesi ta\s yuxa\s e)/xontes 'with their hearts in their mouths', D.Chr.32.50; a)po\ xeile/wn, opp. a)po\ kardi/as, Plu. l.c.; a)p' a)/krou x. filosofei=n
on the surface only, Luc.Apol.6; e)p' a)/krou tou= x. on the tip of one's
tongue, Id.Ind.26; prosarmo/sai ta\ x. (sc. th=| ku/liki) Id.DDeor.5.2; prosarmo/zein ta\ x., xei/lh proseggi/sai xei/lesin, of persons kissing, Id.DMeretr.5.3, Am.53; xei/lesin dierruhko/sin with gaping
lips, Ar.Nu.873; e)n toi=s x. tima=n LXXIs.29.13; e)n x. e(te/rwn lalei=n, i.e. in strange
speech, 1 Ep.Cor.14.21; x. e(\n pa/ntwn LXXGe.11.6, cf. Pr.10.19. of horses, X.Eq.6.8: of birds,
bill, beak, E.Ion1199, Opp.H.3.247, AP9.333 (Mnasalc.). metaph. of things,
edge, brink, rim, of a bowl, xrusw=| d' e)pi\ xei/lea kekra/antai Od.4.616, cf. 132; *)elpi\s . . e)/mimne pi/qou u(po\ xei/lesin Hes.Op.97, cf. Hdt.3.123, Ar.Ach.459; of a ditch, Il.12.52, Hdt.1.179, Th.3.23; of the ocean, Mimn.11.7, cf. LXXGe.22.17; tw=n th=s gh=s troxw=n Pl. Criti.115e; of rivers, lakes, Hdt.2.70,94, Arist.HA570a22; of the whorls, Pl.R.616d, 616e; au)lai/as, tei/xous, LXXEx.26.4, Plb.10.44.11; of the womb, Arist.HA583a16; of a wound, Gal.11.127.
xeilote/nwn, ontos, o(, epith. of crabs, Batr.297.

xeilofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(
bandage for the lips, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.35.

xei/lwma, atos, to/,
lip, rim, Aq.Ex.37(38).2.

xei=ma, atos, to/,
winter weather, cold, frost, Od.14.487: then,
winter as a season of the year, xei/matos w(/rh Hes.Op.450; ou)/pote karpo\s a)polei/pei xei/matos ou)de\ qe/reus Od.7.118, cf. Alcm.76; fe/rontas x. kai\ qe/ros brotoi=s, of the stars, A.Ag.5; ou)/te xei/matos te/kmar ou)/t' a)nqemw/dous h)=ros Id.Pr.454; xei=ma in acc., during
winter, Od.11.190, Hes.Op.640; xei/mati S.Ph.293.
storm, x. pu=r te da/i+on Alcm. 79, cf. Lyr.Adesp.100, A.Ag.199 (lyr.), 627, E.Andr.748, al.; ka/lliston h)=mar ei)sidei=n e)k xei/matos A.Ag.900.—Poet. form of xeimw/n, used also in Pl.Ax.371d. (Cf. Skt.
héman 'in winter', Lith.
žiemà 'winter', etc.)
xeima^d-eu/w, = xeima/zw, Str.4.6.7, Onos.9.1.
xeima^d-i/zw, = foreg., dub. l. in J.AJ18.1.3 (fut. part. -iou=san).

xeima^/d-ion, to/,
winter dwelling, winter quarters, xeimadi/w| xrh=sqai *lh/mnw| D.4.32, cf. Str. 11.13.1, Hld.5.18: esp. in pl., xeima/dia ph/gnusqai to fix one's
winter quarters, Plu.Sert.6, cf. Luc.3, Eum.15, Jul.Ep.98.—Adj. xeima/dios, a, on, is cited in Poll.1.62, Suid.; h( xeimadi/a (sc. w(/ra) Et.Gud.563.53.

xeim-a/zw (fut. -a/sw Thphr.Sign.38):—trans.,
expose to the winter cold: found only in Pass.,
to be exposed thereto, Hp.Vict.3.68;
pass the winter, S.Fr.503; o(/pws xeimasqh=| kai\ h(liwqh=| h( gh= Thphr.CP3.20.7; of trees,
live through the winter, xeimasqe/nta [de/ndra] Id.HP4.14.1; xeimasqh=nai xeimw=si w(rai/ois kai\ kaloi=s Id.CP2.1.2. intr.,
pass the winter, Ar.Av.1097 (lyr.), X.Oec.5.9, Isoc.7.54, etc.: of armies,
go into winter quarters, Hdt.8.133, X.HG1.2.15, 3.2.1, Plb.27.18.1, etc.
raise a storm or
tempest, qeou= toiau=ta xeima/zontos S.OC1504; o(/tan xeima/zh| o( qeo\s e)n th=| qala/tth| X.Oec.8.16, cf. IG7.4255.5 (Orop.); xeima/sei [h( nefe/lh] e)f' h(ma=s Plu.2.195d: impers., e)xei/maze h(me/ras trei=s
the storm continued, Hdt.7.191; xeima/sei
there will be stormy weather, Thphr.Sign.l.c. c. acc.,
drive forth or
away, of a storm, e)/cw x. [tou\s mu/as] Id.Fr.174.7:—Pass.,
to be driven by a storm, overtaken by it, Th.2.25, 3.69, al.; xeimasqei\s a)ne/mw| Id.8.99; e)n qala/tth| xeimazome/nou ploi/ou Pl.Ion540b, etc. metaph.,
toss like a storm, distress, to/d' ai(=ma x. po/lin S.OT101; th\n sa/rka to\ paro\n mo/non xeima/zein Epicur.Fr.452: also,
annoy, vex, S.Ichn.331, Men.208, Phld.Lib.p.61 O., POsl.48.8 (i A. D.); sfh\c toi=s ke/ntrois plh/sswn e)xei/maze Aesop.393:—Pass.,
to be tempest-tossed, distressed, esp. of the state considered as a ship, E.Supp.269, Ar.Ra.361; do/mwn o)/lbos xeima/zetai E.Ion966; also of single persons, kata\ qa/lassan xeimasqei=sai (as example of a yuxiko\n pa/qos) Sor.3.84;
suffer grievously, A.Pr.563 (anap.), 838, S.Ph.1460 (anap.), Gorg.Pal.11, Pl.Plt.273d; i)sxu\s e)n no/sw| xeima/zetai S.Ichn. 267; tai=s sai=s a)peilai=s ai(=s e)xeima/sqhn Id.Ant.391; a)/llh| d' e)n tu/xh| x. E.Hipp.315; xeimazo/meqa . . u(p' a)pori/as e)n toi=s nu=n lo/gois Pl.Phlb. 29b, cf. La.194c; u(po/ tinwn PSI4.349.4 (iii B. C.); e)n stratei/ais h)\ no/sois h)\ e)n qala/tth| x. Pl.Tht.170a; of feverish patients, xeima/zontai ma/lista pemptai=oi Hp.Prog.24.

xeim-ai/nw, aor. 1 e)xei/mhna (v. infr.),
drive by a storm:—Pass.,
to be driven by a storm, be tempest-tossed, Hdt.8.118: metaph., fo/bw| kexei/mantai fre/nes Pi.P.9.32. metaph.,
disturb as by a storm, xeimai/nei o( xeimazo/menos he who is himself in distress
brings others into a like state, Arist.Po.1455a31; xeimai/nei d' o( baru\s pneu/sas *po/qos AP12.157 (Mel.). intr.,
to be stormy, qa/lassa . . a)/gria xeimh/nasa ib.7.652 (Leon.) impers., xeimai/nontos
when it is winter, Theoc.9.20.

xeim-a/mu_na [a^m], h(,
defence against winter, thick winter cloak, A.Fr.449, S.Fr.1112, Ael.Dion.Fr.445.

xei/ma^ros, o(,
plug in a ship's bottom, drawn out when the ship was brought on land, to let out the bilge-water, Hes.Op.626.

xeima/rroos, on, contr. xei/m-rrous, oun, and shortened xei/marros, on: (xei=ma, r(e/w):—
winter-flowing, swollen by rain and melted snow, of mountain-streams, joined with potamo/s, o(/n te [the stone] potamo\s xeima/rroos w)/sh| Il.13.138; w(s d' o(po/te plh/qwn potamo\s pedi/onde ka/teisin xeima/rrous kat' o)/resfin 11.493: freq. in contracted forms, potamw=| plh/qonti e)oikw\s xeima/rrw| 5.88; w(s d' o(/te xei/marroi potamoi\ kat' o)/resfi r(e/ontes 4.452; xeima/rrw| potamw=| i)/kelos Hdt.3.81, cf. Thgn.348; para\ r(ei/qroisi xeima/rrois S.Ant.712; fa/ragges u(/dati xeima/rrw| r(e/ousai E.Tr.449 (troch.); dia\ xeima/rrou na/phs Id.Ba.1093; xara/dra x. Plb.10.30.2. plekta/nh xeima/rroos seems to be
rushing, furious lightning A.Fr.281. Subst.,
torrent, Pl. Lg.736b, X.HG4.4.7; w(/sper xeima/rrous a)\n ei)s th\n po/lin ei)se/pese D.18.153. simply,
river, LXX Nu.34.5.
drain, gutter, oi( e)k tw=n oi)kiw=n x. D.55.19.
valley, watercourse, LXX 4 Ki.3.16. (Plur. accented xei/marroi by Ptol.Ascal., xeima/rroi by Nicias, Eust. 496.37; later nom. xei/marros Paus.9.33.7, 10.37.3, acc. xei/marron LXX l.c. cod.Alex., Ps.123(124).4, Paus.1.35.7.)

xeimarrw/dhs, es,
like a torrent, Str.9.1.24, 13.1.70.

xeim-a/s, a/dos, h( (sc. w(/ra),
winter season, Hsch. (sc. e)sqh/s)
winter garment, Id.

xeim-a^si/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
passing the winter, wintering, foitw=si e)s x. e)s tou\s to/pous tou/tous Hdt.2.22.
winter quarters, Plb.2.54.14, al., D.S.19.37, App.BC2.52, Dura6434 (iii A. D.). = xeimw/n,
storm, Arist.Pr.940b15 (pl.), Thphr.Vent. 50 (pl.), Hsch.

xei/m-a^sis, ews, h(,
tempestivitas, Gloss.

xeim-aske/w,
exercise oneself in winter, of soldiers, Plb.3.70.4, Arr.Epict.1.2.32.

xei/m-astron, to/,
winter clothing, Ar.Fr.888.
xeim-a^tiko/s, h/, o/n, late form for xeime/rios, Sch.Opp.H.3.459.
xeim-a/w and (dub.) xeime/w, = r(ige/w, Hsch.
xeime/qlh, v. xime/tlh.

xeimer-i/zw, = xeima/zw 1.2,
pass the winter, winter, peri\ *mi/lhton Hdt.6.31; peri\ *qessali/hn 8.126; e)nqau=ta 7.37; e)n *ku/mh|, au)tou=, 8.130; also in later Prose, D.H.15.10; meta\ tw=n lo/gwn Them.Or.10.130a.
to be stormy, Thphr.Sign.42.

xeimer-i^no/s, h/, o/n,
of or
in winter, opp. qerino/s, x. tropai/ Democr.14,etc.; x. mh=nes Th.6.21; pro\s h(/lion to\n x. Hdt.1.193, cf. X.Mem.3.8.9; x. a)natolh\ tou= h(li/ou kai\ dusmai\ ai( x. Hp.
Aër.3, cf. Arist.Mete.364b3; o)/mbroi Plb. 9.43.5; sussi/tia x. Pl.Criti.112b; decamenai/ ib.117b; pureto/s Hp. Acut.（Sp.）24; no/soi Gal.17(1).734; a)rgurw/mata Ath.6.230d; ma/xh D.18.216; [tina\ tw=n zw/|wn] a)poba/llei ta\s x. tri/xas their
winter coat, Arist.Pr.893a5; x. o)/neiros a
winter night's dream. Luc.Somn. 17; also th\n x. (sc. w(/rhn) the
winter season, Hdt.1.202, cf. Thphr.CP 4.8.1, D.S.1.11; ta\n x. (sc. e(ca/mhnon） a)/rxein SIG2940.3 (Cos); ta\ x.
Pl.Lg.683c, 915d.
stormy, xwri/on Th.2.70; to\ x., opp. to\ eu)dieino/n, Thphr.Vent.1. x. shmei=on sign
of a coming
storm, Arist.Pr.941a2, Thphr.Sign.11.

xeime/r-ios, a, on, Il.2.294, Pi.O.6.100; also os, on S.Ph.1194 (lyr.), Th.3.22:—
wintry, stormy, a)/ellai Il. l.c.; nifa/des 3.222: u(/dwr 23.420; o)/mbros Hes.Sc.478, Pi.P.6.10, E.Hel.1481 (lyr., nowhere else in E., never in A.); no/tos S. Ant.335 (lyr.); a)/nemoi Democr.14; w(/rh xeimeri/h the
wintry or
stormy season, Od.5.485, Hes.Op.494; h)=mar x. Il.12.279, Hes.Op.524, 565 (pl.); nu/c Emp.84.2, Pi.O.6.100; nu\c x. u(/dati kai\ a)ne/mw| Th. l.c.; x. pu=r Pi.P.4.266; oi( xeimeriw/tatoi mh=nes the
most wintry months, Hdt.2.68; ta\s xeimeriwta/tas [h(me/ras] Arist.HA599a24; so x. kata\ mh=na Simon.12; h)=r x. a
stormy, cold spring, Hp.
Aër.10; a)kta\ kumatoplh\c xeimeri/a a shore stricken by the
wintry waves, S.OC1241 (lyr.); neut. pl. as Adv., xeime/ria bronta=| Ar.Fr.46; e)n xeimeri/ois in
cold places, opp. to e)n a)leeinoi=s, Arist.HA613b2; e)a\n i)/dwsi . . xeime/ria
