stormy weather, ib.614b21; x. ai( su/nodoi tw=n mhnw=n ma=llon h)\ ai( meso/thtes Id.GA738a21. Adv. =i/ws
in wintry fashion, Hp.Epid.4.7. metaph., x. lu/pa
raging pain, S.Ph.1194 (lyr.); x. ta\ pra/gmata, punningly, Ar.Ach.1141.—Correct writers use xeime/rios =
wintry, stormy, xeimerino/s (opp. qerino/s) =
in winter-time, in the winter season, but later authors neglected this distinction, xeimeri/h|si (sc. w(/rais) Nic.Al.623; xeime/rioi tropai/ App.BC2.48, 52.

xeimer-iw/dhs, es,
stormy, xeimw/n Gp.1.12.23.
xei/mer-os, on, poet. for xeime/rios, Arat.797, 1084.
xei/metlon, v. xi/metlon.

xeimi^-e/w,
to be chilled, xeimiou=sa sa/rc Hp.Loc.Hom.29.

xeimi^/-h, h(, Ion. for xei=ma,
winter cold, chilly weather, ib. 10.

xeimo-qnh/s, h=tos, o(, h(, (qnh/|skw)
frozen to death, Luc.Lex.14.

xeimo-spore/omai, Pass.,
to be sown in winter, Thphr.CP4.11.3.

xeimo/-sporos, on,
sown in winter, ib.4.11.1.

xeimo-fu^ge/w,
avoid the winter or
wintry weather, Str.1.2.28.

xeimw/n, w=nos, o(, (xei=ma)
winter, xeimw=nos dusqalpe/os o(/s r(a/ te e)/rgwn a)nqrw/pous a)ne/pausen Il.17.549; xeimw=ni
in winter, 21.283; e)n xeimw=ni Pi.I.2.42, A.Ag.969, X.Mem.4.3.8; e)n tw=| x. Id.Cyr.8.8.17; xeimw=nos w(/ra| And.1.137; also xeimw=nos
in winter-time, X.Mem.3.8.9, Pl.R. 415e; x. me/sou
in mid-
winter, Ar.Fr.569.1; tou= x.
in the course of the winter, Th.7.31; tou= au)tou= x. Id.8.30; dia\ xeimw=nos, dia\ tou= x., Pl. Ti.74c, X.HG3.2.9; xeimw=na
during winter, S.OT1138 (v.l. xeimw=ni）; to\n x.
during the
winter, Hdt.3.117, X.HG1.4.1; to\n deino\n x. Id.An. 7.6.9; to\n x. o(/lon Ar.Fr.345; o( a)mfi\ to\n x. xro/nos X.Cyr.8.6.22; o)/ros a)/baton u(po\ xeimw=nos in consequence of
the cold weather, Hdt.8.138, cf. Th.2.101: pl., nifostibei=s xeimw=nes S.Aj.671; opp. kau/mata, Pl.Lg.829b; a)muntikh\ xeimw/nwn Id.Plt.280e.
the wintry quarter of the heavens,
the north, *bore/hs kai\ x. Hdt.2.26.
wintry, stormy weather: generally,
storm, e)pei\ ou)=n xeimw=na fu/gon kai\ a)qe/sfaton o)/mbron Il.3.4; ou) nifeto\s ou)/t' a)\r x. polu\s ou)/te pot' o)/mbros Od.4.566; o(/te tis x. e)/kpaglos o)/roito 14.522; o)pwrino\n o)/mbron kai\ xeimw=n' e)pio/nta Hes.Op.675, cf. Alc.18, Sapph.Supp.11.6, etc.; *gaia/oxos eu)di/an o)/passen e)k xeimw=nos Pi.I.7(6).39; qeo\s xeimw=n' w)=rse A.Pers.496, cf. Ag.649, 656, S.Aj.1145, etc.; x. o)rniqi/as Ar.Ach.876; x. katerra/gh Hdt.1.87; e)pe/pese/ sfi x. te me/gas kai\ pollo\s a)/nemos Id.7.188, cf. Pl.Prt.344d; e)pigeno/menos x. Hdt.7.34, Th.4.6; xeimw=ni xrhsa/menoi Antipho 5.21; x. notero/s
a storm of rain, Th.3.21; e)n eu)di/a| xeimw=na poiei=n X.HG2.4.14: pl., u(po\ tw=n x. because of the
winter-storms, Hdt.4.62; e)/n ge xeimw=sin kai\ e)n eu)di/ais Pl.Lg. 961e, cf. 919a. metaph., qeo/ssutos x.
storm of calamity sent by the gods, A.Pr.643; x. kai\ kakw=n trikumi/a ib.1015, cf. Ch.202 (pl.), 1066 (anap.); doro\s . . e)n xeimw=ni in the
storm of battle, S.Ant. 670; qolerw=| . . x. nosh/sas, of the madness of Ajax, Id.Aj.207 (anap.); x. gh/rws baru/s, of life's
winter, AP10.100 (Antiphan.); of a person, x. o( meiraki/skos e)sti\ toi=s fi/lois Alex.178.7, cf. 46.4; x. kat' oi)/kous . . kakh\ gunh/ Men.Mon.540: rare in Prose, of battle, Onos. 32.10; of mental and moral
trouble, Epicur.Ep.3p.62U., Polystr.p.19W.; x. tou= klu/dwnos xalepw/teros, of pirates, Them.Or.23.286a: pl., xeimw=nas e)/xein to have
trouble (in cutting teeth), Hp.Dent.12.

xeimwniko/s, h/, o/n,
for winter use, i(ma/tia POxy.1901.37 (vi A.D.).
wintry, kairo/s Sch.Opp.H.1.601: Comp. -w/teros
Cat. Cod.Astr. 1.144.

xeimwno/qen, Adv.
in a storm, Arat.995.

xeimwnotu/pos [u^], on,
buffeting stormily, lai=lay A.Supp.34 (anap.).

xei/r, h(, xeiro/s, xeiri/, xei=ra, dual xei=re, xeroi=n, pl. xei=res, xerw=n, xei=ras, penult. being regularly short, when the ult. is long; dat. pl. regularly xersi/ （xeirsi/ occurs in cod.Vat. of LXX, as Jd.7.19, 1 Ch.5.10, and late Inscrr. as CIG2811
b.10 (Aphrodisias), 2942c (Tralles): but Poets used the penult. long or short in all cases, as the verse required, xero/s, xeri/, xe/ra, xe/re, xe/res, xe/ras (of which Hom. uses only xeri/; xe/ra h.Pan.40); gen. dual xeiroi=n S.El.206 (lyr.), 1394 (lyr.), IG22.1498.76; gen. pl. xeirw=n ib.31, common in Prose.—Poet. forms, dat. pl. xei/resi（n) once in Hom., Il.20.468, also Q.S.2.401, 5.469 (v.l.); xei/ressi Il.12.382, Pi.O.10(11).62, S.Ant. 976 (lyr.), 1297 (lyr.), and once in trim., E.Alc.756; xe/ressi（n) Hes.Th.519, 747, B.17.49; xere/essin AJA36.460 (Galatia):—Dor. nom. xe/rs Timocr.9; xh/r Sophr. in PSI11.1214a3 (also, = di/yakos, Ps.-Dsc.3.11); gen. xhro/s Alcm.32, IG42(1).121.22 (Epid., iv B. C.); acc. pl. xh=ras ib.96, Aeol. xe/rras Alc.Supp.4.21, Theoc.28.9.—On the accent and declension of these forms, v. Hdn.Gr.2.277,748:—
the hand, whether
closed, paxei=a Il.3.376; barei=a 11.235, al.; or
open, flat, xersi\ kataprhne/ssi, xeiri\ kataprhnei=, 15.114, Od.13.164, al.; ei)s th\n x. e)gxea/menoi/ ti X.Cyr.1.3.9: freq. in pl. where
a single hand is meant, Il.23.384, etc.; reversely, sg. where more than one
hand is spoken of, e.g. Od.3.37, etc.; dual joined with pl., a)/mfw xei=ras 8.135; xei=re a)mfote/ras Il.21.115.
hand and arm, arm (cf. Ruf.Onom.11,82, Gal.2.347), ph=xun xeiro\s deciterh=s Il.21.166; kata\ xei=ra me/shn a)gkw=nos e)/nerqe 11.252; xei=res a)p' w)/mwn a)i/+ssonto Hes.Th.150; x. ei)s w)/mous gumnai/ Longus 1.4; e)n xersi\ gunaikw=n pese/ein into
the arms, Il.6.81, etc.: hence, words are added to denote the
hand as distinct from the
arm, a)/krhn ou)/tase xei=ra 5.336; peri\ a)/krais tai=s x. xeiri=das e)/xousi X.Cyr.8.8.17, cf. Pl. Prt.352a. of the
hand or
paw of animals, o(/sa [zw=|a] xei=ras e)/xei X.Mem.1.4.14; poreu/esqai e)pi\ xeirw=n go on
all fours. LXX Le.11.27; so of monkeys, Arist.HA502b3; of the
fore-paws of the hyena, Id.Fr.369; of the bear, Plu.2.919a. Special usages: to denote position, pote/ras th=s xero/s; on which
hand? E.Cyc.681; e)pi\ decia\ xeiro/s Pi.P.6.19; e)p' a)ristera\ xeiro/s Od.5.277; xeiro\s ei)s ta\ decia/ S.Fr.598; laia=s xeiro/s A.Pr.714 (but xei/r is often omitted with decia/, a)ristera/, as we say
the right, the left). freq. in dat. of all numbers with Verbs which imply the use of hands, la/be xeiri/, xersi\n e(le/sqai, Il.5.302, 10.501; xersi\n a)spa/zesqai Od.3.35; prokali/zesqai 18.20; xeiri/, xeroi=n yau=sai, S.OT1510, 1466: sts. this dat. is added pleon. by way of emphasis, o)/nuci sullabw\n xeri/ Id.Aj.310. gen.,
by the hand, xeiro\s e)/xein tina/ Il.4.154; xeiro\s e(lw/n 1.323, etc.; ge/ronta de\ xeiro\s a)ni/sth he raised him
by the hand, 24.515, cf. Od.14.319; xeri\ xeiro\s e(lw/n Pi.P.9.122; tina\ xeiro/s e(lkein Id.N.11.32; a)ne/lkein tina\ th=s x. Ar.V.569 (anap.). the acc. is used when one takes the
hand of a person, xei=ra ge/rontos e(lw/n Il. 24.361; xei=r' e(/le deciterh/n Od.1.121; xei=ra/s t' a)llh/lwn labe/thn, in pledge of good faith, Il.6.233; so e)/mballe x. decia\n prw/tista/ moi S.Tr.1181; also e)/mballe xeiro\s pi/stin Id.Ph.813, cf. OC1632. other uses of the acc.: in prayer or entreaty, xei=ras a)nasxei=n [qeoi=s] Il.3.275, etc.; poti\ gou/nasi xei=ras ba/llein Od.6.310; a)mfi\ . . *)arh/ths ba/le gou/nasi xei=ras *)odusseu/s 7.142; a)mfi\ de\ xei=ras deirh=| ba/ll' *)odush=i+ 23.207; a)mfi/ tini xei=re b. 21.223; peri/bale de\ xe/ras Ar.Th.914, cf. A.Ag.1559 (anap.); xei=ras proi/+sxesqai Th.3.58, 66; so also xei=ras a)ei/rwn Od.11.423, cf. Il.7.130 (tm.); x. a)natei/nein (v. a)natei/nw 1.1). ta\s xei=ras ai)/rein to hold up
hands in token of assent or choice, of persons voting, Ar.Ec.264; th\n x. ai)/rein And.3.41; o(/tw| dokei= tau=ta, a)ra/tw th\n x. X.An.5.6.33, cf. 7.3.6; a)nateina/tw th\n x. ib.3.2.9, 33; xei=ras o)regnu/s Il.22.37; xei=r' o)re/gwn ei)s ou)rano/n 15.371; xei=ras o). tini/ Od.12.257; pro/s tina Pi. P.4.240; poti\ sto/ma xei=r' o)re/gesqai Il.24.506 (but xei=ra/ tisi o). to reach them
one's hand in help, X.HG5.2.17); also xei=re e(ta/roisi peta/ssas Il.4.523, etc.; pitna\s ei)s e)me\ xei=ras Od.11.392 (but xei=re peta/ssas abs., of one swimming, etc., 5.374, al.). [*)ili/ou] xei=ra e(h\n u(pere/sxe held
the hand over as a protector, Il.9.420, etc.: less freq. tisi, 4.249, cf. 5.433; xei=ra/ q' u(/perqen e)/xeis IG14.1003.10 (Rome). in hostile sense, xei=ras or xei=ra e)pife/rein tini/, Il.1.89, 19.261, al.; xei=ras e)fie/nai tini/ 1.567, Od.1.254, al.; xei=ras e)piba/llein tisi/ Plb.3.2.8, etc.; xe/ra tini\ prosenegkei=n Pi.P.9.36; xei=ras e)pi/ tini i)a/llein, v. i)a/llw 1.1. xei=ras a)pe/xein keep
hands off, loimoi=o barei/as xei=ras a)fe/cei Il.1.97 codd.; kertomi/as de/ toi . . kai\ xei=ras a)fe/cw . . mnhsth/rwn Od.20.263; a)qana/twn a)pe/xein xe/ras A.Eu.350 (lyr.); tw\ xei=re a)pe/xetai Pl.Smp.213d; pau/ein xei=ra/s tinos Il.21.294. xei=ras e)pitiqe/nai tini/, in token of consecration, 1 Ep.Ti.5.22, etc. with Preps.: a)na\ xei=ras e)/xein tina/s to be intimate with . . , Plb.21.6.5; ai( a)na\ xei=ra/ tinwn o(mili/ai S.E.M.1.64; ta\ a)na\ xei=ra pra/gmata the matters
in hand, Plu.2.614b, etc. (also oi( a)na\ x. xro/noi the
current period, PRyl.88.21 (ii A. D.); ta\ a)na\ x. what comes his way, Ps.-Ptol.Centil.18; a)na\ x. th=s pu/lhs
hard by . . , LXX 2 Ki.15.2. a)po\ xeiro\s logi/sasqai to reckon
off-hand, roughly, Ar.V.656 (anap.), cf. Luc.Hist.Conscr.29: but po/tison th\n gh=n a)po\ xeiro/s by
hand, PCair.Zen.155 (iii B. C.). dia\ xerw=n e)/xein, labei=n, literally, to have or take
between the
hands, A.Supp.193, S.Ant.916; dia\ xeiro\s e)/xein to hold
in the hand, ib.1258 (anap.), Ar.V.597 (anap.); to have
in hand, i. e.
under control, Th.2.76; dia\ xeirw=n e)/xein th\n politei/an Arist.Pol.1308a27; ta\ tw=n cumma/xwn keep
under control, Th.2.13: later, to have a work
in hand, be engaged in it, Phld.Acad.Ind.p.69M. (xero/s), D.H.Isoc.4; ta\ o(/pla Plu.Cor.2, etc. (also dia\ x. by direct payment, opp. dia\ th=s trape/zhs by banker's order, BGU1156.8 (i B. C.), etc.; cf. dia\ x. e)/speude th\n pra=sin Charito 1.12); of arms, dia\ xeiro\s ei)=nai Luc.Anach.35; dia\ x. e)/xein, c. part., to be
continually doing, Plu.2.767c; dia\ xeiro/s tinos poiei=n ti LXXJo.17.4, al., cf. Act.Ap.7.25, al. e)s xei=ras labei=n ti literally, S.El.1120, etc.; to take a matter
in hand, undertake it, pra=gm' e)s xe/ras labo/nt' E.Hec.1242; a)/gesqai/ ti e)s xei=ras Hdt.1.126, 4.79, etc.; dou=nai/ tini e)s xe/ras, ei)s xei=ra, S.El.1348, X.Cyr.8.8.22; katasth=sai ei)s ta\s x. tinos Aeschin.2.28; of persons, i(/keo xei=ras e)s a(ma/s thou hast fallen into our
hands, Il.10.448 (in Hom. also simply o(/ ti xei=ras i(/koito Od.12.331, cf. 24.172); so ei)s xei=ras e)lqei=n tini X.Cyr.7.4.10, cf. 2.4.15: generally, to have to do with any one,
converse with him, Id.An.1.2.26 (so e)s xei=ra gh=| cunh=yan E.Heracl.429): most freq. e)s xei=ras e)lqei=n tisi to come to
blows or
close quarters with . . , A.Th.680; a)llh/lois Th.7.44: abs., ei)s x. e)lqei=n Id.4.96; e)s x. i)e/nai Id.2.3, 4.72, cf. PTeb.765.6 (ii B. C.); sunie/nai X.Cyr.8.8.22; also e)s xeirw=n no/mon (fort. nomo/n） a)pike/sqai Hdt.9.48; e)n xeirw=n no/mw| (fort. nomw=|） a)po/llusqai Id.8.89, cf. Aeschin.1.5, SIG167.37 (Mylasa, iv B. C.), Heraclid.Pol.25, Plb.1.34.5, 5.111.6; e)n xeiro\s no/mw|
Arist.Pol.1285a10, D.H.6.26; e)n xeirw=n nomai=s SIG700.29 (Lete, ii B.C.), v. l. in LXX 3 Ma.1.5; e)n xeroi=n di/kh| cj. in E.Ba.738; ei)s xei=ras summei=cai toi=s polemi/ois X.Cyr.2.1.11; also ei)s xei=ras de/xesqai/ tinas to await their charge, Id.An.4.3.31; e)s x. u(pomei=nai/ tinas Th. 5.72. e)k xeiro/s by
hand of man, S.Aj.27: from
near at hand, at close range, e)k xeiro\s ba/llein X.An.3.3.15; a)mu/nasqai ib.5.4.25; ma/xesqai Id.HG7.2.14, cf. D.S.19.6; plhga\s e)k x. a)nade/casqai Plu.
tim.4; ou) mh\ swqh=| e)k x. sidh/rou LXX Jb.20.24; h( e)k x. di/kh
lynch law, D.H.4.37; h( e)k x. bi/a Plb.9.4.6: metaph., h( e)k x. qewri/a
closerange reading, D.H.Isoc.2; so of time,
out of hand, off-hand, forthwith, Plb.5.41.7, al. de/pas mhtri\ e)n xeiri\ ti/qei Il.1.585, cf. Od.13.57, 15.120, al. (always so of a cup, hence e)n xersi\ ti/qei de/pas, though found in most codd., was condemned by the critics in Il.l.c., Od.3.51, 15.130); presbh/i+on e)n xeri\ qh/sw Il.8.289; to/con, e)/gxos e)/xwn e)n xeiri/, 15.443, 17.604; skh=ptron de/ oi( e)/mbale xeiri/ Od.2.37; but e)n . . xeiri\ skh=ptron e)/qhken Il.23.568; of a gift, e)n xersi\ ti/qei 1.441, 446; e)n tai=s x. e)/xein, literally, Pl.R.432d; ta\ o(/pl' e)n tai=s x. e)/xwn D.9.8, etc. (metaph., e)/ti memnhme/nwn u(mw=n kai\ mo/non ou)k e)n tai=s xersi\n e(/kast' e)xo/ntwn Id.18.226); but e)n xersi\n e)/xein also, to have
in hand, be engaged in, to\n ga/mon Hdt.1.35; e(orth/n Plu.Alex.13; th\n peri\ *dhmosqe/nous pragmatei/an D.H.Th.1; e)n xeiri/ tina di/khn e)/xwn Pl.Tht. 172e; o( e)n xersi\ po/lemos the war
in hand, D.H.8.87; periteixismo\s e)n xersi\n w)/n ib.21; h( e)n x. zh/thsis S.E.M.11.208, etc.; freq. of fighting, e)n xersi/
hand to hand, e)n x. h)=n h( ma/xh Th.4.43; e)n x. a)poktei=nai Id.3.66, cf. 4.57,96, etc.; e)n x. gi/gnesqai toi=s e)nanti/ois Id.5.72; e)n x. ei)=nai/ tinos X.HG4.6.11; di/kh e)n xersi/ Hes.Op.192; o( yo/fos tw=n o(/plwn kai\ tw=n i(/ppwn o( fruagmo\s e)n xersi\n e)do/kei ei)=nai D.S.19.31; h( e)n xersi\n [dustuxi/a] Plu.Cleom.22: also in dual, ta)n xeroi=n S.Ant.1345 (lyr.); e)n xeiri/ tinos
by the hand of . . , LXX Jo.21.2, al.; e)n x. a)gge/lou Act.Ap.7.35 (v.l.). e)pi\ xeiro\s e)/xein
on or
in one's
hand, Thgn.490; e)pi\ xei=ra/s tinwn e)kfe/rousi put into their
hands, Plu.2.815b; also e)pi\ xei=ra/ tinos
next to, LXXNe.3.4. kata\ xeiro/s, of washing the hands before meals, u(/dwr kata\ xeiro/s (sc. fere/tw tis), Ar.V.1216, cf.Av.464 (anap.), Fr.502 (lyr.), Philox. 1, Ath.9.408e; (without u(/dwr） kata\ x. e)do/qh Alex.261.2, cf. Arched. 2.3: prov. of that which is easily come by, Telecl.1.2 (anap.); pa/nta moi kata\ x. h)=n ta\ pra/gmata
at hand, Pherecr.146.5; also kata\ xeirw=n dou=nai, xe/ein, labei=n, Philyll.3, Antiph.287 (v.l.), Men.470 (troch.), cf. Phot.s.v. kata\ xeiro\s u(/dwr: kata\ xei=ra in
deed or
act, kata\ x. gennaio/tatoi D.H.7.6; opp. sune/sei, Plu.Phil.7; kata\ xei=ra/ sou according to thy
will, LXX Si.25.26: but kata\ xei=ras [th=s sofi/as] by her
side, ib.14.25. meta\ xersi\n e)/xein
between, i.e.
in, the hands, Il.11.4, 15.717; [a)/leison] meta\ x. e)nw/ma Od.22.10: meta\ xei=ras e)/xein to have
in hand, be engaged in, Hdt.7.16.b/, Th.1.138. la/be para\ xei=ra take
in hand, LXX To. 11.4; but to\ pa\r xeiro/s the work
in hand, B.13.10. pro\ xeirw=n
close before one, S.Ant.1279, E.Tr.1207 (s.v.l.), Rh.274; pro\ xeiro\s ei)=nai cj. in Pl.Com.69.5. pro\s xeiro/s tinos by his
hand, A.Supp.66 (lyr.), etc.; pro\s e)mh\n xei=ra at the signs
given by my
hand, S.Ph.148 (anap.); pro\s xei=ra u(poborboru/zontes on
pressure, Hp.Epid.4.7. u(po\ xersi\ a(lou=sa
under, i.e.
by, another's
hands, Il.2.374, etc.; u(po\ xei=ra poiei=sqai to bring
under one's power, X.Ages.1.22; oi( u(po\ x. persons
in one's power, D.6.34; u(po\ th\n x. e)lqei=n to come
into one's hand, Luc.Herm.57, etc.; u(po\ x. in
hand, i.e. in
stock, Arist.Mete.369b33; but also,
at hand, i.e.
at once, Plu.2.548e; ta\ u(po\ x. ib.56b, Dsc.1.35; o( u(po\ x. the attendant, Dsc.5.75; pare/rgws kai\ u(po\ x.
extempore, Plu.Arat.3, etc.; also kaqu/po xei=ra kinw=n [ta\s ou)si/as], in Alchemy, Ps.-Democr. p.51 B.
the hand often receives the attributes of
the person using it, x. mega/lh, of Zeus, Il.15.695 (x. pagkrath/s, of God, Secund.Sent.3; x. u(permh/khs, of the 'long
arm' of the king, Hdt.8.140.b'）; qoh\ x., of one throwing, Il.12.306; a)fneia/ Pi.O.7.1, cf. S.El. 458; eu)sebeste/ra, eu)filh/s, A.Ch.141, Ag.34; ka/rbanos ib.1061; geraia/ E.Hec.143 (anap.); ponhra/ Id.Ion1316, etc.: to denote wealth or poverty, pleiote/rh| su\n x. Od.11.359; kenea\s su\n x. e)/xontes 10.42, cf. E.Hel.1280, etc. it is represented as acting of itself, xei=res maimw=sin Il.13.77, cf. S.Aj.50; xei\r o(ra=| to\ dra/simon A.Th.554; dh/mou kratou=sa x. Id.Supp.604 (dub. l.): prov., a( de\ x. ta\n x. ni/zei Epich.273; or simply, a( x. ta\n x. AP5.207 (Mel.). pl., in theurgy, name for spiritual
powers, ai( dhmiourgikai\ [tou= *)apo/llwnos] duna/meis a(\s qeourgw=n pai=des xei=ras a)pokalou=sin Procl. in Cra. p.101 P., cf. eund.
in R.2.252K. to denote
act or deed, opp. mere words, in pl., e)/pesin kai\ xersi\n a)rh/cein Il.1.77; mnh=m' *(ele/nhs xeirw=n of her
handiwork, her
art, Od.15.126 (so in sg., dw/rhm' e)kei/nw| ta)ndri\ th=s e)mh=s x. S.Tr.603); xersi\n h)\ lo/gw| Id.OT883 (lyr.), cf. OC1297, etc.; th=| xeiri\ xra=sqai to use one's
hands, i.c. be active, stirring, opp. a)rgo\s e)pesta/nai, Hdt.3.78, cf. 9.72; ta\s x. prosfe/rein to apply
force, X.Mem.2.6.31: sg., bou/leuma me\n to\ *di=on, *(hfai/stou de\ xei/r A.Pr.619; mia=| xeiri/ single-
handed, D.21.219; xeiri\ kai\ podi\ kai\ pa/sh| duna/mei Aeschin.3.109, cf. 2.115; xersi/n te posi/n te Il.20.360, cf. Pi.O.10(11).62, esp. of using the hands in a fight, cf. supr. 11.6d, e, f; of deeds of violence, pri\n xeirw=n geu/sasqai before we try
force, Od.20.181; a)di/kwn x. a)/rxein to give the first
blow, X.Cyr.1.5.13, Antipho 4.2.1, Lys.4.11, etc.; a)muno/menos a)/rxonta xeirw=n Pl.Lg.869d: generally, xei=res
violent measures, force, e)pi/sxete qumo\n e)niph=s kai\ xeirw=n Od.20.267; u(po/dikos xerw=n A.Eu.260 (lyr.); xersi\ pepoiqw/s Il.16.624, etc.; e)n xeirw=n no/mw| v. supr. 11.6d; o(/pws qana/toio barei/as x. a)la/lkoi, v.l. for kh=ras, Il.21.548.
a number, band, body of men, esp. of soldiers, xei\r mega/lh Hdt.7.157; in dat., ou) su\n mega/lh| x. Id.5.72; pollh=| x. 1.174, Th.3.96, E.Heracl. 337; pleon., x. mega/lh| plh/qeos Hdt.7.20; dedwma/twmai d' ou)d' e)gw\ smikra=| xeri/ A.Supp.958; oi)kei/a xei/r, for xei\r oi)ketw=n, E.El.629; su\n plh/qei xerw=n S.OT123.
handwriting, th\n e(autou= xei=ra a)rnh/sasqai Hyp.Lyc.Fr.5, cf. IG9(1).189 (Phocis); th=| e)mh=| x. *pau/lou I Ep. Cor.16.21, Ep.Col.4.18:
copy, counterpart of a document, SIG712.31 (Crete, ii B.C.);
deed, instrument, h( x. h(/de kuri/a e)/stw PRein.28.18 (ii B.C.), cf. PCair.Zen.477 (iii B.C.), etc.
handiwork of an artist or workman, glafura\ x. Theoc.Epigr.8.5, etc.; ai( *)efesi/ou xei=res Herod.4.72, cf. 6.66; sofai\ xe/res APl.4.262; ta\s *feidi/ou x. Lib.Or. 30.22. of any implement resembling a hand: a kind of
gauntlet, X.Eq.12.5, Poll.1.135 (pl.). x. sidhra=
grappling-iron, Th.4.25, 7.62; also of an
anchor, AP6.38 (Phil.).
axle-tree, LXX 3 Ki.7.18(32). in LXX,
pillar or
cairn, as it were
a finger pointing to heaven, xei\r *)abessalw/m LXX 2 Ki.18.18; also a)ne/staken au)tw=| xei=ra, i.e.
trophy, ib. 1 Ki.15.12. xei=res e)la/tinai, of oars, Tim.Pers.7.
catch of a trigger, Hero Aut.13.9; x. kata/gousa th\n toci=tin Ph.Bel. 68.4, cf. Hero Bel.78.2. instrument of torture, LXX 4 Ma.8.13.
handful, korw/nh| xei=ra pro/sdote kriqe/wn Phoen. 2.1.
ointment containing
five ingredients, Orib.Fr.89, Alex. Trall.7.1. (Cf. Arm.
jein (
dzern), Alb.
dore, Tocharian (A-dialect)
tsar, (B-dialect)
sar, all =
hand.）

xeira/gr-a, h(,
gout in the hand, Asclep. ap. Gal.13.1026. Ptol.Tetr. 153 (pl.).

xeiragr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from xeira/gra, cj. in Aët.2.25.
xei/ragr-os, = foreg., Gloss.

xeira^gwg-e/w,
lead by the hand, tina LXXJd.16.26 cod. A, Muson.Fr.15Ap.79H., Act.Ap.9.8, Plu.Cleom.38: generally,
guide, direct, fruktw/ria e)s a)sfalei=s katagwga\s ta\s nau=s x. Hdn.4.2.8; x. tou/tw| th\n e)/codon will
guide his exit, Procop.Gaz.p.158B.: metaph., x. th\n eu(/resin mnh/mh| Plu.2.48b; th\n yuxh\n e)pi/ ti Max. Tyr.10.6; also
'lead by the nose', cajole, Posidon.36J.: abs., Luc.Tim.32, Porph. Chr.30:—Pass., LXX To.11.16 cod. <*>, u(p' au)tw=n tw=n pragma/twn PPetr. 3p.22 (iii B.C.), cf. D.S.13.20; e)pi/ ti Hdn.7.1.2.

xeira^gw/g-hma, atos, to/,
leading by the hand, Sch.E.Ph.848.

xeira^gwg-i/a, h(, = foreg., BGU1768.11 (i B.C.), Longus 4.12, Sch.E.Or.883, Suid.: metaph., pro\s th\n x. th=s kra/sews in order to
induce mixture, Max.Tyr.15.4.

xeira^gw/g-i^mos, on,
liable to seizure, PLond.2.220 ii 21 (ii B.C.).

xeira^gwg-o/s, o/n,
leading, guiding, x. a)rxh/ Supp.Epigr.8.464 (Egypt). Subst.,
leader, guide, e)/xei . . x. to\n plou=ton o( ge/rwn Philem.127; cf. Act.Ap.13.11, Plu.2.794d: tou= bi/ou tuflh\ x. (of *tu/xh), ib.98b; qeoi=s e(/pesqai xeiragwgoi=s h(gou/menoi Lib.Or.61.4.

xelr-algo/s, o(,
suffering from gout in the hand, Petr.Patr. in Boissevain D.C. iii p.744 No.166.

xelr-a^leipte/w,
anoint the arms for wrestling,
practise wrestling, D.S.26.3.

xelr-a/lu^sis [a^], ews, h(,
manacle, handcuff, Sm.Je.40(47).1:—hence Dim. xelr-a^lu^si/dion, to/, Gloss.

xelr-a/maca [a^m], h(,
bath-chair, Herod.Med. ap. Orib.6.25.2, Paul.Aeg.3.18.

xelr-a^ma/cion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Petron.28; child's
go-cart, Sor.1.117.
xeiramo/s, = xhramo/s, EM810.25, perh. to be read in Lyc.181.

xeirapt-a/zw,
touch with the hand, take in hand, handle, Hdt.2.90.
xeirapt-e/w, = foreg., Orib.Fr.19.

xeira/s, a/dos, h(, (xei/r)
chap, crack, prop. in the hands, but also in the feet, xeira/des xeirw=n, podw=n,
chapped hands or feet, D.L.1.81; also xira/s Suid., Eust.194.40.
heap of stones, etc., Hsch.

xeir-afesi/a, h(, =
emancipatio; xeir-afete/w, =
emancipare; and xeir-a/fetos, =
emancipatus, Gloss.

xeir-ayi/a, h(, (a(/ptw A)
violence offered, rough handling, Sammelb.6152.13 (i B.C.).
hand to hand fight, close combat, xeirayi/ai kai\ pezw=n kai\ i(ppe/wn Anon. ap. Suid. as a term of wrestling,
clasping of one's antagonist so as to throw him (cf. a(/mma 1.5), Plu.2.234d.
gentle friction, massage, Cael.Aur. TP1.4;
gentle treatment, in operations, Heliod. ap. Orib.50.47.1.
xeir-ekma^gei=on, to/, = xeiro/maktron, Sotacusap.Apollon.Mir.36, Gloss.

xeir-erga/ths [a^], ou, o(,
one who works by hand, Tz.H.10.779.

xeir-hth/s, ou=, o(,
manual labourer, BGU9 iii 19 (iii A.D.).

xeir-la/w,
have chaps in the hand, Poll.2.152.

xeiri/d-ion, to/,
glove for rubbing the body, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.18.5; xeiridi/wn v.l. for xeiri/dwn in Gal.6.230.

xeirid-o/omai, Pass.,
to be furnished with hands, Nicostr. ap. Simp. in Cat.369.11.
to be furnished with sleeves, Gloss.

xeirid-wto/s, o/n,
sleeved, kiqw/n as worn by Asiatics, Hdt.7.61, cf.PTeb.46.34 (ii B.C.), Philostr.Im.1.28, Hdn.5.3.6; of the Gallic xitw\n sxisto/s, Str.4.4.3.
having hands, Suid.

xeir-i/zw, Dor. fut. xeiricou=nti Rev.Arch.1925(22).62 (Callatis), part. xeiricou=ntas IG9(1).694.44 (Corc., ii B.C.): pf. kexei/rika PTeb. 76.3 (ii B.C.):—
handle, manipulate, of a surgeon, Sor.Vit.Hippocr. 12:—Pass., Hp.Off.3, al., Sor.Fasc.7.
manage, administer, esp. of public funds, Plb.1.20.4, 1.75.1, al.; pro/sodon PTeb.l.c.; xrh/mata Tab.Defix.96.17 (iii B.C.); a)rgu/rion IG l.c.; th\n zuthra/n Wilcken Chr.272.11 (ii A.D.). generally,
handle, lo/gous S.E.M.7.443;
control, manage, o)rga\s kai\ pa/qh Phld.Rh.2.263S. Med.,
nominate, appoint, POxy.59.14 (iii A.D.):—Pass., ib.1029.5 (ii A.D.): metaph., gene/sei xeirisqei\s a)pe/qanes
as appointed by your nativity, Supp.Epigr.7.904 (Gerasa).

xeir-iko/s, h/, o/n,
manual, e)/rga POxy.1692.5 (ii A.D.).

xei/r-icis, los, h(, = xeirismo/s 1, Hp.Fract.7.
administration, tou= a)rguri/ou IG9(1).694.66 (Corc., ii B.C.).

xei/r-ios, a, on, = u(poxei/rios,
in the hands, under control, E.Andr.411; mostly with a Verb, xeiri/an a)fei/s tini having left me
in the power of, captive to, another, S.Aj.495; e)la/bete . . *(ele/nhn xeiri/an; did you get her
into your power? E.Cyc.177; x. a(lou=sa Id.Ion1257 (troch.).
xeir-i^pe/da, Boeot. = xeirope/dh, IG7.2420.27 (Thebes, iii B.C.).

xeir-i/s, i=dos, h(,
a covering for the hand, glove, Od.24.230, X.Cyr.8.8.17, Clearch.
14.
covering for the arm, loose sleeve, such as the Persians wore, e)pikath/menos xeiri/di ple/h| （xeiri\ diplh=| codd.) a)rguri/ou Hdt.6.72, cf. X. HG2.1.8, Cyr.8.3.14, PLips.40 iii 23 (iv A.D.); used also by the Gauls, Plu.Oth.6; by tragedians, Luc.JTr.41. = xeiri/dion, Agathin. ap. Orib.10.7.18, Gal.6.187. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr.2.437; xeiri=das Od.l.c.)

xei/r-isma, atos, to/,
part handled or
operated upon, Hp. Art.11.
treatment, ib.14,42.

xeir-ismogra/fos [a^], o(,
inventory-keeper, registrar, PLips.102i9 (iv A.D.), Stud.Pal.20.81.4 (iv A.D.).

xeir-ismo/s, o(,
handling, manipulation, treatment, esp. in surgery, Hp.Off.3, Paul.Aeg.6.122.
management, handling, th=s tu/xhs
by fortune, Plb.1.4.1; tw=n pragma/twn
of business, 5.26.4; o( kata\ me/ros x. 2.35.3; o( x. th=s xa/ritos
exercise, 31.28.11; tw=n dogma/twn
execution, 6.12.3: abs., 1.28.4; of literary or rhetorical
treatment, D.S.5.1, Phld.Rh.1.371S. esp. of
financial administration, Schwyzer631.11 (Milet., ii B.C.), Rev.Arch.1925(22).62 (Callatis), POxy.2125.3 (iii A.D.);
department, PTeb.758.14 (ii B.C.), Wilcken Chr.432.13 (ii A.D.), 170.27 (iii A.D.). pl.,
administrative posts, Vett.Val.39.12.
inventory, register of property, Wilcken Chr.71.11 (pl.), 91.14 (both ii A.D.).
guild, corporation, tw=n kubernhtw=n PGiss.11.11 (ii A.D.), cf. PPetr.3p.206, al. (iii B.C., abbrev.).
xeiri/sofos, f.l. for xeiro/sofos.

xeir-iste/on,
one must manage or
conduct, to\n po/lemon D.S.17.16. xeiriste/os, a, on,
to be operated upon, Hp.Mochl. 40.

xeir-isteu/w,
act as administrator, TAM2.539 (Arsada, Lycia).

xeir-isth/s, ou=, o(,
manager, administrator, PHib.1.74 (iii B.C.), PCair.Zen.737.15 (iii B.C.), Plb.3.4.13, 98.8, al., Cat.Cod.Astr.2.193; a)llotri/wn Vett. Val.10.14, al.; oi( dia\ tw=n oi)kono/mwn x., *(ellhnika/ 7.179 (Chalcis, iii B.C.).

xeir-istiko/n, to/,
salary of xeiristh/s, PTeb. 121.49 (i B.C.).
ledger, POxy.1257.10 (iii A.D.), etc. Adj. xeir-ko/s, h/, o/n,
entered in a list, kat' a)/ndra x. puro/s ib.1444.4 (iii A.D.), 1526.4 (iii A.D.).
xei/r-istos, h, on, irreg. Sup. of xei/rwn (v. xei/rwn B).
xeiro-a/lu^sis [a^], ews, h(, = xeira/lusis, Gloss.
xeiro-a/nac, etym. of xeirw=nac, EM811.8.

xeiro-balli/stra, h(,
hand-sling, = Lat.
falarica, Gloss.; title of work wrongly ascribed to Hero.
xeiro-ba/nausos [ba^], on, = ba/nausos, Poll.7.7.

xeiro-ba^rh/s, e/s,
heauy in the hand, Philetaer.10 (lyr.).

xeiro/-bi^os, on,
living by handiwork, PEnteux. 82.7 (iii B.C.), Suid.
xeiro/-blhma, atos, to/, and xeiro/-blhton, to/, glossed by dra/gmata, Hsch.
xeiro-bli_ma/omai, = yhlafa/w, Luc.Pseudol.24 (-blhm- cod.).

xeiro-bole/w,
throw the arms about, Id.Lex.5.

xeiro/-bolon, to/,
handful, bundle, Tz.ad Lyc.34 (xero- cod.).

xeiro-bosko/s, o/n,
supporting oneself by manual work, Poll.7.7, Hsch.

xeiro-brw/s, w=tos, o(, h(,
gnawing the arms, desmo/s Stesich.4.

xeiro-ga/stwr, oros, o(, h(,
one who fills his belly with his hands, i.e.
lives by handiwork, Hecat.367 J.: *xeiroga/stores, name of play by Nicopho.

xeiro-goni/a, h(,
Hand-production, a name of Persephone, Hsch. (fort. -ge/neia).

xeirogra^f-ew,
report in writing, PTeb.72.465 (ii B.C.).
give a guarantee by note of hand, peri/ tinos ib.48.5 (ii B.C.): c. inf. fut., ib.66.59 (ii B.C.): but, esp. x. to\n basiliko\n o(/rkon
subscribe to the royal oath,
make an attested
declaration, PRev. Laws 27.5, al. (iii B.C.), etc.

xeirogra^f-i/a, h(,
report in writing, PTeb.64（
a).54 (ii B.C.).
declaration attested by oath,
written testimony, x. o(/rkou basilikou= ib.27.32 (ii B.C.); kata\ no/mous xeirografi/as PRev.Laws 37.13 (iii B.C.); parabebhko/tos ta\ th=s x. PAmh.2.35.31 (ii B. C.).

xeiro/gra^f-os, on,
written with the hand, holograph, manuscript, su/mbolon, a)sfa/l<e>ia, PFay.303 (ii A.D.), PGrenf.2.75.13 (iv A.D.): hence xeiro/gra^fon, to/,
manuscript note, IG22.1013.52, Plb.30.8.4, LXX To.5.3, D.H.5.8, Artem.3.40; to\ kaq' h(mw=n x. Ep.Col.2.14.
note of hand, bond, PRein.7.22 (ii B.C.), Plu.2.829a, etc.; also xeiro/gra^fos, o(, CIG4629 (Syria). parox., xeirogra/fos [a^], o(,
clerk, amanuensis, PTeb.209 (i B.C.).

xeiro-da/i+ktos [a^], on,
slain by hand, sfa/gia S.Aj.219 (anap.).

xeiro/-deiktos, on,
manifest, Id.OT901 (lyr.).

xeiro/-desmos, o(,
handcuff, manacle, Gloss.
xeiro-di/kaios [i^], on, = sq., Suid.

xeiro-di/khs [i^], on, o(,
one who asserts his right by hand, uses the right of might, Hes. Op.[189].

xeiro-do/sion, to/,
wages, hire, Gloss.

xeiro-dote/w,
give with the hand, xeirodotei= tro/pon a)lei/ptou kai\ pro\s ta\ gumna/sia kalei= Ph.1.640 codd. (xeirodetei=
binds his hands with the cestus, cj. Wyttenbach; sugkrotei= cj. Mangey).

xeiro/-dotos, on,
given by hand, x. da/neisma money
lent without written acknowledgement, Poll. 2.152. x. para/ferna
movable goods, Arch.Pap.4.130 ii 30.
furnished with hands, Porph. in Cat.123.11.

xeiro-dra/kwn [a^], ontos, o(, h(,
with serpent hands or
arms, E.El.1345 (anap.).

xeiro-dro/pos, on,
plucking with the hands, Nic.Th.752.

xeiro-h/qeia, h(,
domestication, Arist.Phgn.809a33, Gp.16.1.11.

xeiro-h/qhs, es,
accustomed to the hand, manageable, commonly of animals,
tame, kroko/deilos Hdt.2.69; qeo/s tis x., as Cambyses sneeringly calls Apis, Id.3.28; x.pw=los X.Eq.2.3; le/wn D.S.1.48, etc.: c. dat.,
used to, e)gxe/leis a)nqrw/pois x. Plu.2.976a; [qhri/a] x. gigno/mena toi=s po/nois, i.e. by training, ib.2f. of persons,
civilized, Str.11.2.4;
amenable, c. dat., moi x. h)=n kai\ e)tiqas（s）eu/eto (fort. e)tetiqa/seuto) had become
submissive to me, of a person, X. Oec.7.10; tiqaseu/ousi xeiroh/qeis e(autoi=s poiou=ntes D.3.31; tw=| dh/mw| Plu.Per.15; toi=s [e)n filosofi/a| legome/nois] pare/xousin e(autou\s x. Id.2.14e; x. u(/brei
used to it, Luc.Merc.Cond.35: Comp., h(donh=| -e/steros Jul.Caes.318a. of things,
manageable, tolerable, th=| dianoi/a x. dia\ th=s o)/yews Plu.Mar.16; ta\ o(/pla toi=s sw/masin e)gi/neto x. Id.Phil.9, cf. 2.47b; au(tw=| x. katasthsa/tw to\ paqhmatiko\n th=s yuxh=s mo/rion Jul. Or.6.199c.

xeiro-qesi/a, h(,
application by hand, of an instrument, Artemo Hist. ap. Ath.14.637c.

xeiro/-kmhtos, on,
wrought by hand, paradei/gmata Ti.Locr.94e, cf. Arist.Cael.287b16, Mete.381a30; oi)kh/mata Str.2.5.10; x. u(/data, = freatiai=a, of
artificial reservoirs, Arist.Mete. 353b25; x. qeo/s Heraclit.Ep.4.2; neut. pl. as title of work by [Democr.], Fr.300 (variously corrupted).

xeiro-kope/w,
cut off the hand of, tinas D.S.25.3, cf.33.14, App.Hisp.68:—Pass.,
have one's hand or
hands cut off, Str.15.1.54, Plu.2.305c.

xeiro-ko/pos, on,
cutting off the hands, Macr.Exc.p.601 K.
xeiro-kra^si/a, h(, = xeirokrati/a, Phld.Ir. p.32 W., D.H.6.65, 8.72, D.S.36.6, Plu.2.332c.

xeiro-kra^te/w,
grasp by the hand (or
violently), PMag.Berol.1.82.

xeiro-kra^thsi/a, h(,
seizure by violence, Nech. ap. Heph.Astr.1.21, Cat.Cod.Astr.7.135 (both pl.).

xeiro-kra^ti/a, h(,
right of might, government by force, Plb.6.9.7, D.S.36.11, App.BC1.17.

xeiro-kra^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
using the right of might, o( qhriw/dhs [tro/pos th=s politei/as] kai\ x. Plb.6.10.4.

xeiro-kri/ths [i^], ou, o(,
counter of votes, teller, BCH58.319 (Mylasa),
Wiener Sitzb. 132(2).12 (ibid.), Inscr.Magn.110a1.

xeiro/-ktu^pos, on,
stricken by the hand; v. xoroitu/pos 1.

xeiro-la/bh [a^], h(,
handle, Ph.Bel.76.23, Inscr.Delos1441 Aii53 (ii B.C.).

xeiro-la^bi/s, i/dos, h(, = foreg., Hero Spir. 1.5: esp.
plough-handle, Poll.1.252.

xeiro-loge/w,
gather by hand, Gp.10.21.6 (Pass.).

xeiro-luxni/a, h(,
lantern, PGrenf.2.111.25 (v/vi A.D.).

xeiro/-maktron, to/,
cloth for wiping the hands, towel, napkin, Hdt.4.64, Ar.Fr.502, X.Cyr.1.3.5, PCair.Zen. 87.8, al. (iii B.C.): the Scythians used scalps as xeiro/maktra, Hdt.l.c.: hence *skuqisti\ x. e)kkekarme/nos S.Fr.473.
head-cloth, used by women, Sapph.44, Hecat.358 J., and perhaps so in Hdt.2.122, x. xru/seon, [Written xeirw/maktron PRev.Laws 94.4 (iii B.C.), PEnteux.38.3,9 (iii B.C.), but xeiro/maktron PCair.Zen. Il.cc. (iii B.C.):
xeiro/-w- might be due to 'contamination' with the root of o)mo/rg-numi.]

xeiro/-mantis, ews, o(,
diviner by palmistry, fortune-teller, Poll.2.152.

xeiro-ma/ppion, to/ (cf. Lat.
mappa), towel, Sammelb.7033.43 (v A.D.).

xeiro-ma/xa [ma^], h( (sc. e(tairei/a),
the working-class faction at Miletus, opp. h( plouti/s, Plu.2.298c, cf. Eust.1425.64.

xeiro-ma^xe/w,
fight with the hands, sens. obsc., AP12.22 (Scyth.).

xeiro-ma^xi/a, h(,
manual labour, Eust.1716.3.
xeiro-mh/rion, to/, gloss on r(uka/nh, Hsch.

xeiro-mu/lh [u^], h(,
hand-mill, X.Cyr.6.2.31.
xeiro-mu/lion [u^], to/, Dim. of foreg., Dsc.5.88, PMag.Par.1.3089.
xeiro/-mu^lon, to/, = xeiromu/lh, Cass.Fel.40, Gloss.; also xeiro/-mu^los, o(, ib., Edict.Diocl.15.55.
xeiro/-ni^bon, to/, = sq., Epich.79 (pl.).

xeiro/-niptron, to/,
basin for washing the hands, Eup.118.1, prob. in IG22.1416.7.
water for washing the hands, Poll.2.150, EM810.50.
hand-washing, Dsc.1.7.

xeironom-e/w,
gesticulate with the hands, X.Smp.2.19, D.C.36.30, toi=si ske/lesi e)xeirono/mhse, of one standing on his head, Hdt.6.129; xeironomou=nta
volanticultello, flourishing the knife, of an expert carver, Juv.5.121.
practise shadow-boxing, Thrasym.Fr.4, Pl.Lg. 830c, Plu.2.747b.

xeironom-hsei/w, Desiderat.,
wish to gesticulate, Cratin. 453.

xeironom-i/a, h(,
shadow-boxing, Hp.Vict.2.64, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.30.1, Gal.6.324(pl.), etc.
pantomimic movement, gesticulation, Ath. 14.631c, Plu.2.997c, Luc.Salt.78, Plot.5.9.11. e)n xeironomi/ais, = e)n xeirw=n no/mw| (v. xei/r 11.6d), LXX 3 Ma.1.5 (v.l. e)n xeirw=n nomai=s).

xeiro/nom-os (parox.), o(,
one who moves the hands in pantomimic gestures, posture-master, Hsch.

xeiro/nws, Adv. of xei/rwn,
worse, for the worse, J.AJ17.9.5, Procop. Arc.6, Pall.
in Hp.Fract.12.281 C., Suid. s.v. *)/abel.

xeiro-pe/dh, h(,
handcuff, IG22.1424a274, PCair.Zen.782（
a).13 (iii B.C.), LXXPs.149(150).8, Si.21.19, al., D.S.20.13, Poll.2.152, etc.
xeiro/-pedon, to/, = foreg., Gloss.

xeiro-plhqh/s, e/s,
filling the hand, as large as can be held in the hand, li/qoi X.An.3.3.17; koru/nh Theoc. 25.63; a)gka/lisma Luc.Am.14; x. me/geqos
handful, Thphr.HP4.2.7; so x. de/smh Dsc.1.8, etc.; neut., a)lfi/twn xeiroplhqe/s Gp.14.17.2. Adv. -qw=s
by handfuls, Sch.Luc.Tim.20.
xeiro-plhqiai=os, a, on, = foreg., Thphr.HP9.4.10, D.S.3.23,28.

xeiro-po/dhs, ou, o(,
with chapped feet, Alc.37 B.

xeiro-poie/omai, Med.,
perpetrate with one's own hand, au)th\ pro\s au(th=s xeiropoiei=tai ta/de S.Tr.891.

xeiro-poi/htos, on,
made by hand, artificial, opp. au)tofuh/s (natural), skh=ptron Hdt. 1.195; li/mnh 2.149; e)/rgon Pl.Criti.118c; o(do/s X.An.4.3.5; tei/xh J.BJ4.10.5; gh/lofos, te/lma Jul.Or.2.63b, 65c: freq. in LXX of idols, Is.2.18, al.; flo\c x. a fire
intentionally kindled, opp. a)po\ tau)toma/tou, Th.2.77; so limo/s, opp. au)to/matos, Procop.Arc.26; a)na/gkh, te/xnh, Id.Goth.4.26,22. Adv. xeiro/-tws Plb.10.10.12: x.w)xu/rwto, opp. fu/sei, J.BJ7.8.3.

xeiro-po/nia (sc. i(era/), ta/,
holiday of workmen and artisans, Hsch (-poni/a cod.).
xeiro/-pous, o(, h(,
xeiro/-poun, to/, gen. -podos, = xeiropo/dhs, Poll.2.152.

xeiro-si^dh/rion, to/,
grapnel, grapplinghook, ibid. (v.l.).

xeiro-skopi/a, h(,
vote by show of hands, Revue de l'histoire des religions 63.331 (Tyre).

xeiro-skopiko/s, h/, o/n,
based on palmistry, oi)w/nisma Suid. s.v. *(/elenos.

xeiro-sko/pos, o(,
inspecting the hand, = xeiro/mantis, Artem.2.69.
counter of hands, i.e.
teller of votes, IG9(1).109.8 (Elatea),
Bull. Soc. royale des lettres de Lund 1928/9 iv 43 (Cardamyle, i A.D.), Tim.Lex., Suid.

xeiro/-sofos, on,
skilled with the hands, esp.
gesticulating well, Luc.Rh.Pr.17, Lex. 14, Lesbon. ap. eund.Salt.69:—xeiri/sofos is a f.l.

xeiro-stro/fion, to/,
instrument of torture for twisting the hands or
arms, Hdn.Epim. 150.

xeiro-te/nwn, ontos, o(, h(,
with outstretched arms, of the crab, f.l. for xeilo- Batr.297.
xeiro/teros, h, on, Ep. for xei/rwn, Il.15.513, 20.436, Hes.Op.127, Parm.8.24, etc.

xeirotexn-e/w,
to be a xeirote/xnhs, Hp.Ep.17, Poll.7.6.

xeirote/xn-hma, atos, to/,
work of art, Babr.30.4 (cj.), Poll.7.7, Lib.Or.11.254.

xeirote/xn-hs,
ou, o(,
handicraftsman, artisan, Hdt.2.167, Ar.Pl.533 (anap.), 617 anap.), Th.6.72, Pl.R.597a, PBremen48.27 (ii A.D.), etc.; opp. a)rxite/ktwn, Arist.Metaph.981a31; of slaves who brought in income to their owner, X.Mem.3.11.4; fau/lous kai\ x. Pl.R.405a; opp. filo/sofoi, X.Vect.5.4;opp. politikoi/, Plb.10.17.6; ti/s o( x. i)atori/as . .; who is the
expert in surgery . .? S.Tr.1000 (anap.), cf. Hp.VM7; pole/mon x. Plu.Comp.Lyc.Num.2.

xeirotexn-i/a, h(,
handicraft, banausi/a kai\ x. Pl.R. 590c: pl., gewrgiw=n a)pe/xesqai . . kai\ x. ib.547d; ai( peri\ xeirotexni/as e)pisth=mai Id.Plt.304b.

xeirotexn-iko/s, h/, o/n,
skilful, Ar.V.1276 (Sup.).
handicraftsmen or
artisans, sumbo/laia Pl.R.425d: h(
xeirotexn-kh/ (sc. te/xnh), = xeirotexni/a, Id.Plt.259c: pl., Id.Phlb.55d. Adv. -kw=s Il.2.148.

xeirote/xn-ion, to/,
tax on handicraft, SIG481 B3, BCH59.9 (both lph., iii B.C.).
xeirotexn-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, = xeirote/xnhs, Sch.rec.A.Pr.893. xeiro/-tmhma, atos, to/, in pl., f.l. for xeiro/kmhta in Zos.Alch.pp.209,239B.

xeirote/xn-tmhtos, on,
cut by hand, po/ntos Ph.1.674 (sed leg. -kmhtos); v.l. in Str.1.3.18.

xeiroton-e/w,
stretch out the hand, for the purpose of giving one's vote in the assembly, peri\ tw=n a)ndrw=n Plu.Phoc.34; mh\ x.
vote against the motion, Luc.Deor.Conc.9:—but mostly, c. acc. pers.,
elect, prop.
by show of hands, Ar.Ach.598, Av.1571, etc.; ei)s th\n a)gora\n x. tou\s tacia/rxous . ., ou)k e)pi\ to\n po/lemon D.4.26; c. dupl. acc., strathgo\n x. tina/ X.HG6.2.11, cf. Isoc.8.50:—Pass.,
to be elected, Ar.Ach.607; e)pi\ tou=t' e)xeirotonh/qhsan, i(/na . . Lys.28.14; x. e)/k tinwn Pl.Lg.763e; x. e)pi\ th=s dioikh/sews Decr. ap. D.18.115: c. acc. cogn., x. th\n a)rxh\n th\n e)pi\ tw=| qewrikw=| Aeschin.3.24, cf. Ar.Ec. 517 (anap.); xeirotonhqei\s h)\ laxw/n Pl.Plt.300a, cf. Aeschin.1.106. later, generally,
appoint, Ph.2.112; of the Jewish High Priest, J.AJ13.2.2; to\n u(po\ tou= qeou= kexeirotonhme/non basile/a ib.6.13.9, cf. 7.9.3;
appoint to an office in the Church, presbute/rous Act.Ap.14.23, cf. 2 Ep.Cor.8.19 (Pass.). c. acc. rei,
vote for a thing, Ar.Ec.297 (lyr.), 797, lsoc.7.84; gnw/mas D.18.248: c. inf., o( dh=mos e)xeiroto/nhsen e)cei=nai . . pe/mpein
voted to send, Aeschin. 2.13, cf. IG12.57.29, 63.4:—Pass., kexeiroto/nhtai u(/bris to\ pra=gu' ei)=nai
it is voted, ruled to be . ., D.21.216.
span with the hand, to\ ai)doi=on Artem.1.78 (ap.Suid.; xeirokopei=n codd.).

xeiroton-hte/on,
one must vote, Ar.Ec.266.
one must appoint, tina\ e)pimelhth/n Ph.2.57.

xeiroton-hth/s, ou=, o(, = Lat.
creator, Gloss.

xeiroton-hto/s, h/, o/n,
elected by show of hands, Aeschin.3.25, Arist.Ath.54.3; a)rxh\ x. an
elective magistracy, opp. klhrwth/, Aeschin.1.19,113,3.14, Arist.Rh. Al.1424a14.

xeiroton-i/a, h(,
extension of the hand, LXXIs.58.9.
voting by show of hands, Th.3.49; xeirotoni/an mnhsteu/ein to court or seek
election, Isoc.8.15; x. tou= dh/mon
election by the people, Din.1.114, S.Pelekides 76 (Thessalonica). generally,
election, appointment, Ph.2.93, etc.
a vote, in pl., Pl.Lg.659b, Aeschin. 3.3; collectively,
votes, oi(=s a)\n h( plei/sth x. gi/gnhtai Pl.Lg.755d, cf. 756b.

xeiro/ton-os, on,
stretching out the hands, x. litai/
offered with outstretched hands, A.Th.172 (lyr.).

xeiro-tri^be/w,
rub with the hands, rub, Heliod. ap. Orib.49.3.9, Hippiatr.10, Sch.D.3.31:—xeiro-tri/bw (sens. obsc.) is f.l. in EM 100.15.

xeiro-tri^bi/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
surgical or
medical treatment, xeirotribi/hs a)tremaio/ths Hp.Praec.13.
rubbing, handling, Hippiatr. 33.

xeiro-tu^ph/s, e/s,
struck by the hands, krota/lwn xeirotuph\s pa/tagos AP5.174 (Mel.).

xeirourg-e/w,
do with the hand, execute, diakonh/sasa kai\ xeirourgh/sasa Antipho 1.20; esp. of
acts of violence, neani/skoi, oi(=s e)xrw=nto ei)/ ti/ pou de/oi xeirourgei=n Th.8.69, cf. Aeschin.2.117.
make by hand, build, oi)kodomi/an Ael.NA3.24:—Pass., polla\ gumna/sia e)kexeirou/rghto Pl.Criti.117c.
use as material, work in, e)le/fanta cj. in Ael.NA17.32.
practise an art, esp. of music, a)/|donte/s te kai\ xeirourgou=ntes Arist.Pol.1340b20, cf. 1342a3, Iamb.Comm.Math.26;
produce by art, of hatching eggs by artificial means, D.S.1.74:— Pass.,
to be highly cultivated, of vines, u(po\ th=s a)nqrwpi/nhs e)mpeiri/as Id.3.62;
to be dressed, of meats, Megasth.28. of surgeons,
operate, Hp.Flat.1, Plu.2.71a, Gal.2.228: c. acc.,
operate upon, Sor. 1.4, Artem.4.2:—Pass., o( xeirourghqei\s a)/nqrwpos Gal.10.943. sens. obsc., D.L.6.46.

xeirou/rg-hma, atos, to/,
handiwork, a word used by Gorgias, Pl.Grg.450b, ubi v. Sch.
manufactured article, D.H.Pomp.1.7 xeirourg-hte/on,
one must perform an operation, Antyll. ap.Orib.4.4.7.

xeirourg-hte/os, a, on,
to be operated on, Paul.Aeg.6.21.

xeirourg-i/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
working by hand, practice of a handicraft or
art, skill herein, Ar.Lys.673, etc.; opp. gnw/mh and gnw=sis (theory), Hp. Morb.1.6, Pl.Plt.259 e; opp. cu/nesis, Id.Amat.135b.
ahandicraft or
art, Id.Plt.258d, 277c; tw=n zwgra/fwn . . h( kalh\ x. Anaxandr. 33.1: pl., peri\ te/xnas h)\ xeirourgi/as tina/s Pl.Smp.203a, cf. Grg. 450b. esp.
the art or
practice of surgery, opp. the administration of medicine, xeirourgi/h| xrh=sqai perform
an operation, Hp.Prog. [23]; xeirourgi/hn e)n grafh=| dihgei=sqai
the mode of operation, Id.Art. 33, cf. D.S.5.74, Ph.1.253, Dsc.5.15, Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.7, Sor.1.12, etc.

xeirourg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of technical dexterity, h( x. e)pisth/mh Arist.Pol. 1341b1; ta\ mh\ x. (sc. tw=n texnw=n) Phld.Po.5.2; x. me/ros th=s mousikh=s the
practical part of music, i.e.
execution, Plu.2.1135d.
of or
for surgery, h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh)
surgery, D.L.3.85. Adv. -kw=s Poll.2.148.
worked by hand, to/ca Hero Bel.75.5.

xeirourg-o/s, o/n,
working or
doing by hand, Plu.2.564e:
practising a handicraft or
art, peri\ grafikh/n Ael.NA17.9; oi( x.
artificers, artists, Id.VH14.47, etc.; also x. te/xnai Lib.Or.25.36. xeirourgo/s, o(,
surgeon, Plu.2.486c, Ptol.Tetr.180, Gal.10.455, Artem.4.2, AP11.280 (Pall.).

xeiro/-xwlos, on,
maimed in the hand, Hippon.139.

xeir-o/w, (xei/rwn)
worst, master, subdue, tina\pro\s bi/an xeirou=n Ar.V. 443 (troch.); x. to\n e)le/fanta Ael.NA17.32 (s. v.l.). mostly in Med., fut. -w/somai S.Ph.92, Th.1.122, etc.: aor. e)xeirwsa/mhn Hdt.1.211, Th.3.11, etc.: pf. kexei/rwmai Luc.Salt.79, D.C.50.24 (Pass., v. III):—both of countries or nations, and of single persons,
conquer, overpower, subdue, w(s e)xeirw/santo tou\s e)nanti/ous Hdt. l.c., cf. 2.70, al., E.IT330,359, HF570; to/cois xeirou=sqai A.Ch. 694; ou) ga\r h(ma=s . . pro\s bi/an xeirw/setai S.l.c.; bi/a| x. tou\s e)nanti/ous X.Ages.1.20; x. tina\ sfi/si Th.4.28: sts. with collat. notion of
killing, X.Cyr.7.5.30, Isoc.10.25; also, of
taking prisoner, E.Tr. 861, X.HG2.4.26; th/nd' e)xeirou/mhn a)/gran
became master of this booty, S.OC950. without any sense of violence, x. tina\ lo/gois Pl.Sph.219c, cf. X.Mem.3.7.8; x. qre/mmata
tame them, Pl. Sph.222a; h( o)/rxhsis kexei/rwtai tou\s a)nqrw/pous Luc.l.c.; di' h(donh=s Plu.2.139a; dia\ th=s kolakei/as Ael.VH14.48, etc. Pass.,
to be mastered, conquered, subdued, pro\s bi/an xeirou/menon *tufw=na A.Pr.355, cf. S.Tr.279, E.El.1168: fut. xeirwqh/somai D.11.5: aor. e)xeirw/qhn Hdt.3.120,145, al.; xeirwqei\s bi/a| S.OC903, cf. Tr.1057; xeirwqh=nai sfi/sin Th.8.71: pf. kexei/rwmai Id.5.96; kexeirwme/nas a)/gesqai to be led
captive, A.Th.326 (lyr.); ai)xmalw/tous kex. Pl.Lg. 919a.

xei/r-wma, atos, to/,
that which is subdued, a conquest, dou/lhs qanou/shs, eu)marou=s xeirw/matos A.Ag.1326.
deed of violence, a)/fantos e)/rrei qanasi/mw| x. S.OT560.
a work wrought by the hand, tumboxo/a x., of earth thrown up (v. tumboxo/os), A.Th. 1027.

xei/rwn, o(, h(, neut. xei=ron, gen. -onos, acc. -ona: nom. and acc. pl. xei/rones, -as, xei/rona, contr. in Att. Prose xei/rous, xei/rw; dat. xei/rosi, poet. xeiro/nessi Pi.N.8.22:—(for Ep. form xerei/wn, poet. xeiro/teros, xereio/teros, v. sub vocc.):—irreg. Comp. of kako/s: (xei/rwn from *xer-ywn, cf. xerei/wn): of persons,
mcaner, inferior, either in bodily strength and bravery, or in rank, opp. a)rei/wn, Il.10.238, Od.20.133; su\ me\n e)sqlo\s e)gw\ de\ se/qen polu\ xei/rwn Il.20.434; tou= ge/net' e)k patro\s polu\ xei/ronos ui(o\s a)mei/nwn 15.641, cf. Od.20.82; h)= polu\ xei/rones a)/ndres a)mu/monos a)ndro\s a)/koitin mnw=ntai 21.325; opp. krei/sswn, Pi.I.4(3).34(52); to\n o)/lbion to/n te x. E.Ba.422 (lyr.); ta\ xei/rona S.Fr.192, E.Supp.196. later in moral sense,
worse than others, sts. almost like a positive,
knave, opp. a)gaqo/s, S.Ph.456, cf. Th.3.9, Lys.16.3; oi( pe/nhtes kai\ oi( dhmo/tai kai\ oi( x. X.Ath.1.4, cf. 3.10; oi( x., opp. oi( a)gaqoi/, Pl.R.460c, etc. x. bi/os, opp. a)mei/nwn, ib.618d; gnw/mh X.Cyr.8.8.7.
worse in quality,
inferior, of horses, Il.23.572:
inferior, less skilful, i)htroi/ Hp.Acut.6; zwgra/foi, dhmiourgoi/, etc., Pl.Cra.429a, R.421e, etc.: x. ei)s sofi/an, ei)s th\n a)reth/n, Id.Tht.162c, R.335b; pro\s a)lh/qeian Luc. JTr.48; c. acc., x. ta\ polemika/ X.Cyr.8.8.20; x. th\n yuxh/n, th\n dia/noian, Aeschin.3.46. Isoc.11.43; ta\ a)/lla mhde\n x. Id.4.105; c. inf., x. h(mw=n tau=ta poiei=n X.Cyr.2.1.16; ou)de\n xei/rous e)/sesqe . . a)khkoo/tes you will be none
the worse for having heard . . , D.24.139;
less kind, mh\ x. peri\ h(ma=s au)tou\s ei)=nai . . tw=n u(parxo/ntwn Id.2.2. of things,
inferior in quality, a)/eqlon Il.23.413; u(podh/mata X.Oec. 13.10; o)/noma Pl.Cra.429b.
worse, harder, more severe, no/sos E.Andr.220; moi=ra Pl.Phdr.248e; timwri/a Ep.Hebr.10.29. neut., as a Subst., to\ x.
inferiority, Polem.Call.27; but mostly in phrases with Preps., e)pi\ to\ x. tre/pesqai, kli=nai, fall off, get
worse, X.Cyr.8.8.2, Mem.3.5.13; e)pi\ to\ x. metaba/llei e(auto/n Pl.R. 381b; a)lloiou=sqai e)pi\ to\ x., opp. e)pi\ to\ be/ltion, Thphr.CP6.3.3; also pa/nta u(popteu/ontes e)pi\ to\ x. putting the
worst construction on . . D.H.6.85; lamba/nein ti e)pi\ to\ x. J.AJ16.7.4; also pro\s to\ x. metaba/llein D.S.20.57; kata\ to\ x. Pl.Lg.720e; in the
lower sense, opp. kata\ to\ krei=tton, Dam.Pr.7: less freq. in pl., e)pi\ ta\ xei/rw i)e/nai X. Mem.3.9.9; ta\ x. proairei=sqai Isoc.8.110. as a predicate, a)lla\ soi\ au)tw=| x. (sc. e)sti/ or e)/stai) Od.15.515, cf. X.An.7.6.4; with a neg., ou) x. [e)sti] c. inf., we may
as well, Pl.Phd.105a, Arist. EN1127a14; simply ou) xei=ron, in an answer, it is
as well, Ar.Eq. 37; la/b', w)=ga/q': ou)de\n x. Clearch.Com.4. as Adv.,
worse, x. bouleu/sasqai Th.3.46, cf. 6.89; x. pra=cai Id.7.67; biw=nai, zh=n, Pl. R.344e, 519d.
in inferior degree, less, a)gapa=n Id.Lg.928a; fulaka\s x. fulattome/nas X.HG6.2.17, etc. Sup. xei/ristos, h, on,
worst, Pl.Plt.303a, etc.; o( x., opp. o( be/ltistos, Lys.1.2; esp. oi( x.
men of lowest degrce, X.Mem.1.2.32. Adv. xei/rista Arist.PA687a24, Metaph.1083b2 (dub. 1.); also -tws LXX 2 Ma.7.39.

*xei/rwn, wnos, o(, Aeol. *xe/rrwn Alc.Supp.8.9, Dor. and Thess. *xirwn [i_] IG12(3).360 (Thera), Supp.Epigr.1.248.6 (Thessaly, iv B.C.):—
Cheiron, one of the Centaurs, dikaio/tatos *kentai/rwn Il.11.832; son of Cronus and Philyra, Hes. Th.1001, etc.: teacher of Achilles, Il. l. c., 16.143, 19.390; of Asclepius and Jason, Pi.N.3.53; worshipped as the father of the Art of Medicine, Plu.2.647a: *xei/rwnos u(poqh=kai, title of a poem ascribed to Hes., Quint.Inst.1.1.15, Sch. Pi.P.6.16. *xei/rwnos r(i/za, = pa/nakes to\ *xeirw/neion (v. *xeirw/neios 11, Nic.Th.500.

xeirwn-akte/w,
practise handicraft, Eustr.in EN7.6, Sch.Il.7.435.
xeirwn-a/kths, ou, o(, = xeirw=nac, Zonar.: -akte/wn (gen. pl.) is f.l. in Hp. Acut.44.

xeirwn-aktiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for handicrafts, mechanical, x. kai\ ba/nausoi Pl.Ax.368b, cf. Gal.Protr.14; x. ge/nos D.Chr.12.69; x. te/xnh Gal.17(1).521; x. e)rgasi/a Sch.B Il.18.468.

xei/rwn-ac (properisp.), aktos, o(,
one who is master of his hands (a)/nac tw=n xeirw=n), i.e.
handicraftsman, Hdt.1.93, 2.141, Hp.Acut.8, Art.53, D.H.6.51, Plu.2.802a, etc. as Adj., pa=s o( x. lew/s S.Fr.844. generally,
one who handles, deals in a thing, tw=nde xeirw/naktes . . lo/gwn, i.e.
soothsayers, E.Fr.795.3.

xeirwn-aci/a, Ion. -ih, h(,
handiwork, handicraft, Hdt.2.167 (pl.), A.Pr.45, Ch.761 (pl.), D.Chr.12.82. = sq., PGrenf.2.60.4 (ii A.D.).

xeirwn-a/cion, to/,
a tax paid by handicraftsmen, Arist.Oec.1346a4, PPetr.3p.307 (iii B. C.); PTeb.287.10 (ii A. D.), etc.: pl., POxy.1647.44 (ii A. D.); x. gerdi/wn ib.285.6 (i A. D.).

*xeirw/neios, on,
of or
from Cheiron, X. e(/lkos a sore like
Cheiron's or
needing his aid, a malignant sore, Zen.6.46, Gal.10.1006, Alex.Aphr.Pr.1.92, Hierocl.in CA14p.451M. pa/nakes *xeirw/neion,
elecampane, Inula Helenium, Thphr.HP9.11.1, Plin.HN 25.32.
Cheiron's all-heal, Hypericum olympicum, Dsc.3.50. X. r(i/za, = a)/mpelos a)gri/a,
bryony, Gal.14.186.
*xeirwnia/s, a/dos, h(, = kentau/reion to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.3.6: *xeirw/nios a)/mpelos, = a)/mpelos me/laina, Dsc.4.183; *xeirw/nion, = gentianh/, Ps.-Dsc.3.3.

*xeirwni/s (sc. bi/blos), i/dos, h(, a book
on surgery, AP7.158 (pl.).

xei/r-wsis, ews, h(,
subduing, Pl.Ep.332b, J.AJ18.9.3, D.C.53.7.

xeir-wtiko/s, h/, o/n,
apt at conquering or
subduing, Pl.Sph.219d: h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) the
art of subduing, ib.221b.

xeir-wto/s, h/, o/n,
to be subdued, tameable, Hsch.
furnished with hands, Simp.in Cat. 197.15.
xei/somai, v. xanda/nw 11.

xei/w, Ep. for xe/w,
pour, Hes.Th.83.
xeleu/s, e/ws, o(, = xe/lus, Hsch.
xeli_d-o/neios, on, v. xelido/nios.

xeli_d-o/news, w, h(,
tree which bore the figs called xelido/nia, Anon. (Androt., Phil., or Hegem.) ap.Ath. 3.75d, Choerob. in Theod.1.253 H. (v.l. xelidw/news).

xeli_d-oni/a, h(,
swallow's nest, prob. in Arist.HA626a12.

xeli_d-oniai=os, a, on, = xelido/nios 11, o)/nos Sammelb.6001.5 (ii A. D.); i)xqu=s PLond.1.130.104 (i/ii A. D., horoscope); i([ppa/da] PThead.4.6 (iv A. D.); =
badius, Gloss.; ai( xelidoniai=ai a)spi/des prob. for xelidonai=ai in Aët. 13.22.

xeli_d-oni/as, ou, o(, a kind of
tunny-fish, Diph.Siph. ap. Ath.8.356f. x. i)xqu=s the more northerly fish of the constellation Pisces, Theon ad Arat.242.
the spring wind, because the swallows come with it, Thphr.HP7.15.1, Plin.HN2.122.

xeli_d-oni^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
young swallow, Eust.753.56.

xeli_d-oni/zw,
twitter like a swallow: hence, = barbari/zw (cf. xelidw/n 1), A.Fr. 450.
sing the swallow-song, Thgn.Hist. ap. Ath.8.360c, Eust.1914.43.

xeli_d-o/nion, to/,
celandine, Chelidonium majus, Thphr.HP7.15.1, Ath.15.684e; x. to\ me/ga Dsc.2.180. = a)/mpelos leukh/, Id.4.182. x. to\ mikro/n
pilewort, Ranunculus Ficaria, Id.2.181.
young swallow, Gal.14.386.

xeli_d-o/nios or xeli_d-o/neios, a, on, also os, on Poll.6.81:—
of the swallow, me/los Suid.; x. tei=xos
built by swallows, Thrasyll. ap. Ps.-Plu.Fluv.16.2.
like the swallow, esp.
coloured like the swallow's throat, reddish-brown, russet, i)sxa/des xelido/niai
russet-coloured figs, Philem.Gloss. ap. Ath. 14.652f., cf. Dsc.5.32, Poll.l.c.; x. puro/s Dsc.Eup.1.228; xelido/nia (sc. su=ka) Ar.Fr.569.4 (xelido/neia Epigen.1.2). xelidoni/a, h(, a kind of
gem, Plin.HN37.155;
lapis chelidonius ib.11.203. x. a)spi/s, a kind of
asp, Philum.Ven.16.1, Gal. 14.235, cf. xelidoniai=os. dasu/pous xelido/neios, of the common hare, Diph.1. xelidonei/a ku/lic, name of a kind of cup, IG11(2).154B7 (pl., Delos, iii B.C.), cf. 145.46 (ib., iv. B.C.), Inscr.Delos385a53 (ii B. C.). xelido/nion, to/, an eye-salve, CIL13.10021.93.
xeli_d-oni/s, i/dos, h(, poet. for xelidw/n, AP6.160 (Antip.Sid.): metaph. of a poetess, IG14.1892 (Rome).

xeli_d-onismo/s, o(,
singing of the swallow-song, which the Rhodian boys went about singing at the return of the swallows in the month Boëdromion; such a song is preserved by Ath.8.360c.

xeli_d-onistai/, oi(,
singers of the swallow-song, Hsch.

xeli_d-w/n, o/nos, h( (even of the male, S.E.M.1.151); but masc., metaph. of men, Ion Trag.33, cf. Hdn.Gr.1.25: voc. xelidoi=, as if from a nom. xelidw/, Anacr.67, Simon.74, Ar.Av.1411 (anap.), AP9.70 (Mnasalc., with v.l. xelido/n, as in Anacreont.9.2 cod.):—
swallow, Od.21.411, 22.240, Hes.Op.568, Hdt.2.22, Democr.14, etc.: pe/doikos x. A.Fr.53, cf. Ar.Av.714 (anap): prov., mi/a x. e)/ar ou) poiei= Cratin.33 (cf. Arist.EN1098a18); dei=sqai d' e)/oiken ou)k o)li/gwn x. Ar.Av.1417, cf. 1681; x. leukh/, of a rare event, Thphr.Sign.39; the twittering of the swallow was prov. used of barbarous tongues by the Greeks, ei)/per e)sti\ mh\ xelido/nos di/khn a)gnw=ta fwnh\n ba/rbaron kekthme/nh A.Ag.1050: hence o( x., = o( ba/rbaros, Ion l.c.; *qrh|ki/a x. e)pi\ ba/rbaron e(zome/nh pe/talon Ar.Ra.681 (lyr.); xelido/nwn mousei=a bowers that ring with poetasters'
twitterings, ib.93 (parodied from a)hdo/nwn mousei=a in E., v. Fr.88). metaph. of letters, tw=n sw=n x. ai( h(me/terai plei/ous Lib.Ep.46.2.
flying-fish, Dactylopterus volitans, hirondelle de mer, Ephipp.12.5 (anap.), Speus. ap. Ath.7.324f; x. qala/ttiai Arist.HA535b27.
frog in the hollow of a horse's foot (expld. by Hsch. to\ koi=lon th=s o(plh=s), so called from its being
forked like the swallow's tail, X.Eq. 1.3, 4.5, 6.2, Poll.1.188.
the like part of a dog's foot, Suid. = leixh/n 4, Cael.Aur.TP1.138 (pl.);
a growth on the knee in horses, Sch.Nic.Th.945.
hollow above the bend of the elbow, Hsch.
pudenda muliebria (with play on Ar.Lys.770 (hex.)), Suid., cf. Juv.6.365(6). a kind of
ship, Suid. a Peloponnesian silver coin, Id. (*xelidfw/n as pr.n., IG92(1).86 (Corinthian, found at Thermon); cf. Assyr.
hinundu, Lat.
hirundo.）

xeli/skion, to/,
slight cough, Hp. ap. Gal.19.154.

xe/liskon, to/, = tru/blion,
a dish, Hp. ap. Erot.

xelixelw/nh, h(, a girls' game, in which a ring was formed round a player called xelw/nh, Poll.9.125, Eust.1914.54. The xeli- seems to be merely an iteration of the first syll. in xelw/nh; cf. Carm.Pop. 21 (written xe/lei x. Eust.l.c.).
xellari/hs, ou, o(, a sea-fish, = o)ni/skos, Dorio ap. Ath.3.118c.

xellhstua/rx-as, a, o(,
president of a xellhstu/s, IG12(2).498, al. (Methymna).

xellhstuarx-e/w,
hold such office, ib.515 (ibid.).
xellhstu/s, u/os, h(, = xiliastu/s, at Methymna, IG12(2).498, al.
xe/llioi, oi(, Aeol. for xi/lioi, Hdn.Gr.2.604; cf. disxe/lioi.
xe/llos, to/, Aeol. for xei=los, ib.603. xellu/ssw, v. xelu/ssomai.

xellw/n or xelw/n, w=nos, o(, a kind of
mullet, Mugil chelo, Arist. HA543b15, 570b2, 591a23, Fr.318, Hices. ap. Ath.7.306e; xellw/n （xelmw/n cod.): i)xqu=s poio/s, Hsch.
xelu/drion, to/, Dim. of sq., cj. for xe/ndrion in Gloss.

xe/ludros, o(,
amphibious serpent, Nic.Th.411. a kind of
tortoise, Sch.Lyc.340.

xelu/klonos, on,
resounding with tortoise-shell, fo/rmigc Orph.A. 383 codd. (xeluklo/nou with *(erma/wnos Abel).
xe/lumna, h(, = xelw/nh, dub. in Babr.115.5.
xelu_na/zw, = xleua/zw, fluare/w, Hsch.
xelu/neion [u_], to/, (leg. xelu/nion) Dim. of sq. 2, Hp.Ep.23 codd.

xelu/nh [u_], h(, = xei=los
lip, u(p' o)rgh=s xelu/nhn e)sqi/ein Ar.V.1083 (troch.), Com.Vet. ap. Poll.2.89; Ion.gen. pl. xelune/wn Hsch.
jaw, Ael.NA16.12. = xelw/nh 1.2, Nic.Al.555, 558 cod. *p, cj. in Olymp.in Mete.116.13.

xelu/nion [u_], to/, Dim. (in form only) of foreg. 1.1,
lip, Mitteil. aus d. Papyrussamml. d. Nationalbibl. in Wien 1 (1932).160, Hippiatr. 1. Dim. (in form only) of foreg.1.2,
jaw, Hp.Ep.23 (-eion codd.), Hipparch.2.3.35, J.AJ4.4.4, Hippiatr.34.
cranium, Hipparch.3.2.8. = xelw/nion 1.1, Hsch.: pl., f.l. for xelw/nia 11, LXXDe.34.7 cod.Alex.
xelu/nna, a(, Aeol. for xelw/nh 11.2, Sapph.Oxy.1787 Fr.1 + 2.11, Erinn. in PSI9.1090.42 + 2 (p. xii), 1090.65.

xelu_noi/dhs, ou, o(,
with swollen lips, Com.Adesp.1194, Eust.1684.29.

xelu^osso/os, on, (xe/lus)
stirring, sounding the lyre, Alex.Eph. ap. Theon.Sm.p.139H., Cat.Cod.Astr.1.173.

xe/lus, u^os, h(,
tortoise, h.Merc.33.
lyre (since Hermes made the first lyre by stretching strings on a tortoise's shell, which acted as a sounding-board), ib.25,153, Sapph.45, A.Fr.314; kaq' e(pta/tonon o)rei/an x. E.Alc.448 (lyr.), cf. HF683 (lyr.). the constellation
Lyra, Arat.268.
arched breast, chest, from its like ness of shape to the back of a tortoise, Hp.Anat.1, E.El. 837; cf. xelw/nion 11. [u_ in nom. and acc. sg., h.Merc.33,153; later u^, Call.Ap.16, Arat.268, Opp.H.5.404.] (Cf. OSlav.
žely 'tortoise'.)

xe/lusma, atos, to/,
sheathing like the shell of a tortoise, to protect the lower part of a ship during haulage, Thphr.HP5.7.2.

xelu/ssomai, Ep. xellu/ssomai,
expectorate, (xe/lus 11) Nic.Al. 81, Moer.p.102 P.:—Hsch. cites xelou/ein, = bh/ssein (Lacon. or Boeot.). Act. xellu/ssw, metaph. of a swimmer,
spit out, i.e. the waves, Lyc.727, cf. Sch.ad.loc.
xelu=tis, h(, a name of Artemis at Sparta, Clem.Al.Protr.2.38.5 (said to be from xelu/ssw, = bh/ssw).
xelw/n, w=nos, o(, v. xellw/n.

xelwn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xelw/nh,
inferior tortoise-shell, Peripl. M.Rubr.10.
tail-piece, of the stand of a torsion-engine, Hero Bel.84.8.
xelw/neion, to/, v.l. for xelw/nion in Ael.NA7.16. = kukla/minos, Ps.-Dsc.2.164 (sed leg. xel<id>o/nion).

xelw/n-h, h(,
tortoise, h.Merc.42,48, Orac. ap. Hdt.1.47,48; x. xersai/a (cf. infr.2) Arist.PA671a28: prov. of insensibility, i)w\ xelw=nai maka/riai tou= de/rmatos Ar.V.1292, cf. 429 (lyr.), S.Fr.279, Luc.Vit.Auct.9; of slowness, Plu.2.1082e, Lib.Ep.74.1, etc. pontia\s x.
turtle, Crates Com.29; x. qalassi/a Arist. l.c., cf. 540a29, Ael.VH1.6, Paus. 1.44.8.
tortoise-shell, Ph.2.478.
sounding-board of lyre, Plu.2.1030b.
pent-house or
shed for protecting beseigers, x. culi/nh X.HG3.1.7, cf. Aen.Tact.32.11; x. xwstri/s, used to protect sappers and miners, Plb.9.41.1, 10.31.8, Onos.42.3; kriofo/ros, to cover the battering-ram, D.S.20.48, etc., cf. App.Mith.31. = Lat.
testudo, overlapping shields, D.C.49.30. a kind of
frame or
cradle, on which heavy weights were moved by means of rollers underneath, Hero Mech. 3.1 (vol. ii p.294 Schmidt).
footstool, Polem.Hist.44, Hsch., Suid.
coin bearing the impress of a
tortoise, first coined at Aegina, Poll.9.74, Hsch. pl.,
hillocks, LXXHo.12.11.
tomb with arched roof, JHS10.82 (Patara). a kind of
bandage, Heliod. ap. Orib.48.66 tit., Sor.Fasc.56. part of a surgical machine, from its slow uniform motion, Orib. 49.4.45. = xelw/nion 111, IG11(2).159A26,60 (Delos, iii B. C.).

xelwn-i/a and xelwn-i=tis, idos, h(,
tortoise-stone, name of a gem, Plin.HN37.155.

xelwn-ia/s, a/dos, h(, a kind of
beetle, kanqari/s Hsch.

xelw/n-inos, h, on,
made of tortoise-shell, Edict.Diocl.16.6.

xelw/n-ion, to/,
tortoise-shell, Arist. PA671a32, Resp.479a6 (v.l. xelwnidi/wn), Ael.NA7.16.
crab's shell, Plu.2.400a, Suid.s.v. *tene/dios.
arched part of the back, Poll.2.177: pl.,
muscles of the back, prob. for xelu/nia in LXX De.34.7.
part of a lock, IG11(2).287A46 (Delos, iii B. C.), Inscr.Délos 316.72 (iii B. C.), PTeb.46.17 (ii B. C.), BGU1028.20,26
(ii A. D.), POxy.113.4 (ii A. D.), Theognost.Can.124, Sch.Od.21.47.
arch or
bow for releasing the string of the stomach-bow, Hero Bel.77.11.
knob against which the butt-ends of the arms of a torsion-engine rest, ib.93.7. prob. part of an irrigation machine, PLond.3.1177.179 (ii A. D.); part of a crane in which the axle turns, Vitr.10.2.2, al.

xelwn-i/s, i/dos, h(, = xe/lus 1.2,
lyre, Posidon. 10J. = xelw/nh 111.3,
footstool, Att. and Coan word acc. to S.E.M.1.246.
threshold, LXXJu.14.15, Hsch.

xelwnoeidh/s, e/s,
like a tortoise, Eust.869.24.

xelwno/s, o(,
turtle, Hsch. (Lobeck for xelw=nos).

xelwnofa/gos [a^], on,
eating tortoises, name of an eagle or
Lämmergeier, Hsch.
turtle-eaters, pr. 11. of a people on the Arabian Gulf, Str.16.4.14, D.S.3.21, etc.; on the Indian Ocean and Persian Gulf, Plin.HN6.109, cf. 9.38, etc.

xelw/tra, h(,
stillicidium, Gloss.

xe/nnion, to/,
quail (Egyptian
chennu), salted and eaten by the Egyptians, PSI4.428.21, 7.862.11 (iii B. C.), Hipparch.Epic. ap. Ath. 9.393c, AP9.377 (Pall.), PLond.2.239.12 (iv A. D.). a kind of
fish, Hsch.

xeno/siris, o(, Egyptian name of
ivy, Plu.2.365e.

xe/ra^dos, eos, to/,
silt, gravel, and rubbish, brought down by torrents, a(/lis xe/rados perixeu/as Il.21.319; mh\ ki/nh xe/rados Sapph. 114, cf. Alc.105 Lobel, Pi.P.6.13, A.R.1.1123; xera/des (pl.) is given by Hsch., xera/das is f.l. in Sapph. l.c. (ap.EM808.39), and so xera/di (for xera/dei) in Pi. l.c., and xera/dos (for xe/rados) in A.R. l.c.; xe/rados is confirmed by Sch.Il.l.c., Apollon.
Lex., EM808.40.
xera/rios, o(, a public officer at Ilium, perh. (from xei/r) = xeirono/mos (q.v.), CIG3620, 3621.
xerdamo/s: li/qos plhrw=n th\n xei=ra, Hsch. (i.e. xerma/dios).
xe/reia, v. xerei/wn.
xereio/teros, h, on, Ep. Comp. for sq., Il.2.248, 12.270, AP7.371 (Crin.), Q.S.5.555.

xerei/wn, o(, h(, gen. onos, nom. pl. xerei/ous A.R.2.1220:—Ep. for xei/rwn,
meaner, inferior, in rank, worth, or wealth, kei=nos de\ xerei/onos e)k qeou= e)stin Il.20.106, cf. Od.20.45; ta\ xerei/ona nika=| Il.1.576; xerei/ona/ per katapefnw/n 17.539; in body or mind, e)pei\ ou)/ e(qe/n e)sti x., ou) de/mas ou)de\ fuh/n, ou)/t' a)\r fre/nas ou)/te ti e)/rga 1.114, cf. Od. 5.211; rare in Prose, a)/rxesqai u(po\ xerei/onos Democr.49; opp. ka/rrwn, Aesar. ap. Stob.1.49.27. of things, ou)/ ti xe/reion e)n w(/rh| dei=pnon e(le/sqai 'tis not
the worse part, 'twere not
amiss, Od.17.176, cf. 23.262. irreg. forms, dat. xe/rhi+, acc. xe/reia, nom. pl. xe/rhes, acc. neut. xe/reia, all used in compar. sense, krei/sswn ga\r basileu/s, o(/te xw/setai a)ndri\ xe/rhi+ with a man
of meaner rank, Il.1.80; oi(=a/ te toi=s a)gaqoi=si paradrw/wsi xe/rhes Od.15.324; e)sqla/ te kai\ ta\ xe/reia 18.229, 20.310; e)sqla\ me\n e)sqlo\s e)/dune, xe/reia de\ xei/roni do/skon, where e)sqla\ e)sqlo/s and xe/reia xei/roni are evidently correlative, Il.14.382; c. gen., ui(o\n . . ei(=o xe/reia ma/xh|, a)gorh=| de\ a)mei/nw 4.400; ou)/ ti xe/reia patro/s Od.14.176.—xe/reia was written by Aristarch. in Od.14.176, where codd. have xerei/w （xe/rh|a Eust.488.38).
xe/ressi, Ep. dat. pl. of xei/r, Hes.Th.519.

xeri^a/rhs [a^], ou, o(,
skilled in fitting with the hand, dexterous, te/ktones Pi.P.5.35.

xe/rion, to/, Dim. of xei/r, Sor.1.84, Paul.Age.6.74.
small handle, HeroAut.24.3.

xeri^fu_rh/s, e/s,
mixed or
kneaded by hand, AP6.251 (Phil.).
xe/rma, atos, to/, = xa/lic, Hsch.; of the upper stone in an olivepress, Q.S.14.263 (s. v.l.).

xerm-a/dion [a^], to/,
large stone, boulder, such as were used for missiles by the heroes of the Il., o)krio/en 4.518; mega/la 11.265, cf. 14.410; o( de\ xerma/dion la/be xeiri\ . . , me/ga e)/rgon, o(\ ou) du/o g' a)/ndre fe/roien 5.302, 20.285; twice in Od., a)ndraxqe/si xermadi/oisi ba/llon, of the Laestrygones, 10.121, cf. 21.371. = xerma/s 1, Aen. Tact.38.6.—Not a Dim. of xerma/s, but neut. of an Adj. xerma/dios, on,
of the shape or
size of a xerma/s, molu/bdainai xerma/dioi leaden balls
for arm-exercises, Luc.Lex.5.

xerm-a/zw,
clear a field of stones, Hsch. s.v. e)xerma/zomen.

xerm-a/s, a/dos, h(,
large pebble or
stone, esp. for throwing or slinging,
sling-stone, thlebo/los Pi.P.3.49; o)krio/essa A.Th.300 (lyr.); kratai/bolos E.Ba.1096: of
pebbles on the seabeach, A.R.2.695 (cf. sti/a), AP7.693 (Apollonid.); also in later Prose, D.H.9.21, al. in later Poets,
large block of stone, Lyc.20,616, AP7.371 (Crin.).

xerm-asth/r, h=ros, o(,
slinger, r(ino\s x. the leather
of a sling, out of which the stone was thrown, <*>b.172 (Antip.Sid.), cf. Suid.

xerm-a/ths [a_], ou, o(,
slinger, D.H.20. <*>

xe/rna, h(,
poverty, Hsch.; also xe/rnh, h(, Sch.Orib.inc.22(6).13.
*xe/rna_sos, prob. = *xerro/nhsos, *xerso/nhsos, e)g *xerna/sois Docum. <*>nt. dell' Africa Italiana ii Cirenaica94.

xern-h/s, h=tos, Dor. xerna/s, a=tos, o(,
poor, needy, e)n xernh=si do/mois <*>El.207 (lyr.); xernh=ta bi/on AP6.39 (Arch.); with fem. Subst., <*>nh\ x. Gal. ap. Orib.inc.22(6).13; xe/rnhs Hsch., but xernh/s Hdn. <*>.1.64; fem. xernh=ssa ib.1.250. (Acc. to Hsch. from xe/rna, <*>
verty: but acc. to Arist.Pol.1277a38 o( zw=n a)po\ tw=n xeirw=n.）
xern-h/ths, <*> o(, = xernh/s, A.Pr.893 (lyr.), D.H.7.11, S.E.M.2.105, Ael.Fr.342; <*>dro\s xernh/tew Simon.124A.

xern-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or for a day<*>ourer: to\ x. the
proletariate, Arist.Pol.1291b25.

xern-h=tis, idos, <*> of xernh/ths,
a woman that spins for daily hire, gunh\ x. Il.12. <*>, Parth.27.1, Cels. ap. OrigenesCels.1.28; grhu\+s x. AP6.203 (Lacon. or Phil.): abs., ib.9.276 (Crin.), cf. Ael.Fr.343.
xern-h/twr, oros, o(, poet. for xernh/ths, Man.4.114.

xerni^b-ei=on, to/,
vessel for water to wash the hands, basin, to\ x. prw=ton, h( pomph\ safh/s Antiph.66, cf. IG22.1400.41, al., Michel832.46 (pl., Samos, iv B. C.).

xerni^/b-ion, to/, Dim. of sq., Ar.Fr.316, And. 4.29 (cf. Ath.9.408c, wrongly citing Lys.).
chamber-pot, Hp.Epid.7.83.
xe/rni^b-on, to/, = xernibei=on, Il.24.304, IG11(2).144A32 (Delos, iv B. C.), cf. Hdn.Gr.1.378: pl. xe/rniba Philostr.Im.2.23.

xerni^bo/ceston, to/,
wash-basin, Stud.Pal.20.151.10 (vi A. D.), prob. in Gloss.

xe/rnimma, atos, to/,
washing of the hands, Philonid.14.

xerni/ptomai, fut. -yomai E.IT622: Med.: (xei/r, ni/zw):—
wash one's hands with holy water, esp. before sacrifice, xerni/yanto d' e)/peita Il.1.449; au)to/s ge xerni/ptou Ar.Pax961; e)xerni/yato e)k th=s i(era=s xe/rnibos Lys.6.52.
sprinkle with holy water, purify or
dedicate thereby, xai/thn E.l.c. Act. xerni/ptw,
sacrifice, only Lyc.184:—aor. Pass. xernifqei/s
dedicated, AP6.156 (Theodorid.).

xerni/ths [i_], ou, o(,
a kind of white marble, Thphr.Lap.6, Plin.HN 36.132.

xe/rniy, h(, used by Hom. (only in Od., v. infr.) always in acc. xe/rniba; later in nom., A.Eu.656; gen. xe/rnibos S.Fr.1127.7, Ar. Lys.1129, Lys.6.52, D.20.158; dat. xe/rnibi Ar.Av.897 (lyr.), Th.4.97; pl., freq. in Trag. (v. infr. 2); poet. dat. xerni/bessin Simon.44: (xei/r, ni/zw):—
water for washing the hands, before meals, Od.1.136, 3.440, 4.52, etc.: esp. of holy water used before sacrifices, 3.445, Ar.Av.850, Lys.1129; u(/dwr, o(\ h)=n a)/yauston sfi/si, plh\n pro\s ta\ i(era\ xe/rnibi xrh=sqai Th. l.c., ei)/rgesqai xe/rnibos D. l.c. freq. in pl. xe/rnibes,
purifications with holy water, Simon.45, E.Or.1602 Ph.662 (lyr.), etc.; xe/rnibas ne/mein allow
the use of holy water, S.OT240; koinwno\s xerni/bwn a partaker
therein, i.e. an inmate of the same house or companion at table, A.Ag.1037; ei)s i(e/r' ei)sio/nta kai\ xerni/bwn kai\ kanw=n a(yo/menon D.22.78, cf. E.IA675, 1479 (lyr.), IT58, 244, 335; proxu/tas xe/rniba/s t' e)na/rcetai Id.IA 955; used before entering the house after a funeral, Id.Alc.100 (lyr., sg.). rarely of
libations to the dead, A.Ch.129. (On the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.246.)

xero-ke/nws, Adv.
with empty hands, LXX 1 Ch.12.33.

xero-mu^sh/s, e/s,
defiling the hand, fo/nos A.Ch.73 (lyr.).
xero/-nhsos, h(, poet. for xerso/nhsos, A.R.1.925, IG12(5).1076.98 (Ceos), D.H.Comp. 25.
xero/-niptron, to/, = xeiro/niptron, Eust.1351.53.
xero-plhqh/s, e/s, poet. for xeiroplhqh/s, Nic.Th.94.

xero/-plhktos, on,
struck by the hand, xero/plhktoi . . dou=poi the sound
of beating with the hand, S.Aj. 632 (lyr., leg. -plaktoi).
xerro/nhsos, h(, Att. for xerso/nhsos, also OGI330.4 (Thyatira, ii B. C.): for all words formed from it, v. xers-; for xe/rros, v. xe/rsos.

xers-a/broxos, h( (sc. gh=),
uninundated land, PRyl.207（
a).30 (ii A.D.)

xers-ai=os, a, on, also os, on Lyc.534: (xe/rsos):—
from or
of dry land, living or
found thereon, o)/rniqes x., opp. limnai=oi, Hdt.7.119; kroko/deiloi Id.4.192; zw=|a x., opp. qala/ssia, peteina/, Id.2.123, cf. Pl. Ti.40a; xelw/nh x., opp. qalassi/a, v. xelw/nh; mu/es x., Arist.Mir. 842b7; o)/feis, opp. qala/ttiai, Id.HA505b9; h( x. (sc. qh/ra)
hunting of land-animals, opp. fishing, Pl.Sph.223b, cf. AP9.14 (Antiphil.); of
landsmen, opp. seamen, E.Andr.457, Th.7.67; x. paraskeuh/, opp. nautikh/, Ascl.Tact.1.1; x. po/lis
an inland city, opp. seaport (e)piqalatti/dios), Pl.Lg.704b; o(doi\ x., opp. voyages, AP11.42 (Crin.), cf. 4.3b.46 (Agath.):
travelling by land, bradu\s kai\ x. *)/erws Plu.2.750b; ku=ma stratou=, opp. a fleet, A.Th.64: neut. pl. as Adv., Arat. 919. h( xersai=os, as Subst., = xerso/nhsos, Lyc.534.

xers-a/lmh, h(,
barren land covered with a crust of salt, PHamb.12.9 (iii A. D.).

xe/rs-ammos, h(,
sandy waste, POxy.988 (iii A. D.).

xers-a/mpelos, h( (sc. xw/ra),
dry vineland, ib.506.25 (ii A. D.), 729.30 (ii A. D.).

xers-a/nippos, o(,
unmounted desert-guard, PSI4.399 (iii B. C.).

xers-a/ra^kos [a^r], h( (sc. gh=),
inferior land planted with a)/rakos, PHib.1.130 (iii B. C.).

xers-a/sporos, h( (sc. gh=),
land not worth sowing, PCair. Preis.47.7,9 (iv A. D.).

xers-ei/a, h(,
uncultivated state, Hsch.; written xersi/a, CPR233.7 (iv A. D.).

xers-eu/w, intr.,
abide on dry land, live or
lie thereon, S.Fr.321, E.Fr.636, Plu.2.982b.
to be dry land, opp. e)/nudros ei)=nai, Arist.Mete.352a23.
lie waste or
barren, X.Oec. 5.17, 16.5. Pass.,
to be left as dry land, opp. plwta\ ei)=nai, Arist.Mete.353a25 (v.l. -eu/ei).
make or
leave barren, PTeb.61 (
b).114, 74.29 (ii B. C.):—Pass.,
to be made, become barren, Plu.2.2d, Epist.Philipp. in IG9(2).517.30 (Larissa, iii B. C.), PTeb.61（
b).144, 202, al. (ii B. C.), BGU1120.31 (i B. C.), etc.

xers-e/fippos, o(,
mounted desert-guard, PTeb.62.34 (ii B. C.).
xers-i/a, v. xersei/a.
xe/rs-i^nos, h, on, = xersai=os, of tortoises, Plin.HN9.38.

xers-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, perh.
cultivator of waste land, PPetr.2p.110 (iii B. C.).

xerso/-bi^os, on,
living on dry land, opp. limno/bios, Philum.Ven. 36.1.

xe/rso-qen, Adv.
from dry land, opp. sea, E.Heracl.429, Hel. 1269.
from the ground, opp. water, Pi.O.2.73.

xe/rso-qi^, Adv.
on dry land, AP9.105.

xerso-qru/i+on [u^], to/, (qru/on)
land overgrown with rushes, Ostr.1224.
xerso-qru^i=tis, idos, h( (sc. gh=), = foreg., POxy.1347 (iii A. D.).

xersokop-e/w,
break up unirrigated land, PTeb.105.18 (ii B. C.).

xersokop-i/a, h(,
breaking up of unirrigated land, ib.20.

xerso/kop-os (parox.), o(,
worker on unirrigated land, BGU1527.1 (iii B. C.).

xe/rsonde, Adv.
to or
on dry land, Il.21.238, h.Ap.28, Alcm.6, Theoc.16.61.

xersonhs-i/zw, later Att. xerr-,
form a peninsula, Plb.1.73.4,
10.10.5: xerronhsia/zw is read in Str.11.14.6 and is v.l. Id.2.5.29, 11.1.5.

xersonh/s-ios, later xerr-, a, on,
peninsular, Hsch.
of the Thracian Chersonese, E.Hec.8,33, al. *xersonh/sia, ta/, festival at Delos, Inscr.Délos353B45, 366A132 (iii B. C.). xersonh/sion, to/,
revenue from the xerso/nhsos (a domain of the Delian temple), ib.354.22, al. (iii B. C.).

xersonhs-i/ths [i_], later xerr-, ou, o(,
dweller in the Thracian Chersonese, X.HG1.3.10, 3.2.8, D.5.25.

xersonhs-oeidh/s, later xerr-, e/s,
peninsular, Hdt.7.22, Str.9.1.9; sko/pelos, of Circeii, D.H.4.63.

xerso/nhs-os, h(, later xerro/nhsos, poet. xero/nhsos (q. v.), Dor. xerso/na_sos SIG709.52 (ii B. C.), xe/rnasos (q. v.):—
peninsula, Hdt. 4.12, Th.6.97, Str.16.2.10, Plu.Pyrrh.6, etc.
island with a bridge to it, Paus.5.24.1. as pr. n., of various peninsulas, esp.
the Chersonese, i.e. the peninsula of Thrace that runs along the Hellespont, Hdt.6.33. the
Tauric Chersonese or
Crimea, Id.4.99, etc. the peninsula between Epidaurus and Troezen, Th.4.42.
xersonhs-w/dhs, es, later xerr-, = xersonhsoeidh/s, Str.14.6.3.

xersonomh/, h(, in pl.,
waste land used as pasture, PTeb.74.22 (ii B.C., prob.), Sammelb.5172.5.

xe/rsos, later Att. xe/rros, h(,
dry land, opp. water, e)pi\ xe/rsou, opp. e)n po/ntw|, Od.10.459, cf. 15.495; ku/mata makra\ kulindo/mena proti\ xe/rson 9.147; la/i+ggas poti\ x. a)poplu/neske qa/lassa 6.95; ku=ma . . boa/a| poti\ x. Il.14.394; ku=ma . . xe/rsw| r(hgnu/menon mega/la bre/mei 4.425; xe/rson i(ke/sqai Od.9.486, 542; e)pi\ xe/rsw Sapph.Supp.9.10; kata\ xe/rson A.Pers.873 (lyr.), E.IT884 (lyr.); xe/rsw|
on or
by land, A.Pers.977 (lyr.), Ag.558, E.Hel.1066: prov., e)n po/ntw| na=es, e)nxe/rsw| po/lemoi Pi.O.12.4, cf. N.1.62; polla\ . . e)k qala/sshs, polla\ d' e)k xe/rsou kaka\ gi/gnetai A.Pers.707 (troch.); pa/ndokon ei)s a)fanh= te x., of the realm of Hades, Id.Th.860(lyr.).—In Hom. the gender cannot be determined, fem. Pi.Fr.75.17 (dub.l.), A.Supp.31 (anap.), Thphr.CP3.13.3, D.S.3.15, etc.: pl., e)n tai=s xe/rsois on
barren soils, Thphr.HP8.6.4. after Hom. as Adj., xe/rsos, on,
dry, firm, of land, Hdt.2.99; *eu)rw/pan poti\ xe/rson to
the mainland of Europe, Pi. N.4.70; e)n koni/a| xe/rsw|, opp. po/ntw|, ib.9.43.
dry, hard, barren, th=s xw/rhs e)ou/shs x. Hdt.4.123; stu/flos de\ gh= kai\ x. S.Ant.251; paradou=nai [th\n gh=n] xe/rron, i.e. yilh/n,
without a crop on it, IG22.2492.16; x. kai\ a)/kanqa e)/stai h( gh= LXX Is.7.24; xe/rsa
waste places, A.Fr.189; x. limh/n a harbour
left dry, AP9.427 (Barb.): freq. in Pap., PAmh.2.31.12 (ii B. C.), etc. metaph.,
barren, of women, xe/rsous fqarh=nai ka)ga/mous S.OT1502. c. gen.,
barren of, pura\ xe/rsos a)glai+s ma/twn E.El.325. (Cf. Skt.
hár[snull ]ate 'become stiff, bristle', Avest.
zarštva- 'stone', Lat.
horreo.）

xers-o/w,
make into dry land, Tz.H.2.27;
make dry and barren, BGU195.19 (ii A. D.):—Pass.,
to be left dry and barren, gh= kexerswme/nh Plu.2.10d, LXXPr.24.46 (31), PTeb.5.94 (ii B. C.), cf. IGRom.4.147 (Cyzicus).

xe/rs-udros, o(,
an amphibious serpent, Nic.Th.359, Androm. ap. Gal.14.34, Philum.Ven.24.1.

xers-w/dhs, es,
barren, of land, PLond.5.1674.30 (vi A. D.); =
dumosus, Gloss.

xeru/drion, to/, Dim. of xei/r,
little hand or
arm, Mosch.1.13.
xesa=s, a=ntos, o(, = xezhtiw=n, Poll.5.91, Sch.Ar.Av.791, Suid.
xesei/w, Desiderat. of xe/zw, Ar.Eq.888, Nu.295 (anap.).

xesi^fwne/w,
use filthy language, prob. for xqesi- in Hsch., Suid.

xe/sma, atos, to/,
excrement, Heras ap.Gal.12.939,942, Gloss.
xeu=a, xeu=an, xeu=e, v. xe/w.

xeu=ma, atos, to/, (xe/w)
that which is poured, stream, x. kassite/roio
stream of molten tin, Il.23.561; x. qala/sshs A.Fr.192.2 (anap.); po/ntou E.Fr.316.2, Trag.Adesp.157; pota/mion x. u(da/twn E.Hel.1304 (lyr.); x. *)erasi/nou A.Supp.1020(lyr.), cf. Eu.293; x. a)kh/raton pure
spring water, S.OC471; even staqero\n x. standing
water, A.Fr.276; also a)/nemo/s e)stin h)e/ros r(eu=ma kai\ x. Hp.Flat.3: pl.,
streams, *skama/ndrou Pi.N.9.39, cf. A.Supp.1028 (lyr.), E.Ph.793 (lyr.). generally, x. nifetoi=o
fall of snow, Nonn.D.3.213, cf. 210. metaph.,
stream, flow, eu)/mousa x. AP9.661 (Jul.Aeg.): of language, Longin.13.1. pl.,
cast vessels, bowls, xeu/mata a)rgu/rea kuklotere/a Hdt.1.51, cf. Poll.10.82.
xeu/w, v. sq.

xe/w, used in the simple form mostly by Poets, but v. e)g-, kata-, sug-xe/w; -eei is not contr. by Ep., v. Il.6.147, 9.15, Hes.Op.421; but in Trag. and Att. always so, e)k-xei=, sug-xei=s, kata-xei=n, S.El. 1291, E.IA37 (anap.), Ar.Eq.1091 (hex.); for -ee no rule is observed, impf. xe/e Il.23.220; but su/g-xei 9.612, 13.808, xei=sqai Od.10.518; kat-e/xee Ar.Nu.74, D.45.74; e)n-e/xei, e)n-e/xeis, e)c-e/xei, Antipho 1.19, Ar.Pl.1021, A.Ag.1029 (lyr.):— -e/h|, -e/o, -e/ou, -e/w seem never to have been contracted, exc. e)gxeu=nta Theoc.10.53:— fut. xe/w （e)k-xew= acc. to Choerob. in Theod.2.168 H., but this is Hellenistic, LXX Je.6.11, al., e)k-xeei=s ib.Ex.4.9, e)k-xeei=ib.Le.4.18,25, e)k-xeei=te ib.De.12.16,24, e)k-xeou=si ib.Le.4.12, pros-xeei=s ib.Ex. 29.16, al., and the Med. xeo/menos (v. infr.) points to Att. xe/w）, sug- E.Fr.384, e)pi-xei=s Ar.Pax169 (anap.); para-xe/wn Pl.Com. 69.3; Ep. fut. xeu/w Od.2.222 (xreiw/ Aristarch., whence xei/w Porson): aor. e)/xea Il.18.347, Pi.I.8(7).64, etc.; Ep. e)/xeua Il.3.270, 4.269, xeu=a 14.436, Od.4.584, etc.; Ep. aor. 1 subj. xeu/omen Il.7.336 (late e)/xeusa AP14.124 (Metrod.)): pf. ke/xu^ka, （e)k-) Men.915, APl.4.242 (Eryc.):—Med., fut. Att. xeo/menos Is.6.51: aor. e)xea/mhn Hdt.7.43, A.Pers.220 (troch.), S.OC477, Ar.V.1020 (anap.); Ep. e)xeua/mhn, xeua/mhn, Il.5.314, 18.24, etc.; Ep. subj. xeu/etai （peri-) Od.6.232 (perh. indic.):—Pass., fut. xu^qh/somai （sug-) D.23.62, cf. J.AJ8.8.5: later xeqh/somai, （e)k-) Arr.Epict.4.10.26:—aor. 1 e)xu/qhn [u^] Od.19.590, etc.: later e)xe/qhn, not in Inscrr. or Pap., f.l. in Ph.1.455, Euc.Catoptr.Prooem. (vii p.286 H., e)g-, e)k-), etc.: also Ep. aor. xu/to [u^] Il.23.385, Od.7.143; e)c-e/xu^to 19.470; e)/xunto, xu/nto, 10.415, Il.4.526; part. xu/menos, h, on, 19.284, Od.8.527, and Trag. in lyr., A.Ch.401, Eu.263, E.Heracl.76: pf. ke/xu^mai Il.5.141, Sapph. Supp.25.12, Pi.I.1.4, etc.: plpf. Ep. ke/xu^to Il.5.696, etc.—Ep. pres. xei/w, Hes.Th.83; later Ep. pres. xeu/w both in the simple Verb and compds., Nic.Al.381, Lyr.Alex.Adesp.35.19 (fort. Mesom.), Nonn. D.18.344, Opp.C.2.127:—Med., xeu/omai A.R.2.926: in later Prose pres. xu/nw (q.v.); xu=sai is f.l. for lu=sai in codd. dett. of Tryph. 205.—Rare in Prose, exc. in compds. and in Med. Radic. sense,
pour: prop. of liquids,
pour out, let flow, krh/nh kat' ai)gi/lipos pe/trhs xe/ei u(/dwr Il.9.15; basileu=sin u(/dwr e)pi\ xei=ras e)/xeuan 3.270, cf. Od.1.146, etc.; oi)=non xama/dis xe/e Il.23.220; kata\ sto/matos ne/ktar Theoc.7.82: xe/ei u(/dwr, of Zeus, i.e. makes it rain, Il.16.385; o(/tan bore/as xio/na . . xe/h| E.Cyc.328: abs., xe/ei it
snows, Il.12.281 (neife/men is in l. 280): freq. of drink-offerings, xe/ousa xoa/s A.Ch.87:—Med., xoh\n xei=sqai neku/essi Od.10.518; xoh\n xeo/mhn neku/essi 11.26; xoa\s xe/asqai Hdt.7.43, etc.: abs., Is.6.51,65:—Pass., ke/xutai Il.12.284; krh=nai xe/ontai they
gush forth, E.Hipp.748 (lyr.); potou= xuqe/ntos e)s gh=n S.Tr.704; xe/esqai boutu/rw|, ga/lakti
to flow with . . , LXX Jb.29.6. x. da/krua
shed tears, da/krua qerma\ xe/ontes Il.7.426, cf. 16.3, E.Tr.38; a)p' o)fqalmw=n Id.Cyc.405:—Med., o(/sa sw/mata xei=tai Pl.Ti.83e:—Pass., of tears,
flow, da/krua qerma\ xe/onto Od.4.523; a)p' o)fqalmw=n xu/to da/krua Il.23.385; of blood,
to be shed, drip, foni/as stago/nas xume/nas e)s pe/don A.Ch.401 (anap.), cf. Eu.263 (lyr.).
smelt metal, LXX Ma.3.3.
cast, of bronze statues, SIG3g (Susa, from Didyma, vi (?) B.C.). Pass.,
become liquid, melt, dissolve, ta\ kexume/na, opp. ta\ sunestw=ta, Pl.Ti.66c; of the ground in spring, X.Oec.16.12, Thphr.CP3.4.4; kexume/noi o)fqalmoi/ perh.
moist, languishing eyes, Heph.Astr.1.1. of solids,
shed, scatter, fu/lla a)/nemos xama/dis xe/ei Il.6.147; ku=ma fu=kos e)/xeuen 9.7; ptera\ e)/raze Od. 15.527; e)n . . a)/lfita x. doroi=sin
pour into . . , 2.354; [kre/a] ei)n e)leoi=sin Il.9.215; ko/nin ka\k kefalh=s 18.24, Od.24.317; kala/mhn xqoni/, of a mower or reaper, Il.19.222:—Pass., e)n na/sw| ke/xutai spe/rma Pi.P. 4.42; pa/gou xuqe/ntos when the frost
was on the ground, S. Ph.293; ke/xutai no/sos
has spread through his frame, Id.Tr.853 (lyr.).
throw up earth, so as to form a mound, sh=m' e)/xean Il.24.799; xeu/antes de\ to\ sh=ma ib.801, cf. Od.1.291; tu/mbon x. Il.7.336, etc.; qano/nti xuth\n e)pi\ gai=an e)/xeuan Od.3.258, cf. Il.23.256. x. dou/rata
shower spears, 5.618:—Med., be/lea xe/onto they
showered their darts, 8.159.
let fall, drop, kata\ d' h(ni/a xeu=en e)/raze 17.619; ei)/data e)/raze Od.22.20; a)po\ krato\s xe/e (v.l. for ba/le） de/smata Il.22.468; kro/kou bafa\s e)s pe/don xe/ousa A.Ag.239 (lyr.) (but karpo\n x., of trees, not
to shed their fruit, but
to let it
hang down in profusion, Od.11.588):—Pass., plo/kamos ge/nun par' au)th\n kexume/nos
streaming down, falling, E.Ba.456. in Pass.,
to be heaped up, massed together, [i)xqu/es] e)pi\ yama/qoisi ke/xuntai Od. 22.387, cf. 389; of dead geese, 19.539; of dung, 17.298, Il.23.775; also swro\n si/tou kexume/non Hdt.1.22. Pass., of living beings,
stream in a dense throng, Il.16.267, etc.; dakruo/entes e)/xunto Od.10.415, etc.: of sheep, Il.5.141. of persons, a)mf' au)tw=| xume/nh
throwing herself around him, 19.284, Od.8.527:—Med., a)mfi\ fi/lon ui(o\n e)xeu/ato ph/xee Il.5.314:—Pass., of things, a)mfi\ de\ desmoi\ texnh/entes e)/xunto Od.8.297. pf. Pass. ke/xumai,
to be wholly engaged or
absorbed in, *da=los, e)n a(=| ke/xumai Pi.I.1.4; kexume/nos e)s ta)frodi/sia, Lat.
effusus in Venerem, Luc.Sacr.5; pro\s h(donh/n Alciphr.1.6. of impalpable things: of the voice, fwnh/n, au)dh\n x., Od.19.521, Hes.Sc.396, cf. Th.83; e)pi\ qrh=non e)/xean Pi.I. 8(7).64; *(ella/dos fqo/ggon xe/ousa A.Th.73, cf. Supp.632 (lyr.), Fr.36 (lyr.); of wind instruments, pneu=ma xe/wn e)n au)loi=s Simon. 148.8, cf. APl.4.226 (Alc.):—Med., kwmw|dika\ polla\ xe/asqai Ar.V. 1020 (anap.):—but in Pass., kexume/na a)/|smata
non-rhythmical melodies, Aristid.Quint.1.13. ka\k kefalh=s xeu=en polu\ ka/llos Od.23.156; do/lon peri\ de/mnia xeu=en 8.282. of things that obscure the sight, kat' o)fqalmw=n xe/en a)xlu/n
shed a dark cloud over the eyes, Il.20.321; pollh\n h)e/ra xeu=e
shed a mist abroad, Od.7.15, etc. (so eu)/kratos a)h\r xei=tai Pl.Ax.371d); tw=| d' u(/pnon a)ph/mona/ te liaro/n te xeu/h| e)pi\ blefa/roisin Il.14.165, cf. Od.2.395, etc.:— Pass., a)mfi\ de/ oi( qa/natos xu/to
