was shed around him, Il.13.544; kat' o)fqalmw=n ke/xut' a)xlu/s 5.696; nu/c Hes.Th.727 (but pa/lin xu/to a)h/r the mist
dissolved or
vanished, Od.7.143); ou)/ ke/ moi u(/pnos e)pi\ blefa/roisi xuqei/h 19.590; e)xeu/ato po/nton e)/pi fri/c (Med. in pass. sense) Il.7.63. aor. Pass., e)xu/qh oi( qumo/s his mind
overflowed with joy, A.R.3.1009. Pass.,
to be dissipated, diffused, Plot. 1.4.10; ou)de\n tou= xei=sqai dehqe/n Id.6.5.3;
to be rarefied, opp. pilei=sqai, Gal.15.28. (Cf. Skt.
juhóti 'pour (sacrificial offerings)', part.
hutás (= xuto/s), Lat.
fundo, Goth.
giutan 'pour'.)
xhlamo/s, late form of xhramo/s, Eust.1248.53.

xhlargo/s, Dor. xa_l-, o/n, (xhlh/)
with fleet hoofs, x. a(/millai the racing
of fleet horses, S.El.861 (lyr.).
xhl-a=s, o(, = r(a/pths, ple/kths, Hsch.

xh/l-euma, atos, to/,
awl, S.Fr. 486, Poll.7.83,10.141, Hsch.

xhl-euto/s, h/, o/n,
netted, plaited, kra/nea Hdt.7.89, cf. Poll.7.83.

xhl-eu/w, (xhlh/ 111.5)
net, plait, Eup.388, Hsch. Pass., kexh/leumai po/das
I have my feet
stitched together, Trag.Adesp.220.

xhl-h/, Dor. xa_la/, h(,
horse's hoof, Hes.Sc.62, E.Ph. 42, Ion1242 (lyr.), cf. xhlargo/s. of oxen and the like ,
cloven hoof, xhlai\ podw=n Id.Ba.619 (troch.), cf. A.R.2.667; ta\ de\ disxidh= kai\ a)nti\ tw=n o)nu/xwn xhla\s e)/xei Arist.HA499b9, cf. PA655b4, 663a29; of
Chimaera, E.El.474 (lyr.). crab's
claw, Arist.HA527b5, PA 684a27; o(/ ti a)\n la/bh|, prosa/getai pro\s to\ sto/ma th=| dikro/a| xhlh=| kaqa/per oi( karki/noi Id.HA590b25: hence, Astron., *xhlai/, ai(, the
claws of the Scorpion, i.e. the constellation
Libra, Arat.89, 232, al., Ptol.Tetr.24, etc. poet. pl.,
talons of a bird, A.Pers. 208, S.Ant.1003, E.Ion1208; of the Sphinx, Id.Ph.808 (lyr.), 1025 (lyr.); of a wolf's
claws, Theoc.Ep.6.4, cf. E.Hec.90 (lyr., expld. by Hsch. = gna/qos).
breakwater, formed of stones laid at the base of a sea-wall, mostly in pl., Th.1.63 (ubi v. Sch.), 7.53, X.An.7.1.17; ai( x. tou= lime/nos D.S.13.78, cf. D.C.74.10; sg., D.S. 3.44; e)paigiali=tis x. AP10.8 (Arch.).
spur of a mountain or
ridge of rocks answering a like purpose, x. ga\r tou= *peiraiw=s h( *)hetiwneia Th.8.90, cf. Plu.Sol.9, Anon. ap. Suid. s.v. x. o)/rous. of various
cloven or
hooked implements: in surgery,
forked probe, Hp.Morb. 2.33.
notch of an arrow, Hero Bel.111.1, Hsch. s.v. glufi/des; but also (pl.) the
claws composing the hook (xei/r), Hero ib.2; also the
claws or
arms of the skorpi/os v, Vitr.10.10.4, 10.11.7.
rims of the eyelids, Ruf.Onom.20.
crack in the heels or other parts, Poll.4.198.
net, plait, Hsch. s.v. xhleuta\ kra/nh.
xh/l-inos, h, on, = xhleuto/s, a)/ggos Anacr.37.

xhlo/s, h(,
large chest, coffer, xhlou= d' a)po\ pw=m' a)ne/w|ge kalh=s daidale/hs Il.16.221; e)u+ce/sth| e)ni\ xhlw=| Od.13.10, etc.; kenea=s e)n puqme/ni xhlou= Theoc.16.10.
coffin, IG12(8).600.6 (Thasos).

xhl-o/w,
notch arrows, Ph.Bel.77.8:—Pass., of a hook,
to be equipped with claws, Hero Bel.111.1.

xh/l-wma, atos, to/,
notch, Hp. ap. Gal.19.155, Eratosth.Cat.29.

xhl-w/tion, to/,
netting-needle, Hsch.
xh=mai, gloss on gli/sxrai, Hsch.
xhm-ei/a, xhm-eutiko/s, v. xum-ei/a, -eutiko/s.

xh/mh, h(, (xa/skw)
yawning, gaping, Hsch.
clam, Philyll. 13, Arist.HA547b13, Ael.NA15.12; x. traxei=ai, lei=ai, PCair.Zen. 82.12 (iii B. C.), cf. Xenocr.Aq.31.
measure, Hp.Mul.1.75, 78: there were larger and smaller kinds, Cleopatra ap.Gal.19.769.

*xhmi/a, h(,
Black-land. Chemmi, Egyptian name for Egypt, Plu. 2.364c. (Egypt.
Kmt, Copt. <*> 'Egypt'.)
xhmi/on, to/, Dim. of xh/mh, Gal.6.734, Orib.3.28.1.

xh/mwsis, ews, h(,
an affection of the eyes, when the cornea swells
like a cockle-shell (xh/mh) so as to impede sight, Gal.19.436, Demosth. Ophth. ap. Orib.Syn.8.42, Paul.Aeg.3.22.

xh/n, o( and h(, Dor. xa/n (q.v.), gen. xhno/s: Ion. gen. pl. xhnw=n (not xhne/wn) Hdt.2.45; irreg. acc. pl. xe/nas AP7.546:—
wild goose, Anser cinereus, xhnw=n h)\ gera/nwn h)\ ku/knwn Il.2.460; x. platugi/zwn kai\ kexhnw/s Eub.115, cf. Arist.HA593b22; ei) mh\ su\ xhno\s h(=par h)\ yuxh\n e)/xeis Eub.101.
tame goose, xh=n' h(/rpac' a)titallome/nhn e)ni\ oi)/kw| Od.15.174, cf. 161; xh=ne/s moi kata\ oi)=kon e)ei/kosi puro\n e)/dousin 19.536; x. tiqaso/s S.Fr.866; w(/sper xh=na siteuto\n . . e)/trefe/ me Epigen.2; ga/lakti xhno/s, of an unknown luxury, Eub.90.5; h(/pata xhnw=n Plu.2.965a. nh\ or ma\ to\n xh=na was Socrates' oath, Ar.Av.521 (anap., ubi v. Sch.), Cratin.231, Zen.5.81. (Cf. Skt.
haṃsás, Lith.
žąsìs, OHG.
gans, all =
goose.）

xhna/grion, to/,
young wild goose, POxy.1923.22 (v/vi A. D.). a woman's ornament,
PLond.ined.2199 (iv A. D.).
xhna/lopes, = xhnalw/pekes, Hsch.

xhna^lwp-e/keios, a, on,
of the xhnalw/phc, w)|a/
PLond.ined. 2098 (iii B. C., written -ea), PCair.Zen.562.17 (iii B. C.), Epaenet. and Heraclid.Syrac. ap. Ath.2.58b.

xhna^lwp-ekideu/s, e/ws, o(,
young of the x., Ael.NA7.47.

xhna^lw/p-hc, ekos, o( （h( Herod.4.31. v.l. in Ael.NA5.30),
Egyptian goose, Chenalopex aegyptiaca, Hdt.2.72, Ar.Av.1295, Arist.HA593b22, Herod.4.31.
xhn-amu/xh, h(, = nukth/greton, Plin.HN21.62.
xhn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xh/n, Cyran.100, Hdn.Epim.150, Et.Gud.563.

xh/n-eios, a, on, Ion. xh/neos, h, on (also PCair.Zen.130.26 (iii B. C.)): (xh/n):—
of or
belonging to a goose, krew=n boe/wn kai\ xhne/wn plh=qos Hdt. 2.37; w)|o/n Arist.HA558a22, cf. PCair.Zen. l.c.; xh/neia (sc. kre/a) Menipp. ap. Ath.14.664e; ste/ar Dsc.1.68.3, Sor.1.56; xh/neia h(/pata, a Greek dainty,
foie gras, Ath.9.384c (a)rnei/a shd. be read in E.Fr.467).

xhn-e/rws, wtos, h(, a small kind of
goose, Plin.HN 10.56.

xh/n-hma, atos, to/,
wide gape, mocking laugh, Hsch.; also aor. xhnh=sai: katamwkh/sasqai, from xhna/w or -e/w.

xhn-ia/zw,
cackle like a goose, of a bad flute-player, Diph.77.

xhn-i^deu/s, e/ws, o(,
gosling, Ael.NA7.47, Eust.753.56.
xhn-i/zw, = xhnia/zw, Ath.14.657e.

xhn-i/on, to/,
gosling, BGU1501 (Ptolemaic).

xhn-i/skos, o(, Dim. of xh/n, Eub.15.3.
top of a ship's stern post in the form of a goose's head and neck, Ptol.Alm.8.1, Luc.VH2.41, Nav.5, JTr.47, Artem.2.23, Eust.667.16. ornament on a bowl, Inscr.Délos 372B72 (iii/ii B. C.); part of a machine, Orib.49.4.28.

xhno-bosi/a, h(,
keeping or
feeding of geese, Att. acc. to Moer. p.403 P.: pl., Poll.9.16 (misquoting Plato, v. xhnobwti/a).

xhno-boskiko/s, h/, o/n,
of a gooseherd, klh=ros Pap. in
Atti del IV Congresso Internazionale di Papirologia p.70 (Ptolemaic).

xhno-bo/skion, to/,
place for feeding geese, goose-pen, Gp.14.22.1; written
chenoboscion, Varro RR3.10.1, Colum.8.14.1; as place-name, PGrenf.1.42.14 (ii B. C.), Mitteis Chr.87.38 (ii A. D.).

xhno-bosko/s, o(,
gooseherd, Cratin.46, PTeb.701.290 (iii B. C.), Ostr.Bodl. i304 (ii B. C.), Sammelb.6254 (ii B. C.), D.S.1.74; basilikoi\ x. PPetr.2p.25 (iii B. C.).
xhno-bwti/a, h(, = xhnobosi/a, Pl.Plt.264c (pl.).

xhno-mege/qhs, es,
as large as a goose, Str.15.1.57.
xhno-trofei=on, to/, = xhnobo/skion, Colum.8.1.3 (v.l. xhno-tro/fion).
xhno-tro/fos, on, = xhnobosko/s, Sammelb. 5380, EM811.1: misspelt -tro/pos Ostr.304 (ii A. D.).
xhn-u/stra, h(, = xa/smh, Hsch.; also, = to\ straggeu/esqai, Id.

xhn-ustra/omai,
yawn, Id.
xhn-ust<r>ei=s: boa=|s, Id.

xhnw/dhs, es,
like a goose, S.E.M.7.329.

xh/r, o(, gen. xhro/s,
hedgehog, Hsch. (Cf. Lat.
ēr.）

xh/r-a, Ion. xh/rh, h(,
widow, xh=rai gunai=kes Il.2.289; mh/thr x. 22.499; mh\ pai=d' o)rfaniko\n qh/h|s x. te gunai=ka 6.432; lei/pein tina\ x. e)n mega/roisin 22.484, 24.725, cf. S.Aj.653, E.Andr.348, Tr.380; xh/ras de\ gunai=kas e)poi/hsan Lys.2.71; as a name of Hera, Paus.8.22.2 (xh=rai: ai( mh\ e)/xousai a)/ndras, Hsch.; h( monwqei=sa a)p' a)ndro\s x. Poll.3.47). Com., of a dish,
widowed, i.e.
without sauce, Sotad.Com.1.26. later masc. xh=ros,
widower, Arist.HA612b34 (of birds), Call.Epigr. 17, Gramm. post Hdn.Epim.286. xh=ros, a, on, Adj, metaph.,
bereaved, xh=ra me/laqra E.Alc.862 (anap.); ma/ndrai Call.Cer.106; bi/os Epigr.Gr.406.13 (Iconium); eu)nh/ IG14.1389 i 12; do/mos Call.Epigr. 22; drumoi\ x.
bereft of men, AP9.84 (Antiphan.): c. gen., Il.6.408; fa/rsos . . steleou= xh=ron e)lai+ne/ou AP6.297 (Phanias), cf. Vett.Val. 117.6; xh/rous gunaikw=n oi)kei=n Str.7.3.4; ta\ xh=ra fronh/sews Ph.1.601; nau=s u(/datos x. Ael.NA13.28. (Cf. xwri/s, xati/zw, Skt.
jáhāti 'abandon, renounce'.)

xhr-ai/nw,
to be parted from one's husband, Herod.1.21.

xhr-aio/ths, htos, h(,
widowhood, PMasp.5.23, al. (vi A. D.).

xhra/mbh, h(, a kind of
scallop, Archil.198, Sophr.44.
xhrambh/s: xhrw=n oi)/khma, Hsch. (nisi leg. -a/mbh, cf. xhra/mbas (sine expl.) Suid.).
xhra^mi/s, v.l. for xhramu/s, Hp.Morb.3.15,16.

xhra^modu/ths, ou, o(,
one who creeps into holes, AP7.295 (Leon.) (u_ metri gr., nisi leg.
xhr-du/pths).

xhra^mo/qen, Adv.
from or
out of holes, Orph.L.707.

xhra^mo/s,
hole, cleft, hollow, koi/lhn ei)se/ptato pe/trhn, xhramo/n, of a rock pigeon, Il.21.495, cf. Arist.HA614b35, Hld.8.16; x. [sfhkw=n] Lyc.181; of a mouse's
hole, Babr.107.13; of a
hollow in the hilt of a sword, Ach.Tat.3.20, 21; of a shell, Id.2.11; of the
hollows on the sides of the tongue, Poll.2.107.—The gend. is undetermined in Hom.; fem., A.R.4.1452, prob. in Arist.l.c.; masc., Ael.NA3.26, Philostr.VA2.14: heterocl. pl. xhrama/, ta/, Nic.Th.55, 149, Q.S.9.382; cf. xhlamo/s, xaramo/s, xeiramo/s.

xhra^mu/s, u/dos, h(,
scallop-shell, used as a measure, Xanth.3 (pl.), Hp.Mul.1.34, Str.17.3.11. = foreg., Hsch. (pl.).
xhra^mw/n, o/nos, o(, = xhramo/s, dat. pl. xhramo/nessin Orph.A.1266.
xh/rato, xh/ranto, v. xai/rw.

xhr-ei/a, h(,
widowhood, Th.2.45, LXX Mi.1.16, Sor.1.31, etc.: pl., xhrei/ais to\n a(/panta xro/non mei/nasa IG14.1960.5. metaph.,
want, dia\ xhrei/an e)pisth/mhs Ph.1.358; no/qw| ko/smw| xhrei/a| gnhsi/ou Id.2.492.

xh/r-eios, a, on,
widowed, le/ktra AP9.192 (Antiphil.): Ion. xhrh/i+os, oi)=kos Antim.99.

xh/r-eusis, h(, = xhrei/a 1, LXX Ge.38.14, Ju.8.5.
separation from a husband, Leg.Gort.3.45.

xhr-eu/w, intr.,
to be without, lack, c. gen., nh=sos a)ndrw=n x. Od.9.124, cf. Plu. Pomp.28, Ael.NA4.59: gh= x. tw=n e)kponou/ntwn Alciphr.3.25; o(lka\s tw=n e)mpleo/ntwn xhreu/ousa Hld.1.1; tw=n th=s *)afrodi/ths o)rgi/wn x. Ach. Tat.4.1; ou)de/pote x. tw=n o)/ntwn tino\s o( ko/smos Herm. ap. Stob.1.41.6; x. a)po/ tinos Steph. in Hp.1.219 D. abs. of a woman,
to be widowed, live in widowhood, Is.6.51, D.30.11,33; of birds, Arist. Fr.347; also of men,
to be a widower, Plu.Cat.Ma.24:—Med., xhreu/sh| le/xos E.Alc.1089.
live in solitude, of a fugitive, S.OT479 (anap.). trans.,
bereave, E.Cyc.440; pesw\n xhreu/sei su/noikon Aphth.Prog.13.

xhr-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a widow, Tz.H.13.591.
xh=r-os, v. xh/ra.

xhr-osu/nh, h(,
bereavement, widowhood, Epigr. Gr.370 (Cotiaeum), 574; x. po/sios A.R.4.1064: pl., Man.3.82.

xhr-o/w,
make desolate, xh/rwse d' a)guia/s Il.5.642: esp.
make a woman
a widow, xh/rwsas de\ gunai=ka 17.36; *pria/mou gai=' e)xh/rws' *(ella/da E.Cyc.304:— Med., e)xhrw/santo po/lha Q.S.9.351. c. gen.,
bereave, me . . h)eliou xh/rwsen AP7.172 (Antip.Sid.); pnoih=s ib.287 (Antip.):— Pass., tw=n . . au(tou= xhrw/sei (2sg.) pollw=n (v.l. ktea/nwn) Thgn.956; pollw=n a)\n a)ndrw=n h(/d' e)xhrw/qh po/lis
would have been bereft of . . , Sol. 37; *)/argos a)ndrw=n e)xhrw/qh Hdt.6.83. c. acc.,
forsake, deprive of one's presence, a)eli/ou xh/rwsen au)ga/s Arist.Fr.675.13 (nisi leg. au)ga=s). c. acc.,
take away, pa=san e)rwh/n Opp.C.4.421. intr.,
to be bereft of . . : abs.,
live in widowhood, f.l. for xhreu/w in Plu. 2.749d.

xh/r-wsis, ews, h(,
being bereaved, c. gen., Sch.Il.1.13, cf. Gloss.

xhr-wstai/, w=n, oi(,
far-off kinsmen, who seize and divide among themselves the property of one who dies without heirs (xh=ros）, xhrwstai\ de\ dia\ kth=sin date/onto Il.5.158, cf. Hes.Th.607 (v. Sch. ad loc.), Q.S.8.299, Hsch., = oi( makro/qen (or po/rrwqen） suggenei=s (also expld. = o)rfanisth/s,
one who acts as a guardian to widows and orphans, Eust.533.30). (Compd. of xhro- 'abandoned' and -wsta_- from -w-d-ta_-, nomen agentis of w-d-, cf. Skt.
ā´ dā- 'receive'; and Lat.
hērēd- (
ĝhēro + ē-d-).)

xht-ei/a, h(,
want, need, Hsch.

xh/t-eios, a, on,
in want, bereaved, v.l. for *kh/teioi in Od.11.521 acc. to Eust.1697.27.
xht-i/zw, = xati/zw, EM811.45.

xh=t-os, to/ (only used in dat.),
want, lack, c. gen. pers., xh/tei+ toiou=d' a)ndro/s
from need of such a man, Il.6.463; xh/tei+ toiou=d' ui(=os 19.324; xh/tei e)neunai/wn Od.16.35; xh/tei+ law=n h.Ap. 78; xh/tei+ summa/xwn Hdt.9.11; xh/tei pri/nhs Eup.360; xh/tei oi)kei/wn Pl.Phdr.239d (referred to xh=tis by Tim.Lex.); x. gnhsi/ou ka/llous Ph.2.266; o)stw=n x. Poll.2.166; x. [ko/smou], paradei/gmatos, Them. Or.24.306b, 4.62d; x. xalinou= kai\ h(nio/xou Jul.Or.2.50b; xh/tei+ . . noh/matos Orph.L.76. (Cogn. with xh=ros.）

xht-osu/nh, h(,
desolation, loneliness, AP9.408 (Antip.).

xqa^ma^lopth/ths, ou, o(,
flying near the ground, epithet of a kind of hawk, Arist.HA620a21.

xqa^ma^lo/s, h/, o/n,
near the ground, on the ground, low, eu)nai/ Od. 11.194; sko/pelos -w/teros 12.101; tei=xos -w/taton Il.13.683, cf. Plu. Arat.18; oi)kodomei=n -w/tera ta\ pro\s a)/rkton X.Mem.3.8.9; x. *ai)/guptos Theoc.17.79; lo/foi -w/teroi Plb.10.10.7; x. de/ndra Plu.2.320c; ta\ x. ib.103e; th\n po/lin e)n tw=| x. kei=sqai D.Chr.6.2; also of the sea, ku=ma x. Hld.5.1, cf. Ach.Tat.3.2. of Ithaca, au)th\ de\ xqamalh\ panuperta/th ei)n a(li\ kei=tai pro\s zo/fon dub. sens. in Od.9.25, cf. 10.196, Str.10.2.12. metaph. of persons
of humble station, x. kai\ mikroprepei=s Them.Or.9.126a, 34p.469Dind. (Comp.); also dikaiosu/nh Id.Or.8.118d (Comp.).
sitting in a lower place, Hld.10.6.
pedestrian, a)neime/nh kai\ x. *dwri/s Proll.Theoc.p.5 Wendel.

xqa^ma^lo/ths, htos, h(,
lowness, flatness, Theon Sm.p.124 H., Dexipp. p.184 D., Eust.833.35.

xqa^ma^lo/w,
level, J.BJ3.6.2.

xqe/s, Adv. (lengthd. e)xqe/s (q.v.); where the word occurs in
NT, Ev.Jo.4.52, Act.Ap.7.28, Ep.Hebr.13.8, codd. vary betw. e)xqe/s and xqe/s; xqe/s is not found in Ptolemaic papyri, but in PLond.2.161.8 (iii A. D.)):—
yesterday, h.Merc.273, Th.3.113, Pl.R.327a, Smp.174a, etc.: freq. placed between Art. and Subst., h( x. o(mologi/a, oi( x. lo/goi, Pl.Sph.216a, Ti.26e; th=| x. h(me/ra| Plu.2.773e; x. me\n . . , ta\ nu=n de\ . . Pl.Ti.17a: freq. prw/hn te kai\ x., x. kai\ prw/hn, v. prw/hn 11; x. kai\ tri/thn h(me/ran v.l. in X.Cyr.6.3.11, cf. LXX Ge.31.2. (Cf. Skt.
hyás 'yesterday', Lat.
heri, hesternus, OHG.
gestaron 'yesterday', etc.)
xqesi^no/s, h/, o/n, = xqizo/s, kraipa/lh Luc.Laps.1 (wrongly given as Att. by Phryn.295, PS p.127 B.).
xqesifwnw=n: kakologw=n, Hsch., Suid.
xqiz-a/, v. xqizo/s.
xqiz-i^no/s, h/, o/n, = xqizo/s, twice restored metri gr. for xqesino/s in Ar. (both lyr.), dia\ to\n x. a)/nqrwpon V.281; to\ sko/rodon to\ x. Ra.987, cf. Gal.6.88, Alciphr.3.61.

xqiz-o/s, h/, o/n, (xqe/s)
of yesterday, to\ x. xrei=os their
yesterday's debt, Il.13.745; o( x. po/nos
yesterday's labour, Hdt.1.126; h( x. me/qh Plu.2.13e; ai( x. a)belteri/ai ib.75e, cf. Sor.1.40, etc.: freq. in adverb. sense, with Verbs, xqizo\s e)/bh he went
yesterday, Il.1.424; x. h)/luqes Od. 2.262; x. e)eikostw=| fu/gon h)/mati 6.170; o(/ssa . . x. u(pe/sxeto Il.19.141; x. e)muqeo/mhn Od.12.451; i)/don *me/ntora x. 4.656; ai)\ ga/r . . toi=os e)w/n toi x. . . e)festa/menai would I had stood by thee
yesterday! 24.379: neut. xqizo/n as Adv., = xqe/s, Il.19.195; neut. pl. xqiza/, v. prwizo/s.
xqi/sdos, = xqizo/s, Epigr.Gr.989 (Balbilla).
xqo/a: sw=ma, Hsch. xqo/i+nos: xqo/nios, Id.

xqo/n-eia, ta/,
festival of the xqo/niai qeai/ (Demeter and Persephone), IG4.679.17 (Hermione).
xqonh/rhs, es, = xqo/nios, Hsch.

xqo/nios, a, on, also os, on S.OC1727 (lyr.), E.Hipp.1201, Hel.345 (lyr.): (xqw/n):—
in, under, or
beneath the earth, qeo/s, dai/mwn, Hes.Th. 767, A.Th.522 (lyr.); *)/ai+da sto/ma, of the cavern at Taenarus, Pi.P.4.43, cf. S.OC1727 (lyr.); x. li/mnh E.Alc.902 (anap.); *zeu\s x., of Hades or Pluto, Hes.Op.465; ktu/phse *zeu\s x., of noise from beneath the earth, S.OC1606; bronth/mata x. A.Pr.994; h)xw\ x. w(s bronth\ *dio/s E.Hipp. l.c., cf. Ar.Av.1750 (lyr.); x. qeoi/ gods
of the nether world, opp. u(/patoi, A.Ag.89 (anap.), etc.; x. dai/mones Id.Pers.628 (anap.); xqo/nioi alone, ma=nis xqoni/wn Pi.P.4.159, cf. A.Pers.641 (lyr.), Ch. 399 (lyr.), al., Pl.Lg.828c, 959d (but Ion. xqoni/h, h(, earlier name of *gh=, Pherecyd.Syr.1, cf. Dam.Pr.124bis; x. qeai/, i.e. Demeter and Persephone, Hdt.6.134, 7.153; of the Erinyes, S.OC1568 (lyr.); x. *(/aidas, *(/aidhs, E.Alc.237 (lyr.), Andr.544 (anap.); x. *(ermh=s, as conductor of the dead, A.Ch.1, S.El.111 (anap.), Aj.832, Ar.Ra. 1145, Plu.Arist.21; x. porei/a, opp. ou)rani/a, Pl.R.619e; xqoni/a| freni/, of the dead, Pi.P.5.101; x. *(eka/th Ar.Fr.500 (anap.); xa/ris h( x. grace
with the gods below, S.OC1752 (lyr.); x. fa/ma rumour
that is heard in the world below, Id.El.1066 (lyr.).
sprung from the earth, *tith=nes Hes.Th.697; of Echion, one of the Theban ghgenei=s, E.Ba.541 (lyr.), cf. Paus.9.5.3, etc.; but also of mankind, o( x. a)/nqrwpos, opp. o( e)n ou)ranw=| . . laxw\n th\n u(po/stasin, Procl. in Prm.p.765 S. Adv. xqoni/ws
in an earthly manner, opp. ou)rani/ws, Id.Sacr. p.148 B.
in or
of the country, qeoi/, h(rw=|ssai, E.Hec.79 (anap.), A.R.4.1322;
native, *)/areos . . pa/gon . . cunh/|dh xqo/nion o)/nta S.OC948; genea=s xqoni/wn a)p' *)erexqeida=n Id.Aj.202 (anap.). of things,
of the earth, x. ko/nis (sed leg. gai/+a, Hsch.), A.Th.736 (codd., lyr.); opp. a)e/rios, E.Fr.27.4 (lyr.); prhsth/r Arist.Mu.395a10.—Poet. word, used once or twice in Pl. and in late Prose (v. supr.).

xqono-pais, o(, h(,
earth-born, child of earth, *(/wra Hsch.

xqono/-plastos, on,
formed of earth, Suid.

xqono-ri^fh/s, e/s, (r(i/ptw)
flung on the ground, PMag.Par.1.196.

xqono-sti^bh/s, e/s,
treading the earth, opp. ou)ra/nios, S.OT301.

xqono-trefh/s, e/s,
bred from earth, e)dano/n A.Ag.1407 (lyr.).
xqu/pths, ou, o(, epith. of turo/s, Thespis 4 (anap., qu/pthn cj. Salmasius, cf. qu/pths).

xqw/n, h(, gen. xqono/s,
earth, esp.
the surface of it (rarely
soil, xqono\s tri/moiron xlai=nan A.Ag.872): poet. word (Com. only in lyr. or paratrag.), very rare in Prose, LXX 3 Ki.14.15 (cod. Alex.), Supp.Epigr. 2.520 (Rome); seldom with Art. (only when an Adj. is added, v. infr. 11); a)po\ x. u(yo/s' a)erqei/s Od.8.375, cf. 10.149, Il.14.349; e)c i(/ppwn a)poba/ntes e)pi\ xqo/na 8.492, cf. 11.619; e)pi\ xqoni\ kei=to tanusqei/s 20.483; kate/qhken e)pi\ xqoni/ 6.473, cf. 3.89; xqoni\ fu/lla pela/ssai 13.180; e)pi\ x., opp. ou)ranw=|, 4.443; zw=ntos kai\ e)pi\ xqoni\ derkome/noio 1.88; e)pi\ x. si=ton e)/dontes Od.8.222, etc.; toi\ e)pi\ x. naieta/ousi 6.153; a)/riston a)/ndra tw=n e)pi\ x. S.Tr.811; xqo/na du/menai to go beneath
the earth, i.e. to die, Il.6.411, Hes.Sc.151; e)te/qapto u(po\ xqono/s Od.11.52; kekeuqw\s u(po\ xqono\s buried, A.Th.588; kata\ xqono\s kru/yai tina/ S.Ant.24, cf. OC1546 (Pass.); xqoni\ gui=a kalu/yaimi Pi.N.8.38; kou/fa soi x. e)pa/nwqe pe/soi E.Alc.463 (lyr.); opp. qa/lassa, A.Ag.576; u(po\ xqono/s, of
the nether world, *ta/rtaron . . , h(=xi ba/qiston u(po\ x. e)sti be/reqron Il.8.14; ka/tw melai/nas x. Alc.Supp.7.10, cf. A.Eu.72; oi( u(po\ x. fi/loi, i.e. those
in the shades below, Id.Ch.833 (lyr.), cf. S.Ant.65; w)= kata\ xqono\s qeai/, i.e. the Erinyes, A.Eu.115; ei)s tou\s e)/nerqe kai\ ka/tw x. to/pous ib. 1023.
earth, i.e.
the world, Id.Pr.139 (anap.), Ag.528; e)p' e)/sxata xqono/s S.Fr.956.
Earth, as a goddess, A.Pr.207, Eu.6.
land, country, once in Hom., ei)/sato de\ x., of Ithaca, Od. 13.352; polu/mhlos x., of Libya, Pi.P.9.7; eu)/karpos x., of Sicily, Id.N.1.14; freq. in Trag., freq. without Art., x. *)asia=tis, *fwke/wn, A.Pers.61 (anap.), 485; with Art., pa=san th\n *mukhnai/wn xqo/na S.El.423; th=s perirru/tou x. *ah/mnou Id.Ph.1; th\n *korinqi/an x. Id.OT795; th\n e)mh\n x. Id.Aj.846; th=s *)aqhnai/wn x. (paratrag.) Ephipp. 14.13; even of a
city, th=sde dhmou=xoi x. S.OC1348; no/mous xqono/s Id.Ant.368 (lyr.), cf. OT736,939; Com., w)= po/li fi/lh *ke/kropos, . . ou)=qar a)gaqh=s xqono/s Ar.Fr.110 (lyr.); ce/nhs a)po\ x. Eup.71 (paratrag.). (Cf. Skt. loc.
k[snull ]ámi 'on the ground', Hittite
tegan 'ground', Tocharian
tkan- 'place', Ir.
dū 'place' (acc.
don, dat.
dun).)

xqwro/dlayon, to/, said to be a
Syrian article of food, Ath.3.126a.
xi=, v.l. for xei=, Hp.VC1.

xi_a/zw,
play the Chian: esp.
imitate the Chian musician Democritus, Ar.Fr.912 (anap.), Poll.4.65. xi_a/zw,
mark with two lines crossing like a X:—Pass., zw=|a dusi\ grammai=s kexiasme/na D.S.2.58: esp. of words or lines in which the critic wishes to point out something remarkable, to\ de\ toiou=ton kexi/astai Sch.S.Ph.201; xia/zetai o( sti/xos (in allusion to the word *(ele/nh) Sch.E.Or.81, etc.; absurdly expld. by Eust.1462.41. Rhet.,
arrange four clauses crosswise, Hermog.Inv.4.3, Porph. in Cat.79.6.
make a cruciform incision, Antyll. ap. Orib.44.20.31 (xiezou=men codd.).
cross out, cancel a document, PFlor.61.65 (i A. D.), POxy.1282.34 (i A. D.), etc.

*xi=ai, ai( (sc. krhpi=des), a kind of
men's shoes, Hp.Art.62, Hsch.: cj. for lei=ai in Herod.7.57.

xi_aka/, ta/, a class of
eye-salves, Dem.Ophth. ap. Aët.7.112; also xiako/n, to/, a styptic, Orib.Fr.86.
xi_a/s, a/dos, h(, = *xi=os 11, Poll.9.100.

xi/-asma [i_], atos, to/,
cross-piece of wood, Bito 54.3 (pl.).
cross-bandage, Sor.Fasc.22 (in form xi/esma), Gal.18(1).787.

xi-asmo/s, o(,
placing crosswise, diagonal arrangement, esp. of the clauses of a period, so that the 1st corresponds with the 4th, and the 2nd with the 3rd, Hermog.Inv.4.3; kata\ xiasmo/n Sch.Isoc.12.47.
cruciform incision, Antyll. ap. Orib.44.20.32 (-esmo/s codd., and so of a noose, Heraclas ap. eund.48.9.2; of a bandage, Heliod. ap. eund. 48.65 tit.).
decussation, skiw=n Cleom.1.9, cf. Nicom.Ar.1.19 (pl.); of nerves, Aret.SD1.7.
cancellation of a document, PMasp.151.292 (vi A. D.).

xi-aste/on,
one must cut a bandage in the form of a X, Sor.1.56.

xi-asti/, Adv.
like the Chians, ti/llein Eust.1462.34, Hsch.
crosswise, diagonally, x. tw=n eu)qeiw=n keime/nwn Procl. in Euc.p.357 F.

xi-asto/s, h/, o/n,
arranged diagonally, li/qoi Ph.Bel.94.45; of a noose (in form xiesto/s) Heraclas ap. Orib. 48.3 tit.; of a bandage, Sor.Fasc.7 (in form xiesto/s), Gal.18(1).819. Adv. -tw=s of an incision, PSI10.1180.47 (ii A. D.).
in the shape of a X, shmei=on Eust.599.35. esp. in Rhet. (cf. xia/zw）, x. peri/odos Sch.Isoc.6.42, cf. Sch.Il.16.564, Porph. in Cat. 78.36.
xida/: frikth/, Hsch. xi/dadon: to\ paidi/on, Id. (leg. xi/dalon: a)nti\ tou= <ki/dalon>: to\ ai)doi=on).
xi/dai: a)nti\ tou= < . . > (Cret.), Id. xidale/on: tuflo/n, a)/gamon, pefriko/s, Id. xida=n: x<e>ima/zesqai, deilia=n, Id. xi/dhlos, etym. of ki/bdhlos, Eust.1462.43.

xi=dron, to/, mostly in pl. xi=dra, ta/,
unripe wheaten-groats, rubbed from the ear in the hands, Ar.Eq.806 (anap.), Pax595 (troch.) (cf. Sch. ad locc., Suid.), PCair.Zen.129.13 (iii B. C.), Alex.Trall.1.13, 2.1, al.; ne/a pefrugme/na x. LXX Le.2.14, cf. 23.14: sg., Alcm.75; xi/dra, h(, is corrupt in Hsch.; xe/dra is v.l. in Ph.1.180.

xidropw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in xi=dra, Poll.7.199.
xi_-eze/w, xi_/-esma, xi_-esmo/s, xi_-esto/s, vv. ll. for xia/zw, xiasmo/s, etc. (qq. vv.).

xi/qos, =
cilicia, Gloss. (also written li/qos and zu/qos, ib.).
xi^qwni/skos, o(, = xitwn-, IG22.1514.7.

xi_l-eu/w,
supply with fodder, u(pozu/gia Thphr.CP2.17.6.
feed on, graze, c. acc. loci, Nic.Th.635.
xi_l-h/, h(, = xilo/s, Gal.Consuet. 2, Suid.

xi_l-h/gonos, on,
grown as fodder for cattle, Nic.Al.424.

xi_lia/gwnos [a^], on,
with a thousand angles, Archim.Aren.1.10, al.

xi_li-a/zw,
to be a thousand years old, Tz.H.9.656.

xi_li-a/kis, Adv.
a thousand times, Gloss.

xi_li/-andros, on,
containing a thousand men, po/lis Pl.Plt.292e.

xi_li-a/riqmos [a^], on,
numbering 1,000
men, in phrase -ari/qmou h(gh/twr stratih=s = Lat.
tribunus militum, JRS 2.90 (Antioch.Pisid.).

xi_li-a/rotros [a^r], on,
containing a thousand plough-gates, te/menos Sch.BT Il.13.703.

xi_liarx-e/w, impf. e)xilia/rxei, aor. e)xilia/rxhsa, Plu.Cat.Mi.8, Flam. 20: pf. part. kexiliarxhkw/s D.C.67.11:—
to be a xili/arxos,
Luc. DMeretr.9.4: esp. at Rome,
to be a tribunus militum, IG14.282
(i B. C.), J.BJ3.4.1, Plu. ll. cc., App.Pun.112, etc.

xi_lia/rx-hs, ou, o(, = xili/arxos 1, Hdt.7.81.
commander of a xiliarxi/a 11, Ascl.Tact.2.10, Ael.Tact.9.6. = Lat.
tribunus militum, J.AJ19.1.13, App.BC 2.102, Hdn.6.9.6 (less common than xili/arxos).

xi_liarx-i/a, h(,
office or
post of xili/arxos, X.Cyr.4.1.4. office of
tribunus militum Plu. Cam.38, al., D.C.59.29; a)po\ triw=n x., = Lat.
tribus militiis, IGRom. 4.1204 (Thyatira).
unit under the command of a xili/arxos,
corps of 1024
men, Ascl.Tact.2.10, Ael.Tact.9.6, Arr.Tact.10.5. = xilia/s, LXXNu.31.48, 1 Ma.5.13. Persian military district, AJA 16.13 (Sardis, iv/iii B. C.). = xiliethri/s, applied to work by Asinius Quadratus, St.Byz. s.v. *)ocu/bioi (cf. xilia/s 11).

xi_liarx-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of a tribunus militum, h(gemoni/a D.S.19.3.

xi_li/arx-os, o(,
captain over a thousand, A.Pers.304: esp.
commandant of a garrison, X.Cyr.8.1.14, Oec.4.7. = xilia/rxhs 11, Plb.6.19.1, al., D.H.2.14, Inscr.Magn.157b (i A. D.), etc. (the usual form in this sense). title of Persian court official, Plu.Art.5, Ael. VH1.21; also in Macedonia, D.S.18.48.

xi_li-a/s, a/dos, h(: gen. pl. xilia/dwn Hdt.2.28 (xiliade/wn v.l. in 7.28):—
a thousand, Id.6.58, 7.28, A.Pers.341; x. te/tores Simon. 91; c. gen., polla\s xilia/das tala/ntwn Hdt.2.96, cf. 28; e)nne/a xilia/das e)tw=n Pl.Phdr.257a. generally,
large number, Theoc.16.91, Luc.Herm.56; pollai\ x., of lines of poetry, Call.Aet.Oxy.2079.4. *xilia/des, ai(, title of poem by Euph., Ath.10.436f, etc. = xiliethri/s, Alex.Aetol.4.4; *(rwmai+kh\ x., title of work by Asinius Quadratus, St.Byz. s.v. *)anqion (cf. xiliarxi/a 111, xiliethri/s).

xi_li-asth/r, h=ros, o(,
member of a xiliastu/s, SIG1043.5 (Samos, iii B. C.).
xi_li-astu/s, u/os, h(, a division of the people at Ephesus, ib.353.9 (iv B. C.); at Samos, ib.312.30 (iv B. C.); at Cos, ib.1025.17 (iv/iii B. C.); cf. xellhstu/s.

xi_li^et-hri/s, i/dos, h(,
a period of a thousand years, title of a work by Asinius Quadratus, Suid. s.v. *kodra=tos (cf. xiliarxi/a 111, xilia/s 11).
festival held after an interval of a thousand years, Hierocl.Facet. 62.

xi_li^e/t-hs, ou, o(, or xi_li^et-eth/s, e/os, o(, h(:—
lasting a thousand years, peri/odos, porei/a, Pl.Phdr.249a, R.621d; bi/os Arist.GA745a34: fem. acc. -etin v.l. in Pl.R.615a. xeilie/ths a)gw/n, celebration of the
thousandth anniversary of the founding of Rome, IG22.3169.14 (iii A. D.).

xi_liodu/na^mos [u^], = polemw/nion, Dsc.4.8 (v.l. -du/namis, as in Gal. 12.106); Lat.
-dynamias Plin.HN25.64.

xi/lioi [xi_], ai, a: gen. pl. fem. xiliw=n, irreg. in Att. acc. to Hdn. Gr.1.426 (prob. only when xi/liai was used as a fem. Subst. (v. infr. 3)); dat. pl. fem. (orig. loc.) xili/a_sin IG12.10.18; xili/aisi ib.76.20, 94.10; later xili/ais: dialect forms, Locr. xi/lioi (as in Att., v. supr.) IG9(1).334.39 (Oeanthea, v B. C.); Dor. xh/lioi (written xe/l-) ib. 5(1).1.23 (Sparta, v B. C.), Lesb., Thess. xe/llioi EM817.1 (cf. xellhstu/s), IG9(2).1229.29 (Phalanna, ii B. C.); Ion. xei/lioi Schwyzer 688C15 (Chios, v B. C.), which shd. prob. be restored in Hom., cf. deka/x（e）iloi:—
a thousand, Hom. only in neut., x. me/tra, pura/, Il.7.471, 8.562; prw=q' e(kato\n bou=s dw=ken, e)/peita de\ xi/li' u(pe/sth (sc. pro/bata）, ai)=gas o(mou= kai\ o)/i+s 11.244: usu. agreeing with its Subst., Hes.Th. 364, etc.; but sts. as Subst. folld. by gen., xi/lioi *makedo/nwn Th.2.80: to express the addition of a smaller number, that number may either precede or follow, diako/sioi kai\ x. Isoc.4.87, 93, Pl.Criti.119b: but x. kai\ pentako/sioi Aeschin.2.77; later kai/ is freq. omitted, Plb.3.33.10, LXX Da.12.11, Apoc.11.3; with Preps. x. e)pi\ muri/ois Pl.Lg.895a; te/ttaras pro\s toi=s x. Luc.Cat.4; oi( x. loga/des (at Argos)
the Thousand, Th.5.67, cf. D.S.12.80. sg. with collect. nouns, xili/h i(/ppos
a thousand horse, Hdt.5.63, 7.41; th\n i(/ppon th\n xili/hn Id.8.113; so i(/ppon e)/xw ei)s xili/an X.Cyr.4.6.2; also xili/a o(lokau/twsis burnt-offering
of 1000 cattle, LXX 3 Ki.3.4. xi/liai (sc. draxmai/) as Subst.,
a thousand drachmae, peri\ xiliw=n kinduneu/ein D.22.21; e)n xili/ais o( ki/ndunos ib.26 (x. draxmai/ in full, Pl.Ap.36b). (Cf. Skt.
sahásram 'a thousand' (with prefix
sa- = sṃ-); I.-E.
ĝheslo-, ĝheslio-.）

xi_lio-kaipenthkostapla^si/wn, on, gen. -onos,
1050 times as much, Cleom.2.1.
xi_lio-kra/twr, oros [a^], o(, = xili/arxos, Tz.H.3.719.

xi_liokta^kosiogdohkontapla^si/wn, on, gen. -onos,
eighteen hundred and eighty times as great, Hipparch. ap. Theo Sm. p.197 H.

xi_lio/kwmos, on,
with a thousand villages, pedi/on Str.12.3.39.

xi_lio/mbh, h(,
sacrifice of a thousand victims (formed like e(kato/mbh), Jul.Or.7.214a, Eust.1454.26, etc.

xi_lio/-naus, ews, o(, h(,
of a thousand ships, strato/s E.Or.352 (anap.); o( x. *(ella/dos *)/arhs Id.Andr.106 (eleg.); e)la/tais xilio/nausin, = xili/ais nausi/, Id.IA174 (lyr.); also in later Prose, x. sto/los Str. 13.1.27.

xi_lio-nau/ths, ou, Dor. xi_lio-nau/tas, a, o(, h(,
with or
of a thousand ships, sto/los *)argei/wn A.Ag.45 (anap.); su\n kw/pa| xilionau/ta *)atrei/+da prob. in E.IT141 (lyr.).

xi_lio/-omai, Pass.,
to be fined a thousand drachmae, Lycurg.Frr. 11,60, EM404.43.

xi_lio/-pa^lai, Adv.
long long ago, Com. word, Ar.Eq.1155.

xi_lio/-phxus, u,
of 1000 cubits, Plot.2.9.9.
xi_lio-pla/sios [a^], a, on, = sq., only Adv. -i/ws LXX De.1.11.
xi_lio-pla^si/wn, on, gen. -onos, = foreg., Sm. 2 Ki.18.3.
xi/lios, v. xi/lioi.

xi_liost-o/s, h/, o/n,
thousandth, X.Cyr.2.3.6, Pl.Phdr.249b, R.615c, etc.: h( x.
tax of 1000th, PEleph.14.12 (iii B. C.), Hsch.

xi_liost-u/s, u/os, h(,
body of a thousand, X.Cyr.2.4.3, 6.3.13.31.

xi_lio-ta/lantos [ta^], on,
weighing or
worth a thousand talents, naoi/, mu/droi, Plu.Per.12, 2.924a; o)fru=s e)/xon x., Com. phrase, Alex. 116.7.

xi_lio-fo/ros, on,
carrying a thousand, ploi=on x. vessel
of a thousand a)mforei=s, D.C.56.27.
xi_lio/-fullos, o(, = polu/gonon a)/rren, Ps.-Dsc.4.4. = *)axi/lleios, ib.36. v. stratiw/ths 11.
xi_lio/-xru_sos, o(, name of a compound plaster, Alex.Trall.12p.561P.

xi_li/wros, on, (w(/ra)
of a thousand years, xro/nos Lyc.1153.

xi_lopoi-e/omai, late spelling for xulo-,
digest, Phlp.in APo.417.15: hence xi_lopoi/-hsis, ews, h(,
digestion, Sophon.
in de An.61.28.

xi_l-o/s ( xeilo/s, Ael.Dion.Fr.323 (cf. 397)), o( （h( Babr.46.3),
green fodder for cattle, esp. for horses and beasts of burden,
forage, provender, Hdt.4.140, X.An.1.9.27; ta\ de\ kth/nh pa/nta xilw=| e)/ndon e)tre/fonto ib.4.5.25; of soldiers, lamba/nein xilo/n
forage, Id.Cyr.6.3.5; pro\s x. diatele/sai (sc. th\n o(do/n) complete a stage for
forage, Id.An.1.5.7; i(/ppois x. e)mbalei=n, paraba/llesqai (Pass.), Plu.Eum.9, 2.678a; chro\s x.
hay, X.An.4.5.33. later,
pasturage, Babr. l.c.

xi_lopoi-o/w,
fodder, dia\ to\n fo/bon . . e)xi/lou tou\s i(/ppous, i.e. did not suffer them to graze, X.An.7.2.21:—Pass.,
to be stall-fed, Hsch.

xi_lopoi/-wma, atos, to/,
fodder, Agatharch.61. f.l. for ke/nwma, A.Fr.275.

xi_lw/neios, a, on,
of or
from *xi/lwn, to\ X. the
saying of Chilon (i.e. mhde\n a)/gan), Arist.Rh.1389b3.

xi_lwth/r, h=ros, o(,
nose-bag for cattle or
horses, UPZ76.3 (ii B. C.), PLond.2.402.24 (ii B. C.), Poll.1.185, Hsch.

xi/mair-a [i^], h(,
she-goat, Il.6.181, Hes.Th.322, PCair.Zen.576.3 (iii B. C.); sacrificed before battle to *)/artemis *)agrote/ra, A.Ag.232 (lyr.), X.An.3.2.12, HG4.2.20, Lac.13.8; qallo\n ximai/rais prosfe/rwn S.Fr.502;
a young she-goat (cf. xi/maros), Arist.HA523a1; x. e)c ai)gw=n
kid, LXX Le.4.28,29. *xi/maira, h(,
Chimaera, a fire-breathing monster, Il.6.179, cf. 16.328; Hes.Th.319, etc.; x. pu/rpnoos Anaxil.22.3 (troch.), Epinic.2.10. expld. as mythical for a volcano in Lycia, Str.14.3.5.
ximair-a/s, a/dos, h(, = foreg.1, Schwyzer 644.16 (Aegae).

ximai/r-eios, a, on,
of a goat, qra/sos Hdn.Epim.149.

ximair-i/s, i/dos, h(,
kid, Alciphr.Fr.6.10.

xi^mairo-ba/ths [a^], ou, Dor. xi^mai/ro-tas, o(,
goat-mounter, or
goat-footed, of Pan. AP6.35 (Leon.).

xi^mairo-qu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
goat-sacrificer, ib. 300 (Id.).

xi^mairo-fo/nos, on,
goat-slaying, ib.9.774 (Glauc.).

xi^mairo-fu/lac [u^], akos, o(,
goatherd, A.D.Adv.188.27.
xi^ma/ra [a^r], h(, = xi/maira 1, AP9.317.

xi^ma/rarxos [ma^], o(,
goat-leader, tra/gos x. the he-goat
that leads the flock, AP9.744 (Leon.).
xi^ma^rokto/nos, on, = ximairofo/nos, Opp.C.1.233.

xi/ma^ros [i^], o(,
he-goat, Ar.Eq.661, Schwyzer784a1 (Tenos, iv B. C.), Theoc.Ep.4.15, AP6.190.10 (Gaet.): a young he-goat, older than e)/rifos, Ar.Byz. ap. Eust.1625.33; x. e)c ai)gw=n
kid, LXX Le.4.23; x. e)ruqro/s Berl.Sitzb.1927.156 (Cyrene). fem. = xi/maira, Theoc.1.6, Epigr.6.3, AP6.157 (Theodorid.), 9.403 (Maec.). (Cogn. with xei=ma, xeimw/n, lit. 'one winter old', cf. Lat.
bīmus (fr.
*b[icaron]-h[icaron]mus, cf. Skt.
himás 'winter').)

xi^ma^rosfakth/r, h=ros, o(,
goat-slayer, lu/kos AP9.558 (Eryc.).

entryFree.sense: = xime/tlon, Parod. Epic. ap. Arist.Rh.1412a31; v.l. in Dsc.2.42.

div0.entryFree: xi^me/tl-h, h(, = xi/metlon, Dsc.1.128, 2.42.

xi^metl-ia/w,
have chilblains, ib.37.

xi^/metl-on, to/,
chilblain, mostly in pl., Hippon.19.4, Ar.V.1167, Nic.Th.682, Lyc.1290: sg., Poll.2.198. (Cogn. with xei=ma; misspelt xei/meqlon, xei/metlon in Gloss.）

*xi_ogenh/s, e/s,
of Chian growth, of wine, AP11.44 (Phld.).

xi_oeidh/s, e/s,
in form of a X, Sor.2.41 (cj.); e)pi/desmos Paul.Aeg. 6.66. Adv. -dw=s Sophon.
in de An.19.34.

xi=on, to/,
a Chian wine-jar, Machoap.Ath.13.579e. a measure, PCair.Zen.12.17, al. (iii B. C.).

xi^o/n-eos, a, on, (xiw/n)
snowy, snow-white, xitw=nes Asius 13.3; sa/rc Bion 1.10; sth/qea Scol.Anon.26 (Diehl
Anthologia Lyrica (ed. 1） ii 188).
of or
from snow, u(/data Lyr.Alex.Adesp.37.12; nifa/des AP9.244 (Apollonid.); kru/stallos ib.753 (Claudian.). [i^ by nature, but i_ metri gr. in hexam.]

xi^on-i/zw,
snow upon, cover with snow: impers., ei) e)xio/nize . . th\n xw/rhn [sc. o( qeo/s] Hdt.2.22: abs., ei) e)xio/nize if
it snowed, ibid.:—Pass.,
to be covered with snow, D.S.1.39, Sm.Ps.67(68).15, Dsc.4.61, D.L.6.23 (v.l. kexionwme/nous), Sch. A.R.4.269.
turn into snow, in Pass., PMag.13.299 Preisendanz;
make snow-white, Hsch.

xi^on-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of snow, shmei=on Thphr.Sign.42.
crystalline, e)da/fh 1Enoch14.10.

xi^o/n-i^nos, h, on,
snow-white, th=| xroia=| Ptol.Euerg.10J.

xi^o/n-ion, to/, a kind of
eye-salve, Alex.Trall.2.1.

xi^on-ismo/s, o(,
snowing, Apollon.Lex. s.v. nifa/dessi, Hsch. s.v. nifeto/s.
xi^ono/-ba^tos, on, f.l. for -blhtos, o)/rea Arr.Ind.6.7.

xi^ono-ble/fa^ros, on,
with eye of dazzling white, *)aw/s Mesom.Sol.7.

xi^ono/-blhtos, on,
snow-beaten, *)olu/mpou korufai/ Ar.Nu.270 (anap.).

xi^ono-bole/omai, Pass.,
to be covered with snow, Str.15.2.10, D.S.5.39, 17.82, 18.25, Ath. Med. ap. Orib.1.2.6.

xi^ono-bo/los, on,
snowy, x. w(/ra Plu.2.182e. xiono/bolos, on,
snow-covered, o)/rh Str.9.2.25; cf. xiono/blhtos.

xi^ono/-boskos, on,
nourished by snows, leimw/n A.Supp.559 (lyr.).
xi^ono/-eis, essa, en, poet. for xio/neos, Nic.Al.512. [i_ metri gr.]

xi^ono-qre/mmwn, on, gen. -onos,
fostering snow, snow-clad, skopiai/ E.Hel.1323 (lyr.).

xi^ono/-ktu^pos, on,
snow-beaten, of a mountain, S.Aj.696 (lyr.).

xi^ono/-meli, itos, to/,
snow-honey, a cooling remedy, Gp.8.28.3.

xi^ono/-omai, Pass., v. xioni/zw.
become snow-white, LXX Ps.67(68).15.

xi^ono/-peza, h(,
with snow-white feet, Nonn.D.22.136. [i_ metri gr.]
xi^ono-tro/fos, on, = xionoqre/mmwn, *)arte/midos -tro/fon o)/mma *kiqairw/n E.Ph.802 (hex.).

xi^ono/-xroos, on, heterocl. acc. pl. -xroas,
snow-white, ma=zai Philox.2.6.

xi^ono/-xrws, wtos, o(, h(,
snow-white, of a swan, E.Hel.215 (lyr.).

xi^on-w/dhs, es,
snowy, Hp.Epid.3.2, E.Hec.81 (anap.), A.R.1.826,
Nic.Al.150, Call.Fr.1.53P.; bo/lba AP11.410 (Luc.); ai)=ges Orac. ap.D.S.7.16.

xi^on-wpo/s, o/n,
snow-white, fair, Nonn.D.17.43.

*xi/os [i^], h(,
Chios, Od.3.170, Hdt.1.142, etc.: sts. with Art., Th. 8.15,28,38,99,101. [*xi=on e)s a)mfiru/thn is dub. in Simon.[119]; but *xi=os is found IG2.3412.]

*xi=os, a, on, (contr. from *xi/ios)
of or
from Chios, *xi=ai [krhpi=des] Hp.Art.62, cf. Aristomen.11, etc.; su/kina PCair.Zen.33.12 (iii B. C.); *x. a)oido/s, i. e.
Homer, Theoc.7.47; x. a)/nqrwpos D.35.52: prov., *xi=os despo/thn w)nh/sato 'caught a Tartar', Eup.269. esp. oi)=nos *x. Ar.Ec.1139: freq. without oi)=nos, Id.Fr.216.3, etc.; e)n a)krh/tw| *xi/w| AP7.422 (Leon.). as Subst., *xi=oi or oi( *xi=oi the Chians; without Art., Hdt.1.142, Th.1.19, 3.32, etc.; with Art., Id.8.15,22, etc. o( *xi=os (sc. bo/los), = ku/wn v1, the worst throw of the dice (cf. xia/s), i. e. the external face of the a)stra/galos (Ruf.Oss. 38), with the
ace-dot, opp. *kw=|os (q. v.), *xi=os parasta\s *kw=|on ou)k e)a=| le/gein Stratt.23, cf. Arist.Cael.292a29, AP7.422 (Leon.), Poll. 7.204, 205, Zen.4.74: hence prov., *xi=os pro\s *kw=|on ibid. (in Arist. HA499b29 xi=a is cj. for i)sxi/a, kw=|a for kw=la). ou) *xi=os a)lla\ *kei=os, v. *ke/ws. *xi/a, h(, = masti/xh, Gloss.

*xi_ourgh/s, e/s,
of Chian work, Critias 35; *xiourge/s, to/ (sc. poth/rion), IG11(2).110.27 (Delos, iii B. C.): pl., ib.111, 112.

xi_o/w, (xi=)
mark with a *x or
cross, Tz.H.5.164.
write or
mark crosswise, ku/klos e)p' eu)qei/as xiou/menos Lyd.Mens.3.4: pf. inf. kexiw=sqai Eun.Hist.p.272D.

xi_ra^le/os, a, on,
with chapped hands or
feet, Hsch.
xi/rama, atos, to/, a disease in horses' feet, Hippiatr.52.
xi_ra/s, = xeira/s, Suid.
xita/nallon, v. kitta/nalon.

xi^tw/n, in Ion.Prose ki^qw/n, w=nos, o( (also prob. in Sammelb.4291), Dor. ki^tw/n (q. v.):—
garment worn next the skin, tunic. in early times, only of
a man's tunic (the woman's being pe/plos, Sch.BT Il.2.42), xitw=na peri\ xroi/+ du=nen Od.15.60; kiqw=nas u(podu/nein toi=si ei(/masi Hdt.1.155: sts. with a girdle, Od.14.72; termio/eis 19.242, Hes.Op. 537; malako/s, e)u/+nnhtos, Od.1.437, Il.24.580; [x.] lampro/s . . h)e/lios w(/s Od.19.234; xlai=na/n te xitw=na/ te 14.132, 154; oi( d' a)roth=res h)/reikon xqo/na di=an e)pistola/dhn de\ xitw=nas e)sta/lat' Hes.Sc.287. later worn also by women, a(/ma kiqw=ni e)kduome/nw| sunekdu/etai kai\ th\n ai)dw= gunh/ Hdt.1.8; su/roisa xitw=na Theoc.2.73; the Ionian sleeved x. was distd. fr the Dorian, fastened with pero/nai, mete/balon [ai( tw=n *)aqhnai/wn gunai=kes] e)s to\n li/neon k. i(/na dh\ pero/nh|si mh\ xre/wntai Hdt. 5.87; oi( presbu/teroi [tw=n *)aqhnai/wn] ou) polu\s xro/nos e)peidh\ xitw=nas linou=s e)pau/santo forou=ntes Th.1.6, cf. Eust.954.50; x. podh/rhs, o)rqosta/dios, stato/s (v. sub vocc.); kiqw\n podhnekh/s, worn by Babylonians, Hdt.1.195; kiqw=nes li/neoi peri\ ta\ ske/lea qusanwtoi/, worn by Egyptians, Id.2.81; kiqw=nes ei)ri/neoi, worn by Cilicians, Id.7.91; dub. in E.IT288(pl.).
coat of mail, prob. of leather covered with scales or rings, strepto\s x. Il.5.113; x. xa/lkeos 13.439; kiqw=nes xeiridwtoi\ lepi/dos sidhre/hs
coats of iron scales with sleeves, Hdt.7.61 (s. v.l.): but distd. fr. qw/rhc Id.9.22, cf. X.Cyr.6.4.1.
part of a shoe that coats the foot, upper, ib.8.2.5 (pl.), Arist.Rh.1392a31. metaph.,
any coat, case, or
covering, la/i+nos xitw/n (v. la/i+nos） teixe/wn kiqw=nes, i. e. walls, Hdt.7.139; in Anatomy,
coat, membrane, to\n a)mfi\ th\n o)/yin x. Hp.VM19, cf. Aph.7.45, Epicur. Nat.2.993.1; o( . . x. th=s kardi/as Arist.Resp.480a4; x. u(menw/dhs, a)raxniw/dhs, Id.PA679a1, HA557b16; tou= w)|ou= oi( x. oi( perie/xontes ib. 561a14; of foetal
membranes, Sor.1.7,58, al.; triglofo/roi xitw=nes, of fishing-nets, AP6.11 (Satyr.); xitw=nes a)raxni/wn spiders'
webs, Hp.Int.3: pl.,
pods or
coats of seeds, bulbous roots, etc., Thphr. HP1.12.3, 8.4.1, CP1.4.1, al.
vesture, [fu/sis] sarkw=n a)llognw=ti periste/llousa (sc. yuxa/s） xitw=ni Emp.126; sw=ma x. yuxh=s IG14.2241: pl., prosqe/sei xitw/nwn e)nulote/rwn, of the soul, Procl. Inst.209. (Accad.
kitinnu 'linen garment', Hebr.
kětōnet 'tunic'; xeqw\n ga\r to\ li/non h(mei=s kalou=men J.AJ3.7.2.)

xi^twn-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xitw/n,
woman's frock, Men.727, PCair.Zen.469 (iii B. C.); of men's wear, AP11.154 (Lucill.), Arr.Epict. 1.25.21; of a baby's
frock, Sor.1.111.

xi^tw/n-h, h(, a name of Artemis, represented as a huntress in a short Dorian xitw/n, Call.Jov.77, Dian. 225; xitwne/a *)/a., at Syracuse, Epich.127, Ath.14.629e; kiqw/nh, at Miletus, Milet.1(7) No.202.

xi^twn-i/a, h(,
dress, Melamp.Naev.p.508 Franz.

xi^tw/n-ion, to/, Dim. of xitw/n, prop.
woman's frock or
shift, Ar.Ra.414 (lyr.), Pl.984, Lys.48,150, Fr.325; to\ gunaikei=on todi\ x. ib.632, cf. IG12.386.23, 387.34, 22.1514.51, 1517.125, al., PCair.Zen.776.8 (iii B. C.); also of men's wear, Luc.Merc.Cond.37: prov., [ou) pre/pei] galh=| x. Stratt.71.
xi^twn-iska/rion, to/, Dim. of xitwni/skos, Eust.1166.51.
xi^twn-i/skion, to/, Dim. of sq., IG22.1514.28.
xi^twn-i/skos, o( （

kiqwni/skos ib.1523.18), Dim. of xitw/n,
short frock (u(pe\r gona/twn X.An.5.4.13), worn by men, Ar.Av.946, Lys.10.10, Phld.Ir.p.39W., etc.; with a girdle, Pl.Hp.Mi.368c; w(/ste me . . qoi)ma/tion proe/sqai kai\ mikrou= gumno\n e)n tw=| x. gene/sqai D.21.216, cf. Pl.Hp.Mi. 368c: less freq. of women,
shift, D.19.197, IG22.1514.12, al.; sxisto\s x. Apollod.Com.12.
coat of an abscess, Archig. ap. Aët.8.76.

xi_wdw=s, Adv. = xioeidw=s, Pall.
in Hp.Fract.12.285C.

xiw/n, o/nos, h(: (v. sub fin.):—
snow, in Hom. mostly of
fallen snow, Il.10.7, 22.152; w(s de\ x. katath/ket' e)n . . o)/ressin Od.19.205; u(/perqe x. ge/net' h)u/+te pa/xnh 14.476; to\n *nei=lon r(e/ein a)po\ thkome/nhs xio/nos Hdt.2.22; e)pi\ xio/ni pesou/sh| ibid., cf.4.50; *)idai/a x. A.Ag.564; h(/lios . . th/kei petrai/an xio/na Id.Fr.300.5; kai/ nin . . xiw\n ou)dama\ lei/pei S.Ant.830(lyr.); also of
falling snow, w(/s te nifa/des xio/nos pi/ptwsi qameiai/ thick fall the
snow-flakes, Il.12.278; x. pi/ptousa Hdt.4.31; kate/neiye xio/ni th\n *qra/|khn Ar.Ach.138; o(/tan bore/as xio/na xe/h| E.Cyc. 329, cf. Ba.662; e)pipi/ptei x. X.An.4.4.11; xio/nes pollai\ gi/nontai Thphr.Sign.24: [x.] sfodra\ kai\ a)qro/a kataferome/nh nifeto\s w)no/mastai Arist.Mu.394a36.
snow-water, 'ice-coldwater, *qrh/|khn xio/ni . . kata/rruton E.Andr.215; x. potami/a Id.Tr.1067 (lyr.); used to cool wine, ei) xiw/n e)st' w)ni/a Euthycl.1; oi)=non piei=n . . xio/ni memigme/non Stratt.57; xio/na pi/nein Alex.141.10; tou= qe/rous xio/na . . zhtei=s *x. Mem.2.1.30; h(du\ qe/rous . . xiw\n poto/n AP5.168 (Ascl.): rare in pl., Arist.Mu.394a16. [i^ by nature, i_ Ep. metri gr.] (Cf. Skt.
himás 'cold, winter', Lat.
hiems, Avest.
zyam- 'winter', etc.)

xlabo/s, h/, o/n,
well-fed, Hsch.; cf. xlamuro/s.

*xla/dw,
exult loudly, assumed as pres. of ke/xla_da, wh. occurs thrice in Pi., kalli/nikos . . kexladw/s, of a triumphal hymn, O.9.2; kexla/dontas h(/ba, of two young heroes, P.4.179; ke/xladen kro/tala Dith.Oxy.2.10; Hsch. has kexlhde/nai: yofei=n.

xlai=na, hs, h(,
upper-garment, cloak, wrapper, worn loose over the xitw/n, Hom. (v. infr.), Alc.Supp.9.3, Sapph.Supp.22.9, etc.: in Hom. worn only by men, a)nemoskeph/s, a)leca/nemos, Il.16.224, Od. 14.529; puknh\ kai\ mega/lh ib.520; ou)/lh 4.50, al.; a)mfi\ d' a)/ra xlai=nan peronh/sato foiniko/essan diplh=n e)ktadi/hn Il.10.133; a)p' w)/moii+n x. qe/to Od.21.118; bh= de\ qe/ein, a)po\ de\ x. ba/le Il.2.183, cf. Od.14.500; given as a prize, Hdt.2.91; as ransom, Il.24.230; ai( *pellhnikai\ x. a(\s kai\ a)=qla e)ti/qesan e)n toi=s a)gw=si Str.8.7.5; also used as a
blanket or
covering in sleep, Od.4.299, 20.4; de/mnia kai\ xlai=nai kai\ r(h/gea 11.189; xlai=nai kai\ r(h/gea . . e)neu/dein 3.349; of husband and wife, mi/mnomen mia=s u(po\ xlai/nhs S.Tr.540, cf. E.Fr.603.4, Theoc.18.19, AP5.164 (Mel.), 168 (Ascl.): metaph., xqono\s xlai=na, i. e. earth thrown over a body
like a cloak or
blanket, A.Ag.872: porv., h(=| mh/te x. mh/te sisu/ra sumfe/rei content neither with
cloak nor rug, i.e. never satisfied, Ar.Ra.1459 (the sisu/ra being coarser, cf. xlai=nan malakh/n, sisu/ran Id.V.738 (anap.)); but also x. de/ soi labw\n paxei=an e)pibalw= *lakwnikh/n Theopomp.Com.10; x. pwlei=n, when spring comes, Ar.Av.715 (anap.), cf. xlai=na: xlani/s, h)\ i(ma/tion xeimerino/n, Hsch.: prov., e)n tw=| qe/rei th\n x. katat ri/bwn, of reckless improvidence, Metrod.Fr.55: tra/gou x. mele/a, of a goatskin
cloak, E.Cyc.80 (lyr.).

xlainhfo/ros, on,
wearing a xlai=na, Epic. in BKT5(1).115.

xlain-i/zw,
clothe with a xlai=na, Hdn.Epim.149.
xlain-i/on, to/, Dim. of xlai=na, AP12.40.

xlain-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who clothes with a xlai=na, Hdn.Epim.149.
xlainoqh/ras, ou, o(, = lwpodu/ths, Eust.1863.59.

xlain-o/w,
cover with a cloak, fa/rei+ AP9.293 (Phil.): generally,
clothe, ei(/masi Nonn.D.1.373.

xlai/n-wma, atos, to/,
clothing, x. le/ontos the lion's skin
cloak, APl.4.104 (Phil.).

xla^mu^dhfo/ros, o(,
one who wears a xlamu/s, epith. of ephebi, Theoc.15.6, IGRom.4.360.25 (Pergam., ii A. D.).

xla^mu/d-ion [u^], to/, Dim. of xlamu/s, Men.442 (troch.), PCair.Zen. 609.4 (iii B. C.), D.S.19.9, Plu.Rom.8, etc.; worn by e)/fhboi, pri\n e)ggrafh=nai kai\ labei=n to\ x. Antidot.2.2, cf. Teles p.42H.
shabby cloak, Plu.Phoc.29, Demetr.9, etc.
xla^mud-i/skh, h(, in Boeot. form xla^moudi/ska, = foreg. 1, Schwyzer 462B36 (Tanagra, iii B. C.).

xla^mu^do-eidh/s, e/s,
like a xlamu/s
in shape, Str.2.5.9, 14.

xla^mu^do-poii/a, h(,
making of xlamu/des, Poll.7.33, 159, v.l. in X.Mem.2.7.6.
xla^mu^doury-i/a, h(, = foreg., X.Mem.2.7.6.

xla^mu^doury-o/s, o(,
maker of xlamu/des, Poll.7.159.

xla^mu^dofore/w,
wear a xlamu/s, = *qettali/zein, Poll.7.46.

xla^mudo/omai, Pass.,
to be clad in a chlamys, meira/kion . . kexlamudwme/non Nicostr.32.
xlamuri/s, = bro/mos (B), Hsch.

xlamu^ro/s, a/, o/n,
luxurious, Hsch.; cf. xlabo/s.

xla^mu/s [u^], u/dos, h(: acc. xlamu/da, also xla/mun Sapph.674:—
short mantle, worn prop. by horsemen, X.An.7.4.4; borrowed with the pe/tasos from Thessaly, Philem.34, Poll.10.124; but said to be Macedonian, Arist.Fr.500, Phylarch.62J.; worn by e)/fhboi, Philem. l.c., cf. AP6.282 (Theod.); ma/thr se . . dw=ron e)s *(/aidan o)ktwkaideke/tan e)sto/lisen xlamu/di ib.7.468 (Mel.); xlamu/dess' a)mfemme/noi, of ephebi, IGRom.4.360.35 (Pergam., ii A. D.); e)k xlamu/dos, = e)c e)fh/bou, Plu.2.752f, cf. 754f; e)k xlamu/dos . . w)/|xet' e)s *(/aida IG12(7).447.6 (Amorgos); worn by Hermes, Luc.Tim.30; also by Eros, Sapph. l.c. (v. Poll.10.124), Philostr.Im.1.6, cf. AP12.78 (Mel.). generally,
military cloak, of foot-soldiers, Antiph.16, Men.331, Plu.Phil.11, etc.; of heralds, Ar.Lys.987. of
the general's cloak, Phld.Vit.p.27J., Plu.Per.35, Lys.13, etc.; worn by kings, Id.Demetr.42, etc.; by tragic kings and heroes, Luc.JTr.41; by *seilhnoi/ in a procession, Callix.2: = Lat.
paludamentum, D.C.59.17, 60.17, al., Hdn.4.7.3, Cod.Theod.14.10.1. a civilian's
mantle, PCair.Zen.263.2, al. (iii B. C.), PLond.2.402 ii 16 (ii B. C.), X.Eph.1.8 cod., POxy.1288.24 (iv A. D.). (For its shape cf. Plu. Alex.26.)

xla^ni/d-ion [i^d], to/, Dim. of xlani/s, mostly of
a woman's mantle, Hdt.1.195, Chaerem.14.9, Trag.Adesp.7, E.Supp.110, Ar.Lys.1190 (lyr.): pl., of
blankets, bedclothes, E.Or.42: later, = Lat.
paludamentum, Jul.
ad Ath.277a; contemptuously addressed to Cicero, ta\ lepta/ sou x. D.C.46.18:—also xla/ndion, Michel832.30 (Samos, iv B. C.), GDI5633.13 (near Teos).
xla^nid-i/ska, a(, Boeot., = foreg., Schwyzer 462 B33 (Tanagra, iii B. C.).
xla^nid-i/skion, to/, = xlani/dion, Aristaenet.1.11 (nisi leg. xlaniski/dion).

xla^ni^do-poii/a, h(,
trade of a xlanidopoio/s, X.Mem.2.7.6.

xla^ni^do-poio/s, o(,
maker of xlani/des, Poll.7.159.
xla^ni^d-ourgi/a, h(, = xlanidopoi/a, Poll.7.34.

xla^ni/s, i/dos, h(,
upper-garment of wool, finer than xlai=na (but gloss on xlai=na, Hsch.), worn by women as well as men, Simon.37.12, Hdt.3.139, 140, Phld.Vit.p.21J., etc.; used by old people, Ar.Ec. 848, Antiph.33.3; *milhsi/a x., i. e. of fine wool, Plu.Alc.23, 2.583e; xlani/da forei=n, as a mark of effeminacy, D.36.45, cf. 21.133; parqenikai\ . . xlani/sin malkai=s kata/qruptoi Eub.108 (hex.), cf. Com.Adesp.338; semno\s semnw=s xlani/d' e(/lkwn Ephipp.19 (anap.), cf. Anaxil.18.2 (anap.); opp. the tri/bwn of the philosophers, Teles p.40H., cf. p.53H.; worn on festive occasions, gamikh\ x. a wedding
mantle, Ar.Av.1693; x. leukh/ Id.Fr.491; used as a
blanket, AP5.172（Mel.), Plu.2.989f. later, = xlamu/s 3, Lat.
paludamentum, Jul.
ad Ath.274c, 278d.
xla^ni/skion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ar.Ach.519, Aeschin.1.131; u(po\ tou)mo\n koimwme/nh x. Alciphr.1.38.
xla^niski/dion, to/, = foreg., Ar.Pax 1002 (anap.).

xlani/tides, ai(,
necklaces, Hsch. xla/nos: to\ peri\ tou\s traxh/lous da/sos, Id.

xla_ro/s, a/, o/n, only Pi.P.9.38 xla_ro\n (v.l. xliaro/n） gela/ssais to laugh
exultingly, gaily (fort. xloaro/n); but Hsch. has xlaro/n: ko/xlac; also, = r(uparo/n, lepto/n, truxale/on, w)xro/n, and = e)laihro\s kw/qwn, Id.

xlemero/s, a/, o/n,
warm; and xlemuro/s, a/, o/n,
fresh-growing, Hsch.
xle/os, o(, = xlh=dos, IG5(2).4.19 (Tegea, iv B. C.).

xleu-a/zw, (xleu/h)
jest, scoff, e)piskw/ptwn kai\ pai/zwn kai\ x. Ar.Ra. 376 (lyr.); toi=s katagelw=si kai\ x. kai\ skw/ptousi Arist.Rh.1379a29, cf. Plb.4.3.13, Cerc.18 ii 5, Phld.Lib.p.29 O., etc. c. acc.,
scoff, jeer at, treat scornfully, tina Pl.Erx.397d, D.7.7, 19.23, 47.34, D.C.Fr.109.16; e)mauth\n . . le/lhqa xleua/zous' Men.Epit.215; c. acc. rei, Plu.Rom.10, etc.:—Med., Id.Brut.45:—Pass., Epicr.11.31 (anap.), Arist.Pr.952b22, Plu.Sert.13, 25, 2.504f.
xleu=-ac, a_kos, o(, Com. for xleuasth/s, Poll.9.149.

xleu-a^si/a, h(,
mockery, scoffing, D.24.16, Arist.Top.144a6, D.C.39.19, al.

xleu/-asma, atos, to/,
mockery, LXX Jb.12.4, Sch.B Il.14.459.

xleu-asmo/s, o(, = xleuasi/a, D.18.85, Plb. 18.6.5, Phld.Herc.1457.9(pl.), etc.; meta\ xleuasmou= Plb.8.6.5; e)pi\ xleuasmw=| Plu.2.277c; as a figure of speech,
irony, Anon.Fig.p.213S.
mockery, x. ei)=nai to\ xrh=ma h(gou/menos Plu.Pomp.36;
piece of impertinence, Id.Arat.39.

xleu-asth/s, ou=, o(,
mocker, scoffer, Arist.Rh.1380a29, Procl.Par.Ptol.230, Poll.9.149, etc.: c. gen., M. Ant.6.47.

xleu-astiko/s, h/, o/n,
derisory, skw=mma Ph.2.552. Adv. -kw=s Satyr.Vit.Eur.Fr.39 xvii 9, Poll.6.200.

xleu/h, h(,
joke, jest, h.Cer.202 (pl.); xleu/hn poiei=sqai/ or ti/qesqai/ tina (or ti) make
a jest of . . , Aeschrio 8, Ph.2.111; pra=gma xleu/hs a)/cion Luc.Par.40, cf. Hdn.7.8.4. (Cf. ONorse
glý, OE.
gléo 'glee'.)

xlh/dhs, ou, o(,
eunuch, Hsch.

xlh=dos, o(,
slime, mud, the rubbish carried down by a flood or
swept out of a house, A.Fr.16, D.55.22, 27: metaph., a)rguri/ou xlh=don labw/n Crates Com.28 (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.142; xli/dos Suid.).

xlia/, h(,
warmth, D.S.34/5.15. xlia/zw,
warm, Sch.Nic.Al.206.

xliai/nw, fut. -a^nw= Ar.Lys.386: pf. kexli/agka Hsch.: Ion. aor. 1 e)xli/hna Hermesian.7.89: inf. xli_h=nai AP9.244 (Apollonid.):— Pass., aor. e)xlia/nqhn, Luc.Am.40, etc.: (xli/w):—
warm, seauto/n Ar. l. c., cf. S.Eleg.4; kata\ mikro\n x. tina/ Arist.Pr.888b40; x. i(/n' h( o)du/nh e)/xh|
foment the painful place, Hp.Aff.10; proopth/santa x. pa/lin
warm up meat, Alex.149.11; opp. o)pta=n, Arist.Pr.929b31:— Pass.,
warm oneself, grow warm, dub. in Ar.Ec.64 (leg. e)xraino/mhn）; ke/rata xliaino/mena tw=| khrw=|
smeared with hot wax, Arist.HA595b12; oi)=nos kexliasme/nos Sor.2.87; of persons affected by fever, Hp.Coac. 154; esp.
to be warmed by contact, xrwti/ AP5.164, al. (Mel.): also metaph. of passion, ei)dw/lois ka/lleus kwfa\ x. ib.12.125 (Id.). [i_ in Ar.Lys., Alex., Hermesian., Apollonid.; i^ in S.Eleg., Ar.Ec. l. c. (sed v. supr.), Mel.]

xlia^ro/s, a/, o/n, also o/s, o/n Nic.Al.360; Ion. xliero/s (also in Alcm. 33.5, Sor.1.52; misspelt xlierion in PHolm.16.27), h/, o/n:（xli/w):—
warm, Epich.[290]; u(/dwr Hdt.4.181, Diocl.Fr.139, Sor.1.82; of food, Magnes 1, Cratin.125 (troch.), 143 (hex.), Ar.Ach.975 (lyr.); to\ sw=ma h(mw=n a)tmi/da tina\ x. a)fi/hsin Arist.Pr.884b17; to\ x. to\ e)n glw/ssh| Placit.4.18.1. Adv. xlihrw=s (v.l. -rw=|) Hp.Fist.9; katapla/ssein xlihro/n ibid. of persons,
lukewarm, Apoc.3.16. [i_ in Com. ll. cc.; but i^ in Epich. l. c., Alcm. l. c.]

xlia^ro/ths, htos, h(,
warmth, Procl.Par.Ptol.53.

xlia^royu/xion [u_], to/,
tepid bath, Gloss.

xli/-asma, atos, to/,
fomentation, in pl., Hp.
Acut.(Sp.）33, Mul.1.35, Sor.2.28.

xli-a/w,
to be warm, in Ep. part., xli^o/wnti potw=| Nic. Al.110 (v.l. xlio/enti） kri/mnon xlia/on Id.Fr.68.8 (sed leg. xliaro/n）; a)ta\r h(go\s a)fa/sswn ste/rna po/qw| xlia/oi dub. sens. in Hesperia 5.95 (Athens, iii A. D.).
xli/bion, to/, an Egyptian measure, sko/rdwn, tari/xou, Aegyptus 9.268 (ii A. D.).

xli^d-ai/nomai, Pass.,
to be luxurious, a(bro/thti xlidai/nesqai
revel in luxury, lead a voluptuous, sensual life, X.Smp.8.8.

xli^d-a^no/s, h/, o/n, Aeol. xli/da^nos [i^], a, on,
luxurious, delicate, voluptuous, Sapph. Supp.21.8; xlidanh=s h(/bhs te/ryin A.Pers.544 (anap.); e(tai/ra E.Cyc. 500 (lyr.); of Alcibiades, Plu.Alc.23; cf. xlidh/ sub fin.

xli^d-a^no/sfu^ros, on,
with delicate ankles, Anacreont.41.7.

xli^d-a/w, poet. Verb,
to be soft or
delicate, xlidw=sa molpa/ Pi.O.10(11).84; xlidw=n plo/kamos A.Fr.313: but mostly in bad sense,
live delicately or
luxuriously, Ar.Lys.640 (troch.); rare in Prose, x. kata\ th\n di/aitan Arr.An.5.4.4: c. dat.,
revel in, toi=s parou=si pra/gmasi A.Pr.971; plou/tw| E.Fr. 986; pw/gwni S.Ichn.358; x. e)pi/ tini
to pride oneself upon a thing, dw=r' e)f' oi(=si nu=n xlida=|s Id.El.360: abs.,
show insolence, A.Supp.833 (lyr., s. v. l.).

xli^d-h/, h(,
delicacy, luxury, effeminacy, e)pi\ plei=ston xlidh=s a)pi/keto Hdt.6.127; a)/galma th=s u(perplou/tou x. A.Pr.466; eu)nh=s paroyw/nhma th=s e)mh=s x. Id.Ag.1447; oi)=kos o)gkwqei\s xlidh=| S.Fr.942; trufh/, a(bro/ths, x. Pl.Smp.197d; e)n xlidh=| teqra/mmeqa X.Cyr.4.5.54.
wantonness, insolence, mh/ toi xlidh=| dokei=te mhd' au)qadi/a| siga=n me A.Pr.436; duspo/tmou xa/rin x. S.OT888 (lyr.). concrete, of
luxuries, fine raiment, costly ornaments, etc., E.Ion 26; muri/wn pe/plwn xlidh/ Id.Rh.960: pl., xlida\s po/ntos h(/rpase Id.Hel. 424; of
personal charms, parqe/nwn xlidai=sin eu)mo/rfois A.Supp. 1003; kara/tomoi xlidai/
luxuriant hair cut from the head, S.El.52; zw=ma . . ou) xlidai=s h)skhme/non
luxuriously, richly, ib.452; ko/mas e)ma=s . . parqe/nion xlida/n a maiden's
pride, E.Ph.224 (lyr.):—Mostly poet. [i_ only late, Ps.-Phoc.212 (sed leg. xlidanai=s).] (Cf. xloida=n, ONorse
glita, glitra, 'glitter', Goth.
glitmunjan 'shine bright' (of clothes).)
xli^/d-hma, atos, to/, = xlidh/, E.IA74.

xli^d-i^a/w, Desiderat.,
wish to be luxurious, cj. Lobeck (Path.El.1.157) for kixlidia/w in Com.Adesp.1038.
xli^/d-os, eos, to/, = xli/dhma, Ion Trag.3. v. xlh=dos. xlido/s: sakkopa/qnion, Hsch.

xli^/d-wn, wnos, o(,
ornament, bracelet, or
anklet, Asius Fr.Ep.13.6K., Ar.Fr.320.11, Polyzel.11, IG22.1388.85, 1417.9: pl., D.S.18.27, Plu.2.145a (prob. l.), LXX Nu.31.50, al. (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.2.729).
xli^d-w/nion, to/, Dim. of foreg., IG22.1445.46.

xli^dwno/pous, o(, h(, gen. -podos,
with ornaments on the feet, Hsch.

xli/dwsis, ews, h(,
ornamentation, f. l. for xli/dwsi (cf. xli/dwn), Plu.2.145a.

xli^eroqalph/s, e/s,
lukewarm, Philox.2.40.
xli^ero/s, h/, o/n, Ion. for xliaro/s: also Adv. xlihrw=s, Hp.Mul.1.78; cf. xliaro/s.
*xli/zw, only pf. part. kexlido/ta: a)nqou=nta, Hsch.
xli^o/eis, essa, en, = xliaro/s, v. l. for xlio/wnti in Nic.Al.110.
xlio/omai, Pass., = sxi/zomai, Hsch.

xli/w [i_],
luxuriate, revel, e)n toi=si soi=s po/noisi xli/ousin me/ga A.Ch. 137; o(/milon . . pe/ploisi barba/roisi . . xli/onta Id.Supp.236.

xli^w/dhs, es,
slightly hot, pureto/s Herod.Med. ap. Orib.6.20.23.

xlo-a/zw, (xlo/h)
to be bright green, Arist.Mir.846b13: esp. of plants, Corn.ND28, Plu.2.517d, Gp.11.18.8; to\ xloa/zon pa=n Ael. VH3.1.
sprout, bud, Nic.Th.576; spe/rma par' a)trapitoi=si xloa/zon ib.917. Med.,
feed on grass, Hippiatr.97. metaph., a)/rti xloazou/sas au)lhtri/das
budding, cj. for xno- in Metag.4.3 (hex.).

xlo-anqe/w,
bud, sprout, Hsch.

xlo-anqh/s, e/s,
budding, sprouting, pra/sion Nic.Th.550.
pale, Philum.Ven. 16.5, Dsc.Ther.17.

xlo-a^no/s, h/, o/n,
greenish, Lyd.Mens.1.12. f.l. for xoa/nois, Hsch.
xlo-aro/s, = xlwro/s, cj. in Pi.P.9.38; cf. xlaro/s.
xlo/-asma, atos, to/, f.l. for xlw/rasma, Gal.17(1).929.

xlo-augh/s, e/s,
with a greenish lustre, Luc.Dom.11.

xlo-a/w, = xloa/zw 1 or 11, Eup.105, Nic.Th.30, al., AP5.291 (Agath.); pri\n xloh=sai th\n gh=n Ph.1.30, cf. Jul.Caes.329d.
grow pale, Nonn.D.8.207, al.

xlo-ero/s, a/, o/n,
verdant, o)/zos Hes.Sc.393; :xloerai=s lei/makos h(donai=s E.Ba. 866 (lyr.); x. sta/dia, r(e/eqra, Id.Ion497 (lyr.), Ph.660(lyr.); x. u(lw/dh pa/gon S.Ichn.215; x. me/lea Theocr.27.67.

xlo-erotro/fos, on,
producing green grass, pedi/on E.Ph.826 (lyr.).
xlo-eu/nhs, v. xlou/nhs 1.4.

xlo/h, h(, Ion. xloi/h Hp.Acut.64, cf. infr. 11, also PTeb.112.46 (ii B. C.), Babr.181; Dor. xlo/a, as (E. in lyr., Hipp.1139, IA1058, al.):—
the first green shoot of plants in spring, nai\ ma\ mh/kwnos xlo/hn Archil.108; esp.
young green corn or
grass, Hdt.4.34, E.Hipp.l.c., IA422, etc.; xlo/hn ne/mesqai Id.Ba.735; pota\ ta\ a)po\ xloi/hs Hp. l. c.; opp. karpoi/, Pl.Ti.80d; xlo/hs genome/nhs a)po\ tou= spe/rmatos, of the corn when it first springs up, X.Oec.17.10; e)n th=| x., opp. e)n toi=s spe/rmasin, Thphr.CP4.4.7, cf. HP8.2.4; piai/nontai bo/es xlo/h| kua/mwn Arist.HA595b7. poet.,
young verdure of trees,
foliage, x. a)mpe/lou E.Ba.12, cf. Supp.258, Ion 1435, Hel.180 (lyr.), 1360 (lyr.).
juice of green shoots, x. e)lai/as IG7.3073.162 (Lebad. ii B. C.): but saturi/ou xlo/h| is prob. f.l. for sau/rou xolh=| in Gp.10.21.12.
vegetables, herbs, greens, Antiph.1.5, Sotad.Com.1.9, al. epith. of Demeter,
Verdant, from the young corn, worshipped in Attica, IG22.1356.16, Semus19, Paus.1.22.3; at Myconos, etc., SIG1024.11 (Myconos, iii/ii B. C.), Corn.ND28; *dh/mhtros *xloi/hs i(ero/n IG22.5006.4; also *xlo/h alone, ib.1358.49, Ar. Lys.835. (Perh. cogn. with Lith.
[zcirc ]élti 'to be green, grow', Lat.
holus.）

xloh/-ba^fos, on,
dyed green, f.l. for xolh/bafos (q.v.).

xloh-kome/w,
have green shoots, AP9.750（Arch.).
xloh/rhs, es, = xloero/s, xlwro/s, mi=lac prob. in E.Ba.107 (lyr.); xlohro/s, Hp. ap. Gal.19.155.

xloh-to/kos, on,
producing young shoots, Luc.Trag.45.

xloh-fa^ge/w,
to be herbivorous, Ph.2.340.

xloh-fa^gi/a, h(,
eating of grass, ib. 289.

xloh-fa/gos [a^], on,
herbivorous, zw=|a ib.238.

xloh-fore/w,
put out young shoots, Thphr.HP8.6.5, Ph.1.358.

xloh-fo/ros, on,
bearing green grass or
leaves, gu/ai, e)/onea, E.Ph.647 (lyr.), 653 (lyr.); gh= Ph.2.494, al.

xlo/i+a, ta/,
festival of Demeter *xlo/h and *ko/rh at Eleusis, IG22, 949.7, 35, cf. xloia/ (sic): e(orth\ a)po\ tw=n karpw=n （ka/lpwn cod.), Hsch.
xloida=n: die/lkesqai kai\ trufa=n, Hsch.; also xloidw=si: qru/ptontai, Id., and xloide/skousai: gastri/zousai, Id. (Cf. xlidh/, xlida/w.）
xloio/omai, Pass., = xlwrai/nomai, Hp. ap. Gal.19.155, Gal.17(1).343.

xloo/-karpos, on,
producing green fruits, epith. of Demeter, Orph. H.40.5.

xloo/-morfos, on,
like grass, greenish, ib.84.6.

xlo/os, o(,
greenish-yellow or
light green colour: hence,
pallor, x. ei(=le pareia/s A. R.2.1216, cf. 3.298, Nic.Al.570, 579; deielinh\n th\n d' ei(=le kako\s x. Call.Aet.3.1.12; contr. xlou=s Hp. ap. Gal.19.155.
xlosso/s, o(, Ion. for i)xqu=s, Hsch.

xloubokera^meu/s, e/ws, o(, perh.
maker of ovens or
kilns, POxy.1913.21 (vi A. D.).
xlou/dein, v. xlou/nhs 11.3.
xloui/a, h(, dub. sens. in PHarris 79 (iii A. D.).

xlou/neios, a, on,
of the wild boar, Zonar.: neut. *xlou/neion, to/, place-name, Hdn.Gr.2.459.

xlou/nhs, ou, o(, Ep. epith. of the wild boar, x. su=s a)/grios Il.9.539; xlou=nai su/es Hes.Sc.177; suw=n a)ge/lai xlou/nwn ib.168; x. ka/pros Call.Dian.150. xlou/nhs alone, as Subst., = ka/pros,
wild boar, Opp.H.1.12: hence h)/nuse . . xlou/nhnde reached the
wild boar's lair Nic.Fr.74.6. The word was variously interpreted: = tomi/as,
castrated (because larger and more vicious), Arist.HA578b1, etc.: hence x. te kai\ gu/nandros a)nh/r, o( x. te kai\ gu/nnis, Ael.Fr.10. = monio/s,
solitary, kata/ te xalepo/thta kai\ a)lkh/n Ar.Byz. ap. Eust. 772.59. = a)fristh/s,
foaming at the mouth, from Dor. *xlou/dein, = a)fri/zein, Sch.B Il.9.539. = xloeu/nhs, o( e)n th=| xlo/h| eu)nazo/menos,
couching in the grass or
greenwood, Apollon.
Lex., AB1260, EM812.46.
robber, cf. xlou=nai: lwpodu/tai oi( th=| xlo/h| eu)nazo/menoi, Hsch.; thus a)/ndra d' e(spe/rhs kaqeu/donta a)p' w)=n e)/duse . . xlou/nhs Hippon.61; h)\ fw=ras a)naide/as h(/ tina xlou/nhn Alex.Aet.5.7; so perh. makroskelh\s me\n a)=ra mh\ x. tis h)=|; A.Fr.62.

xlou=nis, h(,
virility, spe/rmato/s t' a)pofqorai\ (Musgrave a)pofqora=|） pai/dwn kakou=tai x. A.Eu.188.
xlouno/s, o(, = xruso/s, Hsch.
xlou=s, v. xlo/os.

xlow/dhs, es,
grass-green, greenish-yellow, pale, Hp.Epid.4.13, Pl. Ti.83b, Thphr.HP3.18.8, 7.9.2, Gp.10.74.1.

xlurw/n, =
sanium, Gloss. (dub.).

xlwr-a/zw,
eat green provender, Gal.17(1).929.

xlwr-a^qe/w,
gleam green (formed on the analogy of leukaqe/w), cj. in Theoc.25.158, IG14.1389 ii 24 (v. qe/w (B): but these poets may have meant xlwra\ qeou/sh| （-an), misunderstanding leukaqeo/ntwn in Hes.Sc.146).

xlwr-ai/nomai, Pass.,
become pale, aor. part. Pass. -anqei/s S.Fr.1114; -ai/nesqai as expl. of (e)k-）xloiou=sqai, Gal.17(1).343:—Act. in Gloss.

xlwr-a/kopon [a^], to/, a
green plaster for the relief of pain (cf. a)/kopos 11.2), Heras ap.Gal.13.1046.
xlw/r-asma, atos, to/, = xlwro/ths, Hp. Epid.6.2.6.
xlwr-a/w or xlwr-e/w, = xlwria/w, f.l. in Jul.Caes.329d.

xlwr-eu/s, e/ws, o(, an unknown
bird, Arist.HA609a7, Plin.HN10.203, Ael.NA 5.48.

xlwr-hi/+s, i/dos, pecul. poet. fem. of xlwro/s,
of the greenwood, or (less prob.)
pale green, epith. of the nightingale, xlwrhi/+s a)hdw/n Od.19.518.

xlwr-i/asis, ews, h(,
a greenish colour, paleness, Hsch. s.v. xlo/os.

xlwr-ia/w,
to be greenish, to be pale, Hp.Epid.4.35, Longus 4.31.

xlwr-i/zw,
to be greenish or
pale, LXXLe.13.49, 14.37; li/qos -i/zwn Herm. Trism. in Rev.Phil.32.258, cf. Aët.4.9.
xlwr-iko/s, h/, o/n, perh. f.l. for xwriko/s, a)rtemisi/a PMag.Par.1.914.

xlwr-i/s, i/dos, h(,
greenfinch, Fringilla chloris, Arist.HA592b17, 615b32, Nic.Fr.54, Ael.NA4.47. a kind of
grape, Gp.5.2.4.

xlwr-i=tis (sc. li/qos), idos, h(,
grass-green stone, Plin.HN37.156.

xlwr-i/wn, wnos, o(,
golden oriole, Oriolus galbula, Arist.HA616b11, 617a28, Plin.HN10.87.
xlwro-bota/nh [a^], h(, v.l. for xlwra\ b., LXX 4 Ki.19.26 cod.Alex.

xlwro-eidh/s, e/s,
of a greenish appearance, Thphr.Lap.33 (Comp.).

xlwro/-komos, on,
green-leaved, ste/fanos da/fnas E.IA759 (lyr.).

xlwro-kurti/s, i/dos, h(, a kind of
prawn (kari/s), Hsch.

xlwro-me/la_s, me/laina, me/la^n,
dark green, Gal.17(2).66.

xlwro-poio/s, o/n,
making green or
pale, S.E. M.6.49, Hsch. s.v. xlwro\n de/os, etc.

xlwro/-pti^los, on,
with green feathers, peleia/des Ael.NA16.2.

xlwro/s, a/, o/n,
greenish-yellow, pale green, xlwrai\ r(w=pes Od.16.47; o)/ros . . xlwro/n h.Ap.223; xlwrai\ e)la/tai Pi.Fr.167, E.Ba.38; xlwrai=s u(po\ ba/ssais S.OC673 (lyr.); xlwra\n a)n' u(/lhn E.Hipp.17; do/naki xlwro\n *eu)rw/tan Id.Hel.349 (lyr.), cf. S.Ant.1132 (lyr.); also in Prose, si/tou e)/ti x. o)/ntos Th.4.6; ta\ fuo/mena x. to\ prw=ton ei)=nai Thphr.Sens. 78; h( x. the
green plaster, Androm. ap. Gal.13.470; xlwro\s li/qos, = sma/ragdos, PHolm.5.10; of sea-water, Poet. ap. Plu.2.767f(cf. E.Fr. 1084); of other water, AP9.669.3 (Marian.): xlwra/, h(,
green paint, as a stage-property to represent a river in scenery, Pap. in Eos. 32.30 (v/vi A. D.).
yellow, me/li x. Il.11.631, Od.10.234; a)mfi\ xlwra\n ya/maqon on the
yellow sand, S.Aj.1064; w)|ou= to\ x.
yolk of egg, Zopyr. ap. Orib.14.61.1. generally,
pale, pallid, xlwro\s a)da/mas Hes.Sc.231: most freq., of persons,
pale, xlwro\s u(pai\ dei/ous Il.10.376, 15.4; x. *)axlu/s (personified) Hes.Sc.265; xlwrote/ra . . poi/as e)/mmi Sapph.2.14; hence as an epith. of fear, xlwro\n de/os Il.7.479, Od.11.43, etc.; xlwrw=| dei/mati A.Supp.566 (lyr.), cf. E.Supp.599 (lyr.): in Medic. writers,
yellow, biliouslooking, o)fqalmoi\ -o/teroi v. l. in Hp.VM10; xrw=ma x. i)/sxein Id.Prog. 24; sw=ma . . ou)/te x. a)ll' u(pe/ruqron Th.2.49; also x. ptu/elos, ou)=ron, Hp.Prog.14, VM10 (Comp.). without regard to colour,
green, i. e.
fresh, opp. dry, esp. of wood, r(o/palon . . xlwro\n e)lai/+neon of
green olive-wood, Od.9.320, cf. 379; opp. au)=os, Hes.Op.743; ta\ sfo/dra x. a)/kausta Arist.Mete.387a22; x. cu/la ib.374a5, al.; of various things, xlwrai\ e)e/rsai Pi.N.8.40; turo\s x.
fresh cheese, Ar.Ra.559, Lys.23.6; of fish,
fresh, not salted, Ath.7.309b; of fruit,
fresh picked, IG22.1013.23, Dsc.1.113. metaph.,
fresh, blooming, xlwro/n te kai\ ble/ponta Trag. ap. Hsch. (perh. to be read in A.Ag.677 for kai\ zw=nta kai\ b.）; leimw\n a)/nqesi (sed fort. e)/rnesi） qa/llwn xlwroi=s E.IA1297 (lyr.); xlwro\n go/nu Theoc.14.70; x. ai(=ama
fresh, living, S.Tr.1055, E.Hec.127 (anap.); x. da/kru
fresh, bursting tear, E.Med.906, cf. 922, Hel.1189; xlwra\ dakru/wn a)/xna S.Tr.847 (lyr.); oi)/nou xlwrai\ stago/nes
sparkling, E.Cyc.67 (lyr.). metaph.,
unripe, x. kai\ a)/naima pra/gmata Gorg.Fr.16. (Not contr. fr. xloero/s but cogn. with it and xlo/h.）

xlwro-sau=ra, h(,
green lizard, Sch.rec.Theoc.2.58, 7.22.

xlwro-strouqi/on, to/, =
galucis, Gloss. (dub.).

xlwro/-tomos, on,
freshly cut, da/fna Aristonous 1.10.

xlwro/-tu_ra, ta/,
green cheese, dub. in Gloss.

xlwro-fa^ge/w,
eat green food, Hippiatr. 10.

xlwro-fa/gos [a^], on,
eating green food, Hp.Vict.2.49.

xlwro-fu^la^ki/a, h(, =
viridiarium, Gloss.
xna/smi, to/, given as instance of a neuter Subst. in Theognost. Can.120.

xnau=ma, atos, to/,
slice, tit-bit, Mnesim.4.12 (anap., Meineke for xnau/w), cf. Poll.6.62, Hsch.; pa=n x. 'every scrap', = pa=n pra=gma, Zen.5.73; xnauma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ar.Fr.224 (anap.), TeleclId.1.14 (anap.), Ath.9.381b.

xnauro/s, a/, o/n,
dainty, pleura\ delfa/kei' . . xnauro/tata Pherecr. 108.17.

xnaustiko/s, o(,
one of a sweet tooth, Posidipp.1.7.

xnau/w,
nibble, c. acc., Epich.164, E.Cyc.358 (lyr.), Eub.150.6, Ephipp.8.4.
xniarwte/ra: xnow<des>te/ra, Hsch. xni/ei: yaka/zei, qru/ptei, Id.

xnoa/zw, prop. of youths,
get the first down, Him.Or.7.3; also of girls, au)lhtri/des a)/rti xnoa/zousai Metag.4.3 (hex.); cf. xloa/zw Iv. xnoa/zwn a)/rti leukanqe\s ka/ra just
sprinkling his hair with white, S.OT742.

xnoa/w, commoner form of foreg., of a girl's cheeks, ma=la tea\ . . xnoa/onta Theoc.27.50: more freq. of youths, th\n pareia\n xnow=n Luc. Bacch.2; c. acc. cogn., xnoa/onta i)ou/lous A.R.2.779, cf. Opp.C.4.347; of the down itself, xnoa/ontes i)/ouloi
the bloom of the first down, A.R. 2.43; e)/ti xnoa/ontos i)ou/lou deuo/menos IG14.1362.1 (Rome); of fruit, si/kuon xnoa/onta a gourd
with the bloom on it, v.l. for xloa/onta (ap. Sch.Ar., Suid.) in AP6.102 (Phil.): metaph.,
fresh, xnoo/wsan xa/rin o)/mbrou Tryph.343.

xno/h, Ion. xnoi/h,
axle-box, nave, a)/cwn e)n xnoi/h|sin Parm.1.6; prob. in Emp.46; e)/lakon a)co/nwn briqome/nwn xno/ai A.Th.153 (lyr); e)/qrause d' a)/conos me/sas xno/as S.El.745, cf. 717; a)ntu/gwn xno/as E.Rh.118. metaph., xno/ai podw=n
the joints on which the feet play, as the wheels on the axle, A.Th.371.

xnoi/+zw,
to be downy, neogna\ geneia/si xrw=ta xnoi/+zwn Inscr.Cret.1 xxii 59 (Olus, ii A. D.):—also Pass., Gal.14.778.

xno/i+os, a, on,
downy, pareih/ Anacreont.16.18.

xnow/dhs, es,
like fine powder, downy, Hp.Ulc.17, Thphr.HP1.10.3, Dsc.4.68; mhle/ai prob. in Androt.Georg.ap.Ath.3.82c (xnowdi/as codd.); of salt, Sor.1.82; of arsenic, Olymp.Alch.p.75B.: Comp., Dsc.2.175, Anon. ap. Suid.: Sup., Gal.6.283, Sch.E.Or.115. Adv. -dw=s Gal.11.405. a)h\r x.,
soft, 'muggy', opp. lampro/s, v.l. for notw/dhs Hp.
Aër.15.

xoai=os, a, on,
holding a xou=s (A), sku/fos Hippoloch. ap. Ath.4.129e; stamni/a Anon. ap. Suid. (xoi/dia codd.).

xoa^n-eu/w, contr. xwneu/w, (xo/anos)
cast in a mould, xoaneu/ei Ar. Th.57, cf. 62 (both anap.): c. acc.,
cast, form by casting, xwneu/seis . . ba/seis xalka=s LXX Ex.26.37, cf. 2 Ch.4.3, al.:—Med., die/xean xalko\n prw=toi kai\ a)la/lmata e)xwneu/santo *(roi=kos ktl. Paus.8.14.8.
smelt or
cast metal, LXX 2 Ch.34.17:—Pass., xwneuqei/s
Plb.34.9.11, D.S.5.35; u(po\ tou= puro\s kexwneume/nos Id.16.45; kex. a)rgu/rion Plu.Luc.37. metaph.,
get together, a)rgu/rion LXX 4 Ki.22.9. v. xwneu/w 11.

xoa^/n-h, contr. xw/nh,
funnel, di/khn de\ xoa/nhs (fort. a)koh=| de\ xoa/nhn） w)=ta dietetrh/nato Ar.Th.18, cf. Ph.1.245; ku/likas a)ntlei=n dia\ xw/nhs Pherecr.108.31; kataxei=n w(/sper dia\ xw/nhs Pl.R.411a; as a name of the throat, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.3; as nickname of a great drinker, Ath.10.436e. Medic.,
funnelshaped hollow in the brain, also called lhno/s, pu/elos, Herophil. ap. Theophil.Corp.Fabr.4.5.5.
hollow behind the eye, cj. in Emp. 84.9 (pl.). = xo/anos,
melting-pot, Posidon.48J., Dsc.5.75, AP9.528 (Pall.).—The form xoa/nh is said by Moer.p.401 P. to be Att. (cf. IG12313.127, 314.144), xw/nh Hellenic.

xo/a^n-os, o(, (xe/w)
hollow in which metal was placed for melting, melting-pot, from which it was run into the mould, fu=sai d' e)n xoa/noisin . . e)fu/swn Il.18.470; kassi/teros . . e)n eu(trh/tois xoa/noisin qalfqei/s Hes.Th.863, cf. Emp.96.1, Hp.Cord.8, A.R.3.1299. poet. for li/gdos 11,
mould for casting metal in, Anacr.116. = xoa/nh 1,
funnel, Hp.Cord.2 (xw=nos, as in PLeid.X.29B., Hsch.).
xoa/rbhna: ta\ gra/mmata, Hsch. xoa=sqai: kauxa=sqai, Id.

*xoaspi=tis [i_], idos, h( (sc. li/qos), a precious stone
found in the Choaspes, Plin.HN37.156.

xoaxu/ths, ou, o(,
keeper of mummies, ecclesiastical title in Egypt, UPZ157.34 (iii B. C.), PLond.1.3.3 (ii B. C.).
xo/da^nos, o(, = e(/dra, Hsch. (cf. xe/zw).
xode/antes, = xoditeu/ontes, Sophr. in PSI11.1214d.5.
xoei=on, to/, = paxu\ e)/nteron (i. e. f.l. for xo/rion), Suid.
xo/es, xoeu/s, v. xou=s (A).
xoeu/w, = xw/nnumi, IG4.823.36 (Troezen).

xoh/, h(, (xe/w)
pouring out of liquid,
drink-offering, esp. made to the dead or over their graves (opp. loibh/, spondh/ made to the gods), xoh\n xei=sqai neku/essin (where it is mixed with milk), of honey, wine, and water, poured out in succession, Od.10.518, cf. 11.26, Arist.Mu.400b22: freq. in Trag., always in pl. (as also Hdt.7.43), xe/ousa khdei/ous xoa/s A.Ch.87; xoa\s fe/rein tini/ Id.Pers.609, Ch.15, etc.; x. gh=| te kai\ fqitoi=s xe/asqai Id.Pers.219 (troch.), cf. S.OC477; kexume/nwn xoa=n A.Ch.156 (lyr.); spei=sai, kataspei/sein, e)pispe/ndein, E.Or.1322,1187, A.Ch.149; pe/mpein Id.Pers.624 (anap.); dou=nai S.Ant.902, etc.; patri\ tumbeu=sai x. Id.El. 406; ai)/rein, sta/cai, E.Hec.529, Heracl.1040; xoai=si ste/fein to\n ne/kun S.Ant.431; i(la/skesqai gh=n X.Cyr.3.3.22. rarely of
libations in general, S.OC469, 1599. generally,
stream, *)axe/rontos a)/rsenas xoa/s Id.Fr.523.—Mostly poet.

xoh/rhs, es,
fitted for the Pitcher-feast at Athens (v. xou=s A. 111), a)/ggos E.IT960.

xohfo/ros, on,
offering xoai/
to the dead; *xohfo/roi, a Tragedy by A., in which the Chorus pours xoai/ to the shade of Agamemnon.
xoi/+dion, to/, f.l. in Suid.; cf. xoai=os.

xoi+ei=os, a, on,
holding one xou=s, PCair.Zen.61.3, PSI5.535.15 (both iii B. C.).

xoi+ko/s, h/, o/n, (xou=s B)
of earth or
clay, 1 Ep.Cor.15.47; ko/nis Ph. 2.673.
of the age to take part in the festival of xo/es, IG3.1342.
xoini/k-h [i^], h(, = tou= troxou= e)n w(=| stre/fetai o( a)/cwn, Hsch. (s. v.l.; cf. xoiniki/s 1).

xoinik-iai=os, a, on,
made from a choenix-measure of flour, po/panon IG22.1367.3, al.; e)lath/r ib.1237.7.
xoini/k-ion, to/, Dim. (in form) of xoi=nic 1, Phld.Ind.Sto.5. Dim. of xoi=nic 11, Them.Or.21.248d. = sq. 11, Gal.14.783.

xoinik-i/s, i/dos, h(,
nave of a wheel, Id.18(2).479, Sch.E.Hipp.1234, Sch.Il.2.104. a kind of
trepan, Cels.8.3.1 (acc. written -eiki/da), Gal. 10.448, 19.126.
ring forming the stand for a crown, D.22.72, 24.180. = xoi=nic 11, App.BC4.30.
cave in a rocky shore, Str.12.3.11.
box or
socket for the hinge of a door, IG22.1672.201, 11(2).165.11, 287A102, al. (Delos, iii B. C.).
axle-box, Hero Aut.11.2, Wilcken Chr.176.8 (i A. D.), cf. Hsch. s.v. xno/ai. in torsion-engines,
box or
hub containing strands of gut, Ph.Bel.63.7, 60.3, Hero Bel.96.5. = xno/h 2, Hippiatr. 96.2, 117.

xoini^kome/trhs, ou, o(,
one who measures with a xoi=nic,
as a slave's daily allowance, Ath.6.272c.

xoi=nic, i^kos, h(,
choenix, a dry measure, esp. for corn, Hdt.1.192, etc.; the
choenix of corn was one man's daily allowance, Id.7.187; h( ga\r x. h(merhsi/a trofh/ D.L.8.18; given to slaves, Th.4.16; hence, o(/s ken e)mh=s ge xoi/nikos a(/pthtai, i. e. whoever eats of my
bread, Od. 19.28: prov., e)pi\ xoi/nikos kaqe/zesqai, i. e. sit idle, live in idleness, Pythag. ap. Arist.Fr.197, cf. Plu.2.703f, Ath.10.452e, Ael.VH1.26; ou)de\ th\n x. e)/ti lh/yei (of gold) Luc.Nav.27; x. *)attikh/ (1/48 of the me/dimnos = 4 kotu/lai) X.An.1.5.6; in Pap. usu. abbreviated x, as in PCair.Zen.645.11 (iii B. C.), POxy.1044.3 (ii A. D.), etc. from the like ness of shape, a kind of
stocks for fastening the legs, Ar.Pl. 276, D.18.129. = xoiniki/s VI, PCair.Zen.782
a.7 (iii B. C.), prob. in Supp.Epigr.4.447.48 (Didyma, ii B. C.).

xoi/ra, h(, fem. of xoi=ros,
sow, Orph.Fr.49.41,117.
xoira/gxh, h(, = u(a/gxh, Sophr.98.

xoira^diko/s, h/, o/n,
suffering from xoira/des (11), Aët.12.49.
like xoira/des (11), Hdn.Epim.153. xoiradiko/n, to/, name of a remedy, Orib.Fr.91 tit.
xoira^d-o/leqron, to/, = ca/nqion, Dsc.4.136.

xoira^d-w/dhs, es, (xoira/s 1)
rocky, Str.3.1.9. (xoira/s 11)
scrofulous, fu/mata Plu.2.664f.

xoir-a/s, a/dos, h(,
like a hog or
a hog's back, x. pe/tra
low rock rising just above the sea
like a hog's back, Pi.P.10.52, cf. AP9.289 (Bass.) Subst., x. a)mudra/ sunken
rock, Archil.128, cf. Thgn. 576; opp. sko/peloi o)ce/es, Hdt.2.29; a)ktai\ . . xoira/des te A.Pers.421; x. *dhli/a the Delian
rock, i. e.
the rocky isle of Delos, Id.Eu.9; *dh/lioi x. E.Tr.89; x. *shpia/s Id.Andr.1265; xoira/des, of the Symplegades, Theoc.13.23; ai( x. nh=soi, off Tarentum, Th.7.33. in pl.,
scrofulous swellings in the glands of the neck, etc., Hp.Aph.3.26, AP11.333 (Callicter), Plu.Cic.9,26.
sow, PMag.Osl.1.107.

xoir-a/fios, o(,
farrow, PFlor.148.4,7 (iii A. D.).

xoi/r-eios, a, on, Ep. xoi/reos, h, on:—
of a swine, kre/a xoi/reia Ar.Ra.338, X.An.4.5.31; ko/pros Arist.Fr.277; ko/pron xuri/an (sic) PHolm.25.16. xoi/rea (sc. kre/a)
pig's-flesh, Od.14.81; xoi/reion fagei=n S.E.P.3.223, cf. Hp.Epid.6.4.4.

xoir-e/mporos, o(,
pig-dealer, Sardis 7(1).159 (iii A. D.), PGiss.40 ii 18 (iii A. D.); restd. in PCair.Zen.331.10 (iii B. C.).

xoir-ew/n, w=nos, o(,
pig-sty, Tz.H.11.429.

xoir-i^die/mporos, o(,
pig-dealer, PFay.108 (ii A. D.).

xoir-i/dion [i^], to/, Dim. of xoi=ros, Ar.Ach.521, 806, Pl.Euthd.298d, PCair.Zen.478 (iii B. C.), Plu.Phoc.28, D.C.78.25; without dimin. sense, ga/la xoiridi/ou
PMag. Leid.V. 13.16.
xoir-i/zw, 'behave like a pig', Sch.Pl.Tht.166c.
xoir-i/hma, atos, to/, = xoiri/dion, Hsch.
xoir-iko/s, h/, o/n, late form for xoi/reios, condemned by EM775.33.

xoir-i/nas [i^] (sc. plakou=s), o(, a kind of
cake, Philox.3.14, latrocl. ap. Ath.14.647b.

xoir-i/nh [i_], h(,
small sea-mussel, used by the Athenian dicasts in voting, Ar.Eq.1332, V.333, 349 (all anap.), Poll.8.16; wrongly expld. by Suid., of
hog's bristles.

xoi/r-i^nos, h, on, = xoi/reios,
of hog's skin, a)spi/s Luc.Hist.Conscr.23.

xoir-i/on, to/, Dim. of xoi=ros,
pigling, porker, Ar.Ach.740. Dim. of xoi=ros 1.2, Id.V.1353.
xoir-i/skos, o(, Dim. of xoi=ros, Luc.DMeretr.7.3.

xoiro-bosko/s, o(,
swineherd, Sch.D Il.21.282, Gloss.

xoiro-gru/llios, o(, = Heb.
shâphân, Hyrax syriacus, coney, LXX Le.11.6, De.14.7, Ps. 103(104).18, Pr.24.61（30.26); also xoiro/-grullos, PMag.Leid.V.12.28, Gloss.; wrongly expld. by Hsch. (who makes it neut.) and Suid. as a)kanqo/xoiros, u(/stric, e)xi=nos xersai=os.

xoiro-de/lfac, a^kos, o(, h(,
very young pig, PCair.Zen.274 (iii B. C.), Sammelb.7469.5 (ii A. D.).
xoi/ro-qliy, i_bos, o(, h(, sens.obsc. (xoi=ros 1.2), Ar.V.1364.
xoiro-ka^la^mi/s, = kalama/grwstis, Ps.-Dsc.4.30.

xoiro-komei=on, to/,
pen for keeping swine in, Ar.V.844, Hsch., Suid. (xoi=ros 1.2)
bandage used by females, Ar.Lys.1073.

xoiro-ktonei=on, to/, =
porcinarium, Gloss.

xoiro-kto/nos, on,
slaying swine, Sch.Ar.Pax373. proparox., kaqarmoi/ xoiro/ktonoi purification
by the sacrifice of swine, A.Eu.283; ai(=ma x. blood
of a slain swine, Id.Fr.327.

xoiro-ma/geiros [a^], o(,
pork-butcher, PSI3.202.3 (iv A. D.), PKlein.Form.1052 (vi A. D.), etc.

xoiro-pi/qhkos [i^], o(,
ape with a hog's snout, perh.
baboon, Arist.HA503a19, IG14.1302 (Praeneste).

xoiro-pwle/w, (xoi=ros 1.2)
to be a prostitute, Suid. s.v. xoi=ros.

xoiro-pw/lhs, ou, Dor. xoi/ro-as, a, o(,
pig-dealer, Ar.Ach.818, Fr.578.

xoi=ros, o( （h( Hippon.40, S.Fr.230, Ar.Ach.764):—
young pig, porker (younger than de/lfac, Ar.Byz. ap. Ath 9.375. Cratin.3a), Od. 14.73, Alc.Supp.24.2, Hdt.2.48, A.Fr.309, Ar.Ach.781, etc.; offered as one of the smaller sacrifices, Pl.R.378a, X.An.7.8.5, D.54.39, Henioch.2. generally, = u(=s, su=s,
swine, h)/dh de/lfakes, xoi=roi de\ toi=sin a)/llois Cratin. l.c., cf. Mnesim.4.47 (anap.), Plu.Cic.7, Ev.Matt. 8.30.
pudenda muliebria, freq. in Com. poets, who are always punning on the word and its compds., Ar.Ach.773 sq., etc.; said to be a Corinthian usage, Suid. a fish of the Nile, Str.17.2.4, Ath.7.312a, Gp.20.7.1, 13 tit. (Perh. for
ĝhoryo- 'grey', cf. Norse
griss 'sucking-pig', OHG
grīs 'grey', or cf. Alb.
de[rmacr ] 'pig'.)
xoiro/-sa^kon, to/, = xoirokomei=on 11, Hsch.
xoiro-spe/leqos, o(, = o)no/kleia, Paul.Aeg.7.17.

xoiro-sfa^gei=on, to/,
place where swine are slaughtered, Gloss.

xoiro-sfa^gi/a, h(,
slaughter of swine, Lyd.Mens. 4.158.

xoiro-sfa/gos [a^], on,
sacrificing swine, Hsch.

xoiro-trofei=on, to/,
pig-sty, Eup.453, Phryn.Com.43. = xoirokomei=on 11, Hsch.
xoiro-forbei=on, to/, gloss on subo/sion, Sch.D Il.11.678, Suid.

xoiro-fore/w,
carry a young pig, of the priests in the lustral processions at Athens, prob.l. in Ister 32.

xoiro-fo/rhma, atos, to/,
young pig, Hsch.
xoiro-ya/las, o(, Dor. for -hs, = xoiro/qliy, epith. of Dionysus, Polem.Hist.72.

xoir-w/dhs, es,
swinish, Leonid. ap. Aët.16.44, Hdn.Epim.153.

xoir-wdi/a, h(,
swinishness, Sch.Ar.Eq.980.
xoir-w/nia, ta/, misspelling of xeirw/neia (sc. e(/lkh), Cyran.34, cf. 9.
xoi/+skos, o(, Dim. of xou=s, Inscr.Délos1426Ai 15 (ii B. C.).

xol-a^gwgo/s, o/n,
carrying off bile, po/roi Gal.UP5.3; fa/rmaka Id.17(2).658.
xol-ai/nw, = xola/w, v.l. in Aesop.184 (ii p.263 Chambry).

xol-ai=os, a, on,
biliary, h(=par Suid.
xo/laisi, v. xala/w.

xolargeu/s, e/ws, o(,
a member of the Attic
deme Cholargos, Ar. Ach.855, etc.

xol-a/s, a/dos, h(, commonly in pl. xola/des,
bowels, guts, Il.4.526, h.Merc.123, Antim.45; made into strings for lyre, etc., AP11.352.12 (Agath.): in Com., also xolla/des, Pherecr.246, Men.23. in sg.,
gut-cavity, common to the u(poxo/ndrion and lagw/n, Arist.HA 493a21. (Cf. xo/l-ic, Slav.
želad[ucaron]k[ucaron] 'stomach'; not cogn. with xolh/ as implied by Aret.SD2.9.)

xol-a/w, (xolh/)
to be full of black bile, to be melancholy mad, a)ndra/sin pei/qei xolw=sin Ar.Nu.833, cf. Epicr.5.7, Strato 1.7, Men.Epit.176. = xolo/omai,
to be angry, rage, Antiph.334, D.L.9.66, v.l. in Mosch.1.10, LXX 3 Ma.3.1; Ep. part. xolo/wn Nic.Th.140.

xol-e/dra, h(,
groove, Eratosth. ap. Eutoc. in Archim.p.94 H. (pl.).
gutter, drain-pipe, Ph.Bel.98.9,
Apollod.Poliorc.182.7, Horap.1.21; written xole/ra, Hsch.
xol-emesi/a, xol-emete/w, worse forms for xolhm-, Gal.8.179, 13.185.

xole/r-a, Ion. xole/r-rh, h(,
cholera, a disease in which the humours of the body (xolh/, xolai/) are violently discharged by vomiting and stool, Hp.Coac.117, Acut.（Sp.) 49, al., Aret.SA2.5; but, chrh\ xole/rh obstinate
obstruction, Hp.Acut.（
Sp.).48. (Fr. xolh/ acc. to Cels.4.18(11), but fr. xola/s, Alex.Trall.8.1.)
nausea, e)/stai u(mi=n ei)s xole/ran LXX Nu.11.20. = xole/dra, Hsch.

xoler-ia/w,
suffer from cholera, Dsc.1.115, Plu.2.974b, Gal.14.273.

xoler-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
like cholera, [pa/qea] Hp.Epid.7.82, cf. S.E.P.1.131. of persons,
suffering from cholera, Dsc.4.4, Gal.6.564, Plu.2.831b. xolerikh=| lhfqh=nai to be attacked by
cholera, D.L.6.76.
liable to produce cholera, Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.84.

xoler-w/dhs, es,
of the nature of cholera, tro/pos Hp.Coac.524.
