liable to cause cholera, of pork,Id.
Acut. (Sp.)50, cf. Xenocr. ap. Orib.2.58.79.

xolh/, h(,
gall, bile, Archil.131, A.Ch.184, E.Fr.682, Th.2.49, etc.; x. me/laina black, i. e. diseased,
bile, Hp.Aph.4.23, Pl.Ti.83c (but, = melagxoli/a, Men.Epit.459); canqh\ x. Hp.VM19; purra/ Gal.15.658; xolh\n e)mei=n, bh=cai, Nicopho 12, Herod.3.70 (prob. l.): prov., pikrw=| pikra\n klu/zousi farma/kw| xolh/n S.Fr.854; pikro/ter' au)th=s th=s x. Alex. 16.12; xolh=| a)lei/fein, prov. of
giving one a disgust for a thing, from the custom of mothers putting gall to the nipple when the child was to be weaned, Diph.74. pl. xolai/,
gall-bladder, S.Ant. 1010; called doxai\ xolh=s, E.El.828; also in sg., A.Pr.495; xolh\n tw=n zw/|wn ta\ me\n e)/xei ta\ d' ou)k e)/xei Arist.HA506a20, cf. PA 677b11. metaph. (mostly in Poets) like xo/los (q. v.),
bile, gall, i. e.
bitter anger, wrath, Ar.Pax66; h)\ gunaici\n ou)k oi)/ei xolh\n e)nei=nai; Id.Lys.465; ou)dei\s xolh\n ou)d' o)rgh\n e)/xwn fanh/setai D.25.27; pa/nu e)st' h)/dh x. stirs my
bile, makes me sick, Ar.Ra.4; e)pizei= x.
the bile boils over, Id.Th.468; xolh\n kinei=n Id.V.403, cf. Pherecr. 69.
ink of the cuttle-fish, Nic.Al.473, Th.561. in LXX = Hebr.
rôsh, a poisonous plant, variously called
hemlock or
poppy, Ps.68(69).22, Je.8.14. serpent's
venom, x. a)spi/dos ib.Jb.20.14; of the hydra's
venom, Apollod.2.5.2, D.S. 4.11.
bitter drink, Ev.Matt.27.34. (With xolh/, xo/los, cf. Lat.
fel, ONorse
gall, etc., 'bile, gall':—prob. the name is derived from the colour of bile, and is cogn. with Lat. (
h）
olus, helvus, Germ.
gelb 'yellow', perh. also xlo/h.）

xolh/ba^fos, on,
bile-coloured, of persons, Aret.SD1.13 (vulg. xloh/bafos).

xolhgo/s, o/n,
carrying off bile, fa/rmakon Hp.Loc.Hom.27,28 (xolhgagiko/s and -hgago/s codd.).

xolhdo/xos, on,
containing bile, ku/stis x.
gall-bladder, Alex.Aphr. Pr.1.40; h( x. (without ku/stis) Gal.UP4.12; to\ x. a)ggei=on ib.5.2.

xolhm-esi/a, h(,
vomiting of bile, Poll.2.214, Plu.2.692f; cf. xolemesi/a.

xolhm-ete/w,
vomit bile, Orib.5.31.4; cf. xolemete/w.
xol-i/kion, to, Dim. of xo/lic, Thphr.Char.9.4, Poll.6.52.

xol-iko/s, h/, o/n, (xolh/)
bilious, Plu.2.101c, Gloss.

xo/l-ic, i^kos, h(, later o( (Phryn.283, Id.PS p.125 B.):—mostly in pl. xo/likes, = xola/des,
guts or
bowels of oxen, xo/likes boo/s Pherecr.108.15, Eub.63.4 (anap.); without boo/s, Ar.Ra.576, Fr.82 (anap.); xo/likes e(fqai/ Id.Pax717:sg., Id.Eq.1179, Milet.6.21 (V B.C.); Com. kro/khs xo/lic wool-
sausages, cf. kro/kh 1.3. (Cf. xola/s.）
xo/lion, to/, Dim. of xolh/, M.Ant.6.57.

xo/lios, a, on,
angry, c. dat., AP9.165 (Pall.).
xolla/s, v. xola/s.

xollei/dhs, ou, o(,
a member of the deme Cholleidae in Attica, Ar. Ach.406, Lys.13.58, IG22.2382.14 (iv B. C.), etc.: also written xol-hi/+dhs ib.1742.39, xol-h/dhs ib.159 (iv B. C.).
xolo-ba^fh/s, e/s, = sq., Marcellin. in Sch.Hermog.Rh.4.148W.

xolo-ba/fi^nos [a^], h, on,
dyed bile-colour, yellow-coloured, Arist.SE164b24, Poll.2.214.
xolo/-ba^fos, on, = foreg., Aret.SA2.4.

xolo-dektiko/s, h/, o/n, =
irascibilis, Gloss.
xolo-do/xos, on, = xolhdo/xos, Gal.2.579.
xolo-eidh/s, e/s, = xolw/dhs, Nic.Th.435; ai(=ma Aret.SD1.15.

xolo/-eis, essa, en,
of bile or
gall, full thereof, Nic.Th.253; a)ko/niton, poto/n, Id.Al. 12, 17, cf. Opp.C.1.381.
xoloi/-ba^fos, on, poet. for xolobafh/s, Nic.Th.444.

xoloi-bo/ros, on,
eating like bile, i)o/s ib.593.

xolopoio/s, o/n,
producing bile, qe/ros Hp.Hum.14, cf. S.E.M.9.96, etc. x., to/, = a)bro/tonon, Ps.-Dsc.3.24.

xo/l-os, o(, rarely in physical sense (= later xolh/),
gall, bile, xo/lw| a)/ra s' e)/trefe mh/thr Il.16.203. generally, metaph.,
gall, bitter anger, wrath, ou)k *)axilh=i+ x. fresi/n Il.2.241; frenw=n x. E.Med.1266 (lyr.); x. kai\ mh=nis Il.15.122; x. la/be tina/ 1.387, etc.; x. e)/du tina/ 9.553; x. da/masse/ tina 18.119; x. h(/|rei tina/ 4.23; x. e)/mpese qumw=| 9.436, etc.; x. e)/xei qumo/n ib.675; o(/te x. i(/koi tina/ ib.525; oi)da/netai kradi/h xo/lw| ib.646; xo/lon pe/ssein, katape/ssein (v. sub vocc.); sbe/ssai x. ib.678; pau=sai 1.192, etc.; e)a=n 9.260; meqe/men 1.283; e)cake/sasqai 4.36, Od.3.145; e)k xo/lou metastre/yai h)=tor Il.10.107; xo/loio metalh/gein (v. sub voc.); lh/gein Hes.Th.221; xo/lou pau/qh ib.533; e)k de\ xo/lw tw=de laqoi/meqa Alc.Supp.23.9; lwfh=sai A.Pr.378; po/sei pa/res xo/lon E.IA1609; opp. e)n qumw=| ba/llesqai/ tini xo/lon Il.14.50; x. e)/nqeo qumw=| 6.326; x. e)ne/xein tini/ Hdt.1.118, 6.119, 8.27; e)/xein tini/ E.Hec.1118; o)/rsai Pi.P.11.23; kinei=n E.Med.99 (anap.); *tufw\s e)canaze/sei x. A.Pr.372; xo/lou a)/rcasqai ib.201: c. gen. subj., a person's
rage, x. *(/hrhs, *)aqhnai/hs, Il.18.119 (v. supr.), Od.3.145 (v. supr.): also c. gen. obj.,
anger towards or
because of a person, Il.6.335, 15.138; or
anger for, because of a thing, ti/nos xo/lon kat' au)tw=n e)gkalw=n e)lh/luqas; S.Ph.328; w(=n e)/xwn x. Id.Tr.269: also o)/fra e( . . xo/lou . . a)qana/tois pau/seien h.Cer.350, cf. 410, E.HF840.
bitterness, e)/ridos x. Sol.4.39.
cause of anger, AP11.381 (Pall.）—In Prose used only by Hdt. and late writers, as Luc.Am.2. (On the Root, v. xolh/.）

xol-o/w, inf. fut. xolwse/men Il.1.78: aor.1 e)xo/lwsa 18.111, Od.8.205, 18.20, S.Tr.1035 (hex.):—
anger, provoke, c. acc. pers., Hom. ll. cc.; e)xo/lwse de/ min fi/lon h)= tor Hes.Th. 568; x. tina/ tini
to anger one
by a thing, S. l.c. Med. and Pass. xolo/omai (contr. xolou=mai even in Hom.Il.8.407); 3sg. opt. xolw=|to Thgn.325 (s.v. l.): fut. xolw/somai E.Tr.735; but in Hom. mostly kexolw/somai Il.5.421, al.: aor. Med. and Pass. e)xolwsa/mhn （xolw/seai in Il.14.310 may be either fut. ind. or aor. subj.), e)xolw/qhn; Ep. xolw/qhn Hom. (v. infr.), etc.: pf. kexo/lwmai, mostly in part. kexolwme/nos, v. infr.: plpf. 2 and 3sg. kexo/lwso, -wto, Il.16.585, 21.146; Ep. 3pl. kexolw/ato Od.14.282, 16.425:—
to be angered or
provoked to anger, kexolw=sqai e)ni\ fresi/n Il.16.61; qumw=| kexolwme/nos 1.217, etc.; qumo\n . . xolw/qh 4.494; peri\ kh=ri . . e)xolw/qh 13.206; kexo/lwso kh=r 16.585; xolw/sato khro/qi ma=llon 21.136, Od.9.480: c. dat. pers., *(/hrh| d' ou)/ti to/son nemesi/zomai ou)de\ xolou=mai Il.8.407, cf. 421; basilh=i+ xolwqei/s 1.9, etc.: but also c. gen.,
to be angry for or
because of a person or thing, 11.703, 13.660, Od.1.69, al.; o(/plwn xolwqei/s Pi.N.7.25: with a Prep., kexolwme/nh ei(/neka ni/khs Od.11.544; a)mf' a)straga/loisi, a)mfi\ bousi/n, Il.23.88, Pi.N.10.60; e)c a)re/wn Il.9.566; e)pi\ paidi/ Batr.109: rare in Trag., xolw/setai E.Tr.735; xolwqei/s S.Ph.374; au(tw=| x. Id.Ant.1235; ou(= dh\ x. E.Alc.5 (also in later Prose, D.S.3.67); kexolwme/nos Hdt.8.31, Plu.Fab.22, al., SIG1241 (Lyttus, iii A. D.). Pass.,
to be turned into bile, to\ ou)=ron . . ou) xolou=tai Steph.in Hp.1.163D.

xol-w/dhs, es, = xoloeidh/s,
like bile or
gall, bilious, e)kkri/sies, e)/mes ma, Hp.Aph.2.15, Epid.6.4.4.; xumoi/ Pl.Ti.86e; u(gro/ths Arist.HA506b3; xlwrai\ glw=ssai xolw/dees
caused by biliousness, Hp.Epid.6.5.8; xolw/deis
bilious persons, Arist. Metaph.981a12, Ruf. ap. Orib.7.26.12, Gal.15.568.
bile-coloured, xrw/mata Pl.Ti.71b, 83b; oi(=s a)\n e)pi\ to\ xolwde/steron h( xro/a metaba/lh| Gal.17(2).270.
bilious, angry, x. ti u(poble/pein Luc.Vit. Auct.7, cf. Philostr.Im.2.12.
xol-w/omai, = xolo/omai, Nonn.D.5.447, part. xolwo/menos ib.437, APl.4.128.

xol-wto/s, h/, o/n,
angry, wrathful, xolwtoi=sin e)pe/essin Il.4.241, Od.22.26, etc. literally,
bilious, Luc.Lex.20 (sed leg. xolw/ntwn).

xondr-a/kanqos [a^k], on,
with cartilaginous skeleton, epith. of the sela/xh, Arist.HA516b15, PA655a23.

xondr-eu/w,
make groats, Hsch.:— corrupt in Anaxipp.1.26.

xondr-ia/w, of women's breasts,
swell with clots of milk, Dsc.2.107.

xondr-i/lh [i_], h(,
gum succory, Chondrilla juncea, ib.133, Gal.6.622, al., Hsch. (xondri/llh v. l. in Dsc. l. c.; xo/ndrulla cj. in Thphr.HP7.7.1, 7.11.4, cf. Plin.HN21.105); e(/teron ei)=dos xondri/lhs,
Chondrilla ramosissima, Dsc. l. c.
xo/ndr-i^nos, h, on, = xondri/ths, a)/rtos Archestr.Fr.4.13.
xondr-i/on, to/, Dim. of xo/ndros, Hp.Art.45 (pl.); expld. by pi/nac, ke/ramos, Hsch.
xondr-i/s, i/dos, h(, = yeudodi/ktamnos, Plin.HN25.93, 26.49.

xondr-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
made of groats or
coarse meal, a)/rtos Trypho ap.Ath.3.109c, Philistio ap.Ath.3.115d, LXX Ge.40.16.
xondr-iwto/s, h/, o/n, epith. of ka/nastron, dub. in Supp.Epigr.1.414.6 (cf. p.139) (Gort., v/iv B. C.).

xondro-boli/a, h(,
tessellated work, xondroboli/as e)/dafos Gloss.

xondro-kopei=on, to/,
mill for making groats or
coarse meal, Poll.3.78, 7.19; xondroko/pia (sic): mulw\n o(/pou o( xo/ndros ko/ptetai, Hsch.

xondro-neurw/dhs, es,
neuro-cartilaginous, of a substance between cartilage and sinew, desmo/s Hp.Mochl.1.

xondro-poihtiko/s, h/, o/n,
of making cartilage, du/namis Gal.Nat.Fac.1.6.

xondro-pti^sa/nh [a^], h(,
gruel of groats as a drink for sick persons, Paul.Aeg.1.72.

xo/ndros, o(,
granule or
lump of salt, a(lo\s xo/ndrous Hp.Ulc.17, cf. Sophr. in PSI11.1214
a.3: pl., PLit.Lond.167.18 (ii/iii A. D.); a(lo\s tru/fea kata\ xo/ndrous mega/lous Hdt.4.181; oi)ki/a e)k tw=n a(li/nwn x. oi)kodome/atai ib.185:—xo/ndros abs.,
salt, x. e)poyi/dios AP7.736 (Leon.); also of the
gum of frankincense, Thphr.HP9.4.10; libanwtou= x. Luc.Sat.16, cf. Asin.12; x. liba/nou Dsc.1.68.7.
groats of wheat or
spelt (esp. the latter, Dsc.2.96, Gp.3.7); sasami/das xo/ndron te kai\ e)gkri/das Stesich.2; xo/ndron e(/ywn Ar.Fr.203, cf. 412 (anap.); x. ga/laki katanenimme/nos Pherecr.108.18; e)k d' *)itali/as x. kai\ pleura\ bo/eia Hermipp.63.6 (hex.); x. *megariko/s, *qettaliko/s, Antiph. 34.2,3, Alex.191; o( x. plei=on u(/dwr de/xetai h)\ oi( puroi\ e)c w(=n o( toiou=tos e)ge/neto x. Arist.Pr.929b1, cf. Thphr.CP4.16.2, Plb.12.2.5; xo/ndrou ptisa/nh Gal.6.496: hence,
gruel, porridge, Thphr.HP 4.4.9, Orac. ap. Hierocl. in CA1p.421M.: prov., of an old man, xo/ndron lei/xein Ar.V.737 (anap.).
gristle, cartilage, Hp.Aph. 6.19, Arist.HA516b31, PA655a37: esp.
the cartilage of the breast, which unites the false ribs at the termination of the breast-bone, Hp.Epid.7.3, cf. Prorrh.2.7, Nic.Al.123; and v. cifoeidh/s; also,
the cartilage of the ear, Arist.HA492a16; of the nose, Poll.2.79; of the windpipe (i. e.
uvula), ib.99; w)leni/ths x. the shoulder-
blade, Lyc.155; also of
the young horns of deer, Ael.NA6.5.

xondro/s, a/, o/n,
granular, coarse, a)/leura xondro/tera Hp.Mul.2.193; a)/lfiton a)raio\n kai\ xondro/n Arist.Pr.927b35: mostly of
coarse salt, a(/les ou) xondroi/, a)lla\ xau=noi kai\ leptoi\ w(/sper xiw/n Id.Mete.359a32; xa)/la lh/yetai xondro/n Phoen.2.5; xondrou\s a(/las (cod.Rav. xondra\s a(/las) is prob. in Ar.Ach.521 (v.l. xo/ndrous a(lo/s） xondro/s Adj., xo/ndros Subst. are distd. by Hdn.Gr.1.203, 2.716; Comp. and Sup. -o/teros, -o/tatos, Choerob. in Theod.2.76H. later, generally,
coarse, tri/xes Ps.-Callisth.2.33; ou)hla/ria mikra\ xontra\ (sic) du/o Sammelb.7033.39 (v A. D.); xondro/s, =
grossus, Gloss. (xo/ndros and xondro/s dissim. fr. *xrond-ro-, cogn. with Engl.
grind.）

xondro-su/ndesmos, o(,
cartilaginous connexion, Gal.1.569.

xondro/-tu^pos,
on,
formed of cartilage, Arist.HA617b2.

xondro-fu^h/s, e/s,
cartilaginous, Matro Conv.27.
xo/ndrulla, v. xondri/lh.

xondr-w/dhs, es,
like groats, granular, f.l. in Hp.Nat.Mul.105 (leg. xondrote/ra).
like gristle, cartilaginous, Id.Mochl.1, Arist. HA493a7, 524b27 (Comp.), PA654b25, Aret.SD1.9, al.; opp. neurw/dhs, o)stw/dhs, Arist.HA500b20; xondrw/dh, ta/,
the swimmerets of crayfish, ib.549a25.
xo/ndr-wsis, ews, h(, an affection of the breasts, Sor.1.76.

xo/nnos, o(, Cretan word for
a copper cup, Hermonax ap.Ath.11.502b, Eust.1153.42 (xo/nos Hsch.): pl., perh. name of a festival (cf. xo/es, xu/troi,), Supp.Epigr.1.414.11 (Gort., v/iv B. C.).

xoo-pla/sths, ou, o(, (xou=s B)
one who forms of earth, PMag.Par.1.3047.

xoo-poi/hsis, ews, h(,
treatment by fusion, Anon.Alch. in
Gött. Nachr.1919.25; written xowpoi/hsis, Zos.Alch.p.210 B.

xoo-po/ths, ou, o(,
one who drinks whole xo/es, of Dionysus, Possis 1.
xoo/s, v. xou=s (A) and (B).

xoo/ths, htos, h(,
earthy nature (cf. xoi+ko/s 1), Anon.Alch. in
Gött. Nachr.1919.16.

xoofor-e/w,
carry earth, CPHerm.127 Fr.12 B8 (iii A. D.).

xoofor-i/a, h(,
carriage of earth, ib.Fr.3B3; cf. xwfore/w, -i/a.
xora_g-ei=on, xora_/g-ion, xora_g-o/s, Dor. for xorhg-.
xora_ge/tas, a, o(, Dor. for xorhge/ths.

xoraul-e/w,
accompany the chorus on the flute, Str.17.1.11. -hs, ou, o(,
one who accompanies a chorus on the flute, AP11.11 (Lucill.), Plu.Ant.24: freq. in Inscrr., as IG7.1773 (Thespiae), CIG1719 (Delph.), etc.
xord-a/rion [a^], to/, Dim. of xordh/, Alex.132 (lyr.).

xord-ayo/s, o( (on the accent v. Hdn.Gr.1.227),
a disease in the great guts, the same as ei)leo/s in the small ones, Hp.Coac.502; but the meanings are reversed by Diocl.（Fr.73) ap.Cels.4.20.1; an aggravated form of ei)leo/s acc. to Aret.SA2.6, but not distd. fr. it by Gal.8.388 (fr. xordh/, e(/yw, acc. to Aret. l. c.).

xo/rd-euma, atos, to/,
sausage, blackpudding, Ar.Eq.315.

xord-eu/w,
make into sausages: metaph., x. ta\ pra/gmata
make mince-meat of state-affairs, ib.214.

xord-h/, h(, pl.,
guts, tripe, Batr.222, Pherecr.130.9 (anap.), Ar.Fr.687 (anap.), 461 (sg).
that which is made from guts:
string of gut, ta\ u(poxo/ndria telamw=si kai\ xordai=s diasfi/ggei Sor.2.29; in a loom, Arist.GA787b23: esp.
string of a lyre or harp (not in A. or S., once in E., v. infr.), Od.21.407, h.Merc.51, etc.; e)n *ai)oli/dessi x. Pi.P.2.69, cf. E.Hipp.1135 (lyr.); xorda\s e)pitei/nein, opp. a)nie/nai, Pl. Ly.209b; e)n th=| e)pita/sei kai\ a)ne/sei tw=n x. Id.R.349e; o)cuta/thn kai\ baruta/thn xordh\n poiei=n Id.Phdr.268e; ta\s x. a)llh/lais sunista/nta Id.R.412a: metaph., kinou=sa x. ta\s a)kinh/tous frenw=n Trag.Adesp. 361. musical
note, Pl.Phlb.56a.
sausage or
black-pudding, xordh=s to/mos Cratin.192, cf. Ar.Ach.1119, Nu.455 (anap.): he puns on the two senses in Ra.339. (Cf. Skt.
hirā/ 'vein',
hiras 'strip, band, fillet', Albanian
zo[rmacr ]e 'entrails', Lat.
haru-spex, ONorse
g[oogon ]rn 'entrails',
garn 'yarn'.)
xord-i/on, to/, = foreg. 1, SIG1002.10 (Milet., v/iv B. C.).

xordo-loge/w,
touch the strings before playing, Plu.2.87f.

xordo-poio/s, o(,
maker of strings for musical instruments, Poll.7.154, who also has xordo-poii/a, h(,
the art or
trade of such a person, Adj. xordo-poiiko/s, h/, o/n,
fit for such work, and Adv. -kw=s ibid.

xordo-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in musical strings, Critias 67D.

xordo-strofi/a, h(,
twisting of strings for a musical instrument, Ael.NA17.6 (pl.).

xordo-stro/fos, o(,
twister of strings, D.Chr.8.4, Ptol.Tetr.180 (misprinted xondro-, cf. Procl.Par.Ptol.250).
xordo-to/nion, to/, = sq., Artemon Hist. 12 (pl.).

xordo-to/non, to/,
tail-piece for keeping the strings taut, Arist.Aud.803a41, Poll.4.62, Nicom.Harm.6. Adj. proparox. xordo/tonos, on, Pass.,
stretched with strings, lu/ra S.Fr.244 (lyr.).

xor-ei/a, h(,
dance, esp.
choral dance with music, E.Ph.1265 (pl., nowhere else in Trag., exc. Chaerem.14.3), Ar.Ra.336 (lyr.); r(uqmo\n xorei/as u(/page Id.Th.956 (lyr.); eu)/kuklos x.ib.968 (troch.); x . . . o)/rxhsi/s te kai\ w)|dh\ to\ su/nolo/n e)stin Pl.Lg.654b; o(/lh . . x. o(/lh pai/deusis h)=n h(mi=n ib.672e; mimh/mata tro/pwn e)sti\ ta\ peri\ ta\s x. ib. 655d; qusi/ai te kai\ x. ib.772b; e)pa/rxesqai . . tou\s xorou\s xorei/as tw=| *dionu/sw| dub. in IG12(9).192.11 (Eretria). of any
circling motion, as of the stars, x. kalli/sthn xoreu/onta Pl.Epin.982e, cf. Arist.Fr.11 (pl.), Luc.Salt.17; planh/twn te kai\ a)planw=n xorei/ais Ph.1.16.
dance-tune, a)/koue ta\n e)ma\n *dw/rion x. Pratin.Lyr.1.17, cf. Ar.Ra. 247 (lyr.).

xor-ei=on, to/,
dancing-place, Zonar.; = bwmo/s tis, Hsch.: of a place of torture, LXX 4 Ma.15.20. = au)/lhma, Hsch.; = didaskalei=on, Id. (sed. leg. xor<hg>ei=on).

xor-ei=os, a, on,
of or
belonging to a chorus or
dance, a)oidh/ A.R.2.714, cf. Ael.NA2.11; epith. of Dionysus, Plu.2.680b; of Antinous, IG22.1105 Ab10, Ac3; xorei=oi (sc. a)gw=nes) CIG5328 (Teuchira). in metre, xorei=os, o(, = troxai=os, Cic.de Or.3.50.193, Plu.2.1141b. = tri/braxus, D.H.Comp.17,18, Aristid.Quint.1.22. pl. xorei=a, ta/,
thank-offerings for victory of a chorus, IG11(2).161B13 (Delos, iii B. C.), BCH35.260 (ibid.), Inscr.Délos 442A189 (ii B. C.).
fee for right of attendance at rites of u(mnw|doi/, IGRom.4.353D21 (Pergam., ii A. D.).

xo/r-euma, atos, to/,
choral dance, Pratin.Lyr.1.1 (pl.), E.Ph.655 (lyr.), Ion1474 (lyr., pl.), El.875 (lyr.); ta\ th=s kaki/as x.
dances representing . . , Pl.Lg.655c.

xo/r-eusis, ews, h(,
dancing, Pi.Pae. 6.9, Suid. s.v. xorei=on.

xor-eute/on,
one must dance, E.Ba.324.

xor-euth/s, ou=, o(,
choral dancer, Pi.P.12.27, Ar.Ach.443, Pl.R.373b, etc.; tw=n x. e)ca/gein tina/ And.4.20; ta\ e)pini/kia e)/quen au)to/s te kai\ oi( x. Pl.Smp. 173a: metaph., [qeou=] x.
the devoted follower of a god, Id.Phdr.252d; of a philosopher, oi( *puqago/rou kai\ *pla/twnos kai\ *)aristote/lous x. Jul.Or.6.197d: generally,
pupil, Lib.Or.54.38. epith. of Pan, Pi.Fr.99; of Dionysus, Orph. *eu)xh/ 9. used of dolphins, from their movements, Anacreont.55.24; of cicadae, Ael.NA1.20.

xor-eutiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the dance, ib.2.11, Luc.Salt.10.

xor-eu/w, fut. -sw E.Ba.195, etc.: aor. e)xo/reusa Id.Cyc.156, etc.: pf. kexo/reuka Pl.Lg.654b:—Med., in same sense, E.Ion 1084 (lyr.): fut. -eu/somai A.Ag.31: aor. e)xoreusa/mhn Ar.Th.103 (lyr.), (e)c-) E.Hel. 381 (lyr.):—Pass., aor. e)xoreu/qhn, pf. kexo/reumai, v. infr. 11:—
dance a round or
choral dance, Pi.Fr.116, Epich.109, S.Aj.701 (lyr.), etc.; esp. of the Dionysiac chorus or dance, E.Cyc.156, Ba.21, 184,207, etc.: hence,
take part in the chorus, regarded as a matter of religion, ei) ga\r ai( toiai/de pra/ceis ti/miai, ti/ dei= me xoreu/ein; S.OT896 (lyr.);
to be one of a chorus, Ar.Ra.390 (lyr.), interpol. in D.18.265; considered as a high honour by Athenian citizens, Id.39.16,23; to\ palaio\n oi( e)leu/qeroi e)xo/reuon Arist.Pr.918b21; not allowed to foreigners, Plu.Phoc.30: c. dat. pers.,
dance to him,
in his
honour, *bakxi/w| E.Ba.195, cf. X.Eq.Mag.3.2; peri/ tina Pl.Euthd.277e; a)mfi\ sa\n kiqa/ran E.Alc.582 (lyr.); e)pi\ *kurba/ntesi perh. in their train, S.Fr.862 (lyr.). generally,
dance, esp. from joy, x. u(f' h(donh=s Ar.Pl.288, cf. 761; au)tw\ tw\ ske/lei xoreu/eton Id.Pax 325 (troch.); a(nh\r xoreu/ei, kai\ ta\ tou= qeou= kala/ Phryn.Com.9: x. kai\ e)n eu)paqei/h|si ei)=nai Hdt.1.191. metaph.,
Practise dancing in the chorus, hence
practise a thing,
be versed in it, e)/n tini Pl. Tht.173c, cf. Lg.654b. of any
circling motion, as of the heavenly bodies, a)nexo/reusen ai)qh/r, xoreu/ei de\ *sela/na E.Ion1080 (lyr.), cf. Ba.114 (lyr.); so of a cup, de/pas mesto/n, ku/klw| xoreu=on Antiph.237.3. c. acc. cogn., xorei/as x. Pl.Lg.942d, Epin. 982e; froi/mion xoreu/somai I
will dance a prelude, A.Ag.31; x. ga/mous
to celebrate them, E.IA1057 (lyr.); o)/rgia *mousw=n Ar.Ra.356 (anap.); a)gw=nas Plb.4.20.9:—Pass., kexo/reutai h(mi=n (sings the Chorus) our
part is played, Ar.Nu.1510 (anap.); ta\ xoreuqe/nta
things represented in mimic dance, Pl.Lg.655d. trans.,
celebrate in choral dance, *foi=bon Pi.I.1.7, cf. S.Ant.1153 (lyr.), E.HF 871 (troch.); so Med., Id.Ion 1084 (lyr.):—Pass.,
to be celebrated in choral dance, pro\s h(mw=n S.OT1093 (lyr.), cf. E.Ion463 (lyr.). Pass., also,
to be filled with dances in honour of, c. dat., a)/stea difrhla/ta| pa/nta di' a)nakto/rwn *)/isidi xoreu/etai Lyr.Alex.Adesp.36.19. Causal,
set one
dancing, rouse to the dance, tina E.HF686 (lyr.); po/da xoreu/sas, of spreading ivy, AP11.33 (Phil.); o( d' au)lo\s u(/steron xoreue/tw Pratin.Lyr.1.7:—metaph. in Pass., mani/aisin *lu/ssas xoreuqe/nt' a)nau/lois E.HF879 (lyr.).

xorhg-ei=on, to/, = xorh/gion,
the school in which a chorus was trained for public performance, Phryn.PSp.126 B. generally,
school, Epich.13,104.
treasury, revenue, to\ *dionusi/ou x. Aristox. Fr.Hist.15.
xorhg-e/ths, ou, o(, = xorhgo/s, 1, Iamb.VP30.186: Dor. xora_ge/tas IG42(1).133.7 (Epid., hymn).

xorhg-e/w, Boeot. and Dor. xorhg-a_ge/w, IG7.3210 (Orchom.), 12(1).383 (Rhodes), etc.:—
lead a chorus, xorw=| Simon.147, Pl.Grg.482b (cf. signf.11): c. gen., x. h(mw=n Id.Lg.654a: hence metaph.,
take the lead in a matter, c. gen., tou/tou tou= lo/gou Id.Tht.179d. of the xorhgo/s,
defray the cost of bringing out a chorus at the public festivals, abs., xorhgei=n, trihrarxei=n, ei)sfe/rein D.18.257; e)xo/reues, e)gw\ d' e)xorh/goun interpol. ib.265; x. lamprw=s Antipho 2.2.12, etc.; ka/llion Isoc.19.36: freq. in Inscrr., *qemistoklh=s e)xorh/gei: *fru/nixos e)di/dasken: *)adei/mantos h)=rxen ap.Plu.Them.5, cf. IG12.770, etc.; also o( dh=mos e)xorh/gei IG22.3079, al.: c. acc. cogn., xorhgi/as x. Antipho 5.77, Lys.12.20; [th=| fulh=|] Luc.Dem.Enc.45; x. *)aqhnai/wn Plu.2.724b: freq. with a word to denote the occasion, *lh/naia xorhgw=n Ar.Ach.1155 (lyr.); x. paisi\n *dionu/sia D.21.64; ei)s *)apollw/nia IG11(2).106.1 (Delos, iii B. C.); a)ndra/si x. e)s *dionu/sia Lys. 21.2; x. kwmw|doi=s, purrixistai=s, ib.4; tragw|doi=s Is.6.60; kwmw|doi=s IG22.3090 (less freq. with the Art. added, x. ta\ *dionu/sia toi=s tragw|doi=s Arist.Fr.630); also *panaqhnai/ois x. D.21.156:—Pass.,
to have choragi found for one, xorhgou=sin me\n oi( plou/sioi, xorhgei=tai de\ o( dh=mos X.Ath.1.13; a)/rista xorhgou=ntai oi( pai=des
are well
found by their choragus, Antipho 6.13. metaph.,
minister to, x. tai=s seautou= h(donai=s Aeschin.3.240; tai=s e)piqumi/ais Luc.Par.12; pro\s e)painon Lib. Or.18.7; pro\s mh=kos lo/gou ib.13.26. metaph. also, c. acc. pers.,
furnish abundantly with a thing, esp.
with supplies for war, x. to\ strato/pedon toi=s e)pithdei/ois Plb.3.68.8, cf. 49.11, 52.7, etc.; xrh/masi pro/s ti Id.5.42.7:—Pass.,
to be well supplied, toi=s e)kto\s a)gaqoi=s kexorhghme/nos Arist.EN1101a15, cf. 1179a11: abs., ka/llista kexorhghme/nos best
furnished, Id.Pol.1288b14; kex.

e)pi\ tosou=ton w(/ste . . ib.1323b41; a)reth\ kexorhghme/nh ib.1289a33: generally, e)mbammati/ois kex., of fish, Anaxipp.1.35; pollai=s a)formai=s kex. pro/s ti Plb.4.77.2; diafo/rw| fu/sei, sune/sei, D.S.1.15, 2.6, D.H.Vett.Cens. 5.6; kex. u(po\ th\s fu/sews a)gxinoi/a| D.S.26.2 c. acc. rei (with or without dat. pers.),
supply, furnish, tou\s *)/ibhras ou(\s xorhgei=s moi, i. e. the archers, Ar.Fr.551; xrh/mata h(mi=n D.11.6; ta\s trofa/s D.S.2.35; spo/ron 2 Ep.Cor.9.10; e)c i)sxu/os h(=s x. o( qeo/s 1 Ep.Pet.4.11; pa/qh ta\ xorhgou=nta boh/qeian
affording, i. e. admitting, a cure, Ptol.Tetr.13: c. dat. pers. only, tw=| basilei= LXX 3 Ki.4.7:— Med. in act. sense, xorhgou/meno/s soito\n fo/ron BGU920.29 (ii A. D.):— Pass., tw=n e)k mia=s dapa/nhs xorhghqe/ntwn (sc. dei/pnwn) Arist.Pol. 1281b3.

xorh/g-hma, atos, to/,
expenditure on xoroi/, Inscr.Délos 399A 51 al. (pl., ii B. C.). generally,
means of providing for, tinos Plu. Oth.9.

xorhg-i/a, h(,
office or lh|tourgi/a
of a xorhgo/s,
defraying of the cost of the public choruses, Antipho 2.3.8 (pl.), 5.77 (pl.), Th.6.16 (pl.), etc.: used generally of lh|tourgi/ai other than the trihrarxi/a, Lys.19.57 (pl.), D.20.19 (pl.), Lex ap. eund. 18.106. generally,
expense, Democr.282. generally,
abundance of external means, fortune, h( e)kto\s x. Arist.EN1178a24, cf. Pol.1255a14, al.; politikh\ x.
things necessary to furnish or
constitute a state, ib.1326a5: pl., basilikai\ x. Jul.Ep.89b; pro/gonoi kai\ x. kai\ do/ca
great fortunes, Lib.Or.33.20. metaph., in later historians, of
supplies for war, tw=n a)nagkai/wn, tw=n e)pithdei/wn, Plb. 1.18.9, 4.71.10, etc.: pl., Id.1.16.6, etc. generally,
supplies for a banquet, Plu.2.692b.
extraneous, adventitious aids, Arist. Po.1453b8.
abundance, tw=n eu)tuxhma/twn Id.Pol.1333b17; u(/lhs Luc.Anach.35; u(/datos Hdn.8.2.6; tw=n phgw=n Lib.Or.61.18; pa=sa x. th=s no/sou all
that feeds the disease, Philostr.Im.2.23.
subvention, assistance, Ph.Bel.50.39. f.l. for xorei/a, Pl.Euthd. 277d.

xorhg-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a xorhgo/s, x. a)gw=nes rivalry
in bringing out choruses, X.Hier.9.11; x. tri/podes tripods
dedicated to a god by victorious choruses, Plu.Arist. 1, Nic.3; x. a)rgu/rion IG11(2).161A27, 39 (Delos, iii B. C. ); to\ x. alone, Inscr.Délos453A24 (ii B. C.).

xorh/g-ion, to/, = xorhgei=on 1, D.19.200, Poll.4.106. pl.,
supplies for an army, Plb.1.17.5, al.: generally,
maintenance, PRyl.181.7 (iii B. D.). (in Dor. form xora/gion)
stage-building in a theatre, BGU1028.21 (ii A. D.).

xorhg-i/s, i/dos, h(,
woman-choragus, title of a Comedy by Alexis.

xorhg-o/s, o( (also h(), Dor. xora_go/s Alcm.23.44, Ar.Lys.1315 (lyr.): (xoro/s, h(ge/omai):—
chorus-leader, like the later korufai=os, qeou\s sugxoreuta/s te kai\ xorhgou\s h(mi=n dedwke/nai to/n te *)apo/llwna kai\ ta\s *mou/sas Pl.Lg.665a: generally,
leader of a train or
band, pu=r pneo/ntwn x. a)/strwn, of Dionysus, S.Ant.1147 (lyr.); x. delfi/nwn E.Hel. 1454 (lyr.). at Athens and elsewhere,
one who defrays the costs for producing a chorus, xorhgw=n a)podeiknume/nwn e(kate/rh| tw=n daimo/nwn de/ka a)ndrw=n Hdt.5.83; xorhgo\n katasth=sai/ tina IG22.141.34; x. katesta/qhn ei)s *qargh/lia Antipho 6.11; katasta\s x. tragw|doi=s Lys.21.1, cf. 3; supplied by the fulai/ in turn, D.20.130, cf. Aeschin. 1.11; x. ai(reqei/s, i(ma/tia xrusa= parasxw\n tw=| xorw=|, r(a/kos forei= Antiph. 204.5 (troch.); used of a woman, Milet.1(7). No.265: generally, of liturgies other than the trierarchy, ei)spoiei= xorhgou\s ei)s e)kei/nas ta\s lh|tourgi/as D.20.19. metaph.,
one who defrays the costs for any purpose, x. e)/xontes *fi/lippon Id.9.60; *fili/ppw| x. xrw/menos Id.19.216; x. to\n pate/ra e)/xein ei)/s ti Id.40.51; lh/yetai x. th=| e(autou= bdeluri/a| Aeschin.1.54, cf. 2.79; oi(onei\ x. kai\ misqodo/ths Plb.2.44.3, cf. 8.7.2; th=s fu/sews au)tw=n o( qeo\s x. Iamb.Bab.p.51 Hinck. Astrol., of planets,
patron of a profession or trade, Paul.Al.P.2. Medic.,
supply-veins, Orib.45.18.23. a dressing, Id.46.19.6.

xori^amb-iko/s, h/, o/n,
choriambic, me/tron Heph.9.1, cf. Aristid. Quint.1.26, etc.

xori^/amb-os, o(, in metre,
choriambus, i.e. foot of four syllables (- ^ ^ -), consisting of a
chorius (- ^) and
iambus (^ -), Heph.3.3, Aristid. Quint.1.22.

xoriko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a choral dance, h( x. mou=sa Pl.Lg.670a; ai( w)|dai\ ai( x. the
choral songs in Tragedy and Comedy, Arist.Pr.918b14; x. me/lh Id.Po.1452b21; xorika/ (sc. me/lh) Ar.Eq.589 (lyr.); xoriko/n, to/,
choral part of a drama, Arist.Po.1452b22; oi( x. (sc. au)loi/) Poll.4.81. Adv. -kw=s Ael.NA2.11.

xori^oeidh/s, e/s,
like the afterbirth, u(mh/n Arist.HA561b32, etc. x. xitw/n
choroid coat of the eye, Ruf.Onom.153, Gal.UP10.2; x. mh=nigc, of the brain, the
pia mater, ib.8.9, Herophil. ap. Ruf.Onom. 149; so of the
ventricles of the brain, ibid.; x. ple/gmata (called sustre/mmata by Herophil.) in the brain, Gal.2.719.—Sts. wrongly written xoroeidh/s in codd., as in Arist.GA753b22, etc. Adv. -dw=s Steph. in Hp.2.373D.

xo/ri^on, to/,
membrane that encloses the foetus in the womb,
afterbirth, Hp.Nat.Puer.16, Arist.HA562a6, Dsc.3.150, Gal.UP15.4, Ruf.Onom.230, Porph.Marc.32, etc.; certain animals are said to eat it, Arist.HA611a18, Thphr.Fr.175; cf. a)mni/on 1.2.
membrane round the inside of the egg, Arist.GA754a1.
any intestinal membrane: hence in pl. xo/ria, ta/,
a dish made by stuffing it with honey and milk, haggis, Cratin.326, Ar.Fr.569.4, Alex.172.17, Theoc.9.19, ubi v. Sch.—It is uncertain to which of these senses is to be referred the prov. xalepo\n xori/w ku/na geu=sai 'don't let a dog taste blood', Theoc.10.11.
xo/rios, o(, = xorei=os 11, AP14.15. in Tactics, a form of e)celigmo/s, Ael.Tact.27.1, 28.3, Arr.Tact.23.1, 24.3.
xori_t-ei/a, h(, = xorei/a, IG5(1).1390.73 (Andania, i B. C.).

xo/ri_t-is, idos, h(,
dancing-girl, Call.Dian.13, Del.306, Nonn.D.1.504, 46.158, etc.; xori/ttides (sic) e)nne/a *mou=sai Dioscorus in PLit.Lond.100 D 4.

xoroba^te/w,
dance in a chorus, Suid.:—ba^ti/a, h(,
dancing in a chorus, Hdn.Epim.152.
xoro/danon, to/, = sfondu/lion, Ps.-Dsc.3.76 (nisi leg. xoir-).

xorodi^daska^l-i/a, h(,
office of xorodida/skalos, Pl.Alc.1.125e.

xorodi^daska^l-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the xorodida/skalos, [a)reth/] ibid.

xorodi^da/ska^l-os, o(,
trainer of the chorus, Ar.Ec.809, Pl.Lg.812e, 655a, SIG450.5 (Delph., iii B. C.), etc.
xoroeidh/s, f.l. for xorioeidh/s.

xoroh/qhs, es,
accustomed to the choral dance, nu/mfai h.Pan.3.

xoroi-qa^lh/s, e/s,
flourishing in the dance, kou=rai AP6.287 (Antip.).
xoroi-ma^nh/s, e/s, Ep. for xoromanh/s, Orph.H.52.7, Fr.282, Max.496.

xoroi-ma^ni/a, poet. xoroi-i/h, h(,
furious dancing, APl.4.289.

xoroitu^p-e/w,
beat the ground in the dance, Opp.H.1.472, C.4.342.

xoroitu^p-i/a, Ep. xoroitu^p-i/h, h(,
choral dancing, xoroitupi/h|sin a)/ristoi Il.24.261; later in sg., AP7.448 (Leon.), 9.82 (Antip.Thess.): metaph., ib. 12.253 (Strat.).

xoroi/tu^p-os (parox.), on, Ep. for xoro-tu/pos,
beating the ground in the choral dance, generally,
dancing, Pi.Fr.156, Opp.H.3.250, Nonn.D.9.202, al.; cj. for xeiroktu/pw| in Telest.1.5. proparox. xoroi/tupos, on, Pass.,
played for or
to the choral dance, xe/lus h.Merc.31.
danced over, a)/lsos Nonn.D.13.95.
xoroka/lh, h(, prob. an error for xorw=| k. (Il.16.180), Hsch.

xoroki^qa^r-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
one who plays the cithara to a chorus, CIG 2758
f, al. (Aphrodisias); dat. sg. written xorokiqari (sic) IG14.611 (Sardinia).

xoroki^qa^r-i/zw,
play the cithara to a chorus, Macr.Exc. p.600 K.
xoroki^qa^r-isth/s, ou=, o(, = xorokiqareu/s, Suet.Dom.4.

xoro-kto/nos, on,
choir-destroying, Strattis 15.

xoro-le/kths, ou, o(,
conductor of a chorus, Hecat.Abd. ap. Ael.NA11.1, cf. 15.5, Poll.4.106.

xoro-ma^nh/s, e/s,
mad after dancing, tro/pos Ar.Th.961 (lyr.); cf. xoroimanh/s.

xoro/nde, Adv.
to the festive dance, Il.3.393.

xoro/-ni_kos, on,
victorious with the chorus, Alex.19 (perh. a pr. n.).

xoro-pai/gmwn, on, gen. onos,
sporting in the choral dance, dancing merrily, Orph.H.24.2.
xoro-pai/kths, ou, o(, = foreg., AP6.108 (Myrin.).

xoro-plekh/s, e/s,
weaving, i. e.
mixing in the dance, Nonn.D.6.49, 14.33, al.

xoro-poii/a, h(,
institution, arrangement of a chorus, Poll.4.106.

xoro-poio/s, o/n,
instituting or
arranging a chorus, X.Ages.2.17, IG14.82* (prob. a forgery). in Poets,
leading the dance, w)= qew=n xoropoi/' a)/nac, of Pan, S.Aj.698 (lyr.); *xa/rites E.Ph.788 (lyr.); h(/ba Ar.Ra.353 (lyr.); qusi/ai E.Hec.917 (lyr.); xaropoio/s is found in codd. of E.Ph. l.c. and v.l. in E.Hec. l.c.

xoro/s, o(,
dance, ai)ei\ d' h(mi=n dai/s te fi/lh ki/qari/s te xoroi/ te Od.8.248; meta\ melpome/nh|sin e)n xorw=| *)arte/midos Il.16.183; toi\ d' a)/ndres e)n a)glai/+h|s te xoroi=s te te/ryin e)/xon Hes.Sc.272, cf. 277; ei)s x. e)lqe/men Il.15.508, cf. Od.18.194; ou)de/ ke fai/hs a)ndri\ maxessa/menon to/n g' e)lqei=n, a)lla\ xoro/nde e)/rxesq' h)e\ xoroi=o ne/on lh/gonta kaqi/zein Il.3.393, 394; xorw=| kalh\ *polumh/lh 16.180: later of the
dance as a public religious ceremony, *dio/nuson timw/sas xoroi=s E.Ba. 220; fulh=s *)akamanti/dos e)n xoroi=sin Simon.148, cf. Hdt.2.48, Isoc.9.1; xorou\s a)nh=gon ai( po/leis (sc. ei)s th\n *dh=lon) Th.3.104; pen- a)ndrw=n x. Simon.147, cf. Sch.Aeschin.1.10; ku/klios x. (v. ku/klios）; qusi/h|si/ sfea (sc. *dami/hn kai\ *au)chsi/hn） kai\ xoroi=si gunaikhi/+oisi kerto/moisi i(la/skonto Hdt.5.83; i(/stasan xorou\s parqe/nwn te kai\ h)i+qe/wn Id.3.48; paidiko\s x. Is.7.40, etc.; x. a)ndriko/s X.HG6.4.16, cf. Pl.Lg.665b; tragikoi\ xoroi/, at Sicyon, Hdt.5.67: hence of the
chorus in the Attic drama, oi( x. tw=n tragw|dw=n Ar.Av.787, cf. Pax 807 (lyr.); x. tragiko/s, kwmiko/s, Arist.Pol.1276b4; also x. trugiko/s, trugw|diko/s, Ar.Ach.628 (anap.), 886; arranged in six rows, Cratin. 173; o(\s ou)k e)/dwk' ai)tou=nti *sofokle/ei xoro/n (of the archon to whom the poet applied) Id.15; x. ai)tei=n Ar.Eq.513 (anap.); dido/nai Pl.R.383c, etc.; xoro\n labei=n, e)/xein, Ar.Ra.94, Pax 803, 807 (lyr.); X. sulle/cai, xorou\s a)qroi/zein (i.e. from the tribe), Antipho 6.11, X.Hier.9.4; [xorou\s] dida/skein ibid.; xoro\n ei)sa/gein Ar.Ach.11: general phrases, xorou\s i(sta/nai Hdt.3.48 (v. supr.), S.El.280; e)/stasen Pi.P.9.114; i(ero\n x. i(/state *nu/mfais Ar.Nu.271 (anap.), cf. Av.220 (anap.); a(/yai A.Eu.307 (anap.); xorw=n kata/stasis Id.Ag.23, cf. Ar.Th.958; toi=s x. nika=n X.Mem.3.4.3; xorou= proesta/nai ibid.; xorw=| xorhgei=n Pl.Grg. 482b, etc.
choir, band of dancers and singers, h. Ven.118, Pi.N.5.23, Fr.199; sumfwni/a kai\ xoroi/ Ev.Luc.15.25. generally,
choir, troop, i)xqu/wn S.Fr.762; melittw=n Ael.NA5.13; x. kalli/morfos te/knwn E.HF925, cf. Pl.Prt.315b, Tht.173b, etc.; of things, a)/strwn ai)qe/rioi x. E.El.467 (lyr.), cf. Mesom.Sol.17; x. skeuw=n
row of dishes, X.Oec.8.20; x. dona/kwn
row of reeds, i. e. Pan's pipe, Coluth.124; x. o)do/ntwn
a row of teeth, Gal.UP11.8 (hence oi( pro/sqioi xoroi/, for the front teeth, Ar.Ra.548); th\n sofi/an pou= xorou= ta/comen; in what
class shall we place it? Pl.Euthd.279c, cf. Chor.12.28 p.160 F.-R.
place for dancing, e)n de\ x. poi/kille . . *)amfiguh/eis Il. 18.590; lei/hnan de\ x. Od.8.260, cf. 264; o(/qi t' *)hou=s h)rigenei/hs oi)ki/a kai\ xoroi/ ei)si 12.4; *numfe/wn kaloi\ x. h)de\ qo/wkoi ib.318; at Sparta the a)gora/ was called xoro/s, Paus.3.11.9; so perh. in Crete, Supp.Epigr.2.509.6 (Eltynia, prob. v B. C.): v. infr. (Acc. to Hsch. xoro/s = ku/klos, ste/fanos, and therefore prop. denotes
a ring-dance.）

xoro-sta/des, e(ortai/ feasts
celebrated with choral dances, Call. Fr.66a (cf. Sch.Th.Oxy.853 x 10).

xoro-sta^si/a, poet. xoro-i/h, h(,
institution of choruses: generally,
chorus, dance, AP.7.613.6 (Diog.), 9.603 (Antip.): pl., Call.Lav.Pall.66, IG14.1389 i 58.

xoro-sta^te/w,
lead a chorus or
as in a chorus, Hsch., f.l. in Ph.2.266.

xoro-sta/ths [a^], Dor. xoro-sta/tas, ou, o(,
leader of a chorus, IG12(2).645.36 (Nesus, iv B. C.), Him.Or.9.3, Jul.Ep.186:—fem. xoro-sta/tis, h(, Alcm.23.84.

xoro-sta^tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of instituting choruses: h( x. (sc. te/xnh) Men. Rh.p.360S.

xoro-terph/s, e/s,
delighting in the dance, Nonn.D.14.249.

xoro-ya/ltria, h(,
female harpist who accompanied a chorus, SIG689.3 (Delph., ii B. C.), BCH53.34 (ib., i B. C.), Michel910.24 (Iasus, ii B. C.).

xort-a/zw,
feed, fatten, prop. of cattle (Ael.Dion.Fr.326), x. e(/likas bo/as e)/ndon e)o/ntas Hes.Op.452; xorta/sw to\n ka/nqaron (the beetle being comically treated as a horse), Ar.Pax176; tou/toisi (sc. siti/ois） . . tou=ton xorta/sw ib.139; c. acc. rei, Pl.R.372d:—Pass.,
eat their fill, of cattle, ib.586a; tinos of a thing, Thphr.CP4.9.1. of persons,
feed, bolboi=s e)mauto\n xorta/sw Eub.7.5; h( quga/thr th\n mhte/ra ou)k e)xo/rtasen ou)/te h( mh/thr th\n qugate/ra Supp.Epigr.6.187 (Phrygia): c. gen.,
fill full of . . , qera/peue kai\ xo/rtaze tw=n monw|diw=n (metaph.) Ar.Fr.154:—Pass., c. acc., xortazo/menoi ga/la leuko/n Cratin.142 (hex.): c. dat., x. a(/pasin a)gaqoi=s Amphis 28: c. gen., stemfu/lwn Arist.Fr.107: metaph., lu/phs Ps.-Callisth.2.22; zwh=s LXX To.12.9; e)/n tini Ps.16(17).15: abs.,
feast, kexo/rtasmai . . ou) kakw=s
Eub.30.1, cf. Araros 21, Nicostr.20, Men.465, Ev.Marc.7.27, Arr. Epict.1.9.19.
xortaio/-ba_mos, o(, epith. of Silenus (cf. sq. 1), Hsch.; also xortaio-ba/mwn [a_], on, gen. onos, Trag.Adesp.601.

xort-ai=os, a, on,
of or
for a farmyard (v. xo/rtos 1):—xitw\n x.
a shaggy coat of skins worn by the actor who played Silenus, expld. by mallwto/s, D.H.7.72, cf. Ael.VH3.40: generally,
rough coarse coat, Ar.Fr.707a, Hsch. xortai/a, h( (sc. gh=),
pasture-land POxy.2113.19 (iv A. D., written kort-).

xort-a/ra^kos [a^r], h(,
mixture of a)/rakos
and hay, as fodder, PLond.3.1171.38 (i B. C.), PTeb.423.6 (iii A. D.). Adj. fem. -ara/kh (sc. gh=) PHib.1.75.6 (iii B. C.).

xort-a/rion, to/,
coarse grass, such as grows in bogs, Dsc.5.119 (pl.).

xort-a^si/a, h(,
being fed, fullness, koili/as LXXPr.24.15; ei)s xortasi/an Sammelb.6949.17 (Axum, iv A. D.).
being fed, AP11.313 (Lucill.).

xo/rt-asma, atos, to/, mostly in pl.,
fodder, forage, for cattle, Plb.9.4.3, D.S.20.42, Phylarch.36 J., LXX Ge. 24.25, 32, al.
food for men, Act.Ap.7.11 (pl.).
xort-asmo/s, o(, = xortasi/a, Anaxandr.76, Simp.in Epict.p.69 D.

xort-astiko/s, h/, o/n, (xorta/zw)
good for feeding, nutritious, Hsch. s.v. kapanikw/tera (Comp.).

xort-asto/s, h/, o/n, =
satiabilis, Gloss.

xort-a/xu^ron [a^], to/,
chopped hay, PSI7.820.5 (iv A. D.); written xortoa/xuron, POxy.1862.25 (vii A. D.).

xort-e/gxersos, h(,
meadow-land, grass-land, PAmh.2.94.6 (iii A. D.).

xort-hge/w,
carry hay, BGU1502.1 (iii B. C.), PFlor.322.39 (iii A. D.).

xort-hgi/a, h(,
hay-harvest, ib.198.2 (iii A. D.).

xort-hgo/s, on,
hay-carrying, ploi=a PCair.Zen.191.7 (iii B. C.).

xort-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for hay, genh/mata PPetr.2p.121 (iii B. C.); fo/ros CPR40.23 (iii A. D.), etc.; ta\ x. Ptol.Tetr.81.
xorti/on, to/, Dim. of xo/rtos 1, x. au)la=s Erinn. in PSI9.1090 (p. xii).
xoprto-a/xu^ron, v. xorta/xuron,

xoprto/-bolon, to/, (ba/llw)
place for throwing grass or
hay into, hay-loft, PPetr.3.p.139 (iii B. C.).
xoprto-bolw/n, w=nos, o(, = foreg., Gloss.

xoprto/-bwlos, =
caespes, ib.

xoprto-dre/pa^non, to/,
scythe, ib.

xoprto-qh/kh, h(,
hay-loft, barn, BGU1832.12 (i B. C.), PRyl.129.11 (i A. D.), etc.

xoprto-koph/, h(,
hay-making, PTeb.337.21 (ii/iii A. D.).

xoprto-kopi/a, h(, =
fenaria, Gloss.

xoprto-ko/pion, to/,
meadow, BSA22.197 (Olymus), Dsc.2.147, 3.18, Gp.3.6.7.

xoprto-ko/pos, on,
mowing hay, dre/pana PCair.Zen.782（
a).123 (iii B. C.). -ko/pon, to/,
scythe for mowing hay, PRyl.393v10 (ii/iii A. D.). -ko/pos, o(,
mower, reaper, PGoodsp.Cair.30 xx 12 (ii A. D.), Gloss.

xoprto-loge/w,
collect fodder, forage, App.Hisp.65.

xoprto-logi/a, h(,
collecting of fodder, foraging, Plb.18.22.1, 21.39.12 (pl.), App.BC1.109, al.

xoprto-lo/gos, on,
collecting fodder, oi( x.
foragers, Str.15.1.52.

xoprto-ma^ne/w,
run to grass, grow rank, LXX Pr.24.46(31).

xoprto-nomh/, h(,
green crops grown for fodder, PTeb.61（
a).192, al. (ii B. C.), POxy.918 xi 10 (ii A. D.).

xoprto-paralh/mpths, ou, o(,
receiver of hay, ib.1911.179 (vi A. D.).

xoprto-pa/thtos [a^], on: neut.,
threshed straw, e)sqi/ousi x. mikto\n a)xu/rw| e)pi\ th=s a)/lw ib.1734.4, al. (ii/iii A. D.).
xoprto-phgei=on, to/, dub. sens., IG9(2).522.6 (Larissa, iii/ii B. C.).
xoprto-pghi/a, h(, dub., ib. 7.

xoprto/-plinqon, to/, and xoprto/-plinqos, h(,
square of truf, sod, Gloss.

xoprto-pra/ths [a_], ou, o(,
hay-dealer, Stud.Pal.10.251.9 (vi A. D.).
xoprto-pw/lhs, ou, o(, = foreg., PLond.3.1177.254 (ii A. D.).

xo/rtos, o(, prop.
enclosed place (v. sub fin.), but always with collat. notion of
a feeding-place: in Il.,
farmyard, in which the cattle were kept, au)lh=s e)n xo/rtw| 11.774; au)lh=s e)n xo/rtoisi 24.640. generally,
any feeding-ground, pasturage, freq. in pl., xo/rtoi le/ontos, of Nemea, Pi.O.13.44; xo/rtoi eu)/dendroi E.IT134 (lyr.); xo/rtos ou)ranou=
the expanse of heaven, Poet. ap. Hsch.
fodder, provender, esp. for horses and cattle, Hdt.5.16 (of fish); qhrw=n o)rei/wn xo/rton, ou)x i(/ppwn le/geis E.Alc.495;
grass, Hes.Op.606, E.Rh.771, 1 Ep.Cor.3.12; x. kou=fos
hay, X.An.1.5.10; x. e)bla/sthsen, e)chra/nqh, Ev.Matt.13.26, 1 Ep.Pet.1.24; a)/nqos xo/rtou Ep.Jac.1.10: opp. si=tos (food for man), Hdt.9.41, X.Cyr.8.6.12; xo/rton e)/xei e)/pi\ tou= ke/ratos as translation of the Lat. proverb,
foenum habet in cornu, of a dangerous ox, Plu.Crass.7.
green crop, [gh=] e)sparme/nh xo/rtw| PTeb.27.72 (ii B. C.), al. Poet.,
food generally, dou/lios x. Hippon. 35.6, cf. E.Cyc.507 (lyr.), Crates Theb.10; cf. xorta/zw. (Cf. Lat.
hortus, Welsh
garth 'fold, enclosure', Irish
gort 'crop', 'field'.)

xorto/-spermon, to/,
grass-seed, PLond.3.1171.55 (i A. D.), POxy. 533.7 (ii/iii A. D.), Gloss.

xorto-spore/w,
sow fodder-crops, PCair.Zen. 497 (iii B. C.): irreg. fut. Pass. xortosparh/somai (sic) ib.723 (iii B. C.).

xorto-spori/a,
sowing for fodder, POsl.32.11 (i A. D.).

xorto-sta^si/a, h(, pl., =
stationes, Gloss.

xorto/-strwma, atos, to/,
litter of grass or
hay, ibid.; xorto/-strwtoi stiba/des ib.

xorto/-thlis, idos, h(,
mixture of hay and th=lis, PLond.1.131.606 (i A. D.).

xorto-tomi/a, h(,
a cutting of grass for hay, Gloss.

xorto-to/mos, on,
for cutting hay, dre/pana PCair.Zen.782（
a). 125 (iii B. C.).

xorto-fa^ge/w,
eat hay, PTeb.703.68 (iii B. C.).

xorto-fa/gos [a^], on,
eating grass, EM215.57.

xorto-fo/ros, on,
carrying fodder, Str.15.1.42; x. a(/maca Polyaen.3.15.
producing grass, PSI6.579.6 (iii B. C.), Gp.3.11.7.

xorto-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
guard of hay, PCair.Zen.368.24 (iii B. C.).

xortw/dhs, es,
of grass, like grass, trofh/ LXX 2 Ma.5.27, cf. Dsc.4.69; th\n u(posta/qmhn, tou=t' e)/sti ta\ x. Aët.12.55; to/poi
grassy, Hippiatr.117.

xorw|d-e/w, (w)|dh/)
sing in or
to a chorus, D.C.61.19.

xorw|d-i/a, h(,
choral song, opp. monw|di/a, Pl.Lg.764e.

xorwno/s, o(, = korw/nh (11.6),
crown, Simon.174 (ap.Ath.15.680d).

xorwfelh/ths, ou, Dor. xo/rw|d-tas, o(,
helping or
cheering the chorus, kro/tos Ar.Lys.1319 (lyr., Herm. for xorwfele/tas).

xou=s (A), o(, also h( Anaxandr.41.13 (anap.), Nic.Th.103: (xe/w):— a measure of capacity, = 12 kotu/lai: nom. sg. xou=s Anaxandr.71, Alex.15.19, Men.Her.Fr.5, IG11(2).219A40 (Delos, iii B. C.); gen. xoo/s Ar.Th.347 (cod. R and Suid., fort xow=s), Tab.Heracl.2.36, 57, IG22.1013.55; xou= (in signf. 11) ib.1252.11, Ath.Mitt.30.146 (Mysia); dat. xoi/+ Anaxandr.41.13, D.Prooem.53, PFrankf.1.19, al. (iii B. C.) (also Dor. Tab.Heracl.1.103); xw=| (in signf. 11) Ath.Mitt.30.145; acc. xou=n Dsc.5.7, Ael.NA16.12, IG22.1366.23, PHolm.16.10; written xon (in signf.11), SIG57.21 (Milet., v B. C.); xo/a Choerob. in Theod.1.238H.; nom. pl. xo/es Pl.Tht.173e, IG22.1672.200, Inscr.Délos 396 A 67 (iii B. C.), Gal.18(2).258; contr. xou=s AP5.182 (Posidipp.); gen. pl. xw=n IG12(5).593 A9 (Ceos, v B. C.), xow=n SIG647.27 (Stiris, ii B. C.); acc. xou=s Tab.Heracl.1.103, PMich.Zen.94.4 (iii B. C.); xo/as Hero
*Mens.19,
*Geom.23.63, Aristid.1.18J., Lib.Or.11.126, Gp.8.20.1, al. (xoas unaccented, SIG953.18 (Cnidus, ii B. C.)):—also nom. sg. xoeu/s Hp.Epid.7.10, IG11(2).219 A 8 (Delos, iii B. C.); gen. xow=s Ar.Pax537 (xoo/s ap. Suid.); xoe/ws Gal.12.932, S.E.M.9.320; dat. xoe/i+ or xoei= Hp.Salubr.5, Morb.3.17 cod. q, PHib.1.90.11 (iii B. C.), Choerob. in Theod. 1.238H.; acc. xoa= Ar.Eq.355, Ach.1202 (lyr.), Men.915 (contr. fr. xoe/a, as correctly expld. by Hdn.Gr.2.13 and Choerob. l.c.; found at end of a verse in Ar.Eq.95,113, Ach.1133, Eub.80.4, Men. l.c.); xoe/a Hp.Morb.3.17, Dsc.5.72, 73, Gp.2.6.42, Gal.12.931: nom. pl. xoei=s IG11(2).237.3 (Delos, iii B. C.), Inscr.Délos 440 A 20, 62 (ii B. C.), Ostr.Bodl.i 343 (ii B. C.); written xoiei=s PCair.Zen.160.3 (iii B. C.); acc. xoa=s Ar.Ec.44, Th.746 (cod. R, cf. Suid.), Arist. HA627b4; later xoe/as Ph.Bel.90.26; xoei=s LXX 3 Ki.7.24 (38), Dsc. 5.7, 63, 68, PHolm.16.11, 17; dat. xoeu=sin Arist. GC328a27; xo/esi or xoe/si (perh. formed like drome/si) Wilcken Chr.176.7 (i A. D.): the unaccented forms xoa, xoas, xown, PCair.Zen.516.21, 16, 19 (iii B. C.), prob. belong to xoeu/s: prov., of attempts to measure the immeasurable, oi( th=s qala/tths lego/menoi xo/es Pl.Tht.173d; w(speranei/ tis e)cariqmei=sqai bou/loito tou\s xo/as th=s qala/tths Aristid. l.c. = sumbolh/ iv, h( po/lis didoi= . . xo=n (v. supr.) to\m palaio\n o(rth=s e(ka/sths SIG57.21 (Milet., v B. C.); ei)=nai au)toi=s a)te/leian tou= xou= IG22.1252.11; Argive acc. sg. xw=n Hegesand.31. name of a society or club, a)/rcanta xou= Ath.Mitt.30.146 (Mysia); *dii\+ *(uyi/stw| kai\ tw=| ib.145 (ibid.). *xo/es, oi(,
the Pitcher-feast, a name given to the second day of the Anthesteria, Call.Aet.1.1.2; gen. *xow=n Eubulid.1, Timae.128; dat. toi=s *xousi/ Ar.Ach.1211, Ath.7.276c; acc. tou\s *xoa=s Ar.Ach.961; tou\s *xoa=s a)/gein D.39.16, cf. Phanod.13; tou\s *xou=s IG3.1342.

xou=s (B), o(, also h( Str.10.2.19, 12.8.17, 16.1.9: (xe/w):—
soil excavated or
heaped up, o( x. o( e)coruxqei/s Hdt.2.150; to\n ai)ei\ e)corusso/menon xou=n Id.7.23, cf. 1.185, 8.28, Pherecr.121 (anap.), Th. 2.76, 4.90, IG22.380.26, etc.: gen. xou= Arr.An.2.27.4, POxy.1631.28 (iii A. D.) (uncontr. xo/ou IG9(1).691.6 (Corcyra)); also (from confusion with xou=s A) gen. xoo/s LXX.Ec.3.20, PTeb.342.27 (ii A. D.), PBremen14.13; dat. xoi/+ IG12(3), 248.10 (Anaphe, ii B. C.), Hsch. = koniorto/s,
dust, LXX 3 Ki.18.38, al., Ev.Marc.6.11. xou=s qana/tou
the grave, LXX Ps.21(22).16, cf. Hsch., Suid.

xo/w, 3sg. xoi= （pros-) Th.2.102, 3pl. xou=si Hdt.4.71; inf. xou=n Id.2.137; part. xw=n Id.1.162: impf. e)/xoun Th.2.75, etc.: later xw/nnumi, xorw|d-u/w (qq. v.): fut. xw/sw S.Ant.81, etc.: aor. e)/xwsa Hdt.2.140, PTeb.799.16 (ii B. C.), etc. (Cret.3pl. e)/xousan GDI5056.6 (Istron)): pf. ke/xwka （a)na-) D.55.28:—Med., aor. e)xwsa/mhn Luc.DDeor. 14.2, Philostr.VA4.10:—Pass., fut. xwsqh/somai E.IA1442, (e)g-) Plb.4.40.4: aor. e)xw/sqhn (v. infr.); also e)xw/qhn （sun-) IG4.823.30 (Troezen, iv B. C.): pf. ke/xwsmai Pl.Com.183, Th.2.102, (e)k-, sug-) Hdt.2.138, 8.144:—
throw or
heap up, of earth, xou=si xw=ma me/ga Id.4.71; xw/mata xou=n Id.2.137, Pl.Lg.958e; xw/mata xw=n pro\s ta\ tei/xea
throwing up banks against . . , Hdt.1.162; xw=ma e)/xoun pro\s th\n po/lin Th.2.75; nh=son xw/sas spodw=|
having formed an island
with heaped up ashes, Hdt.2.140; esp. of a sepulchral mound, xw=sai ta/fon Id.9.85, S.Ant.81; tu/mbon ib. 1204, E.IT702, IA1442 (Pass.); mnh=ma X.Cyr.7.3.11; polua/ndria (cf. -a/ndrios 11.2), Plu.Eum.9.
block up by throwing earth in, lime/nas D.25.84, cf. Aeschin.3.109 (s. v.l.); x. formoi=s ta\s ta/frous Plb.1.19.13:—Pass.,
to be filled with earth, esp. of bays in the sea,
to be silted up, porqmou= xwsqe/ntos Emp.100.17; ti/ min (sc. to\n ko/lpon） kwlu/ei . . xwsqh=nai; Hdt.2.11; but of cities,
to be raised on mounds, ib.137. less freq.,
cover with earth, bury, xw=sai/ tina ta/fw| E.Or.1585, cf. Pl.Lg.947e, IG5(1).1249.17 (Laconia), cf. xw/nnumi fin. [o( trwglodu/ths] tarixeu/etai kalw=s . . xwsqei\s ei)s a(/las
covered over with salt, Aët.11.11.
xowpoi/hsis, v. xoopoi/hsis.
xradamu/la: o( koxli/as (Tarent.), Hsch. (a)xrada/mulla cod.).

xrai/nw, A. Th.61, etc., fut. xra^nw= E.Hec.366: aor. e)/xra_na A.Eu. 170 (lyr.); subj. xra/nh| Id.Fr.327; inf. xra=nai Poll.7.129, Porph. Chr.49:—
touch slightly, o)liga/kis a)/stu ka)gora=s xrai/nwn ku/klon, i.e. keeping aloof from it, E.Or.919; x. ou)rai/oisin eu)di/an a(lo/s, of fishes, Achae.27.3: hence,
smear, paint, x. h)\ a)poxrai/nein Pl.Lg. 769a, cf. Poll. l.c., Max.Tyr.40.2:
besmear, anoint, tini Nic.Al. 246:—Pass., xrainome/nhn me/liti AP7.622 (Antiphil.).
stain, bwmo\n ai(/mati mh/lwn B.10.111; pedi/a d' a)rghsth\s a)fro\s xrai/nei stalagmoi=s A.Th.61, cf. Fr.327;
defile, mia/smati muxo\n e)/xranas Id.Eu.170 (lyr.); esp. of moral pollution, le/xh de\ tou= qano/ntos e)n xeroi=n e)mai=n xrai/nw S.OT822, cf. E.Hipp.1266, Hec.366; o)/mma x. qanasi/moisin e)kpnoai=s Id.Hipp.1438; ou)/te fo/nw| tou\s tw=n qew=n bwmou\s xrai/nein dei= Porph.Abst.2.28; of words, qew=n o)no/mata mh\ x. r(a|di/ws
Pl.Lg.917b:—Med., xei=ra xrai/nesqai fo/nw| S.Aj.43:—Pass., ai(ma/twn mia/smasi xranqei=sa gai=a A.Supp.266; kapnw=| xrai/netai po/lisma Id.Th.342(lyr.), cf. S.OC368; ta\ o)/mmata mh\ kexra/nqai toi=s a)sebh/masi Jul.Or.7.205a; o)/yin te kai\ a)koh\n e)xra/nqhmen Hld.10.9.

xraism-e/w, Ep. Verb (not in Od. or Hes.), pres. only in Nic.Th. 914: fut. 3sg. xraismh/sei Il.20.296, Ep. inf. -hse/men 21.316: aor. 1 Ep. 3sg. xrai/smhse 16.837; inf. xraismh=sai 11.120: used by Hom. most freq. in aor. 2, 3sg. e)/xraisme 14.66, Ep. xrai=sme 5.53, 7.144; subj. 3sg. xrai/smh|, xrai/smh|si, 1.28, 11.387; 3pl. xrai/smwsi 1.566; inf. xraismei=n ib.242, al.:—prop.
ward off something destructive
from one, c. acc. rei et dat. pers., ou) koru/nh oi( o)/leqron xrai=sme sidhrei/h Il.7.144; ou)de/ ti/ oi( xraismh/sei lugro\n o)/leqron 20.296; toi=s ou)/ tis du/nato xraismh=sai o)/leqron *trw/wn 11.120: once c. acc. pers. (supplied), mh/ nu/ toi ou) xrai/smwsin [me] a)=sson i)o/nq'
keep [me]
off from you, 1.566. more freq. c. dat. pers. only,
defend, succour (though the notion of
warding off injury is always implied), freq. in Il., 1.28, 5.53, al.: c. neut. Adj., xraismei=n ti
assist, avail at all, 1.242, 21.193, al.; abs., 14.66, 15.652.—Hom. uses xraismei=n with negs. expressed or implied (in Il.21.193, ei) du/natai/ ti xraismei=n is ironical for ou)/ti x. du/natai), cf. 15.32. In positive clauses first in A.R.2.249, al.; imper. xrai/smete Id.2.218. (Said by Sch.A.R.2.218 to belong to the dialect of the Clitorians in Arcadia.)

xrai/sm-h, h(,
help, succour, Nic.Th.583: pl., ib.852.

xraism-h/eis, essa, en,
serviceable, ib.576.

xraism-h/i+on, to/,
means of help, remedy, Marc.Sid.42.
xrai/sm-hma, atos, to/, = foreg., v.l. in Nonn.D.33.369.

xrai/sm-hsis, ews, h(, = foreg., Nic.Th.926, Epigr.Gr. (add.) 903
a.3（Hypaepa).

xraism-h/twr, oros, o(,
protector, prob. in Nonn.D.33.369.

xranto/s, h/, o/n, (xrai/nw)
stained, defiled, Gloss.
xra/omai, v. xra/w (B) C.

xrau=sis, ews, h(,
anchor with one hook, grapnel, Hsch.
xrauti/zw, in impf. e)xrau/tizen, = i)/ceuen, Hsch.

*xrau/w (this pres. implied by impf. e)ne/xraue, v. e)gxrau/w),
scrape, graze, wound slightly, o(/n r(a/ te poimh\n . . xrau/sh| Il.5.138; i(/na xrau/santa dai/+ch| Q.S.11.76; e)/xrausen, glossed by e)pe/tuxen, Hsch. Med. c. gen., of lands,
touch, be adjacent to, xrauo/menon Inscr.Cypr.135.9 H.; also xrauzo/menon ib. 18.

xra/w (A), used in Ep. only in aor. 2,
fall upon, attack, assail, c. dat. pers., stugero\s de/ oi( e)/xrae dai/mwn Od.5.396; ti/s toi kako\s e)/xrae dai/mwn; 10.64; so h)i+qe/ois ou)k e)/sti to/sos po/nos, o(ppo/sos h(mi=n . . e)/xrae AP5.296 (Agath.): cf. e)pixra/w (B). c. acc. rei,
inflict upon a person, kako\n de/ oi( e)/xrae koi=ton Nic.Th.315. c. inf.,
conceive a desire to . . , ti/pte so\s ui(o\s e)mo\n r(o/on e)/xrae kh/dein e)c a)/llwn; why
did he want (or
needed he) to vex my stream of all others? Il.21.369; mnhsth=res . . , oi(\ to/de dw=ma e)xra/et' e)sqie/men kai\ pine/men ye suitors . . , who
have become so eager to . . , Od.21.69. (For signfs. 1, 11, cf. zaxrhh/s; for 111 perh. cf. xrh/, ke/xrhmai （xra/w (B) C), xrh=|, xrh=|s.）

xra/w (B). A. FORMS: contr. xrh=| S.El.35, Ion. xra=| Hdt.1.62(also Luc.DMort.3.2); inf. xra=n Hdt.8.135 (also Luc.Alex.19); Ion. part. xre/wn h.Ap.253, fem. xre/wsa Hdt.7.111; Ep. xrei/wn Od.8.79, h.Ap. 396: impf. e)/xraon Pi.O.7.92 (v.l. e)/xreon), A.R.2.454; 3sg. e)/xrh Tyrt.3.3, Hermesian.7.89, (e)c-) S.OC87: fut. xrh/sw h.Ap.132, Hdt.1.19, A.Ag.1083: aor. e)/xrhsa Hdt.4.156, etc.:—Pass., aor. e)xrh/sqhn Id.1.49, etc.: pf. ke/xrhsmai (v.l. ke/xrhmai) Id.4.164, 7.141: plpf. e)ke/xrhsto (v.l. e)ke/xrhto) Id.2.147, 151, 3.64, etc.:—Med., xrw=mai Th.1.126, etc., Ion. xre/omai Hdt., inf. xre/esqai 1.157 (xra=sqai ib.172); part. xrew/menos 4.151: impf. 3pl. e)xre/wnto (v.l. e)xre/onto) 4.157, 5.82: fut. xrh/somai Od.10.492, etc. in Act. of the gods and their oracles,
proclaim, abs., xrei/wn muqh/sato *foi=bos 8.79: xrei/wn e)k da/fnhs gua/lwn u(/po *parnhsoi=o h.Ap.396: c. acc. rei, xrh/sw a)nqrw/poisi *dio\s boulh/n ib.132, cf. Thgn.807, Pi.l.c., Plot.2.9.9; h( *puqi/h oi( xra=| ta/de Hdt.1.55, cf. 4.155; xrh=sen oi)kisth=ra *ba/tton
proclaimed him the colonizer, Pi.P.4.6; also in Trag., o( xrh/sas A. Eu.798; xrh/sein e)/oiken a)mfi\ tw=n au(th=s kakw=n Id.Ag.1083; xrh=| moi toiau=q' o( *foi=bos S.El.35; soi\ d' ou)k e)/xrhsen ou)de/n E.Hec.1268; x. fo/non Id.El.1267: also c. acc. cogn., x. xrhsmo/n Id.Ph.409; u(mnw|di/an Id.Ion681 (lyr.): c. inf.,
warn or
direct by oracle, e)/xrhsas w(/ste to\n ce/non mhtroktonei=n A.Eu.202; without w(/ste, ib.203; xrh/sant' e)moi\ . . e)kto\s ai)ti/as kakh=s ei)=nai
that I should be . . , Id.Ch.1030; c. inf. aor., Ar. V.159: rare in Att. Prose, ta/de o( *)apo/llwn e)/xrhsen IG12.80.10; to\n *)apo/llw tau/thn th\n gh=n xrh=sai oi)kei=n Th.2.102; tou= qeou= xrh/santos Id.5.32, cf. Lycurg.99; e)/xrhsen o( qeo/s SIG1044.5 (Halic., iv/iii B. C.); o( qeo\s e)/xrhse IG42(1).122.78 (Epid., iv B. C.). Pass.,
to be declared, proclaimed by an oracle, ti/s ou)=n e)xrh/sqh; E.Ion792; mostly of the
oracle delivered, ta\ e)k *delfw=n ou(/tw tw=| *kroi/sw| e)xrh/sqh Hdt.1.49; ta\ xrhsth/ria tau=ta/ sfi e)xrh/sqh Id.9.94; h)pi/ws xrhsqh=nai Id.7.143; to\ xrhsqe/n, ta\ xrhsqe/nta, the
response, Id.1.63, 7.178; e)n *puqw=ni xrhsqe\n palai/faton Pi.O.2.39; peu/qou ta\ xrhsqe/nt' S.OT 604; xrhsqe\n au)tw=| e)n *neme/a| tou=to paqei=n
since it was foretold him
by an oracle that . . Th.3.96; a(\ tou=d' e)xrh/sqh sw/matos which
were declared about it, S.OC355; to\n kexrhsme/non qa/naton Hdt.4.164 (-xrhm- codd.); tou= kakou= tou= kexrhsme/nou Id.7.141 (v.l. -xrhm-): impers., c. inf., kai/ sfi e)xrh/sqh a)ne/moisi eu)/xesqai ib.178: c. acc. et inf., e)ke/xrhsto/ sfi . . tou=ton basileu/sein Id.2.147; c. inf. aor., Id.7.220. Med., of the person to whom the response is given,
consult a god or
oracle, c. dat., yuxh=| xrhso/menos *qhbai/ou *teiresi/ao Od.10.492,565; x. qew=|, xrhsthri/oisi, manthi/+w|, Hdt.1.47, 53, 157; tw=| qew=| Aeschin.3.124; x. ma/ntesi *mou/sais Ar.Av.724 (anap.), cf. Pl. Lg.686a; o(/soi mantikh\n nomi/zontes oi)wnoi=s xrw=ntai X.Mem.1.1.3; x. xrhsthri/w| ei) . .
inquire at the oracle whether . . , Hdt.3.57: abs., u(pe/rbh la/i+non ou)do\n xrhso/menos Od.8.81, cf. h.Ap.252, 292; a)pe/steile a)/llous xrhsome/nous Hdt.1.46; oi( xrw/menoi the
consulters, E.Ph.957; xrwme/nw| e)n *delfoi=s Th.1.126; also x. peri\ tou= pole/mou Hdt.7.220, cf. 1.85, 4.150,155, etc.; kexrhme/nos
having inquired of an oracle, Arist.Rh.1398b33: c. inf., swfronei=n kexrhme/non
being divinely warned to be temperate, A.Pers.829, cf. Marcellin.Vit. Thuc.6: later simply,
receive a divine revelation, Plot.5.3.14.—Hom. has the word in this sense only in Od.: the Act. only in pres. part. xrei/wn (fut. xrh/sw h.Ap.132): the Med. only in part. fut. xrhso/menos.
furnish with a thing, in which sense the pres. was ki/xrhmi, D.53.12, Plu.Pomp.29; Cret. 3sg. ki/gxrhti Inscr.Cret.1 xxiii 3 (Phaestus, ii B. C.); Delph. 3sg. pres. subj. kixrh=| Schwyzer 324.17 (iv B. C.): aor. xre/h ib.13; pres. part. kixre/nte ib.adn. (rarely xrhnnu/nai, xrhnnu/w, Thphr.Char.5.10, 10.13: Med., xrhnnuo/meqa PCair.Zen. 304.4 (iii B. C.)): fut. xrh/sw Hdt.3.58: aor. e)/xrhsa ibid., 6.89, Ar. Th.219, X.Mem.3.11.18, Lys.19.24, IG12.108.16, etc. (3sg. written e)/kxrhsen IG12(3).1350.4 (Thera)); imper. xrh=son Ar.Ra.1159, Pl. Com.205: pf. ke/xrhka Men.461, 598, Plb.29.21.6 ( = D.S.31.10): plpf. e)kexrh/kei App.BC2.29:—Pass., pf. ke/xrhmai （dia-) D.27.11:—Med., pres. ki/xra^mai Plu.2.534b; inf. ki/xrasqai Thphr.Char.30.20: impf. e)kixra/mhn AP9.584.10: aor. e)xrhsa/mhn, imper. xrh=sai E.El.191 (lyr.), etc.:—
furnish the use of a thing, i.e.
lend, usu. in a friendly way, danei/zw being the word applied to usurers (but x. = danei/zw in Antipho Soph.54), ll. cc.; ou) dedwkw/s, a)lla\ xrh/sas Arist.EN1162b33, cf. LXX Ex.11.3; h( peiratikh\ du/namis xrh/sasa tai=s basilikai=s u(phresi/ais e(auth/n Plu.Pomp.24; x. th\n e(autou= sxolh/n tisi Id.Phil. 13; x. ta\n xe/ra, in the formula of manumission, IG9(1).189, 194 (Tithora):—Med.,
borrow, ti E.El.191 (lyr.), Thphr.Char.30.20: abs., xrhsame/nh ga\r e)/nhsa kai\ ou)k e)/xw a)ntapodou=nai Batr.186; po/das xrh/sas, o)/mmata xrhsa/menos having
lent feet and
borrowed eyes, of a blind man carrying a lame one, AP9.13 (Pl.Jun.), cf. Pl.Demod. 384b, 384c. = xrhmati/zw 111, tou= xre/ontos grammate/ws CIG2562.18 (s. v. l., Hierapytna). Med. xra/omai, Att. xrw=mai, xrh=| prob. in Pl.Hp.Mi.369a, xrh=tai Ar.V.1028 (anap.), etc. (also Trag., A.Ag.953), xrw/meqa, xrh=sqe, xrw=ntai, And.4.6, Pl.La.194c, Th.1.70, etc.; Dor. xre/omai Sophr.126; Ion. xra=tai Hdt.1.132, al. (so in later Prose, Iamb. in Nic.p.28 P.); xre/etai v.l. in Hdt.4.50; xre/ontai Hp.
Aër.1; xre/wntai Hdt.1.34, 4.108, al.; xrei/wntai Heraclit.104; opt. xrw/|mhn, xrw=|o Pl. Cri.45b, xrw=|to Gorg.Fr.20, etc.; Ion. xre/oito Hp.Acut.56; imper. xrw= Democr.270, Ar.Th.212, Isoc.1.34, Ion. xre/o Hp.Steril.230, Hdt. 1.155 (v.l. xre/w, as in Hp.Acut.（Sp.) 62); 3sg. Dor. xrhei/sqw SIG 1009.7 (Chalcedon, iii/ii B. C.); 2pl. xrh=sqe And.1.11; 3pl. xrh/sqwn Ar.Nu.439 (s. v.l.; v. infr.111.4b), Th.5.18; xrw/sqwn IG12.122.5; Dor. xro/nsqw Mnemos.57.208 (Argos, vi B. C.); inf. Att. and Ion. xrh=sqai IG12.57.19, Ar.Av.1040, Lys.25.20, SIG57.5 (Milet., v B. C.), IG12(5).593 A12 (Ceos, v B. C.); Ion. and Hellenistic xra=sqai Hdt. 2.15, 3.20, al., IG12(5).606.9 (Ceos, iv/iii B. C.), SIG344.50 (Teos, iv B. C.), 1106.80 (Cos, iv/iii B. C.), PCair.Zen.299.10 (iii B. C.), OGI214.19 (Didyma, iii B. C.), IG22.1325.24 (both forms in Phld.Rh.1.66S. and Ph.Bel., xrh=sqai 57.35, al., xra=sqai 53.49, al.), Ion. xre/esqai as v.l. for xrh=sqai Hdt.1.21, 187, al. (xrh=sqai ib.153 codd.), so in Arc., IG5 (2).514.14 (Lycosura, ii B. C.), Elean xrhh=stai Inscr.Olymp.1.3 (vii/vi B. C.), Boeot. xreiei=sqh IG7.3169 (Orchom., iii B. C.); Locr. and Lacon. xrh=stai IG9(1).334.19, 23 (Oeanthea, v B. C.), 5(1).1317.8 (Thalamae, iv/iii B. C.); part. Att. xrw/menos A.Eu.655, IG12.81.6, etc.; Ep. and Ion. xrew/menos Il.23.834 (as a dactyl), Hdt.2.108, Hp.Acut.18, Dor. xrei/menos SIG395.4, 438.11 (both Delph., iii B. C.), Berl.Sitzb.1927.156 (Cyrene), xrh/menos Riv.Fil.58.472 (Gortyn, iii B. C.), xreu/menos SIG1166.3 (Dodona): impf. Att. e)xrw/mhn Antipho 5.63, e)xrw= Ar.Ra. 111, And.1.49, e)xrh=to Th.1.130, etc.; pl., e)xrw/meqa Lys.Fr.29, e)xrw=nto Antipho 6.28, etc.; Ion. e)xra=to Hdt.2.173 (v.l. -h=to), 3.3, 129, al. (also found in Anaxipp.1.9 codd.Ath.), e)xre/wnto Hdt.2.108, al.: but e)xrh=to 3.41 codd., Herod.6.55, (pros-) Hp.Epid.3.17.a/: fut. xrh/somai S.Ph.1133 (lyr.), etc.; also kexrh/somai Theoc.16.73: aor. e)xrhsa/mhn S.OT117, Th.5.7, al.: pf. ke/xrhmai (v. infr. 1): aor. e)xrh/sqhn in pass. sense (v. infr. vii):—in pf. ke/xrhmai (with pres. sense) c. gen.,
desire, yearn after, the usual sense in Ep., ou)/t' eu)nh=s pro/fasin kexrhme/nos (sc. au)th=s） ou)/te teu a)/llou Il.19.262; no/stou kexrhme/non h)de\ gunaiko/s Od.1.13; komidh=s kexrhme/noi a)/ndres 14.124, cf. 17.421, 20.378, 22.50; mantosunewn kexrhme/noi Emp.112.10.
to be in want of, lack, tou= kexrhme/noi; S.Ph.1264, cf. E.IA382 (troch.); [bora=s] kexrhme/noi Id.Cyc.98; ou) po/nwn kexrh/meqa Id.Med.334; ti/nos ke/xrhsqe, gunai=kes; Theoc.26.18: fut., o(\s e)meu= kexrh/set' a)oidou= Id.16.73; xrh/someqa ei)s ta\ e)/rga kai\ o(dou= . . kai\ u(/datos we
shall need . . , SIG1182.12 (Ephes., iii B. C.): freq. abs. in part. kexrhme/nos,
lacking, needy, Od.14.155, 17.347, Hes.Op.317, 500, E.Supp.327, Pl.Lg. 717c: but kexrho/si dai/ths is f.l. for kexarho/si in Nic.Fr.70.18. pf. and plpf. ke/xrhmai, kexrh/mhn, in pres. and impf. sense, c. dat.,
enjoy, have, fresi\ ga\r ke/xrht' a)gaqh=|si（n) Od.3.266, 14.421, 16.398; au(/th (sc. h( xw/rh） u(/dasi ka/llista ke/xrhtai Hp.
Aër.12; h( katadeeste/rois tou/tois (sc. toi=s ei)/desi） kexrhme/nh tragw|di/a Arist.Po.1450a32, cf.a13, b33; a)/llais, mikrai=s diaforai=s, Id.Metaph.1042b31, Phgn.809a8; u(grote/rais sarci/ ib.b11; qrici\ canqai=s ib.25; kaqarwta/tw| . . ai(/mati Id.Resp.477a21; tw=n . . plagi/ais tai=s r(a/bdois kexrhme/nwn (sc. i)xqu/wn) Id.Fr.295; eu)genei/a| kexrhme/nos IG42(1).83.10 (Epid., i A. D.); sfairikw=| o)/gkw| PLit.Lond.167.25 (ii/iii A. D.), cf. kexrhme/nws (Addenda); so in pres., xrw=ntai deilai=s fresi\, dai/moni d' e)sqlw=| Thgn.161; me/rh
tragw|di/as, oi(=s w(s ei)/desi dei= xrh=sqai, pro/teron ei)/pomen Arist.Po.1452b14, cf. 1458b14.

makes the following
use of the net, Hdt.2.95; xre/wntai ou)de\n e)lai/w| Id.1.193; xrusw=| kai\ xalkw=| ta\ pa/nta xre/wntai ib.215; logismw=| e)la/xista x., plei=sta a)reth=| x., Th.2.11, 5.105; ti/ xrh/setai/ pot' au)tw=|; what

xre/a, v. xrei/a, xre/os.

xre-a^gwgo/s, o(,
one who carries a debtor to prison, Hsch.

xre-a/rpac, a^gos, o(,
one who grasps at money, Man.4.330.
xre/esqai, v. xra/w (B) A init.

xrei/a (written xre/a PCair.Zen.25.2,148 (iii B. C.)), Ion. xrei/h Call. in PSI11.1216.43, h(: (xra/omai, ke/xrhmai):—
need, want, xrei/as u(/po A.Th.287; i(/n' e(/stamen xrei/as considering in what great
need we are, S.OT1443; xrei/a| polemei=n to war with
necessity, Id.OC 191 (anap.): c. gen.,
want of . . , farma/kwn xrei/a| kateske/llonto A.Pr. 481; e)n xrei/a| tu/xhs Id.Th.506; e)n xrei/a| doro/s in the
need or
stress of war, S.Aj.963; forbh=s xrei/a| Id.Ph.162 (anap.), cf. 1004: i(/ppwn h(mi=n xrei/a me\n ou)/te tis pollw=n ou)/te pollh/ [e)stin] Pl.Lg.834b; h)= mh\n e)/t' e)mou= xrei/an e(/cei will have
need of my help, A.Pr.170 (anap.), cf. Call.l.c.; a)fi/konto ei)s xrei/an th=s po/lews came to feel
the need of its assistance, Pl.Mx.244d; i)atrw=n e)n xrei/ais e)so/meqa, e)n xrei/a| h(gemo/nos ei)=nai, Pl.R.373d, 566e; o(/tou se x. e)/xei S.Ph.646; so ti/s x. s' e)mou= [e)/xei]; E.Hec.976, cf. xrew/ 1.2: xrei/an e)/xw, c. inf., Ev.Matt.3.14 (folld. by (i/na, Ev.Jo.2.25); signfs.1.1 and 111 in the same sentence, ou)x ou(/tws x. e)/xomen th=s x. para\ tw=n fi/lwn w(s . . Epicur.Sent.Vat.34: prov., x. dida/skei, ka)\n bradu/s tis h)=|, sofo/n '
necessity is the mother of invention', E.Fr.715, cf.El.376, Men.263: pl., ai( xrei=ai tolma=n bia/zontai Antipho 3.2.1; ai( tou= sw/matos x. X. Mem.3.12.5; prw/th ge kai\ megi/sth tw=n x. h( th=s trofh=s paraskeuh/ Pl.R.369d; ai( a)nagkai=ai x. D.23.148, cf. 45.67 (sg.); polemikai\ x. Arist. Pol.1328b11.
want, poverty, S.Ph.175 (lyr.), E.Hel.420, etc.; dia\ th\n x. kai\ th\n peni/an Ar.Pl.534 (anap.).
a request of necessity, opp. a)ci/wsis (a claim of merit), Th.1.37, cf. 33: generally,
request, th\n pri/n ge x. h)nu/sasq' e)mou= pa/ra A.Pr.700; ka)gw\ . . toia/nde sou x. e)/xw make such
a request of or to thee, Id.Ch.481.
business, w(s pro\s ti/ xrei/as; for what
purpose? S.OT1174, cf. 1435; xrh=sqai/ tini xrei/an h(\n a)\n e)qe/lwsi Pl.Lg.868b; dou=nai e(auto\n ei)s th\n x. Plb.8.16.11. esp.
military or
naval service, h( polemikh\ x. kai\ h( ei)rhnikh/ the
employments of war and of peace, Arist.Pol.1254b32; ai( kata\ qa/lattan [x.], h( e)n th=| gh=| x., Plb.6.52.1, 31.21.3; oi( e)pi\ tw=n x. Aristeas 110, LXX 1 Ma.12.45; oi( pro\s tai=s x. Ju.12.10; oi( e)pi\ xreiw=n tetagme/noi BGU543.1 (i B. C.); in military sense,
action, engagement, ai( kata\ me/ros x. Plb.1.84.7, al. generally,
business, employment, function, Id.3.45.2, etc.; h( e)gkexeirisme/nh x. the
duty assigned, PTeb.741.11 (ii B. C.); ou(\s katasth/somen e)pi\ th=s x. tau/ths Act.Ap.6.3; x. politikai/ Plu.Mar. 32, etc.
a business, affair, matter, like xre/os, Plb.2.49.9, al.; th\n u(pe\r tou/twn x. the
study of these things, Epicur.Ep.1p.29U. x. a)nagkai/a
need of nature, D.S.4.33; trofh=s x. Ph.2.472.
use, as a property,
use, advantage, service, xrei/hs ei(/neka mhdemih=s Thgn.62; th=s x. tou= paido\s a)posterhqh=nai Antipho 3.3.4; h( x. th=s r(htorikh=s Pl.Grg.480a; pwlou=ntes th\n th=s i)sxu/os x. Id.R.371e; xrei/an e)/xein toi=s a)nqrw/pois to be
of service to mankind, Id.Smp.204c; ta\ ou)de\n ei)s xrei/an things of no
use or
service, D.Prooem. 56.3; xrei/an e)/xei ei)/s ti is of
service towards . . , Sosip.1.41; for S.OT 725, v. e)reuna/w 1: pl., xrei=ai . . fi/lwn a)ndrw=n
services rendered by them, Pi.N.8.42; xrei/as pare/xesqai render
services, Decr. ap. D.18.84, IG22.654.15, cf. Plb.1.16.8 (sg.); i(/na soi ta\s x. pare/sxwmai (sic) PCair.Zen.498 (iii B. C.); mega/lhn parei=xe x. toi=s koinoi=s pra/gmasin Plb.3.97.4; pare/xein x. to be
serviceable, useful, Aristo Stoic.1.79; e(ch/konta kai\ triako/sia xreiw=n ge/nh pare/xon de/ndron Plu.2.724e; x. nautikai/
equipments, Ael.VH2.10. as an action,
using, use, kth=sis kai\ x. X.Mem.2.4.1, Pl.R.451c; e)n xrei/a| ei)=nai in
use, Id.Phd.87c; kata\ th\n x. for
use, Id.R.330c; pro\s th\n a)nqrwpi/nhn x. X.Mem.4.2.25; h( x. tw=n lo/gwn the
employment of words, Pl.Sph. 239d, cf. Plt.272d: pl., la/mpei ga\r e)n xrei/aisin w(/sper . . xalko/s is made bright by
constant use, S.Fr.864. of persons,
familiarity, intimacy, tinos
with one, Antipho 5.63: generally,
any relation of business or
intercourse, e)n xrei/a| tini\ th=| pro\s a)llh/lous Pl.R.372a; h( pro\s a)llh/lous x. Arist.Rh.1376b13; [*niko/maxos] sunebi/w *)amunta| . . i)atrou= kai\ fi/lou xrei/a|
in the relationship, capacity, D.L.5.1.
Rhet.,
pregnant sentence, maxim, freq. illustrated by an anecdote, Sen.Ep.33.7, Hermog.Prog.3, Aphthon,Prog.3, Theon Prog.5, etc.: pl., title of works by Zeno (D.L.6.91), Aristipp., etc.; by Macho, a collection of sayings of courtesans, Ath.13.577d; h( tou= *kleome/nous x. Plu.2.218a; xrei=ai kai\ i(stori/ai ib.78f.

xreia^ko/s, h/, o/n,
serving, xreiakoi/
crew of a boat, opp. kubernh=tai, Peripl.MRubr.16; xreakoi/ (in more general sense) BGU14 ii 9 (iii A. D.).

 tro/pon holding this form of education un
necessary, Phld. Acad.Ind.p.79M.; e)a
 . . xr[i=] on e)/xh|s (sc. e)/laion) dub. in POxy. 1665.16 (iii A. D.).
xreiofele/ths, ou, o(, Ion. for xrewfeile/ths, Hp.Ep.17.

xrei-o/w,
have force, avail, pro/s ti S.E.M.7.436.
xrei-w/, v. xrew/.

xrei-w/dhs, es,
needful, Phld.D.3Fr.87, Ph.2.23, J.BJ5.5.8, Ruf. ap. Orib.8.24.7, Ael.Tact.34.1; tisi Crantor ap.S.E.M11.53, Plu.2.724e; to\ x.
necessity, Luc.Am.38; to\ a)nagkai=on kai\ x. Plu.2.1118b; e)n pa=sin toi=s xriw/desin (sic) th=s patri/dos IG4.716.13 (Hermione); x. a)po/fqegma, = xrei/a v, D.L.4.47: Comp. and Sup., -e/steros, -e/statos, Ael.Tact.1.7: Comp., Hld.6.11: Sup., Ps.-Luc. Philopatr.19.
in need of, ta)/lla w(=n o( a)nqrw/pinos bi/os xreiw/dhs Ph. ap. Eus.PE8.11: abs., of parts of the body,
needy, opp. e)nerga/ (productive), Mnesith. ap. Steph.in Gal.1.241D.;
deficient, to\ x. Corp.Herm.18.6.
xrei/wn, Ep. part. of xra/w (B) A. xreiw/n, v. xrew/n.
xreme/da: h(gh= w(s *kalli/maxos, Hsch. (xremeta=|: h)xei= Salm., xreme/da: h)xh/ Bentl., xremeda/ (Advb.): h)xhtikw=s cj. Schneid.Call.Fr. 352.)
xreme/qw, = sq., 3pl. xreme/qousi, and subj. -wsi, Opp.C.1.224, 163; part. -wn ib.263, AP9.295 (Bianor).

xremet-i/zw,
neigh, whinny, of horses, Il.12.51, Hdt.3.86,87, Pl. R.396b, Phdr.254d, Jul.Mis.366a: metaph. of lewd men, x. e)pi\ gunai=ka LXX Je.5.8.—In Hes.Sc.348 we have a shorter form of 3pl. aor. 1, xre/misan, asif from xremi/zw. (Cf. xro/mh, xro/mados, OE.
gremettan, grymettan 'to roar', OSlav.
v[ucaron]z-gr[icaron]měti 'to thunder'.)

xreme/t-isma, atos, to/,
neighing, whinnying, Iamb.Bab.p.50H. (pl.): metaph., x. ga/mou proke/leuqon i(ei=sa AP5.244 (Maced.).

xremet-ismo/s, o(, = foreg., Ar.Eq.553(lyr.), LXX Am.6.7: pl., D.H.Comp.16, Placit.4.19.1:— hence, of any loud noise,
thunder, Thd.Jb.39.19.

xremet-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
fond of neighing, able to neigh, zw=|on Ph.1.310, S.E.P.2.211, Plu.2.877b, cf. Alex.Aphr.in Top.235.24.
xre/mhs, htos, o(, a fish, prob. = xro/mis, Opp.H.1.112, Ael.NA 15.11.
xremi/zw, v. xremeti/zw.

xre/mma, atos, to/,
spittle, expecloration, D.L.2.67 (sed leg. kra/mati).

xre/mptomai, aor. exremya/mhn Luc. (v. infr.), Jul.Or.7.205c:—
clear one's throat, hawk and spit, cough, E.Cyc.626; esp. before making a speech, Ar.Th.381; x. w(s ptu/swn Gal.Protr.8: c. acc., ai(matw=des x.
spit blood, Hp.Epid.5.14; mh=la x. Eup.163(lyr.); platu\ xremya/menos Luc.Cat.12, cf. Pr.Im.20:—Pass., pra/sa . . xre/mptetai
are expectorant, Ruf. ap. Orib.inc.4.28. (Akin to xremeti/zw.）
xre/mus, uos, o(, a fish, = o)ni/skos, Hsch.; cj. for kre/mus, Arist.Fr. 294:—cf. xro/mis.

xre/my, a kind of
fish, prob. = xro/mis, Arist.HA534a8 (v.l. xre/y).
xremyi^qe/a_tros, on, = e)n tw=| qea/trw| xrempto/menos, Com.Adesp. 1198.

xreo-dosi/a, h(,
payment of a debt, Aq.De.24.13, Hdn.Epim.207.

xreo-dote/w,
pay debts, Hdn. ibid.
xreok-, xreol-, etc., later forms in compos. for xrew-, acc. to Lob.Phryn.390; but Hdn.Epim.207 prefers the short vowel.
xreo/n, v. xrew/n.
xreono/mos, o(, dub. sens., title of an official, BSA26.166 (Sparta, ii A. D.).

xre/os, to/ Ep. xrei=os Hom. (who also uses xre/os, but only in Od., v. infr. 1.1): Att. xre/ws Phryn.370, Moeris p.403 P., Choerob.in Theod.1.360H. (and this form appears in codd. of D.25.69, 33.24, 38.14, 40.37, 42.5; but xre/os in Pl.Plt.267a, Lg.958b): gen. xrei/ous E.IA373 (troch., s. v.l.), xre/ous Lys.17.5 codd., xre/ws D.49.18 (and so Choerob.l.c.); no dat. occurs in Ep. forms:—pl., nom. and acc. xre/a^ Hes.Op.647, xre/a_ Ar.Nu.39, 443 (anap.), cf. Isoc.21.13, Pl.Lg. 684e, etc.; Arc. xrh/ata (but Schwyzer [665] xrh=a ta/) IG5(2).343.20, 27 (Orchom., iv B. C.); gen. xrew=n Ar.Nu.13,117, Pl.R.566a, etc.; Ep. xreiw=n Hes.Op.404 (xree/wn cj. Rzach); Ep. dat. xre/esi Man. 4.135; xrh/essi A.R.3.1198: (xra/omai, xrh/):
that which one needs must pay, obligation, debt, *)/arhs . . xre/os kai\ desmo\n a)lu/cas Od. 8.353, cf. 355; xrei=os a)posth/sasqai, i.e. pay
it in full, Il.13.746: esp. of
the obligation to restore or pay for 'lified' cattle and plunder, so the heralds of the Pylians summoned to share in booty all oi(=si xrei=os o)fei/let': . . pole/sin ga\r *)epeioi\ xrei=os o)/feilon (where Sch. A, ta\ perielasqe/nta e)k th=s *pu/lou u(po\ tw=n *)epeiw=n qre/mmata xre/ws kalei=) Il. 11.686, cf. Od.3.367, 21.17; later simply,
debt, au)to\s e)/teise . . xre/os Thgn.205; a)ra=s ti/nei x. pays
the debt demanded by the curse, A.Ag. 457 (lyr.); mh/ ti pe/ra xre/os . . po/lei prosa/yh|s
debt, i. e.
guilt, S.OC235 (lyr.); x. pra/ssein tina/ exact payment of a
debt from one, Pi.O.3.7; e)mo\n katai/sxune x. dishonoured my
debt, i.e. dishonoured me
for not paying my debt, for not keeping my promise, ib.10(11).8; teo\n x.
the debt due to thee, Id.P.8.33: in Com. and Prose, x. a)podido/nai repay a
debt, Hdt.2.136 (where also we have x. dido/nai to give a
loan, and x. lamba/nein to receive a
loan), cf. Ar.Nu.117, Pl.Plt.267a; e)/xw x. w(s ei)pei=n ou)de\n a)ndro\s *(/ellhnos I know of nothing
that 1 owe to any man of Greece, Hdt.3.140; x. a)paitei=n Plu.Oth.2; ta\ u(pa/rxonta tw=n x. a)nei=sqai Id.Sol.15; to\ e)pi\ th\n tra/pezan xre/ws (sc. o)feilo/menon) D.33.24; w)\ kalo\n ei)s a)/loxon qe/menos x., like xa/rin qe/sqai (v. ti/qhmi A. 11.7 fin.), Epigr. in Arch.Pap.1.220 (Ptolemaic); e)/xein ei)/s ti x. Plu.Caes.48: pl.,
debts, Hes.Op.647, Ar.Nu.13, etc.; xreiw=n lu/sis Hes.Op.404; xre/a a)polabei=n And.3.15; xre/a e)pi\ to/kois o)feilo/mena Is.11.42; th\n ou)si/an a(/pasan xre/a kate/lipon left all the property
in outstanding debts, D.38.7; ei)spraxqe/nta xre/a ibid.; e)kplhrw=sai to\ x. a(/pan pay
it, Pl.Lg.958b; to\ x. dialue/tw SIG306.46 (Tegea, iv B. C.), cf. Plu.Luc.20 (Pass.); pro\s ta\ x. a)pa/gesqai Plb.38.11.10, D.H.4.9:—cf. a)pokoph/. metaph.,
the debt that all must pay, fate, death, ou)k e)/sti to\ x. fugei=n Alciphr.1.25; to\ th=s yuxh=s a)paithqei\s x. LXXWi.15.8; also a)\n mh/ tis qa=tton w(s x. a)podidw=| to\ zhn Pl.Ax.367b; o(po/te ei)s to\n a)e/ra a)nadra/mh| to\ x. (sc. h( yuxh/, regarded as lent to the body) Vett.Val.330.33. in Poets,
business, affair, matter, e(o\n au)tou= xrei=os e)eldo/menos Od.1.409, cf. 2.45; xre/os pa=n e)pikrai/neis, of Pelasgos, A.Supp.374 (lyr.);
purpose, object, ei) me\n ga\r u(mi=n mh\ to/d' e)kpra/cw xre/os ib.472, cf. S.OT 156 (lyr.); pa=n o(\ qe/leis . . x. e)ktete/lestai Theoc.25.53: c. gen., so\n ou)k e)/lasson h)\ kei/nhs x. your
affair, E.Hec.892. almost = xrh=ma,
thing, ti/ xre/os; = ti/ xrh=ma; A.Ag.85 (anap.), E.Heracl.95 (lyr.), cf. S.OC251 (lyr.); e)f' o(/ ti x. e)mo/lete E.Or.150 (lyr); ti/ x. e)/ba dwma; Id.Fr.1011 (lyr.); ti/ kaino\n h)=lqe dw/masin x.; Id.HF530, cf. Ar. Nu.30 (with play on signf.1), Theoc.24.66. e)la/fous, me/ga ti x. (cf. xrh=ma 11.3) Call.Dian.100. in Od.11.479, h)=lqon *teiresi/ao kata\ xre/os seems to be = *teiresi/a| xrhso/menos (10.492)
to consult him. elsewh. kata\ xre/os means according to
what is needful, in
due fashion, h.Merc.138, A.R.3.189, Arat.343.
duty, task, charge, office, h)=lqe twu)/t' e)pi\ xre/os Pi.O.1.45, cf. 7.40; oi(=s to/d' h)=n xre/os A.Pers.777, cf. Th.20; to\ so\n mele/sqw . . frourh=sai xre/os S.El.74, cf. E.Or.1253 (lyr.), IT883 (lyr.). to\ sundrw=n x. the
circumstance of being an accomplice, E.Andr.337.
anything useful or
serviceable, xrew=n xrhi/+zonti meta/dosin poih/sasqai Hp.
Jusj.; de/ka stath=rans katastasei=, tw= de\ xrh/i+os ( = xre/ous） diplei= o)/ti k' o) dikasta\s o)mo/sei sunessa/ksai Leg.Gort.3.14, cf. 11, GDI5100.11 (Malla).
value, validity, uhde\n e)s xrh=os (or xre/os） h)/mhn ta\n do/sin the gift shall be of no
value, i. e. invalid, Leg.Gort.10.24, cf. 31. para\ xre/os, = paraxrh=ma, Call.Aet.Oxy.2080.14 (paraxrh=m' ap.Stob.), Nic.Al.614 (prob. orig. = signf. VIII). = xrei/a, xrew/,
need, ti/ d', w)= ta/las, se tou=d' e)/xei ple/kous xre/os; Answ. x. me\n ou)de/n, bou/lomai d' o(/mws labei=n Ar.Ach.454, cf. Bion Fr.2.2.
xre-ofeile/ths, v. xrewf-;
xre-ofei/lhs dub. in A.D.Pron.5.7.
xre-fu^la/kion, to/, v. xrewf-.
xre/y, v. xre/my.

xrew/, Ep. xreiw/, gen. ou=s, h(, less freq. neut., Il.10.142, Od.2.28, 5.189 (where to/son agrees with x.), 4.312, Il.10.85, 11.606, perh. 9.197,608, 21.322, 23.308, Od.4.707; to\ x. Inscr.Prien.9), al. (ii/i B. C.): (xrh/, xrei/a):—
want, need; h)= ti ma/la xrew/ of a truth there is much
need, Il.9.197; xreioi= a)nagkai/h| by dire
necessity, 8.57; a)nagkai/hs u(/po xreiou=s feu/gontes Sol.[36.9] ap.Arist.Ath.12.4: c. gen., i(/n' ou) xrew\ pei/s mato/s e)stin where there is no
need of a cable, Od.9.136; xreiw\ i(ka/netai
want, necessity arises, Il.10.118, cf. 142, Od.6.136; ei)/ pote dh\ au)=te xreiw\ e)mei=o ge/nhtai Il.1.341; xreiw\ bebi/hken *)axaiou/s 10.172; ti/pte de/ se xreiw\ deu=r' h)/gage; . . dh/mion h)= i)/dion; Od.4.312; o(/te me xreiw\ to/son i(/koi if so great a
need should come upon me, 5.189; ti/na xreiw\ to/son i(/kei; 2.28; also e)me\ de\ xrew\ gi/gnetai au)th=s (sc. th=s nho/s, xrew\ gi/gnetai being = xrh/ 1.2) 4.634; even ou)de/ ti/ min xrew\ e)/stai tumboxo/hs Il.21.322. used by Hom. ellipt., xrew/ c. acc. pers., ti/pte de/ se xrew/ (sc. i(ka/nei); Od.1.225, Il. 10.85: folld. by a gen., ou)/ ti/ me tau/ths xrew\ timh=s
need of it touches me not, 9.608; xrew\ boulh=s e)me\ kai\ se/ 10.43, cf. 9.75; ti/ de/ se xrew\ e)mei=o; 11.606: also c. inf., to\n de\ ma/la xrew\ e(sta/menai kraterw=s he
needs must stand firm, ib.409; ou)de/ ti/ min xrew\ nhw=n e)pibaine/men Od.4.707, cf. Il.18.406, Od.15.201, A.R.1.649. = xrew/n,
necessity, destiny, fate, A.R.1.440; h( ei)s to\ x. meta/stasis Inscr.Prien.99, al. (ii/i B. C.).
oracle, prophecy, xreiw\ qespi/zwn metamw/nion A.R.1.491. = xre/os or xrh=ma,
affair, object, Id.4.191; simply,
thing, Id.3.33.—The word is mostly Ep.— Hom. uses both forms xrew/ and xreiw/: but in the ellipt. phrase, mentioned 1.2, he always has xrew/, as monosyll.:—in Il.11.606 xrew/ before a vowel is used short:—xrew/ is disyll. in Parm.1.28.

xrewkop-i/a, h(,
cancelling of debts, D.H.5.67, D.S.29.33.

xrewkop-i/dhs, ou, o(,
one who cancels his debts, an insolvent: esp. said of those friends of Solon at Athens, who took advantage of his seisa/xqeia, Plu.Sol.15 xrew/kop-os (parox.), o(, =
creditor, decoctor, Gloss. (xreo-).

xrewlu^t-e/w or xreol- (so Supp.Epigr.3.436 (Thermum, iii (?) B.C.)),
discharge a debt, Plu.Alc.5; x. to\n misqo/n
pay wages
that are due, J.AJ18.8.9.

xrewlu^/t-hsis, ews, h(,
payment, discharge, BGU362 ix 9 (iii A. D., xreol-).
xrew/menos, Ion. part. of xra/omai, Il.23.834.

xrew/n, Ion. xreo/n (the form best attested in Parm.8.45 and Hdt.); also xreiw/n, Democr.55, to/: gen. tou= xrew/n E.Hipp.1256, HF21, but little used save in nom. and acc.:—
that which must be, kata\ to\ x. Anaximand.1 (Diels Vorsokr.5); th\n moi=ran ei)s to\ mh\ x. parastre/fwn E.Fr.491.3; x. tou= xrhsmou= Plu.Nic.14.
necessity, fate, h(/ te h(liki/a kai\ to\ x. Pl.Phdr.255a; moi/ras tou= xrew/n t' a)pallagh/ E.Hipp.1256; ei)s to\ x. i)e/nai Pl.Ax.364c; a)pelqei=n ei)s to\ x., ei)s to\ x. a)palla/ssesqai, Str.1.3.21, J.AJ7.15.1; oi( th\n ei)s to\ x. poreuo/menoi (cj. for poiou/menoi), v. l. tw=n ei)s to\ x. o(deuo/ntwn, Plu.2.113c; to/ toi xrew\n ou)k e)/sti mh\ xrew\n poiei=n Trag.Adesp.368; o(/ ti ga\r mh\ x. ou)/toi x. paqei=n E. Ba.515; [*)ale/candron] to\ x. e)n *babulw=ni kate/labe Jul.Or.3.107c. mostly in the phrase xrew/n (sc. e)sti), like xrh/, it is
necessary, c. inf., Thgn.564, A.Ag.922, S.OT633, Democr. l. c., etc.: c. acc. et inf., Pi.P.2.52, Hdt.1.41,57, 2.133, A.Pr.772,970, al., S.Ph.1439, Ar. Eq.138, Th.5.49; to\ x. gene/sqai Hdt.7.17. sts. as a neut. part. (like e)co/n, etc.),
it being necessary, since it was necessary, Id.5.50. less freq.,
that which is expedient or
right, o(/rkon d' ou)/t' a)/dikon x. e)/mmenai ou)/te di/kaion Choeril.7; e)/nnepe ti/ soi xrew\n u(pourgei=n S.Ph.143 (lyr.); mhte/r' ei) x. tau/thn prosauda=n Id.El.273, cf. 983, Ar.Nu.1446(lyr.), etc.; with the Art., e)/kanes o(\n ou) xrh=n, kai\ to\ mh\ x. pa/qe A.
Ch..930: abs. in part., u(mei=s a)\n ou) x. a)/rxoite ye would rule un
rightfully, Th.3.40.—In Trag. xrew/n ( = xrh/) appears without e)sti/ or h)=n; in Ar. and Prose the verb is more commonly added, but not in Ar.Nu. l. c., Pl.Sph.220d, Criti.107b, al. as Adj., tw=| x. po/sei E.Fr.501. (Not in Hom. or Hes., Od.15.201 being f. l. for xrew/.) [In Poets xrew/n is sts. monosyll., as in Choeril. l. c., Parm.4.5, al.; outside of hexameters prob. always disyll., since xrh/ can be restored in E.IT1486, Fr.733.3.] (From xrew/, with addition of n from the synonym de/on; when used as part. abs., as in Sol.Fr.34.6, Th.3.40, from xrew\ o)/n.）
xre/ws, to/, Att. for xre/os 1 (q. v.).

xrews-te/w,
to be in debt, Asp.in EN186.27: c. inf., xrewstw= th\n e)ce/tasin poih/sasqai Sever.Clyst.33:—Med.,
have a claim to, ti Hld.7.8;
have a debt owing to one, Id.5.31:—Pass.,
to be owed, owing, Sammelb.4422.4, Sch.D Il.11.685.

xrew/s-thma, atos, to/,
debt, Hsch., Phot. s.v. o)/flhma.

xrew/s-ths, ou, o(,
debtor, Ph.1.634, al., J.AJ3.12.3, Plu.2.101c, SIG833.9 (Epist.Hadriani), Luc.Abd.15, CIG2817.14 (Aphrodisias).
xrew/s-thsis, ews, h(, gloss on o)/flhsis, Hsch.

xrews-ti/a, h(,
indebtedness, Vett.Val.37.26, al.

xrews-tikw=s, Adv.
as a debt, Eust.56.35.

xrewfeil-e/ths, ou, o(,
debtor, Aen.Tact.5.2, D.S.32.26, Ev.Luc.7.41: c. gen. pers., ib.16.5, Cic.Att.7.8.5: c. gen. rei, Plu.Caes.5: metaph., opp. eu)erge/ths, Id.Galb.8. (Spelt xreofil- in SIG742.53 (Ephes., i B. C.), cf. LXXJb.31.37.)

xrewfei/l-hma, atos, to/,
debt, Poll.8.141.

xrew-fu^la^ke/w,
to be a xrewfu/lac, CIG3831a29, a413 (Aezani, xreof-), IGRom.4.580 (xrew[f]-), 585 (ibid.), 657 (Acmonia), 801 (Apamea), 820 (Hierapolis).

xrew-fu^la^ki/a, h(,
office of xrewfu/lac, CIG3847b11 (Nacolea, xreof-), IGRom.4.555.11 (Ancyra, xreof-).

xrew-fu^la^kiko/s, h/, o/n,
of the xrewfu/lac, Supp.Epigr.7.41 (Babylonia, xreof-).

xrew-fu^la/kion [a^], or xreof-, to/,
the office in which the register of public debtors is kept, Supp.Epigr.7.15.17 (Susa, ii B. C.), GDI5149.33 (Cretan, ii B. C., found at Delos), CIG2826.38, 2827.13, 2829.15, al. (Aphrodisias), Rev.Ét.Gr.19.247,259,262, al. (ibid.).

xrew-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
keeper of the register of public debtors, IG12(7).3,36 (Amorgos, iv B. C., xrewf-), GDI3706 vi 37, vii 41 (Cos, xreof-), BSA26.166 (Sparta, ii A. D., xreof-), CIG3429 (Philadelphia, xreof-), IG9(1).375 (Naupactus, xreof-).

xrew-fu^la/ssw, in aor. part. xreofula/canta, = -fulakh/santa, IGRom.4.1638 (Philadelphia). (In this group of words xrewf- is found only in xrewfulake/w IGRom.4.580, xrewfula/kion GDIl. c., CIG2826.38, 2843.9, xrewfu/lac IG l. c.)

xrh/, impers., Il.1.216, etc.; Aeol. xrh= Alc.20, 35, 46; other forms are contractions (crases) of xrh/ (prob. orig. a neut. Subst.) with forms of ei)mi/ (
sum): fut. xrh)/stai S.OC504, Fr.599, Pherecr. 103, Ar.Fr.362, Phryn.Com.34 (on this form, for which codd. generally have xrh=stai or xrh=sqai, v.
