Sch.S.OCl. c.): subj. xrh=| S.Ph. 999, E.Alc.49, Ar.Lys.133; opt. xrei/h A.Pr.215, S.Tr.162, Lys. 12.44, Pl.Euthphr.4c; inf. xrh=nai Democr.276, Ar.Ec.210, Antipho 5.84, etc.; also xrh=n (v. infr. 111); part. neut. pl. xrheo/nta (or xrh\ e)o/nta) Democr.174: impf. e)xrh=n Pi.N.7.44, A.Ch.907, S.Fr.107.6 (only here in S., xrh=n l. 5), Ar.Ra.152, al., Antipho 1.1, And.1.114, Lys. 3.22, al., Th.6.57, Pl.Prt.335c, D.4.3, al., etc.: freq. also without the augm., xrh=n Pi.Fr.123.1, S.El.529, 579, Tr.1133, Ar.Eq.535 (anap.), al., Lys.8.6, al., Th.3.63, D.15.33, al., etc.; both forms in Ar.Ach.540, e)rei= tis, "ou) xrh=n": a)lla\ ti/ e)xrh=n ei)/pate: fut. xrh/dei Hdt.7.8: —
it is necessary: c. inf. praes. aut aor.,
it must needs, one must or
ought to do (like dei=, which is only once used in Hom.), nu=n de\ x. tetla/men e)/mphs Od.3.209; to\n nu=n x. kome/ein 6.207, cf. Il. 1.216, 4.57, etc.; sh/main' o(/ ti x. soi sumpra/ssein A.Pr.297(anap.); o(/ti x. pa/sxein e)qe/lw ib.1067; o(/ ti xrei/h poiei=n Pl.Euthphr.4c, cf. 9a; tou/tou qanein xrh=n au)to\n ou(/nek' e)k se/qen; S.El.579; xrh\ to\ le/gein Parm. 6.1: more freq. c. acc. pers. et inf.,
one must, e)me\ de\ x. gh/rai+ pei/qesqai Il.23.644; tw=| se x. po/lemon . . pau=sai 7.331; ou)de/ ti/ se x. nhlee\s h)=tor e)/xein 9.496; ti/ x. me . . ste/gein h)\ ti/ le/gein; S.Ph.135 (lyr.): xrh=n ga\r *kandau/lh| gene/sqai kakw=s (where gene/sqai is inf. of an impers. verb) Hdt.1.8.—Sts. the inf. must be supplied from the context, esp. in Hom. in phrases like ti/pte ma/xhs. a)popau/eai; ou)de/ ti/ se xrh/ (sc. a)popau/esqai) Il.16.721, cf. 19.420; o(/qi x. pezo\n e)o/nta (sc. ma/rnasqai) Od.9.50; so in Trag. and Att., porqei=n a(\ mh\ x. (sc. porqei=n) A. Ag.342; fu/s t' a)f' w(=n ou) xrh=n (sc. fu=nai）, cu\n oi(=s t' ou) xrh=n (sc. o(milei=n） o(milw=n S.OT1184; e)/kanes o(\n ou) xrh=n (sc. ktei=nai) A.Ch.930; e)pipleu/seie/ tis w(s x. (sc. e)pipleu=sai) Th.2.89; qu/santes oi(=s x. (sc. qu=sai) Pl. R.415e; a)kairo/teron o)/nta h)\ x. Id.Plt.307e; lalei=n meta\ a)felei/as e)/nqa x. Longin.34.2.; so w(s x. A.Ag.1556 (anap.), etc.—The impf. freq. expresses something that ought to have been, but is not, e)nqa/d' ou) parastatei=, w(s xrh=n, *)ore/sths ib.879, cf. S.Tr.1133; and sts. stands for xrh/, xrh=n ti le/gein u(ma=s sofo\n w| nikh/sete Ar.Pl.487 (anap.), cf. 432: abs., e)rei=tis, "ou) xrh=n": a)lla\ti/ e)xrh=n ei)/pate Id.Ach.540. in Hom. without inf., c. acc. pers. et gen. rei, ou)de/ ti/ se xrh\ a)frposu/nhs thou
hast no
need of imprudence, i. e. it does not
befit thee, Il.7.109; ou) me/n se x. e)/t' ai)dou=s Od.3.14; ti/ me x. mhte/ros ai)/nou; 21.110; muqh/seai o(/tteo/ (i.e. o(/tou） se x. 1.124; te/o se x.; 4.463: ti/ xrh\ fi/lwn is found in most codd. of E.Or.667 (dei= cod. V). c. dat. pers. pro acc. is not found; in Il.5.490, A.Pr.3, the dat. belongs to the inf. me/lein; in S.Ant.736 Dobree restored me for ge; in E.Med. 886 h(=| depends on metei=nai; in Ion1316 Dobree read tou\s de/ g' e)ndi/kous, and in Lys.28.10 dikai/ous . . u(felome/nous was restored by Cobet. sts. in a less strong sense, pw=s tou=to pera=sai xrh/; how
is one to get through this? Theoc.15.45; ti/ e)xrh=n me poiei=n; what
was I to do? D.18.28; e(\n ou)de\n kate/sth i)/ama o(/ti xrh=n prosfero/ntas w)felei=n there was no one remedy by the application of which one
could (or
was bound to) help them, Th.2.51, cf. 1.91. to\ xrh=n (inf.)
fate, destiny, E.Hec.260 (s. v. l., to\ xrh\ Nauck); to\ xrh/ Id.HF828; cj. for to\ xrew/n (monosyll.) in Id.Fr.733.3, IT1486.

xrh=, xrh=s, 3 and 2 pers. sg. pres. indic. of a defect. verb, expld. by Hsch. and Sch.S.Ant.887 by qe/lei xrh/|zei, qe/leis xrh/|zeis and found in the following passages: ei)/te xrh=| qanei=n whether she
desires to die, S.Ant.887 (xrh/ codd., cf. Sch.ad loc.); soi\ de\ dra=n e)/cesq' a(\ xrh=|s Id.Aj.1373 (xrh/ codd.); ei)/te xrh=|s (sc. khru/ssein me) Id.El.606 (xrh/ codd.); pro\s tau=q' o(/ ti xrh=| kai\ palama/sqwn E.Fr.918 (anap., xrh/ codd.); pa/ra d' a)/ll' o(/ ti xrh=|s Cratin.127, cf. Eup.4 (prob. l.); ou) xrh=sqa (sc. fwnei=n); Ar.Ach.778 (Megarian). (Cogn. with xrh/, ke/xrhmai 'I yearn after', xrh/|zw.）
xrhe/omai, in some dialects, = xrw=mai, v. xra/w (B) C.
xrh/essi, v. xre/os.

xrh/|zw, Thgn.958, A.Pr.376, Ar.Nu.891 (anap.), Th.3.109, etc.; in Att. hardly found exc. in pres. and impf. (but v. infr. 11): Ep. and Ion. xrhi/+zw, as always in Hom., and Hdt.1.41, 5.19, 30, 9.87; written xrhii/zw, SIG57.41 (Milet., v B. C.); also xrei/+zw, Herod.7.64; Dor. xrh/|zw SIG56.23 (Argos, v B. C.); also xrh/zw ib.1006.3 (Cos, iii B. C.); xrei/zw ib.953.27 (Calymna, ii B. C.): sicil. Dor. xrh/|sdw Theoc.8.11; Megar.Dor. xrh/|ddw Ar.Ach.734: fut. xrh/|sw Ti.Locr.99a, Ion. xrhi/+sw Hdt.7.38: aor. Ion. xrhi/+sai prob. Id.5.65; part. xrhi/+sas ib.20, 7.38: (xrh/):—
want, lack, have need of, c. gen., xrhi/+zonta . . i)hth=ros Il.11.835; ei)/reto . . o(/tteu xrhi/+zwn i(ko/mhn Od.17.121, cf. 558; ou)d' e)mou= didaska/lou xrh/|zeis A.Pr.376; du/o xrh/|sei [mesota/twn] Ti.Locr. l. c.: abs. in part. xrhi/+zwn
needy, poor, Od.11.340, Hes.Op.351.
desire, long for, crave, xrhi/+zein a)peo/ntos ib.367; tou=ton w)=n doke/w . . poih/sein w(=n a)\n xrhi/+zwmen Hdt.5.30; xrhma/twn x. Id.9.87; bora=s A.Ch.530; tou= makrou= x. bi/ou Soph.Aj.473: rarely c. acc., pa=n ma=llon doke/wn min xrhi/+sein h)\ to\ e)deh/qh Hdt.7.38; w(/st' a)/lla xrh/|zein S.OT595, cf. E.Supp.123; an inf. may freq. be supplied, fra/ze . . o(/ ti xrh/|zeis (sc. fra/zein) Ar.Nu.359, cf. 453 (both anap.); i)/q' o(/poi xrh/|zeis (sc. i)e/nai) ib.891(anap.), cf. Th.751, A.Pr. 928, S.OT365; ti/ dh=ta xrh/|zeis; ib.622, OC643. c. acc. pers. et inf.,
ask or
desire that one should do a thing, Hdt.1.41, 112, 152, al.; so c. gen. pers. et inf.,
desire of one to do, Id.5.19,65, 9.55; in Trag., c. inf. only,
desire to do a thing, A.Pr.235, 285, al., S.OT 91, E.Hec.347, etc.: rare in Prose, Th.3.109, X.Cyr.1.6.15. c. dupl. gen. pers. et rei, tw=nde e)gw\ u(me/wn xrhi/+zwn sune/leca hdt.7.53. xrh/|zein para/ tinos c. inf., Ps.-Hdt.Vit.Hom.17. part. xrh/|zwn is used abs. for ei) xrh/|zei,
if one will, if one chooses, Thgn. 958, A.Ch.340 (anap.); a)/lla fanei= xrh/|zwn (sc. *(ermh=s)
if propitious, ib. [815] (lyr.); h)\n to\n qeo\n xrh/|zont' e)/xh| E.Supp.597; potaggelle/tw o( xrh/|zwn, = o( boulo/menos, IG12(1).677.34 (Ialysus); also to\ xrh=|zon
your solicitation, E.IA 1017. Pass., xrhsqei/s is f. l. in S.Ant.24.

xrh/|zw, = xra/w (B) A. 1,
deliver an oracle, foretell, only in E.Hel.516 (lyr.; leg. xrh/sas').

entryFree.sense: xrh/i+a, Cret., = xrh/mata, SIG527.84 (Dreros, iii B. C.), cf. Hsch.

div0.entryFree: xrhi/+zw, Ion. for xrh/|zw.

xrhi/+skomai,
need, tw=| u(/dati Hdt.3.117.

xrh=ma, atos, to/: (xra/omai):—
need, in the phrase para\ x. or paraxrh=ma (q. v.);
a thing that one needs or
uses, cf. X.Oec.1.9 sq. (pl.): hence in pl.,
goods, property (xrh/mata le/gomen pa/nta o(/swn h( a)ci/a nomi/smati metrei=tai Arist.EN1119b26), Od.2.78, 203, al. (never in Il.), Hes.Op.320, 407, etc.; of temple-
treasures, heirlooms, etc., Mnemos. 57.208 (Argos, vi B. C.); ta\ i(ra\ x. th=s *)aqhnai/hs Hdt.2.28, cf. 9.81; qhsaurou/s . . a)/lla te xru/sea a)/fata x. Id.7.190; pollw=n x. e)cai/reton a)/nqos A.Ag.954; peirw= to\n plou=ton xrh/matakai\ kth/mata kataskeua/zein: e)/sti de\ x. me\n toi=s a)polau/ein e)pistame/nois, k. de\ toi=s kta=sqai duname/nois Isoc.1.28; toi=s skeu/esi kai\ toi=s xrh/masin a)poqh/kh Th.6.97; pro/bata
kai\ a)/lla x. X.An.5.2.4; ta\ a)ndra/poda . . kai\ xrh/mata ta\ plei=sta a)pe/dra au)tou/s ib.7.8.12: prov., xrh/mata yuxh\ pe/letai . . brotoi=si a man's
money is his life, Hes.Op.686; xrh/mat' a)/nhr '
money makes the man', Alc.49, Pi.I.2.11; e)n xrh/masin oi)kei= patrw/ois A.Eu.757, cf. Ch.135; also xrhma/twn pe/nhtes E.El.37; ta\ xrh/mat' e)nexura/zomai Ar.Nu.241; xrh/mata pori/zein Id.Ec.236; a)/timoi h)=san ta\ sw/mata, ta\ de\ x. ei)=xon And.1.74; xrhma/twn h(/sswn Democr.50; xrhma/twn krei/sswn Th.2.60; xrh/masi nikw/menos ibid.; xrhma/twn a)dwro/tatos ib. 65; e)lpi/da xrh/masin w)nhth/n Id.3.40; mh/te xrhma/twn feidome/nous mh/te po/nwn Pl.Phd.78a; zhmiou=sqai xrh/masin Id.Lg.721b; even of debts, dialu=sai ta\ x. D.20.12; deqe/nt' e)pi\ xrh/masin e)n tw=| desmwthri/w| Id.24.168.—Acc. to Poll.9.87 the Ion. used also the sg. in this sense, and so we find, e)pi\ ko/sw| a)\n xrh/mati . . ; for how much
money . . ? Answ. e)p' ou)deni/, Hdt.3.38; tau/thn (sc. th\n xlani/da）pwle/w me\n ou)deno\s x. di/dwmi de\ a)/llws ib.139; also in Thgn.197, x. d' o(\ me\n *dio/qen kai\ su\n di/kh| a)ndri\ ge/nhtai; in Att., ou)deno\s a)\n x. deca/menoi at no
price, And.2.4; and in later Prose,
fund, sum of money, Arch. f. Religionswiss.10.211 (Cos, ii B. C.); to\ plh=qos tou= x. D.S.13.106, cf. Act.Ap.4.37, Luc.VH1.20; xrh/mata
merchandise, Heraclit. 90, X.HG1.6.37, Th.3.74;
property, substance, Berl.Sitzb.1927.161 (Cyrene). generally,
thing, matter, affair, esp. in Ep. and Ion., h.Merc.332, Hes.Op.344,402; xrhma/twn a)/elpton ou)de/n Archil. 74; pa/ntwn x. dikaio/taton Mimn.8; prw=ton xrhma/twn pa/ntwn Hdt.7.145; a)nti\ pa/ntwn x. on every
account, And.2.21; deino/taton a(pa/ntwn xrhma/twn ib.1; pa=n x. e)ki/nee 'left no stone unturned', Hdt.5.96; tekmai/rei xrh=m' e(/kaston 'deeds show the man', Pi.O.6.74; pa/ntwn x. me/tron a)/nqrwpos Protag.1; perai/netai to\ x. the
issue is being decided, Plu.Caes.47: pl., simply,
things, o(mou= pa/nta x. h)=n Anaxag.1, cf. Pl.Cra.440a, Euthd.294d, Plot.4.2.1. xrh=ma is freq. expressed where it might be omitted, deino\n x. e)poieu=nto Hdt.8.16; oi(=o/n ti x. poih/seie ib.138; e)s a)fane\s x. a)poste/llein a)poiki/hn to send out a colony without any certain
destination, Id.4.150; freq. in Trag., ti/ xrh=ma; = ti/;
what? ti/ x. leu/ssw; A.Pr.300, Ch.10; or
why? E.Alc.512; so in gen., tou= x. (sc. e(/neka); Ar.Nu.1223; ti/ x. dra=|s; S.Aj.288, cf. Ph.1231; ti/ x. pa/sxei; E. Hipp.909; ti/ d' e)sti\ xrh=ma; what is
the matter? A.Ch.885; pikro/n ti/ moi dokei= x. ei)=nai Pl.Grg.485b; h(du/ Id.Tht.209e, al.; ma/lista xrhma/twn most
of anything, i. e.
certainly, Anon.Oxy.1611.68 (iii A. D.); cf. xre/os 11.2. used in periphrases to express something strange or extraordinary of its kind, u(o\s x. me/ga a huge
monster of a boar, Hdt.1.36; h)=n tou= xeimw=nos x. a)fo/rhton Id.7.188; to\ x. tw=n nuktw=n o(/son what a
business the nights are! Ar.Nu.2; liparo\n to\ x. th=s po/lews what a grand city! Id.Av.826, cf. Lys.83; kle/pton to\ x. ta)ndro/s a thievish
sort of fellow, Id.V.933; to\ x. tou= nosh/matos Id.Lys.1085; maka/rion . . le/geis tura/nnou x. your tyrant-
creature, Pl.R. 567e; x. qaumasto\n gunaiko/s Plu.Ant.31: without a gen., e)/lafon, kalo/n ti x. kai\ me/ga X.Cyr.1.4.8; sofo/n toi xrh=m' a)/nqrwpos truly a clever
creature is he! Theoc.15.83; kou=fon x. poihth/s e)stin kai\ pthno\n kai\ i(ero/n, of the poet, Pl.Ion534b; x. kalo/n ti such a fine
thing! Theoc.15.23; also in a periphrastic use, ou)de\n x. tou= a)gkw=nos ka/myai du/nantai cannot bend the elbow
at all, Hp.Fract.42. so, to express a great number or mass, as we say,
a deal, a heap of . . , pollo/n ti x. tw=n te/knwn, x. pollo\n a)rdi/wn, new=n, Hdt.3.109, 4.81, 6.43; x. pollo/n ti xrusou= Id.3.130; smikro\n to\ x. tou= bi/ou E. Supp.953; o(/son to\ x. parno/pwn what a
lot of locusts! Ar.Ach.150; o(/son to\ x. tou= plakou=ntos Id.Eq.1219; polu\ x. temaxw=n Id.Pl.894; to\ x. tw=n ko/pwn o(/son what a
lot of them! Id.Ra.1278; tw=n lampa/dwn o(/son to\ x. Id.Th.281; also of persons, x. qhleiw=n woman
kind, E.Ph. 198; sfendonhtw=n pa/mpolu/ ti x. X.Cyr.2.1.5; me/ga x. *lakaina=n Theoc.18.4: without a gen., o(/son to\ x. e)pi\ dei=pnon h)=lqe what a
crowd . . ! Ar.Pax1192. (xra/w (B) A)
oracle, Emp.115.1.

xrhma^t-a^gwgo/s, o(,
money-carrier, PHib.1.110.52, al. (iii B. C.).

xrhma^t-i/zw, fut. -i/sw Ep.Rom.7.3, Att. xrhma^t-iw= Lycurg.37: pf. kexrhma/tika Din.1.103, OGI106.7 (Egypt, ii B. C.): (xrh=ma):—Prose Verb,
negotiate, have dealings, esp. in money matters (in this sense mostly Med. (v. infr.11)), Th.1.87, 5.61, Plb.5.81.5; x. ti Th.6.62, Isoc.4.157, Plu. Them.18. of public assemblies,
deliberate, peri\ *eu)ripi/dou o(/ ti xrh\ paqei=n Ar.Th.377, cf. Arist.Pol.1298b29, Rh.1359b3, Lexap.D.21.8; ta\ loipa\ tw=n dhmosi/wn Plu.Tim.38; peri\ w(=n a)\n a(/pac gnw=| to\ dikasth/rion, pa/linxrhmati/sai D.24.55; of presiding officers,
conduct business, Decr. ap. D.18.75, cf. Aeschin.1.23; of the boulh/, D.18.169; o(/sa dei= xrhmati/sai th\n boulh/n Arist.Ath.43.3. c. dat.,
transact business with, th=| boulh=|, tw=| dh/mw|, X.Ath.3.1;
negotiate with, po/lesi peri\ fili/as Th.5.5: abs., ib.61; i)di/a| x., of intriguing persons, D.19.278; x. u(pe\r dhmosi/wn kai\ koinw=n pragma/twn Ael.VH3.4:—Med.,X.Ath. 3.3.
give audience to, presbeutai=s Plb.3.66.6, cf. Jul.Or.1.13a. of an oracle,
give a response to those who consult it, LXX Je.33(26).2, al., D.S.15.10, JAJ11.8.4, Plu.2.435c, Porph. Abst.2.48; di' u(/datos Iamb.Myst.3.11; of gods,
give ear to, x. toi=s eu)xome/nois Luc.Pseudol.8:—Pass.,
receive an answer, warning, in NT of
divine warnings or
revelations, Ev.Matt.2.12, etc.; u(p' a)gge/lou Act.Ap.10.22; h)=n au)tw=| kexrhmatisme/non
a warning had been given him, Ev.Luc.2.26; x. u(po\ daimoni/wn kai\ fantasi/as ei)dw/lwn Vett.Val.67.5.
issue ordinances, etc., x. a)porrh/seis Ph.2.438;
administer justice, e)n tw=| *proswpi/th| OGI l.c.; tai=s po/lesi App.Hisp.98.
issue orders for payment,
pay, a)po\ th=s . . trape/zhs PGrenf.2.23.4 (ii B. C.); tivi Ostr.Bodl.i248 (ii B. C.); lo/gon x. e)s ta\ damo/sia gra/mmata
furnish an account . . ,
Arch. f. Religionswiss. 10.211 (Cos, ii B. C.):—Pass., e)xrhmati/sqh polla\ dia/fora he
was furnished with large sums, Aristeas 9.
take cognizance of, decide upon petitions, [e)nteucin] x. PEnteux.75.9 (iii B. C.), PFay. 12.28 (ii B. C.); e)/nteucis kexrhmatisme/nh PPetr.2p.3 (iii B. C.). generally,
have dealings with, stand in any relation to a person, ou)de\n au)tw=| (sic legendum videtur) pro\s ge/nos e)xrhma/tizen Ctes.Fr. 29.2: hence even mo/lis tai=s a)nagkai/ais [o)re/cesi] x.
to be influenced, affected by them, Plu.2.125b. Astrol.,
operate, of influences, Vett.Val.5.7. Med., xrhmati/zomai: fut. Att. -iou=mai Lys.29.14, etc.: pf. kexrhma/tismai Din.1.15:—
negotiate or
transact business for oneself or
to one's own profit, make money, oi)o/menoi xrhmatiei=sqai ma=llon h)\ maxei=sqai Th.7.13; xrhmatiou/menos a)ll' ou) pro\s u(ma=s filotimhso/menos Lys. l.c.; oi( xrhmatisa/menoi Pl.R.330c; a)/llw| x. kai\ ou)x au(tw=| Id.Grg.452e; esp. by base arts, e)c au)th=s th=s po/lews Din. l. c., cf. Is.9.25; x. a)po/ tinos
to make money of or from a thing, Pl. Sph.225e; a)po\ tw=n koinw=n Arist.Pol.1286b14; a)po\ gewmetri/as Iamb. Comm.Math.25; e)/k tinos Lys.25.3; e), filosofi/as Isoc.11.1; also c. acc. cogn., x. to\n e)k gh=s xrhmatismo/n Id.Lg.949e, cf. Grg.467d; xrh/mata X.Cyr.3.3.5. generally,
transact business, have dealings with . . , tini Hdt.3.118, 7.163. c. acc. rei, x. to\ no/misma
traffic in money, like a money-lender or banker, Arist.Pol.1257b34; but c. acc. pers., x. tinas
make money out of any one, i. e.
get it
from them
by extortion, Plb.32.5.13; so x. para\ tw=n newte/rwn Isoc.10.6. in later writers, from Plb. downwards, the Act. xrhmati/zw takes some special senses:
to take and bear a title or
name, to be called or
styled so and so, xrhmati/zein basileu/s Plb.5.57.2, 30.2.4, cf. Aristeas 298; *ptolemai=os . . ne/os *dio/nusos x. D.S.1.44; e)xrhma/tize *xalkhdo/nios, *krhtiko/s, Str.13.1.55, App.Sic.6; ne/a *)=isis e)xrhma/tize Plu.Ant.54; mh\ patro/qen, a)ll' a)po\ mhte/rwn x.
to call themselves not after their fathers, but after their mothers, Id.2.248d; x. a)po\ tou= dh/mou Harp. s.v. dhmoteuo/menos; x. tou\s maqhta\s *xristianou/s Act.Ap. 11.26; timh=s kai\ pi/stews x. a)/cioi
to be deemed . . , App.BC2.111. generally,
to be called, moixali/s Ep.Rom.7.3: mh/thr Ph.1.440; kai\ w(s x. 'and so forth' (omitting some of the writer's names), POxy.100.1 (ii A. D.), etc.; also c. dat., a)ei\ -i/zwn tw=| prokeime/nw| o)nomati/w| ib.2131.8 (iii A. D.).
change or
be changed, ei)/s ti Gp.12.1.9.

xrhma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n, (xrh/mata)
of or
in money, x. zhmi/a a
money fine, J.AJ11.5.1, Plu.Dem. 27; x. sumbo/laia
money contracts, Id.Lyc.13; oi( x. the
moneyed men, Id.Sol.14; x. peni/a Id.2.524e; di/kh POxy.237 viii 13 (ii A. D.); do/sis BGU473.9 (ii/iii A. D.). Adv. -kw=s,
civiliter, Gloss.

xrhma^/t-i^sis, ews, h(, = sq. 11, X.Oec.11.11, 20.22, Ael.Fr.186. Astrol.,
operation, activity, Vett.Val.289.31.

xrhma^t-ismo/s, o(,
negotiation, giving audience to ambassadors, Plb.28.16.10 (pl.); e)poiei=to to\n x. kai\ tou\s lo/gous ib.16.4, cf. Vett.Val.63.20(pl.).
decree or
ordinance, made by a sovereign or some public authority, D.S.1.64,70 (but x. strathgw=n
business introduced by the generals, Decr.Del. ap. J.AJ14.10.14);
decision on a case or petition, UPZ25.2 (ii B. C.), OGI139.18(pl., Philae, ii B. C.), etc.
administration of justice by xrhmatistai/, PCair.Zen.513 (iii B. C.). any
public instrument or
document, D.S.14.13, Supp.Epigr.3.367.34 (Lebad., ii B.C.), LXX 2 Ma.11.17;
public records, PEnteux.22.9 (iii B. C.), PPar.65.15 (ii B. C.), Chron.Lind.A.7 (pl.), Supp.Epigr.3.674.32 (Rhodes, ii B. C.). generally,
deed, legal instrument, Arch.Pap.4.130iii 41 (ii A. D.), etc.; dhmo/sios x. notarial
instrument, Mitteis Chr.200.9 (iii A. D.), etc.: pl., ib.192.35 (Edict of Mettius Rufus, i A. D.); tw=n dou/lwn tou\s x. the
title-deeds referring to the slaves, PUniv.Giss.20.8 (ii A. D.).
oracular response, divine injunction or
warning, LXX 2.Ma.2.4, Ep.Rom.11.4, Artem.1.2, Vett.Val.1.7, PMag.Par.1.2206. (from Med.)
doing business for one's own gain, money-making, freq. in Pl., a)melh/sas xrhmatis mou= kai\ oi)konomi/as Ap.36b; i)a/treusis kai\ o( a)/llos x. R. 357c; x. dia\ banausi/as kai\ to/kwn Lg.743d; o( e)k gh=s x. ib. 949e: pl., R.465c, Lg.741e, Isoc.3.50; xrhmatismo/s, ou) lh|tourgi/a ge/gonen h( trihrarxi/a D.21.167. later,
appellation, title, designation, SIG739.2 (Delph., i B. C.), D.L.1.48 (pl.);
use of a name or
designation, Arch.Pap.4.122v7 (ii A. D.); simply,
name, Dosith.p.382K. 'affair', x. eu)/xrhstos (of spa/rgana) Sor.1.111 (sed leg. sxhm-.）

xrhma^t-iste/on,
one must make money, X.Lac.7.3.

xrhma^t-isth/s, ou=, o(,
money-getter, trafficker, Pl.Grg. 452a, R.330b. Onos.1.20, etc.; joined with dhmiourgo/s, Pl.R.434a; deino\s x. x. Oec.2.18: metaph., prao/thtos x. Philostr.VS2.17. as Adj., o( x. [bi/os] Arist.EN1096a5 (s. v. l.). in Egypt,
circuitjudge, PCair.Zen.513 (iii B. C.), PRev.Laws 15.4 (iii B. C.), OGI 106.6 (ii B. C.), Aristeas 111, etc.; oi( e)pi\ tw=n to/pwn x. PFay.11.25 (ii B. C.), cf. UPZ162 ii 5 (ii B. C.), etc.

xrhma^t-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for traffic and
money-making, o( x.
a man of business, Pl.R.581d; opp. a)nalwtiko/s, ib.558d; opp. stratiwtiko/s, oi)kh/seis ib.415e; opp. strathgiko/s, diatribai/ Plu.Crass.17; x. oi)wno/s an omen
portending gain, X.An.6.1.23; to\ x. the
commercial class, opp. to\ polemiko/n, etc., Arist.Pol.1291b21; h( -kh/ (sc. te/xnh) the
art of money-making, Pl. Grg.477e, Euthd. 307a, al.; on its varieties, v. Arist.Pol.1256b41.
belonging to or
fitted for the dispatch of public business, x. skhnh/, pulw/n, a tent, hall
for holding conferences, giving audience, Plb.5.81.5, 15.31.2.
notarial, tra/peza PLond.3.1164
d.4(iii A. D.).
oracular, prophetic, yuxh/ Porph.Abst.4.10. Astrol.,
effective, operative, to/poi Vett.Val.29.18, Antioch.Astr. in Cat.Cod.Astr. 8(3).107; of stars Iamb.Myst.3.30.

xrhma^t-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, a)gw/n contest
for a money-prize, Marm.Par.53, cf. Sch.Pi.O.8.101.

xrhma^to-dai/ths, ou, Dor. xrhma^/to-tas, o(,
divider of wealth, ktea/nwn x. A.Th.729(lyr.).

xrhma^to-poio/s, o/n,
money-making, money-getting, Ar. Ec.442; te/xnh X.Oec.20.15.

xrhma^tourgi/a, h(, Astrol.,
operation, activity, tw=n a)ste/rwn Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).214.

xrhma^to-fqoriko/s, h/, o/n,
fitted for wasting money, spendthrift, opp. xrhmatistiko/s, Pl.Sph.225d.

xrhma^to-fu^la/kion [a^k], to/,
treasury, Str.12.2.6.

xrhma^to-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(, = Lat.
praefectus aerarii, Vett.Val.38.34.
xrh/mh, h(, Ion. for xrei/a 1, Archil.56.5, Ps.-Hdt.Vit.Hom.13,14, dub.in Call. in PSI11.1216.19; o(/tew| xrh/mh tea/ e)sti pai=da poih/sasqai cj. in Democr.277.

xrhmosu/nh, h(,
need, want, lack, Thgn.389,394, al., dub. cj. in Trag.Adesp.509 (lyr.).
xrh=n, v. xrh/.
xrh/nnumi and xrhma^to-u/w, v. xra/w (B)B.
xrh=os, to/, Dor. for xre/us.
xrh=|s, xrh=sqa, v. xrh=|.
xrh/|sdw, Dor. for xrh/|zw.

xrhsi^m-eu/w,
to be useful or
serviceable, toi=s e)pilh/ptois Thphr. Fr.175, cf. Phld.Rh.1.221, al., Luc.DMort.10.9; th=| patri/di IGRom. 4.1228 (Thyatira); pro/s ti D.S.1.81, Dsc.2.149; ei)/s ti Epicur.Fr. 458, Gal.19.396, Iamb. in Nic.p.12P.: abs., LXX Wi.4.3, Muson. Fr.18Ap.95 H., Alex.Aphr. in Top.430.2: sens.obsc., D.L.6.91:— rejected by the Atticists, cf. Phryn.367.

xrhsi^m-ologe/w,
speak for edification, prob. in Phld.Po.5.13.

xrhsi^m-ologi/a, h(,
edification, ibid.

xrh/si^m-os, h, on, also os, on X.Mem.3.8.8, Pl.Grg.480b, R.333b: (xra/mai):—
useful, serviceable, first in Thgn.406; ei)s a)na/gkan, e)/nq' ou) podi\ xrhsi/mw| xrh=tai S.OT878 (lyr.); to\ x. frenw=n the
excellence of . . , E.Ph.1740 (lyr.); to\ au)ti/ka x. Th.3.56; h( dia\ to\ x. fili/a Arist.EN1159b13; ta\ x. Men.Mon.579; x. ei)/s ti
useful for something, Hdt.4.109, Ar.Pl.493 (anap.), Pl.R.l. c.; e)pi/ ti Id.Grg. l. c.; pro/s ti E.Hipp.482 (Comp.); i)di/a| e(ka/stw| x. kai\ u(pe\r tou= koinou= w)fe/lima X.Cyr.6.2.34; tou=t' ou)=n ti/ e)sti xrh/simon; Ar.Nu.202; xrh/simo/n e)sti, c. inf., Id.Av.382 (troch.). of persons,
serviceable, useful, S.Aj.410, D.20.7, etc.; Comp. -w/teros Pl.Lg.819c: esp., like xrhsto/s,
a good and useful citizen, x. po/lei E.Or.910; x. poli/ths Eup.118; x. tini Is.Fr.16.1; e)pi/ ti D.25.31; tou\s eu)po/rous dei= x. au(tou\s pare/xein toi=s poli/tais to show themselves
useful, serviceable to the state, Id.42.22, cf. E.Supp.887, Is.Fr.10.1 (Comp.); toi=s sw/masi -w/teroi more
able-bodied, X.Lac.5.9; opp. a)rgale/os th\n o)/yin, Aeschin.1.61.
used, made use of, te/menos -w/taton a
muchfrequented sanctuary, dub. in Hdt.2.178. xrhsi/mh diaqh/kh an
available (i.e.
authentic) will, Is.6.30. nomi/smata ou) xrh/sima e)/cw money
that will not
pass abroad, X.Vect.3.2. Adv., -mws e)/xein to be
serviceable, Th.3.44, X.Cyr.8.5.9; x. tini\ swqh=nai
with advantage to him, Th.5.91, cf. J.BJ6.2.9; ta\ -mws lego/mena Plu. 2.36d.

xrhsi^m-o/ths, htos, h(,
usefulness, Gloss.

<*> xrh=sis, ews, h(, (xra/omai)
employment, use made of a thing, a)ne/mwn Pi.O.11(10).2; xrhma/twn Democr.282; oi)ki/as Pl.Erx.394d, cf. SIG987.33 (Chios, iv B. C.); th\n kat' a)ci/an x. poiou=ntai e(ka/stw| (fort. leg. e(ka/stou) Iamb.Protr.5;
use, practice, Hp.VM4; in pl.,
uses, advantages, Pi.N.1.30; ai( e)s ta\ polemika\ x. the
uses of war, X.Cyr. 8.5.7; ai( politikai\ x. Arist.Pol.1267a23; opp. kth=sis, Pl.Mx.238b, Arist.EN1098b32, Cic.Fam.7.29.1; opp. pw/lhsis, X.Oec.3.9.
usefulness, Th.7.5; opp. a)xrhsti/a, Pl.R.333d; e)s xrh=sin kratu/nesqai
so as to become useful, Hp.Art.27; e)/xein xrh=sin to be
useful, D.11.8.
intimacy, acquaintance, h( oi)keio/ths kai\ h( x. [th=s po/lews] Isoc. Ep.2.14; h( x. h( pro\s a)llh/lous Arist.Pol.1280a36; ai( oi)/koi xrh/seis Isoc.19.11; h( tw=n a)frodisi/wn x. Pl.Lg.841a, Arist.HA581b13, cf. Pol. 1262a34 (pl.), Ep.Rom.1.26; ta\ e)n xrh/sei
familiar objects, Plot.4.4.37. Gramm.,
usage, of words, h( e)callagh\ th=s sunh/qous x. D.H.Amm.2.3; a)nastre/fwn ta\s x. ib.2, cf. A.D.Synt.119.24, al.; h( *pla/twnos x. Id.Pron.72.18; in concrete sense,
example of a word or use, puknw=s ai( x. para\ *ai)oleu=sin ib.66.3;
passage cited, f. l. for kri/sei in D.H.Rh.4.3; indicated by the symbol <*>, Anon.Oxy.1611.56 (iii A. D.); <*> *)aristofa/nous (referring to Av.1181) An.Ox.2.452. (xra/w (B) A),
oracular response, a)po\ kei/nou xrh/sios at his
bidding, Pi.O.13.76. (xra/w (B) B),
lending, loan, Arist.EN 1131a4, Plb.31.23.4, Ps.-Phoc.106.

xrhsm-a^go/rhs, ou, o(,
utterer of oracles, of Apollo, AP9.525.23.

xrhsm-hgore/w,
utter oracles. Luc.Syr.D.10.

xrhsm-hgo/ros, on,
uttering oracles, a)/duton Rev.Phil.46.114 (Yazili Kaya); *si/bulla IGRom.4.1540 (Erythrae).

xrhsmo-gra/fion [a^], to/,
office where oracles are recorded, Rev. Phil.44.249,251 (Didyma, ii B. C.).

xrhsmo-dosi/a, h(,
a giving of oracles, Vett.Val. 184.6 (pl.).

xrhsmodot-e/w,
give oracles, Poll.1.17:—Pass.,
receive an oracular response, CIG4539 (Palestine); aor. inf. written -isqh=nai (as if from -i/zw) Ps.-Callisth.3.17 cod.Leid.

xrhsmodo/t-hma, atos, to/,
oracular response, Suid.

xrhsmodo/t-hs, ou, o(,
one who gives oracles, prophet, soothsayer, Poll.1.14, Vett.Val.112.10.
xrhsmo-la/los [a^], on, = xrhsmolo/gos, tri/podes Orac. in App.Anth. 6.82.10.
xrhsmo-le/sxhs, ou, o(, = foreg., Lyc.1419.

xrhsmolog-e/w,
utter oracles, Ar.Av.964,991, D.S.16.26; ei)rh/nhn x.
to prophesy peace, LXX Je.45(38).4.

xrhsmolog-i/a, h(,
an uttering of oracles, D.S.16.26, Poll.1.18.

xrhsmolog-ikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
the art of divination, ib.19.

xrhsmolo/g-ion, to/,
divination, ib.18.

xrhsmo/log-os (parox.), on,
uttering oracles, x. a)nh/r
soothsayer, diviner, Hdt.1.62, 8.96; of Musaeus, S.Fr.1116.
expounder of oracles, Hdt.7.142,143; and in 7.6, of Onomacritus,
collector of oracles, oracle-monger, cf. Ar.Av.960, Pax1047, Th.2.8,21.

xrhsmolu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
expounder of oracles, Tz. ad Lyc.494.

xrhsmo-peuste/w,
consult an oracle, An.Bachm.1.418 (ubi male -pneustou=nti).

xrhsmo-poio/s, o/n,
making oracles in verse, Luc.Alex. 23.

xrhsmo/s, o(, (xra/w (B) A)
oracular response, oracle, Pi.P.4.60, SIG1044.49 (Halic., iv/iii B. C.), etc.; x. a)sh/mous duskri/tws t' ei)rhme/nous A.Pr.662; e)/xrhs' *)adra/stw| *aoci/as xrhsmo/n E.Ph.409; sfi xrhsmo\n e)/faine delivered
an oracle to them, Hdt.1.159; a)/|dein Th.2.21 (cf. xrhsmw|do/s）; eu)/teknoi x. promising happy progeny, E.Ion424; x. e)/mmetros Plu.2.396c; kataloga/dhn tou\s x. le/gein ib. 397d; xrhsmo\s . . perai/netai is fulfilled, E.Ph.1703; xrhsmou= o)/ntos . . th\n po/lin diafqarh=nai Pl.R.415c; w(/sper xrhsmou\s gra/yantes, i. e. with all solemnity, Lycurg.92, cf. Isoc.4.171.

xrhsmosu/nh, h(,
need, want, poverty, Tyrt.10.8, A.R.2.473, Plot.1.8.5. in mystical sense, opp. ko/ros and corresponding to diako/smhsis, Heraclit.65, cf. Ph.1.89, 2.242, Plu.2.389c.
importunity, th=s x. meti/esan Hdt.9.33.
service, A.R.1.837.

xrhsmo-fo/ros, on,
bringing oracles, Paus.4.9.3.

xrhsmo-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
keeper of oracles, Luc.Alex.23.

xrhsmw|d-e/w,
deliver oracles, prophesy, Hdt.7.6, Ar.Eq.818 (anap.), Pl.Cra.396d; ti X.Ap.30; tisi Pl.Ap.39c; ta\ sumfe/ronta Epicur. Sent.Vat.29; x. e)mme/trws Plu.2.623c:—Pass., kexrhsmw|dh/sqw Pl.Lg.712a; ta\ kexrhsmw|dhme/na Id.Ep.323c. Pass.,
to be inspired, receive a divine revelation, Ph.2.384.

xrhsmw/|d-hma, atos, to/,
oracular response, Hsch., Eust.1426.62.

xrhsmw/dhs, es,
oracular, Philostr.Her.10.4; sofi/a Id.VA6.11.

xrhsmw|d-i/a, h(,
answer of an oracle, prophecy, prop.
chanted or
in verse, A.Pr.775, Plu.2.402d: pl., Pl.Prt.316d.

xrhsmw|d-iko/s, h/, o/n,
oracular, Luc.Alex.22. Adv. -kw=s Eust.45.39.

xrhsmw|d-o/lhros, o(,
oracular nonsense, cj. for xrhismode/lhros in Pl.Com. 13D.

xrhsmw|d-o/s, o/n, (w)|dh/) prop.
chanting oracles, or
delivering them in verse; then, generally,
prophesying, prophetic, x. parqe/nos, of the Sphinx, S.OT1200 (lyr.); epith. of Apollo, Epigr.Gr.1023.2 (Nubia).
oracular, fa/tis S.Fr.573. as Subst.,
soothsayer, oracle-monger, Pl.Ap.22c, Ion534d, al.
xrh)/stai, xrh= 'stai, or xrh\ 'stai, v. xrh/.

xrhste/on, (xra/omai)
one must use, c. dat. rei, Hp.Art.77, Pl.Sph. 267e; o(/ph| kai\ o(/pws x. tini/ X.Mem.3.1.11; pw=s x. ei)/h peri/ tinos D.S.18.64; pw=s x. protre/ponta = pw=s dei= tina xrh=sqai, Arist.Rh. 1375a26 cf. Plb.5.98.9, Phld.Mort.19, Porph.Abst.2.44, etc.

xrhsteu/omai,
to be kind or
merciful, 1 Ep.Cor.13.4.
xrhsth/r, h=ros, o(, = xrh/sths 1, Choerob. in Theod.1.262H., al.

xrhsthria/zw,
give oracles, prophesy, tisi Ephor.31(b) J.; x. ta/de pro\s th\n e)rw/thsin SIG557.6 (Magn.Mae., iii B. C.). mostly in Med. (fut. -a/somai Theopomp.Hist.314),
consult an oracle, Hdt.1.55; xrhsthria/zesqai e)n *delfoi=si e)pi/ tini ib.66; x. qew=|
consult a god, Id.7.178; i(roi=si x.
by means of victims, Id.8.134; ai)ci\ ma/lista x. D.S. 16.26; peri/ tinos respecting something, Hdt.2.52; x. ei) . .
to as the oracle whether . . , Id.5.67; ei)s h(/ntina pare/sontai xw/ran Ant.Lib.8.2:—aor. Pass., tw=n boulome/nwn -asqh=nai IG9(2).1109.34 (thessaly, ii/i B. C.).

xrhsth/rion, to/,
an oracle, i. e.,
the seat of an oracle, such as Delphi, h.Ap.81,214, Hes.Fr.134.6, Hdt.1.47, al., E.Med.667, etc.; to\ e)n *delfoi=si x. Hdt.1.13, cf. X.Cyr.7.2.15; xra=sqai xrhsthri/oisi Hdt.1.47,53, al.: distd. fr. the nho/s, Id.6.19: sts. in pl. for sg., A.Th.748, Eu.194.
oracular response, Hdt.1.63,69, al., Th. 1.25, 2.54: pl., A.Ag.964, S.OC604, 1331, E.Ion532 (troch.).
an offering for the oracle, made by those consulting it: generally,
sacrificial victim, x. qe/sqai Pi.O.6.70; x. pare/xein IG22.1126.33; xrhsth/ria qeoi=sin e)/rdein A.Th.230, cf. Supp.450; x. pe/ptwke E.Ion 419: metaph.,
victim, sacrifice, sfa/gia . . kei/nou xrhsth/ria ta)ndro/s S.Aj.220 (anap.).

xrhsth/rios, a, on, also os, on A.Eu.241: (xra/w (B) A):
oracular, prophetic, e)fetmai/ l. c.; o)/rniqes Id.Th.26; xrhsthri/an e)sqh=ta Id.Ag. 1270; tri/pous x. E.Ion1320; tou)/noma Id.Hel.822; also *)/apollon xrhsth/rie
author of oracles, Hdt.6.80, cf. OGI312 (Aegae, ii B. C.). (xra/omai) = xrhstiko/s,
fitted or
designed for use, useful, xrhsth/ria skeu/h
household utensils or furniture, Pl.Com.27 (ta\ pro\s qewri/an h)\ qusi/an s. Poll.10.11); without skeu/h, Mnemos. 57.208 (Argos, vi B. C.), OGI326.30 (Teos, ii B. C.); o(/sa sku/tina tw=n o(/plwn kai\ tw=n x. Str.13.1.48, cf. 15.2.6, Nic.Dam.106J.; to\n peri/bolon kai\ ta\ e)n au)tw=| x.
Expl.Arch.de Délos 11.291, cf. 120, Durrbach
Choixd' inscr.de Délos 119 (ii B. C.); ta\ dw/mata kai\ ta\ x. tw=n u(da/twn Supp.Epigr.8.170 (Palestine), cf. PCair.Zen.764.37 (iii B. C.).

xrhsthriw/dhs, es,
oracular, divine, mantikh\ x., opp. a)nqrwpi/nh, Philostr.VS1Prooem.

xrh/st-hs (written xrei/sths SIG364.40 (Ephes., iii B. C.)), ou, o(: gen. pl. xrh/stwn (not xrhstw=n, to distinguish it from the gen. pl. of xrhsto/s, Hdn.Gr.1.425): (xra/w (B) A):—
one who gives or
expounds oracles, prophet, soothsayer, Hsch., prob. in Milet.7p.50 (Didyma, i B. C.). (ki/xrhmi)
creditor, usurer, Ps.-Phoc.83, Ar.Nu. 240, 434(anap.), Lys.32.29, Lycurg.22, etc. (xra/omai, ki/xramai)
debtor, Phoc.16, D.30.12, 32.12, IPE12.32B84 (Olbia, iii B. C.), cf. Harp. s. v.: c. gen., kakou= a)ndro/s Phoc. l.c.; xrhma/twn D.36.6.

xrhst-iko/s, h/, o/n, (xra/omai) of persons,
knowing how to use, understanding the use of a thing, tw=n u(parxo/ntwn Arist.Oec.1344b26; despotikh\ e)pisth/mh h( x. dou/lwn Id.Pol.1255b31: abs., du/namis x., opp. u(phretikh/, Procl. in Prm.p.735 S.: also c. dat. (like the Verb), M.Ant.7.55. of things,
useful, serviceable, sw/matos e(/cis Plu.
Cat.Ma.1: Sup., me/li -w/taton Id.2.32e. Adv. -kw=s ib.80b: Comp. -w/teron Arr.Epict.2.9.19.

xrhsto-gra^fi/a, h(,
good or
beautiful painting, Plu.Arat.13.

xrhsto-h/qeia, h(,
goodness of heart, LXX Si.37.11, Demetr.Eloc.244.

xrhsto-h/qhs, es,
good-natured, well-disposed, Arist.Rh.1395b17, Ptol.Tetr.163, al.

xrhst-oine/w,
produce good wine, Str.14.1.15.

xrhsto-karpi/a, h(,
the bearing of good fruits, Str.6.4.1.

xrhsto/-karpos, on,
having, bearing good fruits, ib.3.6.

xrhsto-loge/omai, Pass.,
to be used in a favourable sense, Eust.766.29.

xrhsto-logi/a, h(,
fair speaking, in bad sense, Ep.Rom.16.18.

xrhsto-lo/gos, on,
giving fair words, speaking plausibly, Hist.Aug.Pertinax 13.5.

xrhsto-ma/qeia [a^], h(,
desire of learning, Longin.44.1.
book containing a summary of useful knowledge or
select passages, e.g. the x. grammatikh/ of Procl. and the xrhstoma/qeiai of Hellad., cf. Sor.1.2, al.; so in pl. of the epitome of Strabo; also peri\ -maqi/as (sic) EM227.53, Orus in EM685.57.

xrhsto-ma^qe/w,
to be desirous of learning, Longin.2.3.

xrhsto-ma^qh/s, o(, h(
an adept in polite learning, Cic.Att.1.6.2. Adv. -qw=s, ei)/rhtai Phld.Mus.p.83K.

xrhsto-mouse/w,
to be devoted to good music, Ath.14.633b.

xrhsto/s, h/, o/n, (xra/omai) of things, like xrh/simos,
useful, good of its kind, serviceable, [to/ca] xrhsta\ ou)de/n Hdt.3.78; [a)trapo\s] ou)de\n x. tisi Id.7.215; x. e)pi/ploa Id.1.94; [gh=] E.Hec.594; oi)ki/a, opp. moxqhra/, Pl.Grg.504a; h( x. me/litta, opp. oi( khfh=nes, Arist.HA 624b23: freq. of
wholesome food, meli/twma Batr.39; poto/n, si=tos, Pl.R.438a; peri\ to\ sw=ma Pl.Prt.313d: c. gen.,
for a thing, neu/rwn
for the sinews, Ael.NA14.21; r(a/fanos Alex.15.8; o)/yon Antiph.242, etc. (but
pleasant to taste,
nice, Thphr.Char.2.10): generally, politei/a Isoc.12.135; bi/os Aeschin.1.179; of victims and omens,
auspicious, i(ra/, sfa/gia, Hdt.5.44, 9.61,62; teleuth\ x. a
happy end or issue, Id.7.157; ei) . . tou=to/ ge doke/ei u(mi=n ei)=nai xrhsto/n Id.5.92.a/: pl., ta\ x., as Subst.,
benefits, kindnesses, Id.1.41, 42; xrhsta\ fe/rein Id.4.139; xrhsto/n ti sumbouleu/ein, xrhsta\ e)pithdeu/ein, Ar.Nu.793, Antipho 3.3.9; xrhsta\ le/gein, pra/ttein, etc., Men. 725,787, etc.: but ta\ x. also,
happy event, e)kteloi=to dh\ ta\ x. A.Pers. 228 (troch.);
prosperity, success, ta\ x. d' au)/q' e(/kast' e)/xei fi/lous E.Hec.1227. in moral sense, opp. kako/s, Eup. in PSI11.1213.2; opp. ponhro/s, Pl.Prt.313d; to\ x., opp. to\ ai)sxro/n, S.Ph. 476; xrhsto/s, opp. lupro/s, E.Med.601: but lu=pai xrhstai/ if
working for good, Pl.Grg.499e.
good for its purpose, effective (even for evil), trau=ma, dh=gma, Luc.Symp.44, Alex.55. Gramm.,
in use, current, poihtai=s xrhsta/ Eust.215.8. of persons,
good, esp. in war,
valiant, true, Hdt.5.109, 6.13, S.Ph.437, etc.: generally,
good, honest, worthy, Id.OT610; oi)ke/tai X.Oec.9.5; of women, e)rei= tis w(s *klutaimnh/stra kakh/: *)/alkhstin a)nte/qhka xrhsth/n Eub. 117.11, cf. Men.Mon.634; of
good citizens,
useful, deserving, D.20.7: c. acc. cogn., a(\ xrhstoi\ e)ge/nesqe Th.3.64; x. peri\ th\n po/lin gegenhme/nos Lys.14.31; x. kai\ filo/polis Ar.Pl.900; collectively, o)li/gon to\ x. Id.Ra.783; but also ironically, o( x. ou(tosi/ Id.Nu. 8; oi( x. pre/sbeis ou(=toi D.18.30, cf. 89; e)klela/ktiken o( x. h(mi=n moixo/s Men.16. freq. on Epitaphs, IG3.3149,3155, al. c. inf., o(/soi probateu/ein x. Him.Or.14.32. oi( xrhstoi/, like oi( a)gaqoi/, those of
good family, X.Ath.1.4,6. of the gods,
propitious, merciful, bestowing health or
wealth, qew=n xrhstw=n h(/kein eu)= Hdt.8.111, cf. M.Ant.9.11. of men,
good, kindly, dou/lw| . . x. geno/meno/s e)sti despo/ths patri/s Antiph.265; w(s h(du\ dou/lw| despo/tou xrhstou= tuxei=n Men.Mon.556, cf. Philem.227; o( x., w(s e)/oike, kai\ xrhstou\s poiei= Men.203b, cf. Plu.Phoc.10; x. peri/ tina D.59.2; e)pi/ tinas Ev.Luc.6.35; ei)s a)llh/lous Ep.Eph.4.32. sts.
simple, silly, like eu)h/qhs, xrhsto\s ei)= o(/ti h(gh=| . . , you're
a nice fellow, to think that . . , Pl.Phdr.264b, cf. Tht.161a; w)= xrhste/ D.18.318. of a man,
strong, able in body for sexual intercourse, = gunaiki\ xrh=sqai duna/menos, Hp.Genit.2. of the
dead, whence xrhsto\n poiei=n = a)poktinnu/nai, in a treaty between the Spartans and Tegea, Arist.Fr. 592. Adv. -tw=s
well, properly, Hdt.4.117, Hp.Art.32; x. e)/xein Ar.Ec.219; skeua/sai x. tou)=yon Alex.149.6.: ironically, x. th\n patri/da e)petro/peusas Hdt.3.36.

xrhsto/ths, htos, h(,
goodness, honesty, uprightness, xrhsto/thta a)skei=n E.Supp.872; me/giston a)gaqo/n e)sti meta\ nou= x. Men.788, cf. 472.1; xrhsto/thtos ei(/neka as a reward for
honesty, Aristopho 14.4 (troch.), Timocl.8.17; poiei=n x. LXX Ps.13(14).3; a)kolouqei= th=| a)reth=| x.) Arist.VV1251b33; h( sh\ x., as a honorific address, PGiss.7.15 (ii A. D.), PLond.2.411.6 (iv A. D.), etc.
goodness of heart, kindness, Is.2.7 (but in depreciatory sense,
soft-heartedness, Men. 579); eu)/noian kai\ x. pare/sxhto Hdn.2.9.9; x. kai\ filostorgi/a, filanqrwpi/a kai\ x., Plu.Agis17, Comp.Dem.Cic.3, cf. Luc.Tim.8, D.C. 73.5; h( x. kai\ h( filanqrwpi/a tou= qeou= Ep.Tit.3.4, cf. Ep.Rom.11.22, al.; x. e)q' h(ma=s Ep.Eph.2.7; poiei=n xrhsto/thta to show
kindness, LXXPs.118(119).65; polla\ th=| x. . . ktw=ntai Phld.Rh.1.262S.
simplicity, silly good nature, h)/qous a)plasti/a met' a)logisti/as, Pl.Def. 412e.

xrhstourgi/a, h(,
good deed, service, Iamb(?).ap.Suid. (Berl.Sitz. 1875p.4).

xrhsto-fi^li/a, h(,
the friendship of good men, Arist.Rh.1361b35.

xrhsto/-fi^los, on,
possessed of good friends, ib.38.
trusty friend, opp. kako/filos, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).146.

xrhsto-fwni/a, h(,
goodness of voice, Antyll. ap. Orib.6.10.7.
xrh/stwr, oros, o(, = ma/ntis, Hsch.
xrhth/r, h=ros, o(, perh. = xrhsth/rion (v. xrhsthrios 11), PGrenf.1.21.10 (ii B. C., pl.).
xri=: xri/ei, Hsch. xri/a: murmh/kwn koi/th, Id.

xri=ma, atos, to/, = xri=sma,
unguent, oil, Xenoph.3.6 (pl.), A.Ag.94 (anap.), Achae.5.2, X.An.4.4.13 (xri/sma vel xrh=ma codd.), Call.Lav. Pall.16 (pl.), Iamb.1.241, 272, POxy.529.4 (ii A. D.).

xri/mptw,
bring near; Act. in Hom. only in compd. e)gxri/mptw (q. v.); po/das xri/mptousa r(axi/aisi
keeping one's steps
close along the shore, A.Pr.713; u(p' e)sxa/thn sth/lhn e)/xrimpt' a)ei\ su/rigga
kept the axle
close to the post, S.El.721:—Med., po/da xrimpto/menos ei)nali/w| kw/pa| E.Hel.526 (lyr.); xri/myasqai poti\ pleura\ ka/rh Theoc.25.144:—more freq. in Pass.,
touch the surface of a body,
graze, scratch, xrimfqei\s pe/las
grazing near, close
even to touching, Od.10.516; e)k genu/wn xrimfqei\s go/os the wail or cry
forcing its way to the ear from the clenched jaws, Pi.P.12.21: generally,
draw near, approach, c. dat., do/moisi toi=sde xri/mptesqai A.Eu.185; tei/xesi xrimptome/na E.Ph.809 (lyr.); do/mois ib.99; e)xrimpto/mhn *ku/klwpi Id.Cyc. 406: to/pous ei)s tou/sde Critias 16.4 D.: also in aor. 1 Med., a)ma/qoisin e)xri/myato nhu=s h.Ap.439; o(/tew| xrimyai/ato lu/qron Euph.50: c. gen., nekroqh/khs ou) xrimpto/menos E.Fr.472.18 (anap.). intr. in Act., au)dw= mh\ xri/mptein qrigkoi=s Id.Ion156 (lyr.); li/ssou, gou/nasi despo/tou xri/mptwn Id.Andr.530 (lyr.): abs., xri/mye kiw/n A.R.3.1286.

xri/si^mos [i_], h, on,
used for anointing, Sch.Ar.Pl.529.

xri=sis, ews, h(, (xri/w)
smearing, h( tou= e)laiou ei)s i(ma/tion x. Arist. Pr.966b35; tw=n a)ggei/wn Dsc.1.58 (xrh=sin codd.); [th=s kefalh=s], = a)/leiyis, Diocl.Fr.141.
anointing, PPetr.2p.72 (iii B. C.), LXX Ex.29.21, al.; farma/kwn J.AJ2.14.3 (pl.)
colouring, varnish, wash, Muson.Fr.19p.108H.(pl.), Ael.NA6.41;
colour-washing, tw=n skanama/twn IG42(1).109 i 128 (Epid., iii B. C.), cf. Supp.Epigr.4.270 (Panamara, i(?) B.C.).

xri=sma atos, to/, (xri/w) later form for xri=ma (q.v.), found in codd. of X.Smp.2.4, An.4.4.13, Thphr.Od.8,15, Sor.1.4, Gal.6.402, etc.
anointing, unction, LXXEx.29.7, 35.15, Gal.10.892. in NT of spiritual
grace, xri=sma e)/xete a)po\ tou= a(gi/ou 1 Ep.Jo.2.20, cf. 27.
coating of wall,
plaster, D.S.2.9, Luc. Hist.Conscr.62. (The usual accent xri/sma is wrong, cf. xri=ma.）

xris-te/on, (xri/w)
one must anoint, smear, Orib.Fr.74, Syn.1.20, Gp.16.4.1.

xris-th/rion, to/,
unguent, a bottle of ointments, Suid.

xri/s-ths, ou, o(,
white-washer, Hsch. s.v. koniatai/.
stucco-maker, Steph.in Hp.2.397 D.

xristia_niko/s, h/, o/n,
Christian, Porph.
Chr..88.

xristia_no/s, o(,
Christian, Act.Ap.11.26, 26.28, 1 Ep.Pet.4.16, etc. Adv. -nw=s, zh=n Porph. ap. Eus.PE6.19.

xristo/s, h/, o/n, (xri/w)
to be rubbed on, used as ointment or
salve, opp. pisto/s, A.Pr.480, cf. E.Hipp.516, Triclin.ad Theoc.11.1; to\ e)/laion to\ x.
anointing oil, LXX Le.21.10. of persons,
anointed, o( i(ereu/s o( x. ib.4.5,16, 6.22: pl., ib.2 Ma.1.10. esp. of the Kings of Israel, o( x. *kuri/ou ib.1 Ki.24.7, cf. Ps.17 (18).51; also tw=| x. mou *ku/rw| Is.45.1; pl., of the patriarchs, Ps.104 (105).15. in
NT, o( x. the
Messiah, Ev.Matt.2.4, etc.; o( x. *kuri/ou Ev.Luc.2.26; then used as pr. n. of Jesus, *)ihsou=s x. Ev.Matt.1.1, etc.; *)ihsou=s o( lego/menos x. ib.16.

xri/w, Ep. impf. xri=on Od.4.252, also xri/eske A.R.4.871: fut. xri/sw E.Med.789: aor. e)/xri_sa Od.10.364, etc., Ep. xri=sa Il.16.680, Od.4.49: pf. ke/xri_ka LXX 1 Ki.10.1, al.:—Med., fut. xri/somai Od.6.220: aor. part. xri_sa/menos ib.96, Hes.Op.523, etc.:—Pass., fut. xrisqh/somai LXXEx.30.32: aor. e)xri/sqhn A.Pr.675, Achae.10: pf. ke/xri_mai Hdt.4.189,195, Magnes 3, etc., later ke/xrismai LXX 2 Ki. 5.17: plpf. e)ke/xristo f. l. in X.Cyr.7.1.2; 3pl. e)ke/xrinto Callix.2. [Even in pres. and impf. i is long, Od.21.179 (e)pi-xri_ontes), Il.23.186, S.Tr.675, etc.; xri^ei only in late Poets, as AP6.275 (Noss.): in fut. and all other tenses i_ without exception, whence the proper accent. is xri=sai, kexri=sqai, xri=sma, etc.:—
touch the surface of a body slightly, esp. of the human body,
graze, hence,
rub, anoint with scented unguents or
oil, as was done after bathing, freq. in Hom., lo/eon kai\ xri=on e)lai/w| Od.4.252; e)/xrisen li/p' e)lai/w| 3.466; loe/ssai te xri=sai/ te 19.320; of a dead body, xri=en e)lai/w| Il.23.186;
anoint a suppliant, Berl.Sitzb.1927.170 (Cyrene); pe/plon x.
rub or
infect with poison, S.Tr.675, cf. 689,832 (lyr.): metaph., i(me/rw| xri/sas' oi)sto/n E.Med.634 (lyr.); ou) me/lani, a)lla\ qana/tw| x. to\n ka/lamon Plu.2.841e:—Med.,
anoint oneself, Od.6.96; ka/llei+ a)mbrosi/w| oi(/w| . . *kuqe/reia xri/etai 18.194, cf. Hes.Op.523; e)lai/w| Gal.6.417; e)k farma/kou Luc. Asin.13: c. acc. rei, i)ou\s xri/esqai
anoint (i. e. poison)
one's arrows, Od.1.262:—Pass., xri/esqai u(po\ tou= h(li/ou Hdt.3.124; bakka/ridi kexrime/nos Magnes l. c.; sukami/nw| ta\s gna/qous kexrime/nai Eub.98.3: metaph., *sofokle/ous tou= me/liti kexrime/nou Ar.Fr.581. in LXX,
anoint in token of consecration, x. tina\ ei)s basile/a 4 Ki.9.3; ei)s a)/rxonta 1 Ki.10.1; ei)s profh/thn 3 Ki.19.16; also x. tina\ tou= basileu/ein Jd.9.15: c. dupl. acc., x. tina\ e)/laion Ep.Heb.1.9.
wash with colour, coat, ai)ge/ai kexrime/nai e)reuqeda/nw| Hdt.4.189; pi/ssh| ib.195, cf. Inscr.Délos442A188 (ii B. C.); a)sfa/ltw| X.Cyr.7.5.22 (Pass.); stoa/n Supp.Epigr.4.268 (Panamara, ii A. D.):—Med., to\ sw=ma mi/ltw| xri/ontai
smear their bodies, Hdt.4.191.
wound on the surface, puncture, prick, sting, of the gadfly in A.Pr.566,597, 880 (all lyr.):—Pass., o)custo/mw| mu/wpi xrisqei=s' ib.675.
xro/a, h(, v. xroia/.
xro/a, xroi/+, v. xrw/s.

xroa/zw,
colour, ou)=ra, diaxw/rhma, Ruf.Fr.79.

xroia/, Ep. and Ion. xroih/, Il.14.164, Thgn.1017 (in Call.Lav. Pall.28 xroi+a/ （xroi/hn codd.)), Att. xroia/ and xro/a, the latter always
in Pl. (v. infr.), also in Phld.D.3.9,
sign.5, al. (v. xrw/s):—
skin, esp. of the human body, hence
the body itself, paradraqe/ein filo/thti h(| xroih=| Il. l.c.; kata\ xroih\n r(e/ei i(drw/s Thgn. l.c.; o)/zein . . th=s xro/as e)/fasken h(du/ mou Ar.Pl.1020; ta\ e)canqeu=nta e)s th\n xroih\n (
skin, surface) h)\ xroih=| (
colour, signf. 11) h)\ oi)dh/masi Hp.de Arte9: cf. xrw/s. metaph., 'skin', i.e.
surface, Pythagorean term, Arist.Sens.439a31, Placit.1.15.2, Theol.Ar.18(pl.); x. e)pi/pedos ib.10; so perh. in Epicur.Fr.81, Phld.Sign.5, al.
appearance to the eye, of heavenly bodies, Id.D.3.9.
superficial appearance of a thing, its
colour, Thgn.451, A.Pr.493, E.Cyc.517(lyr.); pantoda/paisi memeixme/na xroi/aisin Sapph.20, cf. Numen. ap. Ath.7.282a; toiou=ton (sc. e)ruqro/n） ei)=nai th=| xroia=| to\ me/li Porph.Antr.16; e)/stin . . xro/a a)porroh\ sxhma/twn o)/yei su/mmetros kai\ ai)sqhto/s Pl.Men.76d; no/mw| xroih/ . . e)teh=| d' a)/toma kai\ keno/n Democr.125, cf. Anaxag.4, Arist. Sens.440a8; e)k triw=n ta\s xro/as a(/pasas memegme/nas, tou= fwto/s, kai\ di' w(=n fai/netai to\ fw=s, kai\ tw=n u(pokeime/nwn xrwma/twn Id.Col. 793b33. esp.
colour of the skin, complexion, xroih=s a)/nqos a)meibome/nhs Sol.27.6; xroia=s a)mei/yeis a)/nqos A.Pr.23; xroia\n a)lla/casa E.Med.1168; leukh\n x. e)k paraskeuh=s e)/xeis Id.Ba.457, cf. Ar.Nu. 1012(anap.); xro/a| a)dh/lw| tw=n dedrame/nwn pe/ri
with colour that gives no hint of what has passed, E.Or.1318; xro/an . . th\n sh\n h(/lios . . ai)guptiw/sei Pl.Com(?).p.615K. (post Fr.55); xro/as ka/llos Pl.Smp. 196a; e)ri/zoi kai\ ga/laki xroih/n Call.Hec.1.4.3. in Music,
nuance of a scale, Plu.2.1143e.—On the accent, v. Hdn.Gr.1.301, al.

xro-i/+zw, = xrw/|zw,
touch the surface of a body, and generally,
touch, *(/hbas xroi/+zei le/xos E.Heracl.915(lyr.), cf. Pi.Fr.139.6（Med.):—Med.,
touch another's skin with one's own, lie with, tini, of a woman, Theocr.10.18 (in Dor. fut. xroi+cei=tai).
colour, stain, x. e)p' o)li/gon a)gxou/sh| Dsc.2.80; poet. aor. Pass. xroiisqei=sai Nic.Fr.74.26, cf. Gal.17(2).275.

xro/-i+sis, ews, h(,
coloratus, Gloss.

xro-i+smo/s, o(,
coloratura, ib.

xro/ma^dos, o(,
crashing sound, x. genu/wn, in a pugilistic contest, Il. 23.688. (From the same Root as xrem-eti/zw, xre/m-ptomai.）

xro/mh, h(, and xro/mos, o(, = foreg.: also
the neighing of horses, Hsch.

xro/mis, ios, o( （h( in Ael.NA9.7), a sea-
fish like ski/aina, perh.
Umbrina cirrhosa, Anan.5.1 (xro/mios), Epich.58 (xro/mios or -i/as codd.Ath.), Arist.HA534a9 (v.l. xre/mis), Numen. ap. Ath.7.295b; cf. xre/mus.

xron-i/zw, (xro/nos): intr.,
spend time, peri\ *ai)/gupton Hdt.3.61.
last, continue, to\ me\n kalw=s e)/xon o(/pws xroni/zon eu)= menei= bouleute/on A.Ag.847; e)n th=| u(ste/ra| Arist.HA523a23; xroni/zwsi ib. 537a7; ou) x. to\ a)lgou=n sunexw=s e)n th=| sarki/ Epicur.Sent.4, cf. Diog. Oen.58. x. drw=n
persevere in doing, Pl.Phdr.255b.
take time, tarry, linger, A.Ag.1356, Ch.64 (lyr.), Th.6.49, 8.16; kexroniko/tes, opp. u(po/guioi th=| o)rgh=| o)/ntes, Arist.Rh.1380b5; kexronikw\s e)n *(rw/mh| Plb.33.16.6; xroni/sai kata\ to\ balanei=on Gal.6.417; h( nau=s kai\ to\n xro/non tou=ton o(\n e)piste/llw soi xroni/zei Hp.Ep.14: c. inf.,
delay to do, x. katabh=nai LXXEx.32.1 (also x. tou= poih=sai/ ti ib. Ge.34.19), Ev.Luc.12.45. of ailments,
to be or
become chronic, Hp.Aph.3.28. of wine,
to be or
become old, to have age, Ath. 1.33a. Pass.,
to be prolonged or
delayed, tw=nde pi/stis ou)k o)/knw| xroni/zetai A.Th.54, cf. Ch.957(lyr.); pole/mou xronisqe/ntos And.3.27; [th\n eu)/noian] xronizome/nhn . . fili/an gene/sqai Arist.EN 1167a11; x. e)n tw=| sw/mati
continue, Id.Pr.907b22; ta\ kexronisme/na nosh/mata Gal.18(2).31.
grow up, xronisqei\s d' a)pe/deicen e)/qos A.Ag.727 (lyr.).
to be located in time, made temporal, Simp. in Ph.716.11, Dam.Pr.405.

xron-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
concerning time, temporal, opp. topiko/s, Plot.3.7.9; x. poi/hsis creation
in time, Jul.Or.4.146b. Adv. -kw=s ib.145d, Prisc.Lyd.36.2, Dam.Pr. 404.
chronological, kano/nes Plu.Sol.27: ta\ x. (sc. bibli/a)
annals or
chronology, Id.Them.27; ai( xronikai/ (sc. grafai/) D.H. 1.8; x. su/ntacis D.S.13.103. Gramm., x. e)pirrh/mata adverbs
of time, A.D.Pron.15.24, cf. Sch.Il.Oxy.221i5;
temporal, i.e. quantitative, para/ggelma A.D.Pron.58.22; of the
temporal augment, x. au)ch/seis Eust.72.45. Adv. -kw=s
in respect of time, diafe/rein A.D. Synt.209.23.

xron-io/omai, Pass.,
become chronic, oi(=si a)\n xroniwqh=| Hp. Art.50.

xro/n-ios, a, on, also os, on E.Ion470 (lyr.), Andr.84, Th. 6.31:—
after a long time, late, e)lqw\n xro/nios Od.17.112; xroni/a me\n h(/keis Cratin.222, cf. Ar.Th.912; x. fanei/s S.Ph.1446 (anap.); xro/nios (v.l. xro/nion） ei)sidw\n fi/lon E.Or.475; tropai/a| xroni/a| A.Th. 706(lyr.); xro/nioi cunio/ntes Th.1.141. Adv. -i/ws
after a long time, Sammelb.4314.2 (iii B.C.).
long-delaying, tardy, *di/ka E.Fr. 223(lyr.); x. ta\ tw=n qew=n Id.Ion1615 (troch.).
for a long time, a long while, xro/nio/n tina e)kbeblhko/tes, h)/laune, S.Ph.600, OC441; mh/ . . xro/nioi me/llete pra/ssein Id.Ph.1449(anap.); xro/nios w)/n, a)pw/n, E.Or.485, IA1099; xro/nio/s ei)/m' a)p' a)nqrw/pwn bora=s Id.Cyc.249.
long-continued, a)reta\ xroni/a tele/qei Pi.P.3.115; a)/ploiai A.Ag.149(lyr.); xro/nia le/ktr' e)/xwn having been
long married, E.Ph.14; x. e)tw=n e)niautoi/ Ar.Ra.347(lyr.); sto/los . . x. e)so/menos, xro/nios stratei/a, Th.6.31; desma\ x. Pl.Lg.855b; of plants,
perennial, opp. e)pe/teios, Thphr.HP1.1.9. of ailments,
chronic, nosh/mata Hp.Aph.2.39, Coac.203; [po/noi] Epicur.Fr.447; no/soi D.H. 1.37, Gal.6.356; i)sxia/s Dsc.1.10; [bh=xes] Paul.Aeg.3.28（Comp.). Adv. -i/ws Philum. ap. Orib.8.45 tit.: Comp. -iwte/rws Hp.Coac. 197. Astrol., x. zw/|dia, f.l. for *kronika/, Cat.Cod.Astr.1.133. Adv. -i/ws Arist.GC328a35, Thphr.Sud.22; neut. pl. xro/nia as Adv., E.Or.152(lyr.): Comp. -w/teron Pi.N.4.6.—Rare in Prose, and only (as it seems) in signf. 1.3 and 5.

xron-io/ths, htos, h(,
long duration, Thphr.HP9.14.2, Sor.2.28, Theol.Ar.23.

xron-i/skos, o(, Dim. of xro/nos,
a short time, LXX 2 Ma.11.1; dub. cj. for *kroni/skoi in Gal.Libr.Propr.12.

xron-ismo/s, o(,
tarrying in a place, Plb. 1.56.3.
delaying, coming late, D.H.6.52.
a becoming chronic, Sor.2.84, Orib.Fr.55.

xron-iste/on,
one must spend time, e)/n tini Arist.Rh.1417b30.

xron-isto/s, h/, o/n,
tarrying, tardy, di/khs te/los Orac. ap. Ael.VH3.43.

xronogra^f-e/w,
compile annals, Tz.H.12.718.

xronogra^f-i/a, h(,
chronological record, annals, Plb.5.33.5(pl.); ai( x. kai\ h( *)atqi/s Anon.Argentinensis p.77 Keil. Astrol., description of xronokratori/ai, Nech. ap. Vett.Val.278.24, Paul.Al.S.1. Astron.,
method of reckoning, Ptol.Phas.p.10H.

xrono/gra^f-os (parox.), o(,
chronicler, annalist, Str.1.2.9(pl.), Luc.Alex.6 (v.l. xoro-), Agath.4.30.

xronokra^t-ew, Astrol.,
to be dominant for a specified period, Vett. Val.186.4; also xronokra^t-ore/w, ib.276.10: hence xronokra^t-ori/a, h(, ib.165.11.

xronokra^/t-wr, oros, o(,
heavenly body dominant for a specified period, Ptol.Tetr. 209.

xronola/bon [a^], to/,
instrument for measuring time, Procl.Hyp. 4.71 (pl.); e)c u(drologi/ou -ou ib.79.

xro/nos, o(,
time, Hom. (v. infr.), etc.: dist. fr. kairo/s, D.59.35, cf. Ammon.Diff.p.79 V.; tw=n de\ pepragme/nwn a)poi/hton ou)d' a)\n x. du/naito qe/men te/los P.O.2.17; muri/os x. Id.I.5(4).28, S.OC618; makro\s ka)nari/qmhtos x. Id.Aj.646; o( pa=s x. Pi.P.1.46, cf. A.Eu.484; pro/pas x. ib.898; e)s to\ pa=n xro/nou ib.670; but in Prose, tou= x. to\n plei=ston Th.1.30, cf. Isoc.9.41; to\n prw=ton tou= x. X.Lac.1.5; to\n di' ai)w=nos x. A.Ag.554; xro/nou pollou= de/ontai take
a long
time, X. Smp.2.4, etc.; do/te ti tw=| x. Antipho 5.86.
time in the abstract, a)merh\s x. Timo 76; trimerh/s S.E.M.10.197, cf. Plu.2.153b; defined by Zeno Stoic.1.26, Apollod. ib.3.260.
a definite time, period, deke/ths, tri/mhnos, S.Ph.715 (lyr.), Tr.164; x. bi/ou, h(/bhs x., E.Alc. 670, El.20; polu\n a)riqmo\n xro/nou gegono/tes Aeschin.1.49: pl., of points or periods of time, toi=s x. a)kribw=s with
chronological accuracy, Th.1.97; toi=s x.
by the
dates, Isoc.11.36; metenegko/nta tou\s x. altering the
dates, D.18.225; makrw=n kai\ pollw=n xro/nwn Pl.Lg.798b; tessara/konta xro/nous e)niautw=n IG5(1).728.7 (Sparta), cf. 14.1747.3 (Rome); xro/nwn mh=kos (dub., leg. xro/nou) Chor.35.51 p.403 F.-R.
date, term of payment due, Leg.Gort.1.10, al.
year, *(ellhnika/ 1.233 (Rhamnus, i B. C.), PLond.2.417.14 (iv A. D.), App.Anth.6.154.1 (leg. ei(=s e)/ti), Ps.-Ptol.Centil.24, cf. EM 254.13.
equatorial degree, Ptol.Tetr.44, Paul.Al.A.2, al., Cat.Cod.Astr.5(1).240. Special phrases: acc., xro/non
for a while, for a long or
short time, Od.4.599, 6.295, Hdt.1.175, 7.223, etc.; polu\n xro/non
for a long
time, Od.11.161; dhro\n x. Il.14.206; ou)k o)li/gon x. 19.157; tou=ton to\n x. Hdt.1.75; e)s to\n ai)e\n x. for ever, E.Or.207 (lyr.); ou) polu\s x. e)c ou(= . . Pl.R.452c; palaio\s a)f' ou(= xro/nos S.Aj.600 (lyr.); h)=n xro/nos e)n w(=| . . , or o(/te . . , Linusap.D.L.Prooem.4, Critias 25.1 D.; e(/na x.
once for all, Il.15.511. gen., xro/nou periio/ntos as
time came round, Hdt. 4.155; so x. e)pigenome/nou, diecelqo/ntos, probai/nontos, Id.1.28, 2.52, 3.53; xro/nou genome/nou after
a time, D.S.20.109; o)li/gou xro/nou
in a short
time, Hdt.3.134; pollou= . . ou)x e(o/raka/ pw xro/nou Ar. Pl.98; ou) makrou= x., tou= loipou= x., S.El.478 (lyr.), 817; baiou= kou)xi\ muri/ou x. Id.OC397; poi/ou xro/nou; A.Ag.278; po/sou x.; after how
long? Ar.Ach.83. dat., xro/nw|
in process of time, Xenoph.18, Hdt.1.80, 176, al.: freq. in Trag., as A.Ag.126,463, Ch.650 (all lyr.); also xro/nw| kote/ Hdt.9.62; tw=| x. pote/ Ar.Nu.865; xro/nw|, xro/nois u(/steron,
long after, Th.1.8, Lys.3.39; ou) xro/nw|
immediately, Ps.Democr.Alch.p.49B.: also c. Art., tw=| x. Ar.Nu.66, 1242. o( a)/llos x., in Att., of
past time, D.20.16, o( loipo\s x., of
future, v. loipo/s 3; so x. e)fe/rpwn, e)pante/llwn, me/llwn, Pi.O.6.97, 8.28, 10(11).7; also kata\ x. i(knou/menon or kata\ x. <to\n> i(. at a later (or the fitting)
time, Ant.Lib.27.4 (cf. i(kne/omai 111.2). with Preps.:—a)na\ xro/non in course of
time, after
a time, Hdt.1.173, 2.151, 5.27, al. a)f' ou(= xro/nou from such
time as . . , X.Cyr.1.2.13. dia\ xro/nou after
a time, after
an interval, S.Ph.758, Ar.Lys.904, Pl.1055, Th.2.94; dia\ xro/nou pollou= Hdt.3.27; dia\ p. x. Ar.V.1476; dia\ makrw=n xro/nwn Pl.Ti.22d: but xro/nos . . dia\ xro/nou prou)/baine/ moi means
one space of time after
another, day after day, S.Ph.285. e)k pollou= teu x. a long
time since, long
ago, Hdt.2.58. e)n xro/nw|, like xro/nw|,
in course of time, at length, A.Eu.1000 (lyr.);
for a long time, Pl.Phdr.278d; e)n pollw=| xro/nw| ib.228a; e)n xro/noisi perh.
formerly, [Emp.]Sphaer.108 (leg. *ka/rpimos). e)nto\s xro/nou within
a certain time, Hdt.8.104. e)pi\ xro/non for
a time, for
a while, Il.2.299, Od.14.193, Hdt.1.116; pollo\n e)pi\ x. Od.12.407; xro/non e)pi\ makro/n Hdt.1.81; pauri/dion or pau=ron e)pi\ x., Hes.Op.133, 326. e)s xro/non
hereafter, Hdt.3.72, 9.89. meta\ xro/non after a
time, Id.2.52, etc.; me/xri tou= au)tou= x. up to the same
time, Th.1.13. pro\ tou= kaqh/kontos x. Aeschin.3.126; so tou= xro/nou pro/sqen S.Ant.461. su\n （cu\n） xro/nw|, like xro/nw| or dia\ xro/nou, A.Ag.1378, Eu.555 (lyr.). u(po\ xro/nou by
lapse of time, Th. 1.21: but u(po\ au)to\n to\n x.
about the same time, Hdt.7.165, cf. Th.1.100 (pl.).
lifetime, age, o( makro\s a)nqrw/pwn xro/nos S.Ph. 306; xro/nw| palaioi/ Id.OC112; xro/nw| mei/wn ib.374; toso/sde tw=| x. so far gone
in years, Pl.Ax.365b; xro/nw| bradu/s S.OC875.
season or
portion of the year, perigra/yai tou= e)/tous xro/non X.Mem.1.4.12.
delay, ou)d' e)poi/hsan (fort. e)nepoi/hsan） x. ou)de/na D.19.163; xro/non d' ai( nu/ktes e)/xonti
linger, Theoc.21.25; xro/nous e)mpoiei=n to interpose
delays, D.23.93. Gramm.,
tense of a
verb, D.H.Th.24, A.D.Adv.123.17, D.T.638.3.
time or
quantity of a syllable, Longin.39.4, A.D.Synt.130.4, al.: braxu\s x. a short syllable, ib.309.23; of the augment, ib.237.10. in Rhythmic and Music,
time, diairei=tai o( x. u(po\ tw=n r(uqmizome/nwn Aristox.Rhyth.p.79 W., etc.; o( prw=tos [x.]
time-unit, ibid., Aristid. Quint.1.14, etc.; xro/nos keno/s ib.18: freq. in pl., le/cis ei)s xro/nous teqei=sa diafe/rontas Aristox.Rhyth.p.77 W., cf. Anon.Rhythm.Oxy. 9ii6; [me/tra] proxwrei= e(/ws l/ xro/nwn Aristid.Quint.1.23.

xronotri^be/w,
waste time, loiter, Arist.Rh.1406a37, Leonid. ap. Plu. 2.225b, Act.Ap.20.16, Men.Prot.p.21 D.:—Med., UPZ39.29 (ii B. C.). c. acc., x. to\n po/lemon
protract the war, Plu.Cat.Mi. 53, Eun.Hist.p.242 D.
xronoulke/w, (e(/lkw) = xronotribe/w, gloss on morgullei=, Hsch.

xrono/w,
make temporal, [h( yuxh\] e(auth\n e)xro/nwse Plot.3.7.11.
xroo/s, v. xrw/s.
xrotih/, h(, late poet. form for xrw/s, AP15.35 (Theoph.).

xrou/sth, h(, = Lat.
crusta, Ann.Epigr.1905 No.172 (Thessalonica).

xru_s-a/etos [a_], o(,
golden eagle, Ael.NA2.39.

xru_/s-aigis, idos, h(,
with golden aegis, epith. of Athena, B.Fr.11, cf. IG12(5).611 (Ceos). (Oxyt. in codd., but proparox. acc. to the rule given in EM518.54.)

xru_s-ai/+zw,
adorn with gold, Hsch. (Pass.).
xru_s-ai+ko/n, to/, name of a coin, dub. l. in Inscr.Délos 1442B51 (ii B. C.).

xru_s-a/ktin, i_nos, o(, h(,
with golden rays or
beams, Hdn.Gr.1.18; in EM518.39, -a/ktis.
xrusa_la/katos, on, Dor. for xrushl- (q. v.).

xru_salli/s, i/dos, h(,
chrysalis, Arist.HA551a19, GA758b31, Thphr.HP2.4.4, etc. old name for a
cockchafer, Eust.1329.29.

xru/s-ammos [u_], h(,
golden sand, Olymp.Alch.p.98 B.; =
balluca, Gloss.

xrus-a^moibo/s, o(, expld. by Hsch. as = a)rgurognw/mwn: metaph., o( x. *)/arhs swma/twn
he who traffics in men's bodies, or
who ransoms the dead
by gold, A.Ag.437 (lyr.).

xrus-a/mpuc, u^kos, o(, h(,
with fillet or
frontlet of gold, epith. of horses, Il.5.358, 363, al. (never in Od.); *(=wrai h.Hom.6.5, 12; *mou=sai Hes.Th.916, cf. Pi.P.3.89; *la/xesis Id.O.7.64; *ou)rani/a B.5.13; also x. xalino/s Pi.O.13.65.
xrus-anqemi/s, i/dos, h(, = sq. 4, Ps.-Dsc.4.58.

xrus-a/nqemon, to/, = e(li/xruson, Dsc.4.57 (also xrusa/nqemos, h(, Cyran.44, Gloss.). = batra/xion I,
garden ranunculus, Ranunculus asiaticus, Gp.2.6.30. = xrusoko/mh, Ps.-Dsc.4.55. = xa/lkas, ib.58.

xrus-anqh/s, e/s,
with flower of gold, e)/rnos Trag.Adesp. in Gött.Nachr.1922p.27; kro/kos AP12.256 (Mel.). xrusanqe/s, to/, = e(li/xruson, Nic.Fr. 74.69.
yellow dye, PHolm.22.2.
xrus-a/nqina, ta/, games celebrated at Sardis, IG22.3169.23 (iii A. D.).

xrus-a/nqrwpos, o(,
'goldman', symbol in Alchemy, Zos.Alch.p.207B.; cf. molubda/nqrwpos.
xrusa/nios, Dor. for xrush/nios (q. v.).

xru_s-antaugh/s, e/s,
reflecting golden light, pe/tala E.Ion890 (lyr.).

xru_s-a/ntinos, h, on, written for -a/nqinos,
gold-coloured, gauna/khs Stud.Pal.20.67.12 (ii/iii A. D.): Lat.
crissantinum, = phlomi flores, Gloss.

xru_sa/oros [a_], on, （a)/or） = xrusa/wr,
with sword of gold, epith. of Apollo, Il.5.509, 15.256, Pi.P.5.104; also of Demeter, h.Cer.4; of Artemis, Orac. ap. Hdt.8.77; of Orpheus, Pi.Fr.139.9; so xrusa_oreu/s, e/ws, of Zeus at Stratonicea, Str.14.2.25, cf. OGI234.24 (Delph., iii B. C.); also xrusa_o/rios, CIG2720,2721 (Stratonicea): hence xru_sa_orei=s, oi(, of a league formed by his worshippers, to\ xrusaore/wn e)/qnos OGIl.c.12, cf. 111.8 (Egypt, ii B. C.); called to\
xru_sa_oriko\n su/sthma, Str.l.c.; cf. St.Byz. s.v. xru_sa_ori/s.

xru_s-argu/rion [u^], to/, =
pecunia auri, Gloss.

xru_s-a/rgu^ros, o(,
alloy of gold and silver, Maria ap.Zos.Alch.p.169B.
tribute of gold and silver, Zos.2.38, PLips.64.30 (iv. A. D.).

xru_s-a/rma^tos, on,
with or
in car of gold, *)aqa/na B.12.194; *mh/na Pi.O.3.19; also of heroes, Id.P.5.9, I.6(5).19. oi( x., of a body of the Macedonian royal guard, Poll.1.175.

xru_/s-aspis, i^dos, o(, h(,
with shield of gold, *)/arhs B.19.11; *qh/ba Pi.I.1.1; *palla/s E.Ph.1372; oi( x., a corps in the Macedonian army, Poll.1.175.

entryFree.sense:
golden goblet
with bottom shaped like a knuckle-bone, Sapph.170 (pl.).
golden Attic wine, Edict.Diocl.2.14, Alex. Trall.1.17, al.; -ko/n, to/, Paul.Aeg.3.50.

div0.entryFree:
xru_sau/g-eia, h(,
golden lustre, Eust.695.4.

xru_saug-e/w,
shine like gold, LXX Jb.37.22.

xru_saug-h/s, e/s,
gold-gleaming, kro/kos S.OC685 (lyr.); do/mos Ar.Av.1710, cf. Cat.Cod.Astr.2.82; to\ th=s deirh=s x., of a peacock, Lib.Descr.24.6: metaph., fro/nhsis Ph.1.57: neut. as Adv., xrusauge\s meidia=n Him.Or.13.7.
xru_saug-i/zw, = xrusange/w, Lib.Descr. 30.13.
xru_sa/fion [a_], to/, Dim. of xruso/s, Hdn.Gr.1.368, Eust.492.36.

xru/sa^fos, o(,
a kind of fish, perh.
gilt head, Marc.Sid.12.
xru_s-a/wr [a_], oros, o(, h(, （a)/or） = xrusa/oros (q. v.), h.Ap.123, Hes. Op.771, Pi.P.5.104.

xru_s-egxh/s, e/s,
with spear of gold, Orph.H.52.11 codd. (qursegxh/s Herm.).

xru_sei=on, to/,
gold-mine, Plb.34.10.10: pl. xrusei=a
gold-mines, X. HG4.8.37, Plb.3.57.3, etc.: gen. pl. written xruse/wn, PSI6.601.10 (iii B. C.).
xru/seios [u_], h, on, Ep. for xru/seos (q. v.).

xru_s-ekle/kths, ou, o(,
one who picks gold-dust from river-sand, gold-washer, Lat.
aurilegulus, Gloss.

xru_s-elefanth/lektros, on,
of gold, ivory, and electrum, overlaid therewith, a)spi/s Epigr. ap. Plu. Tim.31.

xru_s-elefa/nti^nos, h, on,
of gold and ivory, overlaid therewith, Philoch.97, Sch.Ar.Eq.1166.

xru_s-e/mbolos, on,
with beak of gold, of a ship, App.Praef.10.

xru_s-e/mpaiktos, on,
inlaid with gold, BGU781 iv 1 (i A. D.).

xru_s-e/ndetos, on,
gold-inlaid, spa/qh Philem.70; cf. Mart.2.43, 6.94.
set in gold, sfragi/s IG11(2) 161B49, 203 B67 (Delos, iii B. C.); sma/ragdos Plu.Luc.3.

xru_seo-bo/stru^xos, on,
with golden tresses, *dio\s e)/rnos E.Ph.191 (lyr.), Philox.8.

xru_seo/-dmhtos, on,
built or
formed of gold, A.Ch. 617 (lyr., but Herm. xruseokmh/toisi,
gold-wrought).

xru_se-o/dous, o/dontos, o(, h(,
gold-pronged, tri/aina Lyr. in
Mitteil. aus d. Papyrussamml. d. Nationalbibliothek in Wien 1(1932).138.
xru_seo/-kmhtos, on, v. xruseo/dmhtos.
xru_seo-ko/llhtos, on, = xrusoko/llhtos, Paul.Sil.Ambo159.
xru_seo-ko/mhs, ou, Dor. xru_seo-ko/mas, a, o(, = xrusoko/mhs, Simon.26B, Pae.Delph.3.

xru_seo/-kuklos, on,
with disk of gold, fe/ggos, of the sun, E.Ph.176 (lyr.).
xru_seo/-mallos, on, = xruso/mallos, poi/mna, de/ros, Id.El.724 (lyr.), Hyps.Fr.3(1)ii 22 (lyr.), cf. Orph.A.1018.
xru_seo-mi/trhs, ou, o(, = xrusomi/trhs, AP9.524.23:— fem. xru_seo-mi/tra, Melinno ap.Stob.3.7.12.
xru_seo/-nwtos, on, = xruso/nwtos, a)spi/s E.Fr.159 (lyr.).
xru_seo-ph/lhc, hkos, o(, h(, = xrusoph/lhc, h.Mart.1, Call.Lav.Pall.43.

xru_seo-ph/nhtos, on,
with woof of gold, gold-inwoven, fa/rea E.Or.840 (lyr.); x. grafi/s a line or thread
of gold inwrought, AP5.275.2 (Agath.).

xru_seo/-plokos, on,
inwoven with gold, taini/ai B.16.106.

xru_seo/-rru^tos, on,
flowing with gold, o)/lbos Supp.Epigr. 7.14.23 (Susa, Hymn to Apollo, i A. D.).

xru/seos, h, on, also os, on in AP5.30 (Antip.Thess.), Att. contr. xrusou=s, h=, ou=n IG12.358.4, etc.; Ep. xru/seios, h, on: Hom. and Hes. use both xru/seos and -eios, xrush=| is dub. in Il.5.425; Lyr. used xru/seos, a, on, and this form sts. occurs in Trag. dialogue and even in Prose, as X.Ages.5.5 codd., Plu.Luc.37, Apollod.2.5.10, Ant.Lib.36.1; Aeol. xru/sios Sapph.1.8, al. (but xru/sea Theoc.29.37); Boeot. xrou/sios SIG337.8 (iv B. C.): (xruso/s):—
golden, freq. in Ep., esp. of what belonged to gods, xruse/w| e)n dape/dw|, xruse/ois depa/essi, xru/seion e)pi\ qro/non, etc., Il.4.2,3, 8.442, al.; x. ta/lanta the
golden scales of Zeus, 22.209; x. i)tu/s, zugo/n, of Hera's chariot, 5.724,730; i(ma/sqlh x., of Zeus and Poseidon, 8.44 = 13.26; zw/nh x., of Calypso and Circe, Od.5.232 = 10.545, etc.; do/mos Sapph. l.c.; of possessions of mortals, Il.4.133, 5.425, al.: sts.
enriched or
adorned with gold, x. skh=ptron 1.15, cf. 246; ma/xaira 18.598; qu/rai Od.7.88; kli=nai, krhth=res, Hdt.9.82,80; e(/sthke . . *)ale/candros o( x., of a statue, Id.8.121; xrusou=s sta/qhti Luc.Pseudol.15. xru/seia me/talla
gold-mines, Th.4.105 (the only instance of xru/seios in Att., cf. xrusei=on). xrusou=s (sc. stath/r), o(,
a gold coin, = stath/r, IG7.303.98, al. (Oropus, iii B. C.), IPE12.32A13 (Olbia, iii B. C.), LXX Ge. 24.22, Plu.Per.25 (in Pap., not a coin, but the equivalent of 20 silver drachmae, PCair.Zen.28.11 (iii B. C.), etc.); xrusoi= e)pi/shmoi Plb.4.56.3, cf. Poll.9.53,59, Hsch. xru/seon, to/,
gold plaque, SIG1122.7 (Selinus, V B.C.).
gold-coloured, golden-yellow, e)/qeirai Il.8.42, 13.24; x. ne/fh ib.523, etc.; a)e/ros ko/mai Pi.Pae.6.137; tw=n ta\ xrusa= the
yolks of eggs, Ath.9.376d. metaph.,
golden, xruse/h *)afrodi/th Il.3.64, Od.8.337; *moi=sa Pi.I.8(7).5; sqe/nos a)eli/ou x. Id.P.4.144; w)= x. qu/gater *dio/s S.OT188 (lyr.); *)elpi/s ib.158 (lyr.); timh/ Id.Ant. 699; w)= xrusoi= qeoi/ Ar.Ra.483; x. u(gi/eia Pi.P.3.73; logismou= a)gwgh/ Pl.Lg.645a; h)=qos Antiph.212.5; to\ x. o)rni/qwn ge/nos Id.175; x. ge/nos a)nqrw/pwn, of the Golden Age, Hes.Op.109, cf. Pl.R.468e, Phdr. 235e, Cra.397e. sts. used ironically, e)gw\ de\ o( x. but I,
fine fellow that I am . . , Luc.Laps.1; *pla/twna xrusou=n (sc. *)epi/kouros e)ka/lei) D.L.10.8, cf. Menodot. ap. Gal.Subf.Emp.63.
wealthy, Palaeph. 31.4 (s. v. l.). [xru_se/h, xru_se/hn, xru_se/ou, xru_se/w|, etc., in Hom. must be pronounced as disyll., as is fully proved by such passages as Il.1.15,374: but Lyric Poets sts. used u^ in xru/seos, Pi.P.3.73, 4.4, 144, al., B.9.6, 15.2; so also Trag., but only in Lyr., not in Iambics or Anapaestics, S.OT157, 188, Ant.103, E.Med.632,978, IA 1051, IT1253, Tr.856, Ba.372, Heracl.916, HF351, 396, El.192; sts. also Epigrammatists, AP6.292.2 (Hedyl.), 7.233.1 (Apollonid.), 13.18.4 (Parmeno), APl.4.96.8.]
xru_seo-sa/mba^los, on, v. l. for sq. in cod. H (Jerusalem palimpsest) of E.Or.1468 (lyr.), cf. Hermes64.424.

xru_seo-sa/nda^los, on,
with sandals of gold, i)/xnos x. the step
of golden sandals, E. l. c., IA1042 (lyr.).

xru_seo/-skaptros, Dor. for *xru_seo/-skhptros, o(,
with golden sceptre, epith. of Zeus, B.8.100.
xru_seo-ste/fa^nos, on, f.l. for xrusoste/fanos (q. v.).

xru_seo/-stolmos, on,
decked with gold, do/moi A.Pers.159 (troch.).
xru_seo/-stolos, on, = foreg., pe/plwn x. fa/ros E.HF414 (lyr.).

xru_seo/-tarsos, on,
with golden feet or
wings, au)=rai Orph.A. 340.
xru_seo/-teuktos, on, = xruso/teuktos (q. v.), Id.H.55.18.

xru_seo-feggh/s, e/s,
with golden lustre, Id.Fr.236.4.

xru_s-ergh/s, e/s,
made of or
with gold, i(ma/tion Tz.H.3.980.

xru_s-ergo/s, o/n,
making or
producing gold, Lyc.1352.

xru_s-eutikh/ (sc. te/xnh), h(,
goldsmith's art, Eustr. in EN296.10.

xru_s-eyhth/s, ou=, o(, (e(/yw)
goldmelter, Lat.
auricoctor, Gloss.

xru_s-h/goros, on,
of golden eloquence, Epigr. ap. Geel Catal.Mss.Lugd.Bat.p.18 No.54.

xru_s-hla/ka^tos [a^k], Dor. xru_sa_l-, on,
with distaff of gold, not (as Sch.)
with arrow of gold, epith. of Artemis in Il.20.70, al., cf. B. 10.38, S.Tr.637 (lyr.); of Amphitrite, the Nereids, and Leto, Pi.O.6.104, N.5.36, 6.36; of the *xa/rites, B.8.1.

xru_s-h/la^tos, on, (e)lau/nw 111.1)
of beaten gold, A. Th.644, S.OT1268, E.Ph.62, Ar.Pl.9, Plu.Demetr.53; a)/ndres Luc. Sat.8; *pari/a pe/tra E.ap.Satyr.Vit.Eur.Oxy.1176Fr.38ii24.

xru_s-h/lektros, o(, and h(,
gold-electrum, gold-amber, Plin.HN37.127, Aët. 2.35.

xru_s-h/nios, on, (h(ni/a)
with reins of gold, epith. of Ares, Od.8.285; of Artemis, Il.6.205; of Demeter, Pi.Fr.37; Dor. xrusa/nios [a_], of Aphrodite, S.OC693 (lyr.).

xru_s-h/rhs, es,
furnished or
decked with gold, golden, oi)=koi E.Ion157 (lyr.); *)/arktos stre/fous' ou)rai=a xrush/rh po/lw| ib.1154; naw=n qrigkoi/ Id.IT129(lyr.).

xru_siai=os, a, on,
priced in gold coin, dei/ceis D.L.4.38.
xru_si^da/rion, to/, = sq., Ar.Fr.90.

xru_si/zw,
to be golden or
like gold, Dsc.1.15, Critoap.Gal.12.446, Ps.-Callisth.3.21, Hdn.5.6.8, Ath.7.322a; to\ xrusi/zon tou= w)|ou= the
yolk, Gp.14.7.5.
abound in gold, Arist.Mir.833b8.

xru_siko/s, h/, o/n,
made in cash: xrusika/, ta/,
cash payments, POxy. 136.13 (vi A. D.); x. ste/fanoi PTeb.60.102 (ii B. C.), al. = xru/seos 1.2, me/talla Eupolem. ap. Alex.Polyh.Fr.18M.

xru/si^nos [u_], h, on, late form of xru/seos, luxnei=a x. Cumont
Fouilles de Doura-Europos 372 No.13: as Subst., xru/sinos, o(, = xrusou=s 1.3, Alciphr.3.3, al., IG7.26 (Megara, v/vi A. D.), Lyd.Mag.3.27, al., Olymp.Hist.p.462D.

xru_si/on, to/, Dim. of xruso/s,
a piece of gold, generally,
gold, Hdt. 3.95,97, Pl.Euthd.288e, R.336e, al.
anything made of gold, gold plate, ornaments of gold, etc., a)/shmon Th.2.13: pl., D.27.10, 48.55, Men.Sam.167, 1 Ep.Pet.3.3, Plu.Tim.15. esp.
gold coin, money, E. Cyc.161; ou)/t' a)rgu/rion ou)/te xrusi/on Ar.Eq.472, cf. Pl.808, Ra.720 (troch.), etc.; x. *)attiko/n IG22.1687.16; lh=ros pa/nta pro\s to\ x. Antiph.232.1; e)gw\ d' u(pe/labon xrhsi/mous ei)=nai qeou\s ta)rgu/rion kai\ to\ x. Men.537.4 : but stath=ras xrusi/ou Eup.112; xrusi/a
pieces of gold, Pl.R.336e.
gold thread, Hp.Art.32. as a term of endearment,
my little treasure! Ar.Lys.930, cf. Ap11.232 (Callias Arg.). = to\ tw=n paidi/wn ai)doi=on, Hsch.
xru_sioplu/sion, to/, f.l. for xrusopl- (q. v.).

xru_si/ppeios, on,
of, belonging to Chrysippus, dialektikh/ D.L.7.180; ta\ X. his writings, Arr.Epict.2.16.34.
Chrysippius, a plant named from its discoverer, Plin.HN26.93.

xru_si/s, i/dos, h(,
a vessel of gold, piece of gold plate, Hermipp.37 (troch.), Pherecr.128, Ar.Ach.74, Pax425, IG12.268.111, al.; xrusi/dwn bo/trues Lib.Ep.22.3; an Att. word, Ath.11.502a.
gold-broidered dress, Luc.Nigr.11: pl.,
gold-embroidered shoes, Id.
D Deor.2.2.
xru_si/skhptron, to/, = xamaile/wn leuko/s, Ps.-Dsc.3.8.

xru_si/ths [i_], ou, o(, mostly in fem. xrusi=tis, idos,
like gold, containing gold, ha/mmos xrusi=tis Hdt.3.102, Str.3.2.8; li/qos IG22.1424
a.254; x. spodo/s a
yellow powder used for the eyes, Hp.Mul. 1.103; x. gh= Gal.12.184; xrusi=tis alone, a form of liqa/rguros, Dsc. 5.87. h( x.
gold-dust or
ore, Plu.2.526b.
touchstone, lapis Lydins, Poll.7.102. = xrusoko/mh, Dsc.4.55.
xru_so-ba/la^nos [ba^], h(, = ba/lanos mureyikh/, Gal.13.147, 155.

xru_so-ba^fh/s, e/s,
gold-embroidered, Plu.Demetr.41; x. a)/naktes Simm.25. xru_so-be/lemnos, on,
with shafts, arrows of gold, AP9.623 (Cyrus), Orac. ap. Lyd.Mens.3.10.

xru_so-bh/rullos, o(,
beryl with a tinge of gold colour, Plin.HN37.76.

xru_so-bo/stru^xos, on, in Alchemy,
goldentressed, Olymp.Alch.p.95B.

xru_so/-bwlos, on,
with soil of gold, i.e.
containing gold, gh=s le/pas E.Rh.921.

xru_so-ge/ws, wn, (gh=)
with soil of gold: to\ xruso/gewn the
land of gold-ore, Philostr.VA6.1:— xru_so/geios, on, Suid.
xru_so/-glu^fos, on, gloss on xrusoto/reutos, Hsch., Suid.

xru_so/-glwssos, on,
golden-tongued, Tz.H.10.234.

xru_so/-gonon, to/,
black turnip, Bongardia Chrysogonum, Dsc.4.56.

xru_so/-gonos, on,
born or
begotten of gold, genea/, i.e. the Persians, because (by the legend) they were descended from Perseus, who was begotten of Zeus in the form of a shower of gold, A.Pers.79 (lyr., Sch., -no/mou cod.M); of Perseus, Orph.L.551.

xru_so-gra^fh/s, e/s,
gold-embroidered, e)mba/des Callix.2.

xru_so-gra^fi/a, h(,
a writing with letters of gold. Aristeas 176, PMag.Leid.X.34B.

xru_so-dai/daltos, on,
decked with rich work of gold, Ar.Ec.972 (lyr.), E.IA219(lyr.).

xru_so-daktu/lios [u^], on,
with ring of gold, a)nh/r Ep.Jac.2.2. gloss on xrusoko/llhtos, x. sfragi/s
set in a gold ring, Hsch.

xru_so-de/kths, ou, o(,
receiver of gold, Epic.in BKT5(1)p.120(vi A. D.).

xru_so/-detos, on, also a, on Alc.33: (de/w(A)):—
bound with gold, set in gold, sfrhgi/s Hdt.3.41.
overlaid or
enriched with gold, e)lefanti/nan la/ban tw=| ci/feos xrusode/tan Alc. l.c.; x. ke/ras, of a lyre, S.Fr. 244 (lyr.); x. e(/rkesi gunaikw=n, of the
golden necklace with which Eriphyle was bribed, Id.El.838 (lyr.); pero/nai x. E.Ph.805(lyr.): metaph., x. sw/matos a)lkh/n
in golden armour, Id.Rh.382 (anap.).

xru_so-di/nas [i_], a, o(,
with golden eddies, *paktwlo/s B.3.44.

xru_so-e/qeir, ros, o(, h(,
with golden hair, Archil.121; voc. xrusoe/qeire IG12(5).893.3 (Tenos, restored); fem. -e/qeira^ in Max.95.

xru_so-eidh/s, e/s,
like gold, gh= Pl.Phd. 110c; xrw=ma X.Cyr.7.1.2, cf. Thphr.HP6.3.5; me/li Arist.HA627a2; ko/mh Plu.2.771b; of a kind of jaundice, Hp. ap. Herod.Med(?). in Rh.Mus.49.554.

xru_so-ei/mwn, on, gen. onos,
with robe of gold, a)/galma IG4.558.14 (Argos, ii B. C.), cf. Eust.693.48.

xru_so-e/liktos, on,
twined with gold, Paul.Sil.Ambo255.

xru_so/-zu^gos, on,
with yoke of gold, h.Hom.31.15, X.Cyr.8.3.12.

xru_so-zu/mion [zu_], or xru_so-zw/mion, to/, in Alchemy,
ferment of gold, Zos.Alch.pp.160B. (-zu/m-), 247B. (-zw/m-).

xru_so/-zwnos, on,
with girdle of gold, Hes.Fr.278.4.

xru_so/-hlos, on,
with nails or
studs of gold, Eust.95.6.

xru_/so-qric, tri^xos, o(, h(,
golden-veined, la=e Orph. L.292.

xru_so/-qronos, on,
with throne of gold, epith. of Hera, Artemis and Eos, Il.1.611, al.; of Cyrene, Pi.P.4.260; of Isis, Hymn.Is. 7:—poet. word (v. Ar.Av.950 (lyr.)), used by Jul.Caes.307d.

xru_so-qw/rac, a_kos, o(, h(,
with breastplate of gold, Iamb. post Polem.p.49 Hinck, Tz.H.1.993.
xru_so-kalli/as, ou, o(, = a)nqemi/s, cj. in Dsc.3.137. = parqe/nion, cj. in Ps.-Dsc.3.138.

xru_so-ka/nqa^ros, o(,
chafer (cf. xrusomhlolo/nqion), Sch.Ar.Nu.761; -ka/nqaroi, = Lat.
bulli (dub. sens.), Gloss.; also xru_so-kanqari/s, Jo.Sic. in AB1432.

xru_so/-kanqos, in Lat. form.
crisocantes (or
-is), expld. as
peristola or
periscola, Gloss.

xru_so-ka/rhnos [a^], on, Dor. xru_so/-a_nos,
with head of gold, E.HF 375 (lyr.).

xru_so/-karpos, on,
with golden fruit: as Subst.,
ivy, = kisso/s, Ps.-Dsc.2.179, Plin.HN16.147.

xru_so-ke/leuqos, on,
travelling on a golden path, PMag.Berol.2.91.

xru_so/kerws, wtos, o(, h(, and xru_so/-rws, wn, gen. -w (also Dor. acc. in SIG398.24 (Cos, iii B. C.)):—
with horns of gold, e)/lafos Pi.O.3.29, E.Hel.382 (lyr., Elmsl. xrusoke/rata); as epith. of Pan, Cratin.321 (lyr.); of the moon, AP5.15 (Marc.Arg.).
with gilded horns, like a victim ready to be sacrificed, tri/ttoian bo/arxon -kerwn IG12.76.37, cf. Aeschin.3.164, Pl.Alc.2.149c, SIG l.c., Porph.Abst.2.15.

xru_so-ke/fa^los, on,
with golden head, epith. of a fish, Phryn.Com. 50.

xru_so-ki/qa^ris [ki^],
with golden lyre, prob. in Tim.Pers.215 (xruseo- Pap.), cf. Hsch. s.v. xrusa/wr; also xru_so-ki/qa^ros, Suid. s.v. xrusa/oron.

xru_so-ki/trinos, h, on,
of a pale golden hue, Porph. in Ptol. 199.

xru_so/-klustos, on,
washed with gold, i. e.
gilded, qhriklei/wn-klu/stwn zeu=gos Ister 38; fia/lh IG11(2).161 B13 (Delos, iii B. C.); poth/rion Phleg.Fr.36.1 J., cf. Nicom.Com.4 (-klau=sta (sic) codd.Ath.).

xru_so-kogxu/lion [xu_], to/, a
gold shell, i. e.
rolled gold, Ps.-Democr. p.44B.

xru_so/-kokkos, on,
with golden seeds or
grains, Ps.-Apul.Herb. 130.

xru_so-ko/lla, h(,
gold-solder, malachite, basic copper carbonate, Arist. Mir.834b20, Thphr.Lap.26.40, Dsc.5.74,89, Plin.HN33.86.
a dish of linseed and honey, Alcm.74B.

xru_so/-kollos, on,
soldered or
inlaid with gold, e)kpw/mata S.Fr.378; kw/ph E.Fr.587; also xru_so-ko/llhtos di/fros Id.Ph.2, cf. Antiph.106.2, 237, Luc.Ind.29; a(/rmata Jul.Or.2.50d; cf. xrusodaktu/lios.

xru_sokom-e/w,
have golden hair, Philostr.Ep.55.

xru_soko/m-h, h(,
immortelle, Helichrysum orientale, Dsc.4.55, Plin.HN21.50, 148.

xru_soko/m-hs, ou, Dor. xru_sokom-ko/mas, a, o(,
golden-haired, epith. of Dionysus, Hes.Th. 947; of Eros, Anacr.14, E.IA548 (lyr.); of Apollo, Tyrt.3.4, B. 4.2, E.Supp.975 (lyr.), Ar.Av.217 (anap.); o( X., abs. for Apollo, Pi.O.6.41, 7.32, E.Tr.254 (lyr.).
with golden ornaments in the hair, Luc.Gall.13.

xru_so/kom-os, on,
golden-haired, AP6.264 (Mnasalc.); of the plumage of birds, x. pte/ra Hdt.2.73.

xruso-ko/rallos, h(,
'gold-coral', name of several metals, Ps.-Democr.p.44B.

xruso-ko/rumbos, on,
with golden clusters, kisso/s Dsc.Eup.1.69.

xruso-kosmh/ths, ou, o(,
decorator with gold, Vett. Val. 3.24, Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).136 (v. l.).

xruso-kro/ta^los, on,
tinkling with gold, spata/lh cj. in AP5.270 (Maced.).

xruso-la^bh/s, e/s,
with haft of gold, e)gxeiri/dion Men.20.

xruso-lampi/s, i/dos, h(,
glowworm, Phryn.PS p.126B. a precious stone, Plin.HN37.156.
xruso-la/xa^non [la^], to/, = a)ndra/facus, Ps.-Dsc.2.119, Gp.12.1.1, Lyd.Mens.4.42.

xruso/-li^non, to/,
gold thread, gold wire, Paul. Aeg.6.92.

xruso/-lobos, on,
decked with gold ear-rings, ou)/ata, as Pors. in Epigr. ap. Ath.8.343f (Juba), for xrusobo/lois.

xruso-loge/w,
speak of gold, Luc.Gall.6.

xruso-lo/gos, on,
gathering gold, Gloss.

xruso/-logxos, on,
with spear of gold, *palla/s E.Ion9, cf. Ar.Th.318 (lyr.).
xru/solon, to/, dub. sens. in Zos.Alch.p.247 B. (s. v. l.).

xruso-lopos, on,
with golden scales, gloss. on sq., Hsch.

xruso/-lofos, on,
with golden crest, B.Scol.Oxy.2081（
e)Fr.5.7; dra/kontes Hsch.; fem. xrusolo/fa_ in Ar.Lys.344 (lyr.) as epith. of Athena.

xruso-lu/rhs [lu^], ou, Dor. xruso-lu/ras, a, o(,
with lyre of gold, of Apollo, Pi.Pae.5.41, Ar.Th.315 (lyr.), Supp.Epigr.4.467.20 (Branchidae, iii A. D.), Orph.H.34.3 (voc. -lu/rh); of Orpheus, Arist.Pepl. 48, AP7.617.

xruso/-mallos, on,
with golden wool or
fleece, kw=as Pherecyd.105J.; a)rno\s te/ras E.Or.998 (lyr.): metaph., pro/baton x., of a rich fool, Diog. ap. D.L.6.47.

xruso-ma^nh/s, e/s,
mad after gold, spata/lh AP5.301.2 (Agath.): hence xruso-ma^ne/w, Suid.; xruso-ma^ni/a, h(, Tz H.3.301 (pl.).

xruso-mhlolo/nqion, to/, Dim. as if from *xrusomhlolo/nqh,
a little golden beetle or
cockchafer, as a term of endearment, Ar.V.1341.
xruso/-mhlon, to/, = kudw/nion, Plin.HN15.37, Alex.Trall.1.16.

xruso-mh=tris, idos, h(,
goldfinch, Fringilla carduelis, Arist.HA592b30.

xruso-mi/trhs, ou, Dor. xruso-mi/tras, a, o(,
with girdle or
headband of gold, epith. of Dionysus, S.OT209 (lyr.); pecul. fem. -mi/trh, of Phoebe, Opp. C.2.2.
gold-bound, pi/nakes Hippoloch. ap. Ath.4.130b.

xruso/-morfos, on,
in the likeness of gold, of Zeus descending to Danaë, S.Fr. [1127.2].

xru_s-o/mfa^los, on,
with golden or
gilded boss, fia/lh a)rgura= x. IG12.313.65, 314.72, 22.1544.29, cf. Chron.Lind.B.48, Poll.6.98.

xru_so/-nhma, atos, to/,
gold thread, gold wire, Paul.Aeg.6.92.

xru_so-nh/stria, h(, fem. of sq., Lat.
aurinetrix, Gloss.

xru_so-nh/ths, ou, o(,
spinner of gold thread, Vett.Val.3.24 (pl.).

xru_so/-nomos, on,
feeding in gold, very rich, v. l. for xruso/gonos (q. v.). perh. = xrusou=s, poth/ria PBaden 54.4 (v A. D.). parox. -no/mos, o(,
distributor of gold, x. tw=n lampadistw=n SIG1068.11 (Patmos, iii/ii B. C.).

xru_so/-nwtos, on,
with golden back or
surface; x. h(ni/a a rein
studded with gold, S.Aj. 847.

xru_so/-ci^fos, on,
with sword of gold, gloss on xrusa/oros, Cyr., Lex.Havn. in Schmidt Hsch. s.v. xrusa/oron.

-cu^lon. to/,
goldwood, = qa/yos, Sch.Ar.V.1404; = skuqa/rion, Sch.Theoc.2.88.

xru_so-pa^gh/s, e/s,
built of gold, dw/mata IG4.620.14 (Argos).

xru_so-pa/ru^fos, on,
with border or
hem of gold, Plu.Demetr.41.

xru_so/-pastos, on, also a, on Alc.Fr.90 Lobel: (pa/ssw):—
shot with gold, kuni/a l. c.; x. tih/rhs a turban
of gold tissue, Hdt.8.120; ta\ x. e(/sqla (Wilamowitz for e)sqla/) A.Ag.776 (lyr.); x. ko/smos D.50.34; tai=s custi/sin tai=s x. Eub.134; mi/tra Duris 14J.; e)sqh/s Luc.Ind.8; opp. xrush/latos, Iamb.post Polem.p.50 Hinck.

xru_so/-patros, on,
sprung of a golden father, epith. of Perseus (cf. xruso/gonos), Lyc.838: also
xru_so-pa/twr [a^], oros, o(, Nonn.D.47.471.

xru_so-pe/di_los, on,
gold-sandalled, epith. of Hera, Od.11.604, Hes.Th.454; of Eos, Sapph.18.

xru_so/-peplos, on,
with robe of gold, kou/ra Anacr.76; *mnamosu/na Pi.I.6(5).75; *(/hrh B.18.22.

xru_so-pe/ta^los, on,
couered with gold plaques, Lat.
bracteolatus, xitw/n Lyd.Mag.2.4.

xru_so-ph/lhc, hkos, o(, h(,
with helm of gold, of Ares, A.Th.106(lyr.); x. sta/xus spartw=n, of the Sparti at Thebes, E.Ph.939.

xru_so-ph/nitos (leg. xru_so/-htos), on,
brocaded with gold, xitw/n Cyr.

xru_so/-phxus, Dor. xru_so/-pa_xus, u,
with golden arms, *)aw/s B.5.40.
xru_so/-pleuros, o(, = sa/lph, Gloss.

xru_so-plo/ka^mos, on,
goldenhaired, h.Ap.205, Tim.Pers.138.

xru/s-oplos [u_], on,
with golden armour, Tz.H.10.435.

xru_so-plu/sion [u^], to/,
gold-wash, placer, where gold is washed from the river-sand, Str.3.2.8 (pl.); wrongly xrusiopl- Id.5.1.8.

xru_so-poii/a, h(,
the making of gold, Syn.Alch.p.61B, Zos.Alch.p.220B.

xru_so-poi/ki^los, on,
gold-embroidered, Callix.2.
xru_so-poi/kiltos, on, = foreg., IG11(2).287 B72 (Delos, iii B. C.), Inscr.Délos 380.63 (ii B. C.), D.S.18.26.

xru_so-poio/s, o(,
goldsmith, Luc.Cont.12.

xru_so/-pokos, on,
with fleece of gold, Nonn.D.10.102.

xru_so/-polis, ews, h(,
golden city, of Hierapolis, Epigr.Gr.1074. name of a fabulous plant, Aristaenet.1.10, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.7.4.

xru_so/-pous, o(, h(, neut. -poun, gen. -podos,
gold-footed, forei=a Plb.30.25.18; kli/nh Heraclid.Cum. 2.
xru_so-pra/sios [a^] li/qos, o(, = sq., PHolm.11.10; -i/ou (perh. neut.) poi/hsis ib.5.

xru_so/-pra^sos, o(,
chrysoprase, a precious stone
of golden-green colour, Apoc.21.20, cf. Plin. HN37.113.

xru_so-prepw/dhs, es,
looking like gold, Tz.H.5.389 (Comp.).

xru_so-pro/swpos, on,
goldenfaced, epith. of the sun, PMag.Par.2.133.

xru_so/-prumnos, on,
with gilded poop, Plu.Ant.26, App.Praef.10.

xru_so/-prw|ros, on,
with gilded prow, a)ka/tion Philostr.Im.1.12.
xru/sopta, ta/, = ai( ai)qa/lai ai( canqai/ acc. to Gloss.ap.Steph.Thes. et Ducange; x. pa/nta poiei= (sc. o( e)th/sios li/qos) Maria ap.Olymp. Alch.p.93B., cf. Zos.Alch.p.120 B.

xru_so-pteros, on,
