with wings of gold, of Iris, Il.8.398, 11.185, h.Cer.314; *)/erws Ar.Av.1738 (lyr.); pai=des *afrodi/ths Aristaenet.2.10. xruso/pteron, to/, a gem similar to xruso/prasos, Xenocr. Lap.90, Plin.HN37.109. a bird, Cyran.44.
xru_so-pte/ru^gos, on, = foreg., *mou=sai Him.Or.14.37.

xru_so-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in gold, Sch.Ar.Pl.884.
xru_so-rage/s: xrusobafe/s, Hsch. (cf. r(e/zw (B), r(ogeu/s).

xru_so-ra^ni/s, i/dos, h(,
golden ewer, Id.
xru_so/-ra^pis, o(, poet. for xruso/rrapis, Pi.P.4.178.
xru_soro/hs, ou, o(, poet. for xrusorro/hs, tmw=los E.Ba.154(lyr.): of Zeus descending in gold, Hedyl. ap. Ath.8.345a.

xru_s-o/rofos, on,
with golden roof or
ceiling, Philox.14, Ph.1.666, Luc.Cyn.9; also xru_s-w/rofos, skhnh/ Plu.2.329d.

xru_so/-rrabdos, on,
with golden wand, Hdn.Epim.154 (with single r).

xru_so-rra^gh/s, e/s, （r(h/gnumi） e)/rnos
a golden branch
plucked off, Poet. ap. Hsch.

xru_so/-rra^pis, idos, o(, h(,
with wand of gold, epith. of Hermes, Od.5.87, 10.277, h.Merc.539; cf. xruso/rapis.

xrusorrh/mwn, on, gen. onos,
of golden speech, Cyr.

xru_so-rro/hs, ou, Dor. xru_so-rro/as, o(,
streaming with gold, *nei=los Supp.Epigr.8.549.17 (Egy pt, Hymn to Isis), Ath.5.203c; cf. xrusoro/hs.

xru_so/-rru^tos, on,
gold-streaming, A.Pr.805; na/mata Supp.Epigr.4.467.2 (Didyma, iii A. D.); cf. xruso/rutos.

xru_s-oru/kths, ou, o(,
gold-digger, Gloss.
xru_so/ru^tos, on, = xruso/rrutos, gonai\, of Perseus the son of Danaë, S.Ant.950(lyr.).

xru_so/s, o(,
gold, timh=s Il.18.475, etc.; coupled with other precious things, e.g. xalko/s, si/dhros, 6.48; e)sqh/s, Od.5.38; xruso\n ke/rasin perixeu/as (of a victim) Il.10.294 = Od.3.384, cf. 437; w(s d' o(/te tis xruso\n perixeu/etai a)rgu/rw| 6.232; x. damasi/frwn Pi.O. 13.78; koi=los a)/rguros kai\ x. silver and
gold plate, Theopomp.Hist. 283a, cf. Luc.Nav.20; leuko\s x. white
gold, i.e. gold alloyed with silver, opp. x. a)/pefqos refined
gold, Hdt.1.50; x. e(yo/menos Pi.N.4.82; xruso\n kaqai/rein Pl.Plt.303d; basani/zein e)n puri/ Id.R.413e.
gold, to express anything made of gold, e. g.
golden armour or raiment, xruso\n . . e)/dune peri\ xroi/+, of Zeus, Il.8.43; of Poseidon, 13.25; to\ e)mo\n sw=ma mh/te e)n x. qh=te . . X.Cyr.8.7.25; a)raro/tws su/ndesma xruso\s (a gold crown) ei)=xe E.Med.1193; e)n xrusw=| pi/nein Luc.Merc. Cond.26. freq. used by Poets to denote
anything dear or
precious, tau=ta me\n . . krei/ssona xrusou= . . fwnei=s A.Ch.372 (anap.); o( x. h(=sson kth=ma tou= kla/ein a)\n h)=n S.Fr.557; w(s xruso\s au)tw=| ta)ma\ . . kaka\ do/cei pot' ei)=nai E.Tr.432, cf. D.H.Rh.9.4; cf. Pi.O.1.1, 3.42, Plu.Sert. 5: metaph. also, xruso\s e)pw=n
golden words, Ar.Pl.268; xrusw=| pa/ttein tina/ Id.Nu.912 (anap.); u(=sai xruso/n tini Pi.O.7.50. [u_] in xruso/s and all derivs., though Lyric Poets sts. made u short in the Adj. xru/seos (q.v.); once we have xru^so/s, Pi.N.7.78.] (Borrowed from Semitic, cf. Hebr.
chārūts, Assyr. h<*>urāšu 'gold', Aram.
hara 'yellow'.)

xru_so-sanda^laimopotixqoni/a, h(,
goddess of the lower world wearing golden sandals and drinking blood, epith. of Hecate, Tab. Defix. in Rh.Mus.55.250 (-atmo- lapis).

xru_so-sa/nda^los, on,
goldensandalled, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11.

xru_so-sa/pfeiros, h(,
gold-sapphire, Alex.Trall.2.1.

xru_so/-shmos, on,
embroidered with gold, xitw/n, of the Roman
tunica palmata, D.H.3.61, cf. Alex.Aphr. in Top.262.1.
xru_so/-spermon, to/, = a)ei/zwon to\ me/ga, Ps.-Dsc.4.88 (xrusi/- codd.). = xruso/gonon, ib.56, PMag.Leid.V.13.30.

xru_so-spo/ros, on,
sowing gold, Nonn.D.10.145.

xru_so/-staqmos, on,
worth its weight in gold, i)xqu/wn poikili/a Lyd.Mag.3.62.

xru_so/-stegos, on,
with roof of gold, Him.Or.18.3.
xru_so-ste/ptwr, oros, o(, h(, = sq., Man.4.39.

xru_so-ste/fa^nos, on,
gold-crowned, *foi/bh Hes.Th.136; ko/ra E.Ion 1085 (lyr., xruseo- codd.); epith. cf Hebe, Hes.Th.17, Pi.O.6.57; of Aphrodite, h.Hom.6.1, Sapph 9; x. a)/eqla
in which the prize was a crown of gold, Pi.O.8.1.

xru_so-sth/mwn, on, gen. onos,
woven with gold, xitw=nes Lyd.Mag.3.64.

xru_so/-stomos, on,
of golden mouth, i.e.
dropping words of gold, epith. of orators, as Dio Chrysostom, Men.Rh.p.390S., cf. Suid. s.v. *iwa/nnhs *)antioxeu/s.

xru_so/-strofos, on,
made of twisted gold, a)gku/lai S.OT203(lyr.).

xru_so/-swros, on,
with heaps of gold, Tz.H. 12.332.

xru_so-te/ktwn, onos, o(,
goldsmith, AP6.92 (Phil.), Luc.Lex.9.

xru_so/teros, a, on, a Comp. formed from xruso/s（3),
more golden, xru/sw xrusote/ra Sapph.122; au)th=s xrusote/rh ku/pridos IG14.1892.

xru_so/-teuktos, on,
wrought of gold, A.Th.660, Fr.184, E.Ph.220 (lyr.), Eub.20.4, dub. in E.Med.984 (lyr., fort. legit Sch.).

xru_so-teuxh/s, e/s,
with golden armour, Id.Rh.340.

xru_so-to/kos, on,
laying golden eggs, o)/rnis Aesop.343.

xru_so/-tocos, on,
with bow of gold, of Apollo, Pi.O.14.10, Isyll.48.

xru_so-to/reutos, on,
embossed with gold, LXX Ex.25.17(18); also xru_so-to/rneutos, krath/r Ps.-Callisth.3.28.
xru_so-tri^ai/nhs, ou, o(, = sq., cj. in Arion l.2.

xru_so-tri/ainos [i^], on,
with trident of gold, of Poseidon, Arion l.2, Ar.Eq.559 (lyr.), IG12.706.

xru_so/tu^pos, on,
wrought of gold, kra=nos E.El.470 (lyr.); fia/lh Critias 2.8 D.

xru_s-ou/a^tos, on,
with ears or
handles of gold, tri/pous Hom.Fr.17.
xru_sou+pode/kths, ou, o(, = xrusupode/kths, PFlor.11.5 (vi A. D.).

xru_sourg-ei=on, to/,
gold-mine, Str.4.6.7.

xru_sourg-e/w,
to be a xrusourgo/s, Poll.7.97.

xru_sourg-o/s, o(,
goldsmith, LXX Wi.15.9, Poll.l.c.
xru_sou=s, h=, ou=n, Att. contr. for xru/seos (q.v.).

xru_so-u+fh/s [u^], e/s,
interwoven with gold, xitw=nes Callix.2, Hdn. 5.3.6, cf. Chares 4J.; th/benna Ptol.Euerg.3J.; mi/trai D.S.5.46.
xru_so-fa/ennos [a^], on, = sq., pte/ruges Anacr.25.

xru_so-fa^h/s, e/s, Boeot. xrouso- Corinn.Supp.1.20:—
gold-shining, ka/lpides l. c.; *(/alios E.Hec.636 (lyr.); *)/erws Id.Hipp.1275 (lyr.); ste/fanos Epigr. ap. Plu.Flam.12; also xrusofa/h qera/painan *)afrodi/tas Sapph. 57A.

xru_so-fa/la^ros [fa^], on,
with trappings of gold, E.Tr.520 (lyr., cj. for xruseo-), Plb.30.25.6, D.S.31.18, App.Pun.32.

xru_so-fa^nh/s, e/s,
shining like gold, Dsc.5.100, Corn.ND17: hence Subst. xru_so-fa/neia, h(, Eust.991.22.
xru_so/-fantos, on, = xrusofanh/s, plou=tos S.Ichn. 156.

xru_so-fa/sga^nos, on,
with sword of gold, Sch.D Il.5.509.

xru_so-feggh/s, e/s,
gold-beaming, se/las A.Ag.288.

xru_sofor-e/w,
wear golden ornaments or
apparel, Hdt.1.82, Euph. 38, Sotad.9.4, Arist.Oec.1349a24, Chor.32.70 p.360F.-R.; dia/ tina a)rxh\n h)\ i(erwsu/nhn Artem.2.9, cf. 1.77; esp. of priests, dedo/xqai tou\s i(erei=s -forei=n toi=s qeoi=s SIG704E31 (Delph., ii B. C.); oi( -forou=ntes th=| qew=| i(erei=s BMus.Inscr.4.481*.437 (Ephes., ii A. D.); also [i)xqu=s] xrusofore/wn
wearing a gold ornament, Luc.Syr.D.45;
wear a gold ring, App.Pun.104.
pay gold as a tax, D.S.4.83.
carry gold, of streams, App.Mith.103.

xru_sofor-hto/s, h/, o/n,
borne about by gold, Man.5.309.

xru_sofor-i/a, h(,
wearing of golden ornaments, Str.17.3.7: pl., D.Chr.2.51, Vett.Val.3.17.
right to wear gold ornaments, SIG704H26 (Delph., ii B. C.); x. meta\ porfu/ras IG4.606.16 (Argos). esp. = Lat.
jus anuli aurei, IG5(1).1432.37 (Messene, i B. C. /i A. D., cf. l.12), 22.4193.14 (i A. D.).

xru_sofo/ros, on,
wearing gold, golden ornaments or
apparel, *mh=doi Simon.90; parqe/noi Lycophronid.1, cf. Hdt.4.104; deirh/ E.Hec. 152 (anap.). epith. of *(omo/noia, BMus.Inscr.4.481*.471 (Ephes., ii A. D.). as a priestly title (cf. xrusofore/w 1), sune/drion xrusofo/rwn Ephes.2 No.83c; x. strathgo/s BCH28.81 (Tralles); x. alone, CIG2929 (ibid.).
carrying gold, h(mi/onos App.Mith.82.
producing gold, peri\ x. gh=s, title of work by Teucer Cyzic. ap. Suid. s.v. *teu=kros. xrusofo/ron, to/, = h)/lektron 1, Dsc.1.83.

xru/s-ofru^s [xru_], uos, o(, a sea-fish
with a golden spot over each eye, gilt-head, Sparus aurata, Epich.51, Eup.150, Archipp.18, Arist. HA598a10, PSI7.862.6 (iii B. C.), Ptol.Euerg.1J.; written xru/sofos in Cyran.44, Gloss.

xru_so-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
gold-keeper, of gryphons, Hdt.4.13,27; swreuta\s xrhma/twn kai\ x. Rhetor. in Cat.Cod.Astr.8(4).150;
treasurer, qeou= E.Ion54.
keeping money, qu/lakos Plu.Arist.24.

xru_so-xai/ths, ou, poet. xru_so-xai=ta^, o(,
golden-haired, of Apollo, Pi.P.2.16; Dor. nom. xru_so/-ta_s, Limen.4; of Eros, Anacreont.41.12.

xru_so-xa/li_nos [a^], on,
with goldstudded bridle, i(/ppos Hdt.9.20, X.Cyr.1.3.3, etc.; x. pa/tagon yali/wn Ar.Pax 155 (anap.).

xru_so/-xalkos, o(, =
aurochalcum (sic), Gloss.

xru_so/-xeir, xeiros, o(, h(,
with gold on the hands, i.e.
with gold rings, Luc.Tim.20.

xru_so/-xelus, u,
with golden lyre, *paia/n Epigr.Gr.1023 (Nubia).

xru_soxo-ei=on, to/,
the shop of a xrusoxo/os, Test. ap. D.21.22, Plb. 26.1.2, Zeno Stoic.1.58.

xru_soxo-e/w,
follow the trade of goldsmith, Ar. Pl.164, X.Oec.18.9.
smelt ore in order to extract gold from it: hence prov. of those who
fail in any speculation, as the Athenians in their attempts to extract gold from their silver-ores, Pl.R.450b, cf. Din.Fr.6.13, Harp.
xru_soxo/-hs, ou, Dor. xru_soxo/-a_s, a, o(, = xrusoxo/os, Dialex.7.3 (in acc. pl. -as).

xru_soxo-i+ko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for a goldsmith or
gold-smelter, to\ x. pu=r Arist.Spir.485a34; e)rga/zesqai x. te/xnhn follow the trade
of a goldsmith, Test. ap. D.21.22, cf. Poll.7.102; a)/xura x.
goldsmith's dross, PHolm.5.7, cf. PLeid.X.33 B. xru_soxo-kh/, h(,
tax paid by goldsmiths, PPetr.2p.141 (iii B. C.).

xru_so/xo-os (parox.), o(, (xe/w)
one who melts or
casts gold; of
one who gilds the horns of a sacrificial victim, Od.3.425.
goldsmith, Ar.Lys.408, D.21.16,
Plu.2.658d; usually uncontracted in Att., IG12.374.103, 22.1558.56, but xru_soxo-xou=s ib.12.347.40, and so later, PStrassb.92.4 (iii B. C.), Baillet
Inscr.Gr. et Lat.des tombeaux des rois 1076, Ostr.Bodl.i 304 (ii B. C.).

xru_so/-xroos, on, heterocl. acc. -xro/a,
gold-coloured, AP9.525.

xru_so-ye/lia, ta/, = periskeli/des,
Gloss. (crisobsella cod.).

xru_so/w, fut. -w/sw LXX Ex.26.37:—
make golden, gild, IG12.374.29, D.S.1.23, Luc.Ind.15, Dialex.2.13, IGRom.4.1431.16 (Smyrna), Aët.1.106; xrusi/w| x. ti LXX l.c., al.:—Pass., x. paxe/i+ ka/rta xrusw=| Hdt.2.132; *palladi/wn xrusoume/nwn Ar.Ach.547; tw=n . . krani/wn kexruswme/wn Pl.Euthd.299e; perh. of
gilding the horns of victims, Supp.Epigr.6.629, 630 (Pisidia).

xrustoumi=nos, h( (sc. a)/pios A), =
Crustuminus, Crustumerian pear (cf. Plin.HN23.115), PLond.3.964.17 (iii A. D.).

xru_s-upode/kths, ou, o(,
receiver or
collector of taxes in
gold, Stud.Pal. 8.1111.5 (vi A. D.), Gloss., etc.; in papyri also xrusoupode/kths, e. g. PFlor.11.5 (vi A. D.).

xru_/s-wma, atos, to/,
that which is made of gold, wrought gold, E.Ion1030, 1430; xrusw/mata
gold plate, Lys.Fr.56, OGI214.26 (Didyma, iii B. C.), Plb.30.25.16.

xru_s-wma^toqh/kh, h(,
plate-chest, Callix.2.

xru_s-w/n, w=nos, o(,
treasure, PLips.102.7 (iv A. D.).

xru_s-wne/w,
buy or
change gold, Isoc.17.40, IG22.1493 (Phil.Wochenschr.48.783).

xru_s-w/nhs, ou, o(,
financial officer in Egypt, PBremen 83 iii4(iv A. D.), PLips.62i2, al. (iv A. D.), etc.

xru_s-w/nhtos, on,
bought for gold, of slaves, Callistr.Hist.10.
xru_s-w=pis, idos, h(, pecul. fem. of sq., of Leto, Ar.Th.321 (lyr.); of fish, xrusw/pides i)xqu/es e)lloi/ Titanomach.Fr.4 (with masc. Subst.).

xru_s-wpo/s, o/n, (w)/y)
with golden eyes or
face, beaming like gold, of the sun, E.El.740 (lyr.), cf. Corn.ND32; ai)qh/r S.Fr.[1128].
gold-coloured, Plu.Sull.6; ma/rgaros Ael.NA15.8 (Comp.). a fish, = xru/sofrus, Plu.2.977f.

xru_sw/rufos, on, perh. an error for xruswru/xos, e)/rga, i.e.
goldmines, IG Rom.4.608 (Phrygia).

xru_swru^x-ei=on, to/,
gold-mine, Str.3.2.8; also xru_swru^/x-ion, to/, Agatharch.24.
book on gold-mining, Olymp.Alch.p.87B.

xru_swru^x-e/w,
mine for gold, Ael.NA4.27 codd. (xrusoxoei=n Gesner).

xru_swru^x-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
gold-extractor, alchemist, *(=wros o( x. Olymp.Alch.p.103B.

xru_sw/ru^x-os (parox.), on, (o)ru/ssw)
digging for gold, mu/rmhkes Str.2.1.9; e)/rga Supp.Epigr.6.166 (Phrygia, iv A. D.): as Subst.,
gold-miner, Zos.Alch. p.240B.; cf. xrusw/rufos.

xru/s-wsis [u_], ews, h(,
gilding, Callix. 1, Plu.Publ.15, Nic.3, PLeid.X.49B., Aët.1.106.

xrus-wth/s, ou=, o(,
gilder, IG22.1635.37, Plu.2.348e.

xrus-wto/s, h/, o/n,
gilt, Phalaec. ap. Ath.10.44od, restd. in IG12.359.3.

xrus-w/tria, h(,
female gilder, Tab.Defix.69.4 (iii B. C.).

xrus-w/y, w=pos, o(, h(,
gold-coloured, shining like gold, qu/rsos E.Ba.553 (lyr.).
xruttai=os, o( (sc. mh/n), name of month at Lamia in Thessaly, IG9(2).71.5, al. (ii B. C.).
xrw=|, heterocl. dat. of xrw/s (q.v.).

xrw/|zw, E.Ph.1625, Alex.141.9, Arist.Mir.834a8, later xrw/nnu_mi, xrus-u/w (qq.v.): fut. xrw/sw Hsch.: aor. e)/xrwsa Arist.Mete.371a24, Luc. Im.7, etc.: pf. ke/xrwka （e)pi-) Plu.2.395d:—Pass., fut. xrwsqh/somai Gal.1.278, 9.394: aor. e)xrw/sqhn Pl.Tht.156e, etc.: pf. ke/xrwsmai Hp.Epid.7.17, E.Med.497, etc.: plpf. e)ke/xrwsto Alciphr. Fr.6.17:— = xroi/+zw,
touch the surface of a body, and generally,
touch, go/nata mh\ xrw/|zein e)ma/ E.Ph.1625.
tinge, stain, e)/xrwse me/n, e)/kause d' ou)/ Arist.Mete.371a24, etc.; to\ kalo\n xrw=ma deusopoiw=| xrw/|zomen Alex.l. c.; po/son ai(=ma th\n gh=n e)/xrwsen; Lib.Or.42.41; eu)= x.
gives a good
complexion, Orib.Syn.5.23:—Pass., Arist.Col.793b23, Mete.375a6, Zos.Alch.p.171B.; u(po\ tou= h(li/ou Luc.Anach.25; kestreu\s xrwsqei/s
browned in frying, Antiph.217.11; u(po/canqos toi=s fu/llois e)ke/xrwsto au)gh/ Alciphr. l.c.; of the moon, xrwsqei=sa fu/sin polukampe/a Alex.Eph. ap. Theo Sm. p.140H.; of the tongue, Gal.9.394; ta\ me/lana (sc. diaxwrh/mata） u(po\ melai/nhs xolh=s . . xrw/|zetai Id.18(2).142.
taint, defile, ai(/mati pala/man APl.4.138, cf. Porph.Antr.11:—Pass., metaph., ma/thn kexrw/smeqa kakou= pro\s a)ndro/s E.Med.497; of air,
to be infected, mia/smasin Hp.Flat.6. metaph. of an author,
paint, e)/xrwsa . . kathfei= xrw/mati ta\ na/mata Him.Ecl.12.7.

xrw=ma, atos, to/, (xrw/nnumi)
skin, esp. of the human body, ka/qarsis dia\ tou= xrw/matos Hp.Insomn.89 (sed xrwto/s recte cod. q).
colour, esp. of the skin or body,
complexion, Hdt.2.32, 3.101, Hp. Aph.4.40, etc.; xrw=ma a)lla/cai E.Ph.1246, cf. Men.Epit.466; meqista/nai tou= xrw/matos Ar.Eq.399 (lyr.); to\ x. diakeknais me/nos Id.Nu. 120; pantodapa\ h)fi/ei xrw/mata changed
colour continually, Pl.Ly. 222b; x. diame/non an unchanging
colour (of the face), Nicol.Com.1.28; so of animals, x.Cyn.4.7. generally,
colour, Gorg. ap. S.E.M. 7.85; defined by Zeno Stoic.1.26; xrw/mata ba/ptein use
pigments for dyeing, Pl.R.429e; e)k tw=n xrwma/twn kai\ sxhma/twn qewrei=n, i.e. look to
the outside only, ib.601a; dia\ tw=n x. a)peika/zein X.Mem.3.10.1; xrw/masi kai\ sxh/masi mimei=sqai Arist.Po.1447a18; peri\ xrwma/twn, title of treatise by Arist.; e)nalei/fein toi=s x. Id.GA743b24; xrwma/twn kra=sis Luc.Zeux.5; xrw/matos e)/ntriyis, of cosmetics, X. Cyr.1.3.2; toi=s e)gxri/stois ei)s tou\s o)fqalmou\s xrw/masin Arist.GA 747a10; of medicines, fa/rmaka xrw/masi kai\ o)smai=s pepoikilme/na Pl. Cra.394a.
turmeric, Curcuma longa, used in dyeing, Thphr.Od.31.
complexion, character of style in writing, xrw/mata [le/cews] (of to\ strifno/n, to\ tukno/n, etc.) D.H.Amm.2.2; poihtikh=s xrw/mata Phld.Mus.p.84K., cf. Hermog.Id.1.12. metaph. in pl.,
ornaments, embellishments, a)llotri/ois x. kai\ ko/smois Pl.Phdr.239d, cf. Grg.465b; also of style or language, D.H.Comp. 20; of Music, gumnwqe/nta . . tw=n th=s mousikh=s xrwma/twn ta\ tw=n toihtw=n Pl.R.601b. in Music, a
modification of the simplest music: ta\ me/lh metabolai=s kai\ xrw/masin w(s eu)= ke/kratai Antiph.209.4; xrw/mata eu)/xroa e)kiqa/rise Philoch.66:but esp.
chromatic scale or music, ou)/te xrw=ma deilou\s ou)/te a(rmoni/a a)ndrei/ous poiei= Anon. in PHib.1.13.22, cf. Cleonid.Harm.3, Bacch.Harm.23, etc.: x.malako/n, h(mio/lion, toniai=on, Cleonid.Harm.7. Rhet.,
complexion, colourable pretence, Hermog.Stat.1,3(pl.), Arg.D.19<*>12. of the factions in the Circus at Constantinople, Agath.5.14,21. Astrol., = xro/a1.3,
complexion of heavenly bodies, Phld.D.3.9, Vett. Val.107.26.

xrwma^t-i/zw,
colour, tinge, Arist.PA664b16, GA747a10, Thphr. Od.31; ti/ tini Alex.188.4:—Pass.,
to be of such and such a colour, Hp.Coac.380; x. pantodapa\s xro/as Arist.Mete.342b4. metaph. in literary criticism, x. th=| prepou/sh| u(pokri/sei (of Demosthenes) D.H.Dem.22, cf. Phld.Po.2.43.

xrwma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of, relating to colour:—but only found, metaph., in Rhet.,
offering a colourable pretext (xrw=ma IV.4), to\ x., as name of a form of rebuttal, Aps.p.273H. (v.l. xrwma/tion). in Music,
chromatic (cf. xrw=ma IV. 3), melw|di/a D.H.Comp.19; me/los, opp. dia/tonon, e)narmo/nion, Alciphr.1.18, cf. Aristox(?).Oxy.667.1; to\ -ko\n [ge/nos] the
chromatic genus, Plu.2.744c, cf. Phld.Mus.p.63K., Ph.1.321.

xrwma^/t-i^nos, h, on,
coloured, a)bo/llai, la/kkos, Peripl.M.Rubr.6, cf. Sotion p.183W.

xrwma^/t-ion, to/,
pigment, paint, AP.11.423 (pl., Hellad.). v. xrwmatiko/s 11.1.

xrwma^t-ismo/s, o(,
colouring, dyeing, mu/rwn Dsc.1.71 (pl.), Sch.Ar.Nu.516.

xrwma^to-poii/a, h(,
laying on of colour or
paint, Philostr.Ep.40.

xrwma^to-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
dealer in colours, Gloss.

xrwma^tourg-i/a, h(,
dyeing, Cat.Cod.Astr.2.177.

xrwma^tourg-o/s, o(,
dyer, Rhetor. ib.8(4).137.

xrwmokra_si/a, h(,
mixture of colours, changing of complexion, Ptol. Tetr.182 (pl., = ai)sxhmosu/nai acc. to Sch. ad loc.(152)).

xrw/nnu_mi, = xrw/|zw (i.e.
apply xrw=ma IV.2), th=|le/cei Luc.Hist.Conscr. 48:—Pass., Steph.in Hp.1.165; xrwnnu/w, = xrw/|zw, Alex.Aphr.
in de An.45.16, Lib.Decl.7.7.

xrw/s, o(, gen. xrwto/s, dat. xrwti/, acc. xrw=ta (Att. xrw/ only in Choerob.in Theod.1.248H.): Ep. and Ion.gen. xroo/s, dat. xroi/+, acc. xro/a (also in Lesbian, Sapph.Supp.10.6, al.), as always in Hom.and Hes., exc. gen. xrwto/s in Il.10.575, acc. xrw=ta Od.18.172, 179, Hes. Op.556; Emp. uses xrwto/s, 76.3 (but xroi/+ 100.17); Pi. uses xrwti/, xrw=ta, P.1.55, I.4(3).23(41); these forms are freq. in Trag., but Ion. dat. xroi/+ occurs in S.Tr.605, and xroo/s, xroi/+, xro/a are freq. in E., Hec. 548, Med.1175, Ph.264, al. :—dat. xrw=| occurs in the phrase e)n xrw=| v. infr.1.2 and in Sapph.2.10.—rare in Com.and Att. Prose. of the human body,
skin or
flesh, ou)/ sfi li/qos xrw\s ou)de\ si/dhros Il.4.510; kai\ ga/r qhn tou/tw| trwto\s xrw/s 21.568; xrw=t' a)poniyame/nh Od.18.172; a)kro/taton d' a)/r' o)i+sto\s e)pe/graye xro/a Il.4.139; tame/ein xro/a nhle/i+ xalkw=| 13.501; lilaiou|e/nh xroo\s a)=sai, of a spear, 21.168; kaka\ xroi/+ ei(/mat' e)/xonta Od.14.506; xrw=| pu=r u)padedro/maken Sapph.2.10; mu/rois xrw=ta lipai/nwn Anaxil.18.1 (anap.): esp.
flesh, opp. bone, fqinu/qei d' a)mf' o)steo/fi xrw/s Od.16.145; ou)de/ ti/ oi( xrw\s sh/petai Il.24.414, cf. 19.33 (which usage is said by Gal. to have been Ionic, 18(2).435, with reference to Hp.Fract.9); to\ de/rma tou= xrwto/s LXX Le.13.11, etc.; tou= xrwto\s h(/diston a)pe/pnei Aristox.Fr.Hist.84: generally,
one's body, frame, Pi.P.1.55, A.Fr.192.6 (anap.); xrimfqh=nai xroi/+ Id.Supp.790 (lyr.); stei=lai/ nun a)mfi\ xrwti\ . . pe/plous E. Ba.821, cf. S.Tr.605: pl., dia\ ti/ . . oi( xrw=tes o)/zousi; Arist.Pr.877b21; also katedh/santo . . tou\s u(giei=s xrw=tas, w(s traumati/ai D.H.9.50. e)n xroi/+, or e)n xrw=|,
close to the skin, e)n xroi/+ kei/rein to shave
close, Hdt.4.175; e)n xrw=| kekarme/noi X.HG1.7.8; e)n xrw=| kouriw=ntas Pherecr. 30:—metaph.,
to the quick, curei= ga\r e)n xrw=| tou=to S.Aj.786; e)n xrw=| paraplei=n sail past
so as to shave or
graze, Th.2.84; th\n ma/xhn suna/yai e)n xrw=| to fight
at close quarters, Plu.Thes.27; h( e)n xrw=| sunousi/a
close acquaintance, Luc.Ind.3: c. gen., e)n xrw=| tinos
close to, hard by a person or thing, tou= qw/rakos (v.l. sw/matos) Plu.2.345a; th=s gh=s ib. 925b, Luc.Herm.5: abs., e)n xrw=|
near at hand, Id.Hist.Conscr.24, al.; cf. EM313.53, Hsch.
the colour of the skin, complexion, melai/neto de\ xro/a kalo/n Il.5.354; tre/petai x. his
colour changes, i. e. he turns pale, 13.279, cf. 17.733; w)xrh/santa xro/a Od.11.529; xro/a . . a)mei/bein Parm.8.41; meqi/sth xrwto\s . . fu/sin E. Alc.174; metallakth=ra poulu/poun xroo/s Ion Trag.36; ti/ xrw\s te/traptai; (paratrag.) Ar.Lys.127; feu=ge d' a)po\ xrw/s Theocr.23.13; rare in Att. Prose, e)pi\ tw=| xrwti\ me/ga fronei=n X.Smp.4.54, cf. Oec.10.5: in Ion. Prose, of the
colour of a finger, xroi/+ dh=la Pherecyd.Syr. ap.D.L.1.118 (v.l. xrwi/+, cf. Vorsokr.5i.44). generally,
colour, a)mei/bwn xrw=ta porfura=| bafh=| A.Pers.317; to\n xrw=ta [metaba/llei] o( xamaile/wn Arist.Mir.832b14; xrw\s ai(/matos Orph.L.660.

xrw=sis, ews, h(,
colouring, tinting, Dsc.5.112, Poll.7.169, PLeid.X.15B.; x. lamba/nein Epicur.Ep.2p.51U.

xrwsth/r, h=ros, o(,
that which colours or
dyes: x. mo/lubos a lead-
pencil, AP6.68 (Jul.).
xrwti/dion, to/, Dim. of xrw/s, Cratin.302 (troch.).

xrwti/zw,
colour, x. to\n oi)=non
give it
colour and flavour, Plu.2.693c:—Med., x. th\n fu/sin tini/
tinge one's nature with . . , Ar.Nu. 516(lyr.).

xu^dai/+zomai, (xudai=os 11) Pass., metaph.,
to be used in vulgar language, Eust.421.19.

xu^daiologi/a, h(,
vulgar language, coarseness, Phot.Bibl.p.56.

xu^dai=os, on, (xe/w)
poured out in streams, abundant, LXX Ex.1.7; ste/fanoi, i.e. xu/dhn peplegme/noi, Ath.15.686a. Adv. -ws
pell-mell, Herm. ap. Stob.1.49.68.
common, ordinary, foi/nikes Dsc.5.31, cf.
Plin.HN13.46; li/qos Plu.2.85f; e)/laion Hippiatr.69. of persons, x. plh=qos Str.1.2.8; o( x. Porph.Abst.4.18; oi( x. Str.3.1.5, Ph.Bybl. 5, Porph.Chr.63; opp. oi( sofoi/, Phld.Po.5.23, cf. Rh.2.157S., al.: Comp. oi( xudaio/teroi (misspelt xudew/teroi) Sch.E.Hipp.948. metaph.,
common, vulgar, coarse, lalia/ Plb.14.7.8; xudai=a kai\ fau=la Phld.Mus.p.95K.

xudaio/ths, htos, h(,
vulgarity, Jul.Gal.43b, 238b.

xu^daio/w,
make vulgar, debase, in Pass., Aq.Is.33.9.

xu^dai+sti/, Adv.
in common speech, Eust.50.14.
xu^da^no/s, h/, o/n, = xuto/s 1.2, x. gai=a IG7.580 (Tanagra).

xu/dhn [u^], Dor. xu/dan Call.Fr.1.11P., Adv., (xe/w)
as if poured out, in floods or
heaps: hence,
without order or
system, promiscuously, indiscriminately, katapa/ttein x.
wholesale (opp. kotuli/zein, to sell by retail), Pherecr.168; x. beblh=sqai Pl.Phdr.264b; stefa/nwn x. peplegme/nwn Alex.52; pa/nta x. e)/stw AP10.100 (Antiphan.); ta\ x. maqh/mata . . e)n th=| paidei/a| geno/mena Pl.R.537c; fortikw=s kai\ x. o(/ ti a)\n e)pe/lqh| le/gousin Isoc.12.24, cf. Ep.9.5; nomi/mwn x. w(s ei)pei=n keime/nwn Arist.Pol.1324b5; e)nalei/fein toi=s kalli/stois farma/kois x. Id.Po.1450b2.
in unfettered language, i.e.
in prose, opp. e)n poih/masi, Pl.Lg.811d; ta\ x., opp. ta\ me/tra, Arist. Rh.1409b7.
abundantly, AP9.316 (Leon.), Hp.Ep.3; [a(] xu/dan . . lu/pa
overflowing grief, Call. l. c.;
spreading, of poison, AP9.233 (Eryc.).
xuqri/dion, xuqri/s, v. xutri/dion, xutri/s.

xu_l-a/rion, to/, Dim. of xulo/s,
a little juice, Damocr. ap. Gal.14.96; o( *fa/lernos x. stafuli/ou M.Ant.6.13.
xu_l-ia/zw, = sq., Aët.5.139, 7.90 (Ald.).

xu_l-i/zw,
extract the juice from a plant
by infusion or
decoction, Dsc.Praef.9:—Pass., spe/rma xulisqe/n Thphr.HP9.9.4, cf. Dsc.2.182, etc.

xu_/l-isma, atos, to/,
the extracted juice of plants, Thphr. HP9.8.3, Dsc.3.19, Eup.1.35, Zopyr. ap. Orib.14.64.3, Archig. ap. Gal.12.855.

xu_l-ismo/s, o(,
extraction of the juice of plants, Thphr. HP9.8.3.

xu_l-ista/, ta/, cj. for
quinista ( = confection in dynamidia) in Gloss.

xu_loeidh/s, e/s,
like juice, S.E.M.7.119.

xu_lopoi-e/w,
make into xulo/s 1.3, Ps.-Hp.
de hom. fabr.p.285 Ermerins, Alex.Trall.9.2, Paul.Aeg.3.46: hence Subst. xu_lopoi/-hsis, ews, h(, Olymp. in Mete.284.24, Steph. in Hp.1.154D.

xu_l-o/s, o(, (xe/w)
juice in general, opp. u(/dwr, Ocell.2.3, cf. Iamb. in Nic.p.81 P.; in various uses:
juice of plants, xulw=n staktw=n ei)/te a)nqw=n h)\ karpw=n Pl.Criti.115a, cf. Arist.HA596b15, Col. 796a23, Aud.802a15, Thphr.HP6.4.6, LXX 4 Ma.6.25.
decoction, Dsc.Eup.1.55; but distd. fr. a)fe/yhma, Id.1.105. of
animal juices, Hp.Alim.11,14, Arist.Col.794a21.
juice produced by the digestion of food, chyle, Gal.UP4.3.
barley-water, gruel, having the barley or groats strained off, whereas ptisa/nh was taken unstrained, ptisa/nhs x. Hp.Acut.6, cf. Cratin.297 (lyr.), Ephipp.13.6 (anap.): pl., Anaxipp.1.46. = xumo/s 11,
flavour, taste, Gorg. ap.S.E.M.7.85, v.l. in Arist.EN1118a28; ai( dia\ xulw=n h(donai/ Epicur. Fr.67, cf. Ep.3.p.63U., Diocl.Fr.112, Phld.Mus.p.103K.; kat' o)smh\n kai\ xro/an kai\ xulo/n Id.Sign.27: metaph., x. stwmulma/twn, fili/as, Ar.Ra.943, Pax997 (anap.). (Gal.11.450 distinguishes xulo/s
juice fr. xumo/s
flavour, attributing this usage to Aristotle and later writers, whereas earlier authors used xumo/s in both senses: the Mss. vary.)

xu_l-o/w,
convert into juice, make a decoction or
infusion of a thing, ti Hp.Mul.2.209:—Pass.,
to be converted into juice or
chyle, Ti.Locr.101a; kexulwme/nh trofh/ Gal.14.718, cf. Nat.Fac.3.4:
have the juice extracted, r(i/zai xulwqei=sai Dsc. 2.181.
to be moistened, Eust. 1552.33.
extract the juice of, mh=la Gp.8.27.2.
xu_l-w/dhs, es, contr. for xuloeidh/s, Simp. in Ph.23.26, [Gal.]14.515, Gp.2.22.2.
xu_/l-wma, atos, to/, dub. sens. in IG22.1672.200.

xu_/l-wsis, ews, h(,
converting into juice or
chyle, x. th=s trofh=s Plu.2.700b, cf. Gal.Nat.Fac.3.4, Thphr.HP7.5.1.
thickening of a juice by decoction, Dsc.2.86, 109.

xu_l-wto/s, h/, o/n,
converted into a 'humour', Anon.Lond. 39.12.

xu/ma [u^], atos, to/,
that which is poured out or
flows, fluid, Arist. HA550b27, D.S.17.75; even x. nifa/dos Alciphr.1.23; x. te/ssara, viz. the hot, cold, moist, and dry, Ptol.Tetr.19.
ingot, bar, IG7.303.104 (Orop., iii B. C.); x. xrusou=n Inscr.Délos442 B6 (ii B. C.), [xrusi/ou] ib.1432Abi17 (Delos, ii B. C., pl.), cf. Agatharch.28. metaph.,
confused mass, tw=n a)riqmw=n LXX 2 Ma.2.24;
aggregate, Theol.Ar.34;
crowd, presbute/rwn kai\ newte/rwn Aristeas14. au)ta\ ta\ x. tw=n sfairw=n
materials, constituents, Phlp. in Mete.26.8; tou= x. au)tou= tw=n sfairw=n h( ou)si/a ib.4.2. x. kardi/as
largeness of heart, LXX 3 Ki.4.25（5.9). [On accent and quantity v. Hdn.Gr.2.15.]

xu^ma/tion [a^], to/, Dim. of xu/ma
2, Inscr.Délos 396B74, 1409Ba i101(ii B. C.). x. stu/rakos,
lump of styrax, Aët.16.136(146).

xu^m-ei/a, h(, the
art of alloying metals, alchemy, Zos.Alch. ap. Syncell.p.24 Dindorf (written xhmei/a, but
khumia in the Syriac version, Diels
Antike Technik p.109), Olymp.Alch.p.94 B. (xumei/a), Joann.Antioch.Fr.15.3 (FHGivp.548 (xhm-), and so Suid. s.v. de/ras, but (xeim-) in Anon.Incred.3 cod.), Fr.165 (FHGivp.601, xhmi/a cod.P, xhmei/a Suid. s.v. *dioklhtiano/s (vv. ll. xeimei/a, moixei/a), Id. s.v. xhmei/a (v.l. xeim-)). (Named from its supposed inventor xu/mhs (v.l. xhm- xeim-) acc. to Zos.Alch. l.c., cf. eund.pp.169,172B.（xum-), Olymp.Alch.p.84B. (xhm-); more prob. from xu/ma, cf. Diels l.c.)

xu^/m-eusis, ews, h(,
alloy, EM630.52, Eust.828.16, Tz.ad Hes.Sc.122.

xu^m-eutiko/s h/, o/n
concerning alchemy, biblos Zos.Alch.p.220B. (xum-), Olymp.Alch.p.80B. (xhm-）; [bibli/a] Suid. s.v. zw/simos (xeim-).

xu_m-i/zw,
make savoury, season: metaph., x. a(rmoni/an
soften rough music, Ar.Th.162.
xu_m-i/on, to/, Dim. of xumo/s, Sotad.Com.1.19.

xu_m-o/s, o(, (xe/w) used much like xulo/s, though sts. distd. fr. it (v. xulo/s).
juice of plants, Hp.Epid.6.6.3 (cf. Gal.17 (2).327), Pl.Ti.60a, 60b(pl.), Arist.HA554a13(pl.), 596b17, Thphr. HP9.1.1, al.
animal juices, 'humours', Hp.VM18, Arist.HA 556b22, PA676a16;
juice in a wider sense covering 1.1 and 2, Id.Mete. 380b2 (pl.), 32: freq. in later writers, Gal.15.62, 16.497, Porph.Abst. 2.45, etc.; h(mi/peptoi x. Gal.6.258; pe/yai tou\s x. ib.253. xumo/s: si/elos, Hsch. (ai( tw=n xumw=n kenw/seis include ptu/smata in Gal.16.644).
flavour, a(/ma th=| geu/sei o( x. Arist.Ph.245a9, cf. Mete. 356a13 (pl.), de An.414b11: but not of the
action of causing taste, h( tou= x. [e)ne/rgeia] a)nw/numos ib.426a15; i)xqu=n . . , e)/xonta tou\s x. e)n au(tw=| Arched.2.9; opp. o)smai/, xro/ai, Plu.2.646b (and so interchangeable with xulo/s 11 (q.v.), Diocl.Fr.138): several varieties distd. by Thphr. CP6.4.1, cf. Plu.2.913b.

xu_m-o/w,
impart a taste or
flavour, Suid. s.v. a)/geustos. Pass.,
to be converted into xumo/s 1.2, Gal.9.595.

xu_m-w/dhs, es,
like juice, juicy, Sch.Nic.Th.733.
xu_/m-wsis, ews, h(, a stage of pe/yis, almost = xu/lwsis, a)potuxi/a xulopoih/sews kai\ xumw/sews kai\ th=s te/yews Steph. in Hp.1.154D.
xu/nw, later form for xe/w, found in compds.; e)kxu/nein condemned by Luc.Pseudol.29; also xu/nnw, Gloss.

xurbia/zw: skirtw=, Hsch. xu/rra, a call used by swineherds, Id. xurra/bios, o(,
swine-collar, Id. : but xu/rrabos, o(, a bird, Id. xurrei=on, to/, = xurra/bios, Hdn.Gr.1.372.

xu/sis [u^], ews, h(, (xe/w)
shedding, pouring out or
forth, ai(ma/twn Thphr.Fr.174.6(pl.): metaph.,
squandering, ou)si/as Alciphr.1.21.
diffusion, e.g. of nutriment, Gal.6.87; opp. pi/lhsis, Id.Nat.Fac.1.3 (pl.); coupled with a)na/lusis, dia/lusis, Chrysipp.Stoic.2.136, cf. 188. melting, khrou= S.E.P.3.14;
casting, fusing, Str.16.2.25.
dispersion, e)n th=| x. tou= e(no\s plh=qos gi/gnetai Plot.6.6.1.
liquid poured forth, flood, stream, e)kxe/asa ga/poton x., of a libation, A.Ch.97; po/ntou x. Opp.H.5.78; u(/datos Arat.393, A.R.4.1416: metaph, xroni/h x.
lapse of time, AP9.153 (Agath.). of dry things,
heap, fu/llwn x. Od.5.483, 19.443; no/tos . . xu/sin katexeu/ato fu/llwn Call.Hec.1.1.11, cf. AP9.282 (Antip.Thess.); kala/mhs Nic.Th.297. metaph. of
fluency or
copiousness of speech, ascribed to Cicero in contrast to the u(/yos a)po/tomon of Demosthenes, o( *kike/rwn e)n xu/sei Longin.12.4; h( x. tw=n le/cewn Phld.Po.Herc. 1676.6.
quantity, abundance, sarkw=n AP5.36 (Rufin.); x. faulo/thtos
a great deal of badness, Porph.Abst.3.2.
xustai/a, h(, dub. sens. in Sammelb.4425iv7 (ii A. D.).
xu/stos, to/, name of an ingredient of a purple dye, x. qala/ssion su\n fu/kei kai\ o)/cei e(/yon PHolm.23.2; gen. sg. written ku/sqous qalassei/ou ib.22.42.

xu^th/r, h=ros, o(, =
fusorium, Gloss.

xu/ths [u^], ou, o(,
metal-caster, Gloss.

xu^tiko/s, h/, o/n, (xe/w)
having a dissolving power, Arist.Pr.863a6, Gal.11.711.

xutl-a/zw,
anoint one
after bathing, Hp. ap. Erot. (Pass.), cf. Gal. 19.155; cf. xu/tlon 2. metaph.,
throw carelessly down, ta\ go/nat' e)/kteine kai\ gumnastikw=s xu/tlason seauto\n e)n toi=s strw/masin Ar.V. 1213, ubi v. Sch.

xu/tl-on, to/, (xe/w)
anything that can be poured, liquid, fluid; esp., in pl., xu/tla,
water for washing, the bath, Lyc.1099, Euph.9.7; but also,
libations to the dead, Berl.Sitzb. 1927.161（Cyrene), A.R.1.1075, 2.927, Orph.A.32.
a mixture of water and oil, elsewh. u(dre/laion, rubbed in after bathing, Erot. s.v. xutla/zhtai.
running water, stream, Lyc.701.

xutl-o/w,
wash, bathe, gui=a xutlw=sai Id.322:—also in Med., A.R.4.1311: mostly, Med.,
anoint oneself after bathing, Od.6.80: Medic., xutlw/sasqai
to rub oneself with a mixture of water and oil (cf. xu/tlon 2), Gal.11.532. c. acc.,
wash off from oneself, wash off, w(=| ke (sc. tw=| r(o/w|） to/koio lu/mata xutlw/saito Call.Jov.17.

xu^to/s, h/, o/n, (xe/w)
poured, shed, ai(=ma xuto/n blood
shed, A.Eu. 682. of dry things,
heaped up, Hom., only in phrase xuth\ gai=a
a mound of earth, esp. a sepulchral mound, like xw=ma, Il.6.464, 14.114, Od.3.258; so xuth=| qini/ Opp.H.2.635; xuta\ ko/nis IG14.1721.5 (Rome), cf. 12(8).38.4 (Lemnos); also xuth/ alone (sc. gai=a) Epigr.Gr.1034.25 (Callipolis). Subst., xuto/s, o(, = xw=ma,
mound, bank, dyke, Hdt.7.37. x. limh/n
protected by a mole or
mound, A.R.1.987, ubi v. Sch.
cast, melted, a)rth/mata li/qina xuta/ Hdt.2.69; e)n sku/fw| xuth=s li/qou Epin.1.8; x. a)/rguros, pi/ssa, Thphr.Lap.60, Nic.Al.116; xalko/s Orib.49.3.8; ta\ xuta/ things
fused or
welded together, Iamb. in Nic.p.81P.
that can be liquefied, fusible, Pl.Ti.58d, 61c; opp. e)lato/s, Arist.Mete.378a27. generally,
liquid, fluid, flowing, ne/ktar Pi.O.7.7; qa/lassa AP6.66 (Paul.Sil.): poet. also of the hair,
flowing, streaming, Nic.Th.503; x. e)/rnos a
luxuriant shoot or sprout, ib.391.
in shoals, xutoi\ i)xqu/es, of fish caught in nets, Arist.HA543a1. xuth/, h(,
case or
jacket enclosing a wooden model of an engine, HeroBel.96.10.

xu/tr-a, h(, Ion. ku/qrh Herod.Fr.3 Bgk., later Gr. ku/qra PTeb. 112.42, al. (ii B. C.), Choerob in Theod.2.146H.; Sicil. (acc. to Greg. Cor.p.341S.) ku/tra (but ku/qra is Dor. acc. to Choerob. in Theod.2.423H., and xu/tra is found in Epich.33): (xe/w):—
earthen pot, pipkin, Ar.Ach.284 (troch.), Av.43, al., X.HG4.5.4, Antiph.70, Thphr. Char.10.5, etc.; xu/tras i)/xnos a)po\ spodou= a)fa/nize Pythag. ap. Iamb. Protr.21.ld/; xu/trai di/wtoi Pl.Hp.Ma.288d; tou)pi/qhma th=s x. a)felw/n Hegesipp.1.13; children were exposed in pots, to\ d' e)se/fere grau=s e)n xu/tra| to\ paidi/on Ar.Th.505; cf. xutri/zw. xu/trais i(dru/ein set
up, consecrate an altar or statue with
pots of pulse, ta\s x. ai(=s to\n qeo\n (sc. *plou=ton） i(druso/meqa Id.Pl.1197, cf. Sch. ad loc.; *zhno\s e(rkei/ou xu/tras, meq' w(=n o( bwmo\s . . i(dru/qh Id.Fr.245; ti/ d' a)/llo g' h)\ tau/thn (sc. *ei)rh/nhn） xu/trais i(drute/on; Answ. xu/traisin, w(/sper memfo/menon *(ermh/|dion; Id.Pax923, cf. Sch. ai( xu/trai the
pottery-market, Id.Lys.557 (anap.), Poll.7.163. prov., xu/trais lhma=n to have swellings as big as
pipkins in the corners of the eye (cf. lhma=n koloku/ntais), Luc.Ind.23, Diogenian.5.63, Hsch. name given to black figs by Mariandyni, Pherecr.68.4.
a kiss in which one held the other by the ears as by handles (cf. Pl. l. c.), labou=sa tw=n w)/twn fi/lhson th\n xu/tran Eunic.1.
xutr-ai=os, a, on, = xutreou=s, Ar.Fr.472 codd.Poll. (sed leg. xutrea=n).

xu/tr-eios, a, on, = xutreou=s, x. pa/tagos Id.Lys.329 (lyr.). ta\ xutrei=a
earthenware, pottery, Choerob. in An.Ox.2.278.

xutr-eou=s, ou=n,
of earthenware, Ar.Nu. 1474.

xutr-eu/s, e/ws, o(,
potter, Pl.R.421d, Tht.147a, Eustr. in APo. 158.13.

xutr-eyo/s, o(,
boiler of pots, Parmenio ap.Ath.13.608a.

xutr-i/dion [i^], to/, Dim. of xutri/s,
a small pot, cup, Hp.Ulc.17, Ar.Ach.463, 1175, Alex.244.2, Inscr.Délos 1403
A bi84 (ii B. C.); also xuqri/dion, Aët.11.11; Ion. kuqri/dion, Epicur.Fr.182, Olymp.Alch. p.75B.

xutr-i/zw,
put in a pot: esp.
expose a child in a pot, A.Fr.122, S.Fr.532, Pherecr.247.

xutr-iko/s, h/, o/n, = xu/trinos, ke/ramos
Tab. Defix.Praef.p. ii (iv B. C.). (Perh. x. ke/ramos = xu/trai, cf. xu/tra 1.3.)

entryFree.sense: a game described by Poll.9.110, Hsch.

div0.entryFree:
xu/tr-i^nos, h, on, Ion. later ku/qr- Apollod.Poliorc.152.12,
of earthenware: Subst. o( x., = xu/tra, Hp.Mul.2.133; k. o)stra/kinoi Apollod. l. c. xu/trinoi a)gw=nes games at the festival oi( xu/troi (v. xu/tros 11.2), Philoch. 137.

xutr-i=nos, o(,
deep hole from which water springs, Hsch.; of a hot spring or geyser in Cos, Antig.Mir.160;
deep hole, in a river, Peripl.M.Rubr.44, in form kuqri=nos.
niche for a nest in a dove-cot, in form kuqr-, Gp.14.6.2.
xutr-i/on, to/, f.l. for xutri/dion, Ar.Ach.1175. = krani/on, Hsch.

xutr-i/s, h(, Dim. (in form only) of xu/tra or xu/tros, gen. i/dos or i=dos (dual xutri=de Bato 3.2), Hdt. 5.88, IG11(2).110.25 (Delos, iii B. C.), al., Erasistr. ap. Gal.11.215, Apollon. ap. eund.12.651; also xuqri/s, IG7.3498.13,44 (Orop.).
xutr-i/skh, Dim. of xu/tra, PHolm.6.28.

xutr-ismo/s, o(,
exposure of a child in a pot, Hsch.
xutr-i/ths [i_], ou, o(, = puo/s, Sch.Ar.Pax1150.

xutro/-gaulos, o(,
a kind of pot, prob. like
a bucket, IG11(2).154A 71 (Delos, iii B. C.), LXX 3 Ki.7.24(38), PSI4.428.62 (iii B. C.), Poll.6.89: kuqro/gaulos is v. l. in J.AJ8.3.6:—Dim. xutro-gau/lion, to/, IG11(2).154A72 (Delos, iii B. C.).

xutro-eidh/s, e/s,
like a pot, Sch.Theoc.5.58.

xutro-pla/qos [a^], o(,
potter, Poll.7.163, Phryn.PSp.125B.

xutro/-pous, podos, o(,
stand for a pot, Alciphr.3.5, Sch.Ar.Pax893 (gloss on la/sana); also kuqro/pous PMag.Lond.46.269, Zos.Alch.p.222 B.
pot or
cauldron, xutro/podes Hes.Op.748, LXX Le.11.35; x. ke/ramoi App.Anth.5.29.5 (Juba). = toru/nh, Sch.Ar.Ra. 509:—Dim. xutro-po/dion, to/, Hippon.25.

xutro-pw/lhs, ou, o(,
pot-seller, Critias 70 D.: fem. xutro/-pwlis, idos, as epith. of Aegina, Com.Adesp.669 (xutro/polin Meineke).

xutro-pw/lion, or xutro-ei=on, to/,
Pottery-market, Poll.7.163, Sch.Ar.Av.13: pl., = Lat.
ollaria, Agath.2.20.

xu/tros, o(, Ion. ku/qros EM543.38, (xe/w) = xu/tra, Diph.41, Nic. Al.136, PHolm.19.12. pl., of
deep holes in Lake Copais, Thphr.HP4.11.8. oi( *xu/troi, name of
the hot springs at Thermopylae, Hdt.7.176, Delph.3(5).22.53 (iv B. C.).
pot-feast, the 3rd day of the Anthesteria at Athens, Ar.Ach.1076, Ra.218 (lyr.).

xutro-tome/w,
make a fool of, tina dub. in Arg.Ar.Lys.

xutro-fo/ros, on,
bearing a pot or
pots, Sch.Ar.Av.448.

xutrw/dhs, es,
pot-shaped, S.Ichn.295.

xwl-ai/nw, fut. -a^nw=, LXX 3 Ki.18.21: aor. e)xw/la_na ib.Ps.17(18).46:—
to be or
go lame, Pl.Lg.795b, Hp.Mi.374c, POxy.465.39(ii A. D.), etc. trans.,
make lame, Sch.T Il.8.402:—Pass., e)xwla/nqh LXX 2 Ki.4.4.

xw/l-ansis, ews, h(,
lameness, Epict.Ench.9: metaph., in metric, of
a halting line, Eust.400.3.

xw/l-asma, atos, to/,
lameness, Hippiatr.2 (pl.).
xwl-a/w, = xwleu/w 1, dub. in Them.Or.22.282b.

xwl-ei/a, h(,
lameness, Pl.Hp.Mi.37;d, Luc.Vit.Auct.21, Plot. 5.9.10.

xw/l-euma, atos, to/,
a lameness, Hp.Art.60 (pl.).

xwl-eu/w,
to be or
become lame, halt, limp, Il.18.411,417, 20.37, X.HG3.3.3, Porph. ap. Eus.PE3.11. metaph.,
to be maimed, i. e.
defective, imperfect, xwleu/ei h( zwh\ tw=| fau/lw| Plot.1.7.3; a)\n [h( po/lis] tou/tw| xwleu/h| tw=| me/rei Lib.Or.47.10, cf. 59.33, Max.Tyr.20.6, Them.Or.6.75d; o( no/mos e)xw/leuen Palaeph.50; kata\ th\n i)atrikh/n Gal.15.396. trans.,
make lame, Hp.Mul.1.4, S.E.P.3.217:—Pass.,
to be or
become lame, Luc.Sacr.6; and, generally,
to be maimed or
imperfect, Pl.Phdr.248b.

xwl-i^ambopoie/w,
compose choliambics, Eust.1684.51.

xwl-i/ambos [i^], o(,
a lame or
halting iambic, i.e. one that has a spondee for an iambus in the last place, said to have been invented by Hipponax, Demetr.Eloc.251, Sch.Heph.p.101 C.
xwlo-kra/bbaton, to/, = skimpo/dion, Suid. s.v. ski/mpous; also xwlo-kraba/tion Sch.Ar.Nu.254.

xwlo/omai, Pass.,
to become lame, Hp.Aph.6.60: generally,
to be maimed, damaged, Id.Morb.1.3, Ruf. ap. Orib.5.7.6.

xwlo-poio/s, o/n,
making lame, of Euripides, as being fond of
introducing lame men upon the stage, Ar.Ra.846.

xwlo/-pous, o(, h(, gen. -podos,
lame-footed, Man.4.118.

xwlo/s, h/, o/n,
lame in the feet,
halting, limping, c. acc., xwlo\s d' e(/teron po/da Il.2.217, cf. 9.503, Od.8.308, Hdt.5.92.b/, S.Ph.486, 1032; x. kai\ ou)k a)rti/pous Hdt.4.161; x. tw\ ske/lei Ar.Th.24; also c. dat., ske/lei xwlo/s Plu.2.739b; xwlo\s a)mfote/rois Luc.Tim.20: later also of the hand, like kullo/s, xwlo\s th\n xei=ra Eup.343; xei=ra xwlh\n e(/cein Hp.Prorrh.2.1, cf. Pl.Lg.794e: of animals, X.Eq.1.5, etc. metaph.,
defective, fu/sis Pl.Phd.71e;
one-sided, Id.R.535d; basilei/a Orac. ap. X.HG3.3.3. of metre, esp. of the xwli/ambos (q. v.),
halting, me/tron Heph.5.4, Demetr.Eloc.301; also of a trochaic metre, Aristid.Quint.1.25. a)ei/dein xwla/, of a '
lame tale', Herod.1.71.

xwl-o/ths, htos, h(,
lameness, ske/lous Plu.2.963c, Jul.Or.6.201b: pl., Plu.2.35c: metaph.,
lameness or
deformity, of metres, Ath.14.632e. -o/w,
maim, Did. ad D.11.22.

xw/l-wma, atos, to/,
lameness, Hp.Art.62 (pl.), 64, Gal.18(1).678.

xw/l-wsis, ews, h(,
being made lame, lameness, Hp.Art.66, Ptol. Tetr.151 (pl.), Vett.Val.109.36.

xw=ma, atos, to/, (xo/w, xw/nnumi)
earth thrown up, bank, mound, thrown up against the walls of cities to take them, ai(/ree ta\s po/lias xw/masi Hdt.1.162; x. e)/xoun pro\s th\n po/lin The.2.75, cf. LXX.Ez.21.22(27), Hb.1.10, OGI90.24 (Rosetta, ii B. C., pl.).
dyke to hinder a river from overflowing, Hdt.1.184: freq. in Pap., PPetr.3pp.125,341 (iii B. C.), etc.; basiliko\n x. Wilcken Chr.11 A8 (ii B. C.); dhmo/sion x. POxy.290.34 (i A. D.).
dam, Hdt.7.130.
mole or
pier, carried out into the sea,
jetty, Id.8.97, D.50.6, Arg.Id.51, IG11(2).199A33(Delos, iii B. C.), etc.
promontory, spit of sand, A.Supp.870 (lyr.).
sepulchral mound, Hdt.1.93, 9.85, A.Ch.723(anap.), S.Ant.1216, etc.; ta/fwn xw/mata gai/as E.Supp. 53 (lyr.); xw=ma mh\ xou=n u(yhlo/teron pe/nte a)ndrw=n e)/rgon Pl.Lg. 958e.
mass of soil in which roots are found, cj. in Thphr. HP2.5.2.
heap of rubbish, ruin, LXX Jo.8.28, Is.25.2, Lib. Or.61.13. to\ x. th=s gh=s the
dust of the earth, LXX Ex.8.16.
xwma^t-ekboleu/s, e/ws, o(, = e)kboleu/s, Pap. in Wiener Denkschr. 47(4).55(iii A. D.).

xwma^t-ekboli/a, h(,
supervision of dykes, PRyl.90.17(iii A. D.).

xwma^t-epei/kths, ou, o(,
supervisor of dyke-building, POxy. 1469.20 (iii A. D.), etc.: written xwma^t-epe/kths in Hsch., xwma^t-epi/kths in Cyr.

xwma^t-epimelhth/s, ou=, o(,
overseer of dykes, BGU12.11 (ii A. D.), etc.

xwma^t-epista/ths [a^], ou, o(,
overseer of dykes, PPrinceton72.14 (iii A. D.).

xwma^t-ergola/bos [a^], o(,
contractor for construction of dykes, PFay.214 (i A. D.).

xwma^t-i/as, ou, o(,
piling up earth, of earthquakes, f.l. in Arist.Mu.396a4 (ap.Stob.); of rivers, cj. for gwmati/ai in Poll. 3.103.

xwma^t-i/zw,
fortify with mounds, LXX Jo.11.13 (Pass.).
embank with dykes, Sammelb.7376.13 (i A. D.):—Pass., gh= kexwmatisme/nh PTeb.105.26 (ii B. C.).

xwma^t-iko/s, h/, o/n,
connected with dykes, e)/rga ib.13.6 (ii B. C.), Wilcken Chr.388.3 (ii A. D.); without e)/rga, ib.385.19 (iii B. C.), PSI5.488.20 (iii B. C.). xwmatiko/n, to/,
tax for maintenance of dykes, ib.4.344.14,388.1 (iii B. C.), PHib.1.45.23, al. (iii B. C.), Ostr.Bodl.i31 (iii B. C.), iii 79 (i A. D.): pl., PPetr.3p.162 (iii B. C.), BGU1198 (i B. C.), POxy.288.20 (i A. D.).
xwma^/t-ion, to/, Dim. of xw=ma, PSI4.403.21 (iii B. C.), D.H.1.64.

xwma^t-ismo/s, o(,
construction of dykes, in pl., PTeb.106.21 (ii B. C.), PAmh.2.91.10 (ii A. D.), etc.

xwma^to-gra^fi/a, h(,
plan or
register of dykes, PTeb.237 (ii B. C.).

xwma^to-fu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
dyke-warden, PPetr.3p.134, PSI4.421 (iii B. C.).

xwn-ei/a, h(,
melting and casting of metal, Plb.34.10.12, D.S.5.13.

xwn-ei=on, to/,
funnel, Archig. ap. Gal.12.822, Alex.Aphr.Pr.2.3. = xwneuth/rion, interpol. in Suid.

xw/n-euma, atos, to/,
molten-work, molten image, LXX De.9.12, al., PLeid.X.21 B.

xw/n-eusis, ews, h(, = xwnei/a,
PLond.ined.2325 (iii B. C.), LXX 2 Ch.4.3, Maria ap.Zos.Alch.p.149 B.
xwn-euth/r, h=ros, o(, = xo/anon, Sch.Hes. Th.863.

xwn-euth/rion, to/,
smelting-furnace, LXX 3 Ki.8.51, al.; cf. xwnei=on.

xwn-euto/s, h/, o/n,
formed of cast metal, molten LXX 3 Ki.7.19 (33), al.

xwneu/w, contr. fr. xoaneu/w (q. v.).
coat jars
with pitch, tou\s xwneu/ontas keramei=s PSI4.441.3, cf. 15 (iii B. C.); kexwneukw/s PCair.Zen.741.26 (iii B. C.): but pf. part. Pass. kexwnhme/na ib.742.4 (iii B. C.) (xwneu/w and kwna/w became assimilated; cf. a)xw/neutos and a)xw/nhtos (Addenda)).
xw/nh, h(, contr. fr. xoa/nh (q. v.).

xwni/on, to/, Dim. of xw/nh or xw=nos,
crucible, interpol. in Suid. s.v. xwnei=on.

xw/nnu_mi, later form of xo/w, Arr.An.2.18.3, etc.; also xwnnu/w Plb.1.47.3: impf. e)xw/nnuon D.S.14.49, etc.; 3pl. e)xw/nnusan D.C.66.4:—Pass., inf. xw/nnusqai Plb.4.40.4, etc.; subj. xwnnu/htai PSI5.486.5 (iii B. C.); e)xwnnu/meqa
we were covered with a heap of earth, i. e.
had a sepulchral mound raised over us (cf. xo/w fin.), AP7.136 (Antip.), 137.
xw=non, to/,
xw=nos, o(, contr. for xo/anon, xo/anos, = xw/nh, xoa/nh.

xw/omai, Ep. imper. xw/eo, v. infr.: Ep. impf. xw/eto Il.21.306: fut. xw/somai, 3sg. xw/setai, Lyc.362: aor. e)xwsa/mhn, v. infr.: Ep. aor. subj. xw/setai Il.1.80:—Ep. Verb,
to be angry, freq. in Hom. (esp. Il.), 21.519, al., Hes.Th.533: with the addition of qumo/n Il.16.616; kh=r 1.44; khro/qi Od.5.284; fresi\n h(=|si Il.19.127; x. qumw=| h.Cer.330; x. fre/nas a)mfi/ Hes.Th.554.—Construction: c. dat. pers.,
to be angry at one, o(/te xw/setai a)ndri\ xe/rhi+ Il.1.80, al. c. gen. pers. vel rei, xwo/menon kata\ qumo\n . . gunaiko/s
about or
because of her, ib.429, cf. 2.689; xw/sato d' ai)nw=s a)mfo/teron ni/khs te kai\ e)/gxeos 13.165, etc. c. acc. rei, only in the phrase mh/ moi to/de xw/eo
be not
angry with me
for this, Od.5.215; mh\ nu/n moi to/de xw/eo 23.213. folld. by o(/tti, xw/sato d' *(/ektwr,
o(/tti r(a/ oi( be/los w)ku\ e)tw/sion e)/kfuge xeiro/s Il.14.406, 22.291. with a Prep., peri\ bousi/（n) Hes.Sc.12, h.Merc.236.

xw/ra, Ion. xw/rh, h(, = xw=ros,
space or
room in which a thing is, defined as
partly occupied space, distd. fr. keno/n and to/pos, Zeno Stoic. 1.26 (cf.2.163), S.E.P.3.124; potagoreu/onti ta\n u(/lan to/pon kai\ xw/ran Ti.Locr.94b (in o( to/pos th=s x. Pl.Lg.705c xw/ra =
country (cf. 11.1); so xw/ras e)n to/pois *libustikoi=s A.Eu.292); ou)de/ ti pollh\ xw/rh messhgu/s Il.23.521; no/misma . . xw/ras mega/lhs de/oit' a)/n X.Lac.7.5; xw/ran tini\ katalipei=n leave
room for it, Plu.2.123f, etc. generally,
place, spot, stre/yesq' e)k xw/rhs o(/qi . . Il.6.516, cf. Od.16.352; o)li/gh| e)ni\ x. Il. 17.394; xw/ran e)k xw/ras metaba/llein move from
place to
place, Pl.Tht. 181c;
field in a ceiling, IG42(1).103.193, 106ii139 (Epid., iv B. C.); h( prw/th x. the first
field (on the chest of Cypselus), Paus.5.17.6;
socket or
cavity of a joint, Hp.Art.79, 80; of the eye, IG42(1).121.76 (Epid., iv B. C.); as euphemism for the
genital organs, Hippiatr. 33,71.
the position, proper place of a person or thing, e)ni\ xw/rh| e(/zetai Il.23.349: esp. a soldier's
post, *)/arhs ou)k e)/ni xw/ra is not at his
post (or perh. in the
land, cf. Ar.Lys.524) A.Ag.78 (anap.); xw/ran lipei=n, prolei/pein, Th.4.126, 2.87; misqoforei=n kenai=s x. draw pay for unfilled
vacancies, Aeschin.3.146; e)pigra/yai au)tw=| th\n x. UPZ14.88 (ii B. C.): later th\n x. tino\s a)poplhrw=sai, poih=sai, fill a person's
place, POxy.136.15(vi A. D.), PMasp.32.11 (vi A. D.): xw/ran labei=n take a
position, find
one's place, e(/ws a)\n xw/ran la/bh| [ta\ pra/gmata] till they are brought into
position, into
order, X.Cyr.4.5.37; ou) didou\s e(te/rw| to/pon ou)de\ xw/ran diakoni/as Plu.2.62d; ou)k a)\n e)/xoi xw/ran noh/sews h(ntinou=n to\ a)gaqo/n the Good cannot have any
possibility of thinking, Plot.5.6.6; soi\ a)stronomei=n x. your
province is astronomy, Philostr. VA5.15; e)n toi=s a)te/xnois xw/ran e)/xei to\ au)to/maton Eun.Hist.p.225D.: freq. in the phrase w(/ra kai\ x., time and
place, e)n o(poi/a a)ci/a futeuqh=nai kai\ w(/ra\ kai\ xw/ra| Pl.Hipparch.225c; e)n a)/llh| kai\ xw/rh| Hp.Hum. 14; pro\s w(/ras kai\ xw/ras kai\ diai/tas ib.16, Aph.3.3; h(/ te tou= e)/tous w(/ra kai\ x. kai\ fu/sis tou= qerapeuome/nou sw/matos Gal.18(2).399, cf. Alex. Trall.1.10, Steph.in Hp.1.161, 180 D. b. in metric,
position of a foot in a verse, to\ daktuliko\n de/xetai daktu/lous kai\ spondei/ous kata\ pa=san x. Heph.7.1, cf. 8.1; ai( perittai\ x. Id.5.1,6.1. metaph.,
station, place, position, e)n xw/ra| tino\s ei)=nai to be in his
position, be counted the same as he is, e)n a)ndrapo/dwn or misqofo/rou xw/ra| ei)=nai to be in the
position of slaves or mercenaries, to pass or rank as such, X.An.5.6.13, Cyr.2.1.18; e)n ou)demia=| x. ei)=nai to have no
place or
rank, be in no
esteem, Id.An.5.7.28; ou(= me/llei xw/rhn mhdemi/an qe/menai Thgn.152; tou/twn toi xw/rh . . o)li/gh tele/qei Id.822; ta\s megi/stas x. e)/xein Plb.1.43.1. in senses 3 and 4 freq. with a Prep., e)k xw/ras o(rma=n, opp. poreuo/menos ma/xesqai, X.An.3.4.33; ei)s ta\s e(autw=n x. pa/reisi are at their
posts, Id.Cyr.1.2.4, cf. Theoc. 15.57; ei)s ta\s tw=n loxagw=n x. katasth/sesqai X.Cyr.2.1.23; e)n xw/ra| in
one's place, at
one's post, e)n tai=s x. gene/sqai Id.An.4.8.15; e)n xw/ra| pi/ptein, a)poqnh/|skein, die at
one's post, Id.HG4.2.20, 8.39; e)pi\ xw/ras e(/ssai set it in
its place, Pi.P.4.273; also me/nein e)pi\ xw/ras, = me/nein kata\ xw/ran, remain in
force, OGI90.16 (Rosetta, ii B. C.), BGU183.9 (i A. D.); kata\ xw/rhn ei)=nai be in
one's place, Hdt.4.135; [fo/roi] kata\ xw/rhn diatele/ousi e)/xontes Id.6.42, cf. Ar.Pl.367, Ra.793; kata\ x. me/nein Hdt.7.95, 8.108, Ar.Eq.1354, Th.4.26; h)/lpizon . . ou) menei=n kata\ x. ta\ pra/gmata ib.76; me/nei to\ o(/rkion kata\ x.
as it was, undisturbed, Hdt.4.201; e)a=n kata\ x. th\n po/lin leave in
its place, leave
as it was, X.HG6.5.6, cf. Hdt.1.17; kata\ xw/ran me/nein tou\s a)/llous [no/mous] e)a=n D.24.5; kata\ x. a)pie/nai retire in their old
order, X. An.6.4.11.
land, viz.,
a land, country, a(/s tinas i(/keo xw/ras a)nqrw/pwn Od.8.573; h( x. h( *)attikh/ Hdt.9.13; e)mporeu/esqai ei)s th\n x. IG12.57.21, cf. 63.22, al.: freq. in Trag., *(ella/da xw/ran A.Pers.271 (lyr.); *eu)boi=da x. S.Tr.74, etc.;
territory, o( tu/rannos h)\ po/lewn h)\ x. pollh=s [e)piqumei=] X.Hier.4.7: pl., OGI54.11 (Adule, iii B. C.), etc.
landed estate, X.Cyr.8.4.28, 8.6.4. b.
country town, tou\s kh/rukas diape/myantes e)s ta\s x. Schwyzer688B8 (Chios, v B. C.).
the country, opp. to the town, h( po/lis kai\ h( x. Lycurg. 1; ta\ e)k th=s xw/ras Th.2.5, X.Mem.3.6.11; o( e)k th=s x. gigno/menos si=tos ib.13; oi( e)n th=| x. e)rga/tai Id.Hier.10.5; e)n th=| xw/ra| koitai=on gi/gnesqai, opp. e)n a)/stei, Decr. ap. D.18.37; a( koina\ x. (of two cities) IG42(1).77.2 (Epid., ii B. C.): esp. of Egypt as opp. Alexandria, OGI56.5 (Canopus, iii B. C.), PHib.1.27.167 (iii B. C.), etc. (but in PTeb.5.98 (ii B. C.) e)n th=| *)aleca（ndre/wn） x. means 'in Alexandria'); h( a)/nw x. kai\ h( ka/tw, Upper and Lower Egypt, OGI90.46 (Rosetta, ii B. C.), cf. Wilcken Chr.109.9 (iii B. C.).—xw=ros is another form: in signf. 11 xw/ra alone is used in Att.; whereas in signf. 1 xw=ros is common, exc. in the special sense of
one's proper place or
post (xw=ros and xw/ra perh. cogn. with xh=ros, xh=tos).

xwr-a/zw, Dor. 1. aor. imper. xwraca/ntw IG5(1).1390.37 (Andania, i B. C.):—
set up, u(dra/nas l. c.; of an inscription, x. i)n to\s no/mos . . ta\n e)kexeiri/an SIG559.47 (Magn. Mae., from Megalopolis, iii B. C.).

xwr-arxi/a, h(,
district under a governor, S.Pelekides 74 (Thessalonica).

xwr-a/smios, a, on, dub. sens., xwra/smiai e)le/ai ( = e)lai=ai) Supp.Epigr.6.673.3 (Pamphylia, ii A. D.) (but x/ w(ra|sme/nai e)le/ai '600
mature olive plants' (fr. w(ra/|zw, = w(rai/+zw) acc. to Keil's reading).

xw/r-aulos, on, (au)lh/)
dwelling in the country, Suid.

xwr-a_fiai=os, a, on,
belonging to a small farm, Hdn.Epim.152.

xwr-a/fion [a_], to/, Dim. of xw/ra,
small farm, Thphr.Fr.171.7; gloss on bla/sthma, Sch.E.Hec.1204.

xwr-epi/skopos, o(,
country-bishop, i. e.
coadjutor or
suffragan-bishop, Supp.Epigr.8.21.3 (Palestine, vi A. D.), etc.

xwr-e/w, Anacr.108, etc.; fut. xwrh/sw Il.16.629, Hdt.5.89, 8.68.b/, Hp.Nat.Puer.18, and in later Prose, as D.H.4.9, Luc.DDeor. 20.15, etc.; Att. only in Th.1.82 (exc. in compds., a)na-xwrh/sw Id.7.72, a)po- X.Eq.Mag.6.2, pro- Th.3.4, pros- Id.2.2, sug- Id.1.140, etc.); elsewh. in Trag. and Att. always in med. form, xwrh/somai, A.Th.476, S.El.404, Th.2.20, etc., and freq. in compds.: aor. e)xw/rhsa, Ep. xw/rhsa, Il.15.655, h.Cer.430, Th.4.120, etc.: pf. kexw/rhka Hdt.1.120, 122, Th.1.122, Hp.Acut.19, etc.:—Pass., fut. xwrhqh/somai （sug-) Plb.15.17.5: aor. e)xwrh/qhn （sun-) X.HG 3.2.31, D.38.4: pf. kexw/rhtai （para-) D.H.11.52, (sug-) Pl. Phlb.15a: (xw=ros):—
make room for another, give way, withdraw, e)xw/rhsan pa/lin au)=tis Il.17.533; gai=a e)/nerqe xw/rhsen the earth
gave way from beneath, i. e. opened, h.Cer. l.c.; x. pru/mnan, = krou/esqai pru/mnan,
put back, retire, E.Andr.1120; xwrei=te
begone! A.Eu.196, cf. E.Or.1678, Med.820, etc.—The uncom pounded word does not occur in Od. and only fut. and aor. in Il.—Construction: c. gen. rei vel loci, xw/rhsen tutqu\n e)pa/lcios Il.12.406; new=n e)xw/rhsan 15.655; nekrou= xwrh/sousi 16.629; also nhw=n a)/po . . e)xw/rhsan proti\ *)/ilion 13.724; a)po\ kraterh=s u(smi/nhs xwrh/santes 18.244; e)/cw tw=nde dwma/twn xwrei=te A.Eu.180; e)k pulw=n Id.Th.476; e)k proasti/ou S.El. 1432. c. dat. pers.,
give way to one,
make way for him,
retire before him, ou)d' a)\n *)axillh=i+ xwrh/seien Il.13.324, cf. 17.101. after Hom.,
go forward, advance, to\ pu=r . . pro/sw kexw/rhken Call. in PSI11.1216.34; simply,
go or
come, Hdt.1.10, etc.;
go on one's journey, travel, S.OT750; x. e)p' a)delfeou= bi/an Pi.N.10.73, etc.; e)s nau=n A.Pers. 379; x. pro\s e)/rgon
come to action, S.Aj.116, Ar.Ra.884; x. pro\s h(=par
go to one's heart, S.Aj.938; xwrw=n a)pei/lei nu=n
go and threaten, Id.OC1038; dia\ fo/nou x. E.Andr.176; ta\ toceu/mata e)xw/rei dia\ tw=n a)spi/dwn, of weapons, X.An.4.2.28; to\ u(/dwr kata\ ta\s ta/frous e)xw/rei it
went off by . . , Id.Cyr.7.5.16; a)/nw potamw=n xwrou=si pagai/ E.Med. 410 (lyr.), cf. X.HG2.4.10; xw/rei ka/tw
go downwards, i.e. beginning from the upper parts of the body, A.Pr.74; dia\ sto/ma xwrou=nta . . a)fro/n E.Med.1174; x. ku/klw| [o( potauo/s] Pl.Phd.113b; o(mo/se x. tisi/ to join battle, Th.6.101, Ar.Lys.451, cf. o(mo/se 1.2; x. o(mo/se toi=s lo/gois E.Or.921; x. deipnh/swn Ar.Fr.272; pro\s to\ i(ero\n xwrh=sai dro/mw| Th.1.134; xwroi=s a)\n ei)/sw S.El.1491, Ph.674; xw/rei, ce/n', e)/cw Id.OC824: of Time, nu\c e)xw/rei the night
was passing, near an end, A.Pers.384; biosterh\s x.
wander about, S.OC747: Medic., of excretions, ta\ xwre/onta mh\ tw=| plh/qei tekmai/resqai, a)ll' w(s a)\n xwre/h| oi(=a dei= Hp.Aph.1.23; also of the menses, Id.Mul.1.2: c. acc. loci, *kekropi/an xqo/na x. E.Ion1572.
to be in motion or
flux, pa/nta xwrei= Heraclit. ap. Pl.Cra.402a, cf. Hp.Vict.1.5.
go forward, make progress, tou)/rgon ou) xwrei= pro/sw A.Dict. in PSI11.1209.16; pw=s ou)=n ou) xwrei= tou)/rgon; Ar.Pax472 (lyr.); xwrei= . . to\ pra=gma ib. 509; to/koi xwrou=sin Id.Nu.18; xwrei= to\ kako/n Id.V.1483, Nu.907 (both anap.).
come to an issue, turn out in a certain manner, para\ smikra\ . . kexw/rhke
have come to little, of the event of oracles, Hdt.1.120; eu)tuxe/ws x. Id.3.39; kakw=s x.
turn out ill, Pl.Lg.684e; do/ca d' e)xw/rei di/xa E.Hec.117 (anap.), cf. Hel.759: freq. abs.,
advance, succeed, Hdt.3.42, 5.89; pa/nta dia\ pra/cewn kai\ . . a)gw/nwn kexwrhko/ta . . *(rwmai/ois Onos.Praef.8; ta\ pra/gmata xwrei= kata\ lo/gon Plb. 28.17.12; o( lo/gos o( e)mo\s ou) xwrei= e)n u(mi=n Ev.Jo.8.37 (unless in signf. 111. infr.); also,
to be possible, ou) ga/r oi( xwrei= peribalei=n ktl. Ael. VH1.3 (sed leg. e)gxwrei=).
to be spread abroad, h( fa/tis kexw/rhke a report
spread, Hdt.1.122; dia\ pa/ntwn ou(/tws e)xw/rei "ti/s e(/yetai;" X.Cyr.3.3.62; klauqmo\s dia\ pa/ntwn e)xw/rei Plu.Rom.19; o)/noma do/ch| dia\ pa/ntwn a)nqrw/pwn kexwrhko/s a name
spread abroad, ib.1. of money,
to be spent, ta\s me\n dapa/nas xwrei=n e)ntelei=s e)k tw=n oi)/kwn, ta\ de\ e)/rga mh\ telei/sqai lusitelou/ntws pro\s th\n dapa/nhn X.Oec.20.21; ta\ prosgeino/mena xwrh/sei ei)s a(\ a)\n o( dh=mos qelh/sh| IG5(1).18B6 (Sparta), cf. 1432.4 (Messene, i B. C./i A. D.). trans.,
have room for a thing,
hold, contain, freq. of measures, krhth\r xwre/wn a)mfore/as e(cakosi/ous Hdt.1.51, cf. 192, 4.61, Ar.Nu. 1238, Pl.Smp.214a; ou)k e)xw/rhsen au)tou\s h( po/lis Th.2.17, cf. D.21.200, Aeschin.3.164, E.Hipp.941; ou)k e)xw/rei au)tou\s h( gh= katoikei=n a(/ma LXX Ge.13.6; poth/ria . . ou)xi\ xwrou=nt' ou)de\ ko/gxhn Pherecr. 143.3 (troch.); kotu/las x. de/ka Men.Kol.Fr.2, cf. Diph.96, etc.; xwrh/sate h(ma=s
take us
into your hearis! 2 Ep.Cor.7.2; ou) pa/ntes xwrou=si to\n lo/gon tou=ton
find room for . . , Ev.Matt.19.11 (so perh. intr., Ev.Jo.8.37, v. supr. 11.3);
to be capable of, to\ *ka/twnos fro/nhma Plu.Cat.Mi.64: c. inf.,
to be capable of doing, ou) xwrei= mega/lhn didaxh\n a)di/daktos a)kou/ein (v. l. for a)kouh/) Ps.-Phoc.89; dwrea\n o(/shn ou)k e)xwrh/sate ai)tei=sqai IG7.2713.11 (Acraeph., Oratio Neronis). impers., o(/tan mhke/ti xwrh=| au)tai=s e)rgazome/nais [tai=s meli/ttais] when
there is no more
room for them, Arist.HA626b11.

xw/r-hma, atos, to/,
space, room, Gp.4.1.16, PMag.Par.1.1087, Secund.Sent.15;
cavity, to\ tou= a)nade/smou x. Heliod. ap. Orib.48.50.3:
receptacle, c. gen., x. h( yuxh\ h)\ qew=n h)\ daimo/nwn Porph.Marc.21, cf. 19; xo/rion to\ x. tou= e)mbru/ou Gal.19.454.
xwr-hma/tion, to/, Dim. of foreg., Ps.-Callisth.1.6.

xw/r-hsis, ews, h(,
a going, proceeding, h( o(mo/se x., = to\ o(mo/se xwrei=n (v. xwre/w 11.1), Hld.6.5. Math.,
progression, h( e)p' a)/peiron x. Theol.Ar.34 (v.l. prox-). =
capacitas, Gloss.

xwr-hte/on,
one must go on, proceed, D.H.1.56, Herod.Med. in Rh.Mus.58.106, Iamb. in Nic.p.35 P.: pl., o(/ph| au)toi=s xwrhte/a ei)/h Procop.Vand.1.19.

xwr-htiko/s, h/, o/n,
able to contain, u(gro/thtos Sch.Ptol.19.
capable of, a)/nqrwpos zw=|on logismou= x. Ael.NA2.11, cf. S.E.P.3.121. Adv. -kw=s Suid. s.v. xando/n.

xwri/, = xwri/s, x. diatmh/gousi Call.Fr.48, cf. Test.Epict.5.7: c. gen.,
excluding, Schwyzer 197.38 (Itanos, iii B. C.).
xwria/zesqai: le/gein, Hsch. xwri^a^mo/s: ki/sth Id. (perh. for fwriamo/s).
xwri/dion, to/, Dim. of xwri/on 3, Lys.19.28, Plu.Cat.Ma.2; written xwrei/dion IG7.2808.8 (Hyettus, iii A. D.) [i_ in Com. ap. POxy.1803.23].

xwr-i/zw, pf. Pass. kexw/rismai, 3pl. Ion. kexwri/datai Hdt.1.140, 151, al.: (xwri/s). in local sense,
separate, divide, x. a)llh/lwn lo/xous E.Ph.108;
exclude, th\n pte/rnhn Hp.Fract.11, etc.: ti/ tinos, freq. in Pl., x. th\n yuxh\n tou= sw/matos R.609d, cf. Phlb.55e; a)po\ tou= sw/matos th\n y. Phd.67c, cf. Plt.268c, etc.; pa/nta kata\ fula/s X.Oec.9.8; with inf. added, [th\n ta/cin] e)pi\ tw=| me/sw| e)xw/risen e(/pesqai Id.An.6.5.11; oi( xwri/zontes
the Separators, a name given to those Grammarians (Xenon and Hellanicus acc. to Procl.Chr.p.102 Allen) who ascribed the Iliad and Odyssey to different authors, Sch.A Il.2.356,649, 11.692,21.416:—Pass.,
to be separated, severed, or
divided, Hdt.1.151, 3.12, al.; tinos E.IT1002, Pl.Ti.31b; sofo/n . . pa/ntwn kexwrisme/non Heraclit.108.
separate in thought, distinguish, h(du/ te kai\ di/kaion Pl.Lg.663a; a)po\ tw=n w)feli/mwn ta\ kaq' au(ta/ Arist.EN1096b14; x. kai\ diaspa=n Id.PA642b18; esp. in Logic, to\n i)/dion th=s ou)si/as e(ka/stou lo/gon tai=s . . oi)kei/ais diaforai=s x. Id.Top.108b6, cf. 132a13:— Pass.,
to be different, kexwri/datai pollo\n tw=n . . a)/llwn a)nqrw/pwn Hdt. 1.140: less freq. c. dat., kexw/ristai ou(=tos o( xeimw/n . . toi=si e)n a)/lloisi xwri/oisi ginome/noisi xeimw=si Id.4.28; a)p' a)llh/lwn Isoc.14.49; no/moi kexwrisme/noi tw=n a)/llwn a)nqrw/pwn laws
apart from others, far different, Hdt.1.172, cf. Plb.31.23.11; gnw=mai kexwrisme/nai Hdt.4.11; opp. sugkexume/nos, Pl.R.524c; kexw/ristai plei=ston to/ t' ei)=nai kai\ to\ tou=ton fa/skein D.45.26. Pass., kexwrisme/nh a)po\ tou= a)ndro/s
divorced, Plb.31.26.6; qa=sson . . oi)stou= . . xwri/zetai, of a wife, E.Fr.1063.13. later in Pass.,
depart, go away, Plb.3.94.9, D.S.19.65, Heraclit.Incred.8; e)k qro/nwn Ezek.Exag.76.

xwr-iko/s, h/, o/n, (xw/ra)
rustic, rural, Vett.Val.7.8; e)rga/tai POxy.141.5 (vi A. D.), cf. Poll.9.13; in Egypt, leitourgi/ai x., of services
rendered in the xw/ra, i.e. outside Alexandria (cf. xw/ra 11.3), OGI669.34 (i A. D.); x. biblioqh/kh PFlor.46.1 (ii A. D.).
indigenous, ka/lamos PMag.Par.1.63; a)rtemisi/a cj. for xlwr- (q. v.) ib.914; fu=kos PHolm.21.45.

xwr-i/on, to/, Dim. (only in form, cf. x. me/giston Th.2.19) of xw=ros and xw/ra:
place, spot, district, very freq. in Prose from Hdt. down wards, e.g. 2.8,10,29, Th.2.54; also in Com., as Ar.Nu.209, etc.; never in Trag.: e)k tou= au)tou= x. from the same
spot, Hdt.1.11; x. e)/rhmon, x. xalepa\ kai\ petrw/dh, Th.4.9; x. i(ppa/sima X.Cyr.1.4.14: pl.,
sites, oi)ki/sai xwri/a Th.1.12.
town, ib.100, etc.; xwri/wn kata/lhyis Pl.Grg.455b, cf. Lys.28.7, etc.
landed property, estate, Th.1.106, Pl.Lg.844b, Lys.7.4, IG12.325.10; used with a)gro/s, X.HG2.4.1, etc.
place of business, office, D.45.33.
space, room, Th.1.63, etc.; esp. in Geom.,
space enclosed by lines, area, figure, Pl.Men.82b sq., Ar.Nu.152, Euc.Dat.55, Papp.240.17: esp.
rectangle, Archim.Con.Sph.2, al.
passage in a book, Hdt.2.117 (unless interpol.), Luc.Hist.Conscr.12, Ath.15.672a, Simp.
inCael.126.4.
subject, Th.1.97: pl.,
topics, Lycurg.31. Medic.,
part of the body, Hp.Fract.2, cf. Aph. 1.21 (pl.); to\ x. to\ e)pi\ tou= h(/patos periphr. for the gall-bladder, Id.Morb.4.36.

xwri/s, Adv., also xwri/, q. v.: (v. xh=ros):—
separately, apart, once in Il., 7.470; x. me\n pro/gonoi, x. de\ me/tassai, x. d' au)=q' e(/rsai Od.9.221, cf. 4.130, Sapph.Supp.20a.16, IG12.108.32, al.; x. h( timh\ qew=n A.Ag.637; kei=tai x. o( nekro/s Hdt.4.62; x. peri\ au)tw=n e(ka/stou oi( no/moi kei=ntai Antipho 5.10; xi/lia ta/lanta . . x. qe/sqai
set them
apart, in reserve, Th.2.24; x. oi)kei=n live
apart, have an independent establishment, D.4.36, 47.72; x. geno/menoi being
separated, X.Cyr. 4.1.18; x. a)p' a)llh/lwn Parm.8.56, Pl.Phd.98c; mh/ me x. ai)tiw=
without evidence, S.OT608; x. poih=sai
distinguish, Isoc.15.68; x. ble/pein look
two ways, squint, Timocl.27.6; opp. koinh=|, Isoc.12.160; opp. koino/n, E.Hec.860; x. de/ . . and
separately, and
besides, Th.2.13;
separately, Lys.22.16, Plu.Arist.20; le/gein x. peri\ e(ka/stou Lexap.Aeschin.1.35; x. kai\ e)n me/rei Id.3.2; peri\ to\ e(\n kai\ x. about the one and
without [the one] Arist.Ph.203a14;
otherwise, x. de\ mhdamw=s Pl.Lg.950c; x. h)\ o(ko/soi
except so many as . . , Hdt.2.77; xwri\s h)\ o(/sa D.C.53.21; xwri\s h)/ o(/ti Hdt.1.94,4.61,82; also x. ei) mh/ (condemned by Ps.-Hdn.post Moer.p.462P.), Plu.2.698f, A.D.Pron. 91.8, al.; x. plh/n Paus.1.34.4. metaph.,
of different nature, kind, or
quality, Semon.7.1; x. to/ t' ei)=nai kai\ to\ mh\ nomi/zetai E.Alc. 528; x. to/ t' ei)pei=n polla\ kai\ ta\ kai/ria S.OC808; x. w)/|mhn ei)=nai to\ sunei=nai/ te a)llh/lois dialegome/nous kai\ to\ dhmhgorei=n Pl.Prt.336b. as Prep. c. gen.,
without, A.Ag.926, etc.;
without the help or
will of, x. *zhno/s S.Tr.1002(lyr.): after its case, po/nou x. Id.El.915, cf. Theon. Sm.p.1H.
separate from, apart from, x. a)qana/twn Pi.O.9.41; x. a)nqrw/pwn sti/bou S.Ph.487; xwri\s w)/|kistai qew=n E.Hec.2; x. o)mma/twn e)mw=n Id.Or.272; h( yuxh\ x. tou= sw/matos Pl.Phd.67a, etc.
independently of, without reckoning, Hdt.1.93, 106, 6.58; x. te ge/nous ou)k e)/stin o(/tw| mei/zona moi=ran nei/maim' h)\ soi/ A.Pr.293 (anap.); x. de\ th=s do/chs ou)de\ di/kaio/n moi dokei= . . Pl.Ap.35b.
differently from, otherwise than, x. murhrw=n teuxe/wn pne/wn A.Fr.180.5; x. dh/pou sofi/a e)sti/n a)ndrei/as Pl.La.195a, cf. D.19.13.

xwr-i/si^mos [i^s], h, on,
separate (?), PFlor.64.9, al. (iv A. D.); written xwrh/simos PLond.5.1653.47 (iv A. D.).

xw/r-i^sis, ews, h(,
separation, Plot.1.3.3, Hsch. s.v. xa/sis (xw/rhsis cod.).

xw/r-isma, atos, to/,
a separated space, Sch.B Il.5.137.

xwr-ismo/s, o(,
separation, lu/sis kai\ x. yuxh=s a)po\ sw/matos Pl.Phd.67d; x. de/xesqai, opp. sunezeu=xqai, Arist.EN1175a20.
secretion of sap, Thphr.CP6.7.3.
abstraction, Plot.4.7.8. (from Pass.)
a being separated, parting, departure, Plb.5.16.6, D.S.17.10; to\n x. poih/sasqai Id.2.60;
seclusion, LXXLe.12.2, 18.19; o( a)po\ qeou= x. Hierocl. in CA24p.472M.

xwr-iste/on,
one must separate, ti a)po/ tinos Pl.Plt.303d; also ti tino/s, th=s o)xei/as tou\s kriou/s Gp.18.3.1, cf. Iamb.Protr.21.kg/. xwriste/os, a, on,
to be separated, A.D.Pron. 52.23.

xwr-isth/s, ou=, o(,
one who separates, Gloss.

xwr-istiko/s, h/, o/n,
separative, only in Adv. -kw=s, Gal.19.466.

xwr-isto/s, h/, o/n,
separable, physically or logically, lo/gw| h)\ to/pw| Arist.de An.413b14; mege/qei ib.432a20; th=| noh/sei Id.Ph.193b34; kata\ to\n lo/gon x. Id.Metaph.1025b28; of the Platonic ideas, ib.1086b9, cf. EN1096b33; x. kth=ma
alienable property, of slaves, Id.Pol.1254a17.
existing separately, abstract, ou)qe\n . . xwristo/n e)sti para\ th\n ou)si/an Id.Ph.185a31, cf. Metaph.1028a34, 1029a28; x. poso/n
abstract quantity, Plot.6.3.11; x. dhmiourgi/a Jul.Or.4.144b, cf. 7.217d. Adv. -tw=s Iamb.Myst.1.9, al., Id. ap. Stob.1.5.18.

xwr-i/ths [i_], ou, o(,
countryman, rustic, boor, S.Fr.21, X.HG3.2.31, AP7.657 (Leon.), Muson. Fr.11p.60H.:—fem. xwr-i=tis, -idos,
a country girl, Luc.DDeor.20.13.
one dwelling in a place or
country, inhabitant, A.Eu.1035 (lyr.); x. dra/kwn Id.Fr.123, cf. S.Fr.226.
inhabitant of a country town (xw=ros 11.4), oi( x. oi( *zeleitw=n, opp. oi( kwmh=tai oi( *sukhnw=n, LW1534 (Smyrna).

xwr-i_tiko/s, h/, o/n,
of country-folk, rustic, plh=qos Plu.Per.34; x. a)nh/r
countryman, Ael.VH9.27. Adv. -kw=s
in rustic fashion, opp. e)n xlidh=|, X.Cyr.4.5.54, cf. Muson.Fr. 11p.59H.

xwroba^t-e/w,
measure by paces, survey, th\n gh=n LXXJo.18.8, cf. PCair.Zen.329.11 (iii B. C.).
use a level, Hero Dioptr.12.

xwroba^/t-hs [a^], ou, o(,
instrument used by surveyors, level, Vitr.8.5.1
landsurveyor, MAMA3.694 (Corycus, spelt xoro-).

xwrogra^f-e/w,
describe countries, x. th\n *eu)rw/phn Str.2.4.1.
mark out boundaries, Ostr.Strassb.664,669.
design, lay out, plan, to\ mh=kos th=s po/lews Ps.-Callisth.1.31.
serve as metator in the Roman army, IGRom.1.1365 (Egypt, i A. D.). generally,
demarcate, of a snake's teeth, Sch.Nic.Th.234 (Pass.).

xwrogra^f-i/a, h(,
description of a country or
countries, Plb.34.1.5, Str.8.3.17; title of works by Varro, Cicero, etc., cf. Ptol.Geog.Praef.1: pl.,
plans or
maps, SIG685.71 (Magn. Mae., ii B. C.), Vitr.8.2.6. Astrol.,
assignment of countries to their tutelary sign or planet, Vett.Val.360.24.

xwrogra^f-iko/s, h/, o/n,
of or
for the description of countries, pi/nac Str. 2.5.17.

xwro/gra^f-os (parox.), on,
describing countries. opp. to the more special term topogra/fos (describing the single places), as well as to the still more general term gewgra/fos, Str.1.1.16.

xwroqesi/a, h(,
geographical situation, Ps.-Plu.Fluv.5.1.

xwrmetr-e/w,
survey a country, Str.13.4.12.

xwrme/tr-hs, ou, o(,
landsurveyor, IG5(1).1431.40 (Messene, i A. D.); rendering of Lat.
metator, Lyd.Mag.1.46.

xwrmetr-i/a, h(,
land-surveying, Str.16.2.24.

xwronomiko/s, h/, o/n, (ne/mw)
of or
for the distribution of land, no/mos x., = Lat.
lex agraria, D.H.10.36.

xw=ros, o(, like xw/ra 1,
a definite space, piece of ground, place, xw=ron me\n prw=ton dieme/treon Il.3.315; diametrhtw=| e)ni\ xw/rw| ib.344; neku/wn diefai/neto xw=ros a
space clear of the dead, i. e. not filled by them, 8.491; x. u(lh/eis, e)rh=mos, oi)opo/los, yamaqw/dhs, Od.14.2, Il.10.520, 13.473, h.Merc.75; pi/wn Hes.Op.390; eu)ah/s ib.599; katastu/felos Id.Th.806; a)sunh/qhs Emp.118;
region, a)terph\s x., of the lower world, Od.11.94, cf. Emp.121; so eu)sebw=n x. Lycurg.96, Pl.Ax.371c, cf. IG12(7).115.20 (Amorgos); x. a)sebw=n Pl.Ax.371e, Luc.Nec.12; o( peri/geios x. the
region of this world, to\n p. kataleloipo/tes xw=ron metewropolei=n e)gnw/kasin Ph.1.196; de/ndre' e)/qallen x. Pi.O.3.23: pl., Hdt.2.178; *bro/mios d' e)/xei to\n x. A.Eu.24; qhrw=n ou(\s o(/d' e)/xei xw=ros S.Ph.1148 (lyr.); *makrai\ de\ xw=ro/s e)st' e)kei= keklhme/nos; E.Ion 283; po/des de/ oi( ou)x e(ni\ xw/rw| Call.Del.192.
space, compass, poih=sai e)n braxei= xw/rw| th\n du/namin Plb.11.1.3.
land, country, Hdt.4.30; o( *libuko\s x. v. l. in Id.2.19; tou= *)atarne/os e)sti\ x. Id.1.160; th=s *)arabi/hs 2.75: pl.,
lands, tw=n *qhbai/wn e)/keire tou\s x. Id.9.15, cf. S.OT1126: metaph., to\ ga\r nea/zon e)n toioi=sde bo/sketai x. Id.Tr.145; x . . . ou(=tos (leg. au(to/s） a)nqrw/pou frenw=n Id.Fr. 910.
landed property, estate, Axiop.5, X.Cyr.7.4.6.
the country, opp. the town, e)n tw=| x. kai\ e)n tw=| a)/stei Id.Oec.5.4, cf. 11.18; spei/rw t' a)/rouran . . *bere/kunta x. A.Fr.158.
country town, IG12(9).189.26 (Eretria, iv B. C., pl.); o( x. o( *mottianw=n ktl. LW1745 (Gergis).—Rare in pure Att. Prose (Th.2.20, 7.78, f.l. in Antipho 3.2.8), but common in X.

xw=ros, o(,
north-west wind, Lat.
corus, Act.Ap.27.12.

xwrofi^l-e/w, = filoxwre/w (cf. D.H.Comp.6),
cling to a place or
spot, haunt it, Thales ap. D.L.1.44; e)n *ai)/nw| Antipho 5.78.

xwrofi^l-i/a, h(,
love of a place or
country, variant in Philostr.Ep.28.

xwrofu/lac [u^], a^kos, o(,
guard or
watcher of a country or
place, Gloss., dub. in CIG5040 (Nubia).
xwruto/s, o(, collat. form of gwruto/s, Hsch. s.h.v.
xw=s, Dor. for xou=s (q. v.).

xw=sis, ews, h(,
heaping up, esp. of earth,
raising a mound or
bank, esp. against a city, Th.2.76.
filling up, blocking by carth thrown in, x. tw=n lime/nwn Id.3.2; ta/frou D.H.5.41.
embanking, tou= qea/trou IG9(2).522.26 (Larissa, iii/ii B. C.).
xw=sma, atos, to/, late form for xw=ma, D.S.24.3 cod.

xwsto/s, h/, o/n,
made by earth thrown up, e)n xwstoi=s ta/fois kei=ntai E.Rh.414; stenh\ kai\ xwsth\ pa/rodos Plb.4.61.7. of persons,
buried, Tz.H.9.330.

xwstri/s, i/dos, h(, （xw/nnumi） xelw/nh x. a shed to protect besiegers
in
filling up the ditch of a town, Plb.9.41.1, D.H.9.68(pl.), Onos.42.3, Ath.Mech.18.8, al.; without xelw/nh, Ph.Bel.97.28, Did.ad D.11.22; xwstri/des distd. fr. xelw=nai, D.S.24.1; opp. xelw=nai kriofo/roi, Id.20.91.
xw=u, prob. Egypt. name of an unguent, ne/on xw=u (unless it is one word neonxwu), PPetr.2p.114 (iii B. C.); not found in Egyptian sources.

xwfor-e/w,
cart earth, PLond.1.131r36, al. (i A. D.), POxy.1631.15 (iii A. D.).

xwfo/r-ion, to/,
load of earth, PLond. l. c. 138 (i A. D.), POxy. 1577.4(iii A. D.).
